Stella Grace Fitzgerald as Princess Issa - She's interesting, more so in what a Pivotal Role she Could Potentially Play in the Future of Motherworld.🎂 Themes - I liked a couple of the Themes in this film.💘1. The Theme of the Motherworld Losing the Spirit of Compassion.👱2. The Theme of Princess Issa being the One To Reignite that Lost Compassion and Drive the Motherworld into a New Hope. A New Future.🎨💐Visuals - Some of the Visuals were Eye Gazing. Tons of Gorgeous Shots. That Opening Shot was Beautiful. The Huge Scale Galactic Landscapes are Stunning to See at times. That Scene when they are Riding the Elevator downwards at the Lightsaber Womans Planet was a Breathtaking Shot. What a Stunning Shot. 😮⌛Slow Motion - Some of the Slow Motion Battles were a Treat to Watch. That First Slow Motion Battle when the Young Girl is Being Captured was Pretty Good. Sofia Boutellas movements and Manoeuvres and her hair swaying around as she attacks each guy in that Scene were Great to See.🎵 Neutral Note - The Score was Ok, it wasn't Bad.That's where the Positives Stop. 🚫Negatives -📜 1. The Script - Who is Checking and Greenlighting these Scripts? Are they Writing and Reading these Scripts Thoroughly? And When they are Writing these Scripts, are they Concentrating Whilst Reading and Writing these Scripts? There's not Enough Meaningful Dialogue between Characters and there's No Development of Almost Anything. Good Lord🙋2a. All these other Characters - Charlie Hunnam, Tarak (Still looks promising to be fair), The Farmer Guy, Djimon Hounsou, Lightsaber Woman, BloodAxe & Bloodaxes' Sister(both looked and sounded promising and then completely wasted), Robot Dude. 🤖🤦🏻 2b. All those characters I just listed were either completely Underwritten or Useless. They might as well of been 2D Cardboard Cutouts.🌆 3. Where's the World-Building? We visit too many damn Places when we could of Explored a Few of the Places(Especially that place that the Lightsaber Woman was from, Some Stunning Shots there) and got to know more about this particular world and what the view is from them about the Imperium Situation. The Story about the Royal Family of the Motherworld, I wanna see more of that, I wanna see the Scale of Imperiums influence Across the Galaxy. Do others See them as Great because of the Love they once conveyed? Or are Others mounting up attacks and Revolts against them just like Bloodaxe?🤷 Overall, Rebel Moon Part 1 was a Great Opportunity to Build, Build, Build, this Fantastic World and have some Very Good Characters and Storytelling, as I said, there are some Great themes here. Let's Hope that Rebel Moon Part 2 Strengthens and Hones these Elements and really Gets things Going.

title: Great story building
text: I don't know why so many low/negative reviews. Yes there are comparisons to Star Wars, Seven Samurai and Magnificent Seven etc but they are also great films. And there are many films that are similar to each other. But Rebel Moon actually had lots of interesting characters with an actual good female lead. At the risk of getting shot down there was alot of aspects I preferred compared to the Star Wars series and given enough time it could be a very interesting new world. Its about time we got a new fresh story rather than another rubbish attempt to continue a Star Wars film or another Marvel film trying to continue a dead franchise or an awful Fast and the Furious film. This was filmed in a great art style although a little CGI heavy. But yet again it would be hard to get this visual art style in true real life sets. As for the comments on over use of slow motion i didn't mind it. It was very similar style to Sucker Punch which also got bad reviews but I also didn't mind that. Although I may have compared it to past films try to go into it not comparing it to other similar movies and try to enjoy it as something new. I enjoyed it and look forward to the universe growing and hope all the negtive reviews don't win leading to it getting cancelled before it can grow like so many good things do.

title: I would say it's a 7
text: The story is not an original story so don't expect anything different, however I liked the fight scenes and the set up of the travel and how the events were unfolding. Yes, I only watched it for the fight scenes and space travel, at this point, most space travel or intergalactic stories are not that entertaining unlike the stories in the past. I think the second installment might bring better action and fight scenes but that's about it don't expect anything more. The cast were well casted but the dialogue and story is just meh, so action loving fans, just watch and enjoy something that you don't have to analyze or think about.

title: Soo boring
text: This is the worst movie I have seen in years. The characters are terrible. The way the movie flows is all over the place. The slow mo action scenes are boring. The acting is rubbish. The pace of the film is so slow it almost is at a stand still and the flow from scenes just feels all over the place.Apart from the last 15mins it is 2hrs of boredom. At least I didn't waste money paying for this at the cinema. Do these films not get assessed by a variety of individuals before release because I can't believe anyone found this anything above average. Sorry netflix but what a terrible film. Don't waste your time.

title: The movie made by CGI artists
text: This movie epitomizes everything wrong with today's blockbusters. There's nothing in it except fake-looking CGI. It has Nazis, Star Wars, Dune, and the director's signature slow-mo scenes. I think I even saw some Final Fantasy and Dungeons & Dragons in there somewhere. The story was so predictable that I lost interest after 30 minutes but carried on just for the sake of it. Even the music is predictable. If this movie was an attempt to start a new franchise, it needs to find its own voice. I know it's hard, but you can't use generic elements when building a new universe unless generic is what you want. Out-of-focus shots and color grading are simply not enough.

title: Style over substance, but better than expected
text: Not sure why there's so much hate for this movie; it wasn't brilliant but it certainly wasn't a 2/10. Yes it borrows heavily from Star Wars (and lots of other movies and genres). Yes some of the acting was poor. Was the plot a bit thin in places? Yes.But overall I thought it worked OK, though it's clearly setting things up for part 2 and beyond. I'm willing to give part two a go and expect it'll be much better, though I'm betting it'll be as derivative as part one. Do I care? If it's done properly then no - how many now-classic films were derivative? Take an unbiased look at Star Wars for example.Don't be put off by the current review score, it's worth a watch.

title: Promising but the script is so basic
text: I think it is a very good movie with great directing and action scenes; reminds me of star wars. However the dialogue is a bit off, basic and some times makes no sense. The plot is not like unique, you can guess pretty much what is going to happen and why things are happening.The acting is solid and you can easily watch it for fun. The dialogue definitely needs to be updates though to correspond to the high expectations it created.I like the main character and support her journey but she needs to develop more. Looking forward to any interesting plot twists in the movie and the second part.

title: I wanted to like it, but terrible!
text: The trailer looked promising; however, the movie is terrible. There are ZERO original ideas. Everything looks like it was poorly borrowed from other films like Star Wars, Star Trek, to name a few. Not a single of these actors looks like they belong in this "world". Characters are just cruel to be cruel with no rhyme or reason.The special effect during fight scenes are also terrible. Characters shooting hundreds of times to hit one target but miss every single time and the main character takes down dozens of arms men? Ummm Puuuulease!I don't understand why people are so ride or die when it comes to Zach Snyder. His las couple films have been terrible. Yes, he's had some good ones, but this is not it. Fans are fighting online like they are defending a masterpiece and I can't help but watch this terrible movie and laugh at their idiocy.

title: Keep an open mind
text: It's not terrible. I was pleasantly surprised and not disappointed considering the terrible reviews most people gave the movie. It's not your typical Zach Snyder movie but the cast is well put together and the acting is above par. It did feel a little rushed, it would have worked better as a series with multiple seasons so the story could have been fleshed out better. But all in all, I think it's worth the time to watch. Don't let others sway your opinion, be your own judge, with an open mind. Looking forward to the conclusion (?) in part two. I don't want to give any spoilers but there is a few surprises that your may (or may not lol) expect.

title: Zack Snyder's one trick pony
text: Aside from the weak script, the most irritating thing about "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is the direction by Zack Snider. Despite enjoying quite a few of his past movies, this movie is proof that he is NOT growing as a director. He is double-downing on the same techniques and framing that have dominated his past endeavors (the slow-motion action sequences do little the 10th time around, like when the Transformers 17th movie keeps showing and extending the slo-mo transform... we got it the first time.These are not trademarks of Snyder's, they are crutches. Like a furniture maker that can only make the same nice chair, are they a furniture maker or a specific chair maker? Imagine if Spielberg only made shark or dinosaur movies.As for some comments resembling Star Wars, this movie borrows from Star Wars less than Star Wars borrowed directly from older movies.

title: Ubearable
text: This movie is just one big unbearable pile of stepped on cliches. Terrible dialogue, bad acting (as a result) and just a very poor story. A veritable random patchwork of cliche story elements collected from every sci-fi ever made. Executed badly I must add. Starting with the whole "space nazi's visiting the shire stepping on peaceful villagers only to be stopped by princess Riddick" opening.Normally, for any sci-fi or space opera I would really just sit down and enjoy the ride, but this was just unbearable. Was just looking for excuses to get up from the couch and find something else to do. A shame really.

title: Definitely Ambitious !!
text: Rebel Moon, the latest offering from director Zack Snyder, takes audiences on a visually stunning intergalactic journey that pays homage to classic influences such as Dune, Seven Samurai, iconic game Mass Effect. While undeniably captivating, the film does encounter a few narrative speed bumps, but its overall brilliance is a testament to Snyder's unique vision & style that may not be fully understood by all, leaving audiences with a taste of an epic space saga that promises even greater wonders in the next installment.The film masterfully blends elements from iconic sources, creating a narrative mosaic that feels simultaneously nostalgic & fresh. The echoes of Dune resonate in the grand scale & intricate world-building, providing a captivating backdrop for the unfolding story. Seven Samurai's influence brings a sense of camaraderie & heroism to the forefront, enriching the character dynamics with depth & emotion. Mass Effect's impact is felt in the futuristic & intergalactic elements, creating a universe that sparks the imagination with layers of complexity.Rebel Moon, however, is not without its flaws. Some portions of the story feel rushed, leaving audiences yearning for a more thorough exploration of certain plot points & character arcs. Despite these pacing issues, the film manages to redeem itself through moments of sheer cinematic brilliance. The visual spectacle, combined with intense action sequences, delivers on the promise of an epic space adventure.The criticism directed at Rebel Moon seems somewhat perplexing, especially given the film's ability to seamlessly incorporate influences into a cohesive narrative. Perhaps the detractors fail to fully grasp Zack Snyder's unique filmmaking approach. Snyder has a distinct style that blends visual prowess with thematic depth, it's possible that some critics are not attuned to the nuances of his storytelling.In conclusion, Rebel Moon stands as a testament to Zack Snyder's ability to craft visually striking & emotionally resonant films in his own inherent style. While the narrative pacing may stumble at times, the movie's overall impact is undeniably powerful. Those who appreciate Snyder's distinct cinematic language will find much to love in Rebel Moon, it serves as a reminder that sometimes, criticism may stem from a lack of understanding rather than genuine shortcomings in the film itself.

title: Very mediocre, but better than the Star Wars sequels
text: I really wanted to give this a better score, but there were too many glaring faults. It's very mediocre and borrows heavily from different sci-fi instead of making its own world.In terms of the story, it's not too bad. The story itself isn't much of a copy of Star Wars, like others have said, but it feels like more of a copy of seven samurai minus the scene where they help defend the village. Which will probably be the next film.The characters are pretty shallow in my opinion. The main character was OK with no story whatsoever. Her character development was good, but that's about it. The character development of the other characters are very shallow as well.The production value was good. The visual effects were good, but he uses Slo mo was way too much. There were several scenes in which slow mo was definitely warranted, but not 20 to 30 minutes of the actual film lol.Overall better than the modern sci-fi we've seen recently, but still pretty mediocre, which is sad.

title: The absolute bottom of cinema
text: I lost two precious hours of my life that will never be returned to me. Worst entertainment ever. Shame about the money spent on this movie, sets, costumes and special effects. The plot is incredibly stupid and underdeveloped, and the lines seem like they were written for 5 year olds. With each dialogue, my dumb meter overflowed more and more. Zack Snyder really needs to stop making any more movies or someone will be found to take that right away from him. I haven't seen more stupidity in 20 years. And the Irish accent is so so inappropriate for this type of movie I'm speechless. Too bad for the actors - it will ruin their careers. I will never be able to look seriously at them again.

title: A cosmic Odyssey that leaves room for improvement
text: Zack Snyder's latest venture, "Rebel Moon Part One: A Child Of Fire," is an ambitious space opera that showcases his signature visual style and penchant for epic storytelling. While the film has its moments of grandeur and spectacle, it is not without its flaws.Positive Aspects:Visual Spectacle: Snyder's cinematic flair is on full display, with breathtaking visuals that transport the audience to a mesmerizing cosmic landscape. The space battles, alien worlds, and intricate set designs contribute to an immersive viewing experience.Action Sequences: The film doesn't shy away from intense and well-choreographed action sequences. The combination of practical effects and CGI creates a thrilling and dynamic spectacle, with Snyder's trademark slow-motion shots adding a unique flair to the combat scenes.World-Building: "Rebel Moon" introduces audiences to a vast and intricately crafted universe. The various planets, factions, and cultures are distinct, providing a rich backdrop for potential future installments. The lore is expansive and hints at a broader narrative waiting to unfold.Negative Aspects:Thin Character Development: One of the film's main drawbacks is its lack of substantial character development. While the protagonist, played by a charismatic lead, is intriguing, many supporting characters feel underdeveloped, making it challenging for the audience to invest emotionally in their arcs.Pacing Issues: The film struggles with pacing, especially in its first act. The narrative takes time to find its footing, and the exposition-heavy dialogue can be overwhelming. The film's ambitious scope sometimes leads to uneven pacing, with moments of slow contemplation followed by frenetic action.Predictable Plot Elements: "Rebel Moon" relies on some familiar sci-fi tropes and plot twists, making certain narrative beats feel predictable. While the film attempts to subvert expectations, it occasionally succumbs to genre conventions, leaving viewers with a sense of déjà vu.Exposition Overload: The film occasionally leans heavily on exposition to convey its complex universe, leading to information overload. Some viewers may find it challenging to keep track of the various factions, histories, and relationships presented in rapid succession.Conclusion:"Rebel Moon Part One: A Child Of Fire" is a visually stunning space epic that showcases Zack Snyder's directorial prowess. While it falls short in terms of character development and pacing, the film's potential for future installments and its captivating universe may redeem its shortcomings. It's an engaging watch for fans of the genre, though there is room for improvement in the storytelling department. As the title suggests, this is only the beginning, and the promise of a more refined narrative in subsequent parts leaves room for optimism.

title: Very formulaic
text: In an era dominated by the cinematic spectacle of mega-budget productions, I can't help but question the hundreds of millions of dollars and thousands of hours towards films like Rebel Moon. It raises a question about the state of contemporary filmmaking - a realm seemingly entrapped in the formulaic clutches of predictable narratives.The lamentation echoes: What has become of the fertile ground where original ideas sprouted, nurtured by writers who dared to traverse uncharted territories of imagination? The current cinematic landscape appears to be a desolate space, bereft of the daring minds that once breathed life into innovative concepts.Gone are the days when directors aspired to propel the medium forward, pioneering new narrative techniques and visual storytelling. Rebel Moon, rather than breaking new ground, seems to fall into the shadow of nostalgia, trying to expand upon things by copying them?The disheartening realization persists - where are the auteurs who once embarked on a journey to redefine the boundaries of cinema, to challenge both themselves and their audiences? Rebel Moon becomes a symbolic epitome of an industry seemingly entangled in the allure of familiar tropes, forsaking the spirit of exploration that once defined its essence.Perhaps, in the search for blockbuster success, the industry has momentarily overlooked the vital spark that ignites when originality collides with artistic expression. As audiences yearn for narratives that transcend the mundane, one can only hope that the cinematic realm rediscovers its appetite for risk-taking and the untamed territories of creativity.

title: Hells Bells that was bad!
text: I've been looking forward to this film for many months. I'm a big Sci Fi fan and very open-minded to original material, and the lure of world-building on an epic scale and some thoughtful story telling had me hooked as soon as I heard this film (or films) was in the works.Unfortunately it was unrelentingly poor. Almost unwatchable in places. Clunky dialogue only adequately delivered. Distinctly dodgy attempts at British regional accents (for whatever reason that was required I don't know). CGI that appeared to date back to the phantom menace which gave the whole film a video game quality. A story line we've seen many many times before - the 7 samurai, the magnificent 7, the dirty dozen, oceans 11. Goodies that speak in reverential and serious tones (and hence are boring to watch - where's the humour?) and baddies that were so over the top that I almost expected Roger Moore's James 'bond to appear in scenes with them. And why did Antony Hopkins agree to voice a robot, and be the narrator up front? What was he thinking?And above all.....it was actually very slow and boring. 2 hours (there are 15 minutes of credits at the end, and no I couldn't be bothered to check if there was a hidden scene contained) to assemble a team and yet fail miserably to give any of them (with the exception of the main protagonist) any back story whatsoever to make us care about them. I was delighted it stopped 5-10 minutes earlier than I'd feared. And in case anyone cares.....NO it's not "so bad, it's good" at all!

title: Rebel Moon 6.75/10
text:
1. Overall Plot - 7/10
This movie is about a tyrannical empire wanting to take control of a small farming village for it's resources, and how the villagers react and respond and fight back against this vast empire. This movie came to past because Zack Snyder went to Disney with a proposition about a Star Wars movie. They ultimately turned him down, but he went ahead and made the movie anyway. So naturally, I can't watch this and not think of it as a Star Wars Story. If you put it into the light of Star Wars and imagine it as being part of that universe it enhances the plot greatly. It gives meaning to this rebellion that would otherwise have no prior emotion to it. But as a stand alone Sci-Fi film the plot is pretty basic. A runaway powerful protagonist decides to fight am evil antagonistic Empire and assembles a team to help.2. Entertainment / Engagement - 5/10
It doesn't disappoint if you are looking to be entertained for the full film. The action sequences in particular are quite engaging and suck you into it well. However, the classic Zack Snyder unnecessary and overdone slow motion really kills this vibe, and pulls you out of what could be some very cool action shots. In the middle to end of the second act get kind of slow and boring. It tends to be the same "find someone to help us by helping them first" over and over again for each character.3. Emotion / Investment in Story - 5/10
Nothing in this movie grips you and pulls out your emotions. This being like a semi Star Wars movie helps a lot with the investment. If you imagine it being in the Star Wars universe against the Empire then you have more of a leg to stand on and care about the conflict. But as a stand alone it doesn't do much to make you want to care about the conflict.4. Theme and Depth of Story - 6/10
The theme is really to not just stand by and watch people suffer when you are capable of doing something about it. A lot of small good can come together to defeat one big evil.5. Characters - 7/10
There was a lot of difference between each character, and they were fleshed out decently well. However, there just enough time to understand each one's back story well enough. For the short time they spend with each character it feels like enough time, and they executed teaching about their characters well. Each of their actions seem very justified and true to their character.6. Acting / Writing - 7/10
All of the actors were very good, and were good choices for their characters. The writing wasn't perfect and kind of cheesy at times, especially with the classic hero speeches. But mostly it felt good with each character.7. Cinematography - 3/10
This is a Zack Snyder film, so it is filmed like one. The whole film is very dark and grainy. It is filmed in a way that had most of each shot blurry and out of focus. There is one singular focus point and the rest of the shot is blurry. I despise these kind of shots, especially when combined with the whole film being pretty dark for most of it.8. Score - 4/10
Wasn't anything crazy or emotional. Didn't really notice or think about it while watching to be honest. Nothing really stands out.9. Editing / Pace - 5/10
It was edited fine. Nothing to spectacular or bad. The camera would cut a lot during fight scenes which I don't particularly like. Fight scenes are always better when you can see the whole fight clearly with good choreography. The pace was pretty slow. Especially act two. The setup in act one was slow, and then in between act one and two it sped up a bit. Then slowed down quite a bit before the climax.10. VFX/Practical Effects - 5/10
The CGI in this movie wasn't great. It honestly could even just be bad. It looked like it came out of a TV show budget. But a lot of the effects were really good. Like all the blood or closeup shots had good CGI to them. But wider shots is really where it struggled. And things like backdrops just looked terrible and almost cartoony.Average score:
5.4/10My Overall Ranking and Final Thoughts:
6.75/10
I really do like this movie and would recommend it. Especially if you like Sci-Fi films. Just be prepared for A LOT of unnecessary slow motion shots, and fast cutting action sequences. It left me excited for the sequal and to see where the story leads.

title: Who let Snyder cook?!
text:
NO SPOILERS.I don't even know where to begin as my evening has been far from great. I jumped into the movie with no expectations, no background, just enjoyed seeing the trailer some time ago.First few scenes are decent and then it all comes out...
The awful A W F U L and tasteless slow-motion on almost every "action" scene, its the signature of Snyder and this movie stinks of it.I am not sure who wrote the dialogue and screenplay but it was definitely not human, chat GPD or whatever it was deserves whatever little praises it would get for it.Who lets this Snyder guy cook? Just tell him to pack his bags and get out of the kitchen.Every other person seems to have done well on this eye-candy and I am sorry it was ruined like this.

title: Good simple storyline with alot of hope but shortcomings
text: The tale of a soldier warrior estranged from her found master and in rogue fashion. The tale of a farmer that must protect his people from a corrupt and demanding army. Tales that link together create a force to rebel against the governong eye over a planetary system. This has alot to look forward to watching with exciting action and a web of tales growing into one force of rebellion. It has a classic vibe swith unique traits that make to story authentic. However to hate, the battles are piss poor with fake as fake can get fights, explosions, and gun fire. I could easily call this a Z-movie style flim for how fake these special effects come off. However, the sound effects are rather good and give the phoney fighting a spark of life. Worth the watch and it will be interesting to see if the saga grows into a repetitive conundrum of pain for the viewer or a inspiration.

title: A Galactic Adventure Like No Other. Watch it for yourself and ignore anyones opinion.
text:
Introduction:
In the vast expanse of the cinematic universe, few movies have managed to capture the essence of an epic space adventure quite like "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire." Directed by the visionary Zack Snyder, this Netflix original movie is a visual feast that takes viewers on a thrilling journey through a galaxy far, far away. From the stunning visual effects to the engaging storyline, this film is a must-watch for any sci-fi fan.The Plot:
Set in a distant future, "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" follows the story of Kora (played by Sofia Boutella), a young woman with a mysterious past who is tasked with gathering a team of warriors to defend her peaceful colony from the tyrannical Regent Balisarius. The plot is a classic tale of good versus evil, but with a fresh twist that keeps the audience engaged throughout the film.The Visuals:
One of the most striking aspects of "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is the stunning visual effects. The film is a visual masterpiece, with breathtaking landscapes and intricate details that bring the world to life. The action scenes are also well-choreographed and visually stunning, making for an immersive experience that is sure to leave viewers in awe.The Characters:
The characters in "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" are well-developed and engaging. Kora is a strong and determined protagonist, and the supporting cast is equally impressive. Each character has their own unique backstory and motivations, making them relatable and adding depth to the story.The Director's Vision:
Director Zack Snyder's vision for "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is evident in every aspect of the film. From the stunning visuals to the engaging storyline, it is clear that Snyder put his heart and soul into this project. The result is a film that is both visually stunning and emotionally engaging, a testament to Snyder's talent as a director.Conclusion:
In conclusion, "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is a must-watch for any sci-fi fan. The film is a visual masterpiece with an engaging storyline and well-developed characters. Director Zack Snyder's vision is evident in every aspect of the film, making it a truly unforgettable experience. Looking forward to the second part.

title: Snyder is talented but Rebel Moon is a misfire
text: Zack Synder is a filmmaker who is pretty controversial across others (especially on social media) as his works on DC comics have been spoken a lot around. I personally liked his work on "Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole, 300 and Watchman". But as a whole, I just didn't care or connect with many of his works. I won't say I hate his works cause I do believe he has some talents. Rebel Moon is a new project from Snyder but unfortunately, it really feels like a rejected version of Star Wars that feels derivative and extremely boring.The visual effects, productions and costumes are pretty good as the costumes and productions look colorful. Although there are some bad CGI effects. Snyder direction and the writing feels all over the place as if Snyder was implementing many different concepts and ideas but wasn't really sure how to put it together well and makes it messy. I do appreciate that Snyder is trying something different and following his vision but the narrative feels unspecial and messy that it didn't really grasp my attention. The performances are okay but it's a shame cause many of the cast members are actors I like but unfortunately their performances felt a bit underwhelming and were provided with poor dialogue and uninteresting character arches.For the action and thrills, it's messy. I did find some of the action moments to be interesting but the use of slow-motion and the convoluted style causes the action and thrills to fall apart. The editing, soundtrack, and the pacing is pretty off and the tone feels unbalanced.Clearly Snyder fans are going to enjoy this movie which is great for them but I personally didn't care for this movie.

title: I think this was supposed to be a TV show
text: Yeah, just as the title says I think this was supposed to be a limited TV show and could have been done in two seasons considering the second movie is scheduled to be released in April of 2024.The pacing was to fast when introducing each character. World development was too rushed along with the back ground/flashback stories. As much as it is exciting to introduce a new world of different si-fi that isnt the big 3 there is a lot that is needed to unpack here.The only hope I have of this series is to see the future Warhammer 40k series that Henry Cavill and the production company take notes from this series... what ever this was.Beyond that I do hope that second movie at least in editing wise can pick up what happened in this movie.

title: It's not Star Wars not supposed to be...
text: Firstly do feel there's a problem any big sci-fi that has any power state type system vs any kind of down trodden people and when they try to rebel is that fans automatically start to look for comparisons to Star Wars.I Always feel that's unfair, yes the words rebel moon might have been a star wars spin off film title in another franchise but this isn't star wars and to be honest this story line feels much more the magnificent 7 (original Yul Brynner) set in space.It's well done but not complete. I feel it needed to continue rather than finish where it did. It feels a bit lacking because in 4 months the second part comes out. This gives us the problem in that essentially we have an epic length movie split into two parts. The film maker walks the line where we are teased with the story and given enough to keep us interested, but they don't want to give away too much in plot and action or the second film will suffer from a kind of the avengers thanos syndrome (the second film just couldn't quite live up to the storyline and action of the first) and this feels like a story so far film...The effects are beautiful and there well done as you'd expect, Did remind me slightly of 300 with the slow motion action screen in parts, there are some beautiful scenery, touching scenes that are hopefully in place to set the future story. - i would have liked a little more storyline flushing on rest of our motley crew rather then just the main hero flashbacks. A little more back story for them to help us build our relationships and perhaps build bit more emotional connection to the characters would be good so when the story continues we are bit more invested.So I'm left asking would it have been better to just release it all at once and see it in it's completed state? I guess we'll have to wait and see. But my instinct is yes this will be much more appreciated when you can back to back both films and see the story in its entirety.One line review: All in all worth the watch but do hope more to come in part two.

title: If throwing random taste less worlds at you then surely you are a visionary with short sight!
text: Think of your own personal project. You dream about it all the time, work hard and pave a path for that single goal and when the final presentation comes where you gotta go through your slides and everything is wrong right from the font size to the slide titles and all the fancy things you put into the slides don't work on the day. That is exactly what happened here.I can list a few things.1. The casting is totally off. The lead actress did not suit for the role nor she is charismatic to pull this off. Her dialogue delivery just made me less interested. She randomly goes to a new world and tells them directly that she wants to fight mother world(What if they are spies?). Hey, her dialogue gets rebels to leave everything behind and fight for her. So who am I to say her delivery is bad?2. The CGI is not really great at many places.3. The action sequences are boring and on screen looked "TRY HARD".4. Predictable villains and their villainy. Nothing new here.5. Most of the movie carries a shade of grey. He ruined Super Man and he did in this again. I swear I hate grey and grey shades from now on.6. The primary cause of all this is "grain". You have technically far too advanced and those civilisations failed to work out a smart way to produce food? Snyder's creative mind alone can answer these questions.7. Right from costumes, dialogues, hair, lighting, editing and direction are mediocre.Snyder is one of the directors who thinks his imagination and vision is on another level. Watch his interviews. The thing is visionaries already did all these with less budget and more creative output. A man should know when to stop really. If you are going to design your main villain after Nazis for a sci-fi film in 2023, you should really hang up.

title: Not great...
text: I wanted to love this film... I have genuinely looked forward to it. I even restarted my Netflix subscription in anticipation of this film.Unfortunately this film is slow and dull. I'm a Zack Snyder fan and I love sci-fi but the acting, dialogue and terrible accents in this film left me bewildered.Far too much slow-mo and characters that I just didn't care enough about. There is really no excuse for an experienced creator with a huge budget and a great cast.I'd be very surprised if this new 'universe' gets beyond part 2. I just don't think it has the legs to be another MCU, Star Wars or even DC.

title: This movie is very awful and ridiculous.
text:
This movie is very awful and ridiculous.The actor in the lead role is also very awful. If they had chosen a better actor for the lead role, this movie would have been much better
It had very weak special effects and also the process of this movie does not attract the audience to the story line at all, it only shows the conflict of a veteran with a weak and mortal appearance (his actor) with a new commander and nothing special in the story. There is a movie.My score for this movie is 1 because I really wasted my time and money watching it. If there was a score of zero, I would definitely give this movie a score of 0.

title: So here's the issue
text: It's Star Wars but it's not. It's original but it's not. The story is so weak that even quite likeable characters-it's frankly hard to even remember their names.How can you make Watchmen with such a deep powerful story that makes you question everything and then come up with this junk?And the story is junk. Acting ok, cinematography awesome, sound/music ok. Its a nothing watch.Now why didn't Disney want it for the Star Wars family? Simple - this screenplay has no heart which is something Star Wars has always attempted to have even in the really poor episodes.Watch this and you will have forgotten it 5 mins later. I still remember Watchmen 10 years after watching it only once.

title: Why do studios trust Snyder with their money?
text: It took me three sittings to get through Rebel Moon. With its disjointed storytelling and confusing scene transitions, it simply didn't give me enough narrative to hold my attention. Beautiful special effects and chaotic action can't provide substance. At points, transitions felt like time jumps, the story was so challenging to follow. Was it an attempt to be economical with the total length, to the detriment of storytelling?It's also disappointing to see a talented and beautiful cast robbed of the opportunity to display their skills in one dimensional characters whose relationships have to be articulated explicitly through dialogue rather than exposition and development. As a viewer, I didn't care what happened to them because they seemed connected to nothing. The villains are driven by greed? Power? Evil? The protagonists are fighting to preserve only their food supply? Where did this conflict start? Nothing had enough backstory to give the viewer any traction. It felt like arriving to the theater after you'd missed the first act of the play. Pew, pew, pew. Kill the bad guys.

title: Snyder is a writer away from true greatness
text: For the love of god Zack, find a writer. Snyder is top of the class when it comes to visuals, action, and imagination, but the man's ability to tell a story is not up to par. This movie is almost Sucker Punch all over again - one of the best looking movies you'll see, but story and dialogue fall short.I love the cast he put together and the creativity in Rebel Moon is as good as any movie made. I had little investment in any character or their story though, too much was trying to be done in a short time. I have no doubt that I will care more as the story continues to unfold in part 2. The planned R rated directors cut will certainly elevate this movie.Critics are being way too hard on this movie, for certain I enjoyed it more than The Force Awakens, or the Dial of Destiny. Snyder is very talented, he just needs some help in the writing department! Looking forward to part 2!

title: Insultingly Bland Space Opera
text: Yeah, there's no beating around the bush here, Rebel Moon sucks. This film is an edgy mishmash of the most generic sci-fi and fantasy tropes with some of the most flat characters I've ever seen in a film. While many have pointed to Star Wars as an obvious point of inspiration, Rebel Moon seems to be biting off of Seven Samurai very blatantly: as its premise revolves around a former imperial officer has to recruit a number of other notable fighters across the galaxy to protect a village from an impending force that will kill them all if they do not supply them with grain in 10 weeks.Besides the narrative plagiarism, Rebel Moon also has no real sense of originality in the universe it inhabits, as so many of the locations in this film are straight up lifted from other films/genres. These include your average dusty farm planet serving as both a Tatooine/Western townsplace, a Blade Runner-esque cyberpunk planet, and a Roman coliseum planet that looks like it was a leftover set from Gladiator.The characters are even worse, as they all are absolutely devoid of any personality and give absolute no reason as to why they would want to fight for these villagers that they barely know. Despite this, Zack Snyder desperately wants you to think that they are cool so he gives them ultra-edgy names like "Bloodaxe", "Nemesis", and "Decimus". This even applies to the villains, who are the most generic evildoers imaginable. Their outfits are the most on the nose Nazi parodies, with the main baddie Atticus Noble being the worst offender, looking like a wannabe Hans Landa with a Richard Spencer haircut.Despite the edgy dark tone that Rebel Moon is trying to go for, the action is surprisingly neutered, as the camera seems to be afraid to show any actual blood beyond just a quick blaster wound. That being said, this film has a remarkably high number of attempted sexual assault scenes that only seem to be in the movie in order to reinforce that this is a "mature, adult sci-fi" movie despite its PG-13 rating.

title: A fairy tale. In space. Then it's fine.
text: I think what went badly for this movie is the expectations. If you realize it's an overly stylized fairy tale, it's a fine enough watch. Everything is childishly direct: the strong female hero with a dark past, the Nazi-cliché-like villains, the heroic... heroes forming a party, the quest, the good king and queen and princess, the rogue, the traitor, etc. This is a fantasy story, a very simplified one, in space. Once you get that through your head, you can relax: no need to think, well... anything.And what did you expect? I loved Watchmen, but other than that (or maybe even that), every other thing from Snyder is an overly stylized party of heroes quest thing. In history, in space, in the future, in the mind of an abused child, in the DCU, there are always some muscly men and some fierce women plus the occasional robot fighting stupid physical fights for justice. This film is exactly this.And yes, things are ridiculous when people fight physical fights against starships and future soldiers with future weapons. This crap works best where it belongs: in fantasy feudal lands with swords or where superheroes can fight modern weaponry with magical superpowers. But you turned off your brain, as I instructed, right? So you can enjoy the nice CGI, the terrible formulaic plot and the twists you can smell a mile away. I am even looking forward to Part 2. It's not like I want to look at some foreign film where people have real dramas and real emotions that they can't punch away.

title: Not a great plot, but I commend the movie/studio/director for using a lot of less known talent!
text: Not a great plot, but I commend the movie/studio/director for using a lot of international lesser known talent instead of the same typical hollywood roster.Of course there are a couple of well known faces/voices in this, but overall I commend the movie for this reason.Other than that, I find the storytelling to be lacking, and rushed way too much. And way too much focus on slowmo-scenes of why-do-that?-movement.The CGI-scenery is very well done, and I believe that the movie has potential to be better when the sequel comes out.Because as it stands right now, we now too little, compared to the, seemingly vast and story-rich universe, that this could contain.

title: Unbelievably boring
text: I can tolerate many things. A badly written movie. Bad special effects. Bad acting.But not a boring movie. This is a boring movie.Good points: some shots, I guess. They are stunning.Bad things: The whole story could have been told in 5 minutes, or as a rolling text, as in Star Wars. I could not follow the story because it was SO boring. Everything is just BORING. Nothing interesting happens.Some special effects, much to my surprise, were terrible. I honestly wasn't expecting this from Snyder. There's a certain scene with a spaceship bombing a city where the ship looks worse than an early 2000's videogame.I've read the story was stolen from other sources. Probably, but honestly, I was so bored I didn't even care which stories they took it from.Everything is sepia colored and dark. It's just too hard to try and make out what's going on at times because of the darkness.I find it weird how people complained about Rey being overpowered to the point of being a Mary Sue, when the main character in this movie is even worse. She can take on entire armies with her bare hands. FFS.But the worse thing - the movie is boring. Nothing really happens. It's as if Snyder thought that creating some scenes with "impressive" visuals and cheap violence would cover up the fact that he didn't tell a good story.

title: Not his best work but still enjoyed it
text: I'm a BIG Snyder fan, I've pretty much enjoyed all the movies he's made and was incredibly excited for Rebel Moon. With that being said, I definitely don't hate the movie, in fact I could see a lot of potential but the movie felt rushed with the 2hr runtime. I found myself wanting to see more with the character interactions or have a scene play out for longer as well. Here's to hoping the directors cut scratches that itch I'm looking for.I also don't mind that it has lots of Star Wars and Dune and other sci-fi references or calls. To me, I love these kinds of movies and don't really care about that.

title: Sci Fi seven samurai
text: When I saw that this was a Zach Snyder flick, I knew what to expect.It's basically 300 meets Star Wars meets A Bugs Life.If you know what you're getting it's entertaining, and that's why we watch movies - to be entertained.It's action packed, dark, and visually spectacular, from the fight scenes to the impressive cgi spacecraft and diverse interplanetary scenery, to weird aliens and monsters.I can't give it higher than a 6 because the fights are a little dancy, the writing and acting is a little corny, and the whole thing comes off as a bit of a B movie. 6/10 for a sci fi movie is still pretty good.If you're a sci fi or king fu fan, it's definitely worth a watch.

title: Couldn't wait to watch it, then couldn't wait for it to end
text: Some cool visual shots and a bombastic and at times ominous choir-filled score are not enough to give this turkey a single blip of life.Overuse of slow-mo, characters who only get a name long after being introduced - none of which, including the main protagonist, that you actually give a damn about or who have any screen presence - which is more the fault of the writing and direction than the actual performers.The most charismatic of all the characters is the war robot in the 1st act voiced by Anthony Hopkins and called Jimmy, and he doesn't even have a proper face - TBH, I'd have watched a movie about him and the rest of his kind than every single second that followed.I kept turning to my partner and wondering if a child had written the story. It just felt like a bunch of scenes a child might think of as cool, stuck together with spit and bubble gum; a spider monster, a griffin... so much time wasted on throwaway scenes!Ultimately an empty lifeless movie and a huge disappointment.

title: Don't understand all the bad reviews
text: Yes, I agree that much of the plot is pulled from other movies (Star Wars, etc), but I found this to be one of the better movies that I have seen in a while; I was actually surprised. I felt that each of the characters was interesting and developed fairly well. The scenery and visuals were great, especially for a Netflix movie. Fight scenes were done well also.I won't get too much into the plot since other reviews go into that in detail.I will say that I really enjoy most of Snyder's other work, so maybe take this with grain of salt, although going into the movie I didn't know he directed it.IMHO this is worth watching, although maybe not at the same level as classics such as Rogue One.

title: I don't know what the problem with the critics and viewers who are spewing hate on this movie, but it certainly has nothing to do with the movie.
text: There have been unimaginably bad movies in the last decade, and critics and audiences have found a way to applaud and exonerate them. The lynching of this movie is obviously not related to the movie, it is a decision taken before the movie for populism or other reasons. I have no respect for audiences who cannot form their own opinions and make judgments under the influence of others, or critics who comment on films based on their own financial interests.Does the film have any visual value to offer? Definitely. Grand storytelling? Tried. Action scenes? It will do. Does the world of the film feel big and deep? Mostly. Are the decisions the characters make meaningful and logical? Not really, but this is the first time I've seen people who can't get enough of criticizing this movie attach importance to this. I wish you could make this criticism on other movies too.The movie is not really a masterpiece. But does it deserve to be so criticized? Not by our people, who have been praising much less valuable works in the last decade.

title: Terrible Scripted Dialogue
text: I'd almost want to see a version of this that was 40 minutes shorter and half the dialogue cut out. It is over scripted with tragic exposition that makes me sigh every scene.There's plenty other things not working here in performances, frustrating lens/aberration choices that distract alongside every cliche dished out.Some accents pulled out of thin air and backgrounds that look lifted from a stock footage website... there's enough to make you drift off half way to write a review.Zack Snyder did a short film shot on an iPhone that was 100% superior to this. Give Zack Snyder less money and no VFX and CGI budget and see what he comes up with. Too many toys and money without the reasonably delivery of either.

title: Different but okay good
text: I actually enjoyed this movie. I'm not sure why it got so much flack maybe because a lot of people are diehard Star Wars fans but at the end of the day I like this comes concept of a movie it's new it's something different in a way of a new idea I'm so sick and tired of Hollywood remaking the same movies over and over and this was something refreshing and something that was needed. I do feel that some of the characters weren't fully developed. The ending was good. It set up the sequel. I really didn't enjoy the fight sequence that were included in the movie. The CGI effects were great and I believe it'll be a good story moving forward.

title: Good Story Idea But Fell in Delivery
text: I thought this was a good story idea at least in that first part but fell in delivery as I felt this should have an least been a three hour plus film or split into two movies.I would have love to see more character development or more back story show so you could bond with the characters.From the first movie I am going to want to see how the whole thing comes together.Personally I would have preferred for this to be a TV series as this leaves a lot more opportunities for story and character development.A missed opportunity by Zack Snyder to have an amazing hit TV series rather than a bit of a flop movie.

title: Had to check if this was written and filmed within a month
text: That was painful to watch. Especially when you know that they actually had the time to make something good. I also wonder if Snyder has any advisors... You don't need to have studied cinematography to tell that this is a very bad movie.The plot is uninspired or rather inspired from any movie ever written. We have seen this story a thousand times and will see it a thousand times more.The pacing is absolutely terrible. The action is boring with it's tendancy to slow mo everything. VFX are horrible.I really wonder where the 166 m budget went.This movie doesn't respect your time. Don't watch it.

title: Trite
text: The movie is very visually pleasing to sci-fi fans. Filled with stereotypes, cliche tropes, and classic archetypes, never before has the word trite been more apropos. I wanted to like it very much. But, the entire time I found myself thinking, "This is so stupid." Ryan George should have a field day with this one.What's the name of the dreadnought Kings Gaze supposed to be a double entendre, I wonder? I will not elaborate.I can see how this would appeal to children. And, perhaps, if someone were new to space operas, they might really enjoy this one, because it is filled with every single type of moment and character that can be gleaned from the entirety of the genre.

title: It's not getting review bombed, it's actually that bad
text: We all know this isn't academy award winning material, but even just as an action "popcorn" movie it isn't worth your time. The action set pieces aren't even that great. The lead character looks like she is about to cry in every scene and frankly, she doesn't have the acting chops to carry this movie. The biggest problem (of which there are many) is the utter lack of character devlopment. There's no reason for you to care what happens to them.Self-indulgent, overblown, poorly written. If you're going to give up 2+ hours of your life for this, at least wait for the R rated cut. Maybe then at least the violence will be taken up a much-needed notch at a minimum.

title: Story is king, but not the only value in cinema.
text: Yes, many of the other reviews are correct in saying the story didn't really do anything new. It's a simple one. But the world building and stylized nature of it still provide a wonderful and epic experience reminiscent of a vivid dream or a Greek myth of heroes and villains like The Odyssey. I believe Zack Snyder, like James Cameron with Avatar, set out to build a world unlike any other rather than tell a completely new story. I see value in that. Cinema isn't JUST about story, otherwise there would be no reason for the medium. Just read a book. The world building and character design are equally as important in film. So, is Rebel Moon Pt. 1 perfect? Far from it. But it does a lot well.

title: Beautiful, shallow, boring garbage. Avoid.
text: I saw Rebel Moon on Netflix last night so you don't have to. It's beautiful looking garbage. It's as if someone made a movie entirely out of movie trailers. It's like the director asked AI to create some sci-fi fantasy images and then they found an excuse to get all the required characters into the scene to recreate the AI images.I found myself completely uninvested in any of the characters. I couldn't tell you the name of a single character if you offered me a million dollars. I mean there is no-shirt guy. I like to call him 'Space Spartan from the movie 300". And ... well, insect spider lady that had mammal boobs for some reason. And... well.. that's it.It is steals, sorry... "borrows" from so many other franchises. Star Wars, obviously. And Seven Samurai--but in a way even more obvious than how Star Wars borrowed from Seven Samurai. Even the ship looks derivative of the ship from Firefly--complete with large two story cargo bay where characters hang out and chat.The "plot" is that this lady is going around trying to gather Seven Space-Samurai to defend their space-farming village from the very WWII nazi-looking space-empire soldiers. Soldiers that are so comically evil and incapable of following orders that I couldn't suspend my disbelief and kept wondering how anyone could lead these troops. How could they could accomplish anything? I mean, it would be total chaos all the time.Anyhow... I feel dumber for having watched this. I can't believe this was made and it actually makes me want to sell my Netflix stock. What an absolute stinker.2 stars for pretty visuals. -8 stars for everything else that makes a movie great.

title: I think it has a future
text: "Rebel Moon Part 1" takes you on an intergalactic joyride, hitting you right in the visuals with a dazzling display that'll leave you wide-eyed. The acting is solid, not groundbreaking, but it gets the job done.Now, the plot may give you some déjà vu vibes, especially if you're a Star Wars buff or into the whole galactic warfare scene. It's like we've been here before, right? But hold on, "Rebel Moon" throws in a curveball. Sure, it feels like we've seen it all, but it's got its own groove going.I was half-expecting this to be another Marvel copycat, but surprise, surprise! It swerves away from the usual Marvel formula. The plot's got more layers than your standard superhero flick, which is a breath of fresh air. It's not just about the explosions and flashy suits.Now, before you jump to conclusions and think it's trying to outdo Star Wars, just hit the brakes. "Rebel Moon" ain't aiming to dethrone the classics. It's got its own flavor, and you've gotta taste it without expecting a Star Wars rehash.I'm already eyeing Part 2 because I'm hoping they'll keep building on the characters and the story they've got going. Give it a shot, forget the comparisons, and enjoy the ride.

title: Really wanted it to be better
text: I went into watching the movie with hopes that the bad reviews were wrong, but those hopes ebbed as I watched the movie unfold.No spoikers, just some observations...There's a solid movie buried in there, but it got lost amid the slog. The bringing together of the team went on far too long and didn't make me want to care about what happened to the characters.Pacing was a big problem. If Snyder cut back on the unnecessary slo mo sequences, the film would've been a half hour shorter at least.Things didn't really pick up until about 30 minutes from the end. By then I had trouble caring what happened.I'll probably watch Part Two, but it's not something I'm excited about.

title: Can Zack Snyder please stop making movies?
text: I have never watched such an extremely forced movie. The characters are all edge lords who you don't care about in any way. The writing is awful, where you cringe at most words. The actions of the characters doesn't make any sense and I couldn't even make myself finish the movie. It is such a mess, with sci-fi, magic, war, futuristic and medieval aspects. It feels like Snyder wanted to make everything, instead of just focusing on a few parts and making sure they felt believable and polished. I was hoping that Snyder would finally make an okay/good movie, but this is just more proof that he should stop and switch career.And oh my God, the CGI/visual effects look absolutely horrible. I honestly don't understand how someone could make this script and persuade people to be part of making this movie. Just don't watch it, it's a waste of time like every other Zack Snyder movie.

title: Wait for the R-rated cut.
text: The film is too clean. You can tell there's a gritty, down and dirty sci-fi gem hidden in there but it's been neutered to get an appropriate age rating. I understand why it was done - larger target audience etc. But first impressions count for a lot. Netflix and Snyder have played a dangerous game by realising a sanitised version.I may be biased as I enjoy the whole ragtag band of misfits trope, but the film isn't as bad as most reviews make it out to be. The film basically takes that trope and runs with it for 2.5 hours. Then it ends. There lies the main problem; we now have to wait 5 months for the pay off. Would a 4 hour long R-rated offering rather than two (essentially four when the r-rated cuts are released) 2.5 hour long films really turn people off? I don't think so.I know Snyder loves to make use of slow-motion, but he's gone a bit overboard here. I've taken another point off for that.

title: It's really good - ignore the bad review bombing
text: What you have here is a very strong very good start of a sci fi story, I see many reviews bashing it - but most of them are hitting at the director - because for some reason they don't like him.......it's not the movie - it's their distain for the director - I guess (apart from mine) if the review focuses on the director - ignore it!The reviews who focus on the story or the movie as a whole are very positive!!!!!! - so my advice - if you can understand this is the first half of a story and you don't wanna........for some reason hit at the directorWatch it - you will enjoy itIt's like dune mixed with seven samurai a sprinkling of star wars and king arther - if you like that stuff......I watched it and loved it - I can't wait for the second half!Remember if the review is bashing the director - however subtle - it's just their hate for him - not the movie!

title: Exceptionally bad
text: Now to be fair, I spent most of the movie looking at my phone, because it was boring as hell. I'm really not sure what was happening in this movie. Something something rebels, something something bad imperial force. It's as uninteresting as it is unbelievable. Visually it's looks like the stuff that was left on the cutting room floor of bladerunner. The acting may be worse than the story, but it's a hard to tell. They introduced characters so fast and so shallow that I'm not sure I even know everyone's name. Also, why is this PG13. It just doesn't work. It wants to be violent, but it can't. Uggghh I hope this isn't what we're to expect from Snyder going forward.

title: I don't get why it got so much hate
text: I really don't understand the hate this movie got, I was expecting it to be so much worse but I was pleasantly surprised. Ok, it won't win any prices for the screenplay or acting but it was a fun watch. It's a weird world with strange characters blended together, true, it's a bunch of everything but it's a fun watch, isn't that what sci-fi is supposed to be? It's way better than any of the disney star wars sequels for sure. It's got the classic by now split of the the evil white guys that are the negative characters and the diverse group of positive characters with a minority woman in the lead and the strong black men, which noawadays are mandatory, so it got that checked. The visuals are great, it has action, honestly a fun, brainless watch, for the weekend when you don't feel like thinking but just enjoy a movie. It feels like it crams a few too many things together and the way the characters are introduced feels forced, like it would have been better as a series with a full episode dedicated to each character. This is why I took points off mostly. The acting while not great is not horrible either, it just feels like a series more than a movie, I guess that would be the feeling it gives me. Still, worth a watch if you want a basic SF that takes you to a strange new universe without making you think, just a relaxing watch.

title: Not that bad
text: I think the film gets a bit harsh criticism. There are some things that are a bit burdensome, such as the constant use of slow motion, some rushed cuts to the next scene without an interlude and then the choreography in the fight scenes is also a bit crooked... The effects and scenery are different but cool enough. I actually think the personal gallery is fine too. And Ed Skrein is always good as hell. I agree that it doesn't bear comparison with Dune and probably not Starwars either. The story is not innovative either, but honorable and all in all I was well entertained. I'm actually looking forward to seeing part 2.

title: Battle beyond the stars 1980
text: They did not come out and say it but this movie does have the Battle beyond the stars 1980 feeling, i guess this was roger corman best science fiction movie ever.No the story is not 100% the same in Rebel Moon the protagonist had some military training and was pretty good too, but in Battle beyond the stars the protagonist was a real farmer had no military training nor war experience and was a pacifiste.But the rest of the story is the same an invading force against defenseless famers, will come by in a short amount of time to reclaim the land.Now i am not sure why all the bad reviews because this movie was excellent from the effects to acting and honest i cannot wait to see part 2.

title: Suspend reality and lose yourself
text: The special effects in movies nowadays are just incredible. These interplanetary landscapes, galaxies and spaceships look simply awesome. The storyline moves along at a good pace and there are countless characters to enjoy. Reminiscent of early Star Wars in parts. Phenomenal wardrobe and special effects. Very creative blend of medieval and futuristic worlds. It's a long movie. I normally steer clear of 2hr+ movies but this one kept me interested all the way. Science fiction overload at times but allow yourself to embrace the fantasy world and you'll be fine.Grab your popcorn, turn up the volume and enjoy the ride.

title: Not a good movie
text: The dialogue was horrible.The situations were horrible, and unnecessary.So much slow motion to cover up for bad fight choreography.Very disappointed in this, but not all that unexpected since it is a Zach Snyder movie. Why do they keep giving this guy money to put out bad movies? I assume the studios are just looking for losses for their taxes.This first part was slow moving and uninspiring, it could have been shortened to 1 hour for backstory and gathering this horrible band of heroes, then right into the second part.I'll still was the second part, but I expect more of the same boring stuff.

title: not bad - not extraordinary, a nice start.
text: This universe is new.When stargate, starwars, firefly, star trek ... and so many others was released no one give them a real chance. All the critics and the haters was unanimous to say "it will not work" "it is too strange" "it will be forgotten very fast" well ... they were all wrong.I watched this one, and it is a good start.It is not revolutionary, but honestly, what is in 2024 ?We have already seen / watch everything or almost.So, exactly as i said some years ago with star trek discovery and strange new world it will last and some will be very good, some will be forgettable.This new saga deserve a real chance.It is something fresh, let it grow.And by the way, it is not a bad movie at all.

title: Funny that this movie is rated below 6 and Marvel hits 8 / 9
text: Great movie! Takes a lot of work and courage to bring a new Sci Fi hit.Great villains, great heroes, and I can't wait to see the next one!It reminds me of other movies like Star Wars, Avatar, Hunger Games, and superhero movies.I think it's not an amazing movie, the universe has potential and no doubt it's entertaining.I would have invested more time in the characters stories, but i think it's ok.As said in the title, I dont understand the criteria to review this movie vs other ones from Marvel for example (which I love by the way) which have a much better score, and they are similar products.The difference is that marvel is more popular, and this movie is bringing a whole new story.Embrace new projects, new stories!

title: Slow down the slow mo Zack, and focus on the script
text: There are times when too much of what was once a good thing can become overkill, and that's exactly what happens in Rebel Moon. Zack's slow motion moves gave 300 an added edge especially in the action scenes, but now it is in danger of becoming a parody. Why the urge to have slow mo shots in even non-action scenes, e.g. Hugging, planting a flag? And even in action scenes, doesn't Zack get it by now that, too much of an ingredient can actually spoil the taste? I'd wanna watch action scenes flowing smoothly, and while I don't mind the occasional slow mo, having one too many just yanks at the adrenalin build-up within that scene.Underneath Rebel Moon is a plot and narrative with good potential. Maybe the next Dune or Star Wars. Unfortunately this is wasted with poor acting, and poor character and plot development.Having a wooden lead in Sofia Boutella, who fails to project a commanding screen presence is probably the biggest bug. This is nowhere near her turnout in Star Trek, which was probably her best screen role to date.While there are some big names in the acting department, most of them have inconsequential screen time other than when they are showing off their respective fighting skills when called into duty by Boutella's Kora. For e.g. Djimon Hounsou's General Titus is supposed to be a fearsome and skilled warrior, but I can't even recall his fight scenes. It's the same with the rest of the team that make up the rebel warriors, they end up being remembered more for their painted faces or exposed upper body. The final battle scene too, doesn't last long enough to register; in fact, the one scene that I thought was worth the effort was when Donna Bae's Nemesis faced off Harmada. But after that, Nemesis too, slips into the background.The few moments that lit up the screen was when Charlie Hunnam and Ed Skrein were on it. Hunnam's experience probably helped elevate an otherwise short screen time who pretty much stepped into the background until the final moments. Whereas Skrein chews it away with relish playing the baddie, carrying it off as well as he did with his Zapan in Alita Battle Angel. Take these two away, and the rest of the cast are mostly forgettable.And, what's with Irish brogue? Gee whizz, this is supposed to be taking place in a galaxy far, far away, and yet, they sound like they're hanging out at the streets of Dublin? Why mess up whatever dose of realism that exists?Rebel Moon has potential, and while I'm not sure how Pt 2 is gonna turn out, but if it's more of the same as in Pt 1, then it's not going to give us anything fresh or new.And that means we don't really have anything to look forward to.

title: Calls out the uneducated
text: Why do complete puppets keep comparing this to Bore Wars is beyond me. Majority of them reviewed the movie before it was available which is shameful. Watch this than SW New Hope. New Hope gets crushed. Rewatching Star Wars I realized the acting could be compared to a D movie at best. Same as Trek fans they bash Star Wars yet their acting is as bad or worse. Snyder created a world and for the first part I think it was fantastic (better than a story about brothers nailing sisters). This was also brought to Disney from Snyder years ago they just didn't like the violence as Star Wars is for little Ewok inbred loving people.

title: Cliche Fantasy Movie at Best
text: Mediocre fantasy movie written by people that have never seen or read good science fiction. With a budget of $166 million dollars, they seeming could not hire a single person with a sci-fi background. My guess is they just googled "top ten concepts in science fiction", then never bothered to research what any of it meant. Then, for some reason they added a dash of Greek/Roman mythology because "THAT'S SO EPIC BRO!". On a more positive note: If this was released on the SyFy channel as series with 30 minute episodes at a budget of 2 million each, I think I would have given it a few more stars. Netflix should be embarrassed.

title: IT'S NOT A GREAT MOVIE, BUT IT'S A GOOD MOVIE
text: _Personal Vote 6.5/10 (rounded up to 7)Rebel Moon honestly did not excite me, I found it to be a not particularly inspired film that traces a formula established decades ago by Star Wars (which at least in its early iterations had its own originality, though it never blew me away). That being said, however, it is by no means a bad fillm and an average rating around 6 or so would have been honest, but given the excessive criticism it received I preferred to give it, though not on merit, that extra half point...The story is absolutely clichéd however I find that, at least in this first part, it is particularly well rendered and all in all it holds up well, it does not shine but it is okay and manages to entertain.The real highlight of the film is the aesthetic compartment, extremely bombastic and visually charged, which considering the genre and the settings fits perfectly with the atmospheres that the film proposes which, combined with Snyder's direction (which I dislike a lot but in certain contexts like this one in my opinion works) gives the whole thing an "epic patina" with a certain visual display, even vaguely stylized (really in certain aspects it reminded me of the illustrations on the covers of old sci-fi books) which in this case doesn't hurt.So overall I would say it is by no means this bad movie as much as it is a perfectly enjoyable good entertainment film.... Perhaps it could be coming across as pretentious? But is the film itself more pretentious ho who has particular demands from the film in question?

title: I love it, just what I needed to watch!
text: It's a wonderful movie that takes you in a different world. That's how I understand the Seventh Art. You have to be able to just get away from your daily routine and for the next hour and a half just be in a different world! All I can say To all the critics out there is just 'watch the news' if you want reality, well, watch the news. I want a break from reality and that's why I really enjoy movies like this, new adventures, Sci Fi, romantic comedies even. So good work, job well done to the team behind this movie. Keep up the good work. Oh and lovely cast by the way, all in all I'm really happy!

title: as if a game designer created his own first debut film
text:
About Part One:When I watched this tape, it was like playing a computer game, but without an interface (just pressing the "PLAY" button)This film has its significant pluses and minuses. And it was even filmed with the soul, and it is felt...
Overall, despite the mediocre specific cinematography/operator work, at first glance, at first,
filmed allegedly and interesting enough (more interesting than the other way around) based on the story shown. But over time, you notice that everything is not so good, true connoisseurs and moviegoers will see under-processing/low imitations(falsificatio).The plot is too sluggish and straightforward (although, appropriate involved here special effects, even a little somehow corrected it all), the script and the idea have serious potential, but still,
along with the acting barely balance at the appropriate level to hold the whole story for sufficient perception, and the desire to (to) watch further.There is a noticeable attempt to reveal the personalities of the characters and the main hero s/heroine s, although it turned out to be inferior in them*...
Based on everything, this film product can be watched, and try to appreciate, without expecting something special for over-OVER expectations.Although, indeed, it was filmed with a soul, it is felt.Done.

title: Everything was missing
text: When the name Zack Snyder is mentioned, one anticipates a compelling cinematic experience, but with this film, the director/author seems to have missed the mark entirely.Starting from the initial fight sequence, the choreography was notably subpar and as a viewer, it becomes apparent early on that you're in for a dull movie.Star Wars pioneered a similar plot with an evil force attempting to dominate the universe and a group of rebels opposing it. However, that remains a classic to this day. In contrast, this film appears clueless, lacking a coherent story, featuring forced scenes, and suffering from exceedingly poor execution.Despite Sofia Boutella in the lead, the movie fails to evoke any excitement whatsoever.Available on NETFLIX during the holidays, you might consider watching it if there's nothing else, but do so with significantly lowered expectations.Part second releasing on in April 2024, hoping it to be better and ending it for good.

title: 40k
text: Its not bad, but I would rather watch the 40k movie that this really should be...It contains elements of its star wars background, like the bounty hunters scene where even the music screams of star wars, but most of the build up and iconography in the first scenes makes you think of the Empire. This could have been a really cool 40k film, or possibly a star wars film, but as it stands, it falls between, beeing neither here nor there. Snyder is best at making the looks of a film, and not the heart. A 40k film would have been really perfect for his style. Trying to make a whole new universe is ambitious but not really... Necessary. A shame.

title: The secret to happiness is low expectations!
text: There are so many bad reviews about there being nothing original in this film. I didn't mind it because I pretty much expect to not be wowed anymore when watching a show or a movie. So few are super original and it seems like pretty much everything is a remake or copied ideas. This wasn't great but it wasn't as bad as people say. If you go into it to see some cool special effects and want to turn your mind off for a bit you will be ok. If you go into it looking for something insanely new and exciting, you will be disappointed.Now apparently I need to type more because I haven't hit the required minimum characters even though I said all that needed to be said. Have a great day everyone!

title: Interesting universe, with somewhat boring characters
text: Rebel Moon is a sci-fi adventure that takes you on an exciting journey through a captivating universe. The film boasts an intricate world-building that will surely delight fans of the genre. The music and costumes are also noteworthy, adding an immersive touch to the overall experience. Compared to Marvel movies, Rebel Moon offers a refreshing take on the genre, delivering a solid and engaging story. However, it falls short on character development and pacing. The film doesn't invest enough time in the protagonists to make the audience care about their journey, and some moments feel rushed. Despite its flaws, Rebel Moon is still worth watching, and fans will be anticipating its sequel. Overall, the movie earns a score of 6 out of 10.

title: a copy of a copy of a copy...
text: Rebel Moon is the worst movie I have watched in years.The best way I can describe it is that you have a series of channels, all playing fantasy and sci-fi movies, and you switch between them every 10 minutes and watch a scene. There is no connective tissue in this movie. Nothing makes sense. It is a goddamn mess with people who can normally act but don't here. Nothing is original. Everything we have seen in dozens of movies before. Zneyder brings nothing new to the table. Its super slow and lazy and i am sure nobody wants to see the second part. Nobody asked for this or wants to see this. Useless movie.

title: Not perfect but fun, and beautiful to watch
text: This movie is getting more hate than it should just because it started as a Star Wars pitch. Not Star Wars. It's not perfect, it has some exposition issues and yada yada's some things but overall it's an adventure epic with great action pieces, solid acting and great production value. Lots of world building and the start of something fun. Give a chance not expecting LOTR level quality and you'll have fun. Isn't that what we go to the movies for?
