Baddies are cool, tech is weird, scale is felt and again, the action pieces work. You'll get your Snyder trademark slow mos and ramp ups, and they don't overstay their welcome.

title: Really good movie!
text: This was a very good movie with good acting and a good script. The reason this movie has such a low rating is a bunch of Star Wars snobs are expecting something it is not. I love Star Wars and this movie is not Star Wars. It only similarity in the end but that is it. There was no force, no Luke, no Yoda... It was a very good action movie that has potential to be a really good and unique series. The lead actress does a good job and her fighting is very entertaining and the supporting cast were good as well. The main antagonist was excellent, his best roll since Deadpool. One bad thing about the movie was the amount of slow-mo action was a bit too much.

title: Typical Zack Snyder
text: The movie offers light entertainment; nothing more and nothing less. The action is quite impressive, the worldbuilding has the potential to tell interesting stories and cultures. Unfortunately, the characters are bland, the story feels like a mix of "A New Hope" and "The Last Samurai." Unfortunately, the enemies also come across as a cheap copy of the Germans from the Third Reich, both visually and in terms of the plot. If a more creative story had been told, perhaps not so diluted (in the form of a series?), it could have been a lot of fun. I will watch the second part, but I'd be surprised, if the second one is better or different than the first one.

title: Dumb bunch of separated, meaningless elements
text: I have been looking forward this film, watching the trailer I expected a large-scale work of art and a magical, monumental, strange world with quaint creatures, furthermore, a meaningful, coherent mythology.But at the very beginning of the movie I disappointed: a handful nazis attacks a handful irish farmers. These scenes depict a totally Earth-like world, some wears T-shirt, some wears necktie (!), there is no even costums. There is no fantasy, no invention in it. It is no a magical world but a tasteless, boring scene.But there is bigger problem with the the antagonist. Star Wars' Darth Vader was an alien-like, mighty, frightening character, full of mistery, but in Rebel Moon the enemy isn't enough daunting and interesting, it has no strong personality, no face with definite contours. Noble is a miserable clown, his soldiers are small-minded, stupid men with only dumb sexual motivation. You can't feel the power and the threatening presence of the evil, as you did so seeing the Star Destroyers and Death Star in Star Wars. So there is no true, gripping conflict in this film.At the second half of the film Kora is hopping from planet to planet. The problem is that none of this worlds and their people is interesting enough, they are underdeveloped, you don't know anything about them. The characters (Nemesis, Tarak etc.) have no personality (or, only in visual appearence), no background story, no any motivation - why do they fight with Kora? Their presence is only a flash on the screen.There are few interesting landscapes and buildings. Backgrounds are empty, in most of the cases you can see only the gloomy sky or some blurry tower, walls. Colours are greyish, it should be more light on the screen.Only Sofia Boutella is great, she is so charismatic, beautiful like a nymph and agressive like a soldier at the same time. She would have deserved a better film.

title: Better than you'd think
text: I was originally out off watching this my the low rating on here, however I don't get why people berate it so much. The actors and acting are all decent, despite Charlie Hunnam's accent, with the lead actor playing Kora and Atticus Noble being particularly good. The visual effects are also very good, especially when called upon so much for a sci-fi film (recent Disney releases have been much worse). The plot although not groundbreaking is easy to follow and makes sense, although is clearly a set up for the 2nd.If you want an easy viewing sci-fi film to just sit back and relax to then this is worth a try. Ignore the harsh "critics"'on here. I've seen considerably worse that scores higher.

title: ABSOLUTELY DREADFUL
text: Welcome to the rebel moon universe, a carelessly crafted world of patch work, hand stitched together(barely) by none other than the "Great" Zach Snyder himself. This movie is heavily influenced by much better media, and yet somehow fails to capture even a modicum of it's influencers brilliance. The main character is dull and uninteresting to watch (not the actress' fault). The side characters just seem to appear as the plot demands, no real reason for why we need them other than to make the film feel seven samurai esque. The dialogue...oh my God the dialogue, who the heck talks like that? Nobody.Now Zach is known for his amazing action scenes, but they were no where to be found here, the frequent use of slow motion, plus the unnecessary need for cool shots really turned this movie's action scenes on it's head, matter of fact i got so bored with some of it that i had to skip, skip again, then hyper skip. (Thank God for that netflix skip button).There is also a twist in this movie that even a child could see coming, it's a wonder how a trained soldier and her lackeys couldn't see it too. All in all, this movie is dreadful and Zach should not be allowed to write his scripts alone or maybe even at all. 3/10.

title: The Most Disappointed I can remember
text: I was so excited for this movie. I watched it the second it came out and man was I disappointed. I don't understand how this could be made. Everything about this movie is boring. Every action scene is in slow motion... Literally every part... Not just a key moment here and there to highlight something but the entire action scene is in slow motion. So the movie plods along with hard to hear dialogue with pretty backdrops and then when you think you're finally going to get some action it's in slow motion.I like Zack Snyder movies but this is easily his worst movie. I won't bother with the sequel and I suggest you don't bother with this movie. I'm so glad it wasn't in the theater.

title: The seed of something...
text: A settlement on a distant moon finds itself threatened by a tyrannical ruling army, strangers from across planets band together to stop them.Director Zack Snyder hodgepodge draws inspiration from ancient Rome to Old English epic poems, real-world history, and more, echoing Westerns, Seven Samurai, Tolkien, and Frank Herbert, among others. Borrowing elements from Star Wars, Chronicles of Riddick, and Battle Beyond the Stars, Snyder excels in blending this diverse mix into a visually hard-hitting, coherent, and entertaining ride that holds potential for the beginnings of something special.Sofia Boutella as Kora is notable, alongside the likeable cast ensemble. Ed Skrein as antagonist Admiral Atticus Noble makes for a memorable character. Both Charlie Hunnam and Michiel Huisman deserve a mention. Anthony Hopkin's dulcet tones as the voice of mechanical knight of Jimmy is a fitting addition.Granted, there are moments of overkill, along with lingering slow-motion scenes. While the costumes are intricate and beautifully made, they never distinctly define the differences between the players, especially in the case of the rebels Nevertheless, with a few twists and an abundance of flashbacks and exposition thrown in, the synergy between acting, special effects, Tom Holkenborg's score and staging contributes to the film's overall compelling and immersive nature.Highly recommended science fiction -take a look for yourself.

title: Worth it!
text: I don't understand how this got such a low rating? It is excellent! The storyline is brilliant, the characters are amazing and the acting is above par! Definately a movie that his ample potential for quite a few sequels. I say yes...worth a watch and a good 90 minutes spent. I love the emotion portrayed, the main actress is a stunner with striking features, and her acting is brilliant. I will not spoil the plot for you but I love the storyline even though it is an obvious plotline, good vs evil, the masses revolting against the privaleged few ... It is after all called rebel moon..I say watch it and ignore those who tend to overblowt their importance in critique.

title: I was hoping reviews were harsh, but they were on point.
text: I often like sci-fi movies a lot more than the general public but I have to agree on this one. It's basically Star Wars meets Dune meets Seven Samurai but instead of being inspired by those, or even an homage, it's just lazy, sloppy copy/paste stitched together with an overabundance of lens flare.Questionable directing, bad writing, and mediocre acting even from actors who are usually better like Charlie Hunnam made it difficult to keep my attention, though I admit it gets a little less boring towards the end, but the first hour does set a low bar. You can definitely skip this and I am not sure I'll even attempt watching Part 2.

title: Very good just needs expanded
text: Surprised how much I enjoyed it. The only thing that felt stifled was the amount of characters they needed to develope in a brief amount of time. Would have been better with more content and backstory. Looking forward to the Snyder cut.Surprised how much I enjoyed it. The only thing that felt stifled was the amount of characters they needed to develope in a brief amount of time. Would have been better with more content and backstory. Looking forward to the Snyder cut.Surprised how much I enjoyed it. The only thing that felt stifled was the amount of characters they needed to develope in a brief amount of time. Would have been better with more content and backstory. Looking forward to the Snyder cut.

title: I used to like Sci-Fi... thanks Zack
text: Love Sci-fi but hate any original ideas? Then you're gonna love the borderline copyright infringement that is Rebel Moon on Netflix...It's almost laughable how many different ideas Zack Snyder has hijacked to create this rather poorly executed pile of low grade CGI rubbishIt shamelessly dips between Star Wars, Dune and even into Warhammer 40k. Then, through what I can only assume was an AI generated joke, we get a painful hybrid of Avatar & Harry PotterIf you watch with both eyes partially closed you will still spot the mad max makeup, nazi costumes and middle earth sceneryNot to mention he manages to fill this two hour fan fiction without creating a single character arc at any point. Honestly, you can create a better character story by skipping up and down channels on freeview and calling yourself a directorYes ok, the Borg Queen with a spider body is a nice effect, although nothings we haven't seen before but, no amount of Firefly Class & Battlefleet Gothic knock off ships could drag this movie out of the black hole left by the reported £130 budgetThe only close thing to a saving grace are the occasional fight sequences which, if not for the horrendous over use of super slow motion, Judge Dread guns and laser swords would almost make a salvageable 15-20 minutes of viewingBut hey, if you get bored, you can always just pretend you're watching literally any other B movie spin off from pretty much any sci-fi universe that takes your fancyI've never written a movie review before, which I hope tells you how abysmal this time theft dross is. I am amazed how someone can take so many incredible ideas and make something almost painful to watchIt's your time though, so if you have over two hours you want to lose and never get back, you know where to look.Utter trash.

title: Entertainment, sequences and visuals
text: 6.5 actually.Yes, it's definitely an incredible story with a lot of unbelievable moments but all in all I was entertained and even captivated. Beautiful visuals really amaze and the acting is fair but not wonderful. I think it's a little bit mish mash with the whole idea. You've got a quaint little village looks like it's set in the 18th century, then you have bizarre looking monsters as well as people who look like they are from ancient Rome mixed in with modern Star Wars like ships and weapons. It's a bit confusing to work out which era we are in.However, the pace is better than I expected and it kept me watching. I was not expecting to enjoy it as I don't normally watch this type of film.The action scenes are great to watch apart from being completely unbelievable but all the same it's film and we don't expect reality.I do recommend it if youre after fiction not fact.

title: A lazy script, but an overhated movie
text: Rebel Moon: Part One = 6/10The film has great visuals and conjures up some beautifully staged and filmed images on the screen.Ed Skrein as the antagonist plays his role great and with a lot of charisma. The General is an absolute scene stealer and a really good bad guy.Kora also works well as a protagonist and has an interesting backstory and an exciting relationship with Nobel.The film has some very creative approaches, especially when it comes to the backstories of the various characters, it is clear that the film has a lot to tell.The film has a lot of good action. The fights are well staged and are extremely fun and have a certain brutality to them.Unfortunately, the plot is all back and forth until the end and simply doesn't find a point. The entire plot only builds up what is supposed to be completed in the sequel. It's just rushing from planet to planet without leaving time for deep scenes.The characters also barely function and each character barely gets to say more than three sentences in the entire film. There isn't a character who doesn't fulfill a cliché or even has a hint of depth.The CGI is typical of Zack Snyder but is unfortunately rather weak.

title: How can you make something that bad and pretend it's original?
text: With all the promo this film got since it's annoucement, it should have been very good, or at least good. It is not the case. First of all, the whole plot is a rip off from the Ahsoka book. The badass rebel hiding from the vilains on a farmng moon going to find people to create a true rebellion against Nazis with Roman names.Everything in that movie has been seen at least 1000 times in the past, including the villain saving a little girl, raising her as a warrior and becoming the main villain. It's just pathetic with soulless characters and ugly spaceships.I'm thankful that Disney refused this garbage for a Star Wars Movie. Maybe when the part wil come out we may appreciate it but I really doubt about that. We already know howthis story will end...

title: A New Vision of something Familiar
text: So yes it's going to give off Star Wars vibes very quickly, with that being said-nothing's original so enjoy watching fun slow-mo action scenes, some world building, and an interesting ensemble of rag tag characters.I won't say that this didn't come with its own amount of flaws (which hopefully get resolved by the directors cut) so I'll just judge this version for now. It definitely would've worked better as a series as we don't get enough backstory for some of the other members of the team. There were some scenes that really could've used some explaining or maybe just should've been cut entirely.Parts were a bit rushed but overall I think if you go in knowing that it's a Snyder film and it's going to be what it is then you'll get some enjoyment out of it.The acting in my opinion wasn't necessarily over the top but if some scenes weren't rushed than or if there was just more backstory then they would've connected to the audience more.Again, he wasn't trying to retell a rated R Star Wars but drew inspiration heavily from "Seven Samurai" and "Heavy Metal"

title: Enough with the negativity.
text: Zack Snyder has done a great job with his own vision. James Cameron was dealt the same destruction when Avatar first came out. They are both creative people beyond what the movies have become. Most others are remakes and pawns off other ideas. Enough badgering and enjoy. It's up to everyone to come to thier own conclusion. I, in my opinion, give more glory to those that make their OWN story. I enjoy these NEW ideas. This masterpiece is filled with every aspect: action, compassion, revenge, drama and the idea of what could be. Enjoy for yourselves and dont read these reviews! It's all about experiencing what YOU want and what whisks you away.

title: Seven Samurai in space. Surprisingly enjoyable
text: I knew from the get go the movie was going to be roasted by critics and audience as well. This is a Zack Snyder so expect lots of slow mo's and ridiculous writing and characters. But for some reason I really enjoyed this movie more than I thought I would or even should.The story is pretty similar to Seven Samurai but in space. Farmers are threatened by soldiers and then seek the help in different parts of the system to recruit a band of warriors to fight them (the soldiers) when they come back for the harvest. Apparently Zack Snyder wanted to make a Star Wars movie and Disney didn't like his pitch so he made his own thing. The movie has influences from all kinds of sci-fi movies like Dune and Flash Gordon. I am actually looking forward to part two.

title: Felt like a bad video game made with early 2000s CGI
text: From what i hear, this had a bigger budget than The Creator, but it looks terrible, like youtube-fan-movie-terrible.Scenes on the "Rebel" moon were color graded to be invasive red, but on a different cut there was no grading at all - it was raw footage. I had to rewind just to make sure i was not losing my sanity. Such goofs make me believe that this was outsourced to low budget studios with big promises. But the reality of this is that the money saved on hiring quality talent is lost in the "box-office" along with your credibility as filmmaker.Writing was video game level - they were going from one side quest to another while gathering new npc teammates. Villains were made to be infantile-evil. Screenwriter, please study "Hans Landa" from Inglourious Basterds to gain insight.

title: Not as great as I had hoped.
text: I was really looking forward to this film. I love Zach Snyder and thought his Justice League cut was a masterpiece. I think this movie had a lot of great potential but it just unfortunately doesn't live up to the hype. It's got incredible visuals and special effects. Musical score is good. Performances are solid. Character building is minimal. I really didn't feel like we had enough time in 2 hours to understand any of the characters enough to truly care about them other than Kora herself. Writing was subpar. Costume design was a bit off. Why are the soldiers wearing what looks like tortoise shells? Why is the arch nemesis wearing a simple white dress shirt and black tie? Why is his most menacing weapon what appears to be a simple cane? Why do the soldiers speak in a US military style dialect? And for the love of God can we please move on from these movies depicting what appears to be a skinny female waif sustaining on 1200 calories a day who we're supposed to believe can defeat a room full of fully armed and muscled super soldiers? No offense to Sofia Boutella...I mean, she's gorgeous but am I really supposed to believe she's some sort of Seal Team 6 assassin? Do something like Felicity Jones in Rogue One. That was more believable but this was just...way over the top. Some of those fight scenes had me rolling my eyes. All that being said, my wife enjoyed it much more than I did. I think the best performance was probably Ed Skrein as the bad guy. The most interesting performance was the robot voiced by Anthony Hopkins but he's barely in the film. I'll come back and re-vote after I get to watch the director's cut. I really hope it's much better and fleshes in more details.

title: Better than expected
text: Considering the scathing reviews, I went into this with no small amount of skepticism. I was pleasantly surprised. Is it as good as it could have been? No. But is it as bad as critics have said? No. It's entertaining and its populated with actors I really like, including a nearly unrecognizable Corey Stoll, Michiel Huisman. And Sofia Boutella. I enjoyed it. So if you like sci-fi, give it a try and you also might be pleasantly surprised. I really like Boutella a lot, and I enjoyed her as much in this as I did in The Kingsman and Star Trek. And I Loved Huisman in The Haunting of Hill House and he doesn't disappoint. Plus he's gorgeous.

title: There is no need for a Part Two
text: To be honest I'm not the biggest Snyder fan so my expectations were very low but Snyder again managed to underperform my literally non existent expectations and delivered a movie that is long winded, not well written, most of the time boring and senseless. The main problem starts with the poor storytelling. From the beginning there is no real character development, the audience gets introduced to a bunch of protagonists, species, worlds and conflicts with some flashy recaps, not understanding what's the overall framework/role of each one and which leads at the end to more unanswered and open questions. The movie also feels like a copy of different previous works by mixing elements from Star Wars, dune, Harry Potter mixed with Conan (LOL) or other movies, trying to create something better. Overall i had really to fight with this one giving it a chance but this was a disappointment on all levels. If you guys still liked it I'm happy for youSo My summary about rebel moon:

title: Worth A Watch
text: Overall, it's worth a watch...Visually stunning, but felt like the characters would benefit from a little more time to develop. Hard to feel scared or sad for characters that didn't have enough screen time to gain your emotional attachment. Like other Snyder films, I imagine the directors cut will fill in those gaps and bump up the rating a couple notches.Wish they would have released the director's rated R version first or maybe just both parts together but I understand the dilemma. It won't win any awards but it's got a lot of potential and I'm interested to see where it goes with part 2.

title: Boring, predictable, poorly directed, Star wars knockoff
text: I had high hopes for this movie, but Its bad, really bad, Its like a b budget movie with lots of cgi. The writers must have been 4th graders because the story line is just so bla bla bla... The directing is just terrible, it looks like they brought in a high school drop out working for a $10 an hour temp service to cut and paste the movie together. And the fight scenes are like they used a cookie cutter, i mean the super swords woman looked like my grandma swinging fly swatters at a few bees, rhe punches thrown looked like they was straight off a middle school drama club play. I mean wtf is going on in Hollywood....

title: fun weekend popcorn movie for all in the family
text: This movie is not a 10, but it is now a 2 or 3 either. The plot is 100% inspired by the 1954 movie Seven Samurai, and the mmany copies of it like the more American 1960 The Magnificent Seven. History truly repeats itself.Movies 4, 5, and 6 of star wars did not have the great dialogue, yet I had a ball in the theatre, even with Jar Jar Binks.No, no oscar awards here . This is a live action comic book movie, akin to the silver age. Think Flash Gordon, Buck Rogers. Gang, it is just plain fun and I did not mind all the slow mo scenes Snyer adores to use. It was fine.My picky 15 year old jaded teen daughter liked it, and my ancient self did as well. At times it is fun to watch a movie with a super simple plot, where good and evil are super defined unlike Mission Impossible Dead Reckoning and that convoluted layered plot that requires an evidence board to keep semi straight. Not in this movie, poor falmers good, nazi looking gestapo storm troopers bad. Easy.That this was supposed to be a Star Wars movie that Disney turned down is very evident. Too bad, too. Better than the force awakens trash. There is zero wokeness in this movie, and the female lead is not unbeatable or all powerful . She knows she needs help.This is the pg13 version. There will be Snyder cut that will be about 4 hours long with more meat. Not kidding you. I heard it will add all the character development that was removed from this version. The biggest weakness the movie has is lack of character development. First though we need to get past part 2 in early 2024. Looking forward.

title: It's like the script was written by chatGPT - an absolute stinker
text: It's like someone had asked chatGPT to write a script for "the magnificent seven in space". To say that it is derivative would be a kindness. It's more like a smorgasbord of lines and scenes plagiarized from other Sci-fi movies. The acting is wooden, and the script is clunky - it's like a bad Star Wars fan fic. The writing makes George Lucas seem as sophisticated and witty as Oscar Wilde. Also, the director loves lens flare even more than JJ Abrams.The only interesting parts were the Norwegian style colony and the conflicted robot. It says something when the robot is the actually the best actor in the movie. But the movie plummets rapidly after the first 20 minutes and just become a badly edited collection of movie rip-offs.An absolute stinker.

title: Magnificent Seven in Space
text: I disagree with the reviews that say the plot of Rebel Moon is hard to follow or does not make sense. It is also NOT a rip off of Star Wars or Dune. If anything, it follows the plot of the Magnificent Seven - band of fighters gathered to protect a small town fro.big bad guys. Yes there is a "bar scene" similar to the bar scene is Star Wars, but there are similar bar scenes in almost every western ever made. While Rebel Moon shares some plot elements with Star Wars, it is not the same move. Star Wars shares many plot elements with Foundation. So what? Rebel Moon is its own movie with many interesting plot twists and notable differences. CGI is excellent. It has grit and realism. Entertaining movie. Well worth the watch.

title: Good but not great...still it's being judged too harshly
text: No real spoilers here.I read about thirty of the reviews here before firing up the movie. I was going to watch it either way. The people who are giving this movie ratings of 1, 2, 3 stars clearly were not watching this movie with the intent of just kicking back and enjoying a new sci-fi movie. They went into it with all the knowledge of what brought it about to begin with, who made it, and I believe had already decided that they were going to watch it with a super critical eye, and they had great fun tearing it apart when it was over. I feel it is being judged a bit too harshly.Are there plenty of cliche' sci-fi tropes here? Of course. Can you draw parallels to other fairly recent characters and themes from other big name movies? You bet. Nowadays I think it is nearly impossible to find any TRULY unique and original movies of any genre anymore. Everything has been done. So now the studios are just redoing them.Honestly I enjoyed it. I popped my popcorn and I put the movie on and I relaxed and watched a pretty solid movie. It's a Netflix movie. It was never going to make a billion dollars. But it's a decent popcorn flick with plenty of action, okay storytelling, and one or two characters you might begin to care about. The special effects were solid. The world building was fine, you can only do so much of that when trying to stuff as much into two hours as they do here. A bit overwrought and melodramatic too much of the time, but it is dealing with heavy stuff.To be honest with you, about the only thing that REALLY annoyed me were the uniforms of the villainous and ruthless Realm officers, which you will see relatively soon in the movie. Stylized SS uniforms or maybe Soviet era uniforms. Long jackets, jackboots, peaked cap hats, skinny ties, and tall collars, it's all there. No imagination at all. Change the SS or Hammer & Sickle on the collars and hats to some other squiggly lines and you've got innovative costume design. THAT is cliche'.Will I watch part 2? Yes I will. Is this the beginning of the next huge sci-fi universe, destined to spawn numerous sequels and huge fandom? No it is not. Relax, eat your popcorn, and watch with an open mind. Don't let others overly influence your enjoyment of what is ultimately an enjoyable movie.

title: Wasted potential.
text: A small settlement of farmers living on a distant moon is put on high alert, when a powerful, hostile battleship appears above their land, one of its villagers rises up to take on their aggressors.It's one of those films, where I'm watching, and asking myself if I'm enjoying it or not, and that is never a good sign.On the plus side, some of the special effects are pretty good, and some of the acting is decent, but the story has been done so many times, it just felt laboured and unoriginal. Even the music, I've heard it all before.I did like some of the costumes, were those conquerors inspired by The Nazis? They had that kind of vibe.Even the script just felt clunky and too stagey, it needed to be a little more raw, just too polished.Sofia Boutella does a solid job, but there's a little too much brooding, too many of those side eyed glances, Charlie Hunnam is decent too, a little wasted here I'd argue, but that accent, yikes.Don't ask me why, but it felt like a poor man's Dune.It could have been so much better.5/10.

title: Entertaining and Underrated Sci-Fi Adventure
text: In Veldt, a peaceful farmer colony is visited by the cruel Admiral Atticus Noble (Ed Skrein) of the Imperium from the Motherworld with his soldiers. He tells the villagers that they are hunting down the rebel siblings Devra (Cleopatra Coleman) and Darrian Bloodaxe (Ray Fisher) and offers to buy the village's surplus grain. However, their leader Sindri (Corey Stoll) refuses the offer and says that their production is not enough for his people. However, the ambitious Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) contradicts Sindri and tells to Noble that they might have surplus to sell to him. Noble kills Sindri and tells Gunnar to provide all their production in ten weeks. The he departs from Veldt but leaves a troop to check their harvest. When the soldiers catch the girl Sam (Charlotte Maggi) to gang-rape her, the villager Kora (Sofia Boutella) protects her and kills them all. Kora warns the villagers that Noble will return to destroy their village when he learns what happened and departs to the port of Providence with Gunnar to recruit General Titus (Djimon Hounsou) and his army to defend their village. They stumble upon the criminal Kai (Charlie Hunnam) that offers his ship to bring Titus. During their journey, he offers two warriors to fight with them, in a journey of revelations, betrayals and friendship."Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is an entertaining and underrated sci-fi adventure by Netflix. The storyline is a mix of "Seven Samurais" with "Star Wars", supported by a magnificent cinematography and CGI. But presently it is hard to see an original movie, since most of them are influenced by previous storylines. The screenplay is very reasonable, entwinning flashbacks along the development of the plot. The tyrannic villain is excellent, but the conclusion disappoints when he is rescued. The existence of invincible enemies is annoying in any movie. My vote is seven.Title (Brazil): "Rebel Moon - Parte 1: A Menina do Fogo" ("Rebel Moon - Part One: A Girl of the Fire")

title: Yawn.
text: I asked a friend of mine to come to see this with me in a theatre in New York but he could not come so I did not go. I'm so happy I did not pay extra to see this outside of my nNetflix account.I was told this would be Zack Snyder's best film ever. Not even close.Visually amazing, the scenery was something you wanted to see on a big screen, but what a boring story. It was so so boring watching some soldier gather other rebels to save her Moon. So boring.I think it's even worse when I realize this is supposed to be Part one of other parts. If part two turns out to be super good it will only be even worse that we got put through this garbage just to get to the good part.I did not see this in the theatre yet I want my money back.

title: Awful!
text: Please stop giving money to Zak Snyder.He has proven over and over, that he lacks the necessary creativity and imagination required for a SciFi creator.This movie is blatantly copying so many other movies and directors that it's hard to keep track of it. Theres the anamorphic lenses of Batman, which don't make any sense in this movie. Then there's the great story of the seven Samurai, which for Snyder isn't enough. He had to add star wars, Warhammer 40k. Predator, jj abrams lens flares, john effing carter , and countless more.And what puts the cherry on top is this awful CGI he constantly uses. Almost as if he's funneling my Netflix payments through his own CGI company directly into his own pockets.@Netflix: I am seriously considering cancelling my subscription because of abuse of funds. I am not willing to finance such crap any more.

title: Stunning to look at.
text: Oh my god was I excited for this. It was taking so much just to keep my expectations reasonable. So I kinda have a lot to say.Now in case you don't want to read the whole thing I'll condense it into a paragraph: basically the premise of the movie, the creature concepts and the characters types were great, visually it's a marvel; but when it came to the story and giving characters depth, it falls flat. Zack had a great vision/idea, he just should've had great writers to go with it. For screen play and dialogue. Cinematography was great, because if you watch this on mute this looks cool af.I loved the Zac snyder's justice league so I was hoping this will be like that and just kill it on first try instead of waiting for the directors cut, but it just feels like so much is missing in terms of character exploration and just has expositions in general where it's just narrated, mostly Kora.The initial world-building in the movie was great, providing a vivid glimpse into life and setting the tone visually. However, things only started took a turn after the characters left the moon/village. The film start with Anthony Hopkins' prologue and a score that felt of Game of Thrones-y. The beginning gave me immense promise, establishing a dark and captivating sci-fi ambiance. Visually, it was stunning-abounding with hero shots and scenes that seemed like they could be turned into paintings. The film showcased a strong vision in terms of creativity, featuring intriguing characters, creatures, and inventions. I particularly enjoyed the portrayal of creatures like the small blue-brained parasite thing, the imposing spider lady, and the eerie witches in red cloaks. While Zac apparently did everything, I think additional writers could have strengthened the overall narrative.Also a random thought, in the past, movies and series featuring AI or robots often portrayed them as inherently malevolent, leading to conflicts or wars. There was a prevailing assumption that any intelligent being other than humans would pose a threat. However, in recent films, there has been a shift towards showcasing the humanity within these AI entities, depicting their capacity for goodness or possessing a soul. One of the earliest movies to explore this perspective was Wall-e. Prior to that, many movies like the Terminator series portrayed AI and robots as antagonistic forces. Anyway I loved the robot, writing a paragraph about someone that only featured at the start and very end.Charlie Hunnam was great, Sofia boutella wasn't as bad ass as I thought she'd be when she wasn't in fighting scenes. Michiel Huisman looked like he could've been played by any other actor. Djimon Hounsou wasn't as good as I expected, felt like he was overcooking it in his intro. Ed Skrein felt very natural for the role, and I can't wait to see more of the robot. But I think the issues I had with the character was how they're written.The characters lacked depth, making it hard to form strong feelings of either liking or disliking them. Throughout most of the movie, many characters didn't have background stories, leaving us in the dark about what makes them 'them.' Then, in a rush at the end, their backgrounds are hurriedly revealed all in like 5min. Even for the few characters with backstories, it feels like a hasty summary, meeting them midway through their journey and abruptly asserting, "You can trust me because I used to be or am this person." This universe felt established, but lacking the sense of a franchise's promising beginnings.The first part of Rebel Moon could have significantly been better by dedicating more time to building up the characters and properly introducing them, instead of hastily summarizing their backgrounds in just 30 seconds or less. And me saying 30seconds is generous, because all one of them had was "hey this is a prince of a planet" and the story moves on. Like when were you gonna tell us?? It felt like when your spouse, in the middle of a random conversation, tells you 'oh by the way I mortgaged the house and the kids changed schools' then proceeds on with another conversation. Don't just gloss over that. Give us context. Also, the characters were recruited far too easily, as if the writers hurriedly pushed them to agree or trust others solely for the sake of advancing the plot without ample justification.A recent movie that's a good example of a "part 1" movie done well was dune. We got to like the characters and be in awe of this new foreign worlds, we got to really know them while still keeping intrigue and mystery on the part 2. But Zac Snyders movie felt like he kept too much a secret for too long, and you leave with all these thoughts of what's what, what's next and why something was the way it was but only because it feels like the movie is missing pieces.The story was a bit generic as far as rebel movies go, but the plot offered up a little switch with about 30 minutes to go but the climax ends pretty quickly. And Oh my god I was so hoping they didn't blow up the village at three end, for a split second I thought on the walk back to the village a ship would drop a missile.I didn't emotionally feel attached to the characters. Honestly if this didn't say "part 1" in its title I don't think they would green light another sequel. As something that's meant to start a franchise, it follows the same trope from many other sci-fi's that revolve around rebels, while lacking any spark or magic touch. I do hope that the sequel will be more inspired and creative story wise, with a more thrilling pace. I am glad that we don't have to wait too long, the ending showed that there's so much more history and lore that this universe has to offer.

title: This is just garbage, no, worse than garbage!
text: Decided to stop watching this crap after 45 minutes of wasted time. It has the feeling of being made by amateurs, rather than by a professional crew. Some of the animations were okay, but if that is all there is, then really, you have nothing. Every scene seems "borrowed" from other movies, and where have we seen rebels against the empire before? The thing that ruined it for me, really utterly and completely ruined it, were those dumb slow-motion shots, as it takes away all believability that one is immersed in some extragalactic fairy-tale. This seems more like an ongoing Sci-Fi horror show of C-grade quality. Can't believe that this "movie" has blown away $90,000,000 (or more). Please, we need real directors and producers with actual talent and new great stories, as this is just garbage, no, worse than garbage!

title: Star Wars + Justice League = Rebel Moon
text: One of the most anticipated film of 2023, "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is released and here's my thoughts on this film:-Positives :-1. Cinematography and color pallet of this film is completely Snyder Style, absolutely stunning.2. CGI and visuals are great.3. Film is enjoyable and engaging, atleast it don't get you bored.4. Action Choreography is so good.5. Background scores is amazing, I really enjoyed it.Negatives :-1. Story is not interesting, and it's like mixture of star wars and justice league.2. Unnecessary slow motions is the thing I didn't like it in this film.3. Writing, Direction and Storytelling of this is film is not good, just OK.4. Character Arcs are just so bad. I can't connect to any of the character.6. There are so many emotional moments, but I can't feel it due to poor character development.Final Thoughts and Review :-Overall, For "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire", I have OK OK feeling, it may be one time enjoyable, but that's all. I'm fan of Zack Snyder, and despite being him as director of this film, I sadly going to say that this is the most disappointed film of 2023 in my opinion.

title: A mess of a movie
text: What a mess.In its attempt to be an epic story it entirely messes everything up with exaggerated effects and messy and naive storyline.There seems to be no originality in this movie nor anything to make it stand out from others. The script and dialogues are cringingly mediocre.The movie seems to be too hyped up, but does not deliver anything but disappointment. Some fight scenes do look impressive, but shadowed by the poor and thin storyline. There is no background story and everything relies on the poorly executed and confusing story, that makes one wonder why to have wasted more than two hours on this film. The story is scratched on the surface with no depth at all.Why the Irish accent?I was surprised to see the that the director is Zack Snyder.

title: Rebel Moon
text: Jack, Jack, Jack, Jackedy Jack, Jack, Jack, Jack. This is bugs life in space, right? - followed swiftly by the stir-wars canteena and lord of the rings pubs, followed swiftly by Harry Potter and the prisoner of axe-key-bun, followed by a much better version of avatar riding a hippogriffe thingmyjig (wow, spellcheck actually let me write thingmyjig!). I'm halfway through and having a lot of fun watching this. But am a little disappointed there's no 300 blood and guts all over the place splattering. But I guess the millennials in charge of certification are... I love the way there's slow-mo in a whole bunch of random bits like falling on a stool and firing a gun and missing the target. I'm just envious you all get to have such fun making all these things. It is a load of fun.

title: Loved it!
text: Rebel Mood: A Cinematic Journey with Room for Growth..Rebel Mood is a visually captivating film, the cinematography shines, delivering stunning visuals. The attention to detail in world-building adds depth and authenticity to the narrative, making it a standout feature.However, as a fan of Zack Snyder's work, there's a sense that something intangible is missing. It's a feeling that lingers, leaving room for speculation on what could enhance the overall impact.Despite this, the film remains an enjoyable experience, showcasing Snyder's signature style and flair. As the narrative unfolds, I can't help but be intrigued, eagerly anticipating the second part. With the foundation laid in part one, there's optimism that part two will fill in the gaps and deliver an even more extraordinary cinematic journey.Rebel Mood stands as a testament to Snyder's ability to create visually striking worlds and characters, setting the stage for what could potentially be an epic saga.

title: Space Lady Don't need no man!
text: This god awful film compelled me to review it.How many more times do we gotta see some ChiComm's power fantasy before it sinks in that this is lazy, tropish, and uninspired?The characters are purposely stupid, aside from our hero armor donning leading lady.The world building is simply slapped together trying to steal elements from pretty much every actually good SciFi film.And don't forget, bad guys are bad...like space nazis...ya know...a novel concept in 2023. The characters, subtext, and symbolism is so hamfisted it's embarrassing. Nuance and subtlety must not exist in this reality.Boo, trash flick, skip it and save yourself 2hrs.

title: A potential universe with some polishing needed
text: Rebel Moon has potential to become a big universe. Part 1: A Child of Fire was good, although it had some issues with pacing and character development. Due to the short runtime, we didn't get to see much interaction between the crew members. And the background stories were planned for part 2, therefore I feel I have not invested much into the characters. That's the only issue I have with the movie. Everything else is amazing. The cinematography is beautiful, every scene is a painting. The action sequences were awesome, Kora was very badass. I would highly recommend this movie for anyone who got bored of the superheroes genre and wants a new breath of air. Give this movie a chance. I am also eagerly waiting for the r-rated version, which definitely will enhance the viewing experience.

title: An unmitigated dumpster fire
text: Let me start by saying that I really wanted to like this film. Truly. But where to begin with this abomination? Let's start with the story: it's a hackneyed good vs. Bad origin story laden with cringe worthy tropes. I regularly felt like I was watching a bargain bin mashup of the worst elements of Star Wars and Guardians of the Galaxy. The pacing of the story is also dismally narcoleptic. The film just trudged slowly forward and felt remarkably boring for what should have been a fun adventure.Then there's the characters. Or the lack thereof. They're trite, unrelatable, stereotypical and consistently at the mercy of a ghastly script that's regularly, unintentionally funny.The direction is no better, I'm afraid. The action sequences are clumsy and severely lacking in both panache and credibility. There are countless B-movie-like green screen shots that just didn't work out in creating the art style and atmosphere the Snyder achieved in 300. Then there's the use and abuse of tired old bullet-time moments that looked great in the Matrix 20+ years ago, but not anymore. And notably, considering it's a Zack Snyder film, I was surprised by how poor the photography was.The acting is, of course, subpar across the board. With this script, these people never had a shot, but they couldn't even live up to poor script expectations. Not a single one of them delivers a credible performance. There's an overarching feeling of everyone phoning it in throughout the film.Sadly, nothing came together in Rebel Moon. This is an absolute train wreck of a film, even below par for Netflix, which is quite the accomplishment.

title: B movie with a massive budget
text: I've been in the mood for a sci-fi adventure inside a massive universe for some time now so I was pretty excited for this movie since the first trailer came out. Unfortunately this movie did not deliver.Rather than Rebel Moon being inspired by past movies it instead feels embarrassingly derivative. So many things seem as if they were picked from different blockbusters and mashed up into one movie.The action scenes are a slo-mo mine field. The heavy use of slow motion feels uninspired and is more distracting than anything else.None of the actors performances are worth mentioning. The dialogue didn't give anyone much to work with.The music score is completely pedestrian and unmemorable. The CGI is good and that is really the only part of the movie I felt entertained by.Rebel Moon is a campy snooze fest with good cgi. I don't think a Zack Snyder directors cut is going to save this one.

title: A movie that Surprised me
text: I'm gonna give my completely honest and unbiased review of this film. Now before I start I normally dislike Zack Snyder films however this film was freaking great. I had some issues in terms of the pacing but it was an absolute blast and I really hope it does well on Netflix and the second film is good because it was super fun. The film is a gorgeous visual masterpiece and it has some amazing performances from lots of the cast and it's nice to finally see Ray Fisher in another film and he does an awesome job here. Kora gives an absolutely breathtaking performance and I thought she was great I do wish there were things in the the film that were different but I can't say it without giving spoilers. All I can say tho is if u are looking for a super fun and gory sci-fi universe with Black-jack and hookers this is right up ur alley!!

title: Visually stunning with a lot of action.
text: If you like sci-fi with a lot of action and excellent special effects, you're in for a treat. The plot keeps a good pace with a couple of twists thrown in. This won't be nominated for movie of the year(maybe some special effects awards) but if you're looking for a couple hours of some good, Snyder Sci-fi action, then get yourself some popcorn, sit back and enjoy.This is certainly better than the Star Wars prequels and the sequels after the first three, it would have been a better addition to the Star Wars universe than anything Disney did outside of Rogue One, which this reminds me of. Don't listen to the critics and give this a chance.

title: Not a Computer Game
text: After the first fight scene, I thought this must be a computer game adapted for the screen, but after researching I found it was not. I started losing interest during several backstory monologues, but I kept watching. I turned it off several times to do other things. After three days, I successfully completed the film. Sofia Boutella's look and fighting style kept me interested. They didn't do much to humanize her, which would have helped people connect with her more. She was all tough all the time. I could appreciate her skills and bad assness, but I had trouble connecting to her backstory, because her character wasn't written with much depth or vulnerably.I can appreciate the scope of the project, and it was worth watching to see the special effects, some of the aliens, and well choreographed fight scenes. One scene with a giant spider mother was a cross between a Witcher monster and the Borg queen from Star Trek. If you like sword battles, one of the characters who is added to the team about mid way is pretty awesome to watch. There was an awesome flying sequence with a large bird creature that reminded me of flying with a dragon. I hope they bring the bird back for Part 2. I would have liked to have seen the giant bird more in Part 1.There were too many unoriginal elements to give this a strong recommendation. People familiar with the genre will recognize an alien saloon scene and bad guys dressed in WWII German uniforms. That being said, I will most likely tune in to Part 2 in April. The chemistry between actors, fighting skill levels, and some interesting aliens are enough to make me think I will tune in to see more.

title: Somehow less than the sum of its parts
text: I suspect this fell victim to too many parts of it being edited out - unfortunately, the sum of the remaining parts don't clear the high bar set these days for engaging story telling.But this movie suffers from more than that. Convincing onscreen action and plot requires attaining a level credibility (albeit increasingly combined with a certain amount of viewer incredulity), this is what drives audience investment in story, and I'm afraid in this department Rebel Moon, although it tries hard, misses the mark. Perhaps Part 2 if it gets made won't have this problem.Rebel Moon suffers from too much clichéd character and context building. Yet despite this we don't really know enough about the main character, nor her band of combatants - this is a problem, the story requires us to be rooting for them.The script and story telling needed a much lighter touch with more consistent pace and oomph, and more depth - the bones are there, but the flesh fell off them - which is a real shame, as I can imagine a version of this movie that is exciting and engaging.It's still reasonable holiday fare, not a complete right off, but if you were hoping for a new peak experience sci-fi movie, or indeed for top-shelf Zack Snyder, this aint it.

title: Not a single original thought to be found.
text: Rebel Moon is a disappointing film that fails to deliver anything original or exciting to the sci-fi genre. The film is a blatant rip-off of several classic films, such as Seven Samurai, The Magnificent Seven, The Hidden Fortress, and of course, the original Star Wars trilogy. The film lacks any creativity or innovation, and relies on clichés, tropes, and fan service to appeal to the audience. It is poorly written with a predictable plot, shallow characters, and cheesy dialogue. The film tries to be dark and gritty, but ends up being dull and boring.The film's only redeeming qualities are its visual effects, including some stunning landscapes, spaceships, and battles, which are enhanced by Snyder's signature slow-motion and stylized cinematography. However, these aspects are not enough to save the film from its many flaws and, ultimately, Rebel Moon is a forgettable and uninspired film that does not live up to its own potential.Would have been 1 star for being such a staggering disappointment, but extra stars awarded to all the crew for their hard work and skill, especially in light of being given such awful material to work with.

title: Almost loved it
text:
I don know why, but I think the move has beed cut wrong. When some scenes end and another starts, I sit there and "Ehh! What just happened? Did I miss something?"
I really hope another version comes out really fast. I feel here is more to this story than what we have seen on Netflix.I really love what was not ruined ut cutting, and I guess more people would love it to if they without effort could live in the story and in the flow without beeing disrupted buy "Ehhh! What just......"Despite everything, I am looking forard to the second movien i April...Just not to drown in negativity. What an incredible start!!! The feeling it creates. That is by far the best start I have seen.

title: This is just incredibly sad
text: This is just incredibly sad. It's trying to be much like other more successful franchises, but only ends up in mediocrity. The costume design is poor, the acting is poor, the writing is poor, the directing is poor, the visual effects are poor. God knows what that weird blurring is trying to achieve, but it gave me a headache. Did they tell actors to exaggerate the accents of their mother tongues? It was jarring. The writers never seem to have heard of "show, not tell" either, making a large number of scenes just unbearably boring. What were they thinking? I guess this is what Netflix is nowadays.

title: Entertaining
text: Given the many reviews and mixed responses I have seen online, I was quite surprised at how much I enjoyed this film. The pacing was a bit erratic, but I found myself immediately engaged with the characters. I found the acting to be, well, acting, but the special effects were very good. Since Snyder originally pitched this as a Star Wars story the parallels for me were to be expected. Definitely worth the time to watch it. My advice is to suspend disbelief, go in with no expectations, understanding where this story got it's beginnings, and I think you won't be disappointed. I am looking forward to Part 2.

title: Worst movie in Snyders career.
text: Zach Snyder is a hack. He stopped making decent movies years ago, and this might just be the worst in his career. Its clear for all to see that he has been reading Jodorowsky & Moebius' The Incal, and tried to come up with something as epic as that, only to fail miserably. Nothing works here, absolutely nothing. Neither script, actors, costumes, music, effects, NOTHING. Its like watching a car crash in slow motion. How bad can it really get? Speaking of slow-motion, the use in here is so over-used its ridiculous. The style and rythm is completely broken with the use of it. Worst Ive seen in 23.

title: Where is the hate coming from?
text: Dont understand the hate. The movie is good, you have ships, an awful villain, and a nice group of rebels, and there are all the cliches we love, fighting, beating, betrayal, etc. It's, good, well done, amazing production, and fun.Just watch it and check for yourself, try to don't pay attention to people who just want to criticize.Rebel Moon is to Star Wars as The Orville is to Star Trek, they are all very good.Also, I feel that the characters are still being developed, they seem ready but they are not. Right now they are ghosts from their past, and they are starting a new journey now, so there is a lot of room for story and character growth.

title: Decent, episodic fun with great visuals
text: It's pretty good, but I can see where the bad reviews come from. This film is all set up for the second one where the action is featured. You should treat it like the first batch of episodes of some miniseries; very episodic and setting up for an epic second half. The pilot introduces the farmlands, then Kora and Gunnar have to assemble warriors one by one, then a mid-season finale for the climax. And as someone who's more a series person, I very much enjoyed it.It's got a nice setup with the traditional farmer community, and while the rest of the film as said feels episodic and doesn't feature much action, they manage to make it not boring and neither filled with worldbuilding distracting from the plot. I also found it interesting that Kora manipulates the last two warriors to join the fight; we see her motivate the general with revenge, right after hearing Nemesis preach against revenge as a driver, and then she talks to the Bloodaxe as if their trade with the village was detected by the Motherworld, rather than the truth.As a downside, there were some tropes I personally did not care for, though I can see others liking them/not being bothered by it. Think for instance the one 'good' young soldier who tries to stand up for Sam. Kora's backstory was revealed too early, too much at once and perhaps too elaborate and specific to begin with. For instance the shot with the child hands taking the gun out of the dead adult hands is really powerful, that's kind of enough for one flashback moment and the audience can fill the blanks or come back later to hear more. And lastly, the climax has these warriors going from helpless and outmanned to badass fighters in 1 scene. I didn't feel that fit the scene to be honest and would have preferred an escape in a followup scene. That doesn't change that this is an overall decent setup with a fair share of action preparing an actual action movie.

title: All Spectacle, Zero Substance
text: And unfortunately none of the spectacle is great. Besides the opening action scene where "Kora" saves a villager, None of the action is exciting beyond that. Zach Snyder over saturates all the action in slo motion, and the choreography is boring.The action isn't the only thing that let's the audience down. All the characters in Rebel Moon are one note and boring. Some of them have cool names, balisarius, general Titus, revenge samurai lady, prince blah blah blah, but we don't get to know any of them beyond artificial dialogue given to each character. Each "Rebel" has a few minutes of screen time, haphazardly edited together.I read a critic review saying Zach Snyder made this movie to make a cool looking trailer, couldnt have said it better myself. Zach Snyder must be immune to criticism because he never learns from his mistakes. Sucker Punch, Rebel Moon, Batman vs Superman, Justice League, Army of the Dead all have the same issues. Poor stories, boring characters and empty spectacle. This is Rebel Moon in a nutshell. Another massive disappointment from Snyder and another big budget bore produced by Netflix.Don't even get my started on the eye rolling ending. Learn from your mistakes Zach.

title: Questionable poor reviews
text: The story is a bit thin, characters and scenes are predictable but it's actually ok. I didn't read the review on this beforehand, only because it was a Zack film and a good cast assembled. If I read the reviews, I might have been put off. So I'm glad I watched it first. Of all the Sci-Fi films made, there's no way this one is in the bottom half. But that's what these rating suggest.Why should you watch it?1) Effects are up there, nothing worse than watching a film with substandard cinematography. 2) Most Sci fi films these days have terrible acting, this is definitely better than the Netflix norm. 3) There's no top rated Sci-Fi films out there at the moment, so this is as good as it gets. Then who cares about the story if there's a bit of adventure mixed in.I wouldn't watch it again, but I'm glad I've seen it and will look forward to part 2.

title: Its alright
text: Ive heard this was gonna be good. Seems like a big project from Netflix, while putting two parts of the story, seems like a pretty big investment from Netflixs side.A pretty good and intriguing storyline pretty well put together. A rebel against dictatorship.Soundtrack is really good and really fits the style of the film. The script is very well written. And acting is also very good.Love the atmosphere in the film.I actually get some Star Wars ambience mixed with Avatar vibe.But it has many areas where it fails.The main character does a pretty bad job in giving some authentic acting. And many illogical plot holes.I can really recommend it. Will definitely watch part 2.

title: Promised so much and failed to amount to anything.
text: I put this on anticipating a great movie. The visuals are fantastic, the trailer exciting and the cast intriguing... but that's it. The plot is so thin as to be non-existent. The characters are dull with no development and the bad guys are just comical.It could have been so much more. If it had been a long running series where we get to see the characters grow and learn about their background and motivations through action and dialogue rather than massive info dumps then there would have been a chance.I feel bad for the cast. None of them deserve to have their professional reputations linked to this dross.Honestly, the whole movie feels like an April Fool joke. Don't waste your time.

title: I expected different - This is so sluggish and very mixed!
text: I've anticipated this awhile I enjoy most Zack Snyder films, especially his Dawn of the Dead remake, Watchmen, Sucker Punch, and even Man of Steel is quite enjoyable, but this has a lot of slowness for an epic action movie. It feels lacking however it gets fairly better over time. The action is the best aspect by far, the sci-if/futurist vibe is great, and has some top-notch bits mashed in as well. The cast is excellent so I don't understand why Sofia Boutella is on the bottom credit members that should be fixed - she's a lead! I like how it's got a Star Wars spinoff vibe to it mixed with other several types which is intriguing, this is great at times. I imagine Part Two will be better.

title: Zack snyder should be banned from making movies
text: I don't normally write reviews. But this movie is so bad, such a waste of time, that I felt the need to warn you. This was the worst movie I've seen in a long time. Zack snyder should be banned from making movies indefinitely. Even the bad Star Wars movies are a thousand times better than this. I seriously wonder how such a movie gets approved and released. I advise you not to take seriously the opinions of people who have any positive opinions about this movie. It is impossible for someone who without getting anything in return to praise this movie. I believe that even someone who does not understand writing can write better quality content with AI. It's that bad. 🤷‍♂️

title: Do the haters even realize?
text: So the ppl whining about this being a Star Wars rip off, you do realize the Zach Snieder was hired to write and direct a Star Wars trilogy and was fired by that psycho Kennedy so she could further ruin the franchise. This was Snider's F you to Disney. Watch it for what it is and hope Falony can salvage what's left. The movie was pretty good when you take into account the history behind the motivation behind making this new story. I want this to succeed just to show the mistake Disney made. Kind of a protest watch if I'm being honest. One, two, three stars not quite. Five to six stars? Maybe. But add another 1-2 to stick it to Disney.

title: Too bad!
text:
I had hoped for something fresh! In love Sci Fi,
but this was just a journey through the same human tragedy! The village of peaceful people taken from "Brave Heart". It just felt too "Been there done That"!! I must admit I lost interest after the first fight! I will have to try watching this again! But judging by the other reviews I won't find much to change my mind!!Forgot to mention the Nazi uniforms! Big opportunity lost to create a fresh villain's!! Good writing wouldn't need the characters to look like what we have in our memories to get the points across as to who stands for what in their story!!Note: this is my first exposure to the Rebel Moon world maybe it's supposed to reference the same old stuff we kept seeing over and over!

title: How is the rating for this movie so low?
text: It's a very good movie. Go watch it. If you have something against "slo-mo" action then, fine, don't watch it. It's just "think outside the box" filming. The CGI doesn't suck as bad as some reviews claim it to be. It's not the best, but it's freaking enjoyable to watch. The story is good, plot is good, don't think too much about the film. It's not that complex, so relax and have fun. The characters are decent at their roles, no Oscar awards here but I had fun watching them. If you like Star Wars movies, this kind of rips off from it a bit. Loved the spaceships as it reminded me of the older Homeworld PC game. Great watch!

title: I'm not sure what people were expecting?!?
text: Clearly expectations ruined a lot of movie watchers experience.Because there isn't so much wrong with this movie that it isn't enjoyable and worthwhile. Even if not a world shattering blockbuster.Comparing to Seven Samurai, of which this is heavily based, the only significant problem and difference is that Rebel Moon run time isn't long enough to adequately show the recruitment of its protagonists. (Just imagine cutting Seven Samurai down by an hour...)The movie would have been better if it were long enough to fill out the character development in the middle act. But you can easily look past this and follow the story without difficulty.---I don't understand the comparisons with Star Wars.This has almost no connectable references with Star Wars whatsoever.This feels like it actually is in the Warhammer 40k universe.That Snyder actually had the audacity to pitch this for Star Wars is probably the biggest farse this movie brings. And thankfully, that never happened.Snyder has never been good at making movies, so I really do think that the actual qualities in this movie have nothing to do with his abilities, and are a fluke.The actual world as built in the movie is fun.This movie is reminiscent of much older writing styles in simplicity and linearity. It is a casual action flick that delivers on action, and is effective at bringing a new spin on the Seven Samurai framework. Even if a little rushed.This would be better rated had the character development been more fully realized, they're an interesting group of protagonists, and the acting is on point. The antagonists are excellent however, and the story between the main protagonist "Sofia Boutella" is very good. Boutella's performance holds a lot together that otherwise would have been lacking.A second part will hopefully bring us to a conclusion that ties and holds it all together more fully. If done right, a second half could make this an excellent duology. There is enough in the framing that this movie has brought to make that possible.

title: Script is by a 12 year old
text: Zach really hasn't written a movie worth watching since the original 300. And, this movie continues the downward spiral as you listen to the half baked dialogue and pedantic lines coming out of these actors mouths. It's laughable and uninspired. We all knew this would be largely a computer generated movie, but the CGI is atrocious and embarrassing. Layers of digital imagery that don't even remotely appear realistic. The action sequences are trash as well; still using bullet time and stop motion mechanics from 25 years ago. Each semblance of an action scene has a pause to hone in on the digitally created or altered sequence making it more ridiculous than it would have been had Zach never slowed the shot down. Characters are standing in the middle of rapid machine laser fire and not even taking a single hit. People are overly melodramatic for no reason. There is a guy wearing more bronzer than an entire tanning salon owns, and Zach chose to have the bad guys resemble Dutch Neo Nazis. Nothing about this is really inspiring at all, nothing is redeeming at all either. People just want to fight Mother World on the back of a couple of corny gimmick lines from the "main character"

title: Not worth it
text: Someone needs to tell Zack that not everything needs a slow motion scene. If you take away all of the slow motion scenes, this could have easily been a 1.5 hour movie. There are some scenes which will be familiar to Star Wars: lonely farmer girl who need a ship. In regards to character development, there was none. I felt zero attachment to any character. I believe Charlie Hunnam only had 10 lines throughout the whole movie. This is no lore than a paycheck for most of the characters. And why not clean Djimon's face when he was getting cleaned? I say skip this movie. It is a hot mess. I had high hopes for this movie. Won't be surprised if it does not get a second movie.

title: There's a diamond buried somewhere in this messy movie.
text: There's a diamond buried somewhere in this messy movie.Sofia Boutella carried all the emotion of the film on her back, like a titan.At first, I was loving it. The first 20 minutes are very good, but the movie gets lost in a mega-boring second act full of pseudo-world building.For a story that needs to introduce about 10 central characters, it spends almost no time developing them. Djimon Hounsou, who is an excellent actor, speaks 2 or 3 sentences in the whole movie and appears in a handful of scenes... the rest doesn't do much either.Is it well directed/shot? I'd say so. But it feels more like a music clip than a movie. I'm not talking about the slow motion, Snyder is a pro at that. But many scenes are so artificial that you feel the actors aren't fully immersed in the narrative. Charlie Hunnam, for example, is very cartoonish here (in a strange way).I don't understand why Zack Snyder keeps releasing bad/mediocre movies even though he has complete creative control and astronomical budgets.Heck, this guy made Watchman and 300, which are really great and recent cult movies. His Director's Cut of Justice League got me excited for this one, but unfortunately I'm going to have to wait for another Director's Cut to find out if this movie can be any good or if it's just another average movie like Hollywood likes to release these days.I'm afraid Zack Snyder is turning into Michael Bay...

title: Torture session
text: My God! There's another one just like that coming!What a waste of money and time.The executives of NETFLIX watched the movie before it was released? Have they tested the movie with a real audience?One of the worst sci-fi movies I have ever seen.(Yes, is that bad. Worst than my english.)The "plot" is a bunch of pieces from another movies, tempered with horrible dialogues using the special effects to disguise it.They are expecting to create a "universe" based on that movie?Good luck!NETFLIX have already canceled series that were way better than this movie, like "1899" and "Arquive 81". This movie is a 100 times worst than both series, and probably more expensive.Hire me, dudes. You will save a lot of money.

title: RPG Cutscenes
text: Rebel Moon is like watching a movie made up entirely of RPG cutscenes. It's essentially a science fiction "Magnificent 7" that spends 3/4 of its runtime putting a team together (which it hardly uses) and world building through exhibition dumps.The action in the middle of the movie is spent introducing characters and doesn't build tension. In fact, when the twist ending completely derails the narrative (it's telegraphed, but still a fun idea) there hasn't been much development at all.This review sounds pretty harsh. It is a bad start, rushed and incomplete, with goofy dialogue and structure, but it feels like there's genuinely something here. The sequel will be better... if they decide to make it. Netflix dropped $166 million on exhibition. Let's hope they don't waste it.

title: Can I earn a badge for watching it all?
text:
This was indeed a challenge, worthy of rewarding those who complete it.A simple review might just say "pretentious"
Others will point out how highly derivative, melodramatic and self-important the picture presents as.It was hard not to multi-task during viewing.I for one downloaded travel expenses for a claim, peeled potatoes for a Christmas roast, and researched the pulley configuration for my ride on lawn mower.A highlight was the role of the water girl and the droid played by Sir Anthony Hopkins. Sadly, short lived in the overall story.If you want to see the magnificent seven (or the seven samurai) played out in space with lots of creature costumes and laser battles, with an annoying overuse of slow motion in fight scenes that seem to remove drama and excitement from what would have been impressive choreography, and a star studded cast not wasted as much since Jupiter Ascending, then this might be the movie for you.Four stars. (Out of ten)

title: A motley crew in space
text: Well,, the movie dont sparkle, and it will not blow you of the chair , but it dont deserve to be dragged in dirt either, its an ok sci-fi movie but also its nothing more than okThe story is perhaps a bit simple and its too long, it feels like someone had alot of ideas and tried to knot it toghetter in one movie , and must say alot of stolen material , but the acting is great and production is awesomeThe movie start well I think and keep up to the middle but then it losing speed and start to fade out and thats why its to long alsoBut its ok , for Netflix standard this is a fantastic supermovie.

title: Pathetic, Lifeless and Unintentionally Hilarious
text: What makes classic Star Wars great is how it really transports you to a galaxy far, far away. Everything feels lived-in, characters occupy a life - they're not a character card in a 90's fighting game. What makes Dune great as a movie and a book is a sense of scale and scope, with vivid characters and bizarre McGuffins.Rebel Moon has none of that, instead opting for exposition dumps and cliches in the service of a setpiece here or a melodramatic dialogue there. It feels like back-to-back cutscenes in a videogame where the plot wasn't the point, but without the videogame that held them together, which might have been where the world building was. It is lifeless, empty, and devoid of any joy or wonder that is so crucial to get right.From a plot standpoint, the script never rings true - the main drive for the bad guys in this specific scenario is taking grain from farmers, yet repeatedly we are told and shown how they destroy whole planets without so much as stealing a sandwich. Our heroes fly around in a ship eveyrwhere, except for when it would be cooler for them to ride space horses through a field of wheat, so they're on horses now for some reason. The bad guys intend to execute the good guys in a very specific way but refuse to shoot them when all hell breaks loose and a gun fight ensues right over some of our captured heroes. A gunner on a massive space ship is also its pilot (??) and the cockpit of this gigantic space faring vessel is made of regular glass so thin you can smash through it with a stick (???). Some dude is holding a hero as a slave, and when the heroes show up to free him the dude just sets his own slave against some Train Your Dragon lookin CG cretin as a wager, for no good reason just so that a wonky CG fight scene can happen.It is SO underwritten, it makes Sucker Punch look well thought out. The characters are so flat you can't help but remember - this was made by the man who doesn't understand what motivates Superman or Batman, some of the most ubiquitously beloved & relatable characters of their genre. This thing screams "Snyder Script" because it is a failure to understand motivation, arcs and what keeps viewers interested.And visually? It's just slowmo after slowmo, blatant green-screens and bad CG, and an abundance of close-ups leaves very little visual world-building, except for when a scene is set up. I am uncertain what eye-candy people refer to, it is all completely flat and derivative, dour and smudged and often too dark to enjoy like every other terrible Snyder film.Nothing works. Not a single thing.There is an upside though - it is so needlessly edgy, so cringe, so pathetic in how self-important and smug and stupid and flat it is, that while we set out in the hopes of watching an enjoyable film we loved hate-watching it. So if you enjoy to dunk on terrible, ugly, stupid movies for a couple of hours - boy are you in for a treat, because this has a chance at becoming a trash hate-watch classic.

title: Sit back and enjoy it for what it is
text:
I just don't understand the reasoning behind people consistently trashing Snyder's movies. Although this movie is far from perfect the cinematography and action are a perfect combination to enjoy yourself at home with friends and family to watch a seemingly epic adventure film. It's a lot of fun and has Snyder elements that are overplayed but who cares. We need to get back to enjoying films for what there purpose is. This isn't a Star Wars film and frankly Rebel Moon is better than both of the last two Star Wars films anyways. The characters in Rebel Moon have their flaws, but movies like Valeria get better reviews and that's just not cool. The sci fi
elements are great and the action sequences are always so intense. Sit back and enjoy it for what it is.

title: IDF in space
text: This show blends some interesting aspects of modern life and warfare into a pseudo-sci-fi franchise. Great acting but it rings too true to contemporary events and as a result starts to feel like propaganda. Propaganda being put out at a time when need nothing remotely like that. This is not all that bad. It's way better than most of the stuff being put out into the world. A lot of explaining instead of showing and doing but some great effects also. Lots and lots of explaining and you feel like you need a masters degree in snyderology to understand what is going on. Seems like a thinly veiled comment on current events.

title: Snyder got his Star Wars Version and its...fade
text: So.... Snyder didn't get a chance to direct his own chapter of a Star Wars movie. Disney didn't want to give him the change so Snyder did what he does best - went to another side and directed his own version according to Lucas' vision.It has (almost) no light sabers, but the protagonist and antagonist are almost the same, you've got your fair share of struggles in a depressed world, post traumatized ruling of a king, which was fair and kind.
