If that is the case, while this could have easily fit into that universe, I am glad it was spun off into its own thing, rather than being tethered to another property that comes along with too many expectations of what it should be. Also, I am not interested in seeing "A New Hope" recycled for the third (fourth?) time by the powers that be at Disney.The visuals are incredible, something that goes without saying for any Zack Snyder film. Not many directors can build visuals like this guys does. The story is strong and doesn't lag anywhere. The movie easily sets up what could be a broad new movie universe and does a great job of exploring themes of oppression, rebellion, the horrors of war and the reality of wartime economics.The actors are top notch, I could easily watch stand alone films with Ray Fisher, Charlie Hunnam and Ed Skrein's characters in them. If I've seen Sofia Boutella in anything else, I am not aware of it, but she was fantastic as well. The way most of these characters are portrayed, makes me want to see more of them, particularly Ray Fisher and his character.The only thing that I felt was lacking was some of the character development. I understand that it is difficult to introduce a new world full of these interesting characters to an audience within the span of 2 hours, but still, there are some fantastic characters that are introduced here, that we just don't get enough time with. Some motivations could have been fleshed out a bit more.I'm looking forward to the sequel, I enjoyed this one a lot.

title: Visually stunning with no character development.
text: I had low expectations before viewing, and it did turn out better than I expected. However, once finished I did find a certain emptiness with the story and characters. The movie goes from action scene to action scene with very little in-between moments that show us the characters. What we do see is an interaction between two characters that is meant to only setup the next scene, but does nothing to show us who they are. Missing were those short meaningless moments that help build the story for each person. While visually stunning, at the end of the film I just did not see any attachment to any character, meaning whether they lived or died, whether they would return or not meant nothing as I hardly see them as existing in the story (although they did exist in an action scene).

title: studios need to stop giving zack synder money
text: I have no idea what i just watched.It was quite possibly the most wish-washy sci-fi plot of all time, and that's saying something considering how bad the recent star wars films have been.This film is an incoherent mess. It started off well in the first 15 minutes, but after that, it didnt go down hill, it went straight down to an abyss.The acting is horrible, the set pieces are predictable, the dialogue is passable.To stick to the age restrictions they not only dont add any blood despite several characters getting stabbed, they also dumb down the plot too.The only redeeming part is that the cgi is pretty. But thats it.Save yourself the time and avoid watching this mess.

title: Sofia Boutella Makes it Worthwile... Just
text: Zack Snyders epic Rebel Moon aims to establish a new sci-fi universe and right of the bat, it's not a real pass. Yet, if you want to know if you should put this on, my answer weirdly is yes. It's worth the watch for Sofia Boutella's performance, although ultimately the film itself is lacking. Now you know, let's dive in deeper.Rebel Moon is a mix of too many influences. Warhammer 40K springs to mind, as well as The Chronicles of Riddick for the fascist display of armies. There's some Greek mythology. Star Wars is heavily copied. And Alien is a reference for its grittiness in technology, which does work well. There is a bit of 'Avengers Assemble' to it, which is cool actually. And there are Zoë Saldana's action performances as an influence, of which Sofia Boutella shows us a new, slightly rougher version that is very, very likeable. She is hands down best part of the film.And that's saying something, because the writers made it incredibly hard for her and all the other actors. The script is on the nose and Sofia's character Kora is used as an instrument for heavy exposition, which is a waste of talent and quite baffling really for a production of this magnitude. Instead of us experiencing the story, it's basically explained to us.The weird thing is, the moment everybody shuts up and the action starts, the film is quite good. In some moments, it even nails the feel of the combat with fantastic shots, moves and sound design.What comes out is too much noise and too little signal. Like many of Snyder's films, the plot is predictable, the dialogue more like boring monologues. It would be nice if he would realize an audience can handle a little bit more intelligence. With 160 million bucks... we love your camera Zack, but please hire an extra writer man.All in all, we are left with a mix bag of extremes. The writing is bad. Yet the action is pretty good. And the cast - including big names Hopkins, Hunnam, Huonsou and plenty of upcoming talent like Huisman, Skrein and awesome Bae Doona - do really manage to shave off the worst thankfully.So, I can't say the film is a pass. But I did find it an interesting watch. Here's me hoping they all get better lines in part two.

title: Dull
text:
I liked snyder's work such as 300, Dawn of the Dead, and Watchemen.DCEU weren't my taste but I'll leave it as it is since I'm not big DC fan.In my honest opinion, he should focus on visual and directing like those movies and stay away from writing.This is clearly not polished.This isn't a film, it's a chunk of ideas, which wasn't tied with solid story pacing or character development.All of the exposition felt forced and uninteresting.Battles were hit and miss. I couldn't figure out a purpose of Nemesis's first fight in the first place since it went nowhere from both story
and character development.Finally the movin took its shape at 90 minutes past, when most of decent to masterpiece do that in 15 minutes because otherwise audience would go comlete boredom, which this movie went.There is nothing new. That is ok for me if the character, visual, pace, lines, or battle is interesting enough. This one lacks all of them.And from Part 2 trailer showed me exact rip off of the seven samurai. How original!I don't know which one is worse, Army of the Dead or Rebel Moon.AotD is messed up nonsense where every character did what they shouldn't in zombie movie but at least sequences were cohesive.On the other hand, for this one, decisions made by characters were understandable.But I don't see why they made those choices other than the sake of keep movie going forward.CGI is alright. Acting was meh.If you are snyderfan and want consume everything he made, that's fine.But I can assure you everything you will
get is avalable in more entertaining way if you just watch The seven Samurai, Star Wars EP4, Rogue one and The hidden fortress.

title: Please, someone get this man a writer
text: Just get him a good script to direct. His movies look good, very good actually, even though he tends to use slow motion one too many times. I was genuinely interested in what a Zack Snyder Star Wars film would look like. Turns out the answer is "just boring".It's the definition of style over substance, and as much as I enjoy his style, it's nowhere near enough to keep me interested for 2 and a half hours, let alone 4 (?) movies, I think. I don't care.After the first hour, which I think was pretty decent, I started zoning out big time. Two characters in act 2 had an overly long introduction, from which the main takeaway, if not the only one, was that they were cool. That was the extent of their character development. I am sure they must had some lines in the film, but I remember none of them. Didn't even get their names to be honest, the only thing I know is that one of them is played by Doona Bae and the other can tame creatures. When you are not invested in any of the characters, you are also not invested in anything that is going on.This is for me the worst kind of movie, the boring one. Competently made, takes itself very seriously, not bad enough to laugh at it, just tedious.

title: Not original, and no credit given to those they stole from.
text: Up front, I have to admit to not watching this yet, but the plot is so obviously a Seven Samurai clone that the producers should be sued for not including Akira Kurosawa, Shinobu Hashimoto, and Hideo Oguni in the writing credits.Hmmm...seems that wasn't long enough to post as is, so I'm just gonna riff here a bit...there have been a number of good films that have followed The Seven Samurai plot, and most have been honest enough to include writing credits for those that wrote The Seven Samurai that the producers of Rebel Moon should be ashamed (and punished in some manner) for ripping them off.

title: How Did This Get Made?
text: No one will ever convince me that this was not written by AI. Every single moment was oversentimental, generic, and filled with exposition.Inconsistencies and stupid shid are overflowing and it is impossible to immerse yourself in the world because you are constantly taken out of it with things that just don't make sense.The problem here is that it is executives of multinational corporations making the decisions that artists and writers should be making. I hope it flops. Hollywood needs a wake-up call.This is what happens when you don't pay writers. You deserve what you get. Ruined a $166M film with a ten cent script.

title: Maybe a 7 for action 5 or 6 for story
text: I think the action scenes and CGI were pretty decent.The villain was decent as well. Writing and script was more like a 5. Some of the "recruiting" of other characters was a bit cheesy and definitely felt rushed. Which is disappointing considering there will be multiple parts to this.Overall I was disappointed I watched the movie. I think both my wife and I enjoyed it. But I haven't seen many of the last star wars movies. I think the last star wars movie I watched was the first one with Kylo Ren.Anyone I'm just typing to fill this review now. 7 for action, 5ish for plot and script. Decent average meh.

title: Worst Zack Snyder movie I've ever seen
text: Let me start by saying that in general, I am a fan of Snyder. Do I subscribe to the idea that he's one of the best directors ever, absolutely not, but I think he's certainly done some solid work and in general creates some stunning visuals and thrilling action, and good or bad, I am always curious when a new Snyder film releases. So understand me when I say this may be the worst film he has ever made, I am saying this not as a hater, but one who always watches his work with fingers crossed.For starters, the main criticism I see for the film is that it's heavily derivative of other films. Now, that isn't the biggest problem with the film, but those complaints are also not overexagerated. In short, the film is a mix of Seven samurai and star wars/firefly. The evil Empire (cleverly renamed "The Imperium") looms over the galaxy, bending all who live in it to its fascist will. A small band of rebels, lead by a former stormtrooper, spark the flame of rebellion to fight against their oppressors. Sound familiar, yeah, thought so. Also there's lightsabers.But make no mistake, beyond the blatant lack of originality in display, there is plenty more to criticize here.My main issue, the characters and pacing. Our lead, Kora, is fine. Sofia Boutella does her best with the material given and is suitably badass, as she has proven in the past repeatedly. Her character is nothing we haven't seen before, but certainly the one who we get the most development with. Every other character, forget about it. At a certain point (after the end of the first act), the film enters a formula. Go to new location, meet new character, action scene, said character joins team.This is where the pacing becomes a major issue as well. The character introductions are incredibly abrupt. With some, we don't even get an introduction, just a character suddenly appears and now they're part of the crew. No side characters ever get a chance to show any personality beyond whatever generic trait they are introduced with, and every scene just feels completely disjointed from what came before.Now, on to what Snyder is best known for, his visuals. To his credit, there is some beautiful and epic imagery. The first shot of the main character's home in particular is a beautiful sci fi image that can only exist in a film like this. Unfortunately, for every cool visual, there's also quite a few that are very drab and boring. Bland and brown desert planets, desaturated brown worlds, lots of brown. Occasionally some variation but largely just plain stuff. And the action is not all that exciting. The first fight of the film is arguably the best, being the most hard hitting and well made, the rest are just either rapid cut or filled with sudden slo mo (I know it's a Snyder film, but my god is there SO MUCH SLO MO). Nothing that really felt especially impactful imo.In short, the film is a rushed mess with no attention to characters or story, and blatantly rips off dozens of better films. The visuals are fine, but nothing ever amazes me. Perhaps the directors cut (which should've just been released from the start, what's with this weird planned directors cut on steaming) will fix stuff, until I see the proof I am not holding my breath. Snyder says he wants this to be a massive franchise spanning movies, games, comics, etc. As it stands right now, I think they're lucky they're getting a part 2.

title: What a beautiful, beautiful cast!
text: Really, whoever casted this beautiful bunch, thank you from the bottom of my heart. Scenery is equally as stunning an the details like the weapons an the android... just absolutely beautiful! Acting is great and believably immersive. Characters a nicely fleshed out and not too cliche. I want to jump in and just go on an adventure alongside these guys. The only part I didn't like are flaws in the battle scenes. The way our hero moves make the strikes and shots she's landing a little too unbelievable. She comes of as a little clumsy, not something you'd expect from a battle hardened commander. But this only flaw is absolutely excusable. Loved it!

title: A Mixed Bag Movie That Still Packs Some Enjoyment
text: As a fan of Heavy Metal comics, I was intrigued by Rebel Moon, but it didn't blow me away. Overall, I liked it, but at the same time, I was left wanting more.Allow me to explain.What I Liked: Visually, it's a treat, creating a world that's immersive and visually stunning. The action, especially with Sofia Boutella, is a thrill. If you're into Zack Snyder's style, you'll probably find something to enjoy here. It's got that Snyder touch, for better or for worse.What I Didn't Like: The film feels rushed, like a longer story chopped to fit the runtime. Some scenes and characters could've used more depth, which made the action less impactful. It hovers on the surface without diving into campiness or complexity.Maybe there's a better version out there held back for marketing reasons. Netflix might have missed the mark with this one.Critics giving it one star might be too harsh, but a perfect score is pushing it. For me, it's a 6 out of 10. It was enjoyable, but I wished for a bit more polish and depth.Overall, it's a sham, it had the elements for a great flick but ended up as a decent afternoon watch.I will definitely watch Part 2.

title: Gives sci-fi a bad name
text: Doing the Magnificent Seven in space with Warhammer-like aesthetics should be an easy feat to pull off and be right up my ally but somehow this movie fails on every level. Pacing is bad, dialogues are bad, acting is bad, VFX looks subpar, world building barely happens, characters are dull and boring, only the action scenes are somewhat ok. If the movie just wouldn't go in slooooooow moooootion all the time for absolutely nooooo reasoooooon...It's baffling why Netflix wasted an impressive 160 million dollar budget on this when it must have been obivious to them that the script isn't good. It's even more baffling why the pulled off a massive marketing campaign, advertising it to the general public in subway stations, when even a blind fool can see that the end result is just as bad. This is nothing you want to draw attention to, if you want to attract new subscribers. To be fair, I still see this a notch above Disney Star Wars, as Zack Snyder thankfully doesn't ruin the creative work of others but that is not a bar by which you want to be measured.

title: Really Enjoyed - I must be a weirdo
text: Well, I really enjoyed this. Most of the reviews I have seen hated it. I thought it was engrossing, a world you can really get into and shot beautifully. Yes, it's all gobbledegook, there are plot holes and, like the A Team, the heroes never get hit by multiple people with guns firing from 5 yards away. But this is fantasy right? Take your brain out and enjoy.I enjoyed all of the performances. Charlie Hunnam always contributes a welcome dodgy accent and it was admittedly weird that space seems to be full of Northern Irish people and Scandinavians. The bad guy was awesome.Oh, and just to annoy everyone I enjoyed this much more than Dune.

title: Like an assault on your senses perpetrated by a toddler
text: At first I had hope that this would be a film where their was balance with story and special effects both given their dues oh boy was I wrong.If you are a two year old that likes using all the colors at once and thinks that to make something dramatic throw in slow motion and lots of lasers then this is your film , Snyder clearly has lost any sense of direction and taste if this is what he produces. I'd rather bestrapped to a bed of razorblades and be forced to watch showgirls whilst having my balls repeatedly slapped by a large walrus . Every aspect of this film of overdone over acted over CGI'd and over directed. Snyder stop now you've clearly lost it.

title: How Zack is continually allowed to make garbage like this is beyond me
text: I don't get it. I don't think he's made 1 truly great film. Dawn of the Dead was probably the only film in his filmography that was really enjoyable and a fresh take on the genre.His commercial success speaks volumes as its mostly music videos and thats what his movies feel like. There is no tangible plot or substance. Its all visual.This film suffers in so many areas from plot to script to performance. Its as bad as Army of the Dead and I thought that was one of the worst films I had seen in a decade.Please stop giving him money and take that 200 million and give 40 million budgets to some more competent voices.

title: Take it for what it is
text: Ok so I get the disappointment from people and kind of understand some of the ratings. But I think this movie should be reexamined for what it is. Which is first off, classic Zach Snyder, you cannot deny the graphics, the action scenes, the overall beauty of the creativeness in each scene. Now, with that being said let's examine what everyone is truly struggling with. It feels like a rip off, so much that appears and feels like stolen storylines from some of our most popular and beloved Sci-fi stories. Yes this is very true, but look at it like this it's an homage to all of us Sci-fi nerds. Zach took some of the best, scrambled them up, added to them, and created new worlds, new characters, new reasons to love the best stories in Sci-fi.I recommend you watch this movie, or rewatch it; with new vision. Accept it for what it is and you just might discover you like it more than you thought. Trust me there are things in the movie that will surprise you. Things you really didn't see coming.For those saying it's a rip off of Star Wars, it's a rip off of so much more than Star Wars. I see Dune, Pitch Black Series, Indiana Jones, Gaurdians of the Galaxy, Clash of the Titans, and several others.Appreciate the movie for what it is. I for one am looking forward to the release of part 2.

title: Gave up
text: I gave up on this after about half an hour. It's slow, acting is strained and everything is over-delivered, as if the actors are trying to add gravitas to every line, make everything seem important.It takes about twice as long to get anywhere than is needed, every moment feeling stretched out to near breaking point.The cinematography is strange, often with parts out of focus in a distracting way. The vocals feel seperated from the characters, like a poorly dubbed vocal track.All in all I had to give up, with no sense that.it was going to suddenly get any better. Hugely disappointing as I was looking forward to this.

title: How to take it
text: I didn't think negatively with the nods and parallels between this and other material, it's just, now it's got sparta. I liked the scoundral, that was cool. And the suitcase prisons were pretty nice. It's got some hero shots, and you'll start asking yourself how this would have looked with troopers. Everyone likes a good cantina. Yes, it's ok to roll your eyes. More required characters. I thought discount cillian murphy was pretty tyranical. Why do these need to be so long. How to take it. No, this review does not contain spolers. Submit. Almost there. Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire (2023).

title: Astoundingly bad. Please read a book instead.
text: The zero dimensional script is as shallow as the VFX projected onto the green screen. VFX which, by the way, is as soulless as the characters and their artificially eye-watered emotions.To top it all, the action sequences are dismal and nonsensical. Yes, we know the bad guys are always bad shots, but our stormtroopers have anti-target missiles that are so efficient in avoiding their prey that point blank range is too far away.This film is a supremely pitiful effort. Even the editing and framing is clunky, but I guess that is congruent with the clammer of clichéd and predictable dialogue.One has to wonder how this gets made. How many millions of dollars wasted. More so, how many millions of hours of human endeavour wasted, either in being ploughed into making this nonsense, or, for its viewers, never being realised in any meaningful way - myself included.

title: It's Star Wars meets Dune!
text: I finally got the chance to watch Rebel Moon, and I gotta say, it was incredibly cinematic and pretty action packed when it comes to Zack Snyder who made Dawn of the Dead, 300, Man of Steel, BvS: Dawn of Justice, and Zack Snyder's Justice League and Army of the Dead. I pretty much enjoyed this movie because of Zack Snyder who knows how to make movies so cinematic in the most possible way for his filmmaking industries.Sofia Boutella was great and so brilliant, as she played the most badass character known as Kora. I also loved her in The Mummy (2017), Star Trek Beyond, and Kingsman. The Cast and Crew, did a really good job with their roles, and the acting was pretty good, and the story was not that bad when it comes to true storytelling from your very own making.For me it was totally cinematic, and I say this is worth a movie to watch 100% and it's also Zack Snyder's movie of the year in 2023!

title: Enjoyable and entertaining
text: There is nothing new to the storyline, we can find many similar plots on other movies, but still I can't understand why bad rating for this enjoyable movie.It is true that there are some flaws in the movie, but to be said as entertaining is good enough, and I want the Part 2 soon.I can say that the chemistry among the characters is not built enough, but Sofia Boutella is so so sexy and we can see that the wardrobe is to enhance this although absurd in several scenes.I just love to watch a movie where the protagonist are building up a team with specialties and again I get that part on this movie.Anyway, this movie is entertaining enough.

title: Blend of hit movies and this is what you get.
text: If you think you can combine several top movies together and make it a hit, you're wrong. It's like Pirates of the Caribbean meets Lord of the Rings versus Aquaman versus Vikings, with a touch of Pirates of the Caribbean meets Dune meets Star Wars. French, Indonesian, Japanese, Italian, and Korean, they all serve great food, but combine them together in a big blender and think you'll serve great food, you're wrong. This is what this movie makes me feel like. Not bad acting, but what a bad script. Oh and don't forget the names. Dreadnut? The bad guys al look like the Germans in WW2 including the scenery. Jesus what shameful performance. In spite of the good acting, this proves that script is everything. But you should watch it because we haven't laughed so hard in a long time.

title: Decently fun with great visuals, but cliche and subpar acting
text: This is something we have seen many times. A stranger comes to a village, the village is attacked by some dictator/bandit with hordes of disposable henchmen. The stranger gather a bunch of misfits and great fighters, get the village to fight with them and yea, well, there you have it.Despite the cliche premiss this has a lot of greatness too. The visuals and general cinematography are great. Sound design is excellent, and the world building is pretty good. Several of the characters are also fun and interesting. This feels like a real world/s in a distance galaxy far, far away.Were this fail is mainly with dialogue and acting. The core cast is good enough, but many others are not and a lot of the side- characters are even awful. I also fail to see how much of the dialogue could have made it past any pre screening. I also dislike the overuse of slow-motion. Every fight scene, every shooting, and even people walking need to have slow-motion. My final complaint is that this feels rushed and together with the other negatives, especially the acting, it make this feel like a 1990s TV episode rather then the epic space opera it aspires to be.This is not bad, it is watchable. But so cliche you will know what happens before it does, and that make this kinda boring.I give a generous 6/10. That is probably too high of a score, but I kinda like this and it is good to have some new scifi to watch. Sadly this was not as great as it could have been, but not too bad either.

title: It's not bad - just not that good.
text: So far, Rebel Moon is fine, but feels cobbled together from many ideas that we've seen elsewhere many times before. Homage is one thing, and is often great, but this is something altogether more dull and predictable. Even a direct rip-off can be done in a way that at least feels fresh and stylish, but that doesn't happen here either.There's no fun, no richness of character, no light or shade in the dialogue - the script hangs at the same tonal grey all the way through the movie.Visually the movie is quite nice; that's something we come to expect from Snyder, but even here, there is nothing really new or unexpected.If you're going to admit to not being given the permission to do a Star Wars movie, then going ahead and doing it anyway, you really need to deliver something that proves that Disney/Lucas Films should have trusted you with the project. If anything it would have benefitted from being part of a larger universe that we already knew. As a world that had to stand on it's own, each location felt like an echo of a generic type rather than a specific place that acted as a character in the narrative.Story wise, 'A Child of Fire' has its origins in Seven Samurai, but in terms of space remakes of that story, while Battle Beyond the Stars may act as a less sophisticated visual remake, it tells a more compelling story. Along with the Star Wars rip-offs there is also a character taken blatantly from a Doctor Who episode spliced together with one from Star Trek. It's a you'll know it when you see it situation.Rebel Moon does have a few interesting religious references in some name meanings and one small sub narrative borrowed one of the apocryphal Gospels, but doesn't really seem to do anything interesting with those references.Ultimately, Snyder had the potential of a whole new universe to explore but ended up rehashing all the old ones. Let's hope that Part II does something a little more interesting.

title: Bit rushed. Not great. Not terrible.
text: Whilst not a bad film, Rebel Moon struggles to do anything new. Visually, it is good. The acting is OK. Not the worst, not the best. It does however feel like 3 films squished into one. This leaves it feeling a little like Zack Snyder is throwing everything at the wall and hoping some of it sticks. We have a full party of characters thrown into the mix with very little back story or origin at all, other than "this guy is a good soldier", "this guy is ripped and rides gryphins well" and "oh look this lady fights with definately-not-lightsabers". It made it really difficult to care about any of them more than "oh I guess that's kinda cool".I would say one stand out performance is Ed Skrein as the main villian. He's got the smarmy bad guy role down to a t. The other actors do a passable job with Charlie Hunnam being quite decent also. Unfortunately Sofia Boutella was a little one note, but wasn't terrible.All in all. It's a bit of a rushed and cheesy mess, which is surprising as it's only part 1. Really it should have been stretched out to part 1, 2 and 3 in itself. That said it is somewhat enjoyable and worth a watch, especially for the visual effects. I'd say if you enjoy the Michael Bay type, transformers action movie, then you'll like this. Lots of big explosions and excessive use of bullet-time and characters action sliding under stuff. If you are looking for a strong plot, and interesting characters then you should probably look elsewhere.

title: people are harsh
text: This is my first review and It's more of a review on the negative reception on Rebel Moon rather than on itself.First of all, any space opera type cinema is going to be reminiscent of Star Wars because it was basically the first of its kind. It's hard to be TOTALLY original when others have come before it. Personally, I didn't see "Star Wars," if anything, I saw Warhammer 40k in there. I thought it was interesting and decent. Anything with operatic landscapes, potentially many epic story lines, and Snyders style is going to be pretty good. Many of you have been way too harsh on this piece and I'm willing to bet that when that part 2 comes out, you'll all be watching it the same as me.

title: Overhyped!
text: This movie, so far, is hugely overhyped. Star Wars story???? Glad it never panned out. But I'm not giving up on it yet!A bit too easy to get a team together: "Hey do you want to fight against the evil empire and put your life on the line. Odds are you will die? Yes sure, why not. Have nothing better to do.". Childish to say the least.But there is still the director's cut plus the second part which can turn this around. I do hope there is more material that can connect the dots on the story and the characters. Provide a bit more depth. It really feels like someone has gone berserk in the cutting room on this one.All in all it reminds me of "Battle Beyond the Stars" without Sybil Danning's hoo****!

title: I rather enjoyed it.
text: Ignore the whiny, science fiction nerd, drama queen outrage. I think they just come on here and rant to sound superior because no one pays them attention IRL. I actually get a kick out of reading their "woe is the fate of cinema" and "I'm canceling Netflix I'm so upset" comments. Funny stuff.It's a good couple of hours of fantasy and science fiction to watch with some beautiful moments and gorgeous visuals. There are also some dark and uncomfortable ones too. I'm very much looking forward to part two.I knew zero about this story and am not trying to compare it to original source material or other movies in the genre.

title: cliche upon cliche?
text: Space facist's versus Idealist's? That's never been done before?...... So let's start with all the plagiarism? Which is understandable, due to originality being a very rare commodity. Buckbeak from Harry Potter.....he even bowed? Light sabre's from? ....well u all know where? Robot from...take yer pick? Why OH Why was it deemed necessary to waste money on Mr Hopkins? And why have horse's with Halloween masks masquerading as alien creatures? Did you run out of money, or just ideas?Who could possibly have known that the all powerful Regent of the known universe came from the Falls Road in Belfast?And who's idea was it to have Hunnam' follow the same trajectory, with the some of the worst accent work to ever appear in Sci Fi, No forget that, in Movie history ? WTF...... was it Charlie attempting to show off his chop's, or Zach's idea of an insider joke?It looked great, and so it should for $130 mill, but why didn't they spend some of that on a decent script?I will say that it was rarely boring, if just a little predictable, and did roll along at a decent pace.Good cast, Good effects, vacuous script?

title: I enjoyed it.
text: The story didn't have the pizzazz of most movies, but it did have an easy to follow and compelling plot. As we watched it I kept saying, "Looks like they borrowed that from ____." My son would respond, "I was thinking the same thing." I'm not one to criticize a move for having similarities to other movies, because if an idea is good, it's worth copying, and trying to do better.I saw elements of Infinity War, Dune, The Seven Samaria, and I cold probably list a dozen others. At most it seemed like a very loose retelling of The Seven Samurai, but a well done one.This part left more than enough loose threads to be resolved in the second part. I was thinking it felt like it was based on a novel, but the writing credits (which Zack Snyder got top billing) were all for the screenplay.Well worth the watch.

title: Derivative - yes. Enjoyable - very much so.
text: Sure Rebel Moon is derivative of so many other sci-fi movies like Stars Wars, Galaxy Quest and on and on.Yet, with that a given, I really found it to be very enjoyable.The plot is set up right from the beginning on a small, rural farming community on an outer edge planet in a universe where the Motherworld is all powerful. But, having lost its king, it is now under the sway of more nefarious forces. Well, one of the Moterworld ships show up at the farming community in search of rebels and to appropriate the communities crops. One person, an outsider with a mysterious past, Kora (Sofia Boutella), fights back - tremendously. So, that leads to her and the crop master, Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) to leave on a quest to gather an army to protect their village against the Motherworld's forces. At this point, you can pretty much mail the rest of the script in as the two of them gather together a motley crew of killers, all with a grudge against the forces of the Motherworld, and proceed on their rebellious mission.Like many reviews will have stated, this is not a very original film. Most every scene is a copycat from some other sci-fi film. However, I really enjoyed it and found it engaging for the over two hours running time. And, while I have a pretty good idea what is coming in part two, it is definitely a follow-up film that I'll watch.

title: Lazy and boring writing. Waste of potential
text: Production quality is outstanding, many good actors and visually stunning in places. But the writing and directing is terrible! Plagiarising other stories and ideas (Star wars) is not a problem if it is entertaining and engaging.This is slow, boring and does not make sense. I'm assuming Zack Snyder thinks that if you know the Star Wars saga he can be lazy and not explain his own story.What is it with the soft porn style soft focus? Why, when it gets exciting does the slow motion kick in?The most strange thing about this movie is that it can show the horrific attempted gang rape of a girl, but the fight scenes have no blood or real violence.This director/writer should never be given such a large amount of money to create a film again untill he can prove he can write something decent.

title: What the hell did I just miss?
text: As a sci-fi fan I was happy to finally see Rebel Moon available on Netflix. It started off good but after approximately 30 minutes you start to notice the cracks. Midway the movie is just an overall mess.This movie is so fast paced, you have zero opportunity to really connect and invest in the characters. On top of that comes over editing which makes you wonder 'What the hell did I just miss?' 80% of the movie.Sofia's character is cool, but there are a few others, like Jimmy the robot, who definitely deserved more screentime. Hopefully part two will fix that.Can someone give Tarak some upper body armor or maybe just a simple shirt in part 2? It makes no sense for an experienced fighter to run around in just pants!Come on already!

title: Rebel Sloooooow Moooooon-tion
text: I really do start to believe that AI writes the scripts of these kind of movies (I'm looking at The Creator). Nothing is original in it, but it would be OK if other elements were good. I'm even willing to buy that a 100 pounds woman destroys 6-7 200 pounds soldiers but at least create a believable choreography, make her extremely fast or agile or something. Making these scenes in slooooooow moooooootiooooooon amplifies this problem. Slow motion is inconsistent, it's there even if it wasn't necessary at all like when walking out of a ship or turning a table over for a makeshift cover.Of course the lead is female, the rebel team has to be as diverse as possible, in where male members have to be saved or have to amend their way of life. Of course the bad guys are all white guys sinister looking hulks with bald head and beard or rude brutes with military haircut and square-chin... except the good one who is somewhat colored and scrawny. Even their uniform resembles those German uniforms of the 2nd WW. They have been doing these kind of things in every movie, in every series for years and it's extremely boring by now.The movie is visually OK. You can see the possible Star Wars movie in it (Snyder originally inteded this movie as one). But it would have been bad as a Star Wars movie as well. Not that nowadays the Star Wars brand is a guarantee for quality, quite the contrary.

title: Good film
text: Zack Snyder is an anomaly for me. I loved 300. I did not think much of his Superman, Batman or Justice League films. Then he had his zombie flick on Netflix which again I thought was good. This film, Rebel Moon, falls into the good category of a Zack Snyder film.It was good. Not brilliant. But good. Some of the set action scenes were really well put together. I liked that the story was not rushed. But sometimes it was a little to slow. But on the whole, I enjoyed what I saw and I am looking forward to the second part.I'm not a professional critic, just a layperson and watch films for their entertainment value. I was entertained.Are you not entertained? Oops, sorry. Wrong film.

title: Cliché after Cliché, fell asleep on both movies
text: It's just bad.It's boring, we could predict what would be said because, well: it's just basic punchlines and the eternal, long, boring, numbing monologues that try so hard to mimic great movies but exactly because of that it's clearly forced and not true/real/new/fresh... its just a copy paste of everything that has been done before.Feels like a teenagers week assignment made in a hurry, Thursday night to be presented the next day.Yes, very beautiful sceneries AND??? After the first 10 minutes you start to wonder "ok but what about the movie?"And to read that they plan to continue and make 4 more of these??? Count me out, the second one just halfway seen (truly fell asleep multiple times!) I will not force myself to see another of this horrible mess.You CREATE an epic!You DON'T pretend one!What a waste of money.

title: Part One
text: What I think is important to take into account with this movie, is that it's Part One out out at least two, so many things that could feel hollow or rushed or insubstantial, might (and judging from the trailer, probably will) be covered in the future film(s): the lack of backstory for any character save the main, the missing motivation in most of their actions, the hollowness of the world's lore. It's really hard to tell whether all of that should've come first or not without contemplating the complete story, and it's not complete yet. Just from the runtime of 2 hours and the artistic style that involves a lot of slowed down scenes, it's not possible to put a lot of story into one movie.That said, the Part One looks gorgeous - every location, every character, the weaponry and the costumes, it's all neat and detailed. Not without downsides though - it does look uninventive and derivative in many aspects, down to a light-ish blades and a robot voiced by a famous British actor. Perhaps that's the largest issue with the movie (again, so far), that it feels like a combination of existing space universes, and not much unique ideas like weapons or animals (yet). There are few, but not many.Actors are mostly doing a great job, especially the lead ones - in my opinion they all depict the situations they're in quite well. Save for maybe the merchant/smuggler character, but that might be my personal dislike in Charlie Hunnam's acting in general.So to summarise, it's a beautifully made chapter in the story, and whether the whole story is great or dull - remains to be seen.

title: Waiting for the extended director's cut, as usual with zack
text: Why the 7, one might ask?Excellent sound, excellent visuals, I really like the style and creativity, characters are okay. Has a gameplay feel to it, in a good sense.But the single most disappointing thing is the storyline lacks depth. The movie is simply to short to build this much characters and essemble them. This result is very shallow dialogues to introduce any depth. Missed chance, seeing there are multiple parts.Some characters are being launched by other characters but first character haa no background so it is nearly impossible to emphasise with any motivation.It is easy to compare with star wars especially based on the trailer, but that does not do any justice.If there would be an 4 hour extended zack snyder cut, this could and probably would be a 9. The movie has the ingredients. Maybe trim down on the slowmo moves zack, we know you like them and they are your trademark, but enough is enough.

title: There are many better thing to watch
text: Not quite went wrong here. This could have been one of the best sci-fi ever create. However despite its chunky budget, lots of good concepts, it fails to deliver.The first 30-40 minutes seem generally pretty good, from there is goes downhill quickly and doesn't stop until you get to the end. The initial setup creates some sexual tension between 2 of the lead characters, then it is pretty much ignored for the remainder of the film. The other characters added as the film progresses join with little or no resistance. There is little backstory on who they are, nor do you get any attachments to them to care enough if they live or die. Despite being over 2 hours it really needed another hour to flesh out the characters and give you a better scale of the universe. Talking of universe, some space travel would have been good but for some reason travelling to another planet was achieved by simply showing some text on where they magically transported to.Then there is the camera work and cgi. Everything seems to have a deliberate blur which does little other than to irritate or distract you. All it did for me is to create a lack of depth perception almost bordering on claustrophobia. For a film which is always going to be effects driven I am unsure who signed off to say they were good enough. Generally poor in most areas, and worse than films from 20 years ago in others.Overall this could and should have been so much better.

title: A decent intro
text:
The whole film I can see was just one big intro to something that the director want to be a big franchise.. I can see his vision is all over the place
. The film also has inspirations from films like the fifth element. Star wars. The matrix and some other Sci fi nods.. it was watchable but now I'm holding the next part to higher standards..
The acting is good the characters are okay Charlie H character was a meh for me.I can say we could go without all the slow mo cinema·ography. I would say I want more gore there should have been more bloodied parts in the action that would have made it feel more real for me.

title: Good not great
text: I believe this movie would have been better as a 10-episode TV series. In a TV series, they could have explored the nuances of the story in more detail, allowing for a more thorough and comprehensive exploration of the plot. By turning this into a season one, and then subsequently releasing a season two, the story could have been fleshed out much better. Currently, it feels rushed, with the plot jumping from one place to another. The main antagonist is unimpressive, and the overall quality is mediocre. It's not a fantastic watch, but if you find yourself with nothing else to view on a lazy Sunday afternoon, it's worth a watch. It's not amazing, but it's also not as terrible as some critics are making it out to be. It's simply a good, but not great, movie.

title: I wanted to love this
text: I'm a big fan of Zack's work. He has a distinctive, recognizable style that I appreciate. Man Of Steel is, in my opinion, the best superhero movie since The Dark Knight. His version of Justice League was amazing. 300 is a fun movie. BvS extended was pretty good. Watchmen I thought was a miss, not horrible just lacking. I hated Army of the Dead.Rebel Moon I would compare to Sucker Punch. I wanted to love both movies. Cool visuals and concept but something just doesn't work. I can't say exactly what. Rebel moon feels like it's all set up for future stories. It never felt like a complete story but just a springboard for sequels. It's not a contained story arch. It just doesn't work on its own as a stand alone movie.

title: Was hoping for just a little more to make it an 8....
text: The hype around this movie was huge, Zack Synder having been a huge Star Wars fan wanted a spin on the space fighting frontier to be more a like a Western style movie across the stars away from everything else...Now the plot was simple... Farmers having to defend their planet from a mighty threat like Stars Wars Empire's 'Darth Vader' but without the warriors to defend their homeland...Movie becomes a quest movie taking in a few vistas and interesting characters to add with some decent set pieces and interesting creatures to add... But the action was lacking for an all out Sci Fi adventure it fell a little flat in the the second half but finishing on a decent midway point, hoping for a more action packed, part II.

title: Great start unfortunately missing key content
text: Rebel Moon is one of the hardest reviews to write. There is something special here and I am looking forward to the extended cut and Part 2. Great visuals and world-building. I enjoyed the casting, costuming, and aesthetics.On the other hand, you can feel the missing content. After the opening act concludes, the film progresses at a breakneck pace and never stops to let you take in the world or the characters. All of the characters outside of the two with the most screen time are left very undeveloped. The script and even the action can feel underwhelming at times.So why a 9? I ultimately just liked it and want more. It is always easier for me to voice critical bullet points than cheerleading ones. I think if you are interested enough to be reading the reviews for this movie, it is worth watching. There was enough to like here when you realize this is only 1/3 of the project. It will be interesting to see if Netflix regrets not putting their best foot forward from the beginning. I plan to watch all 4 releases, but the consensus review score makes it appear like some people will not return even if the extended cut and Part 2 are better reviewed which would be a shame.

title: Just enjoy it
text: If you can forget who the director is, or don't care like I do, and you aren't lookng for some deep Star Wars tie in, you will probably enjoy this. Is it a 10? No. Does it have lots of open plot lines? Yes. By itself, the movie would be frustrating. With the promise of more (and soon), it does a great job of setting the stage for additional instillations. I don't need all of the answers now, I like to be left wondering. Does it transport you to another, believable, universe and tell an immersive story? Yes, yes it does. I've watched far better rated movies and been much more disappointed. Set your expectations aside, strap on your seat belt and grab your popcorn and go for a ride.

title: What is this? Is this it?
text: Zack Snyder = 10/10 concept 10/10 visuals 4/10 execution everytime. It's a running theme with him, Watchmen was the only one that landed the execution, although ZSJL is faaaar better than the Josh Weedon version and this film is no different unfortunately. I'm writing this review a little over half way in and it's as follows;Effects: Sometimes 8/10, creatures and aliens look amazing. Other times 5/10 and looks like an early 2000s game. You can really tell it was shot on green screen sometimes.Acting: The acting talent is there, they are all competent actors, but they either overact or under act and end up looking like a low budget fan film. They try to hit ALOT of emotional beats, with big music swells, and they just miss every-time as we just don't care about the characters.Story: Pretty generic, no deviation from a much used storyline...so far, this part 1 after all. It's a bit paint by numbers with typical story beats. It's definitely not changing the genre.Filmmaking: Typical overindulgence from ZS. Slow mo, gritty muddy look, 10 different angles of the same shot.The film suffers from a major identity crisis, it doesn't know whether it wants to be Star Wars, 300, Warhammer 40K, live action anime, Destiny or Dune. ZS has cherry picked the "best parts" of all these and done them worse then the respective properties. Plus there is a massive overuse of anamorphic lenses. Some shots are just plan out of focus.Overall I was intrigued when the adverts and trailers arrived and was left wanting when I watched the film, as with the budget of the MIGHTY NETFLIX and such a high profile director, this should have been a home run. Netflix still has a way to go to deliver a film on this scale of the aforementioned titles.

title: If you're not the Simpsons Comic Book Guy, you'll like the movie.
text: Both parts of Rebel Moon resonated with me. After eagerly awaiting the second part, I still crave more because of the intriguing storyline and presentation. While the concept of sunrises and sunsets may be familiar, the film's beauty is captivating and worth experiencing.In my opinion, it's stunningly beautiful despite its simplicity; some scenes are truly enthralling and worthy of revisiting, and the music adds to the overall experience. Special mention goes to the song performed by the general.These are the kind of space operas that resonate with me. They're like the Star Wars I've been waiting for.A unique blend of Beauty, Humanity and Reality.What's refreshing is that it's not male-centric and lacks the usual machismo.The film manages to avoid being boring or excessive.If you're open-minded and appreciate diverse representations, then this film is for you. Each character brings their own story and cultural background, enriching the overall narrative, rather than feeling like forced diversity.To me, it's like a snapshot of modern society and human existence. It highlights the eternal struggle against oppressors who seek to subjugate and erase those they deem unworthy, while also emphasizing the importance of preserving one's identity and cultural heritage.Thank you to everyone supporting Ukraine and other nations resisting tyranny.Remember! Nobody wants war but when conditions allow for the rise of an empire it's inevitable unless individuals stand up against it and fight for their rights and freedom. Respect yourself and others.

title: Mother Russia in Space
text: Snyder makes a valiant effort in telling his science fiction epic. However, after watching the film, the more I think about it, the more I realize 'Rebel Moon' is just this decades 'Jupiter Ascending'. That is not good company, though I did like 'Rebel Moon' more.I feel as though Snyder has good ideas, but he just hasn't perfected the art of how to actually tell a good story. The characters are okay, but most of the acting is atrocious with a few exceptions. Hunnam, Boutella, and Skrein are fine, but not great. The CGI was decent most of the time, but sometimes just looked weird, or a bit off. Zack really needs to calm down with the slow motion action moments; they're cool if used sparingly and in the right moments, but not twenty times in every action sequence.It also felt like there were not many original ideas. Lucas did Nazi's, so Snyder did the Soviets. The whole warmongering and even look, reminded me of Necromongers from 'The Chronicles of Riddick'. The creatures looked good, but again felt like knockoffs ie. Buckbeak from 'Harry Potter'. I liked the robot Jimmy the most I think, but again, not super original. Oh, and that double cross could be seen from six miles out.On a side note, it was kind of funny realizing that both of Khaleesi's boyfriends who played Daario in 'Game of Thrones' were in this film. I always preferred Skrein's version.

title: I had high expectations.
text: From the very beginning, from the first monologue it becomes clear that Rebel Moon will be just a conglomerate of motifs taken from other, more or less successful movies. The originality of the film has immediately gone out the window, and the question arises of how successfully the fusion of borrowed pieces from other film titles will be executed.The director presents us with a complexly imagined plot composed of many imaginatively different elements; but the problem of the entire film is that its potential is not exploited.I don't think the problem was with the money - the film is a visual spectacle. I believe the problem lies in the fact that nobody bothered to put two and two together, or to understand that the first part of the film Rebel Moon would look like a wrinkled shirt (very nice, but still quite wrinkled).The film could have been much better, but as it is, it's watchable and provides decent entertainment for a rainy afternoon.

title: Absolutely Entertaining. I still don't get the hate
text: I am not a fan of Star Wars and neither do I know a lot about Zack Snyder. I went into this film with little or any knowledge about what it was about and my mind was blown. From the beginning scene that set the pace for the enthralling plot to the each characters' story and the assembling of heroes, I loved every moment. The truth is the movie isn't without fault. I noticed there wasn't a lot happening since it is the first part of a film series but it was really entertaining. I spent two hours glued to my screen eager to see how things play out for these heroes and each of them played their part way absolutely well, even though it does seem they didn't have enough screen time. That's why there's a second part. So, I get the hate when it comes to wasting of characters and actors. But the fight scenes were amazing, the design of characters and their backstories were absolutely entertaining. I still can't get the absolute hate for this amazing fantasy film.

title: Visually stunning
text: Visually beautifully stunning.The world building is epic, in the vein of Star Wars or Tolkien. There is a shadow of a much larger world sitting just behind this.The action is spectacular and, well, action packed.The characters are fairly standard, so easy to understand but with no real depth. It's hard to care about any of them really.The dialogue is there. With the exception of the main bad guy (Admiral Noble) all the other characters are either really on the nose, or just exposition dumps.The characters all make a lot of weird or out of character choices simply to make the plot move forward.

title: The things that sparked my interest
text: This is definitely a 7.5 for me.I don't understand people who think there can be something originally made about space war at this point. I knew I would recognise a lot of other movies in this one but instead I wondered if it could add something, anything that would catch my interest.And I think it did.Here are those things: the lead actor woman is strong, hard working, plain looking, quiet, difficult, badass, introvert, natural and she's so interesting to me that I want to know more about her.The men are gorgeous, thank someone for portraying men to the attraction of a female gaze. God they're hot.I like the fight-scenes, I like the slomo - maybe especially because it's a woman doing the fighting. It's not usual to see a woman like that. So clinical. Is this movie feminist? It just hit me LOL.I thought the world portrayed was beautiful. There were some great nature scenes that made me think a bit about avatar.It also made me think about matrix, obviously Star Wars(but on a more personal level), guardians of the galaxy.The ending was pretty basic but honestly I want more!!

title: Lost Potential
text: The vast potential with the cast, the universe build, the beautiful visuals, and much more was lost on a too fast paced and unbalanced story telling. Started well, got iffy in the middle, then ended poorly with some unbelievable (even for sci-fi) action sequences. The action sequences are fun to watch for the most part.I will watch the second part, more out of curiosity and hope it'll get better.Again, too fast paced of a storyline. Felt super rushed with some far-fetched action sequences that left you guessing how the "bad guys" won any small scale battles let alone major wars. Don't want to spoil it, it'll be noticeable during those scenes.

title: Derivative But Decent; Way Better Than Critics Say
text: Rebel Moon Part One is fine. It's derivative and the characters are underdeveloped but it's reasonably entertaining. It wears its influences on its visual sleeve, including Star Wars, Blade Runner, The Matrix and Harry Potter 3. The story is like the first episode of a streaming series. There's lots of exposition and superficial character introductions that are left to be developed in later installments. I'm not usually a fan of Zach Snyder's plodding, overcooked style but this is an improvement since he's often cutting and pasting from better directors/movies.I think 6/10 is a fair rating, although anywhere from 4 to 8 would be reasonable. What isn't reasonable is the absolute hate this has gotten from professional critics. Professional critics have dogpiled this movie because: they're corrupt, effete creeps; and they think they can get away with it since Netflix didn't really indulge in divisive identitarian marketing despite a very diverse cast. If this had been marketed as a Disney/Amazon/MarySue Pictures Production featuring "the First Nonbinary Aleutian Furry in a starring role," it would have a 10,000% critical rating on RT. But it's Zach Snyder and it's Netflix, so around 20% is about the best for which anyone could hope.Is this a great movie? No. Is it better than most of the gutter trash that professional critics half-heartedly endorsed this year at the behest of their corporate masters such as The Marvels, Rings of Power, or Indiana Jones And The Destruction Of A Legacy? Yes, absolutely.

title: Disappointing, Full of clichés and predictable
text: This movie is a huge mess, it is visually good, not amazing, the story is predictable, and the characters are boring. The audio design is over complicated so that it doesn't sound real at all which spoils immersion, take the space animal in the beginning for instance, it doesn't sound like one animal, but 50 in a choir. Then there is a woman with a tiny frame who can over power men twice his size with ease and many other "huh?" Moments that yank you out of the immersion. So many clichés, that I am stunned. All in all, I can't really recommend this, even for fans of B movies. You will just feel like you have wasted your time.

title: Not great not terrible
Epic!, Magnificent..
text:
Do yourself a favor..
and for once more IGNORE all the toxic fanboys/girls that have caused so much harm..to so many Sagas and Gems..,
and watch it..Stunning visual effects, great atmosphere, sceneries, great action with nice slo-mo scenes, good soundtrack and an interesting fast moving story. Also good performances from most of the cast.Some new interesting ideas..and characters, very good villains.., and an overall captivating and tense atmosphere of mystery.., sci-fi and fairy tale..I dare to say that this movie is a successful mix of Dune, Star Wars, 300, and Blade Runner put together, in a very interesting sci-fi mix..
I also liked the Nazi-like.. appearance and colors of the Empire's officers, generals etc. I believe it prepares.. you subconciously.. for how brutal they are..Can't wait for Part 2!..
hope there will be even a Part 3!..Thank u Zack Snyder!, (and Netflix..),
you're a Genius!..

title: Why is the bad guy so lame he's a wannabe Tommy Shelby it looks like a Nazi for some reason and has a Negan complex
text: Negan is running an intergalactic army. The bad guys make no sense at all, and are so aggravating to listen to and watch.The main characters in the character building is awesome but everything in between is super boring and slow and they're keeping all the characters very shallow which means one could go at any point and we wouldn't know or care.When you build a sci-fi world, you have to introduce everything and have it make sense with some mystery but there's so many open ended scenarios for every different character and object and race that there's no answers just questions. I really hope that this picks up in part two I don't remember the main characters names.

title: Another Zack Snyder stupid cut
text:
Trashiest of trashy movie....
Will remind you of the Mila Kunis fantasy movie it looked like a spoof
Parody
.Zack Snyder has been fooling producers and fans for years
...this movie is flat boring with no new element
.most fantasy saga bits have been sewn together for Zack Snyder and his cronies to fool the human kind of another movie
Performances are bad because the script and the idea of the movie is bad.Some scenes just make you wonder if you surely watching a parody movie or not. The genius of Snyder is thriving you to waste another 2 hours of your life
On this waste ....of ott money.just avoid.

title: This is not a terrible movie
text: There are so many different aspects to make a good movie. I think with reviewers and people who watch solely on reviews forget these aspects.Visuals were masterful. The views were insane, seeing how the worlds were so close together was astounding.The special effects were top notch much like all Snyder movies.The acting was really well done with only a few dialogues that could have been corrected.Snyder is a visionary but alas his weak point is he needs someone to hone in on his story for proper storytelling. It did feel rushed but I'm sure there will be a directors cut coming at some point.

title: Enjoyed it to a degree
text: So, first of all the TL:DR, the lore and world seem really interesting and would benefit greatly from a TV series, the movie's plot itself is alright, meh.I would give the movie script itself 6/10 but raised a point as I actually want more from this world, the lore seems really interesting and cool to see so 7/10.Acting: great, had no qualms, stand outs imo are Sofia Boutella as the main character, she was great and much better than what I would have thought from the trailers, along with of course Anthony Hopkins voice acting although his role is brief in this part.Story: Absolutely meh, felt rushed and garbled, very quick, sometimes break neck speeds. This story would have muuuch better benefitted from a TV series that allowed each character and backstory breath as some of them sounded interested; also we teleport from planet to planet sometimes.A good twist involved, basic boss fight at the end. All in all alright but more excited for part 2.Music: seemed cool but can't remember a stand out, maybe one but need to recheck the soundtrack to fit but the music did fit in well into the universe.Design: Very cool, mix of practical and CG that blended quite well giving quite phenomenal shots. This universe looks well lived in, very cool already iconic weapons and ship designs.Directing/photography: As mentioned in the prior paragraph, some great shots, good directing in terms of at least consistent pace, I believe Zack kept as much or the necessary scenes as needed to make the film "work" but it barely does as it feels rushed: defo needed a series.

title: Nice syfy
text: Sometimes emotions are better describe in actions. That's I feel in this movie it doesn't have the most dramatic acting. But feels like a fantasy in space with is one story.I don't get why they are compering to star wars. Some of the reviews look like some people are trying to justify Disney for making a stupid job.Like Kylie said: "maid more lame".The CGI is ok not the greatest but fine. I have seen movies whit bigger biggest whit terrible CGI. The scenery is just beautiful.Thank you for not making dick jokes. Now on days if make action movie have to put comedy.I don't get why this hate whit Zack Snyder. When I see is film it has passion, work, dedication and love.See the movie is good syfy.

title: Snyder Sci-Fi Goodness
text: This movie reminds me a lot of Dune except we don't have a book to refer to when we get confused. It is visually stunning and I love the storyline of a benevolent and caring empire that's rotten from the inside. Rebel Moon did leave me with a ton of questions however. I'll be honest with the costume design and vibe I almost thought I was watching a prequel to the Warhammer 40k universe. I'll be interested to see what Part 2 is like but I won't be holding my breath in anticipation. Overall, if you are a fan of science fiction, Zack Snyder and have 2 hours and 15 minutes of your life to spare then you should watch this.

title: Another Snyder film more concerned with its looksthan its plot.
text: Zack Snyder has a great talent for spectacle, but unfortunately not a lot of talent for making a good, coherent story. He's gone full Michael Bay with this film... Everything about it is style over substance.The nonsensical plot and setting strongly remind me of Jupiter Ascending, another visually great yet overall boring movie of the same vein. Large elements are clearly mimicking the Avatar movies, making them feel stale and recycled. And while there were promising actresses and actors cast in various roles there wasn't anywhere near enough depth or coherent story in this movie for them to do much more than recite their trite (often outright stupid) dialogue while looking dirty and sad in literally every scene.You can by all means enjoy the great visuals in this flick... but it's not good science fiction. It's just old Hollywood trash with extra glitter.

title: A new universe is born!
text: With Part 1 of Rebel Moon being the beginning, there is a lot of set up, but it is needed. The world Zack creates shares the feel of star wars and Warhammer 40k. It feels lived in and a dark dystopian future that could exist.The effects are incredible, the world building is sublime and the villain steals the show with every scene he is in.My only reason it is not a 10 is the dialogue can be a bit rigid and sometimes it feels a little rushed getting the gang together. Some characters need more time to be fleshed out. But that is what part 2 is for I hope!But 100% worth the watch and ignore the critics this is a movie for any sci-fi fan!

title: The magnificent seven but in space
text: A poor villager and veteran anti-hero go on a journey to recruit more lone heroes, to help them fight off a large group of bad guys, who threaten to take over the village and its resources. The poor people in the village agree to give the heroes the little they have as payment. The handful of heroes are vastly outnumbered, but still willing to make a stand.Does it sound familiar? It's basically Seven Samurai or The Magnificent Seven, but in space, even slower and split into two movies, from which this is the first. I was trying to keep count, see if they get exactly seven heroes, so at least it would feel more like an homage and less like a rip off. I'm not sure about the final count though. Anyway, it's hard to care about any of the characters.It also borrows from other sources. The bad guys are kind of the empire from Star Wars. Instead of emperor Palpatine we have the Regent. The relationship between the Regent and the main hero is too similar to Thanos and Gamora from the MCU. In short, the movie gets no points for originality or character development.The fight scenes are not bad. But they have some very obvious continuity issues and some other problems that broke the illusion for me. I won't give examples to avoid spoilers.I did like the landscapes, specially at the beginning. And the odd looking aliens are interesting too. In general the movie has very good visuals. And if you shut your brain a bit while watching, overall the movie is mildly entertaining.

title: What is this? Did Snyder forget how to make movies?
text:
This movie puts you to sleep and confuses you from
the first 10 minutes.It's baffling how incoherent it is. It's like an AI edited it.How can an exciting sci-fi epic start with some neo-1930's Soviet imagery of farmers, boring dialogue, being told - not shown how good someone is, how scary the enemy is.It's incredible.This is not someone who's never made a movie before. Or has Snyder always been like that, and what we've seen was a result of someone stepping in and fixing everything he'd made? I assume that Netflix gave him free reign this time.I'm serious, what the hell is this mid confusing fever dream?

title: COULDA, WOULDA, SHOULDA...
text: I'll start with the positives. A fantastic (wasted) cast, plenty to get excited about with this ensemble, unfortunately only 2 good parts. Lots of backstories, not enough time. Plenty of action and fast paced storyline. Plenty of unfortunate death and destruction without audience connection or care. The special effects seemed over the top at times and made it hard to feel immersed in the movies reality. The script was boring, underdeveloped and predictable at times. Most of the players seemed wooden or forced and I had no connection to them and did not care if they lived or died. In my mind this probably needed to be a 10 part tv series with all the stories and subplots.Too much in too short of time equals too much information and not enough story connectivity. There is so much potential, but it needs a better storyteller or a longer format.

title: Could have been great
text: Firstly, I want to say this is not as bad as the critics say! This movie is worth watching but it does lack in key areas. It has poor story telling, cheesy predictable rushed gatherings of hero's and story development. Visuals are fine, sometimes great. Action is OK.People are criticising the film for being inspired by the likes of the new Dune & past Star Wars movies but there's nothing wrong with that except they are way better.I really wanted to like this but ultimately felt dissatisfied wishing the film had more time to breath and explore character development. But I must have liked it because time went quite quickly.I rated this 6 but could easily have given it less due to cheesy choices and other flaws. Still worth a watch though.

title: In a world with androids and space travel, why are humans still farming hitched behind a plow animal?
text: That's just one of the many dumb non-sequiturs in the world building underlying this movie which wreck this sci-fi flick.Zack Snyder hasn't made a decent movie in well over a decade, and I don't know why he keeps getting chances.The basic plot seems contrived and utterly un-compelling.The characters are all flat, the acting is flat, and whatever back stories the characters have are quickly ruined by the bad plot line.Everything about this movie looks like it was patched together from bits and pieces of many other much better and more coherent sci fi movies.There's nothing original about this movie and it's just a tired effort at filling in Netflix's insatiable need for content.

title: Mid space opera
text: Look, it's okay.It'll get unfairly compared to better movies and will be labelled "Snyder's Star Wars" and so on and I get that I suppose.It does have a bit going for it.Ensemble cast of often seen faces. Visually it's okay. Looks and feels like a Zack Snyder movie. Sophia Boutella gives a decent turn, Charlie Hunnam is his usual dashing self and there's plenty of over stylised violence typical of a Snyder movie.On the flip side it just doesn't have much to offer plot wise. Basically a famed warrior princess hides out amongst simple farm folk only to have her past catch up with her at the cost of those simple folk, saves them, then goes on a kind of intergalactic recruitment drive to collect a rag tag group of similarly famed warriors while being pursued by pound store Tommy Shelby.There's a lot of English speaking humanoid aliens typical of most mid sci fi movies and after the climactic fight it's kind of all about waiting for the next instalment.

title: Halmark level production and dialogue
text: I went into this movie having heard a lot of mixed reviews. Mostly on the poor side honestly but I tried to go into this movie with an optimistic view but wow, this is really really bad. The cgi and set designs take you right out of almost any scene. On top of that, the dialogue is so very bad it almost physically hurts. They over explain what they are doing in the very moment. It feels like I am watching a hallmark made space film with stiff acting and poor writing.The bad guys do look like space Nazi's so that feels like a good nod to Star Wars.All around a very poor effort by Zach. It would have been a great opportunity to compete with film franchise like Star Wars especially after Zach was talking trash about the new Star Wars. In the end a terrific failure.

title: Everything wrong with Hollywood.
text: Zack Snyder is overrated. $122m budget produced by Netflix and the story feels like it was written by an angry pre-teen.The opening 5 minutes set the tone as they throw copious exposition at the audience backed by an unappealing lead relationship arc which continues for 140 minutes of obnoxiously drab storytelling.VFX looks great when the fish eye camera lens isn't so nauseating that the aggressive jump cuts in slow/fast fight scenes aren't giving you conniptions.Zack Snyder is overrated, 300 was clearly a one hit wonder, with the likes of Sucker Punch & now Rebel Moon showing he's out of his depth.Save your time and watch Godzilla Minus One, which on a $15m budget puts almost everything released by Hollywood in the last 12 months to shame.

title: A Sci-Fi Spectacle with Flaws
text: In a galaxy far, far away, Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire bursts onto the screen with a dazzling display of brilliant CG backdrops. The visuals are nothing short of breathtaking, transporting audiences to immersive worlds that set the stage for an epic space saga. The storytelling is the beating heart of this film, weaving a narrative that keeps you engaged from start to finish. From political intrigue to personal triumphs, the plot is a rollercoaster of emotions that resonates with both die-hard sci-fi fans and casual viewers.The action sequences in Rebel Moon are a true highlight, showcasing meticulous production and a knack for capturing intensity. The decision to cut the music during key moments creates a raw and gripping atmosphere, allowing audiences to fully immerse themselves in the on-screen spectacle. Charlie Hunnam's acting prowess is on full display, adding a charismatic touch to the story. His character becomes a linchpin, connecting the audience to the grandeur of the Rebel Moon universe.One can't help but draw comparisons to the more recent Star Wars films, and Rebel Moon triumphs where others stumbled. The film embodies the visual splendor and epic scale that many fans longed for in the galaxy far, far away. Despite some harsh criticism from certain quarters, Rebel Moon is undeniably watchable and thoroughly enjoyable. It's a cinematic adventure that delivers on its promises, proving that satisfying sci-fi can still be achieved on the big screen.However, no space epic is without its flaws. Some moments in Rebel Moon suffer from questionable and unnecessary dialogue, pulling viewers momentarily out of the immersive experience. Additionally, the movie's score, while not terrible, lacks the memorability and unique identity that could have elevated it to iconic status. Despite these minor setbacks, Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire stands as a testament to the power of visually stunning storytelling and is undoubtedly worth the watch for anyone seeking an intergalactic escape.

title: Not a full Moon but still a crescent Moon
text: Rebel Moon is definitely a good movie. Far from perfect, but nowadays we should get our wins whenever we can.The story is simple, perhaps a little too simple. And it doesn't dodges the typical cliches seen in this genre of movies. But we can see the potential of this world that Zack Synder has created.Overall character performances were good and some even very good, unfortunately the performance of the main character Kora (Sophia Boutella) is not amongst them. I had hoped she had grown more as an actress, but it seems clear she will not be growing beyond what she has already shown in the past.And it's a shame really seeing her character played perhaps by another actress like let's say Emily Blunt, would've really shined and could've perhaps been the creation of quite an important character within the sci-fi genre.I understand why Sophia Boutella was chosen for this role, her dancing skills really come through in the action scenes. But it's her ability to show deeper levels of emotion that are lacking and for her character that's also a vital part.Rebel Moon hasn't done anything groundbreaking or revolutionary, but it's still a solid movie. Same as the story might seem too simplistic to some, to others it seems to go over their heads. Some negative critics about it are not only unwarranted but a little petty. As if they were expecting this movie to be what Star Wars or Alien were in their beginning.When even Star Wars and Alien can't reproduce their winning formula.Don't go into this movie with too much expectations and will surprise you in a good way. Go into thinking it will be groundbreaking within the genre and you'll obviously be disappointed.Rebel Moon has potential and it's a good addition to the genre, but it doesn't do anything that can't be expected from a good sci-fi movie. And that's already quite an achievement considering how little in terms of good sci-fi movies we really get.At least Rebel Moon doesn't promise to shoot for the Moon only to fall in a few meters.

title: Utterly awful
