text: Well that was painful. The lead protagonist is a super soldier whose main ability appears to be a miraculous inability to get shot despite lots of people shooting at her from close range. I was rooting for the cardboard cutout baddies so that the mind numbing, pretentiousness and stupidity would end.As a child I had a book depicting images of various SciFi worlds, it feels like Zack tore out four pages of the book and that was the film's storyboard. Vaguely pretty to look at, in a 1980s way, but I think some decent character development, dialogue, and story & scenes that make some sort of sense would have been nice.Maybe the film is deliberately dull and nonsensical, so that in a year or two the director's cut can come out. Wait for that, it'll be over 4 hours long, so at least you'll get more dull and nonsense for your money.

title: Not the epic space opera I hoped for.
text: I wanted to love this. Despite not being a massive fan of Zack Snyder, the first trailer made me think something great was coming. The second trailer dampened my enthusiasm slightly, as the visuals were classicly Snyder - too much green screen done in a way which to me looks more like cells from a comic book with not enough effort to make it look realistic; maybe that's the point. I felt the same way about 300, Justice League, etc. The movie looks like this all the way through, with additional visuals such as blurring around characters in early scenes.But the real problem with this film is the writing. What little plot development there is does nothing to develop the characters, or build a world which draws you in.Someone in another review here describes it as "soulless". I can't believe I've never though of it before but that perfectly encapsulates this, and all of Snyder's work.I'll probably watch the sequel in April, as it effectively costs me nothing. But I would not pay to see it in the cinema were that the only way.

title: Left me wanting for better acting and dialogues
text: It's a good movie but not the best Snyder can do. Let's hope part 2 brings some of the points back. But for now it will be max 7 from me.The pacing was inconsistent and the mains sequence felt very short. There was almost no buildup for main set of event and where there was some time spent on building the characters they didn't do much in the movie.Overall the universe felt short of what a space opera should have been, without the exposure to the Main places of the movie. Maybe if they had spent some more time on the history it would have proven to be success in my books. We still need to establish the most badass villian of the universe like star wars.

title: Woof
text: Dude! Did you know that slow motion is an available technology for movies these days? I had no idea but after watching this movie I am an expert on the subject. I'm not sure if Zack lets anybody give him any constructive criticism ever. He seems like a decent fellow but the only way I can imagine this poor amount of quality control is managed on such a high profile production (every single time) is if he has some serious control problems.I also really like how I am not allowed to dislike something for having abysmal writing unless I am "only following the pack". I very much enjoy how anytime something that isn't well made is produced we have the fanboys crawling out of the woodworks crying foul. It's okay to enjoy things that others don't, or even the vast majority don't. We ALL have guilty pleasures but I assure you "Rebel Moon" is about as much of one as a colonoscopy.

title: Not great, but not as bad as most paint it. Great visuals and a bit lacking in story. Good enough for a Part One.
text: After seeing the flood of negative reviews hitting I went into this movie with zero expectations.Turned out that it was not that bad, its story was weak but not terrible and the great visuals often made up for the not so good writing. The CGI was well done and the environments were rich, each frame contains incredible detail that it could almost be a wallpaper.Most also seem to forget that this movie is a part I, and like most two part movies, the first one provides context and prepares you for part II. And Rebel Moon Part One did just that.I've seen much worse sci-fis where not even the visuals are good and none of them got this amount of hate. After some digging I must conclude that they are not about the movie, but about the director.For example Dune Part I didn't really amount to anything, which is expected for a part one. I dare to say I even find the movies similar, great visuals and a bit lacking in story. Yet Dune was praised.Looking forward for part II and the director's cut.

title: A great movie to narrate youself
text: There is a legendary movie called Scorpion Thunderbolt. The editing in this is worse and that was different movies chopped together. This boasts CGI creatures with no feet, blurred backgrounds, lens flare and staggeringly short draw distances. Each chopped together, nonsense scene, seems as if it is set on a pantomime stage, no scrawling vistas, no depth to the scenery. Like a poorly funded college project with a very small greenscreen. The first 20 minutes up until the posie crown on a robots head are engaging enough. Then comes a slow motion battle, oh wait here is another slow motion battle, hang on, wait more slow mo. After 40 minutes we started to narrate the film ourselves. Mostly you will ask yourself why? Why are the planets so big? Why is the universe so small? Why is there a scene from an alley in the film Gladiator? Why is there a field of corn? Why have you cast him as the general? Why did you find him near a colloseum? Why is the backstory so shallow? Why not just tell a story Zac? Why has that horse got styrofoam on its head? Why are all action scenes played out in the space of 20 metres? Why does the scale of the ships keep changing? Why is this so much fun?If you want to laugh in bewilderment and make up your own dialogue, there is over two hours of special. The CGI floating monolith city is tremendously low quality, like a CGI cutscene from the video game Timesplitters. If you are watching in any form of high definition it's like a low budget child's TV program in places. It's a blast to marvel at just how bad this is. We watched it all the way through, we survived, we are now bonded together more than any character in this movie... Brilliantly bad... No directors cut can fix this... Enjoy!

title: AI Garbage
text: One of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life. This movie feels less like a passion project made by artists and more like the product of an AI, stitching together elements of other better franchises to create a bland, soulless, stew of nothingness. Nothing in this film feels remotely original; Star Wars, Warhammer, Avatar, even HTTYD are some main examples of franchises this movie rips off. There's not even any clear concept on how this world works. Inspiration is fine, but only when you are least have something new to bring to the table. Don't watch this film and waste your time. Just look at the franchises I listed instead.

title: Ignore the Star Wars Fanboys
text: This was a very enjoyable movie that was clearly paying homage to Star Wars. The problem therein is that you can't please a certain variety of beardy bridge inhabiting curmudgeon.Obviously Star Wars and Seven Samurai are the point of reference for this movie. Part 1 has tread very close to both in terms of the plot devices in use. I could understand if someone thought it was lazy because the elements are very pure and in many ways overdone at this point. For example, you might ask if we need another seven samurai tribute film. Imo: sure as long as it's good.As many examples have shown to me over the years, reviews can snowball and I think that's what happened here. Glad I saw the movie before the reviews because I found the first entry to be great.

title: Imitation of starwars
text: This movie from the beginning appears like an imitation of Star Wars. It starts exactly like star wars then it develops into guardians of the galaxy. But in guardian of the galaxy there was good acting, good music and a cool story. Here it's just special effects and action.It seems the makers of this movie just combined a few movies together and made something for Netflix.There is no great acting or amazing story. Just a good film to kill some time. Not more than that. It seems that movies today have become so boring. The only interesting things to watch are documentaries.You can't replace a good story with action and except people to eat it.

title: Overall entertaining movie.
text: Compared to other reviews, my review is pretty high. I believe I was expecting a disaster and since it wasn't, at least to me, that made it mildly successful to me. Let's start with the bad. The movie is very thin as far as the writing goes. It was very difficult for me to care about the characters. The character development was pretty poor. Another thing was it just seemed they just hopped from one world to another, gathering heroes. Ok. Meh. The only one with a really developed back story was the main character Kora. She's cool. Other than that... meh. Now for the good, special effects are cool, and I personally am a sucker for the slow motion scenes which are a hallmark of Zach Snyder. The action scenes are beautiful and the special effects are great.Now, if I had to see this movie in a theater, I would not be happy. Considering this is Netflix, (and I do not pay for my subscription to Netflix) I would say there are way worse movies you could watch on a night. So long as you don't have to pay to see it, I think it is worth a watch. I gave it a 7 because of the cinematography. Otherwise it would have been a 5. I will also repeat what others have said. Zach Snyder is a better director than writer. He should be given scripts, not writing them.

title: Great movie! Almost missed it because of negative reviews
text: The movie is entertaining, captivating. The story is not weak. The characters are great. Very good special effects and super fighting scenes. Each of the main characters are bringing their backstories and those are also very good. Yes, it's somehow like Star Wars but in a good way.So, you really need to start the tv and watch the movie for yourself. With all those other negative comments I was convinced not to watch it. I didn't want to see something like Gen Z empty talk and robotic actors without face expressions and emotions like the reviewers said they were. But in the last moment I decided to actually start the movie and see for myself how it goes.It's a very good movie! Bring the popcorn!🍿

title: A Bugs Life in space
text: This is painful to watch (most especially Charlie Hunnam's accent), it's predictable and has nothing new to say, it's just a rehashing of storylines based on Seven Samurai with ripped off Warhammer visuals. It's style over substance to the point that I was left wondering just how many slow motion shots one film could take!I tried to just enjoy it for what it is, but the acting is so "serious" (strained, wooden, one-note: call it what you will, it's not great) and it takes so long to get anywhere that I had to turn it off after 40 mins. Life's too short for bad films and this is most definitely a bad film and a waste of time that could be better spent doing literally anything else!

title: Don't let Star Trek or Star Wars fans ruin this movie for you!
text: Die hard fans of Star Trek and Star Wars will probably review bomb this movie with low scores, Zack Snyder haters will also score it low because it's his movie ;but don't let their tunnel vision ruin an exciting new IP that's set in a very cool world.Comparing this movie to either of the 2 mentioned titles is doing this film and yourself a disservice, expect nothing and enjoy the experience.There is amazing cinematography, great CGI (especially for a Netflix budget) and the main actors all bring something awesome to their characters that really makes you feel for their pains and struggles.While the plot is kind of like a lot of other movies, the way everything comes together is unique and there is zero pandering present which is also unexpected for a Netflix production!For a lot of people the similarities to the other 2 mentioned titles/IPs will be a barricade they'll never be able to get beyond ;but in all honesty this IP blows Star Wars away (especially everything beyond the original 3 movies and anything Disney has done with the IP).For me Star Wars and Star Trek are very over rated and only became as popular as they did because of the lack of quality choices competing with them (there was around a couple dozen channels and even fewer movie studios in those days).

title: Its great for people who just want to enjoy the story
text: I had to create an account to write this review. I started this movie with such low expectations cause all the reviews. I might need to add another perspective to this as for those who dont compare this with other sci-fic top movies may enjoy it.The movie actually lack of its own unique cause there are plenty thats better. Even though the story is predictable i must say it is great to see something like this again. The script could have been made better but to be honest we need to see the next one to decide whether it is good or not. Overall, I appreciate the work so dont skip this movie !!!

title: It's hard to be different...
text: It's difficult to create a sci Fi drama that does not feel like a spoof these days with such a saturated market and while a few scenes or costumes feel like a cheap knock off this movies does a solid job setting up it's own "universe" filled with unique characters and conflict. The story developes slow as it's clearly setting up a larger interaction between our characters but like many in the the genre it does enough foreshadowing and ground work to keep you interested in the players involved. It's a solid start to this story line and I look for the second part of this drama, not sure how many are planned but it could be a large number with the amount of information included.

title: Better than I expected
text: I almost didn't watch this movie because of all the horrible ratings. I expected it to be a slow-moving slog. It wasn't! I'm not sure what everyone else was expecting to be disappointed with this.It does copy Star Wars a lot. Even some of the "droid" sounds are the same (which I always thought were stupid, digital transmission at such low frequencies would be so inefficient). And some of the fights were dumb, particularly the one using bladed weapons while people with guns stood by and watched. And some of the dialogue was downright silly.But it was still all good fun, maybe coming in with low expectations is the key!

title: What is this mess?
text: Poor Zackie. He either forgot how to direct or he never could I am not sure anymore. This movie is among the worst movies I have ever seen. The cast is bad. The directing is really bad. I know from a director friend of mine that it is always the directors fault if an actor cannot deliver a dialogue or feel comfortable in its role. So bad acting is on Zack. The bad CGI tho. I don't know who's fault is that, but the spaceships and the wide shots are looking horrible in this movie. Like some cutscenes from a 1990's videogame. Writing is also Zack, so all these clichés and copies from the original Star Wars and Warhammer are lame. Cringe. Turok...sorry, I mean Tarak the last Mohican's flight on that giant black bird reminded me of the Neverending Story's dragon flight. And that movie was made in 1984. Simply bad, man. I cannot say anything that is positive. With all these boring and lame slow motions...without it would be 60mins long not 120. Absolutely amateur. Like a cheap lame TV movie. Maybe worst.

title: Great movie - waiting for the 2nd part
text: I am a big fan of sci-fi movies, and this one, although it has its flaws, didn't disappoint. Yes, it has some scenes with major unrealistic situations where the main characters won't survive, but it's a movie in the end, and I can't complain.The most important thing is that the movie has a story, and it's not just special effects that you will forget the moment the movie ends. So if what I mentioned above is fixed, then I think that the second part will be better than the first one.The last sci-fi movie I watched before this one is 'The Creator', and although there is no room for comparison apart for the same genre, I liked this one more.

title: Liked it better than the first part of the new Dune.
text: Which from my perspective, isn't saying a bunch. The story was fleshed out more in Rebel Moon, which is of higher importance to me. Yes, there could have been more background story; but it wasn't a hinderance to the logic of the movie(like it was in Dune). The CGI and Filmography was better in Dune. There were a couple of places in Rebel Moon, that the CGI was kinda subpar and I would have expected better. Especially one of the scenes when they were looking out the back of a ship as it was rising from the ground. Such a simple background scene, looking out a bay door, seems easy compared to some of the other complexities.I don't know why so many people had problems with the story? It wasn't groundbreaking, but it flowed and made sense. The only reason I understood the new Dune is because I had seen the '84 version and the mini-series('84 would have been enough to understand it though). It was entertaining, I don't feel like I wasted my time watching it like I did with the new installment of Dune.The only reason I'm comparing this movie to the new Dune is because they are both kinda Epics within the same genre. I don't know any other movie I can really compare it to recently. Also I would rate this movie around a 7.5, to be a little more fair. It's got good action, it's got a decent plot of pulling the different heroes together, it's sci-fi like it says on the tin. Like I said, it's not groundbreaking; but it is an entertaining movie.

title: Bollywood Star Wars
text: What an absolutely horrible movie. This is what Star Wars would have been like if George Lucas was on hallucinogenic drugs and had no original ideas.The movie just stole every plot from Star Wars to gladiator and combined it into a kaleidoscope of action that made zero sense, characters you didn't understand, and scenes stolen from a bunch of other movies.Netflix hasn't gone wrong with many original movies but this one was bad. Cancel the next two movies and make a sequel to 6 underground. I can't believe they didn't make a second one of those and instead made this horrible movie.Save your time and watch something else.

title: Pretty bad but still kind of watchable
text: Greetings from Lithuania."Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire" (2023) is not a great movie. Honestly, its not even a good one either, but at the end of the day i was somehow mildly entertained. The structure of this movie reminded me of video game, were you a main quest and then do side quests in order to requite companions - literally. Characterization of those characters is also pretty bad - its basically a colorful set of characters who are good at something (mostly killing things). And as for slow motion scenes - they are fine for me because it what director did trough his carrier - it did not bother me. There are action in this movie for sure and its was done OK. Music was pretty good in some scenes and i kinda loved the bird taming sequence. And yes, this movie is also rip offs everything from Star Wars, Avatar and many more movies.Overall, this whole movie can be summed up i think in few sentences. If you really like all previous movies from this director, there is a chance might enjoy this one at least partially. Its not as bad as people say it is (well it kind of is), but for a dumb evening it might do its job.

title: Was this a movie?
text: Where to start with this waste of 2 hours....Look I will just answer the parts you all care about. The action scenes even suck. Now that that's out of the way and you know you can skip it.The dialogue seems to have come from a middle school level drama. The character development is really quick and in your face at first, then suddenly just disappears it's absolutely jarring. The pace is atrocious. And the amount of holes in the movies plot and development could fit the milky way. I'm really not sure what to think. I know I'm not going to be looking for episode 2 as this shamble of a show illustrated that maybe Zack should stick to directing others writing as his is pretty much bottom of the barrel.

title: Starts out good then runs off a cliff
text: Interesting plot and characters, and the dialogue is well written...But only for the first 30 minutes.Then it seems like the filmmakers ran out of time and the rest of the film is just whatever sequence they thought looked cool, giving whatever plotarmor neccessary to the main characters so that they can jump to the end of the film. The difference in quality between the start of the film and the second half is glaring, it's like the dialogue and writing was thrown out the window. Still I would say it's a better movie than Snyder's Justice League, which was a movie composed of nothing but cool looking shots and no substance whatsoever.The CGI and effects are incredible though.

title: Samurai seven
text: This movie should have been titled "Snyder once watched the anime 'Seven Samurai' and thought nobody would notice when he stole the entire story"It's actually laughable how close they are in storyline. The problem is that thist screenplay would have worked as a Star wars film (fun fact that's actually what this was before Disney canceled the project) but without the star wars factor he was forced to fall back on styles and elements that pull it right back towards the anime.In the end it is trying to force a more complex story into two short movies.The characters and their stories are laughably incomprehensible. Never mind the utterly unreasonable way they all just decide to try to fight a literal army that controls everything, without even the slightest reason.The script reads like how a teenage might right their creative writing project, using inspirational and obscure phrases and language that is meant to sound deep or clever. All it really does is sound like the writers don't know how real people talk.And then there is the design. Every space ship defies intelegent design and physics. They look like they are designed to have no corners or sharp edges to protect children. And the giant waterfall above the village which reminds me of the kind of pumps old men put in their fishponds.All in all it's a dogs breakfast.

title: Enjoyable film for average viewer
text: You will definitely enjoy this film if you are the average viewer. The superhero/scifi/fantasy obsessives are apparently displeased with this film as evidenced in the tens of thousands of bad ratings in a matter of days. But to my virgin eyes, I quite enjoyed it. Gravitas and a touch of sophistication as the storyline draws allusions to powerful archetypes, which you might not grasp if you are laser focused on just the sci-fi canon (pun intended).This subtlety is lost on the negative reviewers here, but even if you don't think that deeply, it's a fun and beautiful film. The visuals are excellent, the alien creatures are conceptually interesting (love the spider thingy in the bar in Providence). And most importantly, the acting is rock solid. I cannot watch a movie if it's overacted. No problems here. Lead villain was cool, especially with regard to costume design. The lead protagonist was also cool, not to mention easy on the eyes. I think this actress has real chops...sorry for not knowing her name. Alas, there's no star power here, but those days are gone.

title: Entertaining but still a raggedy 7.
text: Next greatest sci-fi? Probably not, but the cinematography is pretty good, and the production value is pretty high. The Fx are well one. The villains are way overdone, the priests & all, but it's really the writing that lets the whole thing down, but not terribly so, it's better than I could do that's for sure, and likely the same for most of you. I sat though it and it was bad, but I tried to give it a go.It's hard to put this to words, but this film borrowed from Star Wars (bar scene), blade runner (dark cobalt world with Asian people), Greek mythology, gathering up the warriors by having them do great deeds, pesky blinders with the English bad guys, the Han Solo guy they met in the bar that conveniently had a rickety ship, the betrayal by the Han Solo guy who is also Lando Calrissian, the transporting all those dudes in carbonite, the walking evil spiders, none of it's original. It's pretty sad and really noticeable. I tried to like it.The space canons on the kings gaze ship were just ridiculous, who made that decision? Ugh I feel so bad for the actors and the producers that blew their money on this over done turkey.

title: I wanted this to be good, I couldn't even finish it.
text: I couldn't say when the last time I stopped watching a movie was, but I couldn't finish this. It was bad on several levels and has me seriously doubting any future films by Snyder.The lens flares and slow motion were excessive to the point of distracting. The green screen work was terribly obvious. The story and motivations of the characters was nonexistent. The writing was just awful. The pacing felt like sprinting. The cinematography was terrible with focal depths that were so small that much of a scene was fuzzy.I'm pretty easy to please and can find something redeeming in most movies, but I just couldn't go on with this movie. So little delivery on so much hype and I didn't even follow the hype. I went in with nearly zero expectations and still was let down.The only reason I gave it 3 stars was because I thought that the cast did the best with what they were given and the acting wasn't bad. This flop falls solely at the feet of the writer and director, Snyder.

title: Derivative Fun..(..Leave Brain at Door and Enjoy..).
text: After seeing many unfavourable reviews, I still wanted to see myself and make my own mind up. I did, and despite its many flaws, I did quite enjoy it. Mr Snyders recent efforts have been hit and miss, to say the least, though I will probably always give him a chance due to his very best works,(...'300','Dawn of the Dead' and 'Man of Steel'...),currently though I'm beginning to think of him as more of a 'Uwe Boll with more Money and Shinier Toy Box' type of filmmaker. His recent films are really just a collection of scenes,(..admittedly spectacular, at times..),with very little character development,sadly. It's like he just can't wait for the next slo-mo action scene to happen and hang everything else. I will happily watch the second part to see if he can bring it back. Despite all its faults, I still enjoyed it more than the recent risible 'Star Wars' efforts. To sum up...watchable pap.

title: Like Gwyneth Paltrow, it's Empty but beautiful
text: I didn't go into this movie expecting something amazing, because it's Zach Snyder. Not sure why other reviewers thought this was going to be the next Bladerunner 🤷‍♂️, but I suppose that explains why I was able to enjoy it as soulless entertainment.This movie is very nice to look at. The CGI space backdrops, the alien designs, S the fight scenes-- all fun to watch.Everything else is incredible predictable and trite. Whatever you think is going to happen or be uttered next, you're right.I've done paint-by-numbers that had more twists and turns than this movie, let's put it that way.Also, sweet superfluous exposition! Each character gets their time to tell us who they are, what their backstory is, what their motivation is... It's as if Zach read the character descriptions the writer did for his benefit, and was like, "Heck, let's just have them SAY this stuff!"When Chronicles of Riddick came out, people complained that it tried too hard to create an entire space opera universe. (Probably because they wanted Pitch Black 2; honestly I think Chronicles is fantastic).Rebel Moon is what you get when you don't try at all, when your aspirations are to make a Star Wars Clone. Backworld farmer, Han Solo, British robot, Nazi empire, it's all there.Honestly, I kind of appreciate that Snyder made the Star Wars stuff so explicit, it's weirdly refreshing.

title: Warhammer Light!
text: I really felt Zack Synder was doing a demo for trying to be on a future Warhammer directors casting call! And I could see that it would work .... In the movie we're tech priests, bolter pistols and the brutal kinda Steam punk like vehicles and craft! Oh and a dead king and Roman like imagery!The movie tried squeeze to much in a movie this could have easily been two movies and should have been! The start had a good pace but the setting was a little to rural for an advanced world!The second act was way too rushed - gathering the team and getting a bit more fleshed out characters and this should have been the rest of the movie but it had to rush to the final act which was a visual spectacle!Some of the setting and costuming was off putting and threw things out! My was the general wearing a suit and tie in the end like some Peaky Blinder? The Asian lady had a full on Korean warrior get up ... some fought withou shirts like all world had the same climate?! It was just weird ... also the general used a wooden mace in combat?! Silly. It was a dual thing for me one part amazing another part a Mis-mash that does not quite come together. However I am giving it an extra star for being better than any of the three recent Star Wars movies!

title: A bad combination of everything that normally is good in other movies
text: If I had to list everything that is wrong with this movie, I wouldn't know where to start. Let's just say the idea of the story isn't too bad... That's all it has going for it. The scene in the cantina is modeled (at the beginning anyway) on that of Star Wars. The dialogues suck. The characters (and a good part of the scenes involving them) are caricatures of what is most lamentable (or, but in lamentable version, of what is best) in cinema. Action scenes with unbearable slow motion. Moments where part of the screen is blurred without knowing why... In short... I cringed almost constantly throughout the movie.

title: Familiar aesthetic, paired with experimental ideas
text: First if all, the cast is great. An Algerien, non mainstream lead without being sexualised through the roof. Great fighting scenes, with captivating camera work. All other members, chosen really well, from all over the world. Not your typical A-list boring celebrities but more finely assorted actors & actresses.Aesthetically reminds of Riddick, Star Wars & Lord of the Rings. Additionally, new characters are unlocked with innovative sci-fi elements.Plot is ok, nothing extraordinary. But it depends on how it will develops. Didn't like particularly the last scene but ok.Found it more entertaining than Dune.

title: Frustrating
text: Zack Synder's films are immensely frustrating. He clearly has bags of talent for striking visuals. He rarely seems able to turn that into a good film.The same is. Sadly, true of Rebel Moon.OK, so it's clearly choosing to take The Magnificent Seven as an influence. Fine. That's that a solid story to work with.But this part 1 just blows it. It's annoying in almost every way - the constant slow motion, the lack of any logic. As you would expect, there are some really striking visual sequences, but they are just not enough to keep you engaged.And it all ends in an empty sequence with characters you don't care about doing things you don't care about either.And we've got part 2 coming - which you certainly aren't left eagerly anticipating.

title: I enjoyed it
text: I enjoyed myself and never felt like i needed to stop watching it like some people will make you believe. When i started reading about it being bad, i thought it was a shame, but then i decided to watch it for myself, because too often i won't watch something or play a specific game if i hear bad press about it. I liked all the characters even though i'm not a fan of Sofia Boutella. I think a new world filled with potential was created. Fast googling and this was done for 166 Million for BOTH PARTS! That's 84 Million per Movie and filmed back to back to save money. And to the people Talking about star wars, Rise of Skywalker's budget was 416 Million...I think this new world is filled with potential and i'd love nothing but to see Snyder do a Star Wars movie with that kind of budget. Maybe when they finally get rid of Kathleen Kennedy :)Ps: In the meantime, i for one try to have fun with my entertainment and not look for everything that's wrong with something i'm watching. And honestly even with the simple plot i think this is miles above what's been coming out lately. But for 80 million per movie....?? Newest Hunger games budget was 160 Million and i'd rather watch this movie twice than to watch that.PPs: In every scene of this movie i did notice the dedication of always putting something else in for the CGI sets not to look too barren.

title: It's different and a good watch
text: Seeing a lot of reviews calling this the worst movie ever made and whatnot. After watching Rebel Moon, it's clear that there are a bunch of Sci-Fi and Snyder fanboys who expected this to be better than Star Wars and when it wasn't they had to trash it.The story is a bit choppy and I understand the slow mo in the action sequences was a bit overdone, but the movie succeeded in creating an original world in an era where all we've been getting is forced sequels and remakes of remakes for 20 years. I think that had to stand for something.The story is relatively standard for a movie like this, but the lead heroine was tough and as complex as they could've made her given the screen time they gave her back story. I enjoyed watching her as a main character. The main villain was both creepy, threatening and mysterious. The cinematography and world building alone make it worth a watch.I'd recommend it, don't expect Star Wars action and sci fi perfection with Godfather writing and character development and you'll probably enjoy it.

title: The magnificent seven in space.
text: Simple farmers look to hire some fighters to defend themselves against an army who want to steal all their harvest. Sound familiar?Bland, soulless, unoriginal, some dog awful dialogue, wooden performances no excitement and absolutely no humour. Found myself looking at my watch wondering how much longer will this drag on for.I felt nothing for any of these characters, after all the hype this was a damp squib of a movie.The kindest thing I can say about this movie, it was very disappointing.I know the original draft was as a Star Wars story, rewritten when it was pasted over, and thank dog for that or we could have had a different bad Star Wars movie.Just so bad. Bad, bad, bad.

title: Not great but not as bad as I thought
text: The first half is interesting, the second... not so much.But it's precisely what I was going in for, sci-fi with money behind and visually cool but that uses trope after trope after trope.It also abuses the slow motion camera; at some moments it uses it properly but most often than not it fails to deliver.There are some parts of the story that are not explained, and the pace is... weird to be honest.Still there are a bunch of interesting characters even though they are the most archetypical you can think of.All in all I must say that although is not awesome, it is not as bad as people say.

title: Epic story? Falls short. Spectacle? Glare fest.
text: Better than your typical B-C movie tier. I am wondering about everyone's motivation behind their actions. Gratuitous griffin scene literally meaningless. Glare effects overdone to the extreme. So much so that it should be listed as the main character. Camera angles are to tight in action sequences. Some of the acting is believable for a moment or two but then glare pulls you out of falling into the world they are trying to create. Better to watch than a rerun or Disney virtue signaling laden propaganda commercial they call a film. Over hyped, under executed. High tech but using 19th century no country for old men plot Device. Seriously though, the glare is way overdone.

title: Shallow and silly.
text: Perfect netflix product. It's the silliest non-sensical piece of crap I've seen this year. There are similar ones from other streamers (Prime, and the other + around). Girl is the main character, why am I not surprised?It's so shallow. I couldn't even care if the main character would die, couldn't care less about all the others. Where do they come from? What's their story? And talking about storyline... OMG. Was this written by A. I? Possibly by a 5 year's old most certainly.All the Roman references such as Titus (roman Emperor which in the film is a disgraced general), Belisarius (Belisarius was a military commander of the Byzantine Empire under the emperor Justinian I.) are absolutely bizarre. Is this pathetic movie based on a book?Watch and see for yourself.

title: Proper Background buiilding
text: I have to give credit to crew for bravely dedicating a whole part to building the background of the story.The Child of fire seems to serve as the information dump part where we get to understand the world everything is and will be built on.This movie does not do the typical work of making a background, telling a story and closing the story.Seeing when the second chapter will release and how the poster is going, shows that the story is not yet even told.This movie will become the recommended place to start down the line but will not be the favorite story people will crave.As someone who read large stories in series, I have the patience.

title: An Average Chapter One But Still A Mixed Bag Of A Film Overall
text: I didn't hate Rebel Moon like most of the people were, but i do think the movie had some bad stuff in it, mostly the pace and the acting, the pacing was not really well constructed that it really made the film pretty boring most of the time, the performances from some of the main cast unfortunately not very good, Charlie Hunnam performance as Kai was one of the worst and funniest performances i've seen in a while at the same time, the rest of the cast was ok, and i like Ed Skrein as a villain, he is terrifying and threatening, the thing that i like the most was the story, i do like the story of the film, the idea and the concept i find it interesting and quite works just if the movie was executed more well than this, also fills with usual pretty cool Snyder's action sequences, overall Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child Of Fire was an average chapter one of an interesting story fills with pretty cool action and pretty good villain but pacing and acting flaws from the lead cast makes it overall still a mixed bag of a film, and i hope Part Two had some justice to the story.

title: Snyder is Alan Lee, not JRR Tolkien.
text: A bit of Star Wars, a bit of Dune, a bit of Lord of the Rings, a bit of Harry Potter, a pinch of Conan, a couple ideas stolen from the Mandalorian and Flash Gordon and what you get is Rebel Moon, a scifi space opera that seems more like a common denominator of things Mr Snyder seems to like rather than an original story.It's clear that Snyder is excellent in directing, sometimes missing the mark (who hasn't, really? Even Scorsese did Hugo) but mostly creating visual wonders. However all his original work, ie all work that was not conceptually created by someone else, leaving Snyder the sole task of adapting it to the big screen is below average.Rebel Moon is no exception, as this extremely basic and predictable story has been remade so many times one cannot even bother to care about the story. Not even Snyder himself, it seems, as half his characters appear out of nowhere, undertake a task for no reason and without any obvious motive, and proceed to the next scene.This movie feels more like an adventure game than a work of art. "Unlock a new character, mission completed, proceed to the next stage".However, as a visually impressive space opera, Rebel Moon does not disappoint. It can be best enjoyed if playing in the background while one is wrapping Xmas presents or decorating the house, because it is very pretty and one does not need to watch it attentively, as the story hardly matters at all. As such, it is a fun Xmas distraction and -at least as far as I'm concerned- more fun than ONE MORE mindless Santa movie about escaped reindeers, lost presents or naughty elves.I give this a 8/10 for the visuals and a 2/10 for the story and characters. This should count as a 5, but because it's the holidays, I will rate it with a 6/10 coz you know, Xmas spirit and all.PS 1: One should compare this mess to Guardians of the Galaxy to realize how great Marvel used to be before they became a populist political platform: making good space operas is extremely difficult.PS 2: Kudos to the cast for REALLY trying to act in a completely nonsensical story with a horribly idiotic script.

title: Pretty good, but not great.
text: Sci-Fi is like pizza: When it's good it's great. And when it's bad it's still pretty good. Rebel Moon is pretty good, but not great.The plot is obviously derived from Kurosawa's Seven Samauri (see also The Magnificent Seven and A Bug's Life). It also borrows heavily from the 1980 low-budget film Battle Beyond the Stars. And, of course, Star Wars tropes are nearly unavoidable.In contrast to the unoriginality of the plot, the film is visually beautiful.The writing is mediocre. The pacing is bad. The acting is stilted--despite there being several great actors (who are poorly utilized). The action sequences are plentiful and terrific. The characters are generally one-dimensional cardboard cut-outs (although the pacifist robot who "goes native" is intriguing).But hey, this is Netflix, so my expectations weren't terribly high to begin with. If I had paid money to see this (other than the monthly subscription fee I pay anyway) I'd be I bit disappointed. As it stands, I'll probably re-watch Rebel Moon multiple times, mostly for the visuals.

title: Started well but lost its way
text: The first 30 minutes were promising. For a while it looked like this could be a Snyder classic in the making but as soon as they hit a bar full of alien vagabonds the whole movie slumped.The heroes of the movie set out to recruit a gang of clichés to join their posse and head out to fight the villains. The plot is pretty weak as we spend nearly an hour watching the gang trudge planet to planet in search of new freinds in their quest for justice.The acting was poor overall with a special shout out to Charlie Hunnams cheesy attempt at an Irish accent. Ed Skrein was the one saving grace as the head honcho bad guy.You'll sit through it but you're unlikely to enjoy it.

title: Dish of ingredients past.
text: If Avatar, 300, Hateful 8, and Star Wars had an unwanted child it would bully Rebel Moon. There was potential. However, the story is so unoriginal they just took their favorite aspects from a hodge podge of their favorite stories, and mashed them together. Just when it it can't get worse they add a dash of The Fifth Element for good measure. There is an odd mix of intelligent story telling and dry awkward dialog. There was a sort of choppiness to the fluidity of acting thought. Some characters seemed seasoned, while others showed their first time on the job scattered throughout. This really brought a lack of continuity to the whole movie. The special effects gave it their best shot... I guess. But also peppering the entire file. We're moments where they said enough is enough for today. That's good enough.

title: Star Wars NOT found dead in a ditch.
text: Zack Snyder failed so miserably with this film. I see the vision, I really do, but with binoculars. Rebel Moon could have been so much more, they had gold in their hands, yet they failed to give the audience good material. This film is all over the place. ALL OVER THE PLACE. It can't stand on its own two feet, such a half-baked story with rushed character introductions, that it could not make me care for anything that was happening on screen. I didn't spend enough time with these characters to really understand them and care for them.Now, dear Zack Snyder, cool it with the slow-mo. Yes, I agree they're cool and you like them, I like them too, but only when they're earned and feel satisfying. When you're literally giving me a slow-mo every ten seconds, it's only normal that I'll get sick of it after a while. I laughed a handful of times during this movie, and it wasn't with the movie, more so AT it.But because I don't want to completely bury this film, I'd like to give props to the production design and the people who worked on the visual effects, because they are magnificent (with a few exceptions). This is Netflix's most expensive film ever, and you can tell. There's clearly a ton of work put into Rebel Moon.Sad to see Zack Snyder's attempt at a Star Wars film fail so miserably. I hope the 4 hour long Snyder cut does it justice. Waiting for part 2.One more thing, there was an Irish guy in this movie who's name I forget because of course, and he was annoying af.

title: Setting the table for Part II
text: This movie obviously sets the table for the second installment. It was fairly formulaic along the "Epic Quest" trope (define a problem, gather characters and throw in a few interesting side bits along the way), but it held my attention. It felt a bit like David Lynch's Dune as far as how the galaxy of the Mother World is portrayed. The characters weren't horrible. The action was pretty cool. And Sofia Boutella delivers a believable protagonist with a troubled past. This is what I usually call a "popcorn movie" - not going to set the world on fire, but entertaining for what it is. The only problem is, I expected more. Thus I am looking forward to Part II and hoping for the payoff that took two hours to set up. Overall a decent way to spend a couple hours.

title: Another cheap and boring movie
text: Let's make a movie to try and make money. We don't need to invest in a good director and let's copy Starwars but just enough to not be too obvious!Oh and let's make the bad guys really nasty and look like nazi's out of a 1970's wartime film but without any acting qualities.What were they thinking? Were they thinking?The film is boring.The special effects are boring and badly done.Lot's of slowmo that only accentuates how bad scènes are.Good actors are given shoddy rolls.The music is dreadful and annoying.Don't waste your time on this film, it's not worth it. I watched most of it but didn't even care how it was going to end and gave up the last 20 minutes.No spoilers, nothing to spoil.

title: One of the best movies of this year that leaves you wanting more
text: Zack Snyder's Rebel Moon Part 1- A Child of Fire is a phenomenal film that introduces you to this world and the characters that inhabit it. The narrative, acting, cinematography, CGI, VFX, SFX, were all on par, but the pacing issues is definitely something that I noticed, but this can easily be fixed in the extended, rated R version of the film. But, this film is great on it's own, and it sets up what's to come in this new sci-fi (or rather science fantasy) franchise that's going to change sci-fi. Overall, 8.5-9/10 💯. Snyder delivered big and this cinematic & expanded universe is gonna be dope. I can't wait for the extended rated R version and Part 2.

title: it's not that bad..
text:
I had no expectations, no idea what the plot was.Sci fi movies are rare these days, so be happy they made this one.I thought the fx were great, maybe you should turn off the
motion blur in your tv settings !! And put it to filmmaker mode .Now, yes the movie is made from a lot of different sci fi movies.Star wars
dune
chronicles of Riddick
7 samurai or magnificent 7.Firefly
bugs life
clash of the titans
and mostly " battle beyond the stars"
some scenes are almost identical, like the cantina scene. ..the lightsabers are also a cliché
I like the actor playin the villain, I wouldn't be surprised he ends up in the MCU as a super villain,But hey it was still fun to watch.Haters gonna hate.

title: Zack Snyder is the definitive "Most overrated hack" director of this generation
text: How does Zack Snyder get to make movies. He's by far one of worst directors of over generation,. So out of touch with the art of filmmaking and storytelling it defies any logic how he still gets to make movies.He single handedly destroyed the DC universe and one of America's greatest icons Superman. I had thought after that disaster of monumental proportions we wouldn't be subjected to any more from him for a long time.It here we are again. Another movie in which he literally gets everything wrong. Have to admit the trailer was intriguing but the movie...yikes it's a dud right from the start. It's like a bunch of amateurs were given lots of money to produce a film.Another thing that doesn't make sense is how do Zack Snyder movies have such terrible special effects in this day and age.And wait for it...there is also going to be a Zack Snyder cut of this rubbish. Are you kidding me?It's commonly said that Zack Snyder is one of the most disliked directors in Hollywood. Why should that even be a surprise. He's clearly a con man who somehow fools studios into letting him make more movies.Zack please retire and take up another line of work.

title: Stunning visuals with no story
text: Predictable story...whole movie is about introducing characters with no further development of the story... However some positives are terrific landscape...alien planets...beasts... action...and good cgi....one time watch.... started on a promising note but the later half was predictable..had a potential to be an entertainer but nothing concrete happened in this part...it is a mixture of star wars, 300, the enemy army looks like Nazis...Not what is expected of zack Snyder..but still you will enjoy the movie in parts...some sequence are amazing and i already can figure out what will happen in the next part....

title: Cheap but entertaining
text:
Especial effects were good , however dialogue , script and acting was a bit poor. The worst of them all was the Farmer , who almost does not have dialogue but above all lacks character, purpose , he seems completely lost and the actors performance wss so poor , he seemed so lost.Admiral Atticus and Kora were great each playing opposite characters , lead of revolution and the bad guy serving as a messanger of a mother planet ...
Everything seems inspired by the Roman Empire , the names of the generals, how they invaded towns and cities , now planets or moons ... I have never read the books so my review is solely based in what I watched.

title: Lifeless
text: There was next to no appeal in this movie for me.The story is of an evil power from the Motherland who come to take over world by world, draining resources for themselves when a brave rebel stands up to them and starts a quest to recruit top fighters and take on the evil forces and take back their land.That's about 90% of the movie, it's just about watchable, I hate crapping on movies, I'm not a Zack Snyder hater, I like some of his things but this wasn't it.The action was decent when it was ruined by slow motion shots and questionable CGI. The use of Prost ethics was lost in this movie. A major problem was feeling absolutely no connection to the characters of the film, Kora was fine, one or two solid scenes the only reason this movie has even been scored was her and another fight scene and a decent twist I didn't see.The blurry background hurts my eyes at times, I didn't love the score, the acting to be fair was good by a few but other than that, nothing, oh cool sword fight for about 4 minutes,Don't waste your time, 5/10.

title: This Fire is Missing a Spark
text: Rebel Moon is a bit of a Frankenstein. Similar to the recent "The Creator" it avoids original content by following elements of other films. While the film itself is fine, it does feel like a copy of something that has been done better.The plot is that an evil empire called The Homeworld is a cruel overlord that can't help but murder the innocent. Innocents don't want to get murdered and have to look for a group of great warriors to protect them.The acting is good, and some of the effects are grand, however there are definitely some spots where it looks like a mid 2000s video game. While the side characters are meant to be original and unique, I did find myself uninterested. They didn't click.Ultimately, Snyder does his thing. Grand sets, slow mo action and some good tension, but he has done this all before - better. If that is enough for you, then this is fine. What it does not do is bring anything interesting to the table. With the mountains of new content out every week, this film fails to set itself apart. Entertaining, forgettable.

title: This movie convinced me...
text: ...that Zack Snyder should stop making movies.It's as if he's drawn from a colorful hodgepodge of all genres and iconic films to create this pile of garbage.Unfortunately, he only picked the bad fruit from the bulging fruit basket.For example, the cheap copy of Tarzan, who in this movie only takes on the task of presenting his trained upper body.In a desperate attempt to give him some depth, the poor guy is turned into a nobleman from the planet Shirtless.But this is just one of many characterless figures that Snyder wants to bring closer to the viewer.However, they are so boring that I couldn't even remember their names.But at this point, I would like to take the opportunity to highlight the character Bloodaxe as particularly horrible. Rarely have I been so annoyed by a character's stupid actions and simultaneously empty but supposedly meaningful speeches.Although you could actually say that about all the characters, if you're beeing honest...I could write more about the movie now, but it's just not worth it. Because I've probably already spent more time writing this review than Snyder spent writing the screenplay.I give this movie a gracious two stars because I have hope that part 2 can at least save this movie into mediocrity after the fact.Deep in my little heart, however, I fear that Znyder will only hurt the poor souls of all sci-fi and movie fans even deeper with the release of part 2.

title: Self absorbed sprint to sleepy time
text: Derivative and takes itself way too seriously. Runtime and personal screen time would be cut in half without the all unnecessary slo mo everything shots yet the movie would only be 1% better by a shortened runtime. Redundancy in storytelling would cut another 50% of the slo mo-less cut and therefore the cerebral torture would only be half hour long. Acceptable leaving mostly action shots and melodrama bits . One day production companies and fans will come to terms with the fact we do not need or further accept Zack Snyder's brand of ridiculous and quite unneeded storytelling. Proceed only if you want lifeless space incoherency.

title: Good and Lovable
text: The movie was good, it had great action and great music in it. The story was good, and I would love to watch the continuation of this story. All the characters in the movie are Lovable. I want the Rebel Moon Universe to expand. I'd like to give it 8/10. Rebel Moon Part One is surely Netflix's best release of 2023. The final action at the end of the movie was small, but I think that's okay, though it could've been long. Characters like Kora, Tarak, Gunnar, Darrian, etc. Were lovely characters. This movie is another good work by Zack Snyder and the cast, and I'd like to see how the story continues.

title: not disney star wars
text: Thankful that disney passed on this now Zack has a cult but mostly people seem to hate on his movies this is visibly stunning and his choices of music blend well and his melding of techniques works beautifully all said this is better than star wars has been in years acting is about average or solid which is good for sci-fi but he's trying to make a an Epic which is sorta a brave departure and a large gamble that doesn't completely score with me but as a part 1 i'm looking forward to the next chapter and unlike years past don't have to wait years for it (thanks to LOTR)now to answer people's problems with the acceptance of accents screw you read some sci-fi and get educated.

title: Very meh
text:
It was not bad or good. It just just what ever.The effects where great in areas and very terrible in others. Some made me question everything about the makes of this film and how they aloud if to be released.The acting was very bland and one dimensional with lack luster leads and over the top stereotypical villain
The ending made me not want to watch the next one.This is proof you should never believe the hype or let someone have full creative control. Snyder went full Snyder and it suffers because of it.I understand why Disney wouldn't want to make itm I wouldn't want it made either. Netflix need rhses opportunities so I get why it was made but it really shouldn't have been.All in all. It sucked and I would never watch it again nor listen to hype and maybe believe the criticism.

title: The originality of the movie's look at feel can't save a middle of the road action movie
text:
Let me start with the good part of things:
This movie looks beautiful and looks like it's designed with care and a sense of originality.I love how Snyder uses his camera, he's a great cinematographer when he really tries
Snyder really knows how to make things visually distinct from the common look of movies.The battle scenes are also better than the normThe Bad: The story, which little story there is, drags even for a over two hour movie, and the paper thin characters dont help.The story also seems rushed if that can be possible, with little detail given to the plot or world surrounding it.I'm not upset that Snyder decided to riff on Seven Samurai style story, it's been done before, but he never really makes the story enjoyable.The constant slow motion effects also make the movie very repetitive and somewhat bland.The really bad:
Rebel Moon is already slated for a director's cut so some might see this movie and it's sequel as a skip until the cut comes out on netflix.

title: #DontReleaseTheSnyderCut
text: So bad. So derivative, Leibniz is turning in his grave.Best thing for Netflix would be to not release part 2. #DontReleaseTheSnyderCut.I've got to fill this review with another 450 characters.Trailer shows the guys jumping off a ramp into a spaceship. We see the spaceship. We see the ramp. And again. And again. Then the guy sees the ramp. Then he thinks about it with lasers firing all around. Then he fights his way to the ramp, dodging lasers. Then he pauses at the ramp. Lasers stop. Then he slow jogs up the ramp, before slo mo jumping off the ramp. Whyyyyyyhy?Zero interest in any character except maybe the lead. Felt like the first Suicide Squad. Too many characters too fast for you to care about any of them.

title: A Colossal Disappointment
text: An amalgamation of everything that's ever been wrong with Zack Snyder the storyteller, Rebel Moon is an atrociously crafted space opera that presents the (in)famous director channelling his worst tendencies as a filmmaker. Inarguably the weakest entry in his filmography, this sci-fi action epic never for once creates any sort of intrigue about its world or characters and is further marred by mediocre direction, shoddy writing, cringe dialogues, moronic twists & terrible performances. A colossal disappointment, Snyder's latest is not just one of the worst films of 2023 but also ranks amongst the most insipid & unimaginative examples of its kind.

title: Bland and hard to watch
text: It's like everyone was phoning in their jobs. The acting is weak for the most part and the story is a pale imitation of the story that inspired it. Anyone who couldn't see this was based off the seven samurai (as was Star Wars Ep 4) either doesn't know that story, or this story was so hard to watch that they couldn't see it.Zack Snyder definitely over uses the slow motion in his works, which simply makes it hard to stay focused on the boring script. A little slow motion can emphasize dramatic events. Constant use of it is annoying and ruins the moment and story telling.Zack Snyder also seems to try and constantly get the money shot even when there isn't one. And when there is one it is often over baked CGI.The story telling is definitely rolled out slowly. So slow that it loses me as a viewer. Even the exciting bits tend to be slow and a bit boring, often because of the over use of slow motion. It like Zack Snyder can't get out of his own way.Then there's the costumes and such. One of the villains attire is definitely awkwardly out of place. How anyone could think this was the next Star Wars is beyond me. Rebel Moon is too stiff and take itself too serious to even come close to that title.

title: SciFi Fantasy w/an extra-scoop of Fantasy
text: Not a stupid B movie that's for sure. Kinda has a "Serenity" feel to it with a touch of Riddick. Makes me want to go back and watch the Firefly series again.Predictable and good storyline w/a nice twist. The acting is good, the camerawork is solid and the effects are quite well. I especially enjoy the weapon's fire with its secondary effects. There was an attention to detail to it that I have not seen in another movie yet:: Well done to the producers on that! Way Cool!I was somewhat disappointed with the frequent "Epic" camera shoots later on in the show, but hey, it's SciFi Fantasy right? They make for good wallpaper.Overall I would recommend it, especially if your a Sofia Boutella fan. I will keep watch for Part 2, Part 3.... It looks to be a solid series worth watching. Better than anything Star Trek!

title: Couldn't finish this one
text: I thought Zack made some movies before and was decent at it? While I found the beginning interesting, this quickly changed during the really bad fight scenes. Then it got worse because the started to visit one chliche place after the other. Then the CGI effects made it even worse. The bird-thing was ridiculous ... hs it was bad. And what really made me shout ugh wt f were the slomo fight scenes? Who thinks action should be like this has seen to many funny internet videos ... but guess what it doesn't really work for them and it doesn't work for movies. I want the time back i spent watching this.

title: Enjoyable but derivative
text: Even with the lavish production, the smorgasbord of ideas that are discarded as quickly as they are introduced, and the magnetic appeal of star Sofia Boutella, it's hard to watch Rebel Moon and not feel like you've seen it all before.That's because you probably have; this wannabe Seven Samurai in space wears it's influences on its sleeve, with clear inspiration arriving from a long time ago in a galaxy far away and the grimdark 41st millennium to name but two. You've definitely been there, done that, and got the whole collection of promotional t-shirts, but being derivative doesn't make if a bad film - just as a strong cast can't make it feel like a great one.It's perfectly watchable, even good in places. But it's not as good as it should be, or as it thinks it is.

title: Sophomoric screenplay & dialog
text: Watched 45 minutes and turned it off. The screenplay & dialog felt like a B- high school creative writing submission. Here's the formula, take every successful sci-fi and action movie, extract the over worn plot elements and superficial bling, put it in a blender and out pops the script (was this one written by chatgbt?). Then find B actors and make them suffer through their pandering cliche lines. Then Voila! You have a 3 part epic saga you can sell to a streaming company desperate for content but experiencing financial hardship. Not as bad as "Plan 9 From Space" which is too bad because at least that could be laughed at, this is just pathetic.

title: I liked it.
text: I grew up watching sci-fi with my grandma. She's the one that introduced me to this amazing genre 36 years ago. I went into this movie only seeing the preview. I greatly enjoyed it and can't wait for the next one. This is like the 300 meets Star Wars. The beginning heroic scene hyped me up. I love it when people take a stand against tyranny. I didn't expect the anticipated fight scene to happen when it did either, that definitely caught me off guard which was nice. This is only part one so I am hoping we get some more character building in part two as that was one area that was lacking for me. I am looking forward to part two.

title: Should have been a series
text: With an abundance of captivating characters, each with their own intriguing backgrounds and plot points, and a vast world that was meticulously built, one would assume that they would have had the foresight to transform this into a series rather than squeezing so many captivating storylines into a mere two-hour film. The conclusion left me with a whirlwind of thoughts... why wasn't it longer? Why were there so many characters with underdeveloped backstories? Why did they believe that the audience wouldn't appreciate a slow-burning, intricately crafted storyline instead of rushing through everything just to reach the somewhat intense battle at the end?Even now, I barely have a clue about the people they are fighting for. Why should I invest so much emotion in a group of farmers whom I barely had the opportunity to spend time with?Or a motley crew of warriors who were once revered?There was so much more potential that could have been explored, and once again, it fell short of becoming something truly AMAZING, leaving me with a sense that it was only good for what it was...

title: Attention Attention
text: This movie is weak-minded garbage. The film rips off other films. The film has no ability to be engaging in any way, even though I'm a sci-fi fan.Wasted time, effort and money because AI would have generated it better.It's worse than expected and it's worse in a way I didn't quite expect. Definitely the worst Snyder. Terrible, but really TERRIBLE sxxxxt. Rebel Moon is just a big movie embarrassment.Where did this Zack Snyder get to? Rebel Moon comes across as cheap, cheesy and without a shred of originality. The action is well below average, I expected much more. Rebel Moon fails in story, narrative, tricks, action scenes, cinematography... and I could go on for ten more minutes. Nothing really works here, except maybe the CGI is ok. Let me put this out into the world, I've been channeling for six months. Without a doubt the worst movie of the year. Overall it feels like someone tried to emulate Snyder's directorial style, but failed miserably.

title: I liked it better the first time when it was called A Bugs Life
text: I mean I didn't hate it. I was entertained but cmon. It's part Bugs Life part Magnificent Seven part Dances With Wolves.The visuals are great. Decent cast but the story line is stolen from other moviesI was so distracted figuring out what movie the bits were fun it became comical.Was it horrible?.....no. Was it good???....no. Was I glad I didn't go and pay to see it at the theatre? YES!!!I will be interested in where they take us in part two. I hope we see more backstory as well as some more dialogue that isn't forcedAgain, I'm being critical but I did enjoy the film and Sophia is great in everything.Come on part two don't let me down.

title: Everything you have seen before but not as good
text: It's taken me several sittings to wade through Rebel Moon as it's a firm pile of... well.....you get it.Visually nothing we haven't seen and in fact have seen often. Same re the plot nothing we haven't seen and character wise, well we have seen a lot of these characters over and over.It's like Snyder set out to steal from every single trope and make it worse.I have no doubt there will be a directors cut but this is starting to tell me he can't make a film in the time allocated and sets out to fleece us twice over.It's dull and unoriginal - stealing from seven samurai, rogue one, starship troopers and a host of other better stories.I truly believe he has nothing original to give but I've no doubt they will keep chucking money at him as he talks a good game.I was a fan but that affair is firmly over.

title: What happened, Zack Snyder?
text: Sci-fi Star Wars-like movie. The plot is poor and predictable, acting is average at best and CGI looks cheap.It gets a little bloody, in Snyder's style, but the visuals and photography are quite far from what he has used his fans to.There's practically no character building and it all revolves around a revolution you don't really care much about, as you either don't understand it or you haven't been properly introduced to. Maybe a prequel along the line would make it more enjoyable.I usually enjoy Zack Snyder's movies, but the rebel moon is probably one of the worst I've seen him direct.

title: When you work to a formula you get silly putty
text:
I don't know, maybe the pitch was...
You know the way people like Star Wars?Yeah
And you've seen how successful Viking shows are at the moment?Er, OK
What if we combined them and set a Sci Fi film in a small Viking village.Unfortunately, despite the hype, this is a swing and a massive miss for Netflix and Zack Snyder. It's set up as the start of a multi film franchise but unlike the Star Wars sequels, where I was hoping for the next instalment to repair the damage done by the previous film, I'm not invested in waiting to see if it improves.I really wanted to like this, I love Sci Fi, but it fails on pretty much every layer, formulaic and just plain boring.

title: Enjoy the movie!
text:
Don't listen to the bad reviews,the movie is great,very enjoyable no boring parts. I liked it very much and for a Netflix movie it's brilliant.ok the story has took ideas from other movies but that's not a problem for me. The cgi is high standard most of the acting is acceptable...for us who grew up with star wars nothing will top it ,but it's a nice attempt to build up a new science fiction story..
Cinematography was clearly Snyder movie without the extrems from other of his movies.i didn't like the uniforms of the army.so watch the movie because you will not find easy a Great movie on tv!!!!

title: It's just a big mess 🙃
text:
It's just a big mess 🤔
From the beginning of the movie i try to understand the story and what's happen as the original story . The main theme of the story combined between the star war and lord of the rings . The performance of the main character isn't perfect . The CGI isn't great enough as the fantasy movie . The last movies of Zack Snider wasn't great enough to be good movies because he is good director not writer . The ending didn't tell if the next part of the movie worth the waiting . One of the worst scenes in the movie is the action because the slow Motion make it boring and weak as action scenes .

title: A Bug's Life... in space
text: Flick, I mean Kora goes to find help to save the village, before the locusts, no sorry the Imperium returns to gather the 'food!' She enlists the help of warriors, unfortunately it seems they're turning out to be nothing more than a circus act.I'm really sorry. I'm not a director, or actor, but, I am a Sci-Fi fan. Have been since i was a teenager reading 2000A. D. And Asimov, and Aldiss and all the other glorious writers. Surely there is someone out there that can write something that doesn't insult the adult audience, or just simply doesn't appeal only to 11 year old's?I waited for this since the hype machine started, but sadly, like so many other things, it just can't live up to the promises. Will the Creator be any better? Are we getting to the point where nothing can be in the least bit original, entertaining, emotional etc.? The acting is, as some have said, on the wooden side. I'm surprised Clive Owen isn't in it, he'd fit right in!What amazes me, is that the people who green light this, sat through a screening and go 'hell yeah! That was awesome!' In parts I actually laughed out loud, it was so dreadful... Sad times indeed. Why not just watch Rogue One, or the Andor series, Blade Runner, or Alien or the great Sci-Fi films and try and learn? They might get an idea of something much better... I'm left wondering how I could have spent my 2 hours more productively... probably just cleaning cat hairs from my carpets.

title: Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire
text: Anyone remember "Battle Beyond the Stars" (1980)? Well this is a sort of hybrid of that and the "Magnificent Seven" that is quite impressive to look at, but that's about the height of it. A political assassinations has destabilised the kingdom and so "General Noble" (Ed Skrein) is off in his Dreadnought to terrorise the inter-planetary population. He arrives on a peaceful agrarian planet, kills the town father and declares that he'll be back in ten weeks to collect their harvest of grain. Panic sets in, especially when the guards he leaves behind try to force themselves on a villager and they encounter the wrath of "Kora" (Sofia Boutella). She's pretty nimble with her weaponry (so we just know there's a story here somewhere) and also manages to convince the town wimp "Gunnar" (Michael Huisman) that they must set off to recruit some help they can use to thwart the destruction of their livelihoods by "Noble". What we have now are a series predicable, set-piece, escapades as gradually they assemble a disparate band of rogues and criminals who might just want to take on the general in an hopelessly one-sided contest. You might detect the voice of Sir Anthony Hopkins ("Jimmy") and Charlie Hunnam sports a variable Irish accent as the famed "Kai" as this follows extremely well trammelled lines of adventure mixed with romance, political intrigue and some whizzo special effects. The denouement is straight out of "Attack of the Clones" (2002) and sets us up for a second instalment that you could probably just about map out now. I like the genre and I didn't hate the film, but it's disappointingly derivative and - well, you've just seen it all before.

title: A visual story, that doesn't bring anything new to the table
text: I was very excited to see this. I was engaged the whole movie waiting for good fight scenes, Sofia/ Kora is amazing but was not really allowed to showcase her fighting skills, too many cuts. Ed Skrein is quite devious and ruthless, the other cast of "rebels" are extraordinary actors but again aren't given a chance to shine. The worlds are beautiful and cinematic. I feel some scenes were thrown in just for filler without a good reason why it was needed. If it doesn't add to the story is it necessary? I definitely suggest you watch it yourself and form your own opinion. You may like it or you may see similarities between this and Seven Samurai, Star Wars, and Dune to name a few. I will watch the second film because it's offered free on Netflix. I would not go to see this in theaters and pay. Whomp whomp.

title: Like watching a trailer - all action and no coherent story or characters
text: There is no character building or motivation at all here. Characters are just found (quite easily seeing as they are wanted fugitives), have a visually impressive "end level boss" fight and agree to a suicide mission with someone they have never met before. You barely know their names let alone care what happens to them!Throw in a twist you see a mile off and is unsurprising as everyone seems to trust each other implicitly straight away and a half-hearted potential love story and we're done.Story is familiar but could be good and the action is well shot but it's just so soulless and rushed.

title: Derivative and episodic, but moderately engaging
text: I was really looking forward to watching this. The early trailers showed some spectacular scenes and I expected a film that built on those. Instead I got a film that filled in the gaps between those scenes with a highly derivative and unoriginal storyline.Basically this is a combination of The Magnificent Seven and Star Wars, plus a few ideas from Avatar and elsewhere.So I was very disappointed as I realised this would fail to meet my high expectations. But that does not make this a bad film necessarily. Gradually I rose above my disappointment to accept that it's not all bad. The characters are of some interest and the action is moderately engaging. I believe I will even watch the sequel coming out in April. Perhaps now we are beyond the episodic assembling of different characters we will get a more propulsive film. Let's hope so.

title: Sooooooooo bad
text: It is a really really waste of time. A failure of everything.What the hell is wrong with writers ??IT IS BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORING.And the acting was poor. There is nothing interesting in it.Believe me, I'd rather watch the first 3 Star wars over and over and over again than this failure of a movie.The rhythm of the action is so slow.Nothing interesting to keep us in alert.Nothing good to have an impressive audience. Not even the robots.We are evolving not going backwards and our expectations regarding entertainment are higher than 50 years ago.I will never ever see the rest of it. Thank God I was watching it from home, not somewhere where I should pay to watch.

title: Rebel Moon - The real Clone Wars
text: I just watched Rebel Moon. It is the real Clone Wars. Everything in it is a clone of something else. Mostly, it's Star Wars with the darkness of Blade Runner. The main characters are a Princess Leah, a Han Solo (a clone of Hugh Jackman), a handsome version of Darth Vader and, of course, an evil emperor. The monsters look like they were designed by Ray Harryhausen. There is the evil empire from Star Wars and Dune and, of course, a rebellion. When the Jedi warrior took out her light sabers I had to laugh. There was a Millenium Falcon, and all the spaceships looked like U-Boats.It starts out on an Irish version of Tatooine. It moves to a city out of Blade Runner. There is a battle for the Death Star. There is the battle between Luke and Darth Vader, only this time Luke wins. Finally, the Fellowship of the Ring rides off into the distance waiting for the next part of the trilogy.

title: Dumb from the get-go
text: In this sci-fi outing penned by Zack Snyder, Kurt Johnstad and Shay Hatten, we begin with a premise that a space-faring civilization heads into the stars to squeeze resources from subsistence farmers inhabiting a far-flung moon. These subsistence farmers literally scrabble in the dirt and scatter seed. No hydro or aeroponics, no industrial-scale food production, nothing. Either the villains are the dumbest villains in the multiverse, or the scriptwriters are the dumbest writers in the history of sci-fi. We think both possibilities are likely.From the botched premise on, this film never improves in quality. Did we mention it's also quite boring? Lucasfilm rejected the original pitch for REBEL MOON years ago, perhaps with concerns for those same reasons listed above. Zack Snyder disagreed, obviously. Unfortunately, Netflix footed the bill for proving Lucasfilm right.

title: RebelMoon is strong and shining 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
text:
It's an extraordinary warp-speed journey; Snyder's visuals are mind-blowing, jaw-dropping - a cosmic spectacle 💯. Narratively, it ties mythology, sci-fi, and human resilience.
