All the cast members owned their space, @Junkie_XL is a sonic boom of excellence; his music elevates every emotion and has a lot of banger soundtracks. Fight choreography is one of the best of the year. RebelMoon lore is pure and crazy. Director's cut and part 2 are going to be even crazier ✅
RebelMoon" isn't just a movie; it's a cinematic revolution! Snyder's dedication, a stellar cast, and a universe that defies limits make this a masterpiece that demands celebration.

title: Cartoonishly Bad!
text: This one is safe to skip!Zach Snyder's UHD Netflix flick for the holiday season is cartoonishly bad!A déjà vu good-versus-bad story with a female worrier taking revenge against an evil empire to protect her hard-working village ...The world's design and story are highly improvised and inspired by movies such as Battle Beyond the Stars, Star Wars, and John Carter.The movie was originally rejected by Lucas Films and didn't secure proper studio financing, hence the streaming production and commitment for a sequel. So this is Part 1 of a non-relevant saga.The $166 mio budget was masterfully wasted on some insulting CGI and a childish and unoriginal script: The Matrix-inspired slow-motion action scenes won't save the bad storytelling, simplistic dialogues, poor acting, and lack of depth for the characters.It scored 23% on Rotten Tomatoes and on IMDb it qualifies for a solid 4/10 rating, considering the waste of money.Remember District 9? That was produced with a $30 mio budget grossing $210 mio worldwide.This movie will do the opposite!

title: Meh
text: I was really hoping for something spectacular, new, bold, a change for the better. Well, I got meh. It's not bad by any means. It is definitely not great either. It's a decent science fiction film with an all too familiar premise that will keep you somewhat entertained for a couple of hours. The locations are done well from a distance but the movie bounces from one place to another you never get to enjoy the different worlds that are visited. Some of the characters really have no reason for being in the film. There is zero comedy. I mean zero. Maybe a smirk or two but that's it. Way too many slow motion scenes that don't make sense. I mean way too many. Quite a few eye roll moments. The scene at the end that brings down the ship is a huge eye rolling moment. If it is that easy to bring down that size of ship, pretty sure the rebels could win with some sling shots and arrows. But I was entertained for the most part. This borrows from many sci if movies so don't expect anything too earth shattering. Maybe part two will improve but knowing Zach he will do what he does, all he knows how to, the same thing, over and over and over.....

title: I've seen better, but also a lot worse
text: Sci-fi movies have pretty much run their course for story lines. This one is no different. Rebel Moon does suffer a bit from predictability. Let's just accept it. Putting this aside though, Sophia Boutella does a fine job as a warrior goddess (e.g., hot, sexy, athletic, mysterious, etc., all the things we come to expect from a warrior hero). Some people have complained about the slow motion elements of the fight scenes. I don't really mind. After The Matrix series of movies this cinematic style has been used a ton of times. No reason to hammer Rebel Moon for doing the same thing. The quality of special effects fall inline with what I'd expect from a feature movie. The supporting cast is solid. Overall I can't fault this movie for any egregious errors. The only downside is that you can see early on how certain story lines will develop.

title: Just cause critics hate this doesn't mean it's good...
text: A mess of a movie. It has some good ideas but the screenplay seems to be like a first draft with Snyder just jotting down random ideas but never fleshing them out with rewrites or editing, so nothing connects emotionally. Visually it looks ugly. It's dark and dingy... Some designs are cool but it just looks like brown sludge most of the time. The acting is all pretty wooden. The dialogue is cringey. The slow motion in the action is also corny... The slow motion doesn't happen in exciting moments to amplify their effect, it happens at the most random and anti climactic moments and it just looks stupid. This is not a good movie and an R rated version won't save most of the problems mentioned here.

title: Zach Snyder's Star Wars movie is The Magnificent Seven in space
text: Not as bad as I was expecting. Nowhere as good as I was hoping. Slightly better than meh. Director/Co-Writer Zach Snyder (DAWN OF THE DEAD, SUCKER PUNCH, MAN OF STEEL) originally pitched this to Lucasfilms as a new Star Wars trilogy, but when they declined, Netflix took him up and produced this lavish space opera, telling the story of a small farming village on the outskirts of the galaxy coming under the heel of a fascist high tech galactic empire. When the villagers decline help the empire (here called the Imperium) they are told they will return at the end of the season, take all of their crops, and leave them to perish. That's pretty much the same set up as THE SEVEN SAMURAI, THE MAGNIFICENT SEVEN , and even Roger Corman's excellent Star Wars knockoff BATTLE BEYOND THE STARS (which a young James Cameron did the special effects for). A young village woman, who turns out to be a former high ranking Imperium soldier hiding out after betraying them, goes on a mission to find mercenaries to help the villagers fight the Imperium. This sets in motion a set of vignettes, just as the earlier mentioned films did, where each warrior gets their scenes to show off their skills before being asked to help the village. Snyder as a director doesn't seem to bring much original to his material in therms of story, plot, or character, which is certainly true here, but he does have a strong visual flare he brings to all of his films, so they're never boring to look at, even if the materials is rather tepid. I'll be curious to see where this story goes following this film and plan to watch Part Two when it comes out, but I doubt REBEL MOON is definitely not going to be the next Star Wars.

title: Why all these bad reviews
text:
I don't get why everyone is hating this?There have been so much more worse sci-fi over the past 20 years yet this got so much bad repDoesn't anyone remember the quality of the first alien movies or even Star Trek?Haven't we come a long way?I thought this was visually stunning and the fight scenes were quite well done.Beautiful background and composition of unique creatures
Gives me men in black vibes but more action packed!!You can't make everyone happy
But I honestly feel like people hated this just for the sake of hating (haters gonna hate)
Cinema has come a long way
Obviously all these movies aren't real nor are they ment to be.

title: Even with the shirt and tie they don't get it
text: The reviews are hilarious. People complaining about the pure archetypicality. Pure comedy. Amazing so many people can miss the point. And it's professionally made. Awesome. Perfect stoner movie, which means lots of people now.Each character being a very clear, even cookie cutter, archetype allows the movie to show off all of the amazing qualities it was going for, without the need to build a story or have the audience get to know and care for the characters you can travel huge distances in the world you've created, One minute it's a futuristic wild west saloon with brain controlling tentacle aliens, the next huge floating monoliths light from behind by the moon while walking among a civilization that has grown for tens of thousands of years, you can ignore the fact it's a movie and bring the audience into the world you've created.

title: Great VFX, but worn out story and lazy writing
text: To begin on the positive side: the VFX are topnotch, from alien creatures to galactic worlds to epic spaceship-battles: it's all awesomely done and totally convincing. The score is great, and some of the actors are a real treat for the eye, be it Sofia Boutella as beautiful main character Kora, or some of the impressively built male characters (like Dijon Hounsou and Stan Nair).But then my reservations. The story feels like we've seen it a dozen times before in this kind of epic galactic scifi movies: yet another universe with a dictatorial repressive central regime; myriads of downtrodden and exploited common people; and from the latter the rise of a resistance under the banner of some heroic messiah-like leader. It's Starwars, Dune and Foundation (to just name a few) all put in a blender.The writing felt lazy: by using a voice-over at the start of the movie I had within 5 minutes the impression that I had missed a prequel or an episode 0, pulling me into an already fast riding train. The search for the right resistance team-members felt rushed, skipping from one weird world to the next, giving the various characters hardly any depth or even motivation for their willingness to come along. The result is a succession of short anecdotical scenes without real substance.As to the acting: Sofia Boutella constantly has to keep up an almost frozen attitude, so there's hardly any room for her to shine; and Michiel Huisman sure has more potential than this role of a non-descript hanger-on. Ed Skrein does a good job as the (almost caricaturally) sadistic Atticus, but the rest of the cast is just adequate.Another annoying thing: the potentially interesting fighting scenes are all afflicted by a weird whim of the director, to vary within one scene from regular motion to slow, to slower than slow, and back to regular motion again. Who do you think to please with such mannerisms?!Anyway, maybe (as with the disappointing first episode of the new "Dune") this Part One mainly acts as an overture to the Real Thing in the expected Part Two. We'll wait and see, but for now I have my doubts.

title: Many air to the top
text: Well, what can you say about "Rebel Moon"... Difficult... Because the movie is relatively entertaining and amusing, but by no means the smash hit you'd expect when Zack Snyder is at the helm.The story and everything around it is not very original. In fact, the screenwriters and Snyder have brazenly and cheekily borrowed from numerous SF and fantasy originals and even the 7 Ronins. And they don't even conceal it. Which of course makes everything somewhat predictable. But on the other hand: well stolen is half the battle. And it's still fun to watch.The movie is peppered with numerous stars, but (if you disregard Anthony Hopkins as Jimmy's voice) not stars of the absolute top league. More like the second division. Nonetheless, this second guard does their job quite well, even if they perhaps take themselves a little too seriously.So far, the movie has earned a 6 thanks to its entertainment value. I think that with the various loose ends that the first part left behind, there is still a lot to get out of the second part. There is certainly enough air to the top. Let's give it a second chance. But this second chance has to work....

title: You've seen this film before
text:
So there may be some comfort in that for others. Perhaps it's a homage to the films that influenced Rebel Moon.......but every time that happened to me I looked away from the screen. For me it became a game of spot the influence:
Destroyer of worlds - Thanos."Daughter" taken from a destroyed world - Thanos and Gamora.Tarak - if you think that Tarak sounds like a Dothraki then you'd be correct, because he played Qhono in GOT.The list goes on, you'll see that in the other reviews and because of that I generally found it a bit bland. I was quite hopeful for the bot storyline which may come in P2 and though that also feels quite predictable I was excited for it. Sci-fi and fantasy are generally my go to films for a bit of escapism but the familiarity of this storyline led me to turn to my phone, and every time I looked back at the screen I didn't feel like I had missed anything important.

title: Really bad movie!
text: Like others have mentioned,,the plot is awful and the the movie is just plain boring! The dialogue is lazy, the storyline unoriginal and most action sequences leave a lot to be desired. Felt like things were just all over the place all the time with very little character building. Love most of these actors and the genre so was really excited to watch this. In the end, I was really disappointed with the finished product as it seemed like the whole thing was just thrown together without much thought behind it. With that said, prob won't waste my time on the second or recommend it to anyone bc I can't take another two hours of that!

title: Star Studded Cast Let Down By Awful Direction & Writing
text: So the casting for this is fantastic, most of the actors play their part well. The characters you're not supposed to like, you don't like, the ones who you should like come off as (relatively) likable. And there are some truly amazing actors in this movie. The actors who fall down perhaps are getting bad direction, which is a shame.But the movie seems like a weird amalgamation of stuff from Warhammer 40,000, and other sources, et cetera et cetera. Neat ideas that, when forced together by an inept writer, come off very poorly. Coupled with that, the movie engages in a lot of flip-flopping on "tell, don't show" (the main character's backstory is a five minute infodump of stuff that could've been introduced as small details, and that you find your eyes glazing over at) or "show, don't tell" (such as Tarak's introduction, which is a five minute montage of physical prowess that your eyes will glaze over at).And, of course, we have a lot of very tired, over-used tropes. It reads like someone's bad D&D/Warhammer 40k campaign brought to the screen.

title: Had everything to be better
text:
First part of the movie was good, normal speed, was nice... but then seems they rushed the 2/3 part of the movie I was a start to be a bit lost.. why they were on that planet, how they arrive to that person and so on...I was expecting something better...I think they abused the slow motion a bit.. they could remove most of them and with saved time put more effort in adding more argument into the movie...Although the effects/fx was good...
But the interiors of the ships seems very old, I almost make me remember the old TVs and green computer monitors...Just hope they keep the best part of the story in the 2nd and 3rd sequel of the movie...

title: This is so so bad
text: I just wasted 2 hours of my life on this movie. 80% of the movie is slo-mo for lack of a better story. You never know if it's star wars that you are watching, matrix, dune or some cut if the zack snyder batman movies.The characters are very empty, too bad they used a few good actors and gave nothing to work with. The story has a very thin plot with a lot of wholes. It keeps jumping from place to place and time and time again. It drags on in a boring a meaningless fashion.Also, the main idea of this movie is to find general Titus, bur the fill up 1 hour of this movie with side quests of getting other warriors onboard. It fees like a video game story more than a movie.

title: The pieces are there, but...
text: I can see why people don't like Snyder films, but I think I have a soft spot for Snyder films. I've enjoyed almost all of his films and this film is no exception. However, Rebel Moon definitely has its issues that bring it down from what could have been a great movie.We just didn't get too spend a lot of time with any of the characters except for the two leads. Everyone had interesting backstories, but we barely got to dive into any of them and didn't get to see much party banter. The amount of characters in the main party should have been halved to make more room for character moments.Also the structure of the story is a bit boring for the middle section. It's just speed running through new locations and gaining new characters for the party. We don't get to see any traveling and little to no time for characters to bond which just felt odd to me. Also most of them join way too easily. Literally one character joins after a one minute speech and that's it lmao.I also hated that it didn't really feel like an adventure. We just rush to new locale after new locale and don't get too see any party interaction. That's one thing Star Wars generally does well is build camaraderie with the party. We didn't really get to see anything like except for the two leads.And omg, Snyder over did it with the slow motion. I think this film could have been 15-20 mins shorter if there wasn't so much slow motion, it got annoying after a while!The positives is the beginning and ending that delivered on the setting and world building. I really liked the game village and the final fight. Each had some good character moments. The world and lore of the world is also very fascinating. There is no force in this, but there some magical powers in the world which has me curious.This felt like a film that could have easily been an 8 with some tweaking, but as it stands it's a 6/10 for me. It was an enjoyable watch though and I think the second film can be great now since the party is established.Also in a lot of ways, Jeremy Jahns is right by saying this felt like a (rushed) space JRPG.

title: It´s stupid, just so stupid...
text: Movies don´t need to be realistic, especially not Sci-Fi ones.They don´t need to pay any mind to physics or anything else. The focus is entertainment.But this garbage is so extremely insulting to anyone's intelligence, it´s impossible to watch.There are constantly things happening that are so extremely stupid, they blow your mind.In addition the action scenes try hard to be impressive, but the directing and acting just make them laughable at best.The script writing is obviously awful, the dialogues are extremely dull and there is never a sense of urgency.It simply feels absolutely hollow.

title: First great, then horrible
text: I loved the first 1/3. Graphically fantastic, and a slow movie with a slow plot that kept me on suspense. Loved the mix of fantasy, science fiction and a side dash at Conan the Barbarian. But as soon as our bird guy entered the ship it turned into a horrible mush.One short scene after another with no connection, no depth, heart or soul. It felt as if they realized they run out of time/space, but had still soooo much to tell. So everything was shortened until all depth was gone.Also, the story is on rather weak legs. Cinematography top notch though.If you like a good picture over a good book you can stare 2h at beautiful scenes. Just don't forget to mute after 1/3.I for one will skip the next part of this. If I want shallow entertainment, then Hollywood has plenty else of it nowadays.

title: Big names poor execution
text: Honestly very hard to watch there were no sets with real world locations just closed studios with green screen backdrops. A bunch of big name actors but no direction all the lines felt extremely forced. Never had to fast forward through a movie so much, how much slow motion was in the film? Might be interesting to see the ratio of regular speed to slow mo to understand how much shorter than film would be (how much time they wasted not developing the plot). Get rid of Snyder, find lesser known actors, develop your plot, and leave the studio. I'd like a refund of my wasted time watching this garbage.I would say it has good potential for world building and plot but that's not seen here.

title: It has everything, yet nothing.
text:
For those of you who are looking at the reviews as you watch the movie, let me tell you, this is going to be enlightening.This movie is, at its core, a Wish version of Star Wars. A massive, ruthless governing body harassing the galaxy with awful treatment that spawns a resistance movement. But wait, there's more!There are so many similarities to various parts of history or fictional stories that you simply have to add "Space" in front of them and then it makes sense. Here is a list:Space Viking planet
Space wild west frontier planet with space brothels
Space Irishmen
Space Chinatown
Space France
Space Russia
Space Rome with Space Gladiators
Space Aboriginals with crow-horse
Space Avengers
Space Nazis
Space Jesus (although female)
Space Orcs
Space Monarchy
And many many more....And honestly, outside of the absolute main characters, nobody really does much of anything except disappear when the action starts.The movie's plot is...weak, but it's worth it if you're watching it with people who are willing to make fun of it with you.

title: a movie for the Snyder fans
text: I went into this movie with really low expectations after seeing the abysmal reviews. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. There are certain issues that definitely have merit. For example, the characters that are gathered are never really thrashed out and the final 3rd act feels a little rushed but I'm assuming this will be rectified in the sequel.I've been a fan of most of snyders work (I consider his DC Trilogy a masterpiece so perhaps I am biased.All in all I found this movie quite cool.... IF you're a Snyder fan and enjoy his particular brand of movie making.....a solid 8.3/10 for me.

title: The critics are to uptight and need to embrace the kid inside.
text: It's a fun, visual science fiction joyride. A great escape that fuels every kid in us imagination. I can't wait for the R rated version or Snyder cut. He always delivers a consistent genre of entertainment. As a lover of all science fiction and classics like star-wars, I am glad this is not them and is something different.My suggestion to the critics, stop reviewing ever film like to should be worthy of an award or comparing it to others.I hope this turns into a franchise, I could see Zack Snyder going on to pass the torch of directors and producing other spinoffs.We need more franchises that are new and not the usual inside the box types.

title: Not even so bad it's good
text: If you do manage to get through the entire film you'll struggle to remember a single characters name, why they are involved, what made them get involved and be in slightest bit interested in whether they stay involved or not.Even the first member of the gang just seems to get on board and donate his ship after a 30 second bar room shoot out that follows such a regulation format it's embarrassing.I thought these films are based on novels - they're either very bad books or they decided to remove all character building and story progressing aspects from the film.It looks reasonable but not entirely sure where all the budget went - script writing was definitely bottom of the pile.If you want decent SciFi watch Foundation instead.In fact watch something like Firefly and/or Serenity and you'll get a better story.

title: Bugs life, Star Wars and Dune
text: Don't love it but don't hate it.There are alot of characters in it but none that I really care about which is a shame.It really reminded me of Bugs Life and then I couldn't take it seriously.Visually its amazing as to be expected from a Zack Snyder movie, its just a real shame that there was nothing new within the story line.I so badly wanted to see an amazing new Sci Fi movie but this isn't it. The reviews are mixed and I can understand why.I will still watch part 2 because you have to finish things off and I want to see if ants make the harvest, sorry bugs life again.Definitely worth a watch.

title: Quintessential Snyder
text: "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is quintessentially Zack Snyder, with all the visual flair and bombastic style we've come to expect. The film boasts stunning visuals that transport you to a captivating universe, but it can't shake off the feeling of being somewhat derivative. Snyder's signature style shines through, but the narrative struggles at times with unnatural dialogues that feel forced.Despite its flaws, the movie remains a visual feast, with awe-inspiring cinematography that elevates certain sequences. Fans of Snyder's distinct aesthetic will revel in the spectacle, but those seeking a breakthrough in storytelling might find the film treading familiar ground. It's a rollercoaster of cinematic excitement, though not without its bumps along the way.

title: Epic waste of time
text: After Zack made my dreams come true with superman , I was expecting something at least at the same level .. Very bad writing, I felt sometimes that there is no connection through the movie and the dialogues , and after the half of the movie I was writing this critic ! I the cast is not bad at all , but I was totally disappointed with all the others parts , the screenplay and Ofcourse the continuity of the story . The best part were the 3 last minutes . Please , Zack , make a movie like dc superman and take with you Henry or at least someone that if the script is so bad like this one to reject it .

title: The seemingly random coincidences lend a lack of realism.
text: Even though a promising title with great potential, Zack Snyder tries to compress the foundations of a new franchise in a family-friendly, bloodless action movie. He does not seem to fully accomplish this, as the result seems to be a well-technically structured tale, but one of those narrated to kids. The fact that the protagonists are in the center of destruction or action every time they travel to a new planet, makes it look more like a childish dream rather than a serious sci-fi.In addition, the choice to make it so, in order to appeal to a wider age range is for me inaproppriate, sacrificing the necessary realistic atmosphare.On the other end of the spectrum, the characters involved seem to have great room of evolvement and the story its self seems to have a natural flow, making the audience hold its breath for a sequel. Generally, the great condensation of time makes the director's work demanding and remarkably fragile.

title: Good lord cheez...
text: Started pretty interesting, became predictable and ended with a hugh WTF?Whoever thinks Snyder is a good story teller, has never seen a story told well.I mean, characters borrowed from Dune, Star Trek, Star Wars, Seven Samurai and a dozen other movies.Designs which have been seen... I don't know how often times.This is so ridiculous, that anyone could have thought this will be good.Oh, and the dialogs - if you want to call it that way. An open offence for everyone listening.Some people were already joking AI might have been involved writing the story. This is a pretty fair statement.I really wish, less movies were made, but in a ok quality.This one belongs in the box "Nice try became sh...".I really cannot recommend this "movie".

title: A rushed project with not enough budget
text: Just seen it now ...its a 'nah' for me. Besides the very predictable storyline, and totally not realistic scenes (even for their worlds logic) it seems like this is a project which didn't had enough time nor budget. Some animation/SFX scenes are good and some to the level of Dune (nope, not the recent version, but the original) Can't say more before spoiling anything. If you know you know.Not even talking about the overkill usage of the anamorphic look ...good example how not to use it in my honest opinion.If they had more time and budget I think this film would be much better, but still the story is a bit shallow. But then it would have been at least a nice 'marvel kinda' visual enjoyment.Following Zack Snyder on Vero a while ago and seeing al his Rebel Moon teasers made me having high expectations ..so that may have cause this kinda negative review.

title: What was the point!?
text: I'm a huge sci-fi fan and was very excited to finally see this movie on Netflix. After first 15 minutes into the movie I was bored, confused and convinced I've somehow started some other movie by mistake instead the Rebel Moon. So I started watching again from the beginning thinking maybe I was distracted and missed something...But it wasn't me, dialogues and acting is detached and wooden, too much details yet nothing is happening while it's jumping from one to another topic/role without finishing the first or connecting any. Too much badly slow motion scenes, too much fighting scenes that were not good, no clear or surprising storyline, after 40 minutes I've started skipping scenes and fast forward to come to any breakthrough or point , which unfortunately never happened. All together writing was bad, acting also, music was good but too much of it and not really following the scenes... It feels like they had no idea where this movie is going, just filming all kinds of different stories and unrelated scenes and them just throwing them on the screen one after the other. I have no idea if anyone checked this movie before releasing it but looks worse than some amateur kids playing.

title: Zack Snyder is back!
text: From the opening title sequence, I knew this was going to be an amazing film. The Stone Quarry logo has never looked better! Rebel Moon has a dreamy retro-esque/80s feel to it thanks to Snyder's unique visual style which does allow more freedom for the VFX effects. The lense effect he has created works really well for this movie and gives us some truly incredible shots.For a budget of $80M, I thought part 1 looked incredible. The worlds we visit are beautiful, they look lived in and are populated by many unique & exotic aliens. I'm really excited to see how Snyder will expand on this in the extended cut and Part 2.I'm so happy for Sofia Boutella for her first leading role, she absolutely nailed this, she is Kora and Kora is a badass!! The cast is great, they have fantastic chemistry together. But again, I just can't wait to watch the extended cut to delve deeper into these characters, to spend more time with them and discover more about who they are.The violence was impactful, the fight scenes were awesome and the slowmotion was a welcome Snyder touch. The score was absolutely incredible, Tom Holkenborg is on fire again! The technology in this universe is something really special, it went beyond my expectations! I did think RM could have been 20 minutes longer though, just to let some scenes breathe a little and maybe extend some others.The elephant in the room... Star Wars. Tbh I'm so glad this movie isn't a Star Wars story, Rebel Moon is it's own thing and it is carving it's own path. I love the influence Star Wars has had on it but it's no more than the influence of Seven Samurai & Heavy Metal and when the R Rated cut drops it will increase the divide from SW even further.Overall Rebel Moon: Part 1: A Child Of Fire is a fantastic entry into a brand new franchise with a rich universe full of interesting characters and deep lore that I am excited to explored further. Snyder has created something truly unique here and I can't wait to see what more Rebel Moon has to offer.

title: Can anyone name a SciFi movie that they did NOT copy from?
text: Can anyone name a SciFi movie that they did NOT copy from?Here a few examples: Star Wars (all of them), Rogue One, The Matrix, The Expanse, Blade Runner, The Ghost in the Shell, The Fifth Element, Dune (both of them), Avatar (ditto), Mad Max (ditto), and last but not least Serenity. And do not even mention the non SciFi movie greats: The Seven Samurai and/or its derivative The Magnificent Seven.Notwithstanding the above near plagiarism, (or therefore), I found it a very entertaining movie. It has plenty of evil villains with British accents, and "women who kick ass" -- think Ellen Ripley, River Tan, Sarah Connor, Major Killian, to name a few. Great fun!

title: Just okay mid-2000s CGI sludge. I honestly don't know what I just watched.
text: So here's the story with this movie, about 10 years ago, Zack Snyder went to Lucasfilm with a pitch for a Seven Samurai style Star Wars movie. Snyder laid out the pitch, Lucasfilm said "Yeah no thanks".Then the brain trust out at Netflix said "Hey, we'll take it", so they switch some names around and voila, you've got a straight to streaming Zack Snyder's Star Wars movie.The Good: There are some cool visual elements here. Some cool shots and fight sequences exist, but that's about it.The Okay: some of the characters are fun to watch. Sometimes Ray Fisher makes some interesting choices and hey Tony Hopkins shows up as a robot, so that was cool. Sofia Boutella. She looks incredible and proves that she's a legitimate action hero.Everything: screen play is nonsensical and worthless, later in the movie a lot of the green screen and VFX devolve into CGI sludge. At times you kind of can't tell what's taking place.If you're bored and you want to have a couple of beers and watch some whiz-bang for a couple of hours then hey, there you go.

title: Imaginative art direction, but....
text: What do the Wizard of Oz, The Lord of the Rings, Rebel Moon and virtually every saga ever put on a screen? You know the answer.The plucky but reluctant hero collects fellow adventurers like the underside of my bed collects dust bunnies.No trope is left unemployed. The backstory of trying to leave a violent past and live a pastoral life until danger comes to call. The rascal who Hans Soloes from a morally ambiguous opportunist into a heroic leader (or does he?). The jackbooted, self indulgent, sadist, willing to destroy a planet to make a point. The utter disregard for physics and the fact that in space you can't hear rockets and things going boom! Oh, yes, there's the Seven Samurai/Magnificent Seven/The Three Amigos plot of a poor village needed warriors to defend it. Oh, and a hot Asian woman with swords.But it does have Anthony Hopkins as a robot's voice. So it has that going for it.

title: Hooray diverse casting!
text: I love a good high fantasy movie, and this one pleasantly surprised me. First and foremost, this is the first film in awhile where I thought to myself, "look at how easily they built a diverse cast! Why is it so hard for others?"I will admit, not much of this film struck me as "original". But that didn't keep me from enjoying it! I really enjoyed watching the character interactions, and the exposition isn't riveting but it works well enough. I think this first movie (I hope) is just setting the stage for more action, more intense conflict, and more investment in the characters and plot. Introducing a big cast and having each person feel unique and alive is difficult, but I think RMP1 did a good job at it.Overall, if you're a fantasy connoisseur, you could skip this. If you're a more casual fan, and get really attached to characters, I think this would be a good watch for you.

title: This movie make the worst Star Wars part a masterpiece
text: I really suffered through umyje 2 hours and 15 minutes. Where I suffered the most were the slow motions that are annoying and useless. They made probably the whole movie in one go, and then decided to add a lot of slow motions to create two parts out of it.The special effects are sometimes at a level of late 90ties film, not mentioning about a crap acting that calls for the use of AI that would probably make a better job.Only the initial part in the village is interesting. Ok... there are a lot in common with Star Wars but we are introduced a plot like from the Magnificent Seven, just jn space and with much weaker acting.Waste of time!

title: Star Wars x GOT x Matrix
text: I agree with the other reviews in terms of content. I do not agree with the ridiculously low ratings.There's some interesting ideas and some scenes are beautifully apocalyptic. It's eye candy all the time, though they could have taken a chill pill on the slowmo. The story is interesting and the acting is good. There's some issues with the script though. Like others said, a lot of sentences are weirdly written but not to the point that it irritates me. I loved the atmosphere/vibe of this movie. A new mashup universe of Star Wars, GOT and the Matrix was created and I think it's a great base for sequel(s).I'm not a professional in moviemaking but I can't wrap my head around these ratings. How a cringefest like Stranger Things gets an 8.9 while this gets a 5.7 is beyond me. Is it perfect? Absolutely not. It's not even great. But to me it was an entertaining, unexpected surprise on my netflix account.

title: Sci-fi cliche bingo anyone ?
text: Surely there have to be some more original story lines for a sci-fi opera?Others have already commented how derivative of other sci-fi franchises this movie is, to the point of being comical.In fact funniest thing of all was the outfit of the English (of course) baddie general who dressed like inspector Blakey from "on the buses".So let's do a checklist:I could go on.....but I just can't be bothered. It's watchable ....just ....if no other reason than to spot all the cliches.

title: I spent more time writing this review than watching it
text: In reflecting upon the succinct yet ostensibly significant three-minute investment by Netflix in this cinematic undertaking, pivotal inquiries arise regarding the very essence of its content. Does the possession of visual elements alone suffice to elevate it to the echelons of profound cinematic art, or is there an imperative for a narrative depth that authentically engages the audience?The opening sequence, featuring Anthony Hopkins' exposition-laden voice-over, beckons an assessment of its efficacy. Does this approach effectively captivate the audience, or does it risk consigning crucial details to the recesses of forgetfulness? Can the pronounced emphasis on names, places, and temporal intricacies be perceived as compensatory for narrative shortcomings, thereby limiting the audience's immersive experience?Broader scrutiny of contemporary entertainment prompts consideration of the prevailing dichotomy between depth and superficiality in narrative execution. Are discerning viewers increasingly confronted with a dearth of substance beneath the veneer of cinematic experiences? Is the intrinsic nature of entertainment evolving toward narratives that pivot on experiential engagement rather than reliance on mere exposition?The scrutiny extends to the directorial prowess of ZS, prompting a re-evaluation of his acclaimed credentials. Does the absence of compelling storytelling in this instance cast a shadow on his perceived abilities? Is the laudable exception, 'Day of the Dead,' more indicative of collaborative success than the sole merit of the director?Turning attention to Netflix's role as an arbiter of content, questions emerge regarding the platform's pursuit and discernment. Does the platform's voracious appetite compromise qualitative considerations? Is there an apparent indifference to nuances that differentiate mere visual stimulation from genuine artistic expression?In conclusion, the plea for ZS to contemplate an exit from the industry is juxtaposed with the metaphorical image of a sunlit deck chair-a symbol of respite from the demands of the cinematic milieu. The assertion that 'no one will miss' is presented as a contemplative acknowledgement, suggesting a detachment from the film maker's contributions and a recognition of the industry's potential evolution beyond his influence.

title: What else did you expect?
text: Yes, the plot was propably written by an AI that was told to pick out good scenes from blockbusters put them all together and make a credible story out of them , and it did. From Harry Potter, to Star Wars. So, yes, nothing new, a little predictable, but the CGI, albeit not of the same level of Lucas Arts is impressive and the action scenes of which there are many, are great. Both on the ground and in space. It could be a little shorter since it´s the first part of a saga, but all in all it´s a very entertaining science fiction/ fantasy movie. Good cast, interesting characters and come on, it´s a Netfflix movie. I myself am looking for the sequence. Don´t listen to the haters!

title: The farmer...
text: "Rebel Moon" is a visually striking entry into the sci-fi genre, boasting impressive graphics that transport viewers into its vividly crafted world. The storyline progresses at a brisk pace, which, while keeping the excitement up, can sometimes feel a bit rushed. The film is a thrill ride of action and battle scenes that are sure to entertain fans of high-octane cinema. The cast delivers mostly strong performances, bringing depth and intensity to their roles. However, the portrayal of the farmer character leaves something to be desired and detracts slightly from an otherwise stellar ensemble. Overall, "Rebel Moon" is a commendable film, and with a bit more character development, especially for the farmer, it could rise to new heights. Definitely worth watching for its visual spectacle and energetic action sequences!

title: I liked it
text: I've been a Star Wars fan for most of my life, so I can see why some fans and viewers are a little annoyed by this movie seemingly being a carbon copy of modern day Star Wars. I have not been a fan of Disney's acquisition and destruction of such a beloved franchise with the most recent trilogy. Apparently neither was Snyder. He said in an interview that he wanted to make a Star Wars trilogy but the Disney execs shunned his pitch. So, he decided to make his own "Star Wars" film. This film has elements of Star Wars in it obviously with the "laser swords" and the ships going into space. But it also reminds me of the Chronicles of Riddick, Flash Gordon, and Serenity. I guess I consider it a nice substitute to a troubled Star Wars franchise and I'm perfectly okay with that. With that being said, the reason for my score and why I didn't rank it higher was because some of the fight sequences were not as fluid as I would have liked. Lighting and CGI was great and I really liked the brutality of the bad guy. Dialog between protagonists was a little boring at times and some scenes I feel could have been left out to help with the progression of the movie but overall I think Snyder did an impressive job under the circumstances. Solid 7/10.

title: Draft of a screenplay
text: 1. Draft of a screenplay where someone forgot to put flesh on these bare (but exaggeratedly beautiful) bones.2. Beautiful scaffolding where the walls of the building have not been erected yet.3. Characters are dehumanised, overdrawn archetypes that were created using check boxes.4. Movie is full of empty pathos feeling reminding me of communistic monuments in USSR.5. Mundane scenes shown like Dicaprio drowning in Titanic.6. Story is unrealistic and full of absurds; we see spaceships reaping through fabric of space and in the next scene we see a vikings-like village, a woman ploughing a field using horse-pulled plough but they do have an automatic sliding doors.AND THAT'S JUST THE FIRST 20 MINUTES OF THE MOVIE.

title: Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire
text: Zack Snyder is an interesting divisive figure. Like Dutch director Paul Verhoeven, he uses right wing themes and subverts them. Unfortunately unlike Verhoeven, his work lacks the black humour that is needed.Snyder acquired a right wing fan base for his blockbuster hit 300. However anyone who knows anything about graphic book author Alan Moore,a left wing Anarchist. Snyder made a rather faithful adaptation of Watchmen.Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire has Netflix backing. It has been said this is Snyder's attempt to create a Star Wars type universe.It basically is The Seven Samurai. It self remade by Hollywood as The Magnificent Seven. Later remade by B movie maestro Roger Corman as Battle Beyond the Stars.Admiral Atticus Noble (Ed Skrein) of the militaristic Imperium arrives on the backwater moon of Veldt. He warmly embraces the village head offers to buy the surplus grain of these agrarian villagers. Noble then kills their head when he is perceived to be lying.Noble would arrive in 10 weeks time and wants the bulk of the harvest even it means the villagers would be left starving.Kora (Sofia Boutella) has her own backstory with the Imperium. She warns the villagers they will either starve to death or be massacred by the Imperium. Kora and a villager called Gunnar depart for the port town of Providence to recruit warriors to defend them.Like Starship Troopers when a major character later wore a Nazi uniform and the audience seemed not to have noticed. Noble arrives wearing one from nhis grand entrance. A sign that the interstellar empire of the Motherworld are not the good guys. This is reinforced when some of the Imperium soldiers left behind are nasty white guys with South African accents. A nod back to the country's Apartheid era.Snyder does not do subtle and with a female action lead. This was always going to turn off part of the audience just like the Daisy Ridley led Star Wars sequel trilogy.Although there is a longer Director's Cut of this movie due. Rebel Moon - Part One could had done with being shorter and snappier. It needed more humour but I found it entertaining enough.

title: The CGI is worse than the rip-off story line
text: I won't repeat what others said about poor story, acting, etc ... They are right. And I'm ok with movies that are supposed to be cheesey, such as the Fast and Furious franchise. But this... Is just bad.The CGI in the opening scene is so bad we thought it was done purposely bc it was going to be a play being done within the movie. Nope. It was the actual movie. Did I say terrible CGI?So many top actors and they can't come up with a shred of uniqueness? The bad guys: dressed like Nazis. They should have taken it a step further and called them Storm Troopers. Oh, and they even have light sabers! Oh, and a robot that looks nearly identical to CP-30! Too good!

title: Very very boring
text: Oh man. Good god. That was my reaction several times throughout this film, and not in a good way.Within the first minute I was already dreading it, as the opening narration mentioned some generic ruling star empire where "a thousand kings ruled uninterrupted", which is a lot like a chain-smoking fat man with a drinking problem saying he's going to live to be 150. Or maybe it's just being cheeky and there were actually hundreds of kings ruling over the course of a couple of years, being constantly deposed or assassinated every few days.This bothered me because this felt like a lazy foundation from which to start a whole new science fiction universe, and my feeling was correct.This movie spends its first hour just on worldbuilding, except that the world it's building is bland and boring. This could easily be transplanted into Star Wars or Warhammer or any other major franchise and almost nothing would have to be changed. And this isn't in a good "timeless classic" way like the story of Seven Samurai (an obvious inspiration) is.Instead it's because the story's setting is so empty it's like a blank scifi RPG template was picked and Zack Snyder never actually bothered to fill out any of the details.There's tons of comparisons made by reviewers to Star Wars, and the knowledge that apparently this was originally meant to be a Star Wars film that Disney passed on (a rare Disney W). Any resemblance to Star Wars is purely superficial; there's almost nothing here.The original "Star Wars" had a similar initial setup of a big evil empire and a plucky band of rebels building up a resistance against them. As well, it had many different things and people happening around it, references made to things, people, and events that clearly were important to the world we were seeing, like Obi-Wan, the Clone Wars, the Jedi being defenders of the Republic, the Force, Jabba, the Imperial Senate, all these things were brought up in the very first film and treated with a sense of having some very clear importance to the story as a whole.There's nothing like that here beyond the absolute bare minimum of words to fill it in. The "Imperium" rules from its "Motherworld". They were ruled by kings, then their last king was assassinated and an evil psychopath named Balisarius took over or something. Now they are cartoonishly evil and they literally rape and murder and destroy entire planets for no clear reason. They raped murdered and destroyed Kora's planet and kidnapped her as a kid to raise her as a soldier for the Imperium until she deserted.That's it. That's pretty much the entirety of Rebel Moon's world that it took 45 minutes to set up.Without anything else to it, you'd imagine there would be some interesting characters or wild action scenes to entertain with, but there aren't. Everyone has the same sort of bland flattened affect of an RPG NPC waiting for you to level up enough to unlock their backstory sidequest. Some of them don't even seem to have names until many scenes later when another character mentions their name out loud.None of the action scenes are in any way memorable or exciting, as at best they could be described as shot "functionally", except apparently Zack Snyder's gimmick is random slow motion, there's constant instances where the action will suddenly go into slow motion for no reason.The slow motion didn't bother me as much as it apparently does other people. What did bother me was how the camera kept randomly unfocusing during scenes, blurring for no reason, or suddenly going into a sort of fisheye lens appearance, or one shot of Kora and The Farmer Whose Name I Forgot, where suddenly the Farmer's face started to blur while Kora's remained sharp and in focus.All of this would be laughable if the entire film itself weren't so BORING. Pretty much everyone looks and sounds miserable, even in scenes they're supposed to be feeling triumphant in, and the only actor who seems to be putting any real effort into their work is Ed Skrein, which is somewhat amusing because ten years ago he played Daario Naharis in season 3 of Game of Thrones and then was replaced by Michiel Huisman (also in this film) because supposedly they didn't think his acting skills would've been up to par for what they had planned with Daario later on (which turned out to be mostly nothing).If you told me this was a film that was written, directed, photographed, and edited all by first timers, I would believe you. It has almost no redeeming features unless you are the kind of person who likes looking at flashing lights and sweaty people, in which case there are plenty of other movies that have that that aren't as BORING as this.

title: Zack Snyder without DC
text: For all who just write empty reviews before the movie takes just his first breath this is a real Zack Snyders Scifi movie without DC control. A lot of good characters leading by the always impressive Sophia Boutela. Since im a child i dream about fly to stars and fight to the evil and bad people. In few words, this movie its a Bugs Tale in the space. The situations are identical, the same characters and the same development. I hope all the writers involved reevaluate their writing skills or just go to work in an Oxxo store ( cero of any creativity its necesary). Please just see, enjoy and make a good choice about how your life its happening in front of your eyes.

title: A Bug's Life meets Star Wars
text: I loved the special effects! Like other reviews, I was hoping for a bit more storyline. Not bad, but not great either. The storyline completely resembled that of A Bug's Life. I won't give too much away, but if you know, you know. I saw a lot of Star Wars in there too. I'll definitely be on board to watch the second part. Heck, I'm invested now. I can't quite figure out why there is a minimum character requirement for posting reviews. If your review is value-added, why does it have to be a certain length? There, I said it. Now I think it's long enough to qualify for posting, as long as it doesn't get deleted for questioning the authorities.

title: Melodramatic hot air balloon
text: When you read the comments: "Oh It's like (Star Wars, Dune, Seven Samurai, *Insert other ACTUALLY original title*)" don't be fooled by these proletariat of film reviewers.This flatulent, thrice fried in Chinese gutter oil, cat-food-patty-burger, is designed to entertain zoomers in between watching tiktok videos.Featuring a lepton-thin plot, a cast as inspiring as the average DMV desk jockey, and a world with the originality of a Mall Santa Clause. The only thing going for this movie is that it will definitely apease all minorities that might otherwise be offended by actual masterpieces of film, as inclusiveness seems to be top of mind, if anything.The only way I'll finish watching this limp wristed attempt at a scifi epic, is when it is given the Double Sided, Mystery Science Theater 3000, Requiem for a dream style treatment.

title: Looks cool, no heart, drags on... ends.
text: I'm not going to compare this to Star Wars or Seven Samurai or anything else. At this point in cinema history everything can be compared to something already done and it's unfair, so let's just look at Rebel Moon in isolation.Firstly, it looks cool and there has been a lot of effort put in to that end, so we'll done on that. Unfortunately party of the attempt to look cool is doing endless slo motion of things that really don't require it to add to the spectacle. Jumping on to the griffin thing, great! Only happens once so let's give it a sweet slow mo. Every other time a gun gets fired? Nope, seen it a million times, adds nothing to the scene, just let it run. There is likely more spectacle in a well choreographed fight scene at full speed than drawing out a 20 second fight to 2 minutes by slowing everything down. That time spent in slow mo could have been used for something important, which brings me to my next point...Character Development, it's not just a term to make people sound clever in reviews, it's there to make you care for the character, in a positive or negative light. That way when the good guy succeeds you feel joy along with them, when the bad guy gets beaten you enjoy it maybe a little too much but hey, we are all human. If you don't develop characters to have history and feelings and values then we end up with a long collections of people just passing through, and that is what happened here unfortunately. There are attempts to make characters appear noble by giving them the Braveheart moment, but without earning that moment it feels hollowed and is easily dismissed with no emotional impact. It also means when the apparent good guys die there is no impact here either. It's tough to care about the life or death of someone who don't know because you haven't been given the chance to, like a fatal car crash on the news, you know it's tragic from a human standpoint, but you are detached from the emotion of it.Making Evil people SUPER EVIL with no reason except for them being part of the evil empire has a similar but inverse effect. I want to care that the bad guy got defeated but it feels more like putting down a rabid animal than defeating a nemesis. It was sort of just an end to a process than a battle of morals or defiance, it just feels empty and lazy. May as well put 2 people in a room and say "that one is good and that one is bad" and expect us to care who wins based on concept rather than emotion.The standard of acting was frankly not of a high calibre. That may be unfair given the level of dialog they had to work with, but you can at least deliver it like you care. The film really could have benefitted from some star power but sadly, no.Lastly the music is epic, but as the scene does not hit the emotional note for an operatic swelling of strings it just feels overblown, like playing the lord of the rings music over a visual of someone parking their car. It happens so often it becomes a parody by the end, well, the end of this part at least.

title: It is one of the movies of all time
text: Critics panned the movie couple of days ago after the limited theatrical release. But then I also saw Zack saying that the R Rated Cut (duh) is a whole other movie. So that added some confusion and a hidden dread. But I watched it anyway, because why not. Action, Sci Fi, Space..I am in.Giant spaceships, ominous shadows, a young hero, a grizzled warrior, excessive use of slo mo. Trademarks of a Snyder film. But, it felt empty and the story segments felt disjointed. The characters are not believable.Star Wars, Harry Potter (Hippogriff), Doctor Who (Rachnoss), Seven Samurai, Wild Wild West and Spaghetti Westerns. Put those in a blender, take out character development/emotions and you get Rebel Moon. Interesting idea, horrific execution.6/10 for the hype. Definitely one of the movies of all time. Have a day.

title: Disappointing as all the ingredients should be there...
text: The cast, design, CGI & budget are all good. But the plot is so derivative the best thing is to play a group game where you point at the screen & shout 'Star Wars' 'Avatar', 'Matrix' 'Gladiator' 'Solo' etc. As you spot the undisguised theft of scenes and ideas. In case you are dumb or drunk one of the underextended cast talks it through every 5 minutes. Sadly it isn't even smart enough to acknowledge the spoof, like Guardians of the Galaxy does so well. The opening set was too close to Norsemen (a comedy) to get away with playing it straight. The character added to please the China market is so painful I had to pop the kettle on. If you liked Serenity, and you've got a bottle of tequila close to hand then have fun. I shall NOT be watching Part2.

title: Battle Beyond the Stars clone is better than what people give it credit for
text: Effectively, it's an updated version of Roger Corman's Battle Beyond the Stars (1980). But between the 2, this is the better version. It's like comparing Dune (1984) to Dune: Part One (2021) -- but no where near the caliber of Dune: Part One (2021).Though there's a part 2 coming soon, the final fight before the ending did feel like a lackluster.However it has good production value, good effects, decent world and character building, but its periodic slow pace and the 300 (2006) slow motion action was distracting.If Zack Snyder were simply the writer and producer while bringing in -- say -- JJ Abrams, John Woo, George Miller, or somebody with their own personal touch that's compatible with Zack Snyder's story, the this could have easily by an 8/10 rather 6-6.5/10.A possible 9 if James Cameron, Christopher Nolan if he doesn't mind CGI, or Denis Villeneuve if they directed.But when compared to Battle Beyond the Stars (1980) and most of the live action Star Wars movies -- since this was originally conceived as an R-rated Star Wars spinoff -- I'd say behind The Last Jedi (2017), but WELL above the prequels, well above The Rise of Skywalker (2019), well above Solo: A Star Wars Story (2018), and on par with The Force Awakens (2015) and Return of the Jedi (1983).And above Battle Beyond the Stars (1980).

title: ChatGPT writing - hollow acting
text: Must have been something put together by ChatGPT or other generative AI - not one of the actors seems to believe any of it.It seems to be pieced together by bits and pieces of all past SciFi movies. Nothing here is original. Effects are fine but everything has been seen before. The story contain no surprises. The characters are empty and there is really nothing at stake - because they can miraculously shot themselves out of any situation without any real sacrifice.The plot line is thin and for the same reason the characters spend much time discussing their non existing motivations for doing what they do.Is this really what we can expect in 2023 of a sci-fi movie??

title: Entertainingly odd, and Beautiful
text: Let me start by stating I am not a die hard Star Wars (SW) fan. I have seen all of the movies but by no means do I identify with these films. That being said, Rebel Moon is the most fun I've had watching a SW movie since Rogue One. If you enjoy Zack Snyder's films, his cinematic touch is all over this movie. Also nice homage to the Seven Samurai.I do feel the story is rushed, as is typical in a "lets put a crew together" style of storytelling. That being said, I cared about the characters and I am excited to see what happens to them in the sequel. I did find some of the accents & delivery odd to the degree to made me laugh but that simply is what it is. Overall, I wish it had been 30 minutes longer to not seem rushed but appreciated the care shown in some scenes to make the moments feel real & lived in. For a SW Netflix flick, I give it a 8/10, a 6 is watchable, 7 is fun, but an 8 means I'd gladly watch it again.

title: A sort of Star Wars copy but good to watch
text: Storyline is more or less based on StarWars. You have the rebels and Darth Vader with his empire. Then add a little bit of flavor from Lord of the Rings, Avator and Warcraft and voila, Rebel Moon is born! Besides that, I likes the actors, acting, music and special effects. The speed of the movie is good and has a good mix of action (not to soft) which won't disappoint you. So after all not a bad movie and very enjoyable to watch if you accept the non original storyline. I like the fact that part two will follow which I'm also going to watch. Hope it will be a bit more original then part one...

title: Wow
text: So phenomenally atrocious. Comical story if you can call it a story. Human/cyborg/spider fight = lack lustre....at best. All of it is bizarre to be honest. Charlie's Scottish/Irish accent in an irrelevant general space/time = so bizarre. Why. Context to historical events and then complete disregard and ignorance to the same era. Like a weird, poor man's gladiator film. Apparently I need 200 more characters to make this a legitimate review, hurdy gurdy, hurdy gurdy, meatballs, I sweat when I'm typing in helvetica. Paris is a slum if you go outside the tourist traps. Would you eat a key if I asked you? Bottle opener key chains and all?

title: Brilliant
text: Ignore all the bad reviews!! This is a 2 part film and has perfectly set up for the part 2, story and action in this and in Zach Synder style perfectly timed slow mo. Loved every minute of it and really looking forward to part 2. Lots of unexpected scenes too which has also set up for part 2 without giving too much away. I'm really confused with the bad reviews on this because I was gripped from start to finish. It was nothing like dune. All films find inspiration from others and I don't understand how that is an issue. I cannot wait for part 2 and to see how this set up plays out. Well done!!

title: Like ordering Star Wars from Wish
text: Despite horrible reviews, I went on and watched the rebel moon. It's like a patchwork of different ancient classic movie plots, characters and visuals, never inventing much on its own. There is the basic seven samurai plotline, the evil totalitarian imperium (visuals having even a likeness to wh40k in addition to it copying the star wars imperium extensively) , the rebels with their gang -punkish esthetics, blade runner/mad max makeup included. Of course there must be high-tech flaming swords, and planet killing spaceships. On top of all this there is a version of the scene from Avatar(only missing the blue skin), taming a flying beast which has no true relevance to the plot, as well as the fight against a giant spider creature, like scifi-LOTR with the typical ninja character with light sabers - again with little relevance to the plot. Did I mention the is a han solo - esque character, c3po's soldier version with the same Jeeves-y accent, and a cantina full of obnoxious space criminals?However, trying hard not to pre-empt all plot twists, I managed to find enjoyment in the epic visuals the movie offers, with special reference to gun effects - for once sci-fi blasters didn't look or sound like peashooters. Forget there is a plot and consider this as a well made popcorn movie, not much more but not any less either.

title: Understatement to call this movie a Waste of Time.
text: I am confused as to what happened with Zack's ability to write movies. What exactly happened to this once great director? How can you write and direct something so awful, so disconnected, so horrible to look at, & still deem it viable for release? I will never understand how the same director who made movies like 300 and Watchmen can go & release a 3-hrs pile of trash like this one.So many plotholes, so many unnecessary scenes and lines, the characters arent nearly fleshed out as they should be, and the cast choices are quite underwhelming given what characters theyre supposed to portray.It's such a shame that directors like Zack get steady supply of budget to make trash movies when other talented directors get crumbs to make masterpieces.

title: I feel so sorry, this had so much more potential...
text: I feel that the movie would be hugely better if this was done by another director, or even by Marvel (at least old Marvel School). I liked all heroes, I pretty much liked the story, BUT....The result is bad. The female protagonist delivers and may has a bright career in front of her, there were times that I liked feeling like there were fusions of some favorite films (most of them already mentioned by others but I would add Alita Battle Angel), however, there were times that the other movies rip off was so intense (Star wars, Avatar, but the most annoying was the feeling of the movie Sky Captain. Yes, these nazi type bad guys, to me looked like totally ridiculed the movie.Also sometimes visuals were great and sometimes it was like B movie type thing (again like sky captain).So so SAD, this could be a great great movie and saga. I gave it a 7 merelly because there were nice times that I felt they worthed 10, and times that I wanted it to fast forthward.

title: Not good
text: Take Kurosawa, Star Wars, battle beyond the stars, dune, three amigoes, gladiator and a whole bunch of other movies, books and television and mash them all together through the lens of Zack Snyder and what you get is just not a good film.Boring, exposition heavy dialogue - action scenes ruined by a reliance on slow mo to hide boring choreography - production design lifted straight from warhammer 40K and Jupiter AscendingUnlikable characters in boring, gloomy settings - honestly, so many planets visited and all have the same gloomy aestheticNone of the actors have the charisma to starGo watch the films and read the books that clearly Snyder leaned on for inspiration and you'll have a much better experience.

title: didn't even make it halfway through
text: It wasn't entirely intolerable at first for an obvious, cheap-looking Star Wars knockoff. Corey Stoll was fun in a brief role as a village chieftain with beads in his beard.I made it all the way until they visited Mos Eisley sorry Providence and found a cantina filled with funky-looking aliens and at that point the Star Wars rippoff-ery was too much to bear and I gave up.Sorry, but Sofia Boutella can't carry a movie. She just doesn't have that star quality. I couldn't buy her even as a knockoff Luke Skywalker.Just another in Netflix's long, long list of terrible movies. The Netflix logo is a flashing red sign: stay away.

title: A Galactic Tale that Star Wars forgot how to be.
text: When you recruit Zack Snyder to a project in the realms he travels you invite something perhaps unique or unusual or maybe even great.The jury may still be out on this for many but for me after perhaps the tenth time of watching part one, I have realized this has grown on me and much to my utter surprise has scratched my Star Wars itch of which nothing since Rouge One has been able to satisfy.Is it perfect - no - is it formulaic, at times yes. Does if have flashes of cinematic wonder? Absolutely! The gems peppered throughout thrill me on the tenth viewing as much as the first. So that is what makes this something to savor over time and to come back to so often.It has intent! Zack Snyder intent and the ability translate it onto the screen. When SW lost most all its heart in its reimagining, Rebel Moon wore much of its heart right on its sleeve and did so with audacity. Some speak of wooden dialog or varying effects but miss the point as when Kora makes her will known it reigns down in a wrath of badass that will soon define all of the characters to be recruited into her quest of service. From there the deeds and the situations get very thick. I am always pulled into this ride no matter what and its one part visual feast and one part dreaded march to oblivion. Many miss that point. What never wavers though is this vision of audacity that drives the entire film. Even minor characters flaunt it and though you know they wont survive getting in Kora and company's way, they are never the less very dangerous and bring maximum effort to the story.All the cast brings what all I can describe as "flavor" to this journey that keeps things interesting even if not all that unpredictable or verbose. Then comes the gems that make me smile everytime. The crown flowers for the battle robot, the reaching of Kora's fingertips to feel the feathers of the Chimera. These gems of which there are many win over the cinephile in me to love this film more than I did at first.That's some of the movie magic. Of course as many have said what they do with the second part of this story will make or break it in a bigger sense of the word but to be quite honest will in no way ruin my gradually built admiration for the first film alone.And in that there is a wee bit of movie making brilliance.

title: Fun mess!
text: How to make a snyder film: amazing shot + Slomo + good looking people + cool soundtrack + musclesGood storytelling? No we don't need that as long as the shots are "cool".But jokes aside I had a good time watching this altho I'll judge the full story when the directors cut comes out but if I have to judge the story of this cut, it's very messy and I didn't feel much about the characters because we didn't spent enough time knowing them. It was like a video game where you do some shootings and action stuff you meet a new character and then another action moment. I knew exactly what to expect from a zack snyder version of Star Wars and I'm not mad about movie being ridiculous with a lot of cool action moments. I just wish the movie was longer and the story had more depth, it had a lot of potential but we'll see how the Final Cut works. At the end of the day imo zack snyder is a really good cinematographer and filmmaker and if you anything about cinema you know how difficult is to make a movie like this with so many good shots and I really appreciate him explaining filmmaking to the younger viewers and enjoying making his movies.6.5/10.

title: Rebel Moon is embarrassing and disappointing. No originality.
text: Rebel Moon is a derivative work and not at all original.The story of the film is a mess of elements already seen in other science fiction works such as Star Wars, all accompanied by many clichés.Even the sets are not very original. The planets and spaceships look like they were copied from other films, and there's nothing really new to see. Furthermore, the CGI is sometimes unconvincing.The characters are poorly developed and fail to arouse any empathy in the viewer.Overall this part 1 of Rebel Moon is not convincing, it doesn't suck but it isn't a good product either, I personally didn't like. Disappointing.

title: Waste
text: Just a giant waste of sci-fi effort. Should have been a cancelled single season show on the WB. No likeable characters and in between dozing off, you just stay awake listing the star wars mimicry.If this was a theatric release it would rival Wing Commander for box office failure. The worst thing about these failed, uninspired and over budgeted monstrosities is they likely kill off any chance of filming some of the actually fantastic sci-fi book series published in the last 30 years.I don't know what they can do so save part 2 from flopping...but I do know I won't be wasting any effort to watch it as anything but noisy background viewing in the shop.

title: Not bad at all!
text: I am usually pretty picky what movies I watch, never less than 7.0 on IMDB, but I like Zack Snyders movies so it was with some faith I decided to watch this despite all the bad reviews. It's not bad at all! Story is decent, actors are good, photo is great and the effects are good. They even did a good job of making the heroine's fighting scenes believable. First half is better than the last but the last half is not bad either. Normally I would give this a strong 6, cause I am stingy with my ratings but I am giving it a 7 to balance all the unwarranted bad ratings. Totally worth watching! Looking forward to the sequel.

title: Tragically unoriginal and soulless
text: It's rare to watch something attempting to be a sweeping epic and to feel nothing but shocked at the lack of competence with which it was assembled. The characters are beyond hollow, the story feels like an AI attempt at mashing together star wars and the chronicles of Riddick. The movie jumps so quickly to fulfill all the well trodden beats of exactly what you would expect but forgets to give life to its tale. I went in with low expectations and this fell short of those. The CGI is also wildly inconsistent some scenes seem like mediocre work from a 2008 movie while others pass as bare minimum acceptable for 2020. This whole project feels unfinished and poorly crafted.

title: Really cool scenes for a bad movie.
text: The worst part is the 2nd movie will be out in 4 months. So it's already been written and probably mostly filmed. They didn't even take the time to see where the first one fell short and make sure they don't make the same mistakes.So many movies that basicskly had scenes stolen from them. Star Wars, Avatar, Harry Potter, V for Venderta., Alita. The movie wasn't original at all.It totally reminded me of Alita where there was scene after scene that was cool as hell but there was absolutely no story at all. Just a bummer of a movie.I do recommend watching though because of the badass scenes it does have and hope that the second one is much better.

title: Nothing original?
text: This movie is a mish-mash of other titles that barely have any coherence.I feel like the Hero and Village could just abandon the planet and move to another one... that would solve this movie, but no we need a group of few legendary warriors to fight against the Emperium.This sound so stupid and cliche.Just few people against millions.There Is too many scenes of Lens Flares and Slow-motion.While the fighting and choreography is solid, of course we need a moment where woman can fight the badguy only to "lose" 10 seconds later.Despite this movie 2 hours, It goes too fast.Video Game Developers are capable of creating an Interesting stories than Hollywood.If you like Sci-Fi, skip It... don't bother.

title: This movie should have been a 2 parter
text: I think people are being a bit harsh with rating this below 5. My biggest complaint is how rushed the story feels. They could have dedicated this movie to the formation of the team and shared more of their back stories and really develop the characters and then make the 2nd part more geared to them waging war, instead they went with 1 film that feels rushed. The effects are beautiful and I like the mash up of old meets new technology. The cast is good and storyline is pretty basic and easy to follow. It just seems like they sacrificed story for action.The antagonist could have been better, angry white guy with a Peaky Blinders haircut hardly seemed like an interesting adversary eith.

title: Just what...?
text: If the movie wanted me to keep on yelling what, it definitely succeeded..Zack Synder is back with its signature slow mo... too bad the slow mo is kinda meh... most memorable action scene for me was when Sofia moved in a slow mo in her introduction scene. Nothing was going on. It was just her taking one step while bullets going in the background... just what!!?Also the script is bad. I think the problem is that Zack do not treat his characters like human beings... they are just playthings to make cool moments and plot to go forward.Like the shirtless dude who just ride an animal and left the animal there!? I was waiting for a guardians of the galaxy 3 moments (when Quill did a smart deception), but it never came... it just a straight Harry Potter's scene with the Hippogrift. Least the guy is hot.Anyway it is a ridiculous movie but good on him for making things that he likes and paying people for it too. Heard he is a chill dude too so good on him.

title: A masterpiece that really goes in depth
text: This is definitely a great masterpiece considering that they don't produce movies like this anymore. First of all, you must read the book, I think it's worth it. Second of all, all the background story and details are well covered. If you like the intro of Dune, you will like how they introduce the different planets and people around the galaxy. This is something that many sci-fi movies lack these days, the lack of details besides the main story. This part one will open new doors for a saga. The movie overall is underrated. It's only for true lovers of a great sci-fi story. A great masterpiece like this will be only appreciated by those who seek depth and originality, and this one has everything.

title: Original Trilogy Star Wars Plot with New Trilogy Execution
text: Bad. Just bad. I think the people giving this a 10/10 must have forgotten what a good movie is because of the junk we've been fed as of late. Snyder has always made pretty movies and he continued with that here. But wow was this bad.Also soooooo predictable...especially if you've ever seen Star Wars because it's so similar. I could honestly see a semi-strong case for some copyright violations. The last 5 minutes were a carbon-copy of the last 5 minutes of Revenge of the Sith. The first 30 minutes was a New Hope. And everything in the middle was The Last Jedi (aka was terrible and boring and didn't make sense half the time).

title: Entertaining and amusing
text: Yes, they "stole" from everyone, even Harry Potter, and I laughed my ass off every time I saw it!I also grinned at the addition of a tie and streetlights that could have come from the here and now, and if I watch it again I'm sure I'll find more stuff I enjoy.I really like the universe they created and actually like the references to what inspired them. The opening scene was so over the top in it's references, it made clear they knew what they were doing. They added enough to make it entertaining and something new in its own right. Makes me wonder what I'll see next and which movies I'll recognize in their references and shots.The story is okay, the plot could be better, acting as well. But it doesn't bother me very much and I read in another review that they thought it had potential an I tend to agree with that.It was an entertaining sci-fi movie and it looked great! I definitely want to know what happens next and how it'll end.

title: ChatGPT Movie
text:
How can they release movie that is a collection of standard template characters with a template good vs bad story that lacks any creative story telling. It was almost a checklist of characters with a checklist story.Half way through the movie is was a case of comparing where they stole characters, themes, visuals and were they ripping of star wars and Dune.Who released this movie, who let this get out to the public ? Do they have such a low opinion of the intelligence of the general public's intelligence
ChatGPT movie. 0/10 for story telling.If you like this movie - please go read a book.

title: Amazing
text: I was constantly in awe of how amazing this movie is. It's a work of art, totally incredible. People complaining about story are whatever, it's beautiful.
