The idea that there is great people out there that can be gathered up to save something. It's very basic story that is designed to give the amazing visuals a reason to exist. You know you have already seen it this story before, this did something different with it. Really touched me. What an ambitious movie. Really awesome how they pulled it off. I came to this review section fully expecting it to have a solid 10 stars. Imagine my surprise. ,

title: Kind of a forgettable mess, but still watchable
text: I would say that this movie is another hero universe with side characters exposition, sci fi elements, baddies all the standard cliché stuff. In other words, a 'been there done that' type of movie.

title: The Seven Magnificent Samurai Battle Beyond The Stars
text: From a universe where the energy crisis hit hard and lighting is at a premium, comes a mix of stories you have all seen before.Outsider in hiding from their past is integrating into a rural community. Bad guys arrive demanding tribute, they slay to leader of rural community and will be back for tribute in a few weeks. Outsider has to intervene and build a resistance for when bad guys come back.The story telling is slow and even at the slow pace character backgrounds are minimal, each character is introduced with an action scene just for the action. These scenes are even slowed down more by overuse of slow motion. Just over 2 hours should have been enough to tell the whole story, but of course it needs to be cut up in multiple movies.Acting is below average, wooden. The non human aliens have been spotted in other sci-fi and fantasy franchises before.

title: A mix sci-fi and fantasy movies
text: It is a general title, indeed. I could recognise, easily, a little bit (or a bit more) of Star Wars, a bit of Star Trek, kind of Lord of the Rings saga, all with the twist that the main character is a female.The atmosphere is oversaturated and the slow-mo scenes that made "300" an exquisite film, were abused here.The narrative was predictable and the characters could be much more that what were portrayed.Was it fun to watch? Yes, and I will definitely watch part 2. But, do we really need this kind of repetition in our sci-fi and fantasy movies?I am in my mid-forties now and grew up with sci-fi films, which offered me a glimpse of the future. I still cherish Battlestar Galactica (2004-2009) as the best sci-fi series ever made, hands down.We need to reset our imagination.

title: A Feat That Feels... Unfinished?
text: When it comes to worldbuilding and telling a story, Zach Snyder is absolutely fantastic. I'm completely in for this new story-it feels lived in for a long time, the characters are interesting, and he's earned the right to be as extravagant as he wants. This feels like extravagant sci-fi like George Lucas imagined in the 70s. But it doesn't land. Hopefully, doesn't land YET. I'm curious to see how the story continues/ends in Part 2. Maybe it will feel less rushed over two films. Knowing that this was going to be a Star Wars film originally... I kinda wish it was Star Wars. The new IP isn't interesting enough on its own at this point, but imagining it as Old Republic or post-Sequel Trilogy would make this film fit where Zach wanted it to fit, I think. So ultimately, I liked it-I didn't love it-but I'm hopeful the sequel makes it feel complete and doesn't fall as flat as this unfortunately did for me.

title: Hilariously bad
text: I gotta hand it to Zack Snyder- the dude obviously has never met a cliche he didn't want to grab with both hands and make out with.This (Im guessing?) loose re-telling of Seven Samurai is so bad and so ridiculous that it takes hate watching to whole new heights. We laughed our butts off!Throw in scenes ripped off from every blockbuster you can think of (Harry Potter, Witness, The Blue Brothers, Star Wars, the 1984 Dune, Firefly, Star Wars again, Rebel without a Cause, more Star Wars...), a list of actors that look like more famous actors, a metric ton of racial pandering, weird accents, lots of high-wasted pants (!), the obligatory space nazis, and SO MUCH SLOW MO! And you have a snark-fest to warm the cockles of your snickering little heart.Frankly, I can't wait to trash Part 2!

title: You want to like it but you are lost
text: I am watching it feeling like I want to root for the characters, but they are introduced to poorly, and without any connection. I almost feel like I'm missing a back story, or a novel I didn't read. So so random, but almost enjoyable if it wasn't. Who are these people, where are we? The cast is great, the graphics aren't bad, I'm just kind of placed into this story with them, almost like a fever dream. Maybe watch it. But don't be upset if you feel like you missed some scenes without actualy missing anything. I don't even think I know everyone's names... did they even have names? Who's to say?

title: Solid, entertaining sci fi. Big Budget Battle beyond the stars!
text: Great fun, would have made a great Star Wars movie, But reminded me more of Roger Cormans Battle beyond the stars. 7 Samurai in space.Yes the slow mo action gets in the way sometimes, but its a beautiful spectacle. Heard some moaning about under character development, but there wasnt much of that in A New Hope if I remember rightly, all that came in Empire Strikes Back. So I for one am looking forward to part 2 and getting to know the characters better. Loved the mix of fantasy and sci fi in the art direction. Looked like a well worn galaxy.The only character I didnt think was either scary enough or threatening enough was the big bad boss, thought he could have been more monstrous instead of a Scottish Laird who hadnt had his oats that morning.Looking forward to part 2.

title: Not bad, not great
text:
Visually striking with an ambitious scope but without a clear direction. Its inspiration is clear but makes it its own. The set design & cinematography are beautiful yet parts come off as random..
..
Visually striking with an ambitious scope but without a clear direction. Its inspiration is clear but makes it its own. The set design & cinematography are beautiful yet parts come off as random..
..
Visually striking with an ambitious scope but without a clear direction. Its inspiration is clear but makes it its own. The set design & cinematography are beautiful yet parts come off as random..
..

title: 300 in Space...
text:
... would have been a great idea, had Mr. Snyder made it before 300. But at this point the novelty is already lost, so the silliness and lack of substance becomes more evident.I am being overly generous with my rating, because ultimately it is a visually spectacular sci-fi-fantasy epic, however nonsensical. I would like to see more stuff like this, not less.Pros -
1. Visually stunning, worthy of a big screen.2. Plenty of homages to favorites of various genres. The main plot is loosely based on Seven Samurai. The planet where the story begins seems like a Norse village out of the Sagas. The soldiers from the "Motherworld" have a Warhammer 40K aesthetic. There are other visual elements evocative of H R Giger or cyberpunk and various other genres.3, Ensemble cast of some very good actors from all over the world.4. The action sequences are excellent in typical Zack Snyder style.5. A fascinating world and possibility of lore with lot of potential.Cons -1. The movie is extremely short, even for the first half of a duology. Every other problem is related to this.2. The story is very simplistic to the point of being insubstantial.3. No time given for character development (except for the lead protagonist), to understand their motivations or justify their actions. It feels like the second season of a TV show.4. Lot of interesting characters and concepts and worlds are barely touched upon. The pacifist robots, the fallen king, and magic princess, the dispossessed talking spiders etc. Perhaps the sequel will expand on some of it, but another short movie can not possibly be enough. We needed some good 10-20 episodes.5. The downside of so many homages is that a lot of things seem overly familiar.6. An animated production would have suited this tale much better instead of a CGI-laden live-action. Practical effects are more in vogue these days than CGI. No matter how fanciful the CGI action is, it is hard to compete with, say, a short hexagenerian with an apparent death wish doing his own stunts flying fighter planes and jumping off cliffs.And finally, I really wish both critics and average audiences would stop complaining how every new fantasy production is not Game of Thrones or Lord of the Rings, or every new sci-fi one is not like the older Star Wars / Star Trek or The Expanse. Yes, they were masterpieces, but it does not mean we have constantly prove our love for them by turning our noses up at everything else that does not meet their lofty standards. There is plenty of room for glorious silly nonsense like this. Give us more, you hear, Netflix? Try to make them a bit more substantial perhaps.

title: Over promised, under delivered.
text: I found this movie quite enjoyable in parts but overall it was slightly tedious and hard to watch. I kept expecting it to get better, but it didn't. If this was a comic book and I was twelve I probably would read it...but not for over two hours. The thing is, there were obvious storyline parallels to the Magnificent Seven and other movies...but nothing original at all. The whole movie felt under developed and it missed the opportunity to make some very detailed development to the main characters. Where the heck did the robot go? Would this because there is a part two? I guess so, but it left me with a very dissatisfied feeling.

title: Zach Snyder is not good at movie making
text: This film is just not at all good.Over acted like crazy. Did they all do a William Shatner acting class just before filming began?The plot is over used and the only 'surprise' was so obvious that you couldn't even call it a spoiler (even though I won't say it here).There is no time spent getting to care about any character. They are all basically cardboard NPCs. I couldn't care less if any of them lived or died.The scenery was pretty cool and they have created a tangible world that feels lived in. For that one reason it gets a few stars.I can't believe people still think Zack S can make good films.

title: Not bad - even if it is a complete rip-off!
text: I quite enjoyed it really. But I suspect that was because I had no expectations of it.There are a lot of negative reviews about the plot. I find this a little confusing as the entire storyline is made up of elements from other quite successful films. Basically it is "The Magnificent Seven," (and by implication "The Seven Samurai,") combined with an awful lot of Star Wars as well as a fair bit of "Inglorious B*sterds" and executed in the style of Warhammer 40k.On the upside, the fight scenes are quite engaging if somewhat stylised (but far better than anything Ridley Scott could come up with). The villains are truly villainous and the heroes are really hard. And it's quite nice to know that the Ulster accent has survived to spread across the galaxy...Frankly it's entertaining and really not worth the slagging off of some of the two star reviews. Some people have marked it down for being simplistic; while others have done so for it being incoherent. Well, it can't be both!I believe there is a herd mentality which sometimes kicks in amongst reviewers of trying to outdo each other in terms of negativity regardless of the standard of the movie in reality. In actuality, "Rebel Moon," no worse than many graphic novels - and a damn sight better than a lot of superhero movies.

title: Contemptible bid to force another bloated & soulless franchise onto the world
text: "Rebel Moon - Part One: Child Of Fire" is blockbuster director Zach Snyder's sad bid to force another bloated & soulless franchise into the world. Despite a fine cast it's dire, thanks to Synder, Kurt Johnstad & Shay Hatten thoughtlessly stuffing their dull, formulaic script with as many historic & genre themes as possible. Sofia Boutella (deserving SO much better) is a Skywalker-esque rebel who with the likes of Charlie Hunnam, Djimon Hounsou, Corey Stoll & the voice of Anthony Hopkins, battles an evil empire personified by Ed Skrein (an excellent baddie). To call it 'Stars Wars'-lite doesn't even come close to describing what a pathetic rip-off it is. Contemptible.

title: Thoroughly Enjoyable Yarn
text: I dont understand all the hate. The acting isn't perfect (fairly typical for the genre), and the story isn't original (also fairly typical)....but that doesn't detract from it at all. It's a big budget, special effect laden sci-fi , very pretty, and very watchable. I wanted something fairly typical that was easy to watch and was going to entertain and I wasn't disappointed (which is more than I can say for The Creator or Tenet). I guess the negative comments are coming from those who had certain preconceived expectations about what it SHOULD be, rather than what it is. If you are unsure, then give it a start and see how you get on...I did,and happily got all the way through.

title: Pure Entertainment
text:
This movie does exactly what it intends to do. The negative reviews are entirely based on flawed expectations. Don't eat a burger and then complain because you wanted filet mignon. This is a hella good burger!What It Is
Popcorn flick, heroic science-fantasy (NOT science fiction, but fantasy), eye-candy, easy-going EntertainmentWhat It Is Not
Hyper-realistic, hyper-dramatic, deeply emotional, plot-twist heavy, oscar worthy character study, gritty fantasyI'm not sure that I've ever enjoyed a Zack Snyder film before. These days I typically skip them. I was in a sci-fantasy mood so I gave this a shot. I went in having seen 0 trailers. I was blown away.The Good:
Lots of fun characters. Assembling the crew feels like assembling a D&D party. If you've ever played a TTRPG this film should be right up your alley. I struggle to see why anyone would complain about the characters. Then again, the complaining people just seem miserable anyway!Cool locations. I really enjoyed the designs of the planets and cities. Obviously there is inspiration from other media and yet there are many original spins and angles too. That's the beauty of iteration in art. Watching this inspired me to go and do some of my own worldbuilding. I am saddened for those who couldn't allow themselves to be inspired in some way.Fun creatures. I love that fantasy elements are incorporated. This is NOT science fiction. It's science-fantasy. One review complained "I just want good science fiction". Your expectations are flawed, not this film.Great costume and set designs. Really liked the blend of cultural influences throughout. Hope to see much more, especially the non euro-fantasy aspects.Entertaining fight choreography. The somewhat excessive slow mo is obv cheesy but it actually works quite well in that you can see what's going on and notice little details, which is a pleasant break from some of the shaky cam, rapid cut choreography we get in a lot of films. I had to chuckle at a certain flag related slow mo shot but the rest of it never broke my immersion. The first fight scene in particular I thought was done really well. Unlike many films, the dynamic of the fight actually makes sense (as opposed to 12 enemies waiting to attack one by one, or charging in rather than shooting from distance, they fought fairly realistically... for a heroic fantasy, anyway. This is not a realistic war movie, so expectations are not geared for that)Pacing. I never got bored at any point in the film, but there were ample opportunities to breathe as well. Excellent pacing, one of the film's strongest qualitiesPassable Acting. I have no idea why so many people are talking as if these were the worst acting performances of all time. First of all some characters are written to be caricatures. For example, the soldiers. Their acting fulfilled that to a tee. If you don't like that, you are in the wrong genre. The characters with more depth, such as the protagonist and her allies, were played with complete competence. If anything, some of the dialogue could have been a bit smoother, but it never reached a point where I lost immersion. And you don't watch this kind of blockbuster fantasy popcorn flick expecting hyper-poetic dialogue and Oscar worthy, deeply emotional dramatic performances. THAT IS NOT THE TYPE OF MOVIE BEING MADE SO DONT JUDGE FOR THOSE TYPE OF QUALITIES. You wouldn't say a football player is a poor athlete because they can't bowl 300, would you? Well, clearly some of these reviewers probably would, but they'd be wrong.Overall Visuals. Who tf complained about the gryphon? It looked excellent. The visuals were top notch in every aspect of this film. Solid CGI, effects, lighting, etc. Perfectly fit the vibes of the film.Score. I honestly didn't notice the music too much, so it was neither a strong positive or negative pointThe Negatives
Slightly Predictable.Without giving any spoilers, most of the plot points could be easily predicted if you're even mildly aware of fantasy tropes. Is that a problem though? NOPE. Unless you somehow convinced yourself you were going to be watching shutter island? This is not a film that needs super slick plot twists. The plot that occurred was good enough for the popcorn flick this aims to be, but it isn't the selling point of the movie, that's for sureDialogue
Same thing here, pretty standard popcorn flick dialogue. A few lines on the cheesier side, actually a few very decent lines as well though.The Villains
I do absolutely feel the villains were a bit weak. Yes, the most visible of them is extremely despicable, but almost to a degree that it feels like too low hanging of fruit, even for a trope heavy heroic fantasy epic. Some of the secondary villains were a lot more intriguing than the main antagonist, though. I hope the villains improve in the second half overall.Underused Characters
A few characters are introduced that don't get utilized to the degree I personally hoped for, but that's a subjective opinion and there's also a second part plus the possibility of a franchise. Plenty of opportunity to see more!

title: This is awful
text: This deserves a roasting only capable by the amazing team at MST3K. This is one of the worst written movies I've seen in some time and I have seen The Room. I assume this was the rough draft and they fell short on time so just had to go with it, we've all been there.I hope there is an investment made in an action choreographer for the sequel. One cannot rely on camera tricks alone to make action sequences look great, it takes timing and some passion on part of the actors. Oh wait, why don't we just try putting things in slow motion every few seconds that's cool right?Don't get me started on the horses lol.

title: Lazy, Lacking Imagination
text: Where it failed spectacularly was in both the story line and originality. I had a hard time buying into the plot of a small, medieval farming village with a small band of rebels going to war against an advanced, planet destroying tyrant overlord. 9/10's of the story is missing. The Rebel Moon story is too simplistic, like the writers were too lazy to build a universe with factions, allies, and all the other ingredients you need for a good underdog story.There's very little imagination. Rebel Moon relies too much on CGI in an attempt to dazzle viewers. The costumes were dreadful. The antagonists are literally dressed like WWII German fascists, right down to 40's era neckties and suspenders. The Dreadnaught Class Star Destroyer looks remarkably similar to a WWII era submarine. Fantastical beasts on different worlds are just horses with a goofy helmet. And different species are ripped right from other movies, like an alien race whiich are just Orcs who stepped off the LOTR set, and another species which is nearly identical to.the Twi'lek in the Star Wars franchise.Not sure what Netflix's goal is. Rebel Moon is a lazy, bare minimum effort film that pretty much rips off other films. It uses too much CGI in an attempt to trick viewers they are watching a premium Hollywood film. It's a modern Spaghetti Western where it's cheap, easy to produce, and its only goal is to make a quick buck.

title: Strong visuals, derivative plot, violent. A grundgy Star Wars.
text: There's no denying Zack Snyder's impressive visual imagination, which is on full display here. The opening few minutes by themselves are worth seeing, as we are introduced to heroine Kora (Sofia Boutella), living amidst vast scenery on a moon around a huge Saturn-like planet filling the sky. Many later scenes show off Snyder's characteristic obsession with dark, brooding lighting and apocalyptic settings. In its own way, this is all sort of fascinating.It's all very watchable, but the whole problem is that even with stuff to look at, you still need to have a story to tell. All these impressive visuals, and the plot such as it is, are deployed at the service of scenes of extended violence and combat that seem to be just there as set pieces. And as lots of others have already said, this part of it is pretty derivative -- there are elements of Star Wars, of course (a plucky band of rebels against a huge Evil Empire), but also feels from Avatar, Tarzan, Game of Thrones, and other fantasy/sf adventures. It also doesn't help that the basic premise doesn't make a lot of sense: Kora's plan for fighting the Empire and its millions of soldiers is to gather a little rogue band of specialist fighters who can then do (something-or-other) to semi magically bring everything down. Of course it all has to finish up with scenes of hand-to-hand combat that go on and on in great detail. It seems like these scenes are the director's real interest. The main cast has several familiar names, and they all do OK, but most of the time they have little to work with except to keep the action going.If only Snyder would turn over the scripting and storyboarding to someone else. As Ursula LeGuin said, if there's nothing going on but unceasing physical action, it's a sure sign that no story is being told. For me, Snyder's most complete accomplishment is still "Watchmen" (2009), which is also pretty dystopian but has his best combination of plot, characters, and visuals.

title: Not Good Enough
text: '' Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire '' is a sci fi action movie that makes it obvious right from the start that it was originally ment to be a Star Wars movie. And that's because, if it was under the Star Wars universe, the plot holes that this one has would not have been plot holes. Alas, this is a new series of its own that fails to make an impact.First of all, the story is too predictable. It feels like the script was written by choosing a handfull of space tropes and utilizes all of them. However, as the movie focuses more on the action scenes, which feel old and overused, there is no growth, no time for the audience to get to know the characters or even care for them, hence the twists had no impact.So, overall, two out of ten, for the performances mainly.

title: Great
text: I personally think this is a great movie to watch. Not that maybe someone will disagree but i personally thinks this is great. Producers and directors has nowadays have there work cuttout for them because they have alot of people to please,the public outside of the directing amd producing world,so it is understandable that some people will sometimes critisise and some not infact you wont get the whole world happy at one time,so from that part directors and producers should take movies as such and learn from them. For some it may not be the greatest movie of all but its not that bad of a movie to watch.

title: Very rushed
text: Should have fleshed out much much more of the back story, poor pacing. This should have been a series, it may have had a chance. Way too much slo-mo, and no blood??? Very annoying, if you put that much effort into choreography at least have the effects realistic. This story is a very obvious Star Wars reject, but if more effort went into making this a really in depth R rated series...soooo much more potential. The acting was great , but it was so rushed I didn't care about any of them. I hope part 2 may be a bit better? But you hope Jack Snyder puts more effort next time giving the characters the story they deserve.

title: Magnificent 7 ; Star Wars Edition
text: I had high expectations before watching the movie. When I watched it, I realized that the subject of the movie is the same as Magnificent Seven. A few poor villagers are looking for heroes to save their village. How familiar isn't it?The narration in the visuals reminded me of Star Wars. Looks like Zack Snyder copied not 1, but 2 movies. Frankly, I expected better from Snyder.While they were looking for heroes ; nearly all of them doesn't fit their parts.First Tarak was taming a wild animal for his freedoom. And also that was a gamble. This looks very familiar too.Then Nemesis's sword scene with a giant spider.... That wasn't fit to her.By the way I really like Charlie Hunnam but there is not a good dialogue for him. Even proper credits were not prepared for the actors to show themselves.

title: Bad hack job!!!
text: This was the story pitch Zac Snyder to Disney for his foray into the Star Wars universe, Disney declined. Get it...rebels, space, millions of species, evil empire, and even "laser swords" to replace light sabers. So he needed to tweak his storyline to avoid major lawsuits. So it's a horrible written story arc and glued together with nice looking CGI slow-motion but still can't pull off a decent movie. He's really gone downhill between this movie and the last DC movies he made. Even all the big name actors couldn't help this movie along. A handle full of people decide they want to destroy essentially a Star Destroyer and most of the movie is "getting the band together" and each band member is part of the Top 10 wanted fugitive of the new evil empire...sound familiar yet. The space ships still use combustible engines versus antigravity engines so that's not gonna work. Just like SW's, none of the new hero's can be hit by enemy laser rifles even from a few feet away and there's more people sliding along the floor fighting as is that one particular move will make us watchers excited to watch. It's time Zac Snyder stop making movies...honestly, it's a really bad hack job covered in CGI bandaids because it was supposed to be a SW film and he didn't get the permission to make it for Disney so he scrambled at the last minute to find someone who would fund his last effort...Netflix should've known better!!!

title: Not an original thought
text: This is a typical Zach Snyder movie. Slow MOs, potentially strong characters languishing in muddled and predictable story lines. Too bad most of the ideas and development of the story behind it (what little there is) is stolen from so many different movies. Darth Vader, Rae, Han Solo and so many more copycats. Even a couple of light sabers. Great cast but it goes down hill from there. The sets and CG are pretty good but you can tell it's all digital backgrounds. It looks as though they used the Volume to film it. I'm sure Netflix is proud but they shouldn't be. I would bet this movie is the reason our subscription prices went up.

title: Derivative, lacking any originality, and ultimately...utterly boring.
text: I remember Fantastic Four, or rather the cinema emptying over time as the boring mess plodded towards a boring end. Rebel Moon isn't far behind it. Sofia Boutella is the best part of the movie, and carries the role well. Unfortunately, the movie wasn't written to plumb the depths of her character. The plot instead seems intent on re-visiting every bad CGI moment from Corridor Digital's VFX Artists React series, Conan The Barbarian, Harry Potter, Star Wars, Star Wars, Star Wars, sorry, went on repeat there. Everyone and their dog can tell this was a horrible Star Wars script in the past. There are a lot of Nazis too. Star Wars.Snyder seems to have this avid following, and I'm just mystified by it. His body of recent work hasn't performed, and the obvious fortune Netflix spent on this mess is not justified. Skip it.

title: Beautiful cinematography, horrible writing
text: I'd give Rebel Moon a 5, only because the cinematography and VFX are stellar and the production design is beautiful throughout. Other than that, the movie lacks of originality in every department, leaving you wondering if you have actually watched parts of it before or if it's simply that predictable.Rebel Moon suffers first and foremost from really atrocious writing. The main plot is a collection of cliches of the genre, with a main protagonist forming the resistance against a tyrannical intergalactic empire. Unfortunately, that only becomes worse once you realise that the film spends most of the time jumping from planet to planet, introducing "unique" individuals who join the battle, but never allows room for character development or slow moments where we get to meet or relate to them. Once they board the spaceship, we never hear from them again. As a result, no matter what happens later in the film, viewers are left apathetic towards whatever outcome.I won't go into detail of how terrible the dialogue was, because that was truly hard to watch, but at least the actors tried their best to inject some life into their characters. Personally, I didn't find any stand-out performances aside from Ed Skrein, whose portrayal of Noble perfectly captured the cold and malicious nature of his character.All in all, don't expect to watch Rebel Moon and be inspired to investigate further into its story. It's as shallow and unoriginal as most reviewers describe it. If there's nothing else to watch, well, it's there.

title: Best movie I have seen in a decade.
text: How anyone can give this less than a 9 or 10 is beyond me. This is one of the best SCI-FI movies I have seen - my wife even loved it. The move kept my attention non-stop. There were twists at every point. The characters were so well developed and the soundtrack was amazing! This in my mind rivals Star Wars. The worlds and CGI is amazing and I love the mix of races. If you don't like SCI-FI you're not going to like this movie as it's pure to that form from start to finish. This movie is Star Wars meets Star Trek with a bit of Marvel mixed in. I just finished part one and immediately watched it again. The second part can't come soon enough!

title: Inept writing and directing, but decent visuals
text: In summary, the language in Rebel Moon is immature, the acting is stiff, the dialogue is awkward and the story makes very little sense, in fact it is a mishmash of other familiar stories. Oh, and action scenes quite frequently seem to lose all the action in slow motion nonsense.I do like the aesthetics, but that's because I'm a sucker for dark and moody. You might enjoy it on the big screen, but it might also be a very long two hours.Now, there is the off chance that a lot of scenes had to be cut to make Rebel Moon ready for manistream viewing, and that the Snyder cut might prove somewhat redeeming, but I wouldn't hold my breath.

title: Tedious and unoriginal
text: Zach Snyder can't come up with a single original thought. You're think that her learned something from the dreck that was his first "original" story, Suckerpunch. Somehow, this one is worse because he didn't seem to have learned anything since then, despite having worked on other IP to which he brought absolutely nothing and actually lessened by his having adapted them. This is the same person who thought that Superman's adopted father right him nothing but selfishness, and that Superman can only solve problems by killing. The man has the creativity of a spoiled teenage fanboy whose friend and family demands nothing of him.

title: Had potential but in the end 'a bit meh'
text: This had potential, good cast, Hopkins narrating and casting is a thumbs up, nice sets ( love the homestead set with Saturn-like planet on the horizon ). Fairly basic story, Unfortunately the story boarding is a bit crazy its like "quick we only have one movie to put a rag tag bunch of heros together". Quick slo-mo battle here, quick slo-mo battle there, Slo-mo battle at the end. I swear if it was at normal speed the movie would be about an hour long! It just doesn't gel well its like Michael Mann does '300'. Saying that, it has potential and I will watch the second movie before making my mind up. PS. Charlie Hunnams accent is a car crash! If you want genuine Northern Irish accents, employ actors from the north. To a native ear his accent is like fingernails on a chalkboard!

title: Delivers again
text: Zack Snyder delivers again! Love or hate the man, but he knows entertainment. It's a mixture of movies and genres, drama, war, sci-fi. Dune, Star Wars, Seven Samurai, Monuments Men. But it's beautiful, epic in scope, action packed (Ed steals the screen in his scenes) Charlie Hunnam gives a performance I didn't see coming, Sofia is beautiful as always, don't take my word for it, watch it, suspend your hatred for Snyder and just watch it. I wasn't let down, the action is epic in scope, story is great, effects are absolutely top tier. Part 2 comes out next year, it'll be up there with Dune in later years. It's impossible to describe. Just watch it! Don't have to be a Snyder fan or anything. Trust me!!!

title: Bad acting from everyone except Ed Skrein and Charlie Hunnam
text: I can't believe they had all that budget and still couldn't make a decent movie. That's just sad. The story was predictable, the acting terrible. That scene where Kora speaks to the General after they clean him up was cringe-worthy.The only thing that felt realistic was Charlie Hunnam's Scottish accent and his portayal of a morally challenged bounty hunter. And I truly hated Ed Skrein in this, so I guess he did his job well.The action scenes were cool, but at times felt too unrealistic. I get that Kora is super high-ranked soldier but are we really supposed to believe she took out 10 soldier all by herself at once? Aren't they supposed to be trained as well?Overall a disappointment, but not entirely unwatchable, that's why I gave it 5 stars.

title: Seven Samurai X Star Wars X A rushed storyline
text: As many who followed this project before its release knew, Znyder had originally written this story as a Star Wars story. He later changed it to an "original" universe where he then went on to borrow way too much from other great stories but without giving us (the viewers) anything to attach ourselves to. The traces of the Star Wars Empire was all too close visually for us to even attempt to assume otherwise. The "small village who gets -insert any amount of time- to farm rice, I mean grain, to the bad guys before they kill everyone"-plot is something that is seen not only in the greatest film of all time but in many other stories since. And that's OK. There nothing new under the sun. But if a director/writers wants the audience to feel and care for the characters there can't be a 2 minute recruitment of the mightiest war general the universe has ever known. All of these warriors lack soul and personality. I couldn't care two pennies if any of them died, and I didn't.I'm a big 300 fan, which is why I knew that Znyder's effects and music would take a centre stage in this movie and that is what makes me rate it 5/10. And don't get me wrong, the actors (most of them) did a good job, which is part of why I was so excited to see this film.This should have been a series. Everything is far too rushed. There's no build up. I'm sad because I really thought this would be something good. I kept an open eye despite the bad reviews I had seen and I hoped I would join them but here I am.

title: as you may expect
text: I don't think even an extended version can help fix all of the characters being so shallow. My advise to Snyder is to let other people write his scripts, cause he clearly doesn't know how to write a good one.There's no originality here, everything is predictable.B-movie dialogue, surprisingly bad acting (+ that accent).We spent so much time watching the backstory of the main character, instead of that could we maybe let other characters have at least one good line of dialogue so we can get to know them, or not even a good one but at least some line of dialogue so that we could see them interact with each other and not just get picked up by the main character like a package and do nothing for the rest of the film.(the fact that there will be an extended version is not good enough of an excuse to make this so bad).Regarding visuals - everything you would expect from Snyder.

title: A visual artist does not a story teller make...
text: "Rebel Moon," the latest cinematic venture from visionary director Zack Snyder, is a film that can be best described as a visual feast struggling under the weight of its own narrative shortcomings. Despite its stunning visuals, the film disappoints in its depth and character development, leaving viewers with a sense of unfulfilled potential.From the outset, "Rebel Moon" promises an epic adventure. The film's setting, a dystopian future where the galaxy is under the tyrannical rule of a dark overlord, sets the stage for what could have been a compelling narrative. However, the plot quickly unravels into a series of disjointed scenes, lacking the cohesive storyline necessary to engage the audience fully. The narrative, which attempts to weave together multiple subplots, feels fragmented, leaving the viewer struggling to connect with the overarching theme of rebellion and freedom.The lack of depth in "Rebel Moon" is most apparent in its treatment of the central conflict. The rebellion against the overlord, a classic trope in science fiction, is presented in a cursory manner, with little exploration of the motivations and backstories of the key players involved. The film misses an opportunity to delve into the complexities of rebellion, such as the moral ambiguities and the personal sacrifices involved. Instead, it opts for a more superficial portrayal, reducing what could have been a nuanced exploration of rebellion to a simple good-versus-evil narrative.Moreover, the character development in "Rebel Moon" is sorely lacking. The protagonist, portrayed as a reluctant hero thrust into the role of a leader, is a character archetype that has been seen countless times in the genre. Unfortunately, the film does little to add depth or originality to this character, making it difficult for the audience to empathize or connect with their journey. The supporting characters suffer from similar issues, with many of them reduced to mere caricatures. The villain, in particular, is a one-dimensional character, lacking the complexity and depth that could have made them a truly memorable antagonist.Despite these narrative shortcomings, "Rebel Moon" shines in its visual presentation. Snyder, known for his visually stunning films, does not disappoint in this regard. The film is a visual spectacle, with breathtaking landscapes, intricate set designs, and state-of-the-art special effects. The action sequences are choreographed with precision, offering a sensory overload that is both exhilarating and awe-inspiring. The use of color and lighting creates a vivid and immersive world that captivates the viewer, drawing them into the universe of "Rebel Moon."The cinematography in "Rebel Moon" is another area where the film excels. Each frame is meticulously crafted, with a keen eye for detail that elevates the visual storytelling. The camera work is fluid and dynamic, enhancing the action sequences and adding an element of sophistication to the film. The visual aesthetics of "Rebel Moon" are undoubtedly its strongest asset, showcasing Snyder's skill as a visual artist.In conclusion, "Rebel Moon" is a film that struggles to balance its stunning visuals with a compelling narrative. While it succeeds in creating a visually arresting cinematic experience, it falls short in delivering a story with depth and well-developed characters. The film feels like a missed opportunity, a spectacle that dazzles the eyes but fails to engage the heart and mind. For fans of Snyder's work and lovers of science fiction, "Rebel Moon" offers a feast for the eyes but leaves much to be desired in its storytelling.

title: Why the hate?
text: I typically don't write reviews, but I decided to due to being shocked by the multitude of negative reviews. I'm just an average movie watcher who enjoys sci-fi and action movies and I thought this was a great watch. Of course there was some fight choreography that was soso, and a few plot pieces that I personally didn't agree with, but overall it was worth the time.If you have liked anything else that Snyder has done, this isn't far from form. Epic vibes, slow motion fight scenes, and big special effects.I feel I'm starting to think nobody is satisfied these days. It's not perfect, but it's definitely entertaining.1-4 stars is truly egregious. Be for real.

title: I wanted to like this
text: To sum it up in two sentencesThe acting, writing and direction is terrible. The rest is pretty good. (Visuals)I do find it funny that the two characters who played Daenerys' from GoT lovers are both in the movie. I really liked the farmer guy in GoT but his character is so bland in this movie.Charlie hunnam is a complete joke, as usual. Pretty face, no talent. Is that his actual accent or is he "acting"? I can't tell.To sum it up, anytime I see Zak snyders name I set my expectations extremely low. I was not disappointed. This movie looks really cool but lacks any substance. The writing is completely predictable and boring. The acting and direction don't jive together whatsoever. I will watch part two in April for a few laughs after heavily drinking.

title: So much promise, so little delivery
text: Why is it so hard for modern sci-fi movies to get it right? The visuals are decent but that's about all I can recommend. The rest of this is a bit of a shambles of a completely haphazard plot that jumps and leaps about.Poorly written, characters that are empty and impossible to care about, implausible story jumps, disconnected leaps in locations that make no sense.The sense of disappointment was very real for me. I so wanted this to work but it wasn't to be for me. I watched the whole thing but after about the first hour it felt like self-punishment. To be honest, I wish I hadn't bothered.

title: Slow Mo Ridiculousness
text: Rebel Moon was over 2 hours but if you'd remove all the slow motion scenes it's probably more like 90 minutes... time that could have been used for world building and storytelling.The great sci-fi / fantasy movies have depth. This had none of that. Characters were shallow and unrelatable. I'm sure they have great background stories on paper in some Zack Snyder cabinet of curiosities, but they were not presented on screen... rather mentions of things that occurred in the past. No details.It really is a shame. I was looking forward to this but Zack Snyder just is not a great story teller. Disappointing.

title: Loved it and totally loved that the first movie set the stage so we can by engaged and ready for the 2nd
text: I had my whole family watch it with me and even my discerning teenagers thought it was a good one. I have no problem with it being a collaboration of different story plots from different movie through the years. After all, the original Star Wars a New Hope, was just a western in space. I have no issue that they use the first installment to build an understanding of the plot and how the characters fit into that overall plot. This in the end will enhance the future installments for me. I think a lot of the negative reviews are because individuals who make their living reviewing content of this nature see profit in cutting down something that the general population will probably love.

title: Really disappointing
text: This film had great potential butvit is so rushed and the story is so weak. None of the characters have any story creation and join the 'team' with barely any understanding as to why. The rushed nature of the film reminded me of GoT season 8. Should have been 3 parts with better writing and acting needed.If you want a supremely basic sci-fi action film then you should watch this. If you want something original with good acting and a story line worth your time then go watch Dune. In fact that is exactly what this is, a poor man's Dune merged with Star Wars. Please can I have my 2 hours wasted back?

title: Not as bad as I thought
text: Better than announced, this movie draws too much inspiration from lots of other popular sci-fi movies both in characters, but also design and seems to synthetic and cheap at times.I'm glad this is not a Star Wars movie as Znyder wanted it to be, as it has nothing to do with the Star Wars universe feeling.Though it can be a Dune series movie, as he draws a lot of inspiration from that too.Better stick to what you're good at, though?!All together, definitely a movie to watch at least once and now waiting for part 2 and the extended version, though I doubt it would change my perception on the series.

title: Why the hate?
text: This must have been based off a book for it to have such mixed reviews.As an avid Sci-Fi reader/watcher who had zero knowledge on the source material prior to watching this, I thought it was great!! I thought the action scenes were really well done, the universe/technology seems legit, and the characters had me interested in what happened to them.I also watched this with some family who are just average movie watchers and they thought it was entertaining as well!I am excited for April to see where they go with this in part two!Maybe in the future I will read the source material and understand why there is such mixed reviews, but at this point in time I thought it was great!

title: It's just bad
text: Oh man, the plot is so predictable, it seems like it was written by an amateur writer on their first attempt.The dialog is clumsy and unconvincing that is suitable for eleven year old.Despite the cast appearing to be respectful, it should be an embarrassment to them.Don't know much about Zack Snyders work, except his version of Justice league but even that was not exactly a masterpiece.The film is a mesh of copied films like Star Wars, Magnificent Seven and among others also a copy of Judas betrayal of Jesus story.The slow motion of action sequences are just the prolonging of the films disaster.If there were to be a second part this disaster of film, there will be colossal waste of funds, talent and time.

title: Goodness me
text: Goodness, this was so bad, that should be one top 10 worst movies of 2023. Stupid silly and meaningless dialogue, very bad acting from everyone, starts with a vague story, that gets folded within the next 10-15, and which make the movie so predictable afterwards. Too many mistakes, Kora is able to collect and assemble a small army within 1h. Action and fighting scenes were okes, nothing wow. The dialogue between the characters was rather annyoing and stupid. A complete waste of two hours, not sure when part two is coming out, but am definitely not looking forward. After too much buzz, end up with a complete waste of nothing.

title: Zack Snyder cooked!
text: "Rebel Moon" is a must-watch for any Zack Snyder fan. If you love his unique style and his ability to create visually stunning and action-packed films, you won't be disappointed. Don't let the poor critic reviews discourage you (they are shilling for Disney).Sofia Boutella's performance was truly surprising and emotionally impactful. Her portrayal of the character was nothing short of badass. She brought such depth and intensity to the role, and I was completely captivated by her on-screen presence.The score in "Rebel Moon" was so powerful and really added to the emotional impact of the movie. It's a shame that the film had to be cut down by Netflix. I'm really looking forward to seeing the director's cut when it comes out. I bet it'll give us even more insight into the story and characters.I totally see the potential for "Rebel Moon" to become a new franchise like Star Wars for our generation.

title: A beautiful looking mess
text: I'm a huge fan of Zack Snyder and I've seen 300 almost 300 hundred times and consider it one of greatest movies ever made. So I have nothing against Snyder.That being said, Rebel Moon is a monumental failure of epic proportions. What the f was Snyder thinking when he said this movie is the beginning of a planned trilogy and expansion of a fictional world he built.Someone stop him and get him some good stories to adapt as he is good at adapting other people's stories. Snyder has proved that he is a bad writer and reminds me of Dan Weiss and David Beniof, the notorious hacks who murdered Game of Thrones because of their incompetence.A mess is a mess, even if it's beautiful to look at.PSI just found out that the Part 2 has already been produced and will release in April. I have seen the trailer. Ladies and gentlemen, we are in for another bombastic disappointment.

title: Visually amazing....
text: But that's it.I wanted nothing more than to love a brand new sci-fi adventure series of films. This has pretty much zero chance of that happening now.The pacing was horrendous, as was the casting. I hate being overly critical of films in this way, but seriously, I've never seen a cast so unsuited to the story and the environment they were placed.The film progressed at the speed of a freight train smashing through multiple stranded trucks at crossings.It all felt so fake. It was only the visuals that made any of it somewhat believable (except a few odd frames). A sci-fi is never going to succeed if that is the case. Not many films have achieved this.I really wanted to enjoy this, but it ended up being a massive let down. Expected more from Snyder.Not sure I'll even give the next installment a go.

title: What Franchise Are You Ripping Off?
text: Are you trying to be Star Wars? Firefly? Indiana Jones fighting Nazis? The only redeeming quality of this movie is the visuals and even that is ruined in parts by being too overdone. The fight scenes are embarrassingly bad, characters are shallow and in many ways pointless. It's sad cause not gonna lie this has a great cast and the universe itself wants to be interesting so badly. But it's so horribly written and carried out that I can't see how this potential for a good franchise can be redeemed.This is going to be one of those movies that might be looked back on as one of the biggest missed opportunities. The worst part is this is a new completely fresh sci-fi universe would be awesome but this may end up preventing other studios from taking a risk on such a thing. Thanks to junk like this we may lose out on many more fresh IPs in the future.

title: Over-hyped, over-stylised, riddled with cliches and rubbish.
text: This film had me yawning about twenty minutes. I laughed at the many cliches, the ridiculous technology on display ( a gun that needs a hammer action, really?) the use of many South African extras with that awful nasal twang of an accent and a soundtrack lifted straight from some game with no leitmotif...nothing resembling the great Williams soundtracks. Boring, pretentious nonsense.The CGI was acceptable but not great. The acting was wooden. The script is just laughable. I felt no connection with this film...none. It did not blow me away the way Star Wars did back at the beginning of 1978. Even Star Wars and its light script is light years better than this stuff. You want to watch this...fine. If you are a young person grown up in the digital gaming age I suppose you will like it. People looking for more substantial science fiction might need to look elsewhere. Sorry.

title: Daario Naharis vs Daario Naharis and its good, involving and fun!
text: Very very good movie that had great storyline, good actors playing great characters, its an amazing adventure from start to finish and, what people forget, this is only part one!Star Wars wannabe they say.. i say its way more fun than star wars, only thing with star wars is that it hit cinema way way earlier.. this is way deeper story and better more fun movie!A girl, who is by the way played by beautiful actress who does her role great, becomes saved by small village on a distant planet, as movie goes we discover who she really is and it is a good good story, she goes on to form a group of defenders against mighty force.. yes its seen before, but what isnt?!This road is fun, interesting, original, and i just wanted to see general Titus fight in arena, that is only thing missing from this story!Great first movie that has nice base for future development, and Zack Snyder is the right man for the job.Enjoy it!

title: Sci-fi Cocktail Gone Horribly Wrong
text: I had such high hopes for this movie based off the trailer but this Sci-fi cocktail goes down more like Clamato than top shelf tequila.I will say that visually it's everything you'd expect and is very reminiscent of 300. That's where the comparisons to anything remotely watchable ends.It was as if you took Firefly, Star Wars, Blade Runner, and Willow, tossed them in a blender and hoped for the best. What you got instead was the worst.I will say that I am looking forward to part 2. I am dying to see if it is as off pudding as part 1. If so, at least MST3K will have a new film to watch on the satellite of love.

title: Disappointing
text: How does a movie with a big budget, respected director, good actors and storyline, that's taken influence from other popular movies, such as Star wars end up being so bad?It just feels rushed, mixed up and not very clear. There's talks of this having potential and an extended/ Directors cut but tbh, why would I want more of this mess? This is the version of the film that was decided to be released and it's just disappointing, for me a Zach Snyder film has always been a must watch, but now, I don't think I'll bother with part 2 and any future Zach Snyder film will need a lot more than his name and exciting trailor.If you need some Sci-fi "The Creator" is a much better watch.

title: Was this written by an LLM?
text: Probably not fair of me to review, since I could only tolerate the first 45 minutes of it, but, I figure the fact I found it so awful that I dumped out is worth a rate.By about the 20 minute mark, I was thinking, "if this doesn't become interesting by the 30 minute mark, I gotta find something that's less of a derivative mess". Naturally, this was about the point that the (oh so very cartoonish) bad guys showed up. That got me to decide, "at least there's some action, inbound, I'll give it to the 45m mark."I shouldn't have bothered. A movie that starts off with more narrator exposition than Dune 1984 is warning sign number one of what's to follow. Given that the exposition laid out a storyline that was, at best, derivative would be another warning.The casting was a who's who of "I know that guy" and "we cast this guy because we could afford the guy he looks like" actors struggling to deliver lifeless dialogue.The arrival of the bad guys didn't improve things. To call them one-dimensional is to credit them with more character development than they deserve. Skrein's character was, to be charitable, cartoonish. And while they could have gone camp with it, they chose not to. It felt like he was there to collect a paycheck and get off screen as soon as possible. His henchmen were even less well conceived: like "what awful things can we have these guys do, for no logical reason, to these peaceful, weaponless villagers to show everyone how bad these guys are as quickly as possible so we can move the story quickly onwards"It was not long after they were dispatch and the hero's journey had begun - and with zero increase in pacing, urgency or credible story development or acting that I decided to see what else might be available.I shudder to think how ponderous a "not edited to fit into two-ish hours" version of this might be.

title: It sucks
text: Dont watch. Its really bad. Don't let zack snyder make another one of this. Damn its bad. Give anyone the budget and let them try to do it better, anyone with love for science fiction ande i promise that they can't fail. Or they can't make it worse anyway, thats impossible. So now when i have wrote everything about this film (which is nothing) i have absolutely wrote everything you have to know about the film which is nothing except it truly sucks. And i mean the actors suck, the story telling is a joke. Now iam just filling in the 63 characters i have to fill in to be allowed to submit this review.

title: A great tease to what will eventually be great world building
text: Despite what you may read from the shallow and baseless pedantry, this movie is just starting the world building to what will be an epic for a silent many and an unfortunate miss for a loud few. Do not let the absurdly negative reviews, despite claims of multiple viewings, or the focus on the lead's physical attributes, cause any doubt or hesitation. Please check this movie out. Those who are used to limited series with many hours of story and plot formation may be disappointed as there is a lot to cover in a short amount of time, but please let your imagination provide what's missing and enjoy what's presented, instead of focusing on small flaws to ruin an entire experience. I am looking forward to part 2.

title: Nope!
text: Every overused sci-fi gimmick is overused in this film. Slow motion fight scenes for every fight scene. Faceless "guardsmen" that have no purpose. Robots with moral compasses. Cybernetics with no good reason to have them except tgey let us know that it the future.The characters are not likeable and I found myself wondering why I should care about them. They do alot of posing and that gives them advantages in a fight. There are some good actors in the cast that have nothing to work with in this movie.The plot is stale. I have seen it done before and so much better.The visuals and sound are great and the reason I gave it 3 stars.

title: Caffeine free diet Star Wars
text: Caffeine free diet Star Wars i.e. Colored water with bubbles. The plot was transparent and bland with a 100% predictable "twist." There were a couple of interesting characters, but mostly it was filled with clichés, particularly the cliché 90lb girl who takes out half a dozen men twice her size. So dumb! And of course the ending set up the "sequel" i.e. The same movie all over again. By modern standards (Rings of Poop, The Marvels), the movie was tolerable, but in relation to the well told stories of the past this is a two at best. Truly we are suffering through the dark ages of entertainment.

title: Its Really Bad
text: Straight out of the gates you could see this was not going to be a good movie. I hate seeing futuristic sci-fi movies mix advanced technologies vs pastoral civilizations. How can any superior space traveling civilization survive without any ability to feed itself? They fly from various planets to demand food from the locals? Wouldn't it be smarter for them to use their advanced skills to either make their own food or teach the locals to increase their production. Instead they fly across the cosmos to collect "bushels" of grain. Literally, flying light years and expending whatever fuel energy for what amounts to a few pieces of bread.The evil commander who just happens to be a white male is dressed in 1930s or 40's era military wardrobe. I wasn't sure if I was watching Hitler vs the slaves of Egypt here. Again the implication is that a superior and advanced military force cannot beat rag tag collection of misfits.I've read this was a take on the Seven Samurai which is a fantastic story. But that movie sets the samurai against warlords of the same period. Same skills and same equipment etc. You didn't have to question every single that gets thrown onto the screen as you have to with Rebel Moon.2 Stars for CGI.

title: Absolutely awful.
text: The one star is for Charlie who always will get something from me, even though he is wrong for and totally wasted in his role here.For the reportedly exorbitant cost Netflix spent in the making this schlock - funds that could no doubt have fed several beleaguered villages or 5 for a few years - it is really even more poor. Wasted money and wasted cast. Even the CGI effects are not super duper, again, considering cost to make.If you are on your sleepy time meds and just want to give them time to kick in while you are in your LaZ boy then ok, this movie is for you. Otherwise, don't waste your popcorn.

title: Bad very very bad waste of time, laughable
text: There is not a single good thing to say about this movie.Horrible acting, horrible cheesy regurgitated lines, trash characters, bad world building, the plot line is lost a dozen times at least.Fighting for a tiny village on a random planet that will just be attacked again. The general of the fleet has time to babysit these "heroes" of the village. Guess they're not too all-powerful bc he has nothing better to do. The movie could've started at the 1 hour mark but it manages to be 2 hours long due to every other scene being in slow motion.I'd only recommend this movie to someone if I was torturing them.All main characters are human because they don't want to have to deal with any cgi or costume creation. All characters are caucasian except 2 people.For all the actors and actresses in this movie... RENT WAS DUE HAHA.Not a single unique element to this movie except the ugly scorpion-style torture holder robo machine.I'd say there are many stolen themes from Star Wars but that would be an insult to the Star Wars movies as a whole. It's like a chewed up and spit out replication.All this to say, a typical Zack Snyder movie. Or however you spell his name. Forgettable.

title: More soulless, terribly-written, blown budget garbage from ZZZzzzack
text: Here's a free, wonderful tip to save all you newbie film buffs the grief of wasting time watching a dud: IF THE FILM BEGINS WITH SOMEONE NARRATING THE PREMISE VIA VOICE-OVER YOU CAN TURN IT OFF IMMEDIATELY AND MOVE ON TO ANOTHER FILM, because this is LITERALLY the very clearest sign of TERRIBLE storytelling. That's basically also a free tip for any writer aspiring to NOT SUCK.A director/writer who has tact and imagination will immediately engage and draw you into a story with the plot and action elements themselves, letting the story tell itself naturally. Having to explain why you're making a movie right at the start of it is a clear sign the story is going NOWHERE and that the storytellers know that their story isn't engaging enough. Michael Bay, a very similar director, typically all glitz and glam, not much substance (with the notable exceptions of Black Sails and 13 Hours, which were phenomenal, if not, outright surprising standouts in his portfolio), employing a similar approach in Transformers: Dark Side of the Moon, with Optimus Prime or whoever narrating the beginning of the movie with voice-over, explaining stuff in an attempt to engage the viewer, and resulting in a similarly dogwater film. Explaining why you're telling the story rather than simply using the chosen medium of film to actually SHOW it is like a chef giving you mouthwash to have ready for after you taste something... You could just as soon start the story with "Once upon a time a bunch of really cool stuff happened that you might have cared about, just take our word for it... but stick around for some nice special effects!". Learn from the greats, and if you have something to tell the audience about your premise do so more artfully than a voice-over insert - just write a short synopsis for what they need to know at the beginning, like Star Wars, or Gladiator. But, honestly? Most of the time it's better to just jump into the story and let the audience figure it out for themselves, since it really is part of the fun, as it keeps the audience more actively engaged and invested. This applies to ALL forms of storytelling, whether it be comic books, novels, tv series or films, and writers with actual talent learn this before all other narrative devices, but clearly Zack Snyder and his team simply have none. So they lean on and rely heavily upon blown effects budgets.In this day and age it is beginning to seem as if our only hope is that some of these DOGWATER directors and writers like Zack Snyder and this utterly hopeless lot learn to rely ENTIRELY on AI to create their scripts and worlds, since the clearly have neither tact, talent nor imagination, let alone any sense of originality. Zack does very well with overall production aspects and visual capture, and I would write and creatively direct alongside him readily, but he couldn't storytell his way out of wet paper bag and there is plenty of evidence of this shortcoming.300 was merely a translation of Frank Miller's solid storyboard, and likewise Man of Steel/Batman vs Superman/Justice League and Watchman clearly had mountains of material available to translate to the screen. Dawn of the Dead was a fun ride, but, despite it being one of my favourite zombie hikes, let's not get the illusion that this was remarkable film-making, it was simply a solid re-telling of a classic Romero zombie romp. Those films I would consider passable entrees in the realm of blown effects budgets, but then you stumble upon Sucker Punch. The first film he directed with full creative control using his own ideas for a storyboard. AND IT WAS ONE OF THE MOST HAMMERED GARBAGE FILMS I'VE EVER SEEN.Zack seems to do great with taking other people's storyboards and glamourizing them on screen, throwing in his usual barrage of bullet-time effects, lens flare and colour filters, and in many of those aforementioned films does a great job of capturing lasting visuals, and I genuinely did enjoy most of those, even the Superman stuff, but his talent seems to reach the end of its rope with translation-to-screen adaptation, as he comes up with some of the most bizarre and cliched ideas when he's left to his own devices, first witnessed with Sucker Punch, and now with this alarmingly self-indulgent foray into his own saga with Rebel Moon, HEAVILY reminiscent of the shallowness of the former. (To think Netflix would commit to a saga of these duds... CRINGY). He really gets way too stuck up on this idea of what his characters will all look like when they're hanging out together, and pays little attention to anything but, adding story as an afterthought as he attempts to conceive of ways to glorify their coolness while remainly utterly oblivious to the futility of this endeavour if the storyline itself isn't similarly engaging. Piecing together action scenes and visuals IS NOT STORYTELLING. It's just shooting scenes. Scenes don't make a story, STORY makes a story. It's like he gets too focused on trying to make his characters look cool, which backfires, BECAUSE NO CHARACTER IS COOL WHEN THEY'RE IN A DOGWATER SCRIPT. PERIOD. My best recommendation to Zack, who I DO feel has a talent for capturing visuals in a particular way, would be to completely step back from any of the storytelling and writing aspects of his productions, reckognize his lack of talent therein, and leave those aspects to people with actual VISION. Here is clearly the difference between a cinematographer and an actual director and/or writer. Clearly not everybody is Ridley Scott, as much as they may aspire to be.So, we end up with another bunch of characters Zack personally thinks look cool, and he tries the typical "put a bunch of dramatic music and slow motion and close-ups of people crying" on top of a lot of unrelatable story, as protagonists have zero depth and villains are clearly inhuman and fully unbelievable, taking cliched actions to clarify their bad guy status, and has his ensemble cast overract all of it in minimal takes so that he can stretch his effects budget as far as possible, since he knows from practice that they will be the only redeeming quality of his final product.This film is literally just 2 hours and 20 minutes of full-on character introductions and NOTHING IS HAPPENING AT ALL THAT I CARE ABOUT. Some bad guys messed up the place where some good guys were hanging out all innocent and peaceful and now the good guys suddenly feel compelled to take action, forced to fight by little more than the whim of the directionless scriptwriter, since it would seem there's plenty of other places these people could go that appear largely untouched by these bad guys, but they can't do that because then there would be no "movie" to speak of, so let's have the characters embark on some inexplicable quest to go gather more characters, making sure that anyone they add to the ensemble looks maybe cool, the cast literally standing around with vacant expressions, their characters apparently looking for something to do, often just suddenly appearing somewhere else randomly as they are introduced to another trivial scene or action sequence as the camera abruptly, gracelessly cuts to it without explanation or any intriguing journey on the part of the ensemble to arrive there, then after 2 hours and 20 minutes of this presumably we have a reason we want to watch these characters do something that has some sort of story in the sequel? OH and let's not forget, a recent new standard for minimal effort sci-fi of thise variety: put a few random, derivative aliens and alien creatures here and there to remind people that they're watching a sci-fi movie, since not much else will... What are we signing on for here? Is our time and monthly subscription fee not worth anything to Netflix and Zack Snyder?Pisses me off to see garbage directors and producers getting paid big money for wasting people's time, and clearly I'm not alone.Some poor dude in another review: "I just want to see some good sci-fi...", I can literally read the despair, as we see trash like Rebel Moon and The Creator blowing huge budgets alongside all of Disney's armada of Marvel and Star Wars trash, literally slow-crushing the imagination of an entire generation to the point where long-time sci-fi and superhero fans feel like these genres are entirely and hopeless spent. I truly do feel that pain. The deep cold of a vaccuum of imagination and originality. Powerlessly throwing away heaps of cash at anything and everything in hopes that one day someone will finally deliver us the way Peter Jackson did with Lord of the Rings, and Ridley Scott did with Alien before that. Only goes to show how much praise the ACTUAL great storytellers deserve, because, trust, it IS an art, the highest form of art, one that combines all other forms of art in its final form, THE SCREENPLAY, gathering all the visual arts, technology, literature, world-building, performance, music and presentation all in one final product to feed the mind and soul in these few precious moments we have left to enjoy.

title: A completely mediocre, predictable film, all ideas stolen from other franchises!
text: A completely mediocre, predictable film, all ideas stolen from other franchises! The film promotes racism, where all the white male characters are cruel or useless. The plot develops slowly and meaninglessly. The dialogue is boring, like all the characters whose motivations are not clear. Everything is sad, pathetic and without a sense of humor. Who wrote the script for this film? 10 year old child? Why has the level of modern cinema fallen so low? Why, when I watch films made before 2010, I enjoy it and want to watch it again, but I can't watch films of recent years to the end??? Filmmakers have forgotten how to craft and began to churn out soulless one-day films.

title: Big miss from Snyder
text: I really wanted to like this, but too many things went wrong from the get go. I'm not a Star Wars fanboy, but I do like the original trilogy. I really like some of those cheezy Star Wars clones/ ripoffs from the 70's and 80's. I really like low and big budget sci-fi movies from all eras. That being said.There's something wrong with the script and screenplay of this movie. Through out the movie it is telling what is what and not showing. And it makes this feel sluggish and boring. Witch is weird because it's a sci-fi action movie that is quite fast paced (even with all that slow motion). It also feels that scenes are just slap together.Characters don't have enough time to make their mark and that makes them meaningles. It's hard to feel for loss if you have no connection to the character.I can't tell if the actors are just wrongly casted or is the director really not up for it? Dialogue delivery is flat and actors are posing in "cool postures". Lead actress is frowning almost all the time and it feels weird.I also think it looks good at some occasions but effects are over used in many places. Things like lens flare and shallow depth of field. One thing about the shallow depth of field is that it looks like it is done at the post production. It is not filmed like that. Cgi is mostly good, but there are places and scenes where they should have try to make designs better.If you are a sci-fi movie fan go and watch it. Wouldn't recommend it for others.

title: It's not a movie
text: This is not a movie. It is a video game. It's really a shame that this is what Netflix and so many other streamers have come to. This is dollars to stockholders and eventually even this pitiful effort will be replaced by artificial intelligence screenwriters. The special effect in fight scenes are the worst. Befor every kill, we get a stop action grimace and war face from the plasticky actor or actress. Battle scenes are slow motion to even more enhance the cartoonish lack of quality in the story. The cast caught my eye and I decided to watch. Even a boatload of A list stars didn't help one little bit. Sorry I wasted my time on it.

title: How has this got past Lucas lawyers?
text: This is a mind numbingly waste of time film. Take out all of the typical (ridiculous) Snyder slow-motion and it would be half as long, which would be a blessing. It's so close to a certain story in a galaxy far, far away that we ended up playing rip-off Bingo - luckily not as a drinking game as we'd have serious liver damage by now. It's so obvious it's the failed pitch Snyder made to Lucas Films and Disney studios, I can only assume they let it go into production because they knew how pathetic it was. Honestly, I don't usually get vitriolic like this over a film, but I really wanted to enjoy this, I should have known with Snyder at the helm it would be... rubbish.

title: So bad, it baffles...
text: One dimensional people, no characters (yep, you read that correctly), disconnected scenes with no discernible commonality to one another, a plot that doesn't exist, a diegesis (fictional world) that is inconsistent and non-sensical topped off with the laziest screenplay and tired, predictable tropes with no reason to be there. The cinematography is infuriating, everything is largely slow motion for undisclosed reasons, the scenes appear to have no direction which leaves the viewer watching some fight scenes with bad guys literally stood by, waving their arms before moving now it is their turn to be defeated by an entirely unbelievable hero person, in whom you have no interest because you don't understand her reason for fighting by virtue of not knowing anything of her back story. I had high hopes for this film, hoping it might be another Rogue 1. What it is, is a melange of puff pieces with some cracking CGI that is framed poorly, populated by people you know nothing about and care even lass about their goals in a universe that makes no sense and is so disconnected, it feels like a riot of short, unconnected stories with no plot or resolution. This film is egregious.

title: Rebel Moon: Snyder's Visionary Sci-Fi Landscape
text: I had the privilege of attending the Los Angeles Premiere of "Rebel Moon" on December 13th and a subsequent viewing on December 15th at the Netflix Egyptian Theater in LA. This gave me a unique perspective to appreciate the depth and nuances of Zack Snyder's latest creation. Junkie XL's (Tom Holkenborg) score elevated the narrative to epic proportions. Snyder's use of slow motion, a signature element of his directorial style, adds a dramatic flair to the action scenes, though at times it can slightly overshadow the storyline's momentum. The compact 2-hour cut of the film is a tantalizing glimpse into what the extended R-rated version, coming this summer, promises to unfold. A significant aspect of "Rebel Moon" is its divergence from the often-made Star Wars comparisons. While there are elements that may feel familiar to fans of the space opera genre, "Rebel Moon" establishes its own mythology and world-building. The universe created by Snyder is not just an imitation; it's a unique, self-contained cosmos with its own lore and rules. The influence of "Heavy Metal", "Excalibur", and anime adds layers to the visual storytelling, making it a rich, textured cinematic experience. Sofia Boutella shines as Kora, bringing a magnetic presence to the screen. Ray Fisher's portrayal of Darrien Bloodaxe and Ed Skrein's embodiment of the Admiral are performances that resonate long after the film ends. The ensemble cast synergizes to bring this imaginative universe to life, each adding a distinct flavor to the narrative's tapestry. The anticipation for the extended R-rated cut, releasing this summer, is high, promising an even more detailed exploration of this rich universe. The film is a testament to Snyder's visionary filmmaking, distinguished by its unique aesthetic, compelling performances, and a score that resonates with epic grandeur. It's more than a sci-fi film; it's a bold new chapter in the genre, promising to captivate audiences with its originality and depth.

title: Horridly appalling garbage
text: I had heard positive feedback and recommendations for this movie and that's all I knew about it, so I was expecting a good film with some beautiful sci-fi, but boy of boy could one be more astonished and shocked to see such absolute incoherent dreadful garbage this "movie" is. Halfway through, I had to keep reminding and convincing myself that I was still watching the same movie, a Snyder movie, with top tier cast, otherwise I would've believed it to be an exceptionally foul nightmare.None of this makes any sense. Characters are laughable at best. Fight scenes were some of the most difficult to watch I can remember. The spaceships, space travel, the empire.. yeah, nah dude.Just.. I'm out of words.

title: This was so bad I stopped watching halfway through.
text: The preview made it look interesting and I was looking forward to watching it.Big budget, reputed director, known actors, what could go wrong?This plot has been done so often that it makes you wonder how this project was approved.Overwhelming force of bad guys mistreat a village who want to defend themselves and they go out recruiting special people to help defend it...The acting was so bad and dialog so cringy its borderline a parody but nothing is funny about it.Its like a very expensive B rated movie.The only reason I put 2 star is because the cinematography is excellent.Couldn't finish part 1, part 2 will definitely not be on my watch list.Cheers.

title: Just not good
