text: First off, let me say I wanted this movie to be good. I enjoy Star Wars and some of Zack Snyder's movies, so I thought this had potential. That potential is completely wasted on a mashup story of Star Wars and Akira Kurosawa's Seven Samurai, horrible acting, and terrible action scenes.The story is never fleshed out, with every character's story being almost completely forgotten. Their motivations are either completely lost or make no sense whatsoever. Many of the scenes just don't fit in the movie, like the straight up Greek mythology griffin scene or the medieval spider woman in a cyberpunk setting. The most confusing scene is the ending, where you see the main characters on horseback in the distance while the robot from the beginning of the movie appears with deer antlers on its head.The acting, especially the guy who plays Darian Bloodaxe, is just abysmal. Every line he has is delivered as if he were screaming The Declaration of Independence in a historical reenactment. Charlie Hunnam uses at least three different accents for his character throughout the movie, and the main character starts out trying to speak with a normal American tone but switches to a Latino accent for the last quarter of the movie.The action is constantly bogged down and non-immersive due to Snyder's need to add slow-mo every 30 seconds. He goes way overboard with it in this movie, which honestly makes it difficult to enjoy in any capacity. On top of that, the choices he makes on which scenes to slow down are rather odd.Overall, it's just not a good movie. You would think the first part of a multi-part series would take the time to provide backstory for it's important characters, but you really only learn who they all are when the "big twist" happens with about half an hour left in the movie, and is just glanced over at that. If you can ignore gaping plot holes and apply a huge amount of suspension of disbelief, you may enjoy this movie. Otherwise, you may want to spend 2 hours doing something else.

title: I loved it and can't wait for the longer cut!
text: I really enjoyed the film. You can tell there is alot of story here. Like all Snyder films the photographic aspect of this film is amazing. It is beautiful from first to last shot. Also like all Snyder films the action scenes are light years past anything else. They have built a universe here and I want to explore more of it. If I had to list a negative statement it would be in the first hour I felt the tempo of the film was quite quick but I think that's probably because there is another hour of part one that we did not see as they are releasing it as the directors cut. I can't wait till part 2.

title: hard to watch
text: At the beginning it looked promising with a star wars vibe. Almost promising. Cast, cinematography, costumes, colors... about the middle i started getting bored and fast forwarding dialogues. About the end i started to realize im forcing muself to watch this and kept looking how much time left.Truth is the plot could be filmed much better. Film is very dependent on characters but most are really uninteresting.pace is bad and makes you feel as if the plot can never have a conclusion.Using dark colors dont make the movie dark. You need realistic and dark behaviour and heart strangling scenes. You need mystery.

title: We really shouldn't give this 5 stars
text: This movie is really bad. I can forgive bad writing, bad CGI, if it was still entertaining but it wasn't . Visually uncreative, action choreography is so boring, plot just randomly move forward, characters don't have any development beside some cut scenes and what other characters tell about them. And weirdly, every character is hot? Like for what? Even farmers on a desert planet are buffed up. Music is uninspiring. Way too many slow mo shots for no darn reason. Like every small action like putting on a cape gets a slow mo. And because the pacing is so slow and lack of reason to root for any characters, you just don't have any will to watch this 2.5h movie. Better spend your time rewatching Dune or Guardians of the galaxy.I do always get excited for an original story. But this movie doesn't do anything to entice viewers to leaner more about the world or characters.I give this movie 1 star bc I believe we shouldn't reward mediocrity.

title: Form over Substance: A Sci-Fi Mashup
text: Some reviewers here have implored people to go in with an open mind, unburdened by unrealistic expectations. Well, that's exactly what I did. I had no idea this movie existed until Netflix smacked me in the face with a full screen promo yesterday. Being a sci-fi fan, I hit Play.I only lasted for about an hour before it almost put me to sleep. Even zero expectations don't help.So what's wrong? The plot, the dialogue and the characters, in short. I'm not a sophisticated moviegoer, I don't expect a breathtaking journey out of every film, and yet I just couldn't take this one seriously. It felt like someone asked ChatGPT to write a screenplay with elements of their favorite movies. It felt like a 14-year-old wanted to mash up bits of several well-known plotlines and put a ton of VFX on top. It felt like some many other Netflix productions that need to spoonfeed exposition to viewers. It didn't work for me.The story's all over the place, like a first draft that someone was supposed to process into something compelling. Characters felt clichéd and two-dimensional, with zero development, no subtlety, nothing to make me care about them or their quest.I'll give it one more try just for the visuals' sake, but I'm probably not holding my breath for sequels.

title: Imploring for Snyder to retire
text: I was so excited for new sci fi IP this year - the Creator and Rebel Moon both offered that. Both missed the mark, but this isn't a review for the Creator.Rebel Moon missed every single shot it took. The story lacks any amount of believability nor does it offer anything or anyone worth cheering for. The protagonist does nothing to win over the audience and the writing around her makes no sense. The journey to gather the classic "elite force" is rushed and painfully stereotypical. The antagonist is vague, lacking purpose, and overtly stupid. The entire plot of the movie is literally hinging on GRAIN, and it's a futuristic sci fi. Literally everything is based on GRAIN.There is so much missing from this movie, and everyone on an executive level involved in this movie should call it quits.

title: My wife even liked it
text: I am a big fan of the 7 samurai storyline. Loved Magnificent seven, and I loved this version as well. The visual are stunning. The CGI is the best I have seen all year. The villain is fantastic. I love the story. I felt like it was definitely a fresh take in space. This movie is everything the Star Wars sequels could have been. I honestly don't know why it's getting all the hate from top critics who liked magnificent seven. I am glad Snyder makes movies for his fans and not the critics. I don't understand why Snyder gets the hate he gets. You don't have to like his fans to like his movies. Give it a watch, you won't be disappointed. And like I said in the headline. My wife even liked it.

title: Shameless and unnecessary
text: I read all the negative reviews from the movie critics and then some rave reviews from the regular folks and decided to see it for myself, see whose ratings are closer to the truth. There have been many movies canned by the critics but still worth a watch. Not this one. In my opinion, the critic's reviews win by a landslide here. This movie, maybe, just maybe, could have served as an unnecessary episode of Star Wars movie collection, but if not produced at all, wouldn't have made any difference to the cinematic world. There's nothing new here to see, nothing new to tell just the shamelessly plagiarized George Lucas material which looks comically tired in this rendering. A waste of time.

title: BORED AND JUST PPHHHFFFF..Bored
text: Sci - fi horror is my favourite genre of movies to watch, but any Sci - Fi i still love. I seen a few of the clips of this being advertised and i added it to my watchlist. There isnt much good Sci - Fi going around just now. Unless you like stuff thats scared of hurting your feelings, or stuff that just has to tick all there diversity and equality boxes.But im 30mins into this already and this id exactly which ive just mentioned im not going to go threw it all as youve all seen it before and thats what will make this crash and burn like the rest. It looks great, but theres no soul,heart. Or anything of substance to this. Its souless.I cant even write a proper review because there isnt anything to review its that bad. If it wasnt for the good effects etc, then it would be closer to a B or C movie. Thats about it, and about as much as i can say.

title: They slow mo'd a slow mo. Ughh!
text: As a sci fi geek I was excited. As a person with a functioning brain, I couldn't even finish it. It disappointed almost immediately and then became hilarious. When even making fun of how bad it was couldn't get me through, I just had to stop.The unnecessary exposition. The endless unwarranted slow motion. Terrible tentacle CG. Ughh!Perhaps it was a children's movie and intelligent, critical folk, with developed tastes are just not the demographic.Perhaps there's a black and white R rated directors cut somewhere that wasn't committee'd to death and mass appealed ad nauseam. You guys remember Jupiter Rising? Yeah exactly.I really looked forward to this film. Oh well.

title: If only those good slow motion shots were enough!
text: At an independent planet named Veldt, the chief occupation of a village is farming and the grains are sold to the army of Motherland as well as the rebelling group Bloodaxe. When Admiral Noble demands that all the grains to he sold to the Motherland, the offer is turned down by the village chief declines the offer. When it leads to violence and a deadline of 10 months to fulfill the deal, rebellious Kora steps upto form an army of her own to fight back the brutal army of Motherland. How she succeeds in finding the right warriors for her army forms rest of the story.Zack Snyder has come up with not so unique yet gripping story, of the chosen one handpicking powerful warriors to form an army. It's a world terrorized by the Motherland empire and has various life forms. The idea definitely clicks but the execution falters big time. Snyder fails to deliver a single memorable character including the main lead to root for. The screenplay is as basic as one could expect and the style quotient is amped up. There were several cool shots which we typically expect from Snyder and that is all the film delivered. The action scenes remained generic and devoid of highs. There is more to the story, to be narrated in part 2 but as far as part 1 goes, the efforts didn't really set the film apart from similar films that exist.

title: Title: "Rebel Moon: A Galactic Disaster"
text: "Rebel Moon" is an absolute catastrophe that leaves audiences questioning why anyone greenlit this abomination. The film is a soulless attempt at space opera, boasting very poor direction, a laughably weak storyline, and actors who deliver performances so artificial they make you cringe.Wooden Performances: The blame falls squarely on the shoulders of the director and writers as even talented actors are forced into delivering lines with wooden expressions, wooden language, and wooden dialogue. The lack of urgency, expression, fear, or anger on the actors' faces is a testament to the disastrous combination of direction and writing.Dreadful Visual Effects: Despite the occasional commendable visual effects, the majority of the film looks like a poorly executed high school production. It's mind-boggling how a movie made 46 years ago can outshine "Rebel Moon" in effects, background, and laser scenes. The CGI is downright bad, turning what could have been a visually stimulating experience into an eyesore.Action in Slow-Motion: The action sequences, purportedly the film's strength, are sabotaged by the inexplicable decision to employ slow-motion throughout. This not only drains the life out of the scenes but also leaves the audience wondering how a movie with so much action can be so mind-numbingly boring.Plot Devices and Inconsistencies: The film is riddled with plot devices that conveniently place characters where they need to be. The illogical stealth of mile-long ships and the absurd capture of the protagonist by a slow robot are glaring examples of lazy writing. The decision to cloak everything in darkness only serves to hide the atrocious action scenes.In conclusion, "Rebel Moon" is a disaster of epic proportions. Save yourself from this cinematic nightmare and take a hard pass. Zack Snyder's attempt at something different has resulted in a misfire of astronomical proportions.

title: Please don't release the Snyder's cut
text: Typical Snyder: endless slow motion, uselessly overcomplicated scenario, poor hero psychology and caricatural archs.Presenting it as a potential Star Wars heir couldn't be farther from the results. It's closer to the bad movies from the Riddick trilogy, except that Riddick didn't take it too seriously. I don't know what else to add as it's so poor. Oh yes, another dispensable Netflix movie, adding to a long list and proving that Netflix doesn't know how to do a good movie.Watch back a Star Wars instead. The story is simple but powerful, the actors show feelings, the style doesn't age. Start again Snyder. Or don't.

title: Why the hate?
text: I honestly enjoyed the movie. Yes, there are elements from other movies like Star Wars, Dune etc.. but who cares? You watch a movie to be entertained and that's how I looked at it.. a good 2 hours entertainment. Stop comparing to other movies and take it as a different story with different characters. The story could have been improved I agree, but you start getting attached to some of the characters who have their own stories. Take it as it is and stop comparing to other movies or finding resemblances. It is what it is, a smaller budget film and on Netflix .. not a Lucas film. I already can't wait for part 2.

title: A Colossal Waste of Space
text: I have always like Snyder's style. His Justice League cut was epic, I loved Watchmen and 300 and I even hold a smallish candle for SuckerPunch.Unfortunately, either Snyder was on some crazy class-A narcotics the whole time he wrote and directed this infinitely derivative gruel, or he's spending way too much time with Uwe Boll. Eitherway, Rebel Moon was as lazy and disrespectful to the Sci-Fi movie genre as it gets outside of the Marvelous Disney Wars Cinematic Universe.There is almost nothing to recommend this movie, especially if you've seen any retelling of the Seven Samurai or any half-decent good guys fight bad guys in space movies. I mean, it might have been better if Snyder simply admitted he was remaking Battle Beyond the Stars and stuck to that script at least.Without being too spoilery, here's a random handful of the most bilious bile Rebel Moon prettily projectile vomits at you:The most disappointing aspect to Rebel Without a Clue is its character development; everyone is introduced with such carelessness that of course, it's impossible to care about them. The only back-story is Rey's... sorry, Gamora's... sorry, Korra's... sorry, Kora's, and even that had all the depth and emotional history of a used sheet of toilet paper. No-one is likeable, except Westworld's Sir Lord Dame Anthony Hopkins the robot, which is ironic, don'tchathink?Actually, I hope C3PO winds up killing every human on the Moon in Rebel Moon Part II: The Unscargiven, because they're clearly not actually worth saving.

title: The not Star Wars, girl boss of fire.
text: I think the writers and director all worked independently on this movie. This is just a collections of scenes that are loosely stitched together to prepare for the coming of the space Jesus, gender swapped of course. If you ever want to see a 5'4'' girl boss kick the life out of foes twice her size, every single male protagonist sits and watches, this is the film for you. Maybe you're thinking she's an augment, with bioengineered body parts, a super hero with powers that allows her to slow down time or something, there has to be an explanation for all the slow motion right? Right? Well no. You're out of luck. She just trained really hard.How does she know how to move through the storyline? Well she just does. Why these specific people? Wait till the last 30 minutes to get all of that. Ok just skip to the last 30 minutes of the film and you will not be wasting 90 minutes of your life to get the same information.If you're there for the special effects, that's the only thing you will enjoy. No actual story or meaningful character arcs there. I mean why bother with a storyline eh?Just imagine a girl boss that was supposed to be a Jedi getting set up to bring the coming for a gender swapped space Jesus but couldn't because they could get the license for a Star Wars movie and you basically have this steaming piece of ... film.

title: Written by an early AI? Dull, unoriginal and amateurish
text: I guess Zack Snyder just asked ChatGPT to 'write' Rebel Moon using Star Wars as the main input.There is even a lightsabre style weapon.It is shamelessly derivative.What is with the endless slow motion? I haven't measured but I'd estimate about 15% of the film is in slo-mo. It's jarring and unnecessary. I might venture it is to pad the runtime out but at way over 2 hours the film is far too long.The worst things though are that it is narratively incohesive and very dull, things happen for no reason other than to insert some fight scene or FX which flip in and out of slo-mo because.... I dunno.I had to watch it in three sittings as it just cannot hold the viewers attention. A good third of the movie is the protagonist building a team, during which nothing happens to progress the story.Perhaps that's why there is such a lot of randomly inserted scenes, to try and distract from the tedium, it doesn't work.A special mention for Charlie Hunnam's Irish accent, it makes me cringe for him.Snyder won't care but he has become the big budget Uwe Boll.

title: Starwars, meets Warhammer, meets 7 samurai, meets firefly
text: Honestly this was great for a proposed series turned 2 part film. I can not wait till we get the rated R version. The tech is very fun and the ships remind me of Yamato. Warhammer influences drip heavy from it with the armor styles and home world references. 7 samurai is rife through the story plot with strong representation in the heros. I would have liked to see more depth to the characters but understand that cuts had to be made to fit run times and would have loved to see it in it's series format. I hope that the next chapter makes up for the cuts that had to be made. And honestly after what snyder did to the justice league I believe he has earned some latitude.

title: Why was this so bad?!?
text: I am huge fan of Snyder mainly because 300 and Watchmen. Two of my favourites movies. I am always looking for his new movie and this one especially. Oh but this movie is such a mess. There is barely enough dialogs to fill 2 sheets of paper but we have countless slow mo scenes just for sake to be there. There is 0 character development, everybody is so dumb and dialogues are like from Nickleodeon movie. CGI itself is not bad but composition looks strange in some scenes. Sometimes it looks like you are warching some thather play and not a movie. In some scenes there is really strange camer with like fish eye effect. You don't feel any connection with any of the characters because you barely know them, but at the end of the movie they all are like avengers. I didn't know their name by the end. There is no sense of time or urgency. They are just flying from planet to planet find exactly who and what they want to find and sk on. Biggest postivie of thid movie is Ed Skrein who drag this movie by himself. So many great actors in this movie, totally wasted potential.

title: Rip off of Seven Samurai
text:
Basically Seven Samurai in space, but will very poorly developed characters, unconvincing action, and a very wooden lead. To be honest, it was complete rubbish! Very disappointing.......

title: Worse than both "Valerian" AND "Jupiter Ascending" Combined
text: So boring I fell asleep.Honestly! I did fall asleep and had to rewatch this a second time. I almost couldn't bare the experience mentally a second time. Although the photography is visually acceptable. All the Snyderisms* (the abundant and rediculously uninspiring slow motion sequences) gets boring after a while. Some scenes are just deplorable as it seems that the direction was made by autistic third graders.This is a BAD movie. So bad it should be taxed with Co2 penalties.Yes! Computers rendering the CGI produces Co2 by using electricity. And results as this worthless film is pure pollution.

title: Probably Zack Snyder's most uninspiring piece of work! [+30%]
text: Zack Snyder's Rebel Moon: Part One is a less-than-middling space opera, comprised of a series of moments that lack connective tissue. I also have to blame Netflix for turning this into a watered down PG-13 moment-fest instead of a film that has a proper beating heart. Snyder and his team of writers judiciously borrow from every space franchise to ever exist, but fail to add any distinctive spins to their plot or characters.It also doesn't help that they've hired the most mid set of actors who struggle to stand out with the material they're handed. As a result, the film sticks out as a tepid origin story with a mission-driven approach, most of which revolves around a recruitment spree. This alarmingly reeks of repetition, with each character getting a token set-piece to prove their worth but having no payoffs in the final act.And speaking of that final act, the edit department has done an absolutely shoddy job. What is supposed to come off as a battle of few-against-many majorly ends up revolving around a tame showdown between Kora (a wooden Sofia Boutella) and the antagonist admiral (Ed Skrein). The only time Snyder's action choices made me look was in that first breakout set-piece which has comparatively more to do with hands and less with space guns. The heavier usage of laser-spitting guns works within the PG-13 environment, but this story, if at all, had to have some innovative knife-fights & hand-to-combat. That's now how it goes, unfortunately.Forget the storytelling; Snyder's vision of this fictional space-world doesn't bring anything new to the table from an audio-visual perspective either. This also might be one of the few instances where I didn't enjoy Junkie XL's score either. The constant orchestral score didn't do much for me.Verdict: Not looking forward to Part 2. But, I know I'll watch it anyway. Honestly, not even a "Snyder Cut" can save this one.

title: You all need to acquire some PATIENCE
text: First of all see it for yourselves and form your own opinion.Everyone is yelling there is no new intellectual property and when something new arrives everyone starts yelling its crap.Have you even seen whole movie???Yes it is first part of two and in short it can be summed up as getting the band together, gathering main characters, getting to know them a little, their back story and motivations.Plot is not very sophisticated, but the execution is fantastic, visuals are gorgeous, music is appropriate.What else do you need really? It is the beginning of hopefully great new space opera type of movie series.So acquire some patience and see where it goes from here!I enjoyed it so far and will definitely see second part, hoping its as good if not better.

title: Possibly The Worst Film Ever Made.
text: Netflix's trigger happy mentality when it comes to funding meets, 'this will be good simply because it's a famous director/derivative of a famous movie/s'.The result? One of the most insulting things I've ever seen. It rivalled The Room in terms of how bad a script can be. I can't think of a movie that has a weaker plot with plot holes the size of the grand canyon. The actors in this are usually solid so it's baffling how terrible they come across in this. Career killing if I'm honest. It doesn't look the worst which is its only saving grace, but when you look beneath the surface there is a hollow shell of a movie with the worst writing I've ever experienced.Anyone who has any ambitions to become a filmmaker or writer should watch this as an example of what NOT to do.Ps, I'd fully endorse watching David Lynch's Dune 100 times on repeat while hanging upside down and getting punched in the guts by Mike Tyson before I'd recommend this.

title: The most unoriginal space opera ever
text: Visionary director Zack Snyder is giving us a glimpse of what movies entirely made with AI could be with this unoriginal epic: feed it popular scifi movies/games sprinkled with a few classics and it would probably regurgitate this kind of script and art direction.From the plot to the characters, costumes, setting, lore, entire sequences and everything in between, Rebel Moon blatantly borrows from somewhere else and stitches together a predictable and boring string of deja-vu.Wrap it up with an uninspired direction, barely implicated cast and sluggish action scenes (someone sure loves slow-mo) and the result is one of the worst scifi epic to date.I wasn't expecting a masterpiece, but certainly not such a low effort cash grab. Disgraceful.

title: Why a "Snyder Cut" now?
text: Overall I found the movie very underwhelming and disappointing....others have already said everything I want to say what is wrong with this movie so I won't bother here.What I do want to say is this:I understand why Justice League got a "Snyder Cut" because he (tragically) had to stop directing while filming so he couldn't finish the movie himself.But now? He was in full control from start to finish so why will there be a "Snyder Cut"? It's on Netflix so a longer than usual runtime shouln't be a problem. Just release the "cut" you wanted to make right from the start and don't wait! What did I watch now? Wasn't that also a "Snyder Cut"?I for one won't be viewing this new version.....this "not the Snyder Cut (?)" was so bad I have no desire to go through that again. If Snyder thinks the new version will be better: well, to bad. You missed your chance.....should have released it right away.......it now feels like a cheap way to get viewers to watch it again, but I'm not wanting more of it.Imagine all movies would get a "directors cut" after it's first release. What would be the point of viewing the "theatrical release" anymore?It used to be a way to get people to buy the blu-ray but I guess in the streaming age that is not an option anymore.My thoughts: release the best version you can make right away and if it's any good people will want to watch it more than once anyway.....I for one don't watch a "director's cut" in the hope it will be better than the "theatrical release".....I watch it to see new footage of movies I already really liked.....

title: Begun this clone wars has.
text: I don't really have a dog in the Zack Snyder argument, I've liked some of his films, I've disliked others. His version of "Justice League" is better than the theatrical one - but still isn't good. This though probably overtakes "Army of The Dead" though as the worst film he's directed.An evil empire arrives on a small farming planet and demand its upcoming grain harvest. The army, led by General Noble (Ed Skrein) depart leaving a small force behind who, following an incident, are all killed by Kora (Sofia Boutella) a warrior who has been hiding out on the planet. Kora, along with Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) leave to look for a former general, who could lead a rebellion when the army returns. They recruit several more to their cause as they travel.Not a man overflowing with original ideas, "Rebel Moon" once pitched as a "Star Wars" story, is a mishmash of moments, characters and scenes cribbed and lifted from other movies. Its derivative story is then shot through with the worst of Snyder's excesses. Whilst it often looks impressive, it's not an exaggeration to say that literally every action scene involves slow motion, so much so I bet the film would be twenty minutes shorter if those scenes just happened in real time. I also don't understand the decision to make this bloodless tame version and to artificially release a "Snyder cut" with the gore restored at a future date.It just does nothing better than any of the films it's trying to emulate and is so dour and obvious it's a chore to make it through it.What's most annoying is that, despite not having enjoyed this at all - come April I'm going to have to sit through another one, as I can't watch some of something and not all of it.

title: Masterpiece
text: Rebel Moon: A Child of Fire" is the first chapter of Zack Snyder's new saga. He's looking for redemption in big projects after facing tough years and scorn at his old home.The project was born over 20 years ago, even before Snyder could imagine that he would become one of the greatest directors of today. His films, like "Dawn of the Dead", "Watchmen", "300", "Man of Steel" and "Batman vs Superman", are still debated and admired by the public.In "Rebel Moon", we see the director at the peak of his creativity, creating a stunning new fantasy world, full of elements that captivate the public's gaze. This project, however, almost had another fate. Zack Snyder presented his idea to Lucasfilm before it was sold to Disney, but he didn't make it and ended up putting it in the drawer. I think this was one of the best things that happened, as he was able to gain more experience as a filmmaker and consequently enrich his new universe even more. And yes, the film draws inspiration from the same sources that led George Lucas to create "Star Wars". I see this as a good thing, not a bad one.The film shows everything we already know about the director: epic scenes, as every good film should have, and that Snyder knows how to do well. The fight scenes are as good as those in "Batman vs Superman", where the choreography team did a fantastic job. The story is well tied up, unlike what many haters say. The film doesn't suffer from part 1 syndrome and, just like "Dune", it's a great start to a universe, the actors are impeccable in their roles. This makes the film go by very quickly and holds the viewer's attention from beginning to end. The development of the main characters' story is very good.The execution quality of this film is something to admire. The director managed to not only make something extremely cheap, but also with an impressive special effects quality. Amid so many bad projects with exorbitant budgets, Snyder works a miracle in "Rebel Moon". No wonder, the film is on the list of the 20 best in special effects at the Oscars.I had the enormous pleasure of being one of the lucky ones who watched this masterpiece at the early release on December 1st at CCXP 23. I was in the front row and I could see something that will be marked: an auditorium of 3000 people cheering and applauding this film on their feet. It was a big and beautiful surprise of the year 2023, entering my list of the best films of the year.

title: D.E.I. warriors, UNITE! It's as bad as everyone is saying it is.
text:
I have a personal theory that keeps being proven true with every Netflix film; the more ethnically diverse the cast, the worse the movie or television show ends up being. Without fail, every single movie or show where D. E. I. Is the basis for the casting ends up subpar of just downright embarrassing, and Rebel Moon seems to continue this god forsaken trend. Gone are the days where the best person for the job is given the role, the best actor, the most fitting or qualified. Now the roles are given to the right skin color, gender or sexuality, and SURPRISINGLY, it's yielding the most horrendous results. Who would have thought hiring people based on superficial traits over say, talent or merit, would ruin filmmaking this profoundly? I am truly shocked, meaning, I am not shocked at all.Every single new addition to the film was a check box of "diversity";White male villain? ✅
The POC FEMALE lead? ✅
Latino character? ✅
Black character? ✅
Asian character? ✅
Ethnically ambiguous? ✅(Notice how the only genuine casting is the white male villain, because we can't have any other ethnic group ever be the bad guys, now, can we?)I groaned audibly every time they got to a new planet and the D. E. I. Checklist marked off its "representation". Perhaps if they spent more time writing a competent story or building a believable world over obsession over how many people of color they had at any given time on screen, we might have gotten a half decent, and dare I say, entertaining film. But Netflix gonna Netflix, and their racial quotas matter more than their ratings, so they'll just sweep this under the rug and do it again with another film until they get the hit the desperately crave but will never get.Zack Snyder was a director I defended and I used to take great job in celebrating his style and vision as one of film-makings great bad boys. Now I see that he can be easily bought to make a movie that they want you to make, and will happily forfeit his artistic integrity just to see his name on the credits.There are very few redeemable qualities in this film, the character designs, set design and sci-fi design being the only ones, but everything else, from the subpar or hammy acting (except by Ed Skrein), to the SFX overload, to the ridiculous plot, to the under-baked and verbose script felt like an afterthought (why did they talk so much and why did so little of it matter?), and the ridiculously bad action scenes, which all took a backseat to the utter importance of assembling the United colors of Beneton Avengers.A ridiculous movie made by ridiculous people who focus on stuff that doesn't matter to try to build an interesting world and fail on almost every single regard. Imagine if Star Wars had been forced to have racial and gender quotas and this is the movie you would have ended up with. Netflix, we don't subscribe to your service for this. Do better, in the sense of making actual movies for people who enjoy watching them.A message to Ed Skrein; What were you thinking taking this role? You are a master of your craft and one of the finest living actors. You deserved SO much better than this film, which you carried single-handedly, might I add. Your agent did you dirty, and I suggest firing him and finding someone that will get you the roles your talent and skill truly deserve.

title: Another visual masterpiece
text: Turned down by Lucasfilm, Snyder brought his idea to Netflix and now THIS is history.Excellent visual flair that totally upstages recent big budget efforts on an estimated budget of $90m USD.This would have been an excellent Star Wars movie but now it's Zack Snyder's own new franchise.It's a sight to behold just like Snyder's full 4hr vision of Justice League, his original vision.The less said about the butchered 2hr version the better.Netflix gave full reign to Zack Snyder and he really went for it.The story is familiar, what story isn't? Enjoy it for what it is. 2hrs+ of entertainment.Part 2 can't come quick enough.

title: Words fail me but I've put some together.
text: Rebel Moon - so much cheese I could well be visually and mentally constipated for weeks!Moody, rag tag bunch of rebel heroes from the far reaches of a distant galaxy with sultry, none-smiling stares into space in a story that has nutri-blended a ickle bit of Star Wars, GoT and elements of The Matrix to produce a filmic soup that leaves a nasty taste in the eyes!Topped off with the baddie from Deadpool parading around in a uniform stinking of Eau du Nazi and being all clever and English and smiley before stoving heads in with Gandolf's staff.The scary thing is, this film has Part 1 in the title. Compared to this film F&F10 is the cinematic equivalent of The Godfather Part 2.Can only assume Anthony Hopkins had a large gas bill to pay but was astute enough to keep his actual face out of this film that will take many hearty flushes to get it down the filmic u-bend.

title: Battle Beyond the Stars (1980) for Z generatuon.
text: The sad thing about SF movies is that they are settled mostly in infinity of space, yet the topics they can deal are very finite. That's the reason why old fans of this genre, now in a very advanced age, are in a desperate need to get some good SF movie, and yet, that's beyond hope. All stories already told, followed by a litany of endless franchises, remakes, spinoffs, rip-offs etc. This movie is no exception of that rule. If you are a believer of the old rule that original is always better than a copy go and watch a movie from a title of this comment. Otherwise, continue to watch this genre meltdown.

title: Zach Snyder and the Cringey Movie Titles
text:
This movie dragged so much into nothing. Imagine an RPG game where you recruit companions and go on a quest, this is that but it just does not translate into a coherent enough story to keep the viewer engaged. The visual effects are dated and rushed and the characters just exist. Sofia Boutella is just meh in this role. Everyone is. It is very poorly written, the fight scenes are dragged out, the slow-mo is overused. I'm sorry but this movie would be 40% longer without it. Nobody wants to see rice fall on the floor.The costume design is confusing and doesn't know if it wants to be a gritty space-western or a 1940's military set.The most offensive thing about is how poorly unoriginal the villains are, it's just space Nazi's. Almost literally.And the titles of the two movies are unbelievably cringe-inducing
All in all it feels like a parody movie and Snyder clearly has too much creative liberty with studios who keep throwing money at him which once again results in another poor outing for him. Oh and get ready for the directors cut because Snyder has no idea how to create a tv show these days. 10 episodes, 10 hours of story would have made sense right?

title: Inexplicably bland
text: I say 'inexplicably' because at first this seems like it should be a difficult thing to screw up. The trailer hints at an expansive world and high stakes. But maybe it's easy to explain why this is so forgettable: it's mostly an unsatisfying pastiche of clichés that don't really ever cohere into something interesting.It starts off promising enough. The initial scenes set the stage for a peaceful, almost idyllic setting which is interrupted by the arrival of a malevolent force. The introduction of the adversaries is at first portrayed with tension, but this quickly dissolves into just a bunch of cartoonish bad guys. What follows is an awkward hour and a half long team-building exercise followed by what feels like a climax that would feel rushed if we didn't just kind of want it to be over anyway. None of the characters we recruit along the way are given any dimension, we don't really care about any of them, and they don't spend enough time together to form any chemistry with one another.The writing here is just not very good. It's often hard to tell if the actors are really just not into it or if their lines and parts are just so bizarrely uninspired that they have nothing to work with. This is set up like Magnificent Seven in space, but statistically at least one of these characters should *accidentally* be compelling, but they're all really dull. So many things are hinted at and then never qualified or brought up again. In a film like this, at the very least the villain is usually memorable, and Ed Skrein is usually pretty good in those roles, but here even that is paper thin. This is one of those films where things just sort of happen and there doesn't seem to be a lot that connects one scene to another.Of course this is a part one, and maybe part two will somehow develop the innumerable loose threads here. Maybe we'll actually see some chemistry build between the characters and begin to care about this struggle. But I kind of doubt it. There were just too many consistently missed opportunities here and indications that the writers have no understanding of how to build a story of this magnitude.

title: Wow
text: "Wow, just wow. Rebel Moon blew me away! From the stunning visuals to the complex character development, this sci-fi epic had me hooked from start to finish. I was so invested in the story and the characters that I didn't even think to pick up my phone.Zack Snyder's latest masterpiece is a feast for the senses - the fight scenes are intense, the world-building is immersive, and the character development is rich and nuanced. The story kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time, and I can't wait to watch it again to catch any details I may have missed the first time around.If you're looking for a sci-fi movie that will keep you engaged, entertained, and on the edge of your seat, Rebel Moon is a must-see!

title: What a waste of acting talent and film crew
text: The problem is unequivocally Snyder.A story needs an arc. Yet every scene is filmed as if it's the climax of the film, diluting every one of them so that in fact none of them end up important or meaningful. So much slo-mo for such trivial shots, over and over again... when it could have been used thoughtfully.Then there's the decision to spend 40% of the film building out a motley crew (uh, Suicide Squad, anyone?) but leaving so little time for each character that you actually know nothing about them - or worse, they're left with nearly no dialog (or have no role in the film at all).Waste of - and insulting to - great acting talent a fantastic VFX/film crew. Maybe one day someone will introduce Zack to a writer?

title: Latest Uwe Boll offering
text: I'm not sure what happened to Zack Snyder but every movie he makes is worse than the one before. This film has very little substance and no style. It's one of those movies where the plot makes no effort to go anywhere and suddenly it's over. Waste of time to watch it unfortunately. I gave it 2 stars because the acting isn't bad at all really, they just had nothing to work with: convoluted plot and familiar tropes. Hopefully the sequel is better but I'm not leaving much room for hope on that score. As a huge fan of Dawn of the Dead and 300 it's sad to see how far Snyder's fallen. Time to pack in this gig and find another one.

title: derivative
text: There are some gorgeous visuals. But overall there's no depth to the story. The only thing lamer than the plot is Charlie Hunnam's terrible attempt at a Northern Irish accent. And why would someone in some other world have such a distinctive accent. He would be better off - less distracting - just using his normal voice. Sofia Boutella was great in the first Kingsmen movie. But she doesn't have what it takes to carry the movie as a lead. Zack Snyder has directed some worthy films - e.g. Army of the Dead, 300, etc. But he's confused his ability to create credible alternative planets and weird looking creatures with the ability to create a great film. And this falls way short. Very much a Star Wars wannabe but without the compelling story.

title: Haters will hate
text: Forget all these haters scoring it below 6.This is an epic action Sci fi movie which entertains exactly as it should.Star wars rip off? Nonsense, sure then I suppose star trek is also a star wars rip off and any other Sci fi movie.Loved this - very entertaining and loads of fun. High budget cgi, good acting, good directing and full of action.I don't know what people want from a Sci fi movie, if it's too this or too that, then what?Give it a go and decide for yourselves. I personally thoroughly enjoyed it and can't wait for episode two and three and four..Why did I score it 10/10? Because it deserves better ratings than 6 and all these people scoring it low are just bored with life and don't know what they want.

title: No Spoilers, the movie spoils itself
text: A mesh up of older classic movies doesn't mean you've got a hit! I actually thought the acting was horrible and combined with the slow motion action scenes 🚮. I want my money back!I wanted to love it, but it got worse and worse. I truly don't understand repeating scenes from previous movies, over and over again. I feel like I'm not watching something original. It feels cheap. You got me again Synder, you snake oil sells man.Star Wars, The Justice League, 300, Blade Runner, Gladiator, and Dune.** does this review contain spoilers.....lol Nope the movie spoils itself **I can't wait for part two 😂

title: Not rebellious enough
text: Could have been a great movie, but never really entered into anything worthwhile. Snyder's reputation is much bigger and better than what this movie offered.Storyline is nothing new, and neither are the characters. Actually, casting could be challenged regarding all the characters. As much as Sofia Boutella is accomplished, she seems to lack sincerity in her anger and desire as the lead character. Dijmon Hounsou, another very equipped actor had nothing to do as did Bee Doona and Charlie Hunnam. Maybe expected to be more involved in future sections of Rebel Moon.Not much happens in the first hour or so, and then too much happens near the end. Too much time spent on the background and not enough on character development. Maybe would be better as a TV series rather than a movie.Overall disappointing, but hopefully part 2+ will be better.

title: Don't forget to take your stupid pills before you watch it
text: Poor actors. If they were forced to watch their own movie, I am very sorry for them. Mind numbingly boring. From the start it desperately attempts to make an emotional contact with the viewer with cringy bad dialogues and slow motions. I really hoped that this movie could success since it has been rejected as a Disney Star Wars Story and they are all clusterf...s. But it seems Disney dodged a bullet this time. Scottish music and viking beards? Futuristic.sliding Star Trek doors but to warn the people from the approaching colossal attack ship, she rings the chime bell?!? I should have stopped watching there but unfortunately I wasted 2 more minutes of my life after that and then stopped watching.

title: Warhammer 40K meets Star Wars
text: Some storyline is a little too fast, but the characters and the setting near perfect for me :) I like Warhammer 40K's setting, so see the feeling of it in Rebel Moon made me to love it. The story is good, a few spaceopera-cliché is turned out, so it could surprise me.Some tipical spaceopera moments was in it just to get the familiar feeling, so there's a lot of already used situation or story element we saw somewhere else, but there are a lot of new, or familiar but newly used genre-typical moment.Overall I liked it very much, mainly because it has the 40K feeling very well presented, and the characters and their story was fine too. I'm sad that not every character got enough time to tell me their stories, bit because of it I feel that there is a whole world, with history, and I hope the follow-up movie will tell the others' story.

title: Bugs Life in Space
text: I am sorry, I have never scene 7 samurai, however I have seen a Bugs Life. Exact same plot, but Bugs Life made more sense.Why would a giant space ship go to a village of 20 people on 1 planet and ask for food? Wouldn't they go to a major city center in order to have more sway on the populace?What a let down. 50lb chick out fights everyone in slow mo. What's wrong is that she wins with brute force, instead of intelligence (which would be more believable.Do you like slo mo? Every action scene is slo mo, which gets old after the first battle.Did I mention its bugs life in space? Well its worse, its dark moody and not visually appealing as others say. I've seen better. Its CGI.In the end of my rant, it was a real let down for me.

title: Wow can't believe the reviews great show!!!
text: Yes it's not the most original plot kind of feels like dune a little bit....but who cares the plot flows and makes sense...great action scenes!! Overall really good!! I mean the si/fi fantasy mix is really cool. Some of the scenes have this kind of game thrones really did that just happen feel to them. The storyline isn't the most original and I kind of hate the whole all white people are bad vibe from the bad guys. Love the laser guns and how they handle and recoil like a real fire arm. Fighting scenes and the whole droid interactions are pretty dang original. So overall some of the best sci/fi to come out in awhile.

title: Just meh.. like many others
text: In the realm of science fiction, audiences have come to expect innovation, fresh ideas, and mind-bending concepts that challenge the boundaries of imagination. Unfortunately, the recently released film, Rebel Moon, falls short of these expectations, delivering a disappointing experience that struggles to breathe life into tired and clichéd sci-fi tropes.One of the most disheartening aspects of Rebel Moon is its lack of originality. While a few scattered sci-fi concepts manage to capture the audience's attention, the majority feel like tired reiterations of ideas that have been explored countless times before. The film's attempt to revisit these well-worn themes is not only uninspiring but also leaves the viewer yearning for something more substantial and thought-provoking.The narrative itself fails to offer a refreshing take on the genre. Rather than breaking new ground, it seems content to tread water in a sea of predictability. The storyline unfolds in a manner that feels all too familiar, with plot twists and turns that are telegraphed from a mile away. This lack of narrative innovation robs the film of any sense of excitement or intrigue, leaving the audience with a sense of déjà vu that is hard to shake.A critical flaw lies in the portrayal of the heroes/fighters encountered on this lackluster journey. Despite the potential for compelling character development and engaging story arcs, these figures are poorly executed and fail to elicit any genuine interest from the audience. Whether it's the unimpressive performances or the thinly written characters, there is an undeniable emptiness that pervades the film's roster of heroes. As a viewer, one can't help but feel disconnected and indifferent of their origins, which undermines any emotional investment in the overall narrative.Despite its shortcomings, it's important to acknowledge that Rebel Moon does have moments where it flirts with the potential for greatness. There are glimpses of creativity and inspiration that, unfortunately, never fully materialize into a cohesive and compelling whole. It's these fleeting moments that make the film's overall disappointment all the more palpable, as they serve as a constant reminder of the missed opportunities to elevate the narrative and captivate the audience.In conclusion, Rebel Moon ultimately falls short of its potential, offering a underwhelming and uninspiring journey through the well-trodden terrain of stale sci-fi tropes. While a handful of cool concepts manage to shine through the mediocrity, they are not enough to salvage a film that struggles to break free from the shackles of predictability and narrative fatigue. With its poorly portrayed heroes and fighters, and a narrative that fails to push the boundaries of the genre, Rebel Moon is a forgettable entry in the world of science fiction, leaving audiences longing for the innovation and excitement that the genre is known for.

title: So. Many. Sci-fi. Tropes
text:
Not really a Zach Snyder fan here, but was excited to see what I thought would be an original science fiction film.Oh lord, I want those two hours back.So many "yeps":
Every rebellion needs a droid.Every rebellion starts on a farming planet.Shootout in a cantina, yep.Call-back to Stormtroopers, yep.Awesome fighting skills by lightweight female characters, somewhat believable due to agility but Sucker Punch trope, yep.Dune tropes, Alien tropes, gee I think I see too many orc-looking characters.Some of the characters hairstyles remind me of Battleship Earth.Even Avatar tropes.Ride that Harry Potter hippogriff, you long-haired hunky guy!I'm too old to waste my time on this cr*p.Charley Hunnam with an Irish accent?Cringe meter maxed out.

title: Don't Believe the Hate
text: This is a tremendous scifi film. The people who keep complaining about "nothing new here" seem to forget that scifi is a GENRE. That means you can expect a lot of familiar scifi tropes. To say otherwise is to suggest that six guns and 10 gallon hats make a western "unoriginal."I suggest that the majority of people criticizing this film for being "boring" didn't understand it and weren't able to figure out that most of the great content in this film had to be inferred. This is not a film that spoonfeed's you a plot. You need to do some thinking of your own to understand this story. There are no activist "moments" trying to serve in lieu of a plot. The screen isn't inundated with constant flashy explosions and laser blasts to take the place of good character development. The script doesn't try to replace meaningful dialogue with pithy one-liners. This is the "Star Wars for adults" that so many people have been clamoring for since the millenium. Now that it's here, many of these same people want to trade it for something less mature. There's just no pleasing some people.See the film. Engage your brain. Make up your own mind.

title: MAssive disappointment - Visually pretty , but boring
text: Was really looking forward to this but its massive disappointing.Watching it is like watchin 6 other movies all wrapped into one.Its just like a paint by numbers movie, nothing feels original and at times feels like he is just taking ideas from other movies.Its like Star Wars was thrown in a mixer with the Magnificent 7.When they had to find the gladiator from the movie Gladiator and found him in a Gladiator Colosseum and he was a Gladiator that was pretty much it for me.Before people had even saw it they were saying they wanted his Snyder Cut, but he needs to be able to release a movie that works immediately.From someone who did Watchmen this is a big let down.

title: FEMALE ACTION LEADS ARE RIDICULOUS
text: For God sake, just stop it please. "Rebel Moon" is deeply disappointing on multiple levels. The film's attempt to subvert traditional action movie norms with a female lead in a role typically reserved for male characters is forced and unconvincing and the movie struggles to deliver a compelling narrative, regardless of the gender dynamics at play.The screenplay, lacks of originality and depth, compounding everyone's frustrations. The dialogue and character development-or lack thereof-fail to resonate or provide any meaningful engagement with the audience.The action sequences, though abundant, are hollow due to the underdeveloped characters and a plot that treads over familiar ground without offering new insights or excitement. This lack of narrative substance, combined with a perceived overemphasis on gender dynamics leaves me feeling that "Rebel Moon" is an uninspired addition to the sci-fi genre. Misses the mark in both honoring the sci-fi tradition and providing a satisfying, innovative cinematic experience. Knowing how imaginative Zac Snyder can be, it's clear that the executive branch of whatever tinpot studio made this is still pushing the agenda.

title: Rey, Tarzan, and Thomas Shelby.
text: "Rebel Moon: A Child of Fire -Part One" is a weak science fiction movie, with absolute no feeling and no gripping action that holds you on. Zack Snyder wanted to make a new version of something like Star Wars, but first of all: The story feels completely unoriginal, and secondly, this crap just feels like a fast Netflix copy of an amazing franchise of decades. It's disturbing to watch how people get tricked to watch stuff like that, and how big production continues endless s**t! Let's talk about the action sequences. It felt like a video game, the fighting motions of the fighters looked like gaming character movements. Completely basic acting, outside the battles too. Character expressions was showed on a mediocre level, and the main hero of the film, Kora, was trying so hard to be dramatic, but it just looked pathetic on the screen. The rest of the characters that were introduced were forgettable and sometimes I forgot about them in the next scene. The story had two main villains, even though they focused more on the second (That by the way looked a little bit like Thomas Shelby) and I'm not so very proud of them. The menace and creepiness didn't feel like a true villain, and they felt quite generic, too. The scenography was the mark of the low-budget quality here. It looked more like a scenography they would use on a theatre, not on a big film like this. The camera filming was quite decent, and I can't argue much about that. The music was fine, too, and was the only thing that saved the film some stars. It was quite dramatic, and fitted the scenes, but unfortunately, it's not enough to save it. By the way, this is just the first part (The second releases April next year) and I'm not so excited. But I hope they can change something to make the continuation better.

title: Best movie ever!!!!
text: I don't understand what these people are watching, the is an amazing movie! Sooooooooo much depth. Can't wait for part 2. A 5.6 IMDB movie should be a low budget film but, this is adequately budgeted, acting is amazing, story is phenomenal (go Snyder!) production, costumes, music. What are y'all watching?! Why are you hating on such a great movie. Some people said they didn't get the story that it didn't make sense, blah blah, blah... this is part one of a great series and part one was well made introducing the main characters of this series. I love Star Trek, Wonder Women and Harry Potter and I had all in one movie.

title: I really wanted to love it, I can't.
text: Copying is not a crime, but you need to enrich the original with a new vision.In cinema as in theatre, the screenplay is everything. In Rebel Moon its nothing.Snyder mixed "The magnificent seven" with "Star Wars" with as much depth and elegance as a 10 year old.Everything is tremendously serious, there is no trace of irony.The characters are less than two-dimensional, an AI would have made them more original and deeper.I love sci-fi, it's always a bad day when someone butchers it.If they had given Joss Whedon the money they gave to Zack Snyder today we would be celebrating a new Firefly and we would all be happier and more entertained.

title: As bad as the press says.. and then some!
text: I wanted to check, it really is an appallingly bad movie.Am I alone in seeing how this was written, designed and even story boarded with extensive use of AI?Every aspect of this movie is made up from a large amount of meaningless content without any connective tissue whatsoever. A soup of randomly collected assets.The clumsy attempt at bringing three dimensionality to incredibly flat characters through unjustified changes of mind.. The tasteless production design.. the atemporality of events.Clearly Netflix tried an AI heavy pipeline in order to more make money. The result is grotesque.

title: Recipe: Take a few good films and story lines, mix in one large CGI bowl, cook for 2hrs 14mins then throw it straight in the bin.
text: I watched whatever this film was supposed to be and for the life of me, I couldn't understand what the point of spending this amount of money ($166 million) was for. From the title you might think it's a another of the endless Star Wars spinoffs but no, it's not. It's a Zack Snyder something and he's certainly not a Jon Favreau when it comes to Star Wars spinoffs.It comes across as a mix of so many films from the last 25 years that it was difficult to stop thinking, that's taken from? That's the same story line as? That's the same CGI from? It's a rehash of a rehash of a rehash. I can only think people want to watch this film just to know how bad it really is. That's the reason the viewing figures are so high.This is a CGI film with short bursts of just about adequate acting. There was no actor that kept my attention throughout or made the film as being memorable. You certainly don't become emersed in the film as with so many good films out there. This came across as an over budgeted TV movie with a director who really believes his own hype.As with some of the later Star Wars copies of the original series (Rey instead of Luke), its all been done before. For new viewers of films and TV series, this might appear to be new to them. For people older than 25 who might have watched a few actual good films to build some form of opinion, they should recognise this to be a colossal waste of everybody's time.Instead of watching this film, I suggest you watch the original Seven Samurai, the film it's being compared to in story line. Although there are so many stolen story lines being used here, it's hard to know what you're watching.One whole star given because I can't give a percentage of one star.

title: Could be epic
text: I don't understand all the negativity, this is actually a great film and more than this, it could actually be the beginning of an epic saga.Yes, there are one too many slow-mos, yes there are obvious influences and yes there could be slightly more story in the small parts but that shouldn't detract from the fact that this is a good overall story with good, well acted characters. I enjoyed every minute of it, it was well paced and well structured and came together well in the end.I would say that the premise is basic, "all this for a measly farm", but that just lends to the idea of the simple struggles within the bigger fight. There are things I want to know more about both before and after this film, hopefully some of these will be resolved in part 2 but hopefully others are left and some more doors opened for a prequel, possibly a sequel but they would need to appeal to the modern audience, spin offs, side stories, other stories within the same universe are what work, continuing on past the natural conclusion does not.I will definitely watch this again and look forward to Part 2 and if it's true, I'll look forward to the Snydercut, even if it's just to see how different it might be.

title: Heart broken.
text:
Dialogue written by a teenager, action substandard, way to much slow motion. Had so much potential. Same premise as 7 Samurai or The Magnificent Seven. Which are by far better than this catastrophe. Ed Skrein is good and probably the only actor who actually acts in this movie. Don't waste your time. Go get your back waxed instead. Maybe the next episode will actually have some substance. I see now why Disney/Lucas said
No to this being a side story for Star Wars.What am I to do. How will I ever get those 2 hours back? Star Nair as a shirtless Native American type that can magically take some sort of griffin? Truly disappointed.

title: Its like its written by 3 different people that have no intercourse and terrible editing.
text: To start the audience is constantly being told the story its very annoying thete is no room for character development, flashbacks can only happen so much in the first episode of any movie really as we have no knowledge if past events loads of these pointless statements about said past events are pointless. Character development is critical and so is casting.The special affects are ok. It seems like it had a big enough budget but no foresight of how to produce a good film with a terrible story. ToIts a slapped together story with a slapped together cast to make a slapped together movie.We are all a little more dead inside and out after spending our time watching this dribble.

title: ChatGPT making movies now
text: The empire against rebels in space - where did they come up with this original premise? It's absolutely unoriginal, the scenes are uniformly laughably bad.An imperial force that needs grain, because they have nothing to eat? And that's why they stop at some god forsaken Vikings-esque village and wreak havoc, to get grain, really? They didn't solve their food problem with all the robots they've got?This is a Star Wars rehash with the smart, charming and funny bits left out. Why would anyone watch this instead of rewatching the original Star Wars trilogy?It truly is a ChatGPT (version 3.5 mind you, 4.0 would come up with better stuff, for sure) created screenplay that doesn't make a lot of sense, does not have anything original to say, and is just plain boring. Pretty sure Part One will be the only part, unless Netflix just doesn't care and already budgeted for the whole trilogy to get Zack Snyder on board.

title: Terrible
text: As a photographer. The first thing I noticed was the radial blur filter laid over half the scenes. Things at the top and bottom of the screen are blurred out for no reason other than to draw attention to what they want you looking at. I couldn't even make it an hour into the film.The battle scenes, while decently choreographed, were almost entirely bloodless. Stab someone? No blood. No hole. Shoot someone? No blood. No hole.Gravity doesn't seem to exist. With a gas giant as your neighbor in the night sky you'd think that would effect all sorts of things including the physiology of the people, animals, plants, and tides.I can't understand how someone could proof read this script and give it a seal of approval.

title: Best first movie in an original IP in decades
text: Ignore the bots and watch it yourself. This movie is everything a first movie in a franchise should be. Are there unanswered questions? Yep. It's the kick off of a franchise. Are there borrowed tropes from other franchises? Yes there are. It's sci fi, the entire genre borrows things from other franchises. Is there over the top, unrealistic action sequences? Again, absolutely. See previous comment about this being a science fiction movie.The only real negative I can find is the "dreadnought" ship looks more like a mid sized battleship and, while definitely cool looking, doesn't scream fleet killing, planet crushing, fear inducing Dreadnaught. But hey, it is a dang cool looking ship that will have any kid that grew up on Starship Yamamto (or Starblazers) going on a nostalgia trip.

title: A missed opportunity
text: In this " bittersweet symphony ", clichés run rampant, and the attempt at weaving a captivating story falls short. Characters, unfortunately, are reduced to mere vessels for tired tropes, lacking the depth that could have injected life into the narrative. The special effects, instead of dazzling, feel like relics from a bygone era, failing to provide the much-needed visual allure. To compound matters, pacing issues exacerbate the film's struggle to engage, leaving a void where a gripping plot should have unfolded. It's a regrettable missed opportunity in a realm that thrives on innovation and a fresh perspective.

title: Overpromoted category B movie
text: Boring and waist of my time.1. Very poor acting, it's like it was written by a child.2. Anthony Hopkins - good why just why his voice is used for the damn robot! It sounds out of place. It just does not fit to this caracter.2. The plot - partial rip off of Akiro Kurosawa - Seven Samurai just happening in space, but still boring.3. Sci-fi effects not the best in my opinion as I seen way better ones.Overall, I was really hoping for something better from Synder after watching his version of Justice League, which I must say was way better then the original release. Anyway, it is unlikely that I will watch the second part as it's not worth of my time.

title: Zack Snyder, what is this?
text: Being a Zack Snyder movie, I expected so much better. I like sci fi very much so I always hold out hope for a new sci fi movie or tv show. You can imagine my surprise when I got about 15 minutes into this movie and realized that the story was going nowhere.I found it a bit annoying that the main antagonist, Atticus, exists in the distant future but his uniform has a 1940's WW2 style. I was also annoyed that none of the characters are very likeable. I found myself not caring about any of them. The most useless of all was Djimon Hounsou's character. The acting was dreadful. It's not too often that I see Djimon Hounsou phoning in a role like that. He's a good actor but there's only so much a good actor can do with a bad script. You can skip this one......you wont be missing anything.

title: Disappointed
text: I really wanted to like it, but even I don't like recycling that much. The acting was Pinocchio, the dialogues sounded like they were written by someone who gets excited by the colour greige and the story is a hotchpotch of clichés.I thought at about 1:40 it might get slightly interesting, but then it just crumbled. Worst of all the diversity washing. They put all these characters in, but only give them 5 cheesy lines each, no real background, no individual motivation.It seemed too short and too long at the same time, no time to develope complex characters, too long because of the excessive slo-mo every 2 minutes.To quote Kevin Kline: DISAPPOINTED.

title: Possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen
text: This movie was astonishingly awful. I would put this movie ranked worse than Velocipastor or Sharknado. I literally made an IMDB account with the sole purpose of letting you all know that this movie was so painfully terrible. I could give a camcorder to a paraplegic toddler and make a better movie than this. If the government told me to watch this movie or they'd kill me in the most slow and brutal way possible, I'd say "don't bother, the movie will kill me of boredom first". This movie is the cinematic version of a tonsil stone. I will never get that time of my life back, and I beg the creators on my hands and knees to never release another one of these, dear God please, I will give you my first born if you retire and never make another movie.

title: Same Story Different Title
text: How many times are we going to see this story of a poor farming community hiring warriors to fight the big bad army of villains on their behalf?This plot has been done so many times already.7 Samurai, 13 Assassins, The Magnificent 7, and it's remake, Battle beyond the Planets, The 3 Amigos, A Bugs Life, the 47 Ronin and it's remake. Please try to create an original thought!The acting was ok, and the special effects are ok, but my God, the story is the same tired retread with not even a decent hero's journey to pull it all together for the viewer. I will watch beccause iot is on the service that I am already paying for, but I wouldn't see it at a theater.

title: Rebel snooze
text: The good: The visuals/cinematography. Typical Zynder theatrics make for a pleasing to the eye visual spectacle. I also appreciated that the worlds/planets feel bespoke, with their own theme and culture.The bad: Everything else other than visuals is a misfire. The plot and pacing + promises with no payoffs. The first half is the worst for pacing. With exposition dumps and flashbacks galore. Add in frequent (Zynder) slow-mo + ultra slow-mo and the film feels like a slog-fest to just try and get through it. The back half of the film does pick up somewhat (with way less slow-mo), but it's a case of too little too late. And as predicted with a part 1/2 - the movie ends with no ending, and little in the way of actual narrative progression. Finally, the ease of which the (magnificent 7) heroes are recruited really bugged me. It was super easy, barely an inconvenience (thanks pitch meeting). It's hard to care for characters that have limited conviction and/or development. One scene (literally) in most cases, will not achieve this, no matter how good the actor. Though it's possible the characters are further fleshed out in the rumoured director's cut.Should you watch it: If you like Zynder's visual prowess and don't mind watching a movie that is unapologetically derivative of the sci-fi western classics that came before it, than sure - you'll probably find something to like here. For the rest, probably not. Go watch Dune part 1 (same formula, better output). Rebel moon part 2 where I imagine the action/payoffs will be.

title: Unreal! Beautiful film with alot of heart and awesome effects
text: Unreal amazing work of art. This was truly a labor of love for Zack!! Awesome movie!! Really enjoyed it and the world building was impressive! Loved the characters I was really invested in what happens to them! I really hope there are more of these movies I want to see where the story will go. I hope the truth comes out about what happened and how the bad guy got away with the murder of the royal family. Sofia did an fabulous job her stunts were on point great actions scenes and the emotions she emoted we really well done. This is on par with any Star Wars film. I just watched the episode 3 today and honestly it was a bit cheesy compared to rebel moon. Zack is a genius. I really hope there is more.

title: It's so bad it's funny
text: The writing is so unimaginative. It's like a child wrote this. The dialogue is incredibly simple being acted out by sub-par actors with distressed looks on their face.It's almost like they are reading the cliff notes for the actual script, leaving out the fluff.This movie must have cost a fortune to make, and they put all that money into set design and CGI, and got AI to write the script.If they just took a few more months and hired better writers, this wouldn't seem like an AI rip off of Star Wars and some other random action movie.Netflix, please, do better. Oh how far the mighty have fallen.

title: Horrible
text: The beginning had some potential. But then the droid's/old king's lore was only interesting part of this movie and that was 1 minute long. The rest of the movie was about gathering a heist crew like ocean's eleven. The world's story would have been interesting but they decided not to tell it.Basic netflix garbage. Visually also a let down (cgi, horrible fisheye blur lens, etc.).Surely the snyder cut will fix this by providing these random characters some backstory and giving it R-rating. Cannot wait to see where all those tentacles go.Maybe a prequel to this movie would be interesting but the sequel will be a skip for me.

title: The gritty star wars portrayed in Rogue One
text: I am a bit surprised to see, that people dislike this movie.I might not be wellversed in the movie world, but for me this is a fresh take of "seven samurais" meets star wars.And I like how the characters are competent but not overpowered.I will say you arre looking for action in an interesting Wild west meets the samurai, set in a futuristic low sci world, this is a great watch.No idea what other people expected, but clearly the were let down.I get a bit of Firefly vibe, bad reception, but potential to be a cult.My problem is that I would love it to be a serie instead, with long dragged out atmospheric moments, like Godfather used, where you really got the feel of the sceens.That would have served well here, my fear is that the audiance for such, are a dying breed.Give it a chance.

title: Cracking action sci-fi blockbuster. What's not to like?
text: Look, it's a big popcorn movie, what exactly are people expecting with these 1s and 2s? For me, it totally hit the mark - great action, handsome cgi, big characters, plenty of jeopardy and set up nicely for part 2. Sure, it derives from other films, but Hollywood has been eating itself for decades and you can't lay the blame for that on this one film. Besides, revisiting classic tales can be fun and rewarding and does give the opportunity to chuck in some neat inversions and twists. Ultimately I guess the overall success should be judged after part 2, but for now I'm saying a big fun yes, and looking forward to March 2024...

title: Space Opera: A Derivative of Better Movies
text: This was basically just space Nazis vs space drifters in a mash-up of Star Wars, Dune, and Warhammer. They throw in some of the most generic names imaginable like "Motherworld" and "Scargiver," even the name "Rebel Moon" feels completely uninspired. Certainly not the worst sci-fi I've ever seen, but so utterly disappointing. There were also some HORRIBLE CGI sequences for a movie with a $166 million budget. Where did all of the money go? This isn't the Star Wars killer that Netflix is looking for.I wanted to doubt the critics this time, but after watching Rebel Moon I can't emphasize enough how right they were. The premise of the entire story just wasn't that interesting, it worked for a setting like Seven Samurai, but it feels underwhelming in what's supposed to be an "epic sci-fi." Then you have to consider the over-use of slo-mo, borrowing from other franchises to the point of almost plagiarizing, stereotypical "space Nazis," the atrocious dialogue and exposition, the random recruitment sidequests that feel completely disconnected from the main plot threads, the huge dip in the quality of the CGI at times... After all the flaws this film really only has some nice visuals and cool looking costumes. Everything else made this film a massive disappointment to say the least. Snyder seriously needs to stop being involved with the writing process. This movie's script was like an 8-year-old boy playing Mad Libs with all of his favorite shows, movies, and video games. I can't imagine the extended cut being much better, unless they do an absurd amount of reshoots.As a final point, I'll add that I have been a Snyder fan for quite some time, I've loved most of his films, but Rebel Moon fell far below my already tempered expectations. I'm not sure I'll be able to stick around for the ride this time.

title: Bad, low quality, inconsistent, edgelord movie
text: While watching this, you can see all the OBVIOUS 'influences' from popular media. Dune, Star Wars, Seven Samurai, etc.The acting is... ok enough, I guess? No performances really stand out as good or exceptional. Everyone was more or less one note. Speaking of one note, all the characters who are recruited do one thing and then are background characters the rest of the movie.I've heard some say the script is like chatGPT and its an apt comparison.When I say its "low quality", I dont mean the effects, which can be really gorgeous. I mean the 'world' itself. There is so much nonsensical stuff that it boggles the mind. Some characters wear more or less hockey pads as "armor" which cover like 5% of their body, while the rest wear robes and cloaks. I dont know if any of the armor is supposed to be practical, and neither does the movie. And for some reason 20th century Earthen necktie and dress shirts and trench coats??? (The symbolism is so obvious, Snyder might as well have jumped out and screamed ITS JUST LIKE WW2!!!!)So much of the movie is clearly Snyder going "Yo, this would be so cool!!!" and thats as far as his thinking went. Hence the 'edgelord' of it all.
