This goes for a lot of the characters costumes as well, which didnt feel like it had any consistency, but again was "YO THIS IS COOL!"The dialogue and exposition are stilted, and hamfisted.And of COURSE, pretty much all of the center-stage aliens are basically humans/humanoid, because as we all know, all evolved life in the galaxy will be shaped like humans.Yes, there is the ridiculous, slow mo into super slow mo for no reason.For some reason, super powers can travel the galaxy in no time with fuel not being a problem yet no one in this galaxy figured out how to grow food with artificial lights and rely on "grain" (get ready to hear that word 9001 times!)In this end, this felt like a long pointless endeavor of wasted talent and budget. I have no idea why this was made, who the target audience is, or if anything besides the edgelord "YO THIS IS COOL" was put into the characters, world, lore, history, dialogue, etc.If you are able to turn off your brain and go "Ohhh pretty colors" then you might love this.Seriously, check your brain at the door before you hit play on this movie.

title: The world cries out for a decent sci-fi...
text: ...and this certainly is not it.The beginning of the story sets itself up perfectly fine, but then dwindles into the usual cliches and politically-driven nonsense that plagues so many post-2017 productions.The largest issue with this film is the simple lack of any character development or overall world-setting. Tolkien or Martin, the writers are clearly not. I knew nothing of what was going on in the wider universe, nor did I learn anything about the backstory of any characters they happened to stumble across. This meant I simply didn't care about them, nor would I have noticed if they were replaced by cupboard cutouts, midway through.One thing they did achieve was ticking the usual HR diversity checklist. All except the villains, who were all conveniently macho white guys, for a change (yawn).The casting seemed totally off, as did the confusing costuming, and then there's the question... why do we have 9th century nordics in space? Nothing is explained convincingly, nor does any of it make logical sense.Meanwhile, we're once again witness to another stick-thin, attractive female lead who manages to defy physics and somehow is able to kick a load of male bodybuilders around, without taking any hits. Who needs a gym or supplements in this universe?When you're telling a story, you need more than CGI-filled scenes and Matrix-style action shots to convince the audience of a character's credibility. It's horribly shallow and has already been done to death in mindless action films over the past 10-15 years.But the biggest surprise to me is they're actually working on more parts! Who literally wants to see that? Not me.

title: Perfect For the Beginning.
text:
Certainly when we watch a movie (of our liking) we want to identify with a hero. With someone who gives us the ability to keep us in a state of anxiety, conflict and perhaps fear of his own evolution ??.What this particular film achieves, and I see it for the first time in this particular way that Zack Snyder presents it, is to identify us with more than one character. "So the theory of character development has clearly succeeded."
Distinct feelings that are transferred from one personality to another. Also another good thing is that it leaves openings in the personality of each character regarding their story. A chance to give us more explanations for how things got here. Also let's not forget it is the beginning of events.It is not possible in 2 hours and a quarter to transport us through this whole world. It is impossible. The events must somehow start and slowly evolve to open up the story and unfold everything that the director has in mind.I believe it is the beginning of a new and beautiful beginning. It has a lot of potential and a lot that can be assumed in the future. Let the sequel evolve and "deep" reviews after completion. So the continuation is expected of course.

title: Movie written like a video game.
text: What if a movie felt like it was quick traveling through character development. That is this movie. Themes didn't match, and the end fight had no weight, or even thought out into it. One point they must have figured a giant space ship was now controlled by a turret. Why?Netflix, please don't try and create a Star Wars again.your writers as I'll equipped as jr. High students. You gave us characters that have no real backstory, no character development. They just were like side quests to the story. We don't know how they were tied to the story, or how they were even located by the main characters. We just see them land as if they just had quick travel, and then get a 10 minute look how good this character is, then fly away to the next character moment.We get fights that never get more interesting than the first one because the "cool" characters don't do much after their "cool" side quest was over.There is no weight to any action of death, or destruction because we have no time to see any development.Don't waste your time, they didn't either.

title: It kills me to say it but it was really bad
text: I'm so sorry that one of my favorite director did that to himself I mean come on....i was curious about the movie for one reason seeing what was different from Star Wars and Star Trek instead I got some reboot version of Star Wars, I heard he wanted to pitch the idea so it could be part of a Star Wars adventure but the fact is there's nothing really new to add. We've seen all of it before and now in a really bad way, the fight scenes were really bad, screenplay and storyline are neither original or intriguing I mean the only good thing about the movie was knowing Snyder made it which might be the worst thing at the same time cause if it was from some new director it would have been fine but I guess no one would even watch it so bottom line this movie shouldn't exist really I can't even think of a second installment I really don't know how he would save it all since for me it's a bad Star Wars copy and it really hurt me I'm expressing this for the guy that gave me 300 and a 4h Justice League I mean come on how could he not see this coming like even reading that story to me I would have told him make it more original, more distinct if you want to create a world just create it make everything new or something.... I'm soooooo sorrrrrrrry.

title: Cherry picker from other movies
text: Looks like they cherry picked scenes from Dune, Star Wars, and Matrix as if they cannot come up with original creative scenes, stories, etc. It was very boring and disappointing! I'm not even going to watch the part 2 one! The writers are bad! These actors talks very simple as if they're for kids to understand them. The special effect of the movie was not very original. Just same old thing you seen other movies. Don't waste your money watching this movie.Looks like they have spent wasteful $166 million on just part one movie! I don't think they will revenue very much.This movie is not worth watching!

title: Stunning visuals but who wrote these cringy dialogues?
text: The main plot has so much potential and the visuals are great but please Zack, these stunning shots can't cover for the awkwardness throughout the entire movie.All the dialogues sound like they are translated from another language. They are cringy and most of the time unnecessary. Did the actors get goosebumps saying them? The characters are shalow with almost zero development. They could've cut out some unnecessary part to put more into characters.The main plot twist is also obvious. The whole film felt like a big rush from one scene to another with much depth.As a fan of this type of movie, this is the worst of them all.

title: It's action packed
text: I was entertained throughout. The movie was gripping. Sure its not the deepest film you've ever seen, but this movie is action packed, and entertaining. Sure if you boil it down, the plot of the film is basically about the assembly of a team to prevent an opposing force from coming down hard on a peaceful settlement of farmers. But that's not fair. Really, I think this is a good film. Just beware, it is more about entertaining you then making you think - but what's wrong with that? Not every film has be be a hyperneuronal orgy. Grab some popcorn, turn your home theatre amplifier on and give this a chance - I'm sure you'll enjoy yourself.

title: Every SCI_FI trope nothing original
text: Buckle up for some EPIC "Girl Boss" action. With 100% NO originality. It's laughable how every scene, every interpersonal interaction, every action moment, every setting and circumstance is STOLEN from another movie. It's PAINFUL to watch.Even worse, the fact that this movie has 10/10 in 10% of the ratings either means 1 out of 10 people have never read a book, or seen anything made in the the last 20-30 years. Or, they have dementia.I could literally made a MORE interesting YouTube video pointing out everything stolen from non-obscure (Star Wars Cantina) to the very obscure (G-Force) 80s TV show. Literally everything if lifted from somewhere else.

title: So much wasted potential
text: For the first couple of minutes I was really wondering why so many people were saying this movie was bad, and then you realize this is yet another Zack Snyder film that had amazing visuals but insanely boring dialogue. Each and every character has a gazillion SloMo shots to introduce them that it becomes repetitive.What bothers me is that these are good actors that just were given a bad script to work with. Yes this was part of a Snyder pitch for a Star Wars film, and it shows, but if this was meant to be a rated R film then why go for a PG13 and promising a director's cut later next year?And yeah I know the movie needs certain stuff to happen in order for the plot to move forward, but for some reason every character is exactly where they need to be without much struggling. Why is Netflix wasting even more money in part 2 of this?

title: Worthy of MST2K.
text: Wow... what a giant piece of ***t. Zack Snyder managed to rip off every genre and every trope from every Sci-Fi movie in the past 20 years. About the only thing missing was someone yelling "KAAAAAHHHHNNNN!!!" Absolutely nothing original about this movie - even the slow-motion action sequences were ripped right from every McG movie and series right down the "Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith" climax. Thankfully, the unintentional humor saved this train wreck. I was expecting two pithy robots to pop up next to the couch and chime in. Bad acting, bad dialog, incredibly telegraphed action sequences. Really bad CGI and matte shots that would have made "Star Trek - TOS" look cutting edge.

title: Puzzling target audience?
text: A very strange film. Sometimes you watch a film and wonder what age group the writer was aiming the story at. But the plot here is less aimed at an 8 year old but feels more it was written by one. I'm fine with smashing together whatever genre of film you like in the hope of creating something all encompassing...it rarely works. (To be fair I never liked Firefly's constant western scenes either). But the plot is so cheesy, so painfully obvious. A scene where one of the characters is persuaded to join the effort is so hilarious in how weak the argument was. Maybe it was actually a 15 min scene that was condensed to 30 seconds in the edit?So the plot and most of the script is not good. But maybe the cinematic style is good? If you've never seen Sucker Punch, or recent Superman, Justice League then maybe it will interest you. If you have, then it may feel very tired and frankly lazy. Yes, we quite liked the monochromatic-esq comic book colour pop but perhaps it is time to try something new? Oh and while we are there, floating burning embers, is this now what we overdo rather than lens flare?The acting is fine - given the script they had to work with, some of the close combat is fun, a bizarre Viking village in space is...we'll, cheese...but okay. So it's not all bad...but mostly it is.

title: Beautiful
text: Kora was a hero who didn't want to be a hero but necessity brought out the bravery in her. I like that she was not over confident. Sofia Boutella's acting was superb for action sci-fi. This film has a lot of heart. It reminds me of when I first watched Fellowship of the Ring LOTR Part 1. This movie was done correctly. It wasn't obvious. They weren't trying to promote a hero movie. They were showing how some heroes are reluctant heroes. They weren't all warriors. Kora's live interest was a simple farmer unaware of how evil and cruel man can be. There is a lot to explore in this movie. Back stories that can be expanded further.

title: Unoriginal, badly cast, poorly written but great looking
text: The biggest takeaways from this is just how unoriginal it all is. That and it is too long. And why are there too many ridiculous slow motion scenes?Let us count the many movies that RM steals from.- Seven Samurai (the magnificent seven for those aren't cinelitterate), a bit of Avatar (for the bird taming), Star Wars ( for the definitely not copied light sabres)......any more?Why is Michael Huisman such a terrible p*ssy in this? Why did they get Djimon Hunsou, from Gladiator, to be found on the Gladiator planet? Sofia Boutella is just not convincing in the lead.And lastly, does wheat really grow that fast?

title: Zack is at it again. Must-watch
text: With great music to fuel your shaky feet throughout, rebel moon delivers a mood and feel through its characters, creatures and planet veldt. Incredible acting especially from Ed Skrien and Sofia. Amazing action scenes accompanied with cinematography and great visuals. Anthony Hopkins performance also shines through with his voice alone.I'm surprised that despite being called similar to star wars its more like heavy metal meets mad-max meets 300 with a mix of game of thrones and anime. The most insane mix up of genres but rather than end up a mess its a masterpiece and now the golden standard for Sci-Fi. How did he do it? So excited for the directors-cut.

title: Two hours of your life you'll never get back
text: Can be summarized into:Another skinny woman without muscles that beats up an army of highly trained soldiers like they were babies, goes out into space with her farmer friend to find another army made of rebels to convince them to come back with them and protect a tiny village.This movie has such a poorly written script that you start to wonder if it was written by a bunch of stoned writers or an AI that was fed with cheesy movie scripts.It has Bad dialog with a majority of actors that will never get an award for their acting skills. The most cringe worthy scene was probably when they picked up the drunk general.Whoever choreographed the Bad fighting scenes should just stop doing that for a living. The actors aren't used to making fighting scenes. They just look stupid with Overused slow motion effects. Enemies just standing there waiting to get hit or shot.Most annoying is the Extreme Overused CGI. It looks like the entire movie was done inside a studio with green screens surrounding it.Just really bad. How on earth did they think making a part two would be a good idea?I would be embarrassed to put my name on this if I were the director.

title: Stupid. Boring. Disappointing.
text: What a disappointment.The story? Stupid.World building? Full of arbitrary elements.The acting? Boring.Dialogs? Plain.Characters? Arbitrary.Production design? Poor.Visual effects? Exaggerated.Music? Unbearable.There is so much wrong here.It's hard to watch this film to the end.It's really not rocket science:(a) You need believable characters with backgrounds and plausible motives that you want to root for. It has to be made believable why the characters join a fight that they can barely survive. Otherwise it doesn't matter why they join in, why they are in the movie and it doesn't matter what they do or what they want. Five such characters in a row and the attention of even an indulgent audience is broken. Why, for example, should we sympathize with the protagonist, whose backstory as an indiscriminately murdering soldier of the evil superpower is told at length while the reason that led her into exile with the poor people remains vague? Perhaps they wanted to save the clarification of the change of heart for a sequel?(b) If your set designers have no better ideas than sticking a few hoses and parts of old warships from the Second World War on the wall, then even the CGI doesn't help to make these handicrafts look more futuristic with a few flashes of light. Little fits here: the CGI team obviously had no idea what the set design was doing and vice versa. This is where the storytelling and the execution fall far apart.(c) The visual effects are there to support the action and make the alien world believable. It doesn't get any more exciting when every shot is played in slow motion with the actors using their weapons as clumsily as if they had never had any combat training.The only amazing thing is how the trailer manages to make this pile of junk look like a quality piece of sci-fi cinematography.

title: Amazing
text: Epic! One of the best original movies produced by Netflix.The beginning it's a bit slow but it picks up the pace.It gets more interesting as you discover the characters and get some background on the story.It has a lot of surprises and you get hooked as you go further. I like how it present a lot of things without going into traditional Hollywood clichés.I don't know the director but he is really good and the actors live up to to story. I'm excited for part 2.At some points it gives you some vibes of Star Wars produced by Lucas before Disney that ruined everything.Conclusion.Please give it a chance, it it's worth your time!

title: Cringe worthy story and acting
text: Good god this is such a horrible movie. 2 minutes in and I was cringing. 6 minutes in and I felt ill. I actually stuck it out 26 minutes before I had to stop for my own health. Such a sad ripoff of a previous franchise with such bad special effects. I couldn't believe the reviews until I saw it for myself.Ridiculous dialogue at the intro with no explanation as to why people would rebel against a brand new regime that they probably wouldn't even know existed or affect them for decades. Why crack down on the outer colonies that no one cares about instead of the closer ones that caused the coup?Call 988 instead of watching this, please. It gets better, well not this film, but your life will.

title: Weak Visuals, Even Weaker Story
text: Rebel Moon represents Zack Snyder is at his most self-parody like with a film that's all style without anything going on under the surface. I actually think Snyder is a much better filmmaker that he often gets credit for but all his usual gimmicks are dialled up to 11. It's boring, has no voice of its own, the universe never feels real or tangible with some pretty horrendously inserted exposition. The story itself is so basic which creates no sense of pace or urgency and none of these characters feel like they're given any real motivation to go on this quest Snyder is setting up. It suffers from major Part One Syndrome because the entire film just feels like an exposition dump to establish this world and never succeeds at building any intrigue. The whole thing just drags and the actual climax just comes out of nowhere and falls totally flat, as do all of the other action sequences. I've always appreciated the visuals of Snyder's films but the whole aesthetic of Rebel Moon is surprisingly washed out and kind of ugly. It doesn't have any of Army of The Dead's overuse of shallow depth of field thankfully but there barely a single memorable image in the whole runtime. Rebel Moon feels like Zack Snyder's ode to classic Sci Fi films without any of the understanding of what made them great or iconic in the first place. I have no interest in watching a directors cut when that's really the version of the film we should've been watching to begin with. The whole thing just represents all the worst aspects of Snyder as a filmmaker and it one of his worst films he's ever put out. I can hardly say I finished this with a burning desire to watch part two and with how it ends that's a pretty solid indication of the failure of storytelling that Rebel Moon is as a whole.

title: lacking throughout
text: Terrible script, terrible action,, some very misplaced CGI. What I ffound very strange was that 99% of the entire film only one sidee character had a communiicator. The film for the most part acted like they were in a steampunk world despite fancy spaceships. I really did not find any of the acting convincing and the levels of hammy acting is high.Ive seen better scifi tv series than this, such as the expanse and others, i honestly thought this was going to be on the same level as the latest dune, but it just falls so below mediocre i honestly can barely rate it near 5/10.I certainly have no real intterest in part 2.

title: Terrible writing, terrible acting, terrible accents
text:
You ever watch a foreign film thats dubbed in English? How tone-deaf and terrible the voice actors are? And how the translation isn't done in a way English speakers would actually say things, so it's just kind of awkward and cringe..... That's how this movie is. It's like someone who doesn't speak English used Google translate to write an English script. The actors all have
Really bad accents and the timing and cadence of their lines is incredibly awkward. Do yourself a favor and just ignore this movie entirely. Fight scenes and special effects were doing all the heavy lifting. Without them, I would have rated this negative stars.

title: This movie is so so epic
text:
This is just the part 1 and I can't wait for part 2
The scale of this movie is unbelievable and also this movie is one of the beautifulest movie I watched this year.I think Zack Snyder really really payed attention to the details in this movie and this movie was so rich in methodology and more of its history.Every character's story and s open and they can go with it beyond the limits.I really in joyed this epic movie and I do recommend to all the people across the globe to watch it and have their own opinions about it, Netflix really should be proud of what they achieved.The cast is amazing and I hope I see them in the future as well they become my favorite.

title: Another disaster from 'so called greatest director'
text: Aspires to be Star Wars, but falls flat from the very beginning. Visually brilliant, but as usual terrible screenplay as expected from Snyder.Snyder got more than sufficient resources an able director would desire to create cinema, but he shows once again that he is not worth it.I wished the studio or the Netflix would have spent the resources with an able director. They should be wise not to spend any more resources for a sequel/sequels.I'm waiting for his toxic fans to defend this disaster as a masterpiece.I hope he doesn't return with an argument of watching a director's cut to see what he wanted to show.

title: A mixture of Hollywood and Bollywood
text: Saw this movie, it's look like a mixture of Hollywood and Bollywood movie of 70's, screenplay is totally rubbish, direction is poor, graphics are good and actors also did the good job. Editor missed some important shots, technical film look like a mediocre, this kind of content I am not expecting on Netflix. Most of the shots look a like taken from Bollywood 70's and mixed with star war movie. Editor forget to give a shape to movie and important shots were missing or it was not shot by director. It's a waste of time, no need to create the second part, no body is going to watch. Save your money and our time.

title: I got a bad feeling about this
text: Rebel Moon (aka Rebel Moon: Part One) is a bad film, albeit one that shows signs of a (maybe) decent film somewhere in the future. Not just a Part Two that might make the story feel whole, but an extended cut that represents what the author wanted more than what the studio wanted. Then again, I keep reading that the author and the distributor weren't actually at odds during this production or even in the decision to release it in this state, but I'll get to those stories later.People aren't wrong to call Rebel Moon a hodge-podge of imagery from other tales. I almost find it sort of intriguing. Here is a universe that takes inspiration from Star Wars, Dune, Heavy Metal, and even non-sci-fi works like Gladiator and filters it through Zack Snyder -- who, for all his faults, has a style that is entirely his own. The resulting mess recalls 2015's maddening Jupiter Ascending, except it swaps the lush visuals for drab, blurry browns and greys and just doesn't have as much fun with itself.Also fascinating (to me, but probably an oddity to others) is the anachronistic design of this universe, namely in terms of tech and clothing. Some of the people look something like late 1800s farmers, others like Third Reich officers, others like Roman gladiators, and then some characters, like the robots and cybernetic aliens, seem entirely futuristic. It's not all seamless and usually feels a bit random -- as opposed to something like Dune where we understand why some aspects are primitive and others advanced -- but there's something about it that makes it a lot more interesting to look at than had he simply gone all the way in one direction.It also makes sense, I suppose, if one knows the history of this production. Originally pitched as a Star Wars film but rejected by Disney, Snyder was forced to file off the serial numbers and make up his own sci-fantasy universe in which things variably call back to Kurosawa, space ranger serials, WW2, et al. The problem is that characters like Han Solo have more charisma and characterization in their pinky than any of these new characters do in their entire person.And that's not for lack of a great cast. The movie stars Anthony Hopkins, Sofia Boutella, Djimon Hounsou, Ed Skrein, Michiel Huisman (the two Dario Nahaaris actors, together at last), Doona Bae, Jena Malone, and many more. What we get from them is the usual Snyder fare: Important Dialogue interspersed with meaninglessly stylized action scenes (with slow-motion that, even for Snyder, has little rhyme or reason to it), sexy poses, and vacuous "cool" moments.Sure enough, some of this is pretty cool and, like I said, sometimes intriguing in its unapologetic adolescent-mindedness -- not just the mashing together of toys from various franchises and periods but the inability to focus. As with Justice League and BvS, I also enjoyed the music. Alas, that's about the most I get out of Zack Snyder.I think it's wrong to write him off as worthless -- as many critics are hasty to do -- but as for the masterpiece I believe he has in him (perhaps a film in which we can even, I dunno, be bothered to care about anyone), well, I'll have to keep waiting. And despite Snyder's history of superior, more fleshed-out, more cohesive Director's Cuts, I'm not certain his full version of Rebel Moon will be that masterpiece either.When I saw the Rotten Tomatoes score, I was worried. Not because I thought that I'd automatically dislike the picture, mind you, but because I knew for a fact that there'd be weird discourse about "Snyder cuts" and whatnot. But this time, the narrative isn't that Snyder was betrayed by Netflix (a company that ostensibly gives creators more freedom than big studios); rather, the fact that the released version is incomplete and poorly received is "part of the plan". As in, people are supposed to make a fuss about wanting to see a proper cut, thus generating more PR -- for Snyder and Netflix alike -- until we get one. Yes, I've heard this both from people who hate the film (baffled at the strategy) and some who like it, asserting that we non-fanboys just aren't smart enough to get that the movie is bad on purpose and that God Emperor Zack is playing 5D chess with us all to prove how strong his fandom is.Snyder himself, however, has stated that both cuts are valid and that the uncut R-rated version isn't strictly the CORRECT version to see. Regardless, I guess Netflix didn't actually force him to release it this way -- to remove entire storylines and take out the blood spurts that were clearly meant to punctuate the hits and slashes (as it is, the fights look conspicuously bloodless and oft cut away quickly from the stabs; it plays as if something more was really meant to happen). So who are we fighting by campaigning for this film's completion? And how many truly care enough to save Rebel Moon from, I dunno, its own creators?

title: Waste of 40 minutes
text: What a waste of 40 minutes, that's how long it took to realise I was watching The Magnificent Seven set in space. Gave up, assuming the first film is 2 hours of the seven being recruited before the defence of the farming community in the second film. I could of course be wrong, but can't bring myself to find out. I will just watch the original western, the acting will be better and it doesn't get dragged out like Rebel Moon. Very disappointed, have we reached a point where it's all remakes or rehashed ideas? I hope not, there still seems to be plenty of original films coming out, just not this one.

title: Clickbait of a movie
text: Netflix has been teasing the epic movie they had in the works for 2 years now. And finally when it releases, you want to play it the very second and you then learn what a terrible waste of time it is.The movie's story line has all the usual ingredients for a very generic plot. There is the lead character who has a mysterious past but its revealed without much ado. She is said to be fighting with her inner demons and she expresses that with a 24/7 constipated Bella from Twilight kinda face. Her action sequences although repetitive are the highlight of the movie. She lives in hiding in a farming village where they have automatic sliding doors, but their alarm system is a gong that you have to strike with a hammer. And they plough fields the old fashioned way, lol.All the men are super chiseled. Even someone who walked away from their military career and was living as a drunk on the streets has a chiseled to perfection body. There is a quintessential Asian character who is a swordswoman who runs into a barrage of bullets swishing her swords. Her action choreography was one of the lowest points of the movie.All in all, a really boring waste of money. I feel terrible when Netflix wastes money on projects like this and Archies, then spend a bomb on PR, then gets enough watches on the first day to get it trending and then boast about it. We watch these movies on the first day only because we don't have to buy tickets. Otherwise it would have bombed tenfold than the lowest grossers of 2023.

title: Entertaining but not top of the line
text:
If you're looking to be entertained and enjoy a movie this will do it, its a typical sci fi movie at heart but the CGI is beyond normal movies. The acting is ok nothing groundbreaking but the actors themselves did well for what it was, not sure why this movie is getting all this hate its solid and good, I'd watch several more movies in this universe.CGI - top notch
Acting - good not bad
Entertainment factor - top of the line
Story - Good enough won't make you go I need more but wouldn't mind more.This is more a movie about entertainment then story, Visuals to action and execution is there, has that ah factor going for it.

title: Shockingly painfully bad
text: I don't know a whole ton about Zack Snyder, but from what I've briefly seen and heard, he's a talented dude. So what the hell is this trash pile of a movie?? The only thing I can give it is that it looks okay for the most part, aside from some occasional iffy CGI. Everything else about this movie is god awful. The most flat, boring characters I've ever seen, way too much random exposition, way way too much slo-mo, and a plot/story/universe that is so unoriginal and clearly based almost entirely off of Star Wars with other franchises mixed in. I was so bored to the point where I almost turned the movie off.

title: Embarrassingly juvenile
text: I came into this viewing with very low expectations and still I was disappointed.There were some impressive visuals, but even the visuals had some part that would be embarrassing in a low budget TV-series. There were some really good looking aliens but then there were a lot more that looked like make-up done for a school project. For example they had a creature to ride which was a normal horse with some kind of plate armour on its head, there were lots of designs stolen straight for Star Wars and the villain was just a plain Nazi in a Nazi uniform.Zack Snyder has never been a master writer, but this is just sad. The dialogue is at the level of the original A-team and the plot is on par with an episode of Scooby Doo.The action sequences occasionally shine but most of them are generic at best and are invariably like 80s Arnold action.. you know: 1000 bullets fly but none hit the good guys and they always hit.Even the few actors I would have expected to be good were in fact pretty bad and I don't blame them. I don't know how anyone could deliver a good performance given this script.Giving it 4/10 is a kindness and is only for some of the visuals without which it's a 2/10.

title: Wants to be more... but... umm...
text:
We all want something, right?I wanted this to be good. The cast choices are excellent. There's real talent there. They spared no expense on the costs - it wasn't for lack of money that this movie ultimately fails.Rebel Moon: A Child of Fire - Part One just reeks of pretension. Even the title is pompous and turgid.The movie itself attempts much, but in the end simply is overly grandiose. The dialogue sounds like the script was written by a 13yo writing Star Wars fan fiction: it comes across as wooden, and is awkward coming from the mouths of these actors. The narrative is obvious and derivative.It absolutely LOOKS fantastic, which just makes it's short-comings all that more painful... and in that it's typical Zack Snyder fair. An overabundance of "glorious purpose" in slow motion, and action that makes no sense - but for the aforementioned "glorious purpose".I did want this to be good. Upon hearing about the movie's own origin story, I had intended to see this on an IMAX screen... but I am so very, very glad that I watched it at home, via Netflix.In the end, Shakespeare via Macbeth best sums up Rebel Moon:
It is a tale
Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury,
Signifying nothing.

title: A Collection of Sci-Fi Fantasy Tropes
text: I'm hard pressed to think of a trope they left out of this movie. There is not a single scene with an original idea. Most of the movie is a condensed version of the Star Wars saga but there are bits of just about every other sci-fi/fantasy movie thrown in as well. Visually its good looking and the acting was acceptable for an action movie. It's the plot worth of many eye rolls and groans that kills it.The story is about a reluctant hero that gets the gang together to fight the evil empire. The bad guy is super bad of course and the hero is an unstoppable badass. There are no surprises here. You can hear the dialog in your head before the characters speak because you have seen this movie many times before.

title: Rebel Moon is not Star Wars its a Heavy Metal JRPG and this slaps
text:
Using star wars as a reference point for rebel moon is mostly for people who's only exposure to universe building scifi lies along the SW ST binary.Rebel Moon owes much much more of its inspiration and aesthetic to the magnificent 7 kurosawa & Lord of the Rings Tolkien, arzach moebius, final fantasy (12 & 15) Nomura and Lone Sloan druillet. Just to pick the most obvious.I originally put this at the end but I'll put it here instead because I think it's important. ***
In rebel moon the imperium is explicitly pathetic and uncool in their cruelty and some people will struggle with that.The current big budget ecosystem wans to give us an enemy that is faceless or if not faceless then cool or at least redemeable.Rebel moon offers the imperium none of these. The imperium soldiers aren't given to us a faceless enemy, canon fodder. They're are just as human as us, with names, personalities and even small acts of mercy when they want and all the worse for it. Cruel, bitter and pathetic, they are owed and offered no redemption by their victims or the story. That is the strongest political statement a contemporary film can make about the nature of empire. Some will resent this. ***The development of our lead Kora is brilliantly done, she balances bad assery with vulnerability. Her skill are earned without exaggeration and her history has pathos without being maudlin. And she also saves her gentleman in distress while defending his honor ofc.The world of rebel moon is the real secondary lead in this film. The planets and cultures we glimpse are beautifully rendered and steeped in history and I love that we see evidence of worlds that have evolved independent of each other. The set design is *chefs kiss*, the costume design detailed, well thought out with history's as detailed as the worlds they occupy.Loved the performances with Donna Bae and Charlie Hunnam being easy standouts for all they were secondary characters. Skein as Attics Nobel our villain is sinister from the start and Hopkins work with Jimmy together with the vfx team offers one of the most sympathetic performances. In fact the vfx and makeup team did a phenomenal job. Every ship had weight, felt massive and every creature felt real. I came out falling in love with a cinematic world in a way I haven't experienced since Valerian.If you've played final fantasy, kingdom hearts, star ocean, any big scifi jrpg you'll understand the building a party format that the rebel moon plot follows, from the initiating event to the final boss battle.The big critique is that the party members aren't well fleshed out this is true but it is still very much part 1 as it says in the title so I'm not sure this is fair, it's Assessing the first 2 hirs of what is effectively a 4 hr film at minimum 6hrs extended. The more valid is the choppy pacing in the 2nd act, here the pg 13 edits made from the directors cut for a mainstream audience are more obvious and can be distracting. If I came away with one big critique is that there are parts missing and more than once felt like they were missing. I don't know that I rate the strategy of not releasing the r rated directors cut alongside the pg-13 one and no, I don't have a huge amount of faith in the Netflix release strategy department.But, did I enjoy it? Absolutely. I love scifi, love heavy metal, and most of all I love art that has a strong identity. Rebel moon knows what it is, its a self serious, grounded, large scale adventure and is all the more wonderful for it. 10/10.

title: One of the worst films in Snyder's career.
text: Zack Snyder returned only to deliver one of the worst films in his career.Rebel Moon Part 1 makes a strong visual impression, it lacks depth in its characterizations. Even halfway through the movie, basic information about most characters remains elusive, as their motives and stories are poorly developed. Some characters are introduced early on but then fade into obscurity for the next hour and a half, leaving the audience completely forgetting about them. The disjointed and overly dramatic segments underscore Snyder's struggle with storytelling. Despite great cinematography in the action sequences, the choreography falls short, with slow motion and awkward transitions diluting the intensity of the fights. Despite the impressive visuals, the weak storyline detracts from the overall experience. Perhaps, Mr. Snyder, it would be best to focus on directing rather than writing for future projects.

title: Why is it so blurry... Among other things...
text: I couldn't watch it all the way through. The plot, direction, acting and CGI - nothing really works. I'm not sure what the obsession is with blurring out anything and everything... It is a bloody blurry presentation. I had to switch to The Running Man, a 1980s production, that was visually crisp and way superior than this terrible effort.Netflix needs to think through their strategy. There's limited quality content. This one is so messed up, I'm thinking whether Netflix has a plan anymore, and whether I should continue to pay for this content. It's back to 80s and 90s movies for me, folks. So disappointed....

title: Actually really good!
text: I don't know why people don't like this! I actually found it entertaining! Good actors, decent storyline and I'm excited to see what happens in the others.I think people are just too hard to please and run to make reviews on things they don't absolutely love. Now I'm hard to please I would say as I've watched 4 movies lately that would have been amazing if it weren't for the awful endings.This one... I think it's great! And didn't cliffhanger me too much which I like.I was happy everyone had nice to listen too accents and it had lots of diversity. Some good famous names and good depth to it.

title: Down of Rebel Moon
text: If you are a big fun of the movie without sense, screenplay, actors, logic, than this Masterpiece is right for you. I was trying to find some words to describe this movie but I could not.The Rebel Moon part one, maybe is the only part that would ever exist. Because if you already have seen Star Wars you would be very surprised to find them in to new Zack Snider movie. Copy paste and copy paste.What really surprised me in this movie that they didn't create Dart Mooner of the Rebel Moon. In that case it would explain me better why I was watching the bad scenario of Star Wars.The only beautiful moment in this movie - the End.

title: Shockingly bad
text:
Been seeing the adverts for a while now so I thought I'd give it a go, after all the rest of Christmas TV is dire.The acting is just plain awful, the storyline is long and drawn out and just seems to drag on by until the last few minutes of the film.The bad guys 'robot' is just comically bad and Anthony Hopkins must be running out of money to have accepted this role and the accent of the
No decent special effects and the CGI is just poor. Certainly no Star Wars CGI here.Ed Skreins accent is diabolically overplayed and shockingly bad.I wouldn't waste 2 hours of your time if you know what's good for you! I'd rather watch paint dry than watch this again!

title: So many clichés I almost threw up
text: When is Hollywood gonna learn that these "slow motion action sequences" where a single person kills 10+ enemies isnt cool, its stupid, lazy and boring. I wish I had turned of the movie after that sequence instead of wasting another hour of my life, atleast they have already revealed how the rest of the movies will end roughly 20min into the movie.. The only highlight of the movie was Anthony Hopkins.And I havent cringed so hard over costumes/cgi since seeing the OG star wars movies at an adult age, its like they are trying so hard to be original and edgy, same thing with their constant use of slow motion scenes literally every 2-3 minute.....

title: I Canceled Netflix
text: WOW!! This was awful! A complete ripoff of Star Wars: A New Hope.This dumpster fire of a movie had zero character development, the storyline was a joke, and some of the worst acting I have seen in a long time. The only saving grace was the SFX.But the none of the characters are likable, and even the villains are boring, ripping off WWII soldiers.I like a lot of Sci-Fi movies, even bad ones are a least entertaining, but this is almost unwatchable. Zach Snyder has already ruined the DC Universe, and now he is trying to ruin Sci-Fi altogether. It was because of this dumpster fire of a movie, that I cancelled my Netflix account. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!

title: Visually stunning movie, non political drama, just plain good story.
text: In a time when web series are the preferred mode of storytelling, it is refreshing to see a movie that offers a rich and engaging story. The movie is based on a long and complex mythos which we are not much introduced in the first part, but it can be expected to do justice in the second part. It is evident that the movie has to deal with some challenges, such as pacing, character development, and coherence.The movie is not flawless, but it is certainly different from the usual fare. It has a unique vision and style, and it creates a captivating world for the viewers to explore. The movie is a feast for the eyes, with stunning visuals and effects that enhance the story. The movie also has a good balance of action, drama and it does take itself seriously.I felt that some of the characters were underdeveloped or underused, and their motivations and arcs are not clear. The movie also feels a bit rushed at times, as it tries to cover a lot of ground in a limited time. The movie could have benefited from a more focused and streamlined narrative, and a better connection between the two parts.The movie is not a masterpiece, but it is a adventurous and enjoyable watch. It is a movie that does not aim to be pretentious, but rather to experience the cinema and delight. It is a movie that you can relax and chill with on a weekend, and immerse yourself in a different and fascinating world. The movie is a welcome change of pace, and a refreshing tale to experience. Zack Snyder's work is remarkably well done and I am very excited to experience the second part.

title: There is no soul, only a huge budget
text: Like if they gave an amateur director who happens to be just average the biggest budget ever. We know this is supposed to be a trilogy, but this first one was just a brief that didn't succeed in hooking anyone into the trilogy.Some cool visuals and concepts, but again, no soul or development.Why would you introduce a "cool"-looking character who only talks in a few scenes and doesn't do anything else in the rest of the movie?Why would you have an actor slo-mo run in a situation that is supposed to be full-on action and combat and not even have them make a full-on range of motion of his legs to make it feel like he was actually in an extreme situation and not tip-toeing to make a jump on a moving ship? It just feels lame.

title: Low budget summer Sci Fi Channel flick
text: "Rebel Moon: A Child of Fire - Part One" is a cinematic misfire that squanders its potential with a disastrous blend of incoherent visuals and a narrative that feels like a jumbled mess. The attempt to marry practical effects with CGI results in a visual cacophony, more distracting than impressive. The convoluted plot not only fails to engage but actively repels any attempt at audience connection. Pacing issues persist throughout, turning what should be a space opera into a tedious exercise in endurance. Despite a supposedly talented ensemble, the lead actor's performance is as uninspiring as the script. The forgettable score merely adds to the overall mediocrity, devoid of any emotional impact. Predictability becomes the film's unfortunate hallmark, robbing it of any potential for genuine excitement. "Rebel Moon" stands as a testament to cinematic disappointment, a space opera that crashes and burns without leaving a single memorable mark.

title: The "Action" Movie of no importance
text: The story is just plain bad. It's lifeless and doesn't bring any impact or meaning. I knew the second someone said it was the new Star Wars it would be bad. I hate to say it but Star Wars is liked because it was different than anything before. This has literally no connection or anything that could be resembling Star Wars other than energy guns and different planets. The action scenes as others have mentioned are all in slow mo which is cool for some but when you're trying to get across that the battle is crazy you need it to be fast paced with stuff blowing up everywhere causing disorientation so you get the intensity of the battle. Having a few slo mo scenes of the battle can get this across too, however every action scene is in slow mo. Like literally all except 2. I genuinely am so disappointed with how horrible this movie is. It had a ton of potential and couldn't decide what it wanted to do so it tried everything and came up with nothing. I would skip this 2 hour piece of junk.

title: Yet another Zack Snyder banger
text:
I loved it. It didn't suffer from part 1 syndrome as many stated. It's fast paced but not rushed. Movie left me wanting more and more.Gorgeous set designs and locations, packed to the brim with details, with a lovely cast that once again plays off each other very well, I love the anamorphic lenses and the look! First 2.39:1 Snyder movie in 10 years that's crazy
Can't wait to watch this again and dive into a deeper review, but as is I thought it was a great movie and and I'm eager to watch it in my surround sound set up because the sound design is excellent
Zack cooked with this 10/10 banger
PS: Part 2 teaser fvcking rocked.

title: Instead of a movie they made a audio book
text: When you have a camera in your hand, why do you choose to make a audio book?All they do is talk and talk and talk and talk.Instead of telling us, show us! You have a camera, right?This audio book is not worth the time.Everything need to be explained with words instead of pictures. And when the characters needs to be introduced, they are so with the standard book of filming. "Films for dummys". This person is evil, he has to kill someone. These soldiers are evil, they have to be pigs. This girl needs to be the hero, she has to kill the evil soldiers.I actually thought this film was supposed to be ok. But after 1 hour of talking I turned the TV off and went to bed.Tomorrow I will cancel my Netflix account, finally.

title: Ticks every cliched box. Avoid if you can.
text: If you've seen enough movies, then you've already seen this. It's not interesting enough of a movie for me to be bothered listing them, but it has almost every cliche under the sun without being interesting in itself. The characters aren't interesting, the story is well worn and hackneyed, and the cgi is both ordinary and obvious. It was clearly made as quickly as possible to fulfill the content quota for Netflix, and had no redeeming features beyond helping those with insomnia get some sleep. The actors did what they could but had little to work with, the writers well, I can only assume it had actual writers and not some AI program.

title: Special Effects Only
text: If I had any advice I'd say turn down the volume and watch the amazing special effects. However, the action scenes are chock full of super slow motion parts that it makes even that a lesson in futility. The lack depth...every single one is dark and brooding, even the comedic ones. The story is basically Star Wars: A New Hope dressed down in Emo fashion, without any of the charming, interesting or likable characters. The dialogue is awful. The hand to hand combat is embarrassing. The feel of the film is dark, dim, out of focus and quite flat. The main character is a skinny young woman that battles huge, muscled men and monsters with ease. The main antagonist is a skinny young woman that battles huge, muscled men and monsters with ease. There are so many plot holes you can't watch for 15 minutes without falling in to 2 or 3. Because Marvel, Star Wars, Star Trek, Doctor Who, DC, Disney have all failed to bring entertaining SciFi or fantasy media I was sooo looking forward to this new adventure. It's as bad as all the rest. There is a serious lack of creative minds in charge of our media. Someone needs to develop a new industry to take over from the black hole that is Hollywood.

title: Seven Samurai+Star Wars with a bit of Dune = Rebel Moon
text: Honestly, it's a fun action sci-fi movie for the holidays. Does it have good writing? Nope, not really. Is the acting good? Ehh it's okay, very stiff delivery and accents are so so. How are the visuals and action scenes? Not bad, very comic book like and lots of slow motion scenes that it became somewhat comedic but still visually interesting. If you just want some pretty eye-candy and decent action scenes (I like the spider fight and the water girl scene) but are okay with mediocre writing and angsty main character then you will probably like this movie. Zack Snyder is not the best writer, it's more like a 2hr long comic book with lots of cool action scenes and if you are bored and want to see a decent sci-fi flick then Rebel Moon is a good choice.

title: Remake of "Battle Beyond the Stars"
text: It's certainly true that Rebel Moon is a merger of Star Wars (1977) and Seven Samauri (1954) / The Magnificent Seven (1960). But when you really boil it down, it's a remake of Battle Beyond the Stars (1980) and in many ways it's just as cheesy. Poor character motivations, unbelievable loyalties, no depth of backstory... As other reviews have mentioned, the CGI is spectacular. The movie looks beautiful... but the acting is stiff, the writing is awful, the editing is OK, and it's been done before. It's very true that it's hard to find a truly original story in book or film, but it takes a pretty good story to be better than the original(s) you're copying. As an example, when you watch Silverado (1985) you can see the influence of The Magnificent Seven (1960), but you don't dwell on it. Here, you dwell on it. This film had a lot of hype and I wanted to really enjoy it. But it's simply too two-dimensional and obviously not an original film to really enjoy. It's probably better than Battle Beyond the Stars (1980), but not enough.

title: Dull cliché filled drivel
text: I love sci-fi and wanted to love this. But this whole movie just feels like soulless action scene after action scene. Visually it looked good. But the storytelling was really poor. No time was taken to make you care about the characters and there was no significant relationships built on screen. The story was so dull that I wasn't engaged and really struggled to finish the film. I felt the actors did ok considering the poor script, but they still couldn't craft interesting characters. How they persuaded the great Anthony Hopkins to sign on to this, I am not sure. His character was probably the only one I found interesting, and his run time was unfortunately extremely short.It is clear the movie had a monster sized budget, and even spawned a sequel (?!). But how and why is something I do not understand. The film is way too long, has no heart and uses clichés abundantly - to the point I considered creating my own drinking game whilst watching... one drink for every sci-fi cliché! But pretty sure my liver wouldn't have survived it...Overall I was left with two key questions - how did this get made and who decided Charlie Hunham should do an Irish accent?!Netflix... just because you can, doesn't mean you should.

title: Copycat from other movies and videogames
text: Where to begin? Netflix put together a recycled story without character development. I see many copied scenes from Avatar, Dune, World of Warcraft, and John Carter. Some of the battle scenes in the first part of the movie make no sense like the bar fight and the spider battle.I see no original content and just another movie filler to add to the list to keep Netflix subscriptions up. They added the Part One to the title to insinuate more movies to keep people somewhat hooked. Netflix is known to cancel good shows after 1 season.Overall 5/10 because this had so much potential. Instead of this movie, watch John Carter if you're craving a sci-fi movie or the Creator on Amazon Prime, not this.

title: Snyder vs Soderberg
text: What Soderberg does in 10-15 minutes in an oceans film Snyder takes 120 minutes to do. In classic Snyder fashion all style over substance. Some great visuals but no story. Lots of very talented actors and brilliant visual effects ruined by a 2 hour "assembling the team" montage of a movie. Just add something, anything, like hey maybe the resistance would be interested in helping cuz they know where and when the enemies most dangerous weapon will be. Why should anyone think 6d dudes gonna fight off an army. It would be fantastic to see any of these legendary warriors and generals do just that. Explain the backstory behind the death of the king, why should we consider him and his good or should we? Who killed the king, why are his vassals going nuts and full nazi.

title: Its was perfect..for me! Loved it!
text: Well, i dont get the fuss. I absolutely loved the movie. For me, the pace was great, action just right knowing that there is more to come.I mean. We built a rich universe, awesome backstory. A just cause and there are still some unresolved questions.I never expected that they blow up all, and truimph all in one go.Mr Snyder, I loved this movie. I never write reviews and I thought that this is me showing my appreciation for your creativity and what you and your production team(s) have served up.Acting is standard fare, it suits the movie. What i really got was a heist/sci-fi/worldbuilding ect like Brandon Sandersons Mistworld.In fact, if I had the money to bankroll you, you would be perfect to partner with Mr Sanderson to deliver the most epic fantasy heist movie of all time!Keep it up, cannot wait for PART 2.With much appreciation to you and team. And thanks to Netflix for supporting. This will become a cult classic that I know. Tonight I am watching it again, and in years to come, again and again with my kids as one of dads best movies of all time..Francois.

title: Pulpy, Messy, Campy, Surprisingly Okay
text: Rebel Moon gives you a lot to chew on all at once. Is it a drama, an action-comedy, a sci-fi western? It's hard to tell, and you never really get a chance to get your bearings. As soon as the action starts, you're on a one way trip straight through this new universe Snyder has envisioned, and this vehicles does not stop.It became clear to me not too far into the movie that I was going to have to adjust my expectations if I was going to enjoy it. A thoughtfully considered and painstakingly crafted story this is not. It's more like the pulp fiction daydream of a very excitable 14 year old geek. It's less of an entree and more of an appetizer platter. It'll fill you up, but it tastes a bit strange all mixed together on your plate.That said, if you can temper your expectations with that in mind, and just enjoy the ride, Rebel Moon isn't all that bad. It has some pretty cool ideas, and the make-up work, costuming, and props are all pretty sleek, so there's plenty of eye candy in that regard. There are also some fabulous actors in the cast. They're talent is a bit hampered by the poor direction, but they're still great at what they do.Overall, I think if you can take off your critic hat for a moment, turn off you brain, and don't take the film too seriously, you MIGHT just find yourself enjoying it.

title: A new original world without a spin off insight, loved it.
text: I really did enjoy this, it's definitely setting up more. The characters and stories are exciting as is the start to the back story and the princess, the robot also adds excitement...I was a little worried seeing some of the critics scores but then the same critics gave Marvels, She Hulk and others 9/10 so I'm not sure how that works...It's definitely not perfect but I really enjoyed it and I'm looking forward to more... a R rated cut would be good before April, I get the audience appeasing release for a younger audience, it's a great approach!I can't remember how long it has been to watch something like this that isn't a series spin off or movie spin off. We seem to live sequels and prequels... This is very welcomed and I loved it. Hopkins voice too 👌🏼

title: All the hype but yet so disappointing on so many levels
text: I was so looking forward to this first instalment, but having watched it I'm left feeling so disappointed, on so many levels.It is a mish mash of ideas, of themes, drawn from far superior sci fi epics, such as Star Wars, WH40K et al. It ultimately is a pale shadow of what it could and should have been.Try as I did, I could not invest in the story line, the characters, I had no buy in, I just couldn't get behind the "good guys" because they were so one dimensional and so predictable.The acting is average and the visuals? Please don't get me started and what's with the constant slow motion action "scenes"? It's just so overdone.A very poor effort.

title: What utter tosh
text: What is Zack Snyder thinking? This is complete nonsense. The story makes no sense. It's a mix of sci-fi, fantasy and western, but in the worst way.The special effects are some of the worst I've seen in a while. It looks more like it's from the late 80s in places than what many films get right now. At the start, a space ship uses some kind of worm hole to travel through space. When this appears, it looks like a giant vagina. I'm assuming this is deliberate, I just don't know why.All the scenes on alien worlds, look so much like they are in a studio, with big paintings in the back ground.The dialogue is laboured and hilariously bad. The acting is slow and over the top. I can only assume Zack was very exacting with what he wanted from the actors.Lastly the action is tame. It's full of slow mo, that shows up how shonky the fight sequences are.If you are looking for great sci-fi from recent times then watch Dunes, The Creator or Andor, these are all far superior, and their existence makes this even worse.

title: Incredibile potential totally wasted
text:
The film presents a storyline brimming with potential, yet it falls short in its execution, lacking depth in critical areas. Character development is notably absent, leaving the audience unable to connect deeply with the protagonists. The dialogue often feels superficial, contributing minimally to the narrative's progression. While the world within the movie hints at intriguing possibilities, its development feels underexplored, resulting in a somewhat simplistic portrayal of the environment and its underlying logic.On a positive note, the movie excels in its use of CGI, which stands out as a highlight. These impressive visual effects make the viewing experience aesthetically pleasing. The world-building, while only moderately successful, shows promise and provides a glimpse into a potentially richer universe.Overall, this movie might be particularly enjoyable for viewers who have a penchant for sci-fi and fantasy, and those with modest expectations, especially those who value high-quality visual effects over a strongly developed storyline and character arcs.8/10 at CGI
4/10 overall.

title: Dont trust the bad score
text: I don't know what's going on here, but a rating of 5.5 is complete nonsense. Maybe because the film deals too clearly with the themes of submission and rebellion? A THING like The Creator gets almost a 7!Definition of Hypetrain !Rebel Moon is so much better in any way: its full of creative ideas. It's exciting. Much fewer logic errors.It's just fun, while The Creator just made you sleepy!In Germany it was reported in the press that the film would "contain dialogues that had already been heard a thousand times". Maximum facepalm!Bad things: Some CGI looks strangely outdated (artistic intention?).Looking forward for part 2 !

title: Boring!
text:
Beyond boring. I am about 2 mins away from finishing this but I can't even focus on the movie because of how bland and boring it is.Starts out slow
Middle part is slow
The last bit is a dull
That sums it up to be honest.Would end the review there but need more characters so. So many scenes had me thinking why did they do that or how dumb was that. Especially towards the beginning.None of the characters really leave an impression on me even though it is over 2 hours long. The action sequences are very bland and generic nothing that leaves an impression on you it just feels kinda meh.Boring film with a dragged out story that leaves barely an impression..

title: Seven Samurai in space
text: The storyline is clearly inspired by seven samurai, and taken to space/galactic backdrop. Seems like Akira Kurosawa continues to have impact on sci-fi directors (similar to original Star Wars where George Lucas took inspiration from Hidden Fortress). Seven samurai was one of the first Japanese movie I had seen, it had left an impression on how it portrayed poverty, brutality and helplessness. And that's where the story of bravery and sacrifice of few stands out. This being a Jack Snyder movie the focus is more on visuals than story. However visually and thematically it is not something new - similar to Star Wars in a sophisticated future with space hopping, there are rag tag villages, bad guys always somehow resembles nazi soldiers, and planets always seems to be nearby. Was expecting something new. This makes me feel a fresh take on sci-fi from Hollywood will take longer.

title: Saldly sad.
text: What more would I want than a good piece of sci-fi and some guilty visual pleasure. But after more than 20 minutes everything felt so uncomfortably bad that I couldn't help but read reviews so as not to waste my time. It seems like it was a good decision.Although I can tolerate the medieval appearances of intergalactic travelers, I cannot tolerate preschool dialogue and plots as superficial as tracing paper. How difficult it can be to write something that feels like real people in real circumstances. A mystery.A shame, because I was genuinely interested in this potential new franchise. Someone get Snyder away from pencil and paper once and for all.

title: Don't listen to the haters! Just watch it.
text: The lead actress is phenomenal. I've seen her in other movies and I'm glad she's given this break to be in the leading role. She deserves it. The other supporting cast members were amazing. I love the story telling and the message of this film. The phasing was great - it didn't bore me at all. The right drama, action, intrigue and suspense to keep me glued to my seat. The cinematography, set designs and CGI were very well done. It's another win for Jack Snyder and his team. They really did a wonderful job. Sure, there are many similarities to other big pop culture movies (Avatar, Star Wars and the likes). But I don't mind. As long as the story is cohesive and I get some little shocks here and there - I'm ok with that. Watch it! Its what movies are all about - a little escapism - but full on entertainment!

title: Star Wars at home
text: This movie does not provide a single original idea. It was supposed to be a star wars movie that then didn't get green lit, or something. You really can tell. The first 40 minutes you are painfully aware what each person's role and true appearance should have been, had this been produced as part of the star wars franchise.With the movie reminding you in most sequences that this was conceived as a star wars story, it continues to "borrow" (more like "badly copy") themes and ideas from other films.The images are painfully sterile, sometimes the green screen is more than apparent. With some films relying on well choreographed fights, paired with creative camera works, this movie relies on copying the fights from 300: a side view from the action paired with slow motion. The most creative thing this movie does is "a slow motion of a slow motion".Compare this to Nolan, Bay or even any Jackie Chan movie and you will crave to watch any of those movies instead of letting you get bored to death by Rebel Moon.Other imagery is stolen from The Matrix, Avatar (the Pandora one), Terminator and even LotR.There are basically no dialogues in this film. Everything feels like cheap exposition and every character talks at face value - no thinking required on the viewer's side.This movie was boring, sometimes a little funny in how bad it was (but never funny on propose).

title: Battle beyond the stars spoof.
text: Not a very good movie. I even wasnt able to watch it in 1 time. It just didnt catch me. Storyline was far from original, but that can be compensated with good action and special effects. Well besides a lot of explotions it was boring. Lot of slow motion, when shooting, no spaceship battles and backgrounds as if we were back in the 90's. And for people thinking this complete storyline is stolen from star wars, unfortunatly it wasnt. Yes there is an evil empire and someone wielding a kind of lightsabres and there was a rebellion, but actually the main storyline is a remake of battle beyond the stars. But that one was more fun too watch. Trust me it is more useful to watch every star wars movie ever made and battle beyond the stars and all other movies this one is loosly based upon (i.e. 7 samurai, magnificent 7, 300, gladiator), than rebel moon. Yes it takes more time, but at least you will be amused a lot more. Zack Snyder you can do better than this.

title: What's with all the hate???
text: Just finished watching, been on my Netflix watchlist for quite some time, whilst waiting for part two (hate cliffhangers). Frankly it is a Netflix movie but why the bad reviews ? I was engaged from the beginning. Don't expect the whole story handed to you on a silver plate right at the beginning, or in the middle but come on people, where is the love of sequel? Of waiting how it turns out? The love of rooting for characters? Even tho the storytelling, script and some acting is sometimes disappointing (I was willing to overlook it), but the action is good with some very charismatic actors. So don't sit there and try to find every single failure in the film and acting, just sit there, start watching and expect nothing but a story that begins and will continue with a fair amount of action. Pick a side and start rooting for your favourite because all in all it is a film that is supposed to entertain. And it does!

title: Snyder Style Reddick/Star Wars Hybrid
text: Take the Storm Troopers from Star Wars who cannot shoot and just stand there in battle, add the more violent tone of Reddick, throw in a bunch of slow motion in the action sequences to give it a Snyder feel, and you get Rebel Moon.The end result is something generic and predictable. Its not the worst sci-fi ever made but its a bit hard to get on board a story with blatantly idiotic bad guys who are technologically advanced but cant make their own food... and a heroin who is already at the peak of her ability pretty much playing with her food most of the time, and a bunch of tragic back story tag along troops.The universe setting is essentially a copy of the Disney Star Wars trilogy with that super Jedi lady and nazi-like empire (First Reich or something?). Those were not good movies, so why try to copy them?The feel of the movie is a lot darker than star wars and remind me more of the Reddick line of films. Aside from the Storm Troopers who cant hit anything, the fighting were more gritty similar to scenes you see with Vin Diesel taking on a room of bad guys though not nearly as fun. The Reddick films didnt take themselves as seriously as this one sprinkling in some comedic scenes here and there. This had no such thing. It had a very serious tone.Overall, id say this is probably better than Disney Star Wars because those were almost unwatchable, but worse than even the worst Reddick movie. So this is maybe somewhere in between? Again its not the worst sci-fi ever made but I seriously doubt they will make a second unless they have money to burn.

title: Yet another big budget film with appauling sound mixing
text: One mega budget film after another with sound so badly mixed for tv as to be almost unlistenable. Thunderous one minute and can't hear quiet the next. The only way I could watch it is with the remote in my hand permanently turning it up and down. I'm trying to watch it on a very high end tv and I may as well have the cheapest tv in the shop for the sound issues.The film itself is ok and nothing more. It's nothing new with a comedically ott main baddy and chiselled heroes. Yet more women kicking the backsides of male opponents twice their size and baddie grunts who couldn't hit a barn door from 5 yards with a bazooka add to the cliché reality failures.It's just a seven samurai remake in a scifi setting and with a budget that size I'd have expected more.

title: Predictable glitzy eye-candy
text: I am a life long sci-go fan. From the masterpiece of 2001, to Gattica, Minority Report, Interstella, A. I, Automata, series like Peripheral captivated me. I have a tattoo that's an ode to Blade Runner, and my wife is also a huge sci-fi fan. We love to watch these works, and pause to discuss our observations, opinions and insights.We TRIED to watch Rebel Moon. It's just... awful. We've all seen this film already, so formulaic it is.We didn't pause once to talk, and after 20 minutes we both agree to stop. The only thing it's got it the spectacle of effects with mediocre acting. What is this is a film contributing to the art? I don't know. Might as well be written and created by ChatGPT.

title: Lucky Dip, Pick and Mix from all the classics with a Dash of Mummy Returns
text: I have seen every single sci-fi film from1950s right up to Rogue.If there was original writing the producer and directors of this obviously never heard of it. It was absolutely awful. The characters have zero depth. Thor has more depth than the entire cast of this film. At least he was easy on the eye! Did the director grab a bunch of stills from other films, then show it to the cast and crew to replicate?I think kids with exposure to B grade action flicks or those who have not seen Star Wars or Blade Runner will love it.Jajabinks had more character development than anyone here.Waste of time.

title: New sci-fi with 40k flare
text: This is the first movie and it's definitely a character building story, good special effects and pretty decent acting. I was entertained the entire time and left wanting to see more. Yea does it have recycled ideas? Sure! Is that a bad thing? Nope! I can't wait to see the next part! My advise is to enjoy movies instead of criticizing them, there are good movies and bad ones, this is a good movie! Heavily influenced by 40k universe it scratches that itch before the real 40k show comes out. If you like sci-fi you'll probably like this, if you dont.....don't watch it? The names and characters are ripped right from 40k...and that's not a bad thing! There is plenty of world building (which apperantly people don't like? And they set up the movie for the action in part 2. If you watch the movie like that it makes allot of sence and is very interesting/entertaining.

title: Set your expectations to low and you won't be disappointed.
text:
I'm 64 old, 50 years ago at 14 I would have thought this was the greatest film ever made. However having seen hundreds of films in those last 50 years I can say that this is the most derivative and unoriginal film I have witnessed.See if you can spot the following films while you watch it:-The Seven Samurai
Star wars
Avatar
Et al...The story is totally unoriginal. Every Sci Fi trope you can think of is trotted out. The characters have all the animation and depth of a desciated slug. The script is banal.On the up side the CGI is first rate but given the studio and director that is not surprising.Great for a teenager. Set your expectations to low and it's almost worth watching. Oh ane watch out for the horses in fancy dress!

title: This is not the success they were looking for....
text: I watched "Rebel Moon" last night on NF. Unfortunately, the film fails miserably on so many levels.Its pacing felt sluggish and overly prolonged-a comment I rarely make about movies. The narrative was lackluster at best, marred by subpar acting and dialogue that was just not well thought out.Visually, the movie had its moments of beauty, but there were also instances where the CGI appeared rushed and unfinished, with a soft focus that detracted from its storytelling. This seemed like a deliberate choice, but really it's questionable.The excessive use of slow motion often felt forced, over used and failed to convey the intended emotional impact.Overall, the film was a chaotic blend of underdeveloped plotlines and unnecessary scene shifts, failing to deliver on the excitement it promised. It touched on numerous storylines without giving them adequate focus or explanation and jumped between locations so much your head spins.As a fan of Zack Snyder's work, especially his version of "Justice League," I had high hopes for this movie. However, it turned out to be a huge disappointment.The entire narrative of this installment could have been condensed into a 30-minute segment, setting the stage for a more cohesive story which I guess we might get in the next movie.For me, sadly, "Rebel Moon" rates a dismal 4 out of 10.

title: meh
text: It started great, lots of potencial.Then suddently everybody goes to space trying to recruite the avengers, they find stars wars over there and come back with characters that lack narrative depth and real motivation.I swear there are scenes straight up stolen from Avatar. That randomn guy casually trying to ride the angry flying beast or even when the villan is in fetus position on the ground with light wires connecting out of him ... Just felt like it was jake sully connecting with mother nature xDI'm ignoring the second part, it will be another two hours we're never getting back.The cinematography was nice though.

title: Looking forward to the second part!
text: I don't understand some of the ratings here....The movie is the first chapter of the story. The filming, the images, the atmosphere-s are all just beautiful. You are transported in a world that does evoke Star Wars, but it's in a way a tribute to the SW universe. The director is not trying to build a new SW, the storyline has its own narrative.I was looking forward to seeing Sofia Boutella in this role, and she didn't disappoint! She's perfext in it. Her acting is in line with who the character is, the character's past and struggles/demons. It's also a very physical role. The acting of the rest of the actors is also on point, it's exactly what this type of sci-fi is about.Keep in mind this is a first chapter, an introduction to the rest of the story, which I think some of the other reviewers here seem to be forgetting.I recommend watching it, and I'm so waiting for the second part.

title: Could have been something great, such a wasted potential
text: Plot seems to be written by a 15 year old who has not watched a sci-fi before. Characters are all shallow and the plot is progressing at a pace which defies reality and reason. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is the cool fight scenes and visual effects. The universe could have been explored more, this could have been a very successful saga, the story is actually compelling and the background of the main character is interesting. However the poor execution of this movie makes me not want tk watch any future sequels. I had to fight the urge to stop the movie midway and switch to something else.

title: Zach Snyders D&D campaign?
text: I tried to watch Rebel Moon with an unbiased eye. The more I watched, the more I got the feeling that Zach Snyder got drunk one night during a D&D campaign and just threw together all the ideas that were spitballed for a new campaign, and cobbled them together into what is supposed to pass for a movie.
