You either have a character with an insanely intricate backstory (my mother died trying to save me from the evil wizard whilst also being the evil wizards daughter and uh she had a very specific type of incurable disease and then I grew up....) or a barely there backstory (uh... I'm a farmer I guess?). This is what happens when a feminist, a star wars fan, a warhammer 40k fan, and a LotR fan get drunk during D&D and roll nothing but 1s..

title: Very disappointing
text: Wow, I was extremely disappointed with this movie. It seems to be a rip off of so many other science fictions i.e. Star Wars, etc. Everything in the story was very predictable. I thought the pacing was a little fast. Everything just seemed to fall into place too easily not much suspense at all if you're looking for a no-brainer shoot them up kind of sci-fi movie. This just might be the one for you. I don't know if I'll bother watching part two this is a very disappointing for Snyder because I really enjoyed his other films and his redo of the Justice league I don't know if this series can be saved.

title: What did I just watch?😅 It's so bad....
text: Hm...So, they have spaceships that jump through warm holes and travel to the edge of galaxy in an instance, but their engines are powered by hundreds of solders feeding coals into the burner in a boiler room...The way they control those spaceships is using buttons, switches and turn wheels like how they operated the submarines in World war 2.The empire that controls the entire universe sends these spaceships to the edge of the universe, burning God knows how many tons of coals to jump through worm holes so that they can collect wheats hand-grown by human because empire needs food!?!?There are so many terrible story writing in the video like this...Who the hell wrote the story? And how did they get the green light to make this? And a part 2, too!?!?It's too bad. There are some good actors in it but I feel so bad for them to be involved in a garbage like this...

title: Waste of time
text: "Rebel Moon" disappoints on every front as it shamelessly parades as a Star Wars rip-off. From narrative to character design, it lacks any semblance of originality. The plot is a clumsy mishmash of familiar tropes, failing to offer any innovative twists. The characters are mere caricatures, lacking depth and genuine development. Despite attempts at grandiose visuals, the film falls short, unable to capture the awe-inspiring magic of the original. The dialogue is cringe-worthy, attempting to replicate the iconic lines of Star Wars but missing the mark entirely. Even the soundtrack, a feeble attempt at emulating John Williams, only highlights the stark contrast in quality. "Rebel Moon" serves as a stark reminder of the pitfalls of unoriginality, delivering a lackluster experience that fails to honor the legacy it shamelessly borrows from.

title: I'm Want to Love It, But Can't
text: Its beautiful in some instances. The worlds have so much potential. The story and background could be there. I'm really interested in some of the races and places - unfortunately we never get the details we want.The real problems here are:1. The lack of depth in the characters. They go about finding members for their team that seem to be from different reaches of the realm that we learn nothing about.2. Slow-mo everywhere. There's far too much in the fight scenes, but I can't think of any reason for it while somebody is standing still in snow. Its too bad to even be comical when they bust it out for a hug and kiss in a flashback. It doesn't increase the drama, it feels like a reason to add 20 minutes to the runtime. The choreography is so lifeless in the final fight, I found myself skipping ahead to just see how things end.3. The dialogue. Every line feels like filler that could have been written by ChatGPT. It has no life, no character, no style. It's just there to fill the silence and drive the next scene.4. Lack of any struggle. Everything just moves right along as you expect. "There's a guy at this place that could help"... So they go to that place, and they find that guy. He say's no, they say "aw, come on man", he says "ok" *handshake*.. on to the next one.Maybe part two will be good. Big maybe.

title: Better Story Telling Please
text: Watchable, but very clunky story telling, in a sad effort to make you like the characters. Every time a new character is introduced, they pause to do a weak backstory, that really says nothing about them. Zero character development, with overused actions scenes that inspire no emotion. It would have been better if it were part of Stars Wars, as originally intended, then we could have skipped the whole, trying to be the Empire, without being the Empire, but ended up being a weak, not very menacing antagonist. As stated, it was watchable, but it's not something I'd watch again, and probably won't bother with the second one.

title: Enjoyable enough, too much CGI and slow mo.
text: With a better director this could have been a good film. The reliance of CGI and slow mo put me off a bit. I still gained enjoyment (sci-fi geek) out of it. Compare it more to Jupiter ascending than Star wars though. The moment a man jumps from a cliff onto a flying giant bird was when I realised the director does not care about realism in any shape or form.Charlie Hunman was best thing in it. One of the great things of Star wars was for example the music in the cantina. In the cantina in rebel moon you just get boring slow mo fight scenes. Slo mo = a director who has no more ideas. My only hope is he sees this review and sorts out the post production of episode 2.

title: The copy of a copy, trite and empty
text: I really had no expectations when facing this film but I decided to watch it without judging it beforehand.Unfortunately the result was disappointing. I understand that a writer has certain works as the foundation stone for his own work, but if Zack Snyder wanted to make a Star Wars remake with different names, he could have told us.Nothing in the work feels truly authentic and all of its pieces wander freely without any real connection. The characters lack a previous story, a motivation, ideals that justify the reason for their actions, it is simply poorly written.Not to mention the annoying excess of editing such as slow-motion that is always forced into the film's visuals. I love science fiction and I want to enjoy each and every movie of the genre that I watch, but finishing Rebel Moon was quite a challenge and I'm sorry, don't count me in for its sequels.

title: Feels like anime, looks aren't everything
text: Alright so I went into this cold, not knowing much beyond the trailer several months ago. First impressions "hey this feels like Warhammer 40k meets Samurai 7 (the anime from the mid 2000s)".By the end, that's exactly what it is, a weird mix of 40k and Samurai 7 with a heavy dose of star wars, and i'm all for that.Really needs another 30-40 mins of character development for the "team" that's sorely lacking but honestly, super distinctive CGI, cliche yet familiar and fun story, too much slow mo.Quite honestly the whole thing feels like anime and that's not a bad thing. Got more enjoyment from this than the last few Star Wars movies, Dune or a lot of the recent SciFi. Solid hard scifi for scifi nerds. 9/10 if you like mid 2000s anime, warhammer 40k and 80s action movies.

title: Rebel Moon...What ever!
text: First to make it clear, I am a fan of Zack Snyder DCEU Trilogy, but I didn't like the way this movie was built on. A plotless story, no characters' development, fast storytelling rhythm, some characters are there like NPCs, seems that's something missing, CGI was not that good, even the actors aren't doing efforts mastering their roles and character representation.Slo-mo battle sequences are dumped every time, the blurs and focus disturbs the eyes, this doesn't make it awful as the landscapes and the background looks good, therefore, someone should polish Zack Snyder scripts and dialogues. Now I get why Lucasfilm refused Zack's pitch for a Star Wars movie.

title: Oh my. Opportunity missed.
text: Well, I had great hopes for this, all the hype and everything behind it so far, pretty predictable, pretty lame old trope that's been dragged out time and time again. I'm a third way through so far and I will probably persist but does certainly have to improve a real lot for me to be interested in watching part two. They real need to pick up the game. Here is one of the other reviewers says good candy, but an empty shell. I often wonder why things like this get all the money spent on them, and great shows like raised by wolves or even colony just get killed off, and they are so much better than this tripe.

title: Amazing Fantasy Sci-Fi ...
text: As a child, I grew to love reading Fantasy Sci-Fi. This began after seeing the first Star Wars movie in the theater. Star Wars: A New Hope was so revolutionary that I viewed it over thirty times. Later I played board and PC games like Arcanum: Of Steamworks and Magick Obscura and recently Baldur's Gate III, both offer wonderfully balanced Fantasy Sci-Fi.Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire instantly impressed me on all levels. Great emotional story, beautiful visuals, superior casting, seamless believable effects, and the music was perfectly subtle. This true balance promises variety into the future far more than the basic cookie cutter.Well done!

title: One big lazy Cliché
text: I feel there was not a single original idea in this sucker punch of a film, so many old earth accents and not a decent bit of dialogue to be heard. It has a hobbit village, a princess, Conan turns up and does nothing. The greatest general of the age is found and spouts a couple of bad speeches and at one point Jar Jar is seen. Even the visuals are stolen. The bad guys and their weapons are straight out of Warhammer 40k and then the awful out of place OTT music score is trying to punch above it's weight. Another case of great trailer shame about the Film.See if you can spot the stormtroopers who still can't hit anything and even the Emperor makes an appearance lool.

title: An insult to all things sci-fi
text:
Seriously. I'd read the reviews and decided the peanut-gallery of opinion might be biased.I watched it. I understood. Oh my gosh!It was actually terrible. I can't even to begin to explain the lameness of the plot. It is like all other plots from all other sci-fi shows merged into one uninteresting mess.I mean, they take things from Aliens, Empire Strikes Back, Avatar, and more. But, this show succeeds at nothing. It has on soul.It is a wannabe of Netflix.I saw that someone had written, "was this written by AI?"
I laughed at first, but i get it, it may have been actually.Everything about this show was terrible.Acting, writing, screenplay. Plot, green-screen nonsense.Any actual sci-fi fan is an eternal hopeful. This one will challenge those hopes a bit more.Seriously, if you choose to watch this, keep a beverage and you fast-forward button nearby.

title: Good Sci-Fi movie
text: I do not understand why some commentators are describing this movie as a knock off of the Star Wars franchise. And I also fail to understand why all the negative feelings are so heightened towards this movie. In my opinion, it is simply one of the good new sci-fi movies out there. The plot is classic and not very brilliant. However, overall, the actors did a good job portraying their characters, and the CGs are good compared to other movies. It is an easy movie to watch if you leave the stereotypes behind and simply enjoy watching it without comparisons or being judgmental. Simply put it is a good movie.

title: Sci-try movie
text: Visuals were awesome, however no development of storyline among many great actors, very subpar acting...I expect better from zac snyder...goonies guys was the best only because i felt some nostalgia 😂😂...I feel like there were too many slow mo moments for no reason, also I agree with a previous comment about women beating up evey man they encounter, so very unrealistic to say the least. I wonder what the budget on special effects were because this is one very beautiful movie. In conclusion, there were some really good ideas thatvcould have been developed on that would up my rating so I will say less is more when it comes to this movie. I hope the 2nd part is more pointed and thought out.

title: Unoriginal and boring!
text: Rebel Moon is the latest Sci-Fi adventure from Director Zack Snyder that is probably one of his worst movies ever. I know Zack has a few bad movies but this one takes the cake. Some will say this movie is ambitious while I will say this is a complete rip off of Star Wars A New Hope in a way. I won't be going into spoiler details but just watch the film and you will know what I'm talking about. The CGI graphics are inconsistent in this film where they show moments of being impressive and other moments being a head scratcher as below the industry's average. Now as of today this movie is getting bashed by critics and audiences alike. Zack Snyder has responded by saying his Director's cut is the ultimate best viewing experience. That is my problem with Mr. Synder is that his Director's Cut is always the best version but it shouldn't be. He should be making every effort to make the theatrical release his best version for audiences. Now I won't lie there were some cool scenes throughout the film but not anything to warrant a rewatch. I'm curious to see how Part Two turns out in April 2024 as Part One is a complete disaster. Rebel Moon Part One gets a very low 3 stars out of 10.

title: Slow and nothing really happens
text: I think Zack Snyder makes movies for himself and if it finds an audience then great but if not who cares. This is a typical Zack Snyder movie dark, lots of slow motion, special affects and a story that just drags on and goes nowhere.I love some of his movies but i am not sure this one will find an audience. He might have convinced Netflix to make it a 2 part movie but it should have been a 2 hour movie not a 5 hour 2 part.Similar to Justice league - which was a stupid 4 hours long - he has lost touch with his audience and just makes films for himself.He can do much better if he actually thinks about his audience.

title: Stop giving Zack Snyder money!
text: This might have been the worst movie I've ever seen. Snyder has cobbled together (read 'stolen') all his favourite bits from all of his favourite movies and genres but forgot to put in any soul! What this movie lacks in heart it more than makes up for with the badly hidden exoticism. Add to that the fetishising of fascism.... Aaaannnd let's not forget to mention the truly dire script! It was pretty painful watching great actors (I see you Djimon and Anthony) taking the money and phoning it in. They must have been paid silly money! There were no saving graces here but if I was to find anything positive to say it would be that it was a good looking film (think World building and Costumes) with good quality CGI/motion capture of Jimmy the Robot.

title: Amazing new Galatic Adventure
text: Zack Snyder's "Rebel Moon" catapults audiences into a mesmerizing cinematic universe where action seamlessly intertwines with profound themes of religion and extraterrestrial connection. This sci-fi masterpiece not only delivers on Snyder's signature visual style but also explores the depths of human spirituality and the mysteries beyond our world.The film's plot revolves around a rebellion against a tyrannical regime on a distant moon, setting the stage for an epic space opera. Snyder's directorial prowess is evident from the first frame, as he crafts a visually stunning world filled with breathtaking landscapes, futuristic technology, and intense battles that keep viewers on the edge of their seats.What sets "Rebel Moon" apart is its thought-provoking exploration of religious and extraterrestrial elements. The narrative cleverly weaves together themes of faith, destiny, and the cosmic unknown. The characters grapple with their beliefs in the face of otherworldly encounters, offering a unique perspective on the intersection of spirituality and the vastness of the universe.The extraterrestrial connection in the film is not merely a backdrop but a central element that drives the story forward. Snyder delves into the idea that our existence might be intricately linked to forces beyond our comprehension, posing questions about the nature of humanity and our place in the cosmos. The visual effects are nothing short of groundbreaking, portraying encounters with extraterrestrial beings in a way that is both awe-inspiring and thought-provoking.The cast, led by a stellar ensemble of actors, brings depth and authenticity to their characters, making the emotional journey of the protagonists resonate with the audience. The performances, coupled with mesmerizing score, create a symphony of sights and sounds that elevate the film to a truly cinematic experience."Rebel Moon" is a triumph not only for fans of action and sci-fi but also for those seeking a film that challenges the mind and stirs the soul. It invites viewers to reflect on the profound questions that have captivated humanity for centuries while delivering a pulse-pounding adventure in the far reaches of space. Zack Snyder once again proves his mastery in the art of storytelling, leaving audiences eagerly anticipating what lies beyond the horizon of our understanding.

title: How can a bid budget production feel so low budget
text: Tried not to let the negative reviews after me, but seriously this wasn't great. Felt like I was watching a low budget sci-fi midweek opera. Yes there are tropes in all genres but this was almost like a parody, without jokes!Agree with reviews that I read in as much as it's a Star Wars wannabe, but I think the story could make for a good mini series, as the introduction of various 'hero's' fitt r a more drawn out series where back stories and character relationships might work to keep me engaged. However as a move, no!I will watch the second part (come on guys you ain't dune where you can justify 5 hours for this) but more in the hope that it's might serve as a spring board for a decent Netflix sci-fi series; which is much needed.

title: 7 Samurai in Warhammer40k settings
text: It has a potential, but was lost. Good costumes, decorations and CGI spoiled by vanilla dialogs and vanilla fight scenes. Kind of Disney movie.Most probably crew was worried about Rating and brutality has been removed.World designers influenced by Warhammer 40k for sure- costumes,red clerics, guns, spaceships.Protect farmers and hire a crew- 7 Samurais idea.No attach to Samurais in this movie, they are all flat characters, deapite a movie tries to add a story about each one.Trying to get lower rating- has a huge impact on a movie and became another Star Wars.The movie is worth to watch, but you'll fill frustrated what this movie lost..

title: Man, it was bad.
text: Take each and every cliche and slap them together.Huge evil empire. Check. Psycho military executive. Check. Band of psycho marines. Check. Young innocent private among them. Check.Oppressed robot, peaceful village, primitive agriculture in an interstellar age, weird evil priests of death, flying platforms, greedy traitor, faceless evil soldiers who can't shoot, you name it, it's all there.Strong female lead. Of course. Ethnically diverse protagonists. Can't go without them. The enemies? All white-straight-male of course.This movie surprises with absolutely nothing.Even if I gave spoilers, these won't be spoilers, because each and every plot line is predictable.The visuals are totally ok, like they should. Sound is ok. Acting is... okish. Editing... meh. Story? Was there any?I see there was a hope to start a great new space opera franchise. But that requires a bit more than a mere wish to earn big money.

title: Why are people always hating on Zack Snyder's movies?
text:
First of all, a very cool movie!I don't understand why every Zack Snyder movie is getting so much unnecessary hate, people probably just don't like him that much...
After watching Rebel Moon, i do think it offers the viewers great visuals, cool story and also interesting characters. Overall, a true blockbuster with epic proportions. Well done, Netflix!Really hope that the bad reviews don't reflect negatively on the development of the second and third installments. I don't understand the poor reviews here and I don't get what people want from a big budget movie nowadays...
Most reviews here suggested that the story and characters are very weak, which is absolutely not the truth. Rebel Moon has similar vibe and style like Rogue One in my opinion and should be considered in the same category.Hopefully, people start watching and enjoying movies more, because right now most enjoy only critiquing everything that comes out. I was about to skip this good movie only because of the poor comments and rating. Glad i didn't!

title: An incoherent mess
text: It was against my own judgement that I watched this. I have yet to see any film by Zach Snyder that is remotely watchable. However, I decided to give it a go and was barely ten minutes in when I was already regretting it.The biggest problem is it doesn't know what it's supposed to be. With far too many elements that are a direct rip off of a New Hope, bits of Game of Thrones, the Seven Samurai and The Matrix sprinkled on top it just doesn't make any sense. Consequently the action sequences appear to be thrown in to just to try and keep you from spotting the absence of a coherent plot. Zach Snyder should have taken the hint when the makers of Star Wars rejected this, they had good reason too, it is dire.None of the characters grab you and make you root for them as they are all so one dimensional. Why Charlie Hunnam delivers his dialogue in a poor Northern Irish accent is a mystery too.It's just awful on every level. I fell for the hype with Justice League and again with this. Never again will I fall for the dross that Zack Snyder turns out. Netflix have managed to deliver a massive turkey this Christmas.

title: Aquaman Lost Kingdom was better than this! Can you believe it?
text: What the hell happened with Rebel Moon? Who greenlighted this? Nobody bother to doublecheck the script?The movie kept introducing character after character and after their introduction the producers forgot to write more lines of dialog to them.There is a lack interaction between them. They became empty shells just standing there or shooting.There is a long action-packed introduction sequence for this guy who can control beasts. After the introduction he spend the rest of the movie standing there showing his six-pack!! That's it! The other characters received the same treatment.The hand to hand combat choreos were very bad. Not creative at all. Not fluid at all. You can see the actors waiting for the cue to attack the main characters. The choreography in the beginning of the movie at the barn was awful!Rebel Moon gave me vibes from The Wachowskis and Michael Bay movies specially Cloud Atlas and Jupiter Ascending.I don't mind that the movie is copying from other movies but, come on! Can you write something better?Can you believe that the great Godzilla Minus One movie only cost around 20 million to produce?

title: High hopes where not met, Its a B-movie
text:
A few seconds into this thing and Im already looking for the exit. The voice of Anthony Hopkins as an orator for the story is a misscast. His voice is slow, spluttered and tired, not the start you expect from something great and exciting. It continues on from there. We are moved from a beautiful planetary view down to a field being plowed by a solitary slim 100 pound woman with an antagonism towards a friendly male. Its just odd and off.A little later a ship lands in the village but its so poorly filmed, that you can see that the shot is of a physical miniature model bcs the dust caused by the landing is off in scale. A few scenes later and the clear misscasting continues to roll in. The male character Gunnar played by Michiel Huisman performs so badly as an upset or sad man, that Im getting ready to leave the theater.Furthermore the dialects are making no sense, you clearly hear the actors are from scandinavia, south africa and yes brittain which makes no sense considering this clearly plays out thousands of years in the future and the dialects of our time would not remain. And why do the bad guys look like german soldiers straight out of some WWII movie?? I was just shy of expecting a nazi salute.Later, some soldiers grabs a girl who is screaming but the only person coming to help her is the 100 pound woman in a village filled with strong men.... I mean.. whoever wrote this didnt think this through. Its just not believable.The story continues and the 100 pound woman starts a mission to gather a
possy to defend the village. They are suddenly in a western movie with aliens and a guy offer them their ship. They find Tarzan chained working as a blacksmith.. ..noone thought to realise a blacksmith could easily unchain himself, since hes a blacksmith...
The movie continues on like this. The dialogues are stiff, the acting is off, scenes doesnt make sense or are out of place, its offputting to say the least.I dont know what happened when filming this but its clear they didnt aim high. I cant imagine anyone feels good about the end result. I doubt there will be a part 2.Dont expect much, ..in fact just skip this alltogether. You are better off not seeing this. Its shameful.

title: Meh.
text:
You can see they clearly took ideas from Terminator, Guardians of the Galaxy, Star Wars, and plenty of other movies. Visual effects are fantastic, and they should be with a $900M budget, but it felt like it was lacking substance. Character chemistry is ok, writing is decent, it just felt slightly empty with a lot of action. I wish it showed a clear path as to where the movie was headed, it just felt a little aimless with really great graphics.I didn't hate it, I was entertained for sure and
it's worth the free watch, but I'd never buy or rent it. I hope the second half is better than this first.

title: Love!
text:
I loved absolutely everything about this movie.The writing and story line were riveting, the acting which was incredible, the sets, the cinematography,
the creative characters and puppetry were incredibly all spectacular! The star studded cast added to the greatness of this on your seat science fiction work of art. I haven't seen such a creative cinematic work of art in a long time, if ever, to this extent. Seems there was nothing spared in the creativity & ingenuity in the set design, kudos to those who pulled this feat off. Cannot wait to tell everyone who like great cinema to watch, and make sure you pop some corn!!!

title: Written and directed by a 3 year old
text: This is a movie that has unashamedly ripped off a dozen other movie's and done so badly.... The CGI is actually better than the acting which isn't saying much. Charlie Hunam is his usual awful also, his one dimensional acting and shocking accent is laughable. An episode of Peppa Pig would be a better viewing spectacle of originality. The slo mo used constantly in all the action scenes is very annoying. Synder has clearly run out of anything else to offer the cinema world and because Netflix will pretty much give the green light to anything this got made. Apparently there's a sequel...God Help Us All.

title: Slow motion sci-fi version of the Magnificent 7
text: I fell asleep twice whilst watching this. Glad it was on my sofa and not in a cinema. The Sci-Fi channel B movie script didn't help and it could have been 10 minutes shorter if the slow motion fight scenes had been filmed at normal speed.For a film which had several boring moments it also felt as if it was rushed in some parts. I do wonder if it and part 2 would have been better being a 6 part mini series with a little bit more depth being added to the characters.Will I watch part 2? Yes (with a coffee).Will I watch Part 1 again before watching pt 2? Err, No.Now, let's get back to watching season 2 of Foundation.

title: Paradoxical
text: Zack Snyder has created the most paradoxical film in history.Somehow, amazingly and concerningly this movie is both too long and too short.It's original IP yet plagiarises pretty much every space fantasy movie ever made.It's full of new, diverse characters and voices yet they all say the same old stuff.Action is zippy and dramatic, yet every shot goes on 12-20 seconds longer than is comfortable watching.Some of the characters and plots are really intriguing, but the main plot is incredibly dull.It's got pulpy schtick throughout, yet takes itself far too seriously.I'll remember how remarkable forgettable this movie is.

title: How does this hack keep getting work?
text: Snyder has become a meme of himself. Poor movies that he claims are always better in his original super extended cuts. He can't edit clearly and he can't link a cohesive story together. Let another director have a shot rather than giving more and more money to him.Rebel Moon is a complete rip off on Warhammer 40K visuals, along with Star Wars. However, putting those names in the same context of this flaming garbage of a movie is insulting to them. Characters randomly come and go, there is no story linking it all together, there are big death sequences that realy spend time making you try to feel bad but there was ZERO character development before.Snyder, go home. You're drunk.

title: I can't find something wrong
text: I started to watch it because I had nothing to do....and I'm really happy for my choice!! I love Snyder's movie, his picture is so detailed, and I appreciated his plot development. The characters are interesting, background's Kora is well explained, never boring. Flashback are necessary, but not so long. I was afraid to find endless action scenes, and it not happened. Good! And I was afraid that this movie could be too long....no! There is a right space too see and love the story. In my opinion, I consider Rebel Moon a very good sci-fi opera. I love sci-fi, and I always have great difficulties to find a movie that is good for me.

title: Rebel Moon: Part 1 - A Child of Fire
text: This movie could more accurate be called, what happens if you have a self indulgent director whos style was influenced by Frank Miller, made a movie that takes almost every Trope from Star Wars, adds a sprinkle of high fantasy tropes, and gave it the dark nature of Warhammer 40k. Look it isn't the worst movie I have ever seen but it is full of all of the same issues Snyder has in the rest of his movies.The villains are just space Nazis. The hero is the child of one of the Highest Ranking members in the Imperium, she was a highly competent solider and leader. She then collects a band of tropes from beast master prince to disgraced general. The main problem is Snyder seemed to have taken the tropes and just decided they were perfect and they really needed to have some work day, but this movie is so long with nothing other than recruiting happening for about the middle hour of the film.

title: A story so rushed we can have slomo fights.
text: Normally a film gives the heroes backstories you so you can emphasise with and get behind them , not here. As my title says it just seems rushed but yet the 2 hours+ drags on. The only bright colours are from lens flares , explosions and fires , the rest just looks drab and a bit washed out. The CG is nice but cannot save a lack of script.From the imdb page it mentions it was turned down as a StarWars movie and if this is true I can understand why. It sounds like it should be made of all the right ingredients but its lacking the important bits which makes it special.I know it comes free as part of a Netflix subscription but you might be better spending your time on another film.

title: Soulless and depraved of logic
text: Having been hungry for a new space opera, but wary of Snyder's involvement, I walked into Rebel Moon with a healthy dose of skepticism. To say that I still walked out disappointed would be an understatement.The film, writing and direction is devoid of any clear personality. Everything looks drab, and the film never manages to latch on to an identity that makes it stand on its own two feet. Synder has shamelessly borrowed story elements and world building from other, greater Sci-fi. Dune, Star Wars, The Fifth Element and Warhammer 40K have all been scraped by Synder in an attempt to painfully dress his film with an outfit that barely fits, and hangs loose in all the wrong places. It's the equivalent of copying someone's homework; while you can provide a finished piece of work, the understanding of how it was made and why is completely missing. Synder has attempted a space opera without fully understanding what makes them so great in the first place.There is no companionship or development of bonds and friction between the main characters. Instead, the film wastes well over an hour recruiting individuals across the galaxy (system, universe? The scale is never actually explained), before throwing them together and hoping something interesting forms in the melting pot.Synder also seems incapable of listening to any past criticisms of his work, and instead decided to double down. Overley used slow-mo, an over reliance on anamorphic lenses and shallow focus shots. They're all here. It makes watching the film nauseating at times, as 80% of the shots are blurry and out of focus. Someone needs to take the camera away from Synder, and give way to someone who knows how to do the job.I'm disappointed. Synder has been riding on the laurels of a film he made well over 15 years ago, but the gravy train is finally coming to a halt. While ambitious, his technical ability and talent isn't able to keep up with his ideas, leaving his films devoid of love, coherency and meaning.Avoid.

title: Bad script and lazy acting
text: They tried to wash this movie with FX and, to some degree the costumes, but it ended just as you would expect. What are the key issues: #1. The script is super shallow, some weird copy of samurai movie where they are hired to defend the village and Riddick chronicles with a dash of Star Wars. #2. The lines actors are lazily reading on screen are as basic as it gets - the moment you think the movie ain't that bad actually, just wait for them to start speaking. #3. Wardrobe and makeup - OMG, who hired those people?! Space nazis, space vikings and space barbarians? Are you absolutely without any creativity in that department? Anyhow, I just hope that such movies don't hurt the overall sci Fi movies industry - people just don't buy the bad stuff.

title: Complete Rip-Off
text: I was really excited for this movie. I saw a trailer in fall of 2023 and couldn't wait for this to arrive on Netflix. Before I watched I took a look at IMDB and was shocked how low the score for this movie is. After watching...I'm actually shocked the score isn't lower.I'm convinced the run time of this movie would be about 30 minutes shorter if it wasn't for all the slow-mo b#llsh!t.As my title states, this movie is such a rip off as other reviewers have stated.Harry Potter wants it hippogriff back (buckbeak). Star Wars wants all its ships back. Halo wants their guns. The Nazis want their uniforms. Star Wars also wants several of their characters returned. The Magnificent 7 wants their merry band of misfits. There are so many "borrowed" ideas it doesn't feel original at all. Zack Snyder himself imagined this as a Star Wars film and also admitted "borrowing" elements from many different films. Borrowed or more like fully stole. So the film is one big Deja Vu and not in a good way.

title: Disappointed
text: The only word that can embody what I felt is DISAPPOINTMENT,for the most part I have always liked Zack Snyder's films, but I don't understand why he made this... almost everything in this film is very bad... I can't even say what I liked about this film... I'm not sure I would whether I wanted to watch the second part or not, but if I watch it, it's only out of respect for Zack Sneider. The cast is very strange... I didn't like the acting... the script is simply missing...It's not clear why they should fight with these farmers if they are so technically advanced.there is little in the logic of this film that is clear... I hope in the future Zach will make good films.

title: Another movie ruined by Snyder
text: Good story with great characters, BUT you had to have Snyder ruin everything with his addiction to slowmotion which he btw really suck at using... Feels like justice league all over again.. How this man still gets jobs is a mystery for me.. I don't wanna spoil the movie, but I can tell it feels like like watching a very bad version of the matrix mixed with mad max and it's not a good cocktail! The actors are actually great and the scenes are beautiful most of the time, but the camera angle is cheap and not well places which are disappointing when you can see the potential in the script, but the director have no idea of what he is doing. #boycutsnyder.

title: Perfect balance for me
text: Was looking forward to watch this and it didn't disappoint me at all. All these so called critics trying to destroy this movie is such a crime. I hated the marvel mess and was looking forward for some change in the whole movie business. Such an amazing start. Good story and giving value for each characters. Even if someone is in the screen for 2 mins you can connect with them. I am sorry some people don't agree with me. But I have to be honest with myself and give this team a credit for putting togethet something like this and making me want to wait for the next one. Well done Zach. Well done crew. Even if the whole world is against this. I stand united with Rebel moon.

title: Boring
text: Base on the trailer, I should really enjoy this kind of star war -ish movie. All the ingredients are there, cool female lead, amazing action scenes, thousand out of nowhere slowmo. But I just can't stand how boring this movie are.1. ACTING. If you have seen enough scifi movie and TV shows, you already know what will happen, so the only thing director can do to keep your attention from slip away is write interesting characters and creating great chemistry between main characters. I recognize almost every single characters, all of them are capable of giving actual performance. But all there interaction feel like so blatant.2. CONTENT. Feel like director extrude a 8 episode tv series into a movie. Too much checking boxes the characters have to check, rushing from one place to another, as a consequence as a audience you don't really care any of them. You don't care the good guy get killing for helping the protagonist, you don't even care the betray in the end, because you simply don't care any of them getting killed of not. I simply don't understand why Zack urgency to rush and squeeze so much plots into Part I. He should really watch Dune part I, that's how you do a proper part I.3 ACTION scene. It's alright for a Netflix movie.

title: A Child of Many
text: I really like some of Zack Snyder's works a lot: the remake of Dawn of the Dead, 300, Watchmen and Sucker Punch. But while and after making all those okay superhero movies he seems to have lost his taste and skills. Army of the Dead was just schrott (not that kind of trash that somehow gets the blessings of resurrection by the almighty Gods of Cheese) and sadly, Rebel Moon is the same kind of formulaic and generic affair: the story grabs every cliche of sci-fi and action movies imaginable (Star Wars, Dune, Riddick comes quick to mind, and of course Seven Samurai), the characters are, to be tender, rather uninteresting, the score and sound design an underachiever. On the pro side the production is solid and the cast too. The fact, that a director does not improve but gets worse may be a sign that Snyder lost his love for the art of movie-making - I don't have any other explanation for his loss of skill and craft. Not a total disaster and watchable, but that's about it.

title: Same OLD storyline
text:
Once again we have another recycled storyline with a subplot of a love story weaved in. The bad guys look like space nazi and a Lone hero on a quest to find people to fight for the village. Seems like the the storyline of the 7 samurai a.k.a. The magnificent 7. I'm
Quite sure there are some really good Plots to draw from. I really expected something better than this , Yet I was wrong and this is what they gave. How many times is this storyline going to he used. Where and when are we going to see something new .A better use of the money spent on this used plot , Somebody in management ISN'T doing his or her Job. You have writer's waiting to give you new material, So find them in a hurry because the Movie Audience's are far to Mature to keep watching the some OLD stuff.

title: Even two Darios cannot save it...
text: Man I was waiting for it ...waiting, all ready and comfy and I like the first few actors I saw and some GOT leftovers and then things just sped up ASAP: a girl is tilling the ground -sees a ship -she runs to ring a bell and some seriously bad drama and death and we are off to find fighters!!! As soon as Dario the second takes out the picnic blanket I press stop bc that scene was beyond awful...background looked like a wall painting...I just felt it at that moment THIS IS BAD...so I stopped and never looked back then I saw the ratings and comments and felt vindicated...sci-fi has been murdered and we need to protest!

title: Don't understand the hate
text: It's not an Oscar winning movie, granted, but as a visually stunning sci-fi film it's solid as a rock. It's better than the Star Wars sequels. Doesn't deserve the hate at all. It's just fun, with a great cast, interesting worlds and although shallow it's the first of what I assume are to be several movies I liked it a lot. Fight scenes are good, action is rip-roaring and Sofia Boutella is a good lead and great action actress. It really doesn't deserve the hate in my opinion and could turn into a solid film series if given a chance. I'm certainly looking forward to the next one. Try it, you might like it.

title: The many harsh reviews are justified
text: The first 30 minutes were enough to get under my skin but despite my initial reaction, I wanted to see it through rather than listen to my instinct to just switch off there and then. So with an open mind I pushed passed the sloppy intro narrative, ignored the lazy screenplay/set-pieces and forgave the poor visuals that make no attempt to hide what's the set and what's CGI, and tried to focus on the good. And oh boy, not trying to be dramatic, but it's never been so harder to watch a film through.The acting is not what it should be, the talent has been wasted and some scenes really are just awful. Seems rushed almost, or perhaps something else but eitherway I wouldn't be surprised if actors later come to mock this film in the same way Ryan Reynolds pokes fun at Green Lantern.But surely the story is good right? Well, yeh, it's fine i guess. If you haven't watched star wars, dune, the best of the marvel films or avatar (there's a beast taming moment that smacked of it) then yeh this will be a visual treat not seen before so fill your boots. But I guess if you haven't seen those films that suggests this ain't going to be your cup of tea in the first place! Basically, i reckon everyone involved is there for the paycheck, this surely cannot be a passion project. Lazy, boring, unoriginal rehash of greats we've already had before it.This is in the same category as Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets as that too fell short of what it could have been, but at least Valerian, I think, is still a fun watch and had originality. The negative reviews for this one were so justified. At least good actors got a decent paycheck. That's positive at least.Oh nearly forgot, what's with the obsession with slow-mo!? Expertly used if your goal is to quickly tire the viewer of something that, when used right, is awesome. Seriously, don't bother with this one. Such a shame.

title: Top 5 worst of all time
text:
How did this get funded?The worst movie of the year, and would be up there in my top 5 worst of all time.Slow motion effects are used to fill a complete lack of acting and makes an already seeming long movie drag out even longer. Genuinely interested to figure out what sort of market this is aimed towards, I am assuming a very young teenager with the large number of PS5 cut scenes and erratic storyline.The scene from Billy Maddison sums it up best:
This one of the most insanely idiotic things I have ever seen. At no point in your storyline, were you even close to anything that could be considered a movie worth producing. Everyone in this room is now dumber for having watched it. I award you no points, and may God have mercy on your soul.

title: Motivations make no sense
text: Besides being derivative, the silly exposition dialogue , as well as the stories it tells, are written by someone who read how to write a screenplay but has no real creativity. Biggest flaw though... no ones's motivations makes sense. They have some Han Solo guy helping them out but why? He doesn't know the rebels. He doesn't ask for money for passage. The list goes on. And the villain is so lame. The characters are hollow. The writing stinks to high heaven. Amateur hour with a big budget.I was really rooting for this film bc of the hype. Maybe part two, if it's ever made, won't need all this thin backstory and uninspired character development. I'll b looking forward to giving that film a chance. Hopes aren't high.

title: Really enjoyed it
text: Firstly, don't believe the negative reviews. Any review that gives 1/10 don't deserve a read. Its clearly not a 1/10 film...Secondly, I don't think some people appreciate it. Go watch a marvel film again or Star Wars if you don't want to see something ambitious.Zach has always been a director that divides opinion when his films first come out (other than 300) but they hold the test of time.This was really enjoyable, great acting, fantastically filmed and edited. I think that because its one film that has been sliced into two rather edited down into one short film has left it feeling without story, for now... maybe this should have been released as a 4 part series if released for the Netflix audience.Cant wait for part 2!

title: Just average... Barely
text: I was full of hope this would be good, it had all the right ingredients. But it really wasn't, I found myself bored of the dialogue. Every monologue from Sofia Boutella was pointless, they did nothing really to advance the story. The actors all felt wooden, the General Titus stand was a particularly jarring moment. And why are all the men shirtless? Do they not have weather, climate, or apparently clothing shops in space.I found myself wondering how long the movie would actually be if they played all the slo mo sections at normal speed, it was laughable the amount it was used. There was a firefight scene where lasers are being fired everywhere, so it was a joke to see a character suddenly stand up and do a hero pose (in slo mo) with things exploding all around them and then go and do something. The plot armour is strong in this film, main characters are not hit despite literally thousands of bullets being hurled at them in a confined space.The saving grace of this movie is the visuals, CG, set and clothing design. They were very well done.

title: Boring
text: Souless and plagiarised. Its a dune meets star wars meets suicide squad steaming pile of ripped off garbage. There is no note worthy character development, there are no stakes and storyline is essentially "bad guys threatening villagers", hardly the makings of an epic space odyssey.You may watch and think you know whats coming, to save some time, yes, what you are thinking is exactly the same as what you expect because its exactly the same as the other dozens of movies it rips off.To add to it all, poor editing, poor acting and terrible accents.Save yourself some time and frustration and watch Star Wars the Clone Wars or Dune part 1.

title: lacks originality, boring
text: I've been a huge Sci fi fan my entire life and usually can watch anything in that genre but this movie felt off from the beginning.Most things in the movie looked like a rip off from other movies.. I had no emotional attachment to any of the characters and to be honest couldn't wait for the end of the film.For me it was a combination between a rushed and a dull storyline. The robot with the Anthony Hopkins voice looked cool first and made me quite excited about the character but it dissappeared after 20minutes. I just literally I can't point out anything positive really.Massive let down as I was excited before watching it.

title: Snyder's Greatest Hits
text: Ok wow.2hrs and 15min.Opening credits were amazing.Cut to start of film.Started rather flat, a bit convoluted and a wee messy. As the Synder's film carried on it somewhat improved and began to showcase what Synder does best- Slow mo, sweet shot action sequences, and profound set pieces.Being as it was a part one of two it felt very incomplete by the two hour mark.The acting was fine. Lead actress was interesting. Everyone else was subpar. Cool soundtrack, great dolby atmos soundtrack too! Is this for everyone? No. Fans? Maybe. Die hards? Ya okay.Regardless give it a shot. You can always turn it off. Right?

title: Can't wait for part two
text: Oh our cynical society. You read reviews by a bunch of creatively stunted individuals, and you jump on the bandwagon. Tsk-tsk.. Rebel Moon was a joy to watch. This was a great action/adventure film from beginning to finish. Point number one: it's a ripoff of Star Wars. Well, Star Wars ain't that original. It stole from. Old school samurai films that were way better. Point two: the action scenes are stilted. What film did you watch? Lots of great action sequences throughout. Beautifully paced, made for adults, that has replay value. The female protagonist is excellent and so is the rest of the cast. Highly recommended. Can't wait for part two.

title: A Star Wars Wannabe Without the Force
text: "Rebel Moon" is a cinematic equivalent of a spacewalk without a tether - it floats aimlessly in the galaxy of science fiction, desperately trying to latch onto the glory of "Star Wars". Director Zack Snyder's pitch to Lucasfilm might've been a bold move, but watching "Rebel Moon" makes it abundantly clear why they passed. It's like ordering a deluxe burger and getting a soggy bun with a hint of ketchup instead.The film tries to juggle a platter of elements - war, betrayal, space politics - but ends up dropping them all. Princess Issa's plotline, with its healing and resurrection abilities, feels like a cheap magician's trick in a narrative that's already gasping for air. The characters, rather than driving the story, seem to be on a space cruise, admiring the CGI galaxies while forgetting their lines. It's like watching a chess game where the pieces move randomly, hoping to stumble upon checkmate.Admiral Atticus Noble, our villain, is as intimidating as a cat in a shark costume. The attempt at depth falls flat, making him less of a feared military leader and more like a disgruntled office manager. Kora's journey from a soldier to a reluctant hero could have been compelling, but it's handled with the subtlety of a blaster gun - loud, flashy, and ultimately pointless.The film's pacing is like a malfunctioning hyperdrive - slow, jittery, and leaving you nauseous. Key scenes that should evoke emotion or excitement are as engaging as watching paint dry in zero gravity. It's a puzzle where the pieces don't fit, creating a picture that's both confusing and forgettable.Lastly, "Rebel Moon" is a masterclass in how not to pay homage. Its aspiration to be "Star Wars" is so transparent that it feels like a fan film made without understanding what made the original so magical. It's like dressing up for a costume party as your idol, only to realize you forgot what made them iconic in the first place.In summary, "Rebel Moon" is a missed opportunity - a space opera that hits all the wrong notes, leaving its audience floating in a void of disappointment. For a film that had the potential to launch us into a thrilling new universe, it sadly fails to leave the launchpad.

title: How can anyone like this?
text: Awful movie and huge waste of time. So ilogical that it makes me mad. Characters are shallow, story is boring, slow motion action scenes are sooo irritating. I don't understand how people who made this were okay with broadcasting it. Did they watch any scenes after filming was done? And these actors, are they like embarassed to take part in this project? So much money put in something this bad. There is no chance I would watch sequals. I strongly believe that people who put fine reviews are either payed to do so, or just feel cool for having different opinions then most people, nobody can genuinely like this.

title: Oof! I expected so much more.
text: From the poor world-building and lack of character backstory, to the ridiculous over-use of slow motion for something as simple as jumping up onto a ledge, over-reliance on cgi and dialogue that makes Star Wars look good by comparison, Rebel Moon is definitely nowhere near the quality I was expecting, given the hype behind it.I'm not sure exactly what Zack Snyder was trying to achieve here, but I think it's a big swing and a miss.Sure, it's visually pretty in a number of spots, but I'm trying really hard to care about any of the characters other than the farmer and the robot.The robot was by far the best character and was only in it for like 5 minutes.Part 2 is on the way, and maybe it can redeem this mess, but I'm already starting to forget what Part 1 is even about. Forgettable.

title: Nice science fiction
text: Acting is good and production is good...story is not much new but has a surprising turn.The movie is made for a couple of sequels and this will happen in April 2024.The bar scene does resembles the bar scene from Starwars... but, so what....it was a good scene.The heros are some what dress up. To much? ..it think it's ok. Guess fighting a universal power can be done with class.The story could be better because it's not that bad the predict .. Part 1 is only to get fermiliar with the heros so let's see what part 2 will bring.I don't understand the bad reviews because this move is really not that bad.

title: Wanted to see it but.....
text: Really wanted to see this. There were quite a few sci-fi movies and series coming out recently and as a big sci-fi fan I'm slowly getting saturated with films that are mere clones of popular blockbusters. After reading the reviews and watching for a while I decided to fast forward to see these "amazing worlds" people were mentioning here but was disappointed because even fast forward all I could see was people talking most of the time. Also I'm all for diversity because like every sci-fi fan I'm used to a great diversity of characters and am all for making this world so mixed that nobody will be able to ask where you're coming from lol! One thing that bothers me though ( I'm originally German born after the war) that the villains have to look like nazis, ridiculous!Come up with original ideas like Disney's " a murder at the end of the world" which just finished and I was waiting eagerly for every Monday for 7 weeks to see the next instalment or " Monarch" that handled an old concept of Godzilla but was surprisingly fresh and watchable!I'm seriously considering getting rid of Netflix and just keep Apple, Disney (for now) and Prime!

title: Watchable bits and pieces from other films
text: While ultimately watchable, the film is made up of so much borrowed stuff, that sometimes it felt like bits of other films were edited in. And I am not talking just Syfi films. The moments of spectacular are indeed spectacular, and the cinematography exceptional, but the rest are just.. In the words of another reviewer... "spare parts". Without spoiling too much, there is a saloon scene (a la Star wars minus imaginative characters included) which literally has persons costumed like in a 1980s western that just dont belong. And so much contemporary details that make one think they bought the costumes and props from the local walmart. Blow me away with a new universe this is not. The refrences and inspirations are so obvious and kitch its painfully un imaginative. So sure, watch it.. But with low expectations and Have ur phone next to you for the boring tedious bits and u wont be disappointed. Zack needs other people to write scripts for him.

title: GAAAARRRRRBBBBBAAAAGGGEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE
text:
I was waiting for this title so long. Thought I will see something revolutionary.No. Definiately not.The concept is that the title getting worst and worst and worst and when you think it can't be any worst, IT DOES!No original plot, only cliche on the back of another cliche on the back on another one.Without spoilers you will see a complete copy paste of scenes, design of visual concepts and plots from the following titles:The complete Star Wars Saga (including Rouge One)
Dune
Gladiator
The Horse Whisperer
The Magnificient Seven
The Chronicles of Riddick
Lord of the Rings
Harry Potter
Thor: RagnarökAnd these are only the titles which are proudly looking around in the film asking: Yeah I am still well recognizable, looking good, but what the .... I am looking for here?Spent 23 minutes to watch the film. The last 8 minutes fast forwarding.If you never heard about the titles above you have to watch the movie.In this case you can tell your friends that for "one ticket" you watched at least 8 movie.Summary: Waste of Time - You will enjoy it if fast forward.

title: Really enjoyed it! Snyder FTW bring movie 2!
text: First of all I'm a Fan of Sci-fi movies and a big star wars fan.That said, this film is another great work by Snyder! It's not for the whole public and it's not for those who come with the booklet already read... Don't follow the mediocre reviews.This rebel moon world is here to stay. There's certainly a lot more to explore and a lot of character development to dive into. Thanks Snyder for giving us this peace of art!Unfortunately, anything that is not obvious is not appreciated. If it was released today, Matrix would be junk because of the limited sight society we are developing.The film portrays themes that have been used before, but if we look at the great works, they are just like that. They portray reality in parallel. In a world at war, what do you expect?

title: What's your name again?
text: You know a movie has terrible writing when you have no idea who anyone is nor why you're supposed to care about them. There is zero character development in this movie, it should've been a series.There are a few positives about the movie, set design and CGI are pretty good, though some costume choices don't seem to match the rest of the theme of the movie. Especially the costume choices from the one leader dude with the dumb hair cut, can't remember his name.Overall this feels like they've tried to put too much into one movie and I still have no idea why I'm meant to care about these people.Zack Snyders average attempt at Star Wars meets Dune/Chronicles of Riddick.

title: Ok there's quite a bit to look at here...
text:
Antony Hopkins won't save this, pretty actors won't save this, an in vogue (and completely ridiculous) nod to scandi viking esque nonsense won't save this. No, nothing will save this.The plot is just too close to you know what, even down to the senator reference. The phrase cut and paste comes to mind, with added popular references and allusions. Note the multi coloured bunting similar to that found in the himalayas, mixed into a viking village....face-palm.Ok, the subjective bit... I grew up in South Africa and I'm sorry, but I just cringe when I see south African actors trying to act. Arnold Vossloo is one of the few who can actually act. But he's not in this.Objectively speaking, the characters played by the South African actors are of little or no importance to the central plot, so why are they given so much time? The scene with the robot reflects the typical South African macho brain dead attitude. I just found it off putting and only served to sully the film, even more. I'm glad I didn't watch this with my 12yo - the rape narrative was too much. I understand how this served as the tipping point, but let's be honest would you rather be served a turd? Or a Sunday roast?A few more objective points: far far far too much time is spent on one single scene: The Village. Virtually half of the film is like an ensemble piece set in a village. I absolutely love the Nflix 1640 series, but I get nothing from watching this. The film would benefit from depth and breadth if 2 or 3 different locals were switched between, instead of this utterly boring linear thread in one place, then the next place etc etc. More low-fi than sci-fi.The bar scene...cut & paste.Big bird scene LOR cut & paste complete with elvish sounding language.Solderan...? Alderan? Chat gpt could have done better.Come to think of it, chat gpt probably could've done the entire film better (laughing face laughing face laughing face)
Just a little aside.... why did they make the spaceships look like actual boats and submarines? Makes it look like a childs fairytale book.Best bit... When she throws sand in the guys eyes, just about the only clever and practical thing in the whole film.

title: Poor story, unnecessary use of slow mo!
text: Promised so much but delivered very little. Not much original about the story, the use of slow mo was over the top and mostly unnecessary. The main villain is laughable (looks like he has borrowed his outfit from M Bison in the street fighter film), has a terrible bowl cut and seems to use a stick as a weapon when everything around him has guns & laser swords (light sabres). All in all I couldn't really recommend this film. Think the writing and story was very lazy, no real plot twists, no sub plots to occupy your mind. I think part 2 is out in April and I am not even sure how this got authorised. Certainly won't be wasting another 2 hours of my time.

title: Loved it. As usual, director cut is the one i really look forward to.
text: Amazing visuals and cinematography. Since it is part 1, story felt somewhat incomplete but the storytelling was ok.Phenomenal action sequences. It's amazing what the movie accomplished by given budget.Plot was predictable for me. Wish I didn't see the ending from 20 minutes in to the movie. Due to that the ending was anticlimactic for me.I wish if there were less characters in the part so the other characters would have more time to develop in to.Nonetheless, I enjoyed the movie very much. It's Penomenal space opera with somewhat missed potential.Hope Directors cut and part 2 will solve this issue and give us more time to enjoy this art.

title: Snyders clemptomaniac movie
text: MoonAre you looking for a bad knock off of Star Wars? This is the movie for you!Kora the explorer leaves Veldt (ode to Germany) in search of an army against "the Kings Gaze" and Senator Bouillabaisse, who commands admiral not so Noble with his Shusher Wand.The Wakanda twins are leading the rebels in the fight against the Mother world.The movie has space vikings, space nazis, cyberpunk samurai, Newt "Navajo" Scamander, the newly freed black gladiator and GI Senua. The stereotypes are strong in this one folks.It also includes horrible acting and last, but not least every YA fantasy trope you can imagine. We are talking about the female protagonist caught in a love interest triangle, who suddenly has to fight the overpowered enemy. She released a breath she didn't know she was holding, while striking a Vogue pose. Ps. She shoots like a Storm Trooper.The script is full of wonderful oneliners like: to love and be loved....The movie is made by "Slomo Snyder", who tells instead of shows all the intriguing stuff we need to know.Oh, and the "plot" doesn't begin until at least 45 minutes of the movie has passed.Some of the interesting aliens you will encounter are: horses with masks, goats with antlers, dominatrix, candle disco dude, Squid King, Uruk-hai and of course sexoffender wrinkly neck (Wish Ballchinian - if you know you know).We wanted to give it 0,5 stars, but Charlie "Dumman" is in it, so it gets 1 whole star.Can't wait to watch the next. *not*

title: Could have been better
text: Rebel Moon - Part 1: The Child of Fire, directed by Zack Snyder, is an epic space opera film that follows the story of a group of rebels who embark on a dangerous mission to stop a tyrannical force.The film has a number of strengths, including good visual effects and engaging action. However, it also has a number of weaknesses, including weak dialogue and a script that is not as well-developed as it could be.Dialogue is one of the film's biggest weaknesses. Many of the conversations between characters are stilted and lacking in substance. This is especially true for the supporting characters, who are often reduced to clichés.The script is also a disappointment. The story is rather simple and predictable, and the characters are not developed enough to really engage us.In addition, the film has a number of pacing issues. The action is often interrupted by long sequences of dialogue or scenes that are not relevant to the story.Overall, Rebel Moon - Part 1: The Child of Fire is a weak film that fails to reach its potential. The film has a number of strengths, but they are overshadowed by the weaknesses.If you are a fan of space opera films, you may find something to enjoy in Rebel Moon - Part 1: The Child of Fire. However, if you are looking for a film with a strong story and well-developed characters, you are better off looking elsewhere.

title: The lord of wars: the fellowship of the star.
text: The fellowship of the star.Not looking forward to part two. Really lazy script. Actors would be a lot better with AI. Action scenes looked fake and the slo mo did them worst. The use of slow motion was abused.Personally I do not believe there are going to be 6-8 movies with this story.It would be a masterpiece if it was darker, with an atmosphere of watchmen, 300, man of steel and the rhythm of army of the dead.Hopefully, they did the same thing with justice league, the studios cut is a lame parody and the directors cut is an awesome movie. Sell one movie two times. Hopefully, if they want to make a third movie.

title: Disappointing and long
text: Like others I sooo wanted this to be good, Snyder likes his action, his effects his slow mo, so do I. What could go wrong. Well a lot by the looks of it. Not surprisingly massively long just to be able to string it out into more than one part. Psssst here's a secret, you could probably fit it all in during one movie if you cut out all the boring unnecessary bits, just a heads up snyder.The story is either really really simple or I'm just thick and missed the whole point of the film. Revenge? In a word covers it along with freedom. Like other reviews I agree, loads of different concepts and ideas from other sci fi and action films mashed together like different coloured play-do pieces being rolled up as one. It's all just so all over the place and not individualistic. I'm blaming netflix as DC might have just tipped it over the edge into palleatable. Top marks for trying but it was all very PG and a bit bland.Careful we don't see too much blood there's children still up! Make something for the over 12s man! On a plus note it is something I would recommend to watch if there's nothing else on and you have almost completed netflix, it's not that bad and there is a star studded cast. Give it a go but don't expect too much, and don't lose the remote as there will be plenty of bathroom breaks needed.

title: Scifi is back!!
text: Just wow!!..... Unexpectedly stumbled upon 'Rebel Moon' without prior knowledge or expectations, and what a pleasant surprise it turned out to be! Part one rekindled my passion for sci-fi, igniting a craving for captivating characters, thrilling adventures, and the epic scale of intergalactic warfare. This title successfully resurrects sci-fi to its former glory, and I realize how much I've missed a narrative of this caliber. Eagerly anticipating future installments, hoping they maintain the exceptional storytelling quality we witnessed in this first part!I just wanted more... every single second of it.

title: Rebel Moon take the nonsense to another level!!
text: Huge disappointment. So many problems with that movie. Firstly plot: seems like is not plot in the story, definitely don't make sense. It looks like main story is just generic something about the universe where movie have a action and don't make sense with the characters and their stories, actually is hard to describe it because is that bad. Utterly awful.. Wild west in medieval system and Roman empire in fantasy science fiction universe story is like crackhead idea. If think Steven Segal movies don't make sense Rebel Moon take nonsense to another level..you can write big essay or a book what is wrong with this movie. To make a movie longer maker's decided to abuse slow motion scenes - is absolutely horrible use of slow motion it seems like editors guidance was "just make slow motion, mate". Definitely not going to watch continuation, big budgets access to all resources and making so horrible films I've completely lost my faith in netflix.

title: Possibly the single worst piece of scifi media I've seen
text: This is so bad that I felt I had to write a review, which is something I usually only do for movies I really like.It has constant, explicit exposition / failed attempts at character building. "Ah, Warriorwoman, who once killed 16 of my men with nothing but a sharpened cheese wedge, we have not met since our last fight when I killed your entire family and made you very sad."The villains are fascist caricatures with no depth. It reminded me of the anime Hellsing, where the villains were Nazis, but not Nazis who thought they were racially superior as an attempt to cope with post-World War I national embarrassment and scapegoat an innocent population in the process... Rather, they're just Nazis doing evil because they like doing evil, and making war because they like making war. Rebel Moon villain writing is that level of depth.Their costume design is almost as lazy as their writing, being almost copy-and-paste Nazis and Catholic Cardinals. I'm not offended by the messaging there - to the contrary, I'm fully on-board with it. I'm offended by how absolutely lazy and unoriginal the delivery of that message was.It's like Foundation if you lobotomized it. It's like an unwanted child of Star Wars... it *is* an unwanted child of Star Wars. It's the most Disney-feeling non-Disney film I've ever seen.I have watched so much scifi. Maybe every English scifi movie on Netflix, and many not on Netflix. This is one of the single worst pieces of scifi media I've ever seen. The only piece of scifi media which competes in awfulness which I can immediately think of is Dark Matter, a series which feels like you let a 12-year-old goth kid rewrite Star Trek. (I can say that, I was a 12-year-old goth kid once.)Special effects and set design are cool, I guess. I watched the whole thing. I spent most of that time frustrated by how terrible it was, but sometimes that was interrupted by a few seconds of appreciating a set or alien-animal.Go watch Foundation or Annihilation or Star Trek: Strange New Worlds or Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams or Star Wars: Andor or Tales from the Loop or a million other shows instead of this.

title: Oh sweet Jesus, save me!
text: Yes, yet another in the never ending formulaic waste of bandwidth.It's difficult to watch this b-rate (d-rate?)mash-up of bad ...well...bad everything.Seriously...will the people who churn out this insult to anyone watching, never even TRY to portray the bad guys in anything other than Nazi uniforms?I thought Anthony Hopkins was better at choosing movies. Maybe he needed a couple of bucks to redecorate.My nephew tells me he always looks up the IMDB star rating before streaming anything. Anything less than 7 or 8 stars, and he just doesn't watch it.Smart kid! I think I'll start doing the same.

title: Don't waste your time - good for watching on a flight, that's about it
text:
I couldn't spoil this movie if I wanted to - you'll see the plot a mile away because:
1) It's not original - mishmash of other well-known sci-fi genres
2) The writers didn't spend too much time deviating from the absolute norm
3) You'll probably be bored and fast-forward anyway...
Basically this movie is littered with time-fillers, meaningless shallow plot, and just trying to build everything up to one epic battle (the second movie is pretty much the same cookie cutter). Some things just don't make sense - sword fighters in a battle of lasers, evil villains without logic, etc etc
Others mention a lot of "borrowing" from other movies - I don't mind that, but seems like the only recipe here is borrow as much as possible from others and mash it together - forcibly.

title: A Decent Set up for part two.
text: No spoilers: This episode is more of a prelude. It sets up the main protagonist and introduces the beginning of the rebellion. It's building up as a sci-fi Magnificent 7 with nods to Star Wars, Warhammer 40K and more.If you go into expecting a normal Snyder movie you maybe disappointed. It's very clear that he is setting up a story that will have the opportunity to brach off and tell many interesting story's. The alien effects, space ships, and space effects are great. Given the scope of the story there are so many questions set up for the future, but not in a annoying over the top way.I wouldn't call it a blockbuster movie, more the beginning of a Space Epic. I can't wait to discover more of this universe!

title: Unoriginal and even a rip off
text: This movie was written by someone who's seen the big sci fi movies, and thought, I could do that. But failed!It's early parts are straight out of Star Wars - A New Hope. An iconic movie from over 40 years ago that's been revived, digitised in 4K, and still entertains today.There was a scene in Rebel Moon where the protagonists go into a bar to find a ship pilot! I was expecting Hans Solo to appear.Then there's a scene drawn from The Phantom Menace with the Sith using two red light sabres (firey red double swords).Then there's Avatar rips including taming the flying creatures, and another scene where the rebel makes a huge jump with a spear to kill the gun operator onboard a huge warship.One rebel looks like Furiosa from Mad Max Fury Road.Overall it was a mish mash of rips from great movies using a poor script.

title: Visually amazing, Surface level story.
text: I was looking forward to this movie. After the directors cut of Justice League, I figured Zach would make better decisions with the full reign he was given with Netflix. The dialogue is rough around the edges and action scenes really aren't there. The scenes play out almost awkward throughout. Part One gets a 5/10, they did nail the hell out of the visual effects, I'll give them that.Side notes: Most of the characters were casted very well. A couple of them lack the intensity they were shooting for.As far as people complaining comparing it to the Star Wars universe. I actually didn't mind the connection because it didn't feel forced in any way. Doesn't seem like a good reason to bash on the movie.

title: Mid tier Chronicles of riddick
text: Everything seems so rushed.. No nuance. Each scene is a quick transition with very simple dialogue. Every character picked up has limited introduction or a mini game like test to complete to become part of the end goal. Sometimes main characters just sit around while important situations need remedied for no reason than for the other to complete that mini game.Characters are so easily convinced to join one cause or the other. Not much loyalty. Aesthetic and clothing design is pretty awesome except for some random white button up and skinny tie ordeal with a bowl cut? Is this 1985 or the future? A whole movie in and don't know why people are good or bad or how people are rebels or who is in control. Don't know why they're fighting the enemy, why the enemy is fighting them.Everyone is saying star wars clone. It has more chronicles of Riddick vibes but with a new hope farm world beginnings and a goofy heat-saber. The background cgi is muddy and basic. No clean vision for what cinematography is trying to be displayed. Why does every alien world movie have a random Scottish accent??There are 3 legitimate star wars copy scenes. Now a matrix copy scene. Made it even further in. Why is all the CGI dark billowing clouds or fog in the background? Better backgrounds in 70s CGI. Snyder couldn't get over the 300 Persian/Spartan hangover it appears. It's over. Don't know what's going on really. No answers. Left with only questions. Ugh. Started at a 5, reached a 6 1/3 of the way in, and ended with a 4. It's salvageable but not a new hope for much.

title: Design and CGI =10 Stars. Subtract 5 stars for a pathetic script and story.
text: There was enough Beauty to the Art Direction and CGI to keep me watching. Fantastic other worlds, spaceships an action pieces. My only objection to the effects is that I thought the ultra slow motion was overdone. On the other hand, the audio in 5.1 surround is outstanding.I thought "taming the bird" was pretty cool, but the nasty Spider Woman fight was a fail. If the warrior had flaming hot blades at her disposal why did she wait so late to heat 'em up? Oops, sorry for bringing logic into the review. If I attacked all the logic flaws, my review would be 6000, words rather than 600.The script and dialogue are unimaginative, and embarrassingly bad. The good guys may be decent Warriors but they their motivations are consistently ludicrous, and they can't read a room.I don't expect any improvements in part two because I'm certain that the script was written and in the can for both parts. But who knows? It starts streaming today so I'll give it a watch.

title: Another masterpiece of Zack
text:
Another masterpiece. Must-watch
With great music to fuel your shaky feet throughout, rebel moon delivers a mood and feel through its characters, creatures and planet veldt. Incredible acting especially from Ed Skrien and Sofia. Amazing action scenes accompanied with cinematography and great visuals. Anthony Hopkins performance also shines through with his voice alone.I'm surprised that despite being called similar to star wars its more like heavy metal meets mad-max meets 300 with a mix of game of thrones and anime. The most insane mix up of genres but rather than end up a mess its a masterpiece and now the golden standard for Sci-Fi. How did he do it? So excited for the directors-cut.

title: Could have been a great movie
text: Overall, the VFX are excellent, especially some of the 3d character performances which are surprisingly good. The costuming and practical sets are excellent. The casting is perfectly good, the acting is good considering the appalling dialogue and story. Unfortunately the whole effort is spoiled by a complete lack of effort on the part of the writers.
