The "recruitment story" is soo completely contrived. ( dues ex machina?? ) the characters are brutally shoe-horned into the story with almost no effort to weave them in organically. I hate to be mean, but it feels like a 15 year old boy wrote the story and dialogue (and noone proof read it for him). Looking back on Jack Snyder's writing credits before this, there is a predicable string of woefully scripted movies (in terms of dialog), wonder woman, 300, justice league etc... Its a real shame if he had employed some skilled writers it could have been a really great sci-fi film. Such a shame, Jack u need to let go of writing, its just not your thing !!

title: A star wars imposter. And a disappointing one at that.
text: "It doesn't know what it is, but wants to be Star Wars" were my thoughts on seeing this (not knowing who had directed it or any of its history) But then I see it's Zack Snyder and he wanted it to be in the star wars canon! Yep. I can see that. It's a poor imposter and doesn't get close. It does look great as you'd expect but disappears up its wanna be back side. It's like a mongrel trying to be a pure breed. What a shame. It could have been fab but it just isn't! The performances are poor, the storyline is predictable and the characters and settings are all stolen. My score is generous due to the fact that I really wanted to like it.

title: Very Slow with little reward
text: I was excited to watch this movie but quickly regretted starting it at 10pm. It is so slow!! The movie feels like it is a 5 hour epic. Then when there is an action fight scene or aerial battle, it is presented in super slow motion. Why one earth would you give us a slowed down action sequence in a movie that already feels like it is lasting forever. Aside from the pace, I never felt connected to any of the characters. The acting was okay but some seemed very wooden. The visuals were great, of course. In the end, I really do not care to watch the second chapter unless the trailer or director promises a whole lot more than what the first one gave.

title: A solid start given its a new IP and has to build its base
text: Something hie, something flew , somethings borrowed , somethings new ....For the budget i admire zacks vision , he tried his hardest to fills the gaps with as much blur as he could and it didnt spoil it for me , i felt as the movie went on it continued to find its footing , its pace , its tone and left me wanting more ..... i get it the size of the world and rhe history its following on from ........ ,with the R-rated an version dropping soon i imagine the pacing will be far cleaner and characters flushed out more which is always the case with zacks films ....i enjoyed it part 2 will be action packed from start to finish with any questions regarding the cast answered with flashbacks ...For a new world , a new franchise to build with such a budget , i think zack did all he could , amd with the R-rated i think it will be he did all he wanted.

title: I don't care about a single thing happening on screen
text: What I personally could not shrug off when it came to this film was how forced everything felt in a way that the script did not seem revised properly. Nothing flowed and I did not care about a single thing happening before me, I can't feel towards characters who are written like Saturday morning cartoon characters.The continuity between scenes makes it feel like you are watching all of a videogame's cut scenes in order without actually having played the game to get to know the world to fix this problem. I can picture Zack Snyder will fix this problem with his well known "just release a five hour long cut" which is a joke because who needs a full five hours to pull a simple story out of a hat.I have nothing against Zack Snyder as a director in fact I think he is brilliant but his problem is that no matter how good of a director he is he cannot write to save his life. This is apparent in how his best films are all written by other people such as James Gunn. Then again I am not a fan of his overuse of slo-mo which makes his action scenes seem almost Bollywood-esque.Overall no matter how much I want to enjoy it (which I do the world it is set in looks amazing) I can't due to its atrocious writing that rips off and overuses tropes from other franchises like Star Wars or Warhammer 40k.(Gave it a cheeky two extra stars because I still feel it looks nice visually at times)

title: George Lucas and JK Rowling should sue
text:
I dont usually give poor reviews because, for me, movies are for entertainment and as long as I'm entertained, it's a good movie. But I can't even with this movie. Too much of it is spent attempting to be artsy fartsy and not enough time was dedicated to character development or actual storytelling. It's more soap opera than space opera.Pros:
The special effects were, for the most part really good.The actors are talented and played their parts well.The costumes, make up and set designs were beautifully done.The action sequences are great, when time isn't slowed down so you can see whatever.Cons :
Poor time management. Had there been less cloak flapping and otherwise unnecessary "artistic" sequences, it would have been way shorter.The story is just boring. Everything has been done before except maybe the closing scene and that would have been a better story than what was given.I genuinely doubt the director understands what constitutes entertainment to an average viewer.I understand that an original story is hard, but this was borderline a rip off of Star Wars in many places.Is there even a point to a second part?What happened to the robot? How did that happen? Again, story. Plot. Something.....

title: Well-worn plot, but worth it
text: The visuals are good, but the plot is old and well trodden. We've been here before with Kurosawa's Seven Samurai (1954), Sturges' Magnificent Seven (1960) and W. S. Anderson's Soldier (1998), and the countless stories through the ages of helpless (and hapless) villagers who recruit a team of heroes to save them. It's unoriginal - obviously - but it's such a good plot that I don't mind it. I keep telling myself it's a story worth retelling so that kids who will never watch the aforementioned films will at least get to experience this ancient plot. So, in conclusion: (apologies for rambling, but there's a minimum character limit) See it!

title: Thanks biased critics !
text: Yeah I want to thank biased "professional" critics cause thanks to them I wasn't expected anything, I was just curious and guess what ? I loved the movie ! I was in from the begining to the end and now I m waiting for the director's cut and for part 2 ! It's beautiful, the rythm is good, action scenes were alive. The trailer didn't spoil the movie so it was pleasant to discover the world in what RM is set.Just an advice : make your own idea on it, you can like or dislike it, no problem but don't trust "professional" critics cause here clearly some of them where really biased. More when you see some of them giving nice reviews to last MCU or DC movies ^^' clearly be smarter than what they expect from you and make your own idea :)

title: Expected it to be better
text: I hate to say it, what a bore this movie was. I love Zach Snyder as a film maker. Even his divisive Batman V Superman was better than this abomination. I hear there is an director's cut out there. Like 2017's Justice League was an absolute shambles, maybe the director's cut can salvage this movie from being a disaster. We got the director's cut of Justice League and though not perfect, it was a whole lot better.This was Zach's version of Star Wars which had a lot of promise but failed miserable. I'm sure there's a better movie in there somewhere. I feel Netflix really dropped the ball on this one, because l hear there's a R rated version available and why the hell didn't they show that one. The mind boggles. Hopefully part two will be better than this, I'm thinking it could be worse.

title: Epic sci fi saga solid 8 no less.
text: So we have our Rebel moon part 1: A child of fire in Netflix apparently this is the PG 13 cut of the film( expecting to have the directors cut of the rebel Moon part 1 so not making it too long as I need to see more of this rebel moon universe) .I will just say the pacing is very very good,the characters are well played,the dialogues are solid and Amazing directing cinematography. What about vfx and visuals? Is top notch, this is what you expect from Zack snyder The visionary director so for me this is a solid 8 no more or no less manifesting the director which will have more detailed info about the world he built. Go to your Netflix and stream the hell out of it.

title: Predictable
text: Let's start with the good... The movies best quality is the cinematography. The wardrobe and color grading are wonderful and use many elements of hit sci-fi flicks. The use of anamorphic lenses and light flares create captivating visuals.Now for the predictable... The main characters are lack luster and unbelievable. It follows the trend of most current movies of a femme fatale that doesn't deliver.There is an over use of slo-mo during action scenes, while other scenes looked borrowed.Easily judged the poster and the promise of this movie based on the bob hairstyle and I was correct. It is nothing I will revisit.

title: Average remake of a film you've seen.
text: Seven Samurai, Magnificent Seven, Dirty Dozen...All great films. And this is another soft retread that leaves shallow footprints and occasionally wanders off the path in slow motion.The dialogue is stiff, and blunt. The acting seems oddly constrained. As with most of his recent output, Snyder makes something that feels like a video game cut scene rendered in half decent CGI.Ultimately you can watch this as another attempt at a sci-fi epic that telegraphs a wild west backdrop with homesteads and trading posts. It's something that Firefly pulled off two decades ago, and certainly did it with more heart and skill that ln here.It's not offensive, but that's damning with faint praise. As little as I enjoyed the recent Star wars films, this is no moon.

title: Have to be REALLY bored to watch this
text: Ok, Zack Snyder has been given too much money to waste it, once again. I felt like this movie was a mash-up of stolen ideas poorly squished into one. It's like the bad Star Wars (recent ones), meets a little Dune, meets Dollar Tree Guardians of the Galaxy, meets a bunch of random bits from others. The action was always the same, with the main girl running from bullet/lasers in slo-mo just to kick some butt. The plot is really terribe. It starts really slow and waiting 90 minutes just to see something "decent" of length was annoying. The ending was obvious just due to the title, Part One. Overall, if you are stuck on your couch and want to burn two hours of your life since you've watched everything good already, watch it. Otherwise, just be grateful you didn't pay theater price to see this.

title: Entertaining Sci-Fi Action Flick
text: This is certainly no Oscar worthy film. The acting is decent, the writing is somewhat lacking when it comes to character building which results in somewhat less result than I feel it could have been. The story however is still coherent enough and the visual effects are fantastic! One thing that I did notice is that most scenes had amazing cgi but there were a few scenes that looked poor in comparison to the rest of the film. After watching the entire film I could not feel as though we were missing some scenes that were cut out to reduce the film in length. I am told that the directors cut comes in at just over 3 hours in length and Snyder said its almost a completely different film! I am betting that the directors cut is far superior to the release we did get as it would likely fill in a lot of that backstory we feel is missing.Beyond everything I mentioned above, the score is good, cinematography is top notch. The real detractor to this film is the missing back stories that were removed to shorten the run time. I feel if we were to watch the director cut it would fix all these problems.Overall the film is still good. Very entertaining if you are in to science fiction films. I feel as though this film has been review bombed by many people for stupid reasons. I am going with an 8 out of 10 for this one based on the fact that I very specifically enjoy science fiction films. The entertainment value is there, you just have to go into this one with some reasonable expectations and if you enjoy this type genre then I feel you will agree with my score also. Watch this one if you like science fiction and Snyder films!

title: I made an account just to leave a review of how pants this movie is
text: This was hands down the worst movie I have ever seen. Nothing makes sense, it just happens like they expect you to know the lore. No build up at all to anything, just totally confusing. It's like a B-tec guardians of the galaxy. It's like space nazis meet Star Wars and guardians of the galaxy. I've also never seen so much slo motion in a film in my life. Someone could go for a piss and they'd put it in slow motion. Charlie hunnman puts on the worst Irish accent ever heard. I actually thought this movie was dubbed when I saw it. Honestly it's like the film was put together by collage students. The best acting came from the villain and that's being generous. Also it's like they've hired actors and in this movie who look like other A list celebrities. I can safely say I'll never watch this garbage again.

title: Nothing original
text:
I've had an IMDB account for easily over 10 years and I've never written a review. This justified me breaking that silence.So much promise, but unfortunately the most plagiaristic movie I've ever seen.Get ready to see poor copies of
-The Matrix
-Vikings
-Avatar
-Harry Potter
-Red Dwarf
-Halo
-Star Wars
-Star Trek
-Underwold
-LabyrinthAnd keep an eye out for some of the most questionable visual effects you'll ever come across. The black crow/hippogriff has got to be one of my favourites!Don't expect too much from the script. The story barely hangs together and the attempt at making you 'feel' for the characters is outrageously lazy.Final one from me - How is such a large ship controlled by a single guy in a turret?Enjoy!

title: Don't bother
text: Masturbatory Star Wars fan boy junk ... and I'm using the word junk to avoid being censored. I expected so much more from this, especially after the hype. I like Zack's movies, in general, but he missed on this one. The pacing is slow and the story is unoriginal. I can't believe he is going to release a longer version. It could only be worse. Sorry. I wanted to like it, but no.I guess the Star Wars folks were right to reject this. It sounded like they just didn't want an R rated Star Wars movie, but perhaps there was more to it ... like they didn't think it would be any good. Kudos to them for turning it down.

title: Mega disapoinment
text: As most of Netflix movies this is also boring, very boring. With a huge budget and good cast they managed to make a movie that I tried to see for almost an hour the I decided to do something else. To have a good story and to make it this lame it's one the biggest mysteries of 2023 film making. To spent more than 150M and to have this disappointment makes me think that someone trick them and made a lot of money. I have the feeling that Netflix is interested ton produce quantity not quality and the ratio between the price of the subscription and what the offer it's not right. Another movie who overpromised and it will remain as one of the major failures of 2023.

title: Ignore The Negative Reviews!!!
text: Guys - ignore the negative reviews - this was really quite good - I completely enjoyed it. It does move a little slow - but that's because it offers a good amount of character development - all leading up to the second half. But it's a fun story - and maybe it's not wildly different from other Science Fiction movies along these lines - but it was well done - lots of good stuff here and I'm thoroughly looking forward to the second half! Again - ignore any negatives - it good - no complaints from me. I also liked some of the cross genre of sci-fi and almost gladiator or old west films - it's done well. Again - I enjoyed it!

title: Average at Best
text: I had great expectations, watched with my wife and my daughter. Wife nodded off, daughter started playing on her phone.It starts off with a very star wars look about it, yes there is a story and you start to understand the characters as it goes along. The enemy at the beginning on arrival are very SS Hitler type management and you can't shake that feeling.The scenes where there are not human characters are clearly spoofing star wars pub scene type scenario and when the main character comes out of her shell she is a combatant know doubt but very obviously choreographed.So 2 hours and a bit and I wonder was this a school boy essay in film.I was expecting more but got less.

title: Zack Snyder has regressed as a director
text:
I sat through this whole thing. In one sitting. I have regrets.Pros:
1. Music was solid
2. The palpable horniness of the movie makes for a few chuckles, such as spaceships coming out of warp via ethereal space vagina, and the antagonist being very into tentacles.Cons: So many
1. Weak plot, and pacing... and writing. This is effectively Seven Samurai in space. It's a template that has already been written and executed on countless times - should be easy. Except the intros for the warriors feel rushed and sloppy. There's not a lot that makes you care about them. They also just tamely tag along with the bare minimum of provocation, and their scenes are so rushed. They don't feel impassioned to help the protagonist; they do it because the plot expects them to. Then you get hit with several minutes of ultra tragic backstory flashback that feels like it was written by a child.2. Weak acting. Sofia Boutella delivers lines woodenly and doesn't make me care a whit about her backstory. No one else who matters gets enough lines or attention to warrant their inclusion. I enjoyed Charlie Hunnam in The Gentlemen, but felt he was wasted in his role here, as were Djimon Hounsou, Doona Bae, Anthony Hopkins, and Cary Elwes.3. Weak action scenes. Snyder's trademarks abound: overabundance of slow motion, fist fighting in storms, dumb decisions. There's a tavern brawl where every bullet is fired in slo-mo, but the amount of exaggerated muzzle flare obscures everything, making me wonder what the point was (as of writing this I'm still unsure). The main character does not feel like some legendary space warrior, especially when she does things like forgetting she has a gun and running at the bad guys headfirst, with plot armor being the only thing saving her from laser fire. That kind of bravado worked in 300, but makes no sense in this context.4. Absolutely stupid sets and set pieces. There is a wooden mechanized sliding door? All the frontier stuff is made of wood despite no evidence of trees on these planets? It's the future, cement would be cheaper to manufacture. High-tech imperial cruiser, whose pilot/gunner is protected by weak glass that is pierced by a pipe? Firefly portrayed better "sci-fi frontiership" and had more sensible tech.It feels like Zack Snyder has gotten worse over time, relying on the same gimmicks more and more, and not learning how to deliver a coherent plot in an appetizing manner. I'd rather re-watch Sucker Punch than give this franchise another go... and Sucker Punch was very disappointing.

title: Definitely watchable, but the writing was pretty bad.
text: Great cast and costumes, but not even a robot voiced by Anthony Hopkins can salvage this mess of a plot. Action scenes were overindulgent and the slow-mo was honestly comical. Ed Skrein looks like he's having a blast though, so good for him lol.Lots of potential, with more interesting world building that the main story doesn't do enough with, and that's not even getting into how much it outright steals from much better sci-fi like Star Wars and Warhammer 40k.Zach Snyder is a fairly competent director with all the sensibility of a 14 year old boy. So many scenes were outright juvenile and even borderline offensive with how poorly he handles serious topics like slavery and sexual assault.

title: Well now, I guess I'm not on the negative on this one
text: I'll try to keep this short but I felt I had to write a review because of all the negative ones.For me the movie was just fun to watch. Maybe because I didn't read reviews previously or had any expectations but I actually had a great time watching this movie. If you haven't watched it yet. You should and see for yourself if you liked it or hated it because it's not Star Wars (before it got bad).So this is a sci-fi story about an ex imperialist hiding in a community that comes under threat from, you guessed it, the empire. From there on out, it all begins...The way people meet in this story and the way the journey goes was actually quite enjoyable to me. It does feel like there is so much more in this world so hopefully we get to see more of it in the longer version.

title: A very try-hard would-be epic
text: As a lifelong sci-fi fan I was looking forward to this despite the abysmal Army of Zombies. But this is another definite "miss" for hit-or-miss Snyder.First, the good. The cinematography is often stunning, and Snyder frames shots well. The artistic vision is solid and gorgeous, the overall aesthetic a mix of Mobius and Warhammer. Weird and creepy and varied aliens abound.But the visuals alone are not enough, and the story seems like something amateurly constructed to serve the visuals rather than the visuals serving the story. A perfect example of this is the -- gorgeous! -- shot of an android Cernunos near the end, apropos of nothing except the many issues of Heavy Metal magazine that Snyder, like me, has surely read.The dialogue is passable (sometimes just) but as with many poor Netflix serials where either an attempt has been made to squeeze too much material into too short of a time or the writers are just bad writers, too much is told via exposition and neon-signed Meaningful Moments rather than shown through plot and character development. Sophia's character suffers the most from this simply because she has the most lines. But I'm not sure she could pull of a bad-ass woman like Ripley or Sarah Connor anyway even with good dialogue, her demonstrated skill in other roles notwithstanding. "Grrl power" -- and her character wasn't the only boss babe -- isn't actually badass. It's just silly.Anthony Hopkins' combat android was actually the most intriguing character by far and we got far too little of him.

title: Slowmotion
text: So the village has about 20 people. They can barely feed themselves. But the empire who basically controls everything desperately needs the surplus of these 20 people's crop? Really?Billions of people will starve if they don't get the leftovers from 20 farmers. Sounds good. Let's go to war and show some abs.No let's be honest. The plotline worked for the magnificent 7... but it does not work for a conflict between a small village and a galactic empire.The action is okay I guess. Yet too much slowmotion. The acting is... meh... not sure how they got Anthony Hopkins involved. Should have maybe used him more often.

title: Decent. But could have been a lot better
text: "Rebel Moon," a film that recently graced the screens, is a striking example of how a visually stunning movie can captivate an audience while simultaneously leaving them yearning for more substance in its execution, particularly in terms of acting and depth of narrative.From the outset, the film establishes itself as a visual spectacle. The special effects are nothing short of mesmerizing, creating a vivid and immersive universe that can only be described as a feast for the eyes. Each frame is meticulously crafted, with attention to the finest details, making the world of "Rebel Moon" feel alive and bustling. The action sequences are particularly noteworthy, choreographed with such precision and flair that they keep the audience on the edge of their seats. Explosive, dynamic, and often breathtaking, these scenes showcase the pinnacle of what modern special effects can achieve. They serve as the backbone of the film, propelling the story forward with a relentless momentum that is both exhilarating and visually arresting.However, beneath the veneer of these stunning visuals and heart-pounding action, the film reveals its more tepid layers. The story, while intriguing, borrows heavily from the classic "Star Wars" narrative, giving it a familiar, almost derivative feel. It's a tale of rebellion, tyranny, and the classic struggle between good and evil, set against a backdrop of distant galaxies and futuristic warfare. While the story is engaging to a certain extent, its lack of originality prevents it from being truly compelling. The plot unfolds in a predictable manner, and while it manages to maintain interest, it never quite achieves the depth or complexity that could have elevated it from good to great.The acting in "Rebel Moon" is perhaps its most notable shortfall. Despite boasting a cast of talented actors, many of whom have proven their mettle in other productions, their performances here are underwhelming. The characters, while visually striking, often feel shallow, lacking the layers and nuances that make for truly memorable performances. It's as though the actors are aware of the film's emphasis on aesthetics over substance, leading to performances that are competent but lackluster. There's a sense that the cast could have delivered more, had the script and direction allowed them to explore their characters more deeply.This leads to another critique of the film - its apparent focus on physical appearances over acting prowess. Many of the characters are portrayed by actors with impressive physiques, which, while visually pleasing, adds little to the depth or believability of their characters. It seems as though the casting decisions were made more with an eye towards aesthetic appeal than fitting the role. This choice, while understandable in a film that places such a high value on visual impact, ultimately detracts from the overall quality of the performances. It gives the impression that the film is more interested in showcasing its cast's physical attributes than in delivering powerful, convincing performances.In conclusion, "Rebel Moon" is a film that dazzles with its visual effects and action-packed sequences, creating an immersive and visually stunning world that is a joy to behold. However, this focus on aesthetics comes at the cost of depth in both story and character development. The acting, while not terrible, is far from the best work of the talented cast, and the emphasis on physical appearances over character depth is a missed opportunity. The film is enjoyable for what it is - a visual spectacle with an action-packed narrative that echoes the classic "Star Wars" vibe. However, it falls short of being a truly great film due to its lack of originality in storytelling and the underutilization of its cast's acting potential.

title: Hyped yet disappointed
text:
Finished the entire movie last night and 1 thing became clear,Sofia boutella was not a good choice as the lead actress,the plot was too predictable,the lines were written by teenager,the other cast members tried to compensate,they tried hard but bad choice of lead actress+The thief was also a bad actor,too predictable.The villain actors lines and actions were decent,the strange animals scenes were done perfectly,even though the movie was unrealistic because they were found immediately despite the mother world looking for them and they just by default join them,the resistance joins them just after being asked and are willing to take on huge risks,and finally they just let anyone in without any questions or anythingThe CGI and the environments were done perfectly,sound design was not bad as well,but the fight scenes especially the first one where kora fights with the invading guys was faked and everyone could see it,too obvious.The movie felt rushed,no emotional connection with any of the characters, this can't be a Zack Snyder film
It could be improved upon,actors replaced,plot made too layered,more connection.But this is part 1, perhaps part 2 would add even more depth and surprise us all.

title: Issues but overall....I loved it.
text: Sure, the story is a mix of The 300 and the magnificent seven but like I've told people...Everything now is a combination of other movies and stories. Take Star Wars.....Samurai in Space.It does have problems in character creation but the world building more than makes up for it. I loved it. I have seen it about four times already.But, there isn't anything like this...visually out there. So yeah, I'm looking forward to the extended version and for part two.One last thing, this reminds me of those movies that when they came out...they were a flop because people didn't understand them or like them....then in the future they become extraordinary.

title: It's "Bug's Life". But in space
text: It's "Bug's Life", but then again, it's Kurosawa's "Seven Samurai" and its derivation - "Magnificent Seven".The exact same character dynamics: a representative of simple farmers that goes to the city to try and assemble a ragtag group of skilled individuals banding together to protect the weak against powerful oppressor.You know the drill.The thing is: once you notice the main trope, it's inevitable you notice similarities, references, inspirations.I gave it a try because I was curious to see how so many talented people together could not deliver a better rate here in IMDb. Unfortunately all the other reviewers are correct: it's more of the same. Cliche after cliche.It's a shame. I really wanted to like these guys and this production.

title: Meh..
text: Literally one of the laziest movies of all time about the character development.. Space Nazis? Really?You absolutely don't understand what is the motivation of the characters, all of them act like npc's from the cutscenes of a computer game. There are. 7 soldiers and 6 of them are devilishly evil but only one of them is pure good soul.Storyline is totally meaningless and Charlie hunham once again doing a weird accent that he couldn't really handle.I gave 3 just because I m happy that snyder tried to create a whole new universe instead of f.cking up an original with a shotty remake like LOTR.

title: Mashup of different movies
text: An attempt was made to create a new one from various films (villains comparable to Nazis on the moon, the "collection" of the main characters is reminiscent of Marvel-style hero films where a crew has to be assembled, etc.). Video game-like, but not movie-ready animations were combined with a bad story. The viewer cannot build up an emotional connection to the characters or the story. A lot of things happen one after the other, but much of it is completely irrelevant. The movie is embarrassing, the people involved should be fired.The movie joins the ranks of Prime disasters like Shanara Chronicles, Wheel of Time and Lotr. It has to be said that, unfortunately, even Prime's films were better.

title: Worth more than 5.6!!!!!!
text: I can't believe this has only got 5.6!I think all the Star Wars fan boys have given it a low score because it's a Jack Snyder Star Wars rip off. Yes the scene in the bar is clearly from a New Hope and is a total rip off. The start of the film reminds me of Rogue One and has a real grainy feel to it. Love the introduction to the droid in this film. Very cool & heartfelt scene.For an introduction film to the saga I really enjoyed it. I loved how the story was about building a team for what's to come. It's got a real feel good feeling factor to it. Looking forward to the next film in the saga!!

title: Bad even for Netflix
text: I really wanted to see this movie, the trailer looked promising and we have not seen a good sci-fi for quite a long time now. BUT..... What the director wanted to show us? This movie is bad, like going back 15y and maybe even then it would look bad. From old fashioned CGI which will hit you first minute, to bad story without a try being original, character development is just a joke (like watching some very old D&D B-rated movies) ... it's just emptiness. The whole movie is like Riddick meets with Dungeons and Dragons and Clash of Titans (?) And do not take me wrong, those were great movies compared to this. I am not even going to write any spoilers as it's not worth of it.Thank god it's released on Netflix only, can't imagine spending money to see this crap in cinema.2 stars for Ed Skrein (villain) looking like Tommy Shelby from Peaky Blinders :)

title: Lets mix all greatest movies and make one
text: AI wrote it. No doubtHey AI, write me a movie mix of GOT, Matrix, Star Wars(Rouge one), Gladiator, walking dead(negan)How about consept? Put died king, his living girl, lots of bad soldier and general. New generation hero girl looking for soldiers. Captain (Han Solo with accent) Donnie Yen's female version, old friend from Gladiator .Bad General mixture of from inglorious Bastards and walking dead Negan.I guess new generation movies will be far far away from creativity with bad dialogs, predictable scenario.No need to wait Part Two. When I saw trailer I guessed whats coming but it is so sad when it comes from one of the few creative mind Zack Synder. Respect all actors and effects but this one is failure.

title: Any rating of 7 or above is curious...
text:
Hypothesis for those rating Rebel Moon 7 or more...1) They have only just discovered movies (aliens, young children, people who have grown up on a desert islands etc) and hence have no benchmark for what is good nor any knowledge of the other movies that Rebel Moon has (badly) ripped off.2) They are somehow connected with the production of the movie and are (extremely generously) marking their own homework3) They are (I am sorry to say) idiots and they either
(3a) are easily impressed by illogical, derivative nonsense or
(3b) accidentally rated it highly when they intended to (correctly) rate it low. Ooops, oh well.4) It is actually a really good film. It is my mistake to think that Rebel Moon has badly ripped off half a dozen other films, has precisely zero original content, a terrible script, unconvincing acting, annoying characters and a number of fundamental plot flaws. The time and money spent on Rebel Moon was well worth it. Hey, maybe all those other films that I think are good are actually bad.Let us go with hypothesis number 4. Why not. So, forget Star Wars, forget Lord of the Rings, forget Avatar and Dune - just watch Rebel Moon. It is amazing!

title: Critics are wrong
text: I don't know, where the hate for this movie is coming from from, I just watched the movie and I really enjoyed it.Is it the best movie ever? Certainly not, but it is a cool science fiction adventure, more fun than all the latest Star Wars movies (with the exception of Rogue One).Is it the most unique story, no it is not, but Star Wars wasn't unique either.Could you spend more money on CGI, obviously yes, but overall I liked it and I loved the space ships.If you like the genre, you will probably like the movie. I watched it with my adults sons and all of us enjoyed watching a new space opera.

title: Star Wars Fake
text:
First thing is: the movie is beautiful, effects are quite good and scenary are fine.I think they abuse of slow motion.Then:
You can recognise every copy from another movies, every role, every story and scenery are copied and stealed from another success movie, but they are empty and dull, in an annoying sequence of nothing during 2 endless hours.And also... nothing.We just waited for something but nothing happened. Where is Zach? Where is the magic we were waiting for? But it was not.Just an incredible boring movie when the actors do nothing between themshelves, they don't talk, don't explain, just someone expected the story came to us in a misterious cinema way of working or something?2 hours lost. Forget the Second part, save us from dullness.But...
Don't worry, Zach is the master of Second Chances. He will launch a Director's Cut or something and maybe it will be eatable.Lucky us we did't go to the cinema and spend money.

title: Lazy recycled science fiction
text: This highly anticipated film fell short of expectations. Despite my optimism for a revival of Hollywood sci-fi, it disappoints with a lackluster script and subpar acting. The characters lack depth and appeal, seemingly cast solely for their looks. The abundance of attractive actors detracts from the authenticity of the roles. Furthermore, the prevalence of clichéd weak and evil male personas adds nothing new to modern cinema. Regrettably, the film appears as a mishmash of recycled sci-fi tropes, lacking originality or innovation. It's every science fiction and fantasy film made and thrown into a blender and poured out in Zack Snyder slow motion. Oh ya, every action scene is in slow motion. Nothing is original anymore. It's all been done. A hot 110 pound ass kicking Sofia Boutella was going to save this film. The worst part is they made a part 2.

title: Best looking bad movie ever
text: It's a combo of every popular science fiction movie ever made and the seven samurai. Makes zero sense. I really wanted to like it but I just couldn't. They travel around getting different people to help them but never once explain why they need help who they are fighting or how they can help. The characters are interesting but who the heck are they? No back story or explanation on how they found them. I don't know why this was made or how it got green lit There are some good performances which is unfortunate because they are given nothing to work with. I would suggest avoiding this as it's just not good.

title: Another Zack snorefest
text: Zack does it again, another overlong movie that has zero character development, near enough no original story and completely devoid of some kind of emotion which seems surprising when the whole point is that the team should form the soul of the movie.Visually the movie looks pretty good, some of the blending with reality could of been better as it looked very obvious that it was mostly cg.If you are a fan of Zacks style you'll likely give it a 10, but if you have seen movies by pretty much anyone else then i imagine you will be in the generous 4-5 territory.Pretty lifeless affair overall. Not sure i could be bothered to watch the 2nd part.Too obviously intended as a star wars film but what they didnt say was that it was written in the style of Attack of the clones, only inferior.

title: What a gripe the film is much better.
text: The worst film I've seen in my life, it couldn't be worse. What a moan people really have never seen a B or C movie. The directors and film studios shouldn't make any more SciFi films and series, whether Dune, Star Trek, Foundation or For all menkind, today everything is being destroyed. Sometimes the accent isn't right or the acting isn't right and the whole film is only worth one star. Which film studio would want to shoot a new Babylon 5, Battelstar Galactica or Stargate under such conditions? Based on the bad reviews, I think that people didn't see the same movie that I saw. The first part wasn't perfect but it's far from being a flop.

title: BORING..COULDN'T FINISH THE MOVIE
text:
What's wrong with Snyder ? Such a useless movie .can't even finish..tried a lot .After 1 hour 20 minutes felt exhausted. No good action scenes no character Development..absolute disaster..
Snyder is always weak when it comes to story telling and character Development bit this is his worst ..unwatchable.Not sure what Netflix had in mind when they took a premise like this .Such a waste of time ..
Heard there is a snydercut for this ? This guy don't know at all how to make a proper movie on first than stating a cut of directorial talents? Come on ..this is ridiculous..too bland too bad
Worst movie.

title: Battle beyond the stars remake
text: I'm a big fan of Zak Snyder but he should not put his name anywhere near this cliched mess. Comparisons can be made against all the seven samurai / magnificent seven films but this is almost a direct rip off from Battle beyond the Stars. The acting, directing and dialogue are simply awful. Special effects can be forgiven as they are budget enforced, but simple believable interaction and conversation between characters should be a given at any level of film making. It was rumoured that this was once offered to be part of the Star Wars franchise and I am glad that it was refused (even the last trilogy was better than this). There is a part two to follow but I wonder how much interest it will create for those who have sat uninspired through the first instalment. Giving a low score gives me no joy but two stars is well deserved.

title: De-muscular men movies
text: Another bad movie show that women are stronger then men in every movie as the villain and the hero while we just stand there and get splattered bye 110lb women.Well beside that i though this was going to be a good Sci-fi it had it chance and time to but Hollywood and there views on Man stopped it.The movie lost me when a big ship appeared in the sky and i said nice, then when i watch them use machine gun as there weapons couldn't believe that the future was still killing with those.Then the movie took a turn for the worst as a bad John Wick woman killing everyman in her sight.Funny how they show men getting spluttered in mass but never women. Hollywood give it a break.

title: Ignore all the low ratings and immerse yourself in this journey
text: My title says it all, sincerely .Zack is brilliant.Watcher is amazing and a masterpiece.And so is Rebel Moon.Low rating doesnt do this movie justice and rather uneducated or void of certain standard of appreciationI love the flow , its character development & characters screen time has its respective special scene moment is well used & well deserved .Action scene is not over exaggerated to a comical level but rather entertainingly dramatic enough .There's lots i could say about this movie so just go and enjoy it .Maybe should just go back to watching cartoons.Just Another Zack masterpiece.

title: So bad that it might be satire
text: I prefer writing good reviews and saying nothing at all if I dislike a movie or book, but Rebel Moon was so astoundingly bad that I'm willing to break my rule. I only finished it because I was sick with the Christmas plague and too weak to press stop.Every single directorial decision takes the most cliched choice possible. I love sci-fi and build in a lot of leeway, but at some point I stopped watching this as sci-fi and started to marvel at how any adult director could consistently make "artistic" decisions that most 12 year old girls would consider childish and cliche.Maybe they'll reveal that this was actually written and directed by AI? Not the new versions, but the early generation? Amazing movie, for all the wrong reasons.

title: Style over substance
text: It's visually gorgeous. There are single frames here that are pieces of art. But also like a lot of Snyder's work, this film is let down by a terrible script. I know this was originally a Star Wars script and was influenced by films like 'Seven Samurai', and it's honestly better than some recent Star Wars. But the story lacks cohesiveness. It feels like a bunch of random scenes just thrown together. Half of the world building and character design is amazing and very unique, and the other half feels lame. The characters are all one-dimensional and cliched, with clunky robotic dialogue (Charlie Hunnam's accent is cringey). I was excited for this but now my interest in Part 2 has dropped significantly.

title: Most intelligent offensive movie I have ever seen
text:
1. This movie could have been half hour shorter if not for all the frequent slow-motion. What's up with that? There isn't nothing impressing in an effect that is entirely abused throughout the movie.2. Story? We have all watched it a thousand time.3. Special effect? I have seen better 20 years ago.4. Characters? What's going on? Who are all these characters? Where's the background? How do they play all together? Where did they come from? It's all seem random. I have never seen any movie that presents new characters in a more hectic, illogical and nonsensical way. They just seems to be a weird combination of characters borrowed from other sci-fi movies.5. Part 1, so it's suggested that there will be part 2? What a joke.--- Tiny Spoiler from the start of the movie ---
So the evil imperial soldiers that came on a space ships that can raze an entire planet land on a Viking age planet to steal their food. So this evil empire with their sophisticated futuristic tech is dealing with what? Food shortage? Seriously now? That's the story line you're going with?.

title: 5.6 is not an accurate or fair rating
text: Is this an Amazon - who we know owns IMDB now - attack on Netflix?Ask yourself if anyone that's rated this movie a 1 or 2 is someone you now and respect or even rated a different non Amazon movie here.I'm for good quality content.... No matter the creator and it's disappointing if this theory might be even a little bit true.As a long time IMDB user, I've trusted this service and written many reviews and given even more ratings over the years. I am not a teenager, but a 40 something adult with decades of movie going experiences and was alive when the original Star Wars movie came out.This is worth the watch in my humble opinion.

title: 1star because 0 is not possible
text: I have seen Watchmen a few times and loved it, because the adaptation of a comic into live action was wellmade. Snyder actually has that gift, but rarely puts is to real use.I saw 25 mins of this and had to leave it. Still in awe that someone has financed it. Nice scenery and beautiful people just cannot cut it.The complete absence of a decent storyline and the total overuse of slow-fast motion bears witness of laziness.I felt like I was watching a huge chunk of money being burned on a stake of fan made attempts that someone had tried to compile into one big thing. I just don't get it. The SW inspiration is clearly there, but why even try?

title: A generic sci-fi movie with shooty things and a lacking script
text:
A few tldr comments to make before I expand further:
"Visual effects with a small side of story"
"Sci-fi for the sake of profit"
"Generic lines lead to a lack of a cohesive character"
"Too much telling instead of showing"
"Too much story for 2 hours of screen time"
"Worldbuilding a toddler could achieve"Before I start the detailed review to save some of you some time, if you wish to turn off your brain and watch some flashy lights dance around the screen then this movie is for you, if you wish to watch something with engaging content then this movie isn't for you.Ok so starting this review I'd like to say that the visual effects are fairly good, between the group I watched this with and myself we could only note one scene where it felt the CGI was rushed and poorly done, and even in that scene the portion of rushed background effects only made up a few frames that easily could've been cut and had no real meaning in the movie. Cutting those frames would've had no effect on the movie so why post production chose to keep those frames in despite the lacking visuals? Who knows.Besides those few frames however the visuals and cinematography were stunning. Which is what leads to my first point. That this movie felt like a whole lot of visual effects with little storyline. Given that writers strikes didn't affect this film and that production was complete by the time the strikes started it's arguable that this movie stands as reasoning to not give in to writers demands as they seem to contribute very little.Elements of this movie felt disjointed like we were hopping from one franchise to another with very little inbetween leading to the thought that this movies was sci-fi for the sake of profit; get as many action figures and cool sci-fi things as you can slap them together without any consideration of whether they actually fit together and hey presto, you get this film.To add to this when a movie heavily relies on visual effects and disjointed sci-fi elements you'd at least expect the individual one-off lines to be unpredictable, fresh and embody the emotions they're meant to convey. Unfortunately the individual one-off lines that're part of this script don't even sound like something a living thing would say, the robot in this film that got 2 minutes of screentime conveyed more humanity than any of the leads as main characters were given generic lines expected of any modern action sci-fi movie.While speaking of the script I feel it's appropriate to point out that outside of these one-off generic "I'll get you next time" lines the script heavily leans to exposition as filler. Instead of showing us what had happened or what is going to happen the movie loved telling us, as if the audience had no brains, what was happening.For example instead of showing us a scene in which menacing and powerful character, cloaked in black, silently ignites a threatening red laser sword to then proceed in ruthlessly cut down rebelling forces in a small hallway, the director instead would chose to have a scene where the rebels sit around a fire and say things like "they has a big red laser sword", "they're very scary" and "they're the most dangerous person in the universe". If the movie was this review I'd follow that example with something like "this is just an example to show the level of exposition in the movie and neither scene is actually in the movie."
If you're now wondering why there is so much exposition in the film and the director doesn't show rather than tell, it's simple showing the audience what happens would take much longer. In the example above the hallway scene, where the director 'shows' us the menacing character in action, would take about 2 minutes, but the campfire scene, where the director 'tells' us about the menacing character, would take about 20 seconds, which leads into my next point that this movie simply has too much story for a 2 hour movie.During the span of this movie as pointed out earlier, it felt like we were hopping from one sci-fi movie to another, giving some characters lengthy well thought out introductions and other supposedly "main" characters about one minute of introduction that felt meaningless. If instead each "main" character was given a 1 hour movie to introduce them and the sector of the universe they come from, then the franchise could've lead up to something of more significance later, where deaths, betrayals, love stories and other conclusive actions would've meant more to the audience as we would've been able to relate to them and build actual emotional investments. However the movie was clearly cut short so that all of that potential emotional investment and character relation was scrunched up in a ball and flushed down the toilet.To end let's revisit the world building in this movie where we previously stated that this movie got in as many action figures and cool sci-fi things as possible and smashed them together. Well, it's just that; most of the world building feels borrowed like something that's been done before, you have mythical creatures, an generic evil army, a lost prince/princess who gives the promise of a better future, some compassionate robots and a small group of highly talented individuals that have some random reasons to fight against this big bad army. Boom big blockbuster movie goes pew-pew and bang!In conclusion this movie feels like the epilepsy inducing version of Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker, a weak script with some big action scenes and the audience goes "wow look at those big flashing lasers I've never seen before" or "wow some cool CGI animals I've never seen before". One thing the audience won't be saying is "wow that story was really compelling and interesting."If you got bored while reading this lengthy review, then trust me; the review is more interesting than this movie.

title: It's good, not great
text: Plenty of slow-mo action scenes, abit of space combat etc which is all good. The movie takes ideas and established lore from a multitude of other scifi settings. Alot of people are saying all the common ones(stars wars,dune etc) but the one that I can't see anyone saying so far is Warhammer 40k. Names, costumes designs, weaponry etc alot from the 40k setting.The movie has abit of a "Justice League" feel to it with the story revolving around the 2 characters from the faming planet going around and recruiting "heroes" on different planets to form a squad to fight against the motherworlds armies and just feels overdone, especially from synder.

title: Just teRebel
text: I don't write reviews often, but this was one of the worst sci-fi movies in history. Normally nice actors were turned into bad actors. The screenplay is awful, dialogue even worse. Every action scene was in slow-motion, which made it unwatchable. I felt absolutely no emotion or empathy for even one character. Story was not interesting at all. This was almost 2,5 hours that needs to be compensated because I will never get it back. I really hope Zach will do better in the sequel but I doubt it. Hire some people who can actually write a story and dialogue and please let action scenes just run at normal speed. Netflix should ask for a refund, a public apology and not release part 2 as punishment.

title: Boring Sci-Fi Soap Opera!
text: OK where do you start with this Sci-Fi bore fest?First of all has Charlie Hunnam ever made a good movie? Everyone this guy stars in are flops or just nothing to write home about. Any movie starring this actor should be warned of the Hunnam curse of your movie bombing from great heights. Is he a bad actor? Not really but he isn't good at picking films as most turn out to be turkeys.The critics were correct for once avout this pile of plop it is very boring in dialogue with terrible slow motion zoom in and out frames making it hard to watch at times.Overall I could write an whole essay about why this movie sucks but I can't be bothered.If you suffer with insomina watch this movie and it will soon send you into a coma.Part 2 will be like part 1 as it is a Zak Snyder movie so yeah go figure.2/10 for some of the CGI and nothing else in truth!

title: Worse than Battlefield Earth
text: The story is dreadful. I'm 100% convinced that Zack Snyder (Writer/Director) dumped various plot points from other movies (like Lord of the Rings and Star Wars) into an AI script writer and this was what was outputted. The story kind of drivels along without making much rational sense. There are several scenes where the characters are just standing around in the background watching the scene unfold, as if they didn't know what to do with them so they just had them stand there. I'm of a fan of Zack Snyder movies but this one is probably his worst. It's is worse than Battlefield Earth... at least with that one someone attempted to make a sensible plot. It saddens me that there will be a part two.

title: Rehashed nonsense, a waste of time
text: Nothing new or original here, it feels like chat GPT made film with cut scenes from early 2000s games used for the visuals. The whole thing looks muddy and there is no depth to the scenes featuring extensive CGI.Slow motion for the sake of it.It's safe to say that if you are a fan of Zack Snyder you will likely enjoy this but for anyone who likes a quality story with well fleshed out characters rather than a film built on tropes and a Mish mash of other better ideas forced together, you would probably be better spending your time reading a book or going for a walk.A half baked, rejected Star Wars idea is essentially all this is and it's clear Netflix are trying to get their own space set cinematic universe going with this film.Don't waste your time.

title: It's a complete mess, some striking visuals, other amateur CGI.
text: I am writing this sans spoilers, but I will provide the overall plot. In essence, this reminds me very much of Star Wars: A New Hope. Bad guys come and a sassy lady farmer decides to take on the whole empire but needs the help of a handful of others. So part 1 is basically a movie of traveling to pick up all the characters needed for part 2. The problem is that there is no character development. There are only back-stories and "why this person is important". There are some cool action scenes but there are a lot of times where you have to suspend reality and just go with it.The visuals are striking at times, other times they are dark and/or out of focus. Some of the CGI looks like it came from the SyFy channel.Most of it is just meh.As far as the actors, Sophia doesn't come across as believable in the lead role. I liked her in Kingsman but she didn't seem to have the range needed to be the main character. The other characters are a hodge podge that you'll know and 2 of them seen to be wasted in their roles. You'll see what I mean if you watch it.Don't waste your time. This movie wasted a good premise and could have been so much more. Mediocre acting, canned plot line almost carbon copied from A New Hope, and so-so visuals make it barely a 4/10.

title: Someone must have paid to put bad reviews
text: I honestly feel like a group of people with lots of money and time on their hands paid to hire many others to give poor reviews on this film. Half of the reviews depict things that never happened in the movie. For instance, "Samurai in space"? Huh? Only one member of the entourage wields a sword, and I thought it was an excellent scene, to be honest. Could it have been better? Of course. Hindsight is always 20/20. It was a good story that leaves just enough covered for the anticipation of part two. I watch many movies, and it's rare for me to be surprised, but I was shocked a few times throughout. The cast was terrific, setting you up for the beginning of a whole new universe. I cannot wait to see the next one. I'm guessing the haters are a bunch of Star Wars nuts, but I'm a Star Wars nut and really enjoyed this. I'm a big fan of Zack Snyder. The haters have no clue what they're talking about. I promise you. It's a shame, too. But I have a feeling you'll watch it and will enjoy it. If you like Zach Snyders's other films, there is no doubt you'll enjoy this one! Have fun!

title: It's not bad but I did expect a lot more
text: The film is ok. The start drags before anything half decent begins.The protagonist is very forgettable. I felt like she had no real chemistry to her character... No depth to make you root for her.The antagonist is also very forgettable. I don't even know his name and I just finished the film.The storyline is nothing to shout about. Quite plain which is disappointing as this is suppose to rival star wars.Visuals are amazing, CGI is well done and some cool designs however, SLOMO SCENES ARE NO LONGER COOL ZACH SNYDER! Every fight scene has the over use of slomo and it really just grates on me.Overall: meh.

title: Visually fine but the lack of scenario is appalling
text: Visually, the film does a nice job even if all of it has been seen before, sometimes with much better visual effects.Putting all the efforts in visual effects that are ok but not state of the art creates a small disappointment.Claiming an inheritance from great movies like the 7 samurai or Star Wars sets a high standard that is not met. It does not have the depth of either of them, and definitely not the scenario... which is a problem if you consider Rebel Moon is 60 minutes longer at least than the 7 samurai ! The character are most of the time so transparent that you could anticipate their moves and dialogues, except when they lack consistency : some outbursts come from nowhere and create a surprise but not in a good way unfortunately.A huge disappointment.

title: This just makes me sad...
text: Boring, uninspired, contrived piece of trash. What makes me most sad is the thought that Netflix probably canceled something I enjoy to fund this garbage.Is Snyder even capable of original thought? I knew going into this that it'd be bad, I mean, Snyder's track record isn't great. But this is on another level. Bad script, bad acting, boring pace. In typical Snyder fashion, he relied on visuals so much he forgot to give it substance.The movie bounces from recruit to recruit with little to no back story. It's as if he just expected viewers to care about who these people are but forgot to give us any reason to. But it's ok, because they look cool.

title: Boring
text: It's basically Zack Snyder attempting to write Star Wars without it being Star Wars.Instead it feels like a really long episode of Little House on the Prarie and someone is trying to steal their land, but with Irish accents.Dialogue is awful. Actors all look bored. Pace is painfully slow. Fight scene choreography is straight out of Adam West/Burt Ward batman taking on Penguin's henchmen. It's all in slo-mo, making it obvious that nobody is hitting anyone.I would say this was a poor effort all the way round, but doing so would imply that someone, anyone put forth any effort into making this worthwhile.

title: Epic!!!
text: True fantasy stories are not told in one film. After watching part one on Netflix tonight, I am so excited for the future of this series. In the first 20 minutes I was thinking to myself... This is so much better than any Star Wars story or movie I have watched. Especially in recent time. I think the directors cut will give time to character development and storytelling. This theatrical cut definitely felt a little rushed, but at the same time the heart was there. I feel like people lose sight of, and criticize Snyder for lack of story, and maybe even criticize his dialogue. But the story is told through the visuals and the musical score. Emotionality is conveyed. Everyone is allowed to their opinion. But I have always felt connected and been emotionally moved and inspired by Snyder's movies. Excited for where the story goes. It's crazy that something like this could be on Netflix given that even the movies with twice the budget like 100 million more dollars Are not up to this quality.

title: Thank Goodness This Wasn't A Star Wars Film
text: I certainly enjoyed 300 and Army of the Dead, but I wasn't much of a fan of any of Zack's DC movies. I find his work hit or miss. But I came into this with high expectations. I heard about his Seven Samurai meets Star Wars pitch to Disney, but that he had been turned away. With so much Star Wars garbage being cranked out right now, I felt like this was a R rated masterpiece waiting to happen.Boy was I wrong. Snyder has taken so many ideas from other films and directors and just mashed them into this nothing of a movie. It's boring, the fight scenes seemed horribly staged, the villains were cliche and I just couldn't care less about the village or its people.So I stopped watching about 30 minutes in. Now I don't have to watch the extended cut or the sequel. How does this guy keep getting hundreds of millions of dollars to keep turning out this kind of crap?

title: boring
text: If you want to watch a boring rip off version of star wars then i would highly recommend.This movie was really disappointing, I had really high hopes and thought it looked incredible when watching the trailer. But frankly it's just not interesting. The cgi is mid, the plot is plain and generic (you could find movies with a similar premise that are much better than this).The thing is they clearly know it's boring because they've tried to make it more interesting and fill in the gaps with multiple useless action sequences that are not needed. They also seem to like using slow-mo shots a lot which just takes away from the moment anyway when it is so overused.The long monologues are so hard to listen to because the actors voices are so flat and they don't sound engaged at all.This movie had great potential but ultimately just lacked everything that makes a movie exciting and interesting.

title: Unfortunately a bad copy of many movies
text: Snyder, known for his distinct visual flair, attempts to carve a niche in a genre dominated by titans like "Star Wars," "Dune," and "Avatar." However, despite these grand aspirations, the film struggles under the weight of its own ambitions.It's apparent that Snyder aspired to join the ranks of directors who have masterfully created their own space odysseys. Unfortunately, "Rebel Moon" comes across as a muddled homage rather than a distinct narrative. The film tries to blend elements reminiscent of "Star Wars," "Dune," "Mad Max," and "Avatar," but this fusion results in a confusing and disjointed storyline that lacks originality.Snyder's direction, usually a strong suit, feels erratic here. The film's pace is uneven, oscillating between rushed action sequences and sluggish expositions. The narrative tries to juggle multiple themes and references, but ends up losing its unique voice in the process.While "Rebel Moon" boasts impressive visual effects and cinematography - a hallmark of Snyder's style - these aspects cannot compensate for the story's shortcomings. The stunning visuals, though captivating, feel like a facade, masking the lack of depth in the plot and character development.The cast delivers commendable performances, but they are hindered by the script's limitations. The characters lack depth and their motivations are often unclear, which makes it difficult for the audience to form an emotional connection with them.In his quest to create a space epic that could stand shoulder-to-shoulder with the greats, Snyder's "Rebel Moon" unfortunately falls short. The film's overreliance on established tropes from other famous works results in a lack of originality and a confusing narrative. It's a visually striking journey, but one that ultimately feels hollow and unsatisfying. Zack Snyder's ambition is commendable, but "Rebel Moon" serves as a reminder that a successful homage requires a delicate balance between inspiration and innovation.

title: Feel like I just watched a 2 hour trailer for Part 2, and it didn't even get my hyped for it.
text: There's not a lot to like here really, the movie looks great, which isn't a surprise since that is Zack Snyders bread and butter, the plot twist at the end was interesting, would have been better if it was built up better, and that goes to the my biggest issue with this movie.All the characters are just cardboard cut outs, besides Kora and a bit of Gunnar, every character is just there. They go to their planet, get their introduction and after that they are just background characters. So if they had done more character work the plot twist would have actually hit, the death that was played with so much dramatic effect had NOTHING going for it, because the character was in the movie 5 minutes. There's a character introduced, in the first act, we never see him again, until the end and that's just a shot, something like, hey remember him? He exists.The action sequences aren't that interesting as well, and that goes to my second biggest issue with his movie, why so much slow motion? Like, I know Zack Snyder loves slow motion like Tarantino loves feet shots, but Jesus he uses slow mo like a 10 year old who just found out what it is. If he took away all the unnecessary slow mo, there is a solid 10 extra minutes he could have used to actually make a better story or flesh out some of these characters.Story is boring and gets repetitive after a while, there are so many good ideas in there as well, but they aren't developed properly, that's why this feels more like a rip off of Star Wars or Seven Samurai, instead of feeling like it was inspired by.There are so many plans for a Universe around this, movies, shows, comic books, even Video Games, and if they do go forward at least they can do those things knows it's quite hard to do worse than this introduction.

title: Don't jump on the bandwagon, it's a fun ride
text:
Still better than the last star wars trilogy and the stupid disney series (all of them)
Didn't expect much due to the negative critics, but enhoyed the movie a lot
Top dark atmosphere ( a big FU to disney company) good action sequences (well a little bot too much slomotion), good acting (ed skrein as villain is top)
I guess too much jumped on the bandwagon
Well the movie is no oscar contender but it makes a lot of fun, typical zack snyder
Give the movie a real chance, go see it and make your own view, i hoped the last star wars trilogy was like this movie
Overall 8/10 ...and hope the second part is still happening
Please don't jump on the bandwagon.

title: No no no
text: Tired story line, stolen ideas, scenes and set ideas. Far too predictable... and...to be honest...boring and that feeling of deja vu. Acting was mediocre, script poor and clichéd. GCI was good, very expansive but doesn't rescue the movie enough to make it wiry its very high production costs. Can't think of much going for it to be honest. Hunnams accept was appalling, most of the acting was mediocre. The repetitive use of slo mo....really makes this an annoying visual experience. I won't be watching it again or part 2 if and when it appears. I think you need to see this for yourself and form your own opinions.

title: Trailer good - Movie not
text:
..20 years ago I wrote my last review of a movie...Note even Matrix 4 made me do it.I had a feeling from the trailer - it looked like "Jupiter Ascending"
Promising - but maybe bad.And it is !If you are drunk, high, wasted, don't care, switch off your mind - it is watchable - The moment even the slightest consciousness is there, you stumble across one stupid flaw over another.I can be persuaded, lie to myself, fill in some gaps myself "Hey, its a movie" - and dive into it, regardless of flaws or some errors.But this is too many, too much, too blunt, too simple !I don't even know where to start and end - and if so, i would write an essay.Many scenes lack maybe just 20,30 seconds more, to make it more convincing - in one moment the prince is fighting with an animal, and basically within 2 seconds!!! Its resolved, done and just moves on. No feels, no growth - why even bother.So why even bother watching this film ?Well - if you can lie to yourself, there is something in it, which you can extrapolate, imagine, how it supposed to be felt, what the idea was - but the implementation is.... bad.Jupiter Ascending was better...and that one, back then, was "bad" - now it feels actually not soo bad anymore, after watching this.So be careful, if you rly think of watching this. There is so much other bad stuff to watch, which might be more fun - even a documentary about butterflies i should have watched instead...

title: Waste of Talent
text: I had such high hopes for this, but having watched it I feel sorry for the leading cast members, Sofia Boutella in particular, for being associated with this dismal mess.The plot is a mish-mash rip-off of so many genre movies that have gone before - The Seven Samuraii (1954), The Magnificent Seven (1960), even "Battle Beyond the Stars (1980) - that what we're left with here feels regurgitated and stale.In terms of visuals and style, far too much of the time was spent in dark and dismal shots - it's evident that Snyder thinks this makes films "brooding" or "moody" or can add tension: here it just comes across as dreary and lacklustre.Cinematography is poor - in particular the fight scenes, which have no snap or action and it feels like the camera doesn't know where to be to capture what is going on. There's even one section of slow-mo included in a fight on a space station... for ... absolutely no good reason whatsoever... In particular the cinematography lets down other production values - the interior of Kai's ship, for instance, looks and sounds authentic - but even the craftsmanship applied there can't save the rest.Credit where due to the cast - Boutella makes the very best of turgid lines; Ed Skrein is up to his Zapan-era, scenery-munching best ... but even his energy can't bring this turkey back to life.Somehow I doubt people sitting through two hours of this will care enough to watch the second half.Do yourself a favour - if you haven't seen it, avoid it. Go watch "Free Guy" and feel good...

title: Jesus, Mary and Joseph
text: If I was a cartoon my eyeballs would be popping out or brain exploding. This movie is soooo bad. Dialogues and monologues totally boring as if they were whipped up last minute or created as they filmed. Some sentences straight from other films. Accents all over the place. I wasn't sure if Kai was Australian or Irish. Why any of them spoke in different earthy accent, they are alien after all. Also ale in the Viking village, what's that about? Many scenes just predictable or nonsensical, like shooting all over the place, but not hitting anyone. Oh, and that jumping with a spear, how many times we've seen that before? The bad guy dressed in the nazy uniform. Could you be more boring and unoriginal? It's so bare minimum, like, let's just check the boxes what makes a movie. Totally lazy approach.

title: A good introduction to a new universe
text: Part one, while nothing too new in terms of story, is a good introduction to characters and a new universe setting the stage far many more stories to come. If this were a Standalone movie and not a part one of two or more, then I would feel a little different.The graphics are great, the characters are likable, the story line is a bit predictable but there are a few surprises that make you interested in the future stories and how these characters continue to interact with each other.Overall, I'm excited for the next part to continue the story and see what more this universe has to come. Which is why I'm rating it a bit high, because the stage is set for an epic tale.

title: The Seven Samurai in space
text: A perfectly watchable remake of the Sever Samurai story, outrageously overextended in the Snyder way. By no means this is simply influenced as there are way too many similarities to the original. Just adding spaceships and lazers does not make Kurosawa's movie a Snyder original as I have seen it being described. The second part from what I see on the trailer will be even more close to the original, as the training and war preparation scenes are almost similar to the 1954 movie. Again, this is not a bad movie, but it is reasonable why Star Wars said NO, as this is by no means an original script. If I write Romeo and Juliet in space, would that make it my original story? Nope mr Snyder it would not.

title: I hardly ever write reviews but...
text: ... If you've not watched Rebel Moon on Netflix yet, please save yourself the bother. I could give a long explanation as to the many reasons why, but TL;DR - it's a lazy, derivative, boring rehash of every fantasy/sci-fi and western trope ever. The only potentially original character is the Anthony Hopkins-voiced robot, which is woefully underused - appearing only in 10% of the film. Bizarre overuse of slow mo served to make even some of the action sequences boring and formulaic and they are the best bits of a bad bunch. Art direction was shocking, showing how used we have got to really good sci-fi art direction (District 9, The Creator, Dune, the majority of Star Wars output) - this just felt a confused mess of styles, albeit borrowing heavily from Starship Yamamoto, Warhammer 40K, Bladerunner, Dune and even Starfield (recognise the bridge of Charlie Hunnan's ship?). Such a shame as there is definitely a place for an original, new space opera - but this isn't it.

title: Keep pushing.
text: Fair to say I'm not loving this new era of Zack Snyder's at the moment (producing content for a streaming service) & as both an audience / collective fan base, feel as though we're sadly seeing him go from one problematic extreme (a total lack of creative control; artistic power callously stripped from him - with brazen opportunism by Warner Bros at the time - in the wake of a family tragedy) to the other (no discernible over-sight during the production process whatsoever - resulting in the opposite).Therefore, although not terrible (Part 1 - which this definitely seems like - genuinely isn't. Nevertheless, neither is the movie particularly good either)... I'm frustrated by such a demonstrably outstanding filmmaker settling for the continuous construction of uninspired & tedious mediocrity when I know him to be capable of far, far better.I mean yeah, on the one hand, "Rebel Moon" is a vast improvement on "Army of The Dead" (though that's not saying much; the bar is in hell after his previous unmitigated disaster that failed to even meet the usual standard set, merely in terms of aesthetic quality), yet that's the only viable endorsement I can reasonably give because once again, it doesn't feel like he's actually challenging himself here.Zack Snyder's basically provided us with his alternative take on "Star Wars" & that's exactly what this product is, in the simplest of terms... Zack Snyder's "Star Wars" - another copy + paste sci-fi franchise (you could recognise from countless other blockbusters / TV series), unoriginally put to the screen (with no attempt to hide the plagiarism) but with his signature visual style pasted over it - in an unconvincing attempt to assemble some form of uniqueness.In fact, it's disheartening to witness a talented individual reduce their gift to what comes across as a cheap gimmick; lensing other genres through a bespoke, superficial Instagram filter that can be tailored mindlessly to fit each project, refusing to convey anything meaningful via the transference between stories.Even the release of his latest feature feels akin to a desperate, fake imitation of "Justice League" (artificially endeavouring to capture that same demand / interest - borne from entirely different circumstances); rather than distributing his original cut (I can't understand why they'd withhold it intentionally now - Netflix is known to fritter away money so the notion they'd prefer a safer investment by first airing a more palatable version is utter nonsense), they're keeping it from us in the hopes of deliberately orchestrating another viral movement on social media, demanding his extended iteration... It's all so corporate & staged.Is this his brand now?

title: All the bad reviews are just trolls a trollin'
text: Is Rebel Moon the most original story, no. But neither was Avatar, Pocahontas much? And that movie made billions. All the acting is spot on. The VFX was great in most scenes but could have been better in others. The Spider Lady fight was great and Nemesis's blades had great effect even though it is a bit like a lightsaber. The pacing was great at keeping the story moving without spending a bunch of wasted time on trying to win awards with crying monologues or whatever. The detail that every place and prop was dazzling. The Candled Bartender blew my mind and then it keep going.All in all Rebel Moon a great sci-fi film that doesn't fall into the nostalgia trap of Star Wars where every world is a dessert to save money. This could just be the new sci-fi franchise to pick up the dropped ball that is the last three Star Wars movies.

title: Should Have Been a Series
