text: Rebel Moon certainly has potential. The film isn't terrible, but it's not especially noteworthy either. It's the kind of movie where, upon watching Part Two in spring 2024, I'll likely find myself struggling to recall what happened in the first one and thinking, "Who are they again?". There's nothing particularly memorable story-wise, nor are there moments that keep me on the edge of my seat.That said, considering the ambitious scope Zack Snyder is attempting - building a brand new world filled with numerous characters - a two-hour movie just isn't enough to fully engage my interest in anything, including the main plot. I'm aware that Part 2 might offer some improvement, but ideally, I should have been captivated within the first 15 minutes of this film, which unfortunately wasn't the case.Yes, the plot is your typical "mighty empire seeking domination versus a band of mismatched rebels" scenario. It's a trope that's been done many times, but that in itself didn't bother me. I was hoping Zack Snyder would bring a fresh perspective to this type of story, but unfortunately, he did not. This story could have been exponentially better as a series, spanning multiple 6-8 episode seasons, allowing for deeper world and character building.In other words: "make me care".There should be a rule: if a story features more than four to five main characters, each from vastly different backgrounds, it should ideally be developed into a series (or at least a 3-hour movie). Apart from the main protagonist, well-played by Sofia Boutella (who brings a sort of John Wick vibe), I found it hard to care about the other characters. I don't even remember their names, nor do I understand why they joined the cause. It's not that they aren't interesting; it's that the film didn't allow enough time to get to know them and empathize with them. The same goes for the main villain, who is evil just for the sake of it. I also didn't have time to immerse myself in the universe they inhabit.On the plus side, the action scenes are well-executed, except for the overuse of slow-motion (still a thing in 2023?). The special effects are definitely the highlight of this movie.So, can Part 2 redeem Rebel Moon? It's a steep hill to climb.

title: This must've been written by a storm trooper it really missed its mark
text: Well I watched all the first part one of Rebel moon, I'm on the fence and conflicted on what to say about it other then it was interesting and definitely wouldn't compare it to my seven year old self seeing Star Wars for the first time and how my world growing was Star Wars at nine I would not have been allowed into the theatre to see Rebel moon plus or would have scared me for life. This was Star Wars meets Star Trek meets game of thrones the level of violence alone.... I'll watch part two but this ... there is alot in this to farther think about. But never close to the imagination and magical of my seven year self going to see Star Wars not even close. Dad and my mom if they hadn't taken me to see Star Wars , Star Trek and superman growing up my childhood would not have been so damn good . No sure what Zack Snyder was aiming for at here but to compare to my childhood history it misses the mark like a storm troopers aim.

title: Poor
text: Started in a good base then takes off to another story then jump to another. The line of the movie is every where you cant put your hand on the plot. After 20 minutes of watching you are going to lose the interest to follow the whole movie. Although the movie is full of a great actors and its look money where spent on the actors and the graphics which was not so bad . But the main thing is the story and the conversation which was very bad and its a loss that these magnificent actors produced this very poor movie that you don't want to see the end of it even worse they are going to produce a sequel which makes me cry now.

title: Very interested in what I was watching unfold
text: 'Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire' is an enjoyable ride!I will say that I wasn't ever totally engrossed into the story, though at every moment I was still very interested in what I was watching unfold - and for a movie that has a run time of around 134 minutes, that's a big plus. I particularly liked the world building, as well as the special effects.Sofia Boutella is a great choice to lead the ensemble, her performance is one that I thoroughly enjoyed throughout. Ed Skrein is solid in a, shock horror, antagonistic role (does that geezer ever play a good guy?), I've found him quite meh in other movies but here he is very much a positive. None of the others onscreen stand out on their onesies, though as an collective they are a fairly strong cast.I genuinely had a good time with this, can't ask for more than that. I'm fairly lukewarm on Zack Snyder movies, this is the seventh of his work that I've watched and 'Man of Steel' and this are the only ones that I'd actually class as exceptional. Unlike many others, it appears, I look forward to checking out the sequel.

title: What...?
text: Is this a parody of all the biggest movie franchise in the last 20 years plus Star Wars?! You can't tell me that Buckbeak's cousin and that those weren't Uruk Hai. There were too many moments where I asked "oh my god, who are you guys?" And got zero answer. Rebel Moon left me feel frustrated but also understanding why it wasn't optioned as a Star Wars story. I feel like maybe I need to watch it again and pay better attention but I don't want to be let down a second time. I know everyone uses everybody else's stuff these days but an hour into the movie and I couldn't help but notice how much of this story was copy/paste from other major franchises.

title: PG 13 ruined it
text: This movie was ment to be R rated, not PG 13!From the first action fighting scene i was so mad because the scene was clearly edited to be PG13! Kora(Sofia Boutella) use an axe, a knife and guns to fighting soldiers and not one single drop of blood! That's look so UNREALISTIC! Unrealistic is the fact that one slim girl could fight big men even it is a S. F. movie, but..really! Snyder, really? After the masterpiece: Watchmen, after that amazing movie: 300, after the best Superman movie: Man of Steel, after BvS(a very good movie), after even the "Army of the Dead" you came with this mediocrity? I will not watch part two of this! Sorry!IF THERE is a director's cut, i hope it's R rated! But this is not the single problem this movie have: the acting is mediocre, everything seems rushed. Maybe the worst movie from Snyder (me being a fan of his movies)!I'm kinda mad! I was expected much more! But unfortunately..the movie is bellow decent!

title: Cliché
text: This movie is the definition of mediocre; it's riddled with clichés, and the plot is honestly complete garbage. It's boring, predictable, and poorly structured. The pacing is utterly terrible, and the direction doesn't allow any character to truly shine.The only redeeming qualities are the special effects and the soundtrack, which, overall, are quite good. However, this is a credit to the money invested in production rather than Snyder's creativity, which has shown very poor directing skills in this film.It would be unfair to say it's a bad movie considering the production work behind it, but when it comes to the script and direction, even myself could have done a better job. I hope the storyline improves in the sequel, but nothing suggests it will, and the first part hasn't left me with much excitement to follow the story.

title: Should have been a series
text: Snyder really let this one get out of hand with a calamity of too many ideas that ended up really messing with the pacing and story-telling of this film. With the large cast of characters constantly being introduced to us with no real time to flesh them out, there's really no investment in any of them, and it feels like if this was a series they could have gotten a full season out of just putting together the protagonist's crew.This movie has the bizarre paradox of being visually pleasing, while also having some of the laziest and most poorly choreographed action sequences I've ever seen, and how these scenes made it past the cutting room floor makes me think that Snyder didn't actually look at them and just assumed they would be great. Somehow, the slow-motion fight sequences are even more sloppy than the real time ones, and make it look like everything was shot in one take. This, combined with multiple scenes in which bad guys could have just shot the main characters in the face point blank and inexplicably didn't, ruined the action that was supposed to be at the core of the movie.Effects were awesome, costumes were great, but it wasn't enough to save this. A season 1 of Rebel Moon chronicling the life of the protagonist as she climbed through the ranks of the ranks of the military from war orphan to war hero would have been conceptually and visually better than the 2 minute flashback that we got muddled in the many tangled parallel subplots.

title: The Mother World Is Here!
text: Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child Of Fire is the start of the Rebel Moon Trilogy. It follows the moon of Veldt and a small farming village upon it as a Motherworld warship stops to buy grain from the villagers. What follows is defiance by the villagers and the threat of them all being wiped out. The movies story follows Kora an ex-imperium soldier and once bodyguard to the Crown Princess Issa a child gifted with power and expected to usher in a new era for the Motherworld.The story follows the adventures of Kora as she tries to recruit other warriors to defend the village from the motherworld warship and it's sadistic Admiral Atticus Noble. Overall an enjoyable enough story but a bit slow, though hints at a deeper mystery surrounding the Motherworld and the assassination of it's royal family and ascension of regent Balasarius are dropped through out. Look forward to more and to seeing how the story and world continues to develop in future installments.The cast is pretty awesome with wonderful performances from everyone including Sofia Boutella as Kora, Ed Skrein as Atticus Noble, Charlie Hunnam as Kai, Djimon Hounsou as General Titus, Stuart Martin and Anthony Hopjins to name but a few.The VFX and SFX however is the biggest draw of the movie with absolutely insane visuals and a enthralling soundtrack.Overall a solid and well deserved 8/10 from me. Not everyone may agree, but I see potential to the Rebel Moon film series and I'm definitely interested in seeing and learning more about the history of the Motherworld and what happened to the royal family that allowed Balisarius to ascend to regent of the Motherworld. The movie has a decent enough storyline that once again I'm interested in learning more about, a star studded cast and brilliant VFX and SFX.

title: Same thing from Zack Snyder
text: In typical Zack Snyder fashion he focuses on special effects and action sequences, failing to adequately develop the characters. He purposely chose Sofia Boutella as his lead since she is suited for action sequences but lacks the skills as an actor to make her character believable. Snyder also decided to employ the same tried and true images, including slow motion and stop action in fight scenes, that have been used rather than being creative. I assume that most people would rather see action scenes with extended fighting, car chases (which thankfully didn't appear in this fantasy, Sci-Fi tale) or scenes with light sabers that belong in the Star Wars World as well as unbelievable and impossible physical stunts. And, as usual, there is a Nazi-like evil character that even dressed the part and his supporting characters that were reminiscent of other films. In true Star Wars fashion there are intergalactic characters and a scene that reminded me of the Star Wars' cantina scene. Snider made the effort to establish the background story of Kora's (Boutella) fighting ability but that also wasn't adequately developed. The film actually showed promise for the first half hour with the invaded planet where Kora resided. There is a surprise ending in Part 1, however, but even that was somewhat disappointing. As a purely action film it is very satisfying but otherwise it is lacking with overwhelming cliches.

title: Way to much slow mo.
text: This looks like a TV series pilot that didn't get picked up. So they took the 45min episode and stretched the hell of the fights so it could be promoted as a 2hour movie.The dialogue comes off as it was scripted from chatgpt, good actors playing badly acting, the graphics come and go, one scene looks like you're out space then next scene looks like it was studio set.This could have been a good start to a new franchise as star wars is killing themselfs. So I was looking forward to a new sci fi but this failed so badly I couldn't continue to watch more than half of the movie.........oh have I mention the ddddd aaaaaa mmmmmmm sslllloooowwwwww mmmmottttiiiiooooonnn.

title: "Deja Vu: The Space Odyssey"
text: There's even a lightsaber duel thrown in for good measure, just to make sure no franchise is left unscathed.There's really no reason anyone could say this is a horrible movie. The problem is there is ZERO originality. On almost every scene I could tell you which movie that scene was recycled from. When the evil overlord "bad people" show up, somehow I kept thinking they would look milky white skinned and dressed like members of the SS????? WHAT!!! How was I exactly right????? This "sci-fi homage" ransacks the genre's treasure chest, leaving viewers with a sense of déjà vu more profound than a Keanu Reeves time-travel marathon.The plot? A ragtag crew of space misfits embarks on a mission to save Earth from the evil nazis...wait, wasn't that "Guardians of the Galaxy"?SO?? Should you watch "Deja Vu"? If you're a sci-fi enthusiast with a encyclopedic knowledge of the genre and a penchant for meta-humor, then maybe. It's a guilty pleasure, a cinematic mixtape of your favorite (and not-so-favorite) sci-fi moments. But for anyone expecting genuine innovation or a fresh take on the genre, steer clear. This spaceship is headed straight for the been-there, done-that nebula.Final verdict: 4 out of 10 hyperdrives. More of a "deja meh" than a "deja vu."

title: An absolute masterpiece of a sci-fi film
text: This film is breathtaking and is full of so many many amazing visual moments that really show off Snyder as a director! He really chose a fantastic cast and they give amazing performances and his world building is off the charts! He does a great job developing an interesting and fun wold that truly shows how skilled he is and the entire film like I said was a blast this is what sci-fi needed! I absolutely do believe that people should really see this movie it is absolutely worth the time and I'm so excited for the R-rated cut of this movie because it's something he is great at and I think that will be even better than this movie was. I'm so excited to see where this universe goes and how the second film is.

title: "The very idea of love, of... family was beaten out of me"
text: I've read that 'Rebel Moon' was intended to be a more adult-oriented alternative to 'Star Wars,' but there are a couple of problems with that. First, there's nothing to establish this as a "mature" movie beyond the presence of more violence, bad language and the suggestion of sexual assault. 'Rebel Moon' might be harder-edged than 'Star Wars,' but it's not a nuanced depiction of state and rebellion. The baddies are all despicable villains with no subtleties and the heroes are all well-meaning, aw-shucks underdogs who just want to live in peace. There's no questionable morality or blurring of the lines between heroes and villains; this is a very simplistic good vs evil universe. 'Rebel Moon' might have a high body count and some genuine nastiness in it, but there's never any question of who is doing the right thing. That's not mature writing, that's just adding blood to a children's story.Secondly, we've already had an adult-orientated alternative to 'Star Wars,' and it was set in the actual 'Star Wars' universe. The 'Andor' TV series was a masterpiece; a multi-layered, intelligently written sci-fi series that rightfully, won critical plaudits and fan praise. It is an absolute must-see and one of the best depictions of fascism ever committed to film. In its wake, 'Rebel Moon' seems one-dimensional and old-fashioned. 'Andor' was "Star Wars for adults," but 'Rebel Moon' is "Star Wars for edgy teens."Which is a bit of a shame because there are a few things to admire here. Visually, it's stunning. This is a universe of beautiful landscapes, vast spacecraft, creepy human/spider hybrids and all manner of eye-popping delights. 'Rebel Moon' doesn't engage the brain, but it does stimulate the optic nerve and it looks terrific. Plus, let's not ignore the fact it's an original intellectual property and that has to be celebrated. We're drowning in franchises right now, so to see a new one trying to poke through is worth championing. However, it also feels artificial. A lot of franchises spun out of movies that were written as one-offs, but found a huge audience and grew organically. This was written for the sake of being an extended multi-media project of films, novels, videogames and comics before it even earned a single fan.In other words, not great. 'Rebel Moon' isn't boring, but it also isn't exciting or engaging to make a fuss over. It's just sort of, there. The fact it doesn't really have an ending is irritating as well. The entire two-hour runtime consists of them gathering up all the characters for the big adventure they'll have in the next film. It wouldn't surprise me at all if Zach Snyder typed "science fiction, I'm assembling a team, two hours," into an AI script generator and then filmed the results.

title: If You Like Guardians of The Galaxy........
text: Then you won't like this. I think they're trying to copy its success but the only problem with this is that the characters in this film are no where near as lovable as the characters in Guardians. We care about groot and raccoon and star lord. The characters in Rebel Moon are depthless and their origins are quickly glossed over costing us getting actual feelings towards them. They each say how amazing this one is or that one but they lack amazement completely. I was looking forward to this movie ever since I saw the trailer and I'm sorry to say I am disappointed. I may or may not watch the Sequel. That's how much I cared for this film.

title: Zack Snyder should never do a movie again.
text: The only reason, people don't shut off until the end is that they fall asleep after 10 min. I neither connect with the heroes nor with the villains. The pictures are kitschy as metal posters from a china store, the characters hollow as a Potemkin village, the dialoges stupid. I got mentally sick listening to the main hero who always tells me 1:1 what she feels and did and thinks. The heroes self introduction before the movie ends, is so bad, it will go into history. Show, don't tell, dude! This movie does not leave any space for own thoughts. If only this was trash. But it is so bad, it's not even that. Please, give Snyder some money for the promise, he won't do any any any movie again.

title: Not innit to winnit
text: It took all of five minutes to decide I'd finish watching this for Sofia Boutella. Not for the dialog spoken; Not for the acting. Not for the plot nor the script, and certainly not for the many sequences where so many actors feel as if they're actively auditioning for the roles they've been cast in- As if they're holding the script in hand and reading it aloud for the first time. If I'd been told beforehand that for the next two and a half hours, Rebel Moon was a rehearsal for the film, I'd have understood and actually believed it.When part two is released, I'll watch it though... but only for more Sofia Boutella.That's it.

title: Brilliant Sci-fi action
text: I cannot fathom why this is being rated so badly. I found it really refreshing to have a Star War esque, movie with a few adult themes rarely seen in main stream science fiction.Characters were all likeable and I can't wait to see where they take this next. As far as a "setting the scene" movie goes, it was brilliant! Visually epic, action packed, acting was good, storyline, although embryonic was intriguing.I feel like this has been rated badly just because people have a bee in their bonnets with Zack Synder.I think my only complaint would be that the ending of the movie kinda sneaked up out of nowhere. But, it still ended satisfactorily.All in all, a whole heap better than most of the recent Star Wars movies. I really hope the negative reception on here doesn't jeopardise future movies.

title: It should've been WOW, but...
text: The first half an hour is a hardly captivating drama. And, unfortunately, I can't say at that point film kicks off properly. Plot is simple, way too simple!Adventures? Sorry guys, not this time. And that's a shame, because potential for it is pretty much limitless. Instead of interesting twist and difficulties the team goes through to recruit new members, we must see some holiday relevant space village life and listen to "not exactly Tarantino level" dialogues.Amazing action? Well... there is some, but nothing to write home about.The only bright side is the cast. Actors have been chosen properly and they perform well.Overall, linear, sometimes boring, story with some action and nice scenery. Needless to say, I was expecting much more than that.

title: I expected better
text: Unbelievably derivative coupled with no imagination.While it has scale, it lacks scope, very little is developed, just ideas thrown at a wall to see what sticks, then that is ignored for something new and sparkly on another wall. And that goes on for over two hours.I was unsure as to what I was watching, was it a rip off of Star Wars or Games of Thrones? Harry Potter or Star Trek? Every scene has been done in another movie, dialogue is repetitive, even the scenes that add nothing to the story.Acting is uneven, dialogue is strained, delivered in a portentous whisper or a weird abstract accent, just because...The story lacks structure. It's a convoluted Seven Samurai / Magnificent Seven mish-mash where the originality stems from there being six, not seven protagonists.Standard tropes are held out such as Asian woman being good at martial arts and having swords, black guy with dreadlocks, bad guys with blue skin and acne, boss bad guy dresses like a nazi. The usual stuff.Anyway, not holding my breath for the next instalment and I think the 'Snyder Brand' has suffered a heavy hit. I can see why Disney turned it down.

title: Entertaining
text: Typical Snyder movie, visually excellent but paper thin plot. There are some borderline racial stereotypes which add nothing to the plot, aswell as some pointless scenes which don't progress the story. The dialogue seems like its been written by a child, really basic stuff and occasionally makes zero sense.You can clearly see that it was written for Star Wars, it shared many characteristics, but can also see why it was rejected as a Star Wars story. That said, it was entertaining, will certainly watch part 2, but probably not part 1 again. Not sure why Hunman had an Irish accent, pointless...

title: Dared to be good
text:
I see many people saying it's not Star Wars.. correct, it's Rebel Moon, people leaving bad reviews because they expected Star Wars.. this was different but In a daring way
Without trying to ruin the film - the bad guys are bad neegan style / the good guys are good Rick grimes style.. you are comparing with Star Wars but really viewers need to watch with open minds. This world Snyder is offering has the potential to give many many future projects. I'm so glad Netflix got hold of it and not Disney . Is was good to see actual action scenes. 10/10 for breaking the norm.The story is a tiny bit disjoined however I presume that's because part 2 is so close.

title: Insultingly Bad
text: Netflix is a dark, depressing place with very little I can enjoying watching with my teenage son. So, I was excited to see something PG-13. We immediately rolled our eyes when we saw the Viking / English / Scottish village of medieval days being invaded by space traveling Nazis. It somehow managed to go even further downhill from there. I created an IMBD account just to leave my first review ever after reading that this was born entirely out of Snyder's imagination. This movie is poorly reimagined bits and pieces of various Star Wars movies, The Last Kingdom, Harry Potter and who knows what else. Felt like this was a desperate attempt to take what they thought were great scenes from many movies and mash them together to try and force into a new one... I can almost guaranteed a dragon will pop up if we watched the whole thing. We created a game of guessing what movie scenes they were mimicking next, got halfway through and just had to quit.

title: The Long and Short of it...
text: I know what I will say here is not new or inventive; it will simply be a statement, and if you agree or disagree is entirely up to you. I won't give away any spoilers. Watch it for yourself.... if you have disposable income and nothing better to do.A movie NEEDS more than just visuals. A CGI masterpiece with no story, is just meaningless eye-candy. A truly good movie will have, first and foremost, a good story. It will have at least one deep character (more than one would be nice) with a background that you feel obligated to study and understand. You need relatable characters and their decisions, even the ones you don't like, make sense to you and leave you thinking, "I could see myself pushed to that point."If all you have is a half-baked story and some decent CGI, your movie might do well in theaters, but it will still be a forgettable pile of trash. Hollywood is paved with such tripe.I know this is not a revelation for the majority of us. Its been endemic of the collapse of Hollywood for decades. This particular piece of cinema just happens to be an exceptional example of that very collapse.

title: It's a Stunning Sci-Fi Epic
text:
This movie was a visual feast,
with stunning cinematography and amazing effects. It did a great job of introducing the world and the story, but it could have done more to develop the characters and their motivations. It had some exciting action scenes and a cool atmosphere, but it also felt like it missed some chances to make me care more about the people in it. I enjoyed watching it, but I hope the next one will go deeper into the characters and their relationships. It's a space adventure, and I'm hooked.I'm Giving 8 Just because it lacks some core story parts. I'm sure there will be more to story in next phase. Now the world is set up, way to go.

title: Exposition dump in space.
text: Wow. I thought Army would have the Dead was garbage and Snyder couldn't get any worse. However it wasn't supposed to be a challenge. Basically this film is a team up. The worst kind of team up you could imagine. Zero character building followed by zero character interaction. The plot, that exists, is derivative, mind numbingly dull and most of it makes very little sense. The slow motion gets boring really fast. Then the ultra slow motion kicks in and you want to break the screen.I thought Disney were scrapping the barrel for plot and characters. Snyder said "hold my beer".Some people have said this looks good. Maybe in places but it all looks bland.The fight scenes are familiar to The Last Jedi. Slow, cumbersome and unconvincing.It's not worth your time. Don't make the same mistake as me.

title: If I would be the moon, I'd rebel too
text: "Rebel Moon" is a film that, while visually striking in parts, struggles to deliver a compelling narrative. It's a movie you can watch selectively, enjoying the war sequences where the CGI and art direction shine. Yet, when it comes to the story, there's a lot left to be desired.Firstly, it's hard to ignore what feels like another instance of Hollywood's recent trend: portraying female characters as unequivocally stronger, smarter, and more capable than their male counterparts. This approach, while intended to be empowering, often comes across as overdone and unrealistic, especially when female characters outmatch men who are physically much larger. It's perplexing to see this kind of narrative repeatedly green-lit, as it seems to feed into a stereotype rather than offer a nuanced portrayal of strength and capability.The male characters, in contrast, are often portrayed as traitorous or too weak to fight, which seems like a missed opportunity to explore more diverse and complex character dynamics. This one-dimensional portrayal contributes to a feeling of disconnect from the story.As for the plot itself, it treads familiar ground but fails to captivate. Although the film starts promisingly, it soon loses itself in an over-reliance on visual effects and hurried character development. The introductions of the protagonists feel forced rather than organic, detracting from the overall storytelling.Comparing "Rebel Moon" to the storytelling mastery of the original "Star Wars" series highlights a significant decline in narrative artistry. One can't help but wonder how the story might have unfolded had it been crafted in the 1970s by someone like George Lucas, without the pervasive influence of modern trends.In summary, "Rebel Moon" is a film that may appeal to Gen-Z indoctrination love.

title: I wanted to like this movie
text: I was genuinely excited for this one, but fundamentally I just didn't care about the characters and had a hard time following the story. While I felt the first 1/3 of the movie teed everything up well, you are then launched across the galaxy, and introduced to far too many characters to care about in any meaningful way.The effects are great, the battles are gory and well choreographed. But in the end, everyone could have died and I probably would have felt about the same at the end.And then there is the "dues ex machina" problem. The obstacles people faced were just magically overcome. I spent the late 5 minutes of the climax in disbelief because it just can't be that magical and was sure I just didn't understand.

title: Blah wars
text:
This just feels like zack Snyders attempt (and a poor one at that) to start an intergalactic sci-fi franchise but it fails on all attempts.The script feels like it was written by a bunch of 15 year olds who watched Star Wars or dune for the first time, no edits were made and they got the worlds biggest budget to produce the first script.There were some actors I was keen to see hit the big screens again like Charlie hunnam +Michael Huisman and Ed Skrein (oddly played the same character in GOT) but the script really failed to see their full potential. There was literally not a single line in the movie where I thought "that's clever" or "great writing"Charlie honestly needs a better agent or to make better decisions about the movies he chosen. Im a big fan however he's slowly becoming the new Gerard butler. Stick to Guy Ritchie and Kurt suffer movies bro and for the love of god, stop trying to do a new accent in everything you do.Sofia boutella just looked mad/angry the whole movie. I question where she was ready for something like this?Concluding:
Terrible plot
The worst character development
Specific effect amazing in some parts of the room but others felt woeful.I wanted to give it a chance as I thought these reviews were a little odd. After they leave the first planet, it all goes down hill and I had myself asking... really? Oh man, this is going to suck.Overall, the audience deserves better.

title: I want to see more!!
text: I am no film critic, and I am not trying to be.I very much enjoyed this film. I think the lead, Sofia Boutella, was incredible. She commanded every scene she was in, she was powerful and believable, and from her background her morals were sound. Bae Doona was amazing, as always. And the rest of the cast were great.The soundtrack was atmospheric, although not entirely memorable. The cinematography was breathtaking and gave a real sense of the perspective and majesty. The practical effects, although overshadowed by the abundance of CGI, were really impressive. The world's they built felt lived in and life-like, as if the viewers were just visiting along with the characters. The special effects in most scenes were incredible, and really gave a sense of the scale and of this immense universe and story.However, the story and character development seemed very rushed and a lot of the way the story and characters progressed was quite predictable.But, I very much enjoyed the film. It was enthralling and engaging, and I wanted to see more. I was sad to see it finish. The I just wanted to continue watching and am very much excited for the next installment. I really hope Netflix will finish this story and we can see the huge finale. I am very hopeful for this franchise.

title: Promising picture with disappointing story
text:
When I started watching the movie I thought to myself "This is beautiful" but as soon as I heard people talking I knew it's not gonna be easy to watch.In general, the camera operator work is great if we don't count massive number of slow mo that ruin every action scene. The graphics, costumes, atmosphere is truly perfect.But....
Acting is mid at best, sometimes I felt like Im watching some kindergarten show.Dialogues are truly awful.The whole story consists of scenes that have influence on nothing connected in the most lazy way possible. Three quarters of the movie can be deleted and it would change pretty much nothing.I sincerely hope screenwriters didn't get paid.The idea in my opinion was great but it got ruined by truly awful implementation. It's probably one of the worst movies of 2023.

title: A sci-fi spark in need of more fuel
text: Rebel Moon: Part One arrives amidst a flurry of hype, promising a Zack Snyder-directed space opera with "Seven Samurai in space." While it delivers on the space and the samurai-esque warrior women, the "Seven Samurai" part feels more like a whisper than a roar.Strengths:Visually stunning: Snyder's signature slow-motion action sequences are undeniably impressive, with vibrant neon landscapes and brutal zero-gravity combat.A strong female lead: Sofia Boutella is charismatic and fierce as Kora, the reluctant warrior tasked with defending a beleaguered colony.Intriguing world-building: The film creates a distinct dystopian universe with hints of political and environmental themes waiting to be explored.Weaknesses:Thin plot: The story feels derivative, borrowing heavily from classic samurai and sci-fi tropes without adding much originality.Underdeveloped characters: Aside from Kora, most characters are thinly sketched, leaving less emotional investment in their fates.Pacing issues: The film drags at times, particularly in the exposition-heavy first act.Overall:Rebel Moon: Part One is a visually dazzling sci-fi adventure with a promising premise, but it lacks the depth and narrative punch to truly set it apart. It's a decent popcorn flick with flashes of brilliance, but viewers expecting a groundbreaking space epic might be left wanting more.Recommendations:If you're a fan of Snyder's visuals and enjoy classic samurai and sci-fi stories, you'll likely find something to enjoy.For those seeking a more complex and emotionally resonant sci-fi experience, look elsewhere.Final verdict: A visually stunning popcorn flick with potential, but ultimately a middling chapter in a saga waiting to be truly ignited.I hope this review strikes a balance between being informative and adhering to the safety guidelines you outlined. Remember, this is just one perspective, and others may have different opinions.

title: stick to directing
text: Zack snyder need to set his ego aside and let the writers do their job. He is an incredible director. He know how to set the mood in a single frame. I didnt mind his overuse of slowmotion that definitely add drama and 'cool factor'.. But that script is uninspiring at best. It encapsulate all the cliché trope you can think of and then drag it for a solid hour for a gathering party fiesta. Go to this planet, recruit that character type, go to this planet, recruit him also... rinse and repeat until the undeserving final act. It manage to get boring, really fast despite a stereotypical but strong start. The dialogs are dumb, the story is dumb and Zack need to stick to direction if he want to be taken seriously. This was a joke, not even waiting for the second part, i dont care.. Characters are unidimensional and a parody of the stereotype the are suppose to embody. The visuals are great,.world building is good, and the fews action scene there is, are great. Hire some good writers and stop reusing the 50 years old trope we already know.

title: In the end, THIS was fresh to see, and still is!
text: Have to admit it this way. I actually loved this film! I know some negative reviews are trying to be harshly against the film because it was "Inspired" by Seven Samurai and most other types of films, but honestly, which other films haven't been that way before? This however is definitely not a "Rip-off" of Star Wars at all, it is a completely different story compared to Star Wars. It appears such expectations were too high with not enough open minds to take it all in differently. At least I went into this film just open minded, lowering my expectations, without "Nit Picking" on parts of it like I used to. Because I enjoyed this for what it is and that's that. It's only a story to setup more happening in part 2, which made total sense. "Rebel Moon Part 2: The Scargiver" needs to hurry up though, because it will truly explain a lot more and go deeper. This is part 1 after all. It's a Two-Parter type of film, and patience is the key to slow-paced films like this. Hopefully more installments take place after.

title: I was so excited about this movie and wanted to like it so much.
text: "I was really looking forward to 'Rebel Moon' and wanted to like it, but unfortunately, it turned out to be a huge letdown. The dialogue was so stiff, it felt like it could have been written by a language model. The green screen was painfully obvious and distracting.The film was plagued with excessive info-dumps that felt forced and disconnected from the ongoing conversation, and the constant slow-motion scenes, even for something as simple as walking, were just bizarre.The Irish accents were 'top-notch'. Some of the cast members couldn't even keep their accents consistent, but at that point, it hardly mattered.I'm not even going to delve into the blatant rip-offs from Star Wars, Warhammer 40K, and the random griffon thrown in there.If you've literally got nothing else to watch, sure, give 'Rebel Moon' a shot. But don't expect much, despite it being a Zack Snyder film. I certainly was expecting a lot more, and it just didn't deliver.

title: It is even worse than 3 stars
text: I gave it three stars solely because of the manual laborers who put effort into making the movie happen, but, in my opinion, it is a one-star film. It is by far the worst movie I have seen in years and probably the worst SF movie I have ever watched. It feels like a blatant copy of numerous other films, almost like an open imitation. At times, I even wondered if it was intended to be a parody, but unfortunately, it lacked humor. Instead, it comes across as genuinely disheartening. The movie falls short on various levels, including acting, scenography, and plot. The worse fact is that part two is coming in April.

title: Netflix! Get a refund from Zach Snyder
text: If you asked AI to make a movie combining Star Wars,Lord of the Rings and almost every blockbuster since the 80s it would come up with something better than this. So bad. Cliche after cliche. So much LOL. Terrible acting. Terrible writing. Cheap looking. Bad accents. The nazi uniforms and haircuts. Where does one even begin? How does Zach Snyder keep getting money to flush down the drain.? Everyone involved here should be deeply embarrassed. Not often I've seen anything this bad. Save yourself 2 hours and watch paint dry. Or save your money and cancel your Netflix subscription if this is the best they can come up with at this point.

title: Star Wars meets Sucker Punch
text: I didn't watch this for the plot, since even the slim synopsis made me understand that this was a remake of Seven Samurai set in space.I hoped that Snyder could manage to inject something new into the old plot, but it was just eye candy and slow-motion fight scenes; it's really Sucker Punch all over again, with short cool sequences held together by the thinnest of threads.The actors actually try their best to roll with the punches thrown at them by the script; sometimes they fail, sometimes they succeed, but nothing they do can actually save this wreck.A note about the bad guys: in recent movies the scripts evolved from "evil emprire" or "evil Sauron" to something more complex and layered (there are movies where we actually root for the bad guy because he has the moral high ground); this movie is a huge step back towards a "main characters good, adversaries bad" simplicity.

title: Not that good, yet not so bad
text: Hey ya there,The 10 stars was totally not deservet, yet also seeing all those 1/2 stars review whom were also not deserved. Yea the plot is not as great as it could've been. But it's a good start for part one. One thing i loved was the CGI which was really good compared with other production studios. Also the movie quality (regarding filming) was also of great quality, really enjoyed some of those cinematic shots.All in all i felt like it was a strong 6.5 * with the posibility of growing even more with the release of future parts!I understand all the hate, for those who were really hyped for it, but the movie doesn't deserve it...at least not at that level!Happy holidays ya'll! 🔥

title: this is the least original "original" idea ever.
text:
Parts-seven samurai/ magnificent seven
84 dune
every star wars ever madedash of-blade runner and big trouble in little china
new duneswith a twist of-uggg really? Modern politics maybe idk? Were the imperium uniforms based on cold war era russian uniforms?C'mon zack snyder...man. The simple peasant need help plot...jesus this has too much plot getting in the way of the story.Even the action scenes are tired- slide, shoot, slow motion and repeat. Unnecessarily over dramatic as well. This film is a waste of time and money and theres another one...nooooo.I was excited for this film but 5 minutes in i was dissapointed.

title: A waste of time
text: I struggled to find enjoyment in this movie, despite entering the theater with no expectations or exposure to previews. While I tried to keep an open mind, I couldn't shake the feeling of disappointment. The characters felt shallow and uninspired, and the storyline lacked originality, leaning heavily on familiar themes reminiscent of Star Wars, albeit executed in a less compelling manner by Zack Snyder.I'm skeptical about Netflix's hopes for this film's success, as I couldn't muster much enthusiasm for the idea of additional installments. The prospect of a sequel doesn't excite me, considering the lackluster experience I had with the first part. While some may appreciate the visuals and setting, they failed to captivate me or elevate the overall viewing experience.It's disheartening to witness the polarization surrounding this film, with many blindly praising it while others hesitate to voice their true opinions for fear of ridicule. However, even with an open mind, I struggled to find redeeming qualities beyond surface-level entertainment. Fans of Star Wars may find some familiarity, but I doubt it will satisfy their cravings for a truly engaging cinematic experience.

title: Lackluster Letdown: New Film Misses the Mark
text: This was a dull, plodding film. The visuals and plot were dreadful. The movie lacked any cohesive style, with a plot at the level of a preschooler. It was as if the film was made while hungover.The action scenes lacked excitement and energy, with uninspired slow motion sequences. The characters were dull vagabonds, traveling through boring, greyish-yellow planets. The script was simplistic, with dialogues that felt forced and unnatural. The plot lacked substance or intrigue. The acting matched the tone - listless and joyless expressions. Overall, this film failed to deliver compelling action, interesting characters, intelligent writing, or convincing performances. The visual style was monotonous. While the creators likely had high hopes, the execution fell short with no moments of spectacle, wit, or emotional impact. With more care and effort, the action genre can yield impressive results, but this film does not realize that potential.With each new movie, Zack gets worse, having lost his talent like the Wachowski sisters.

title: Not unwatchable... but neither is it good
text: I SHOULD have loved this movie, I am an avid Sci-Fi fan and love watching properties from Starwars, Star Trek, Star Gate, Dune, Serenity, etc. And their spin-offs. This movie clearly wants to be those... but it is just a disjointed mess.The movie was billed as "an adult Starwars," instead, it feels more like fan fiction. We didn't turn it off, it was just (barely) entertaining enough to keep watching. And, I will likely watch the second movie. But, this was just one long missed opportunity.

title: Eye candy with no soul
text: Netflix had been teasing me for a while, the trailer made it seem like a good hard sci-fi flick, so I had high expectations... And, they're not met. It's just eye candy with no soul.Poor dialogue, poor acting, scenario lacks believability and has very little original ideas (how many cowboy movies have the same plots...). And all these issues feed into each other: characters feel superficial and not relatable because of the poor dialogue and lack of facial expressions, and in turn it makes the weaknesses of the plot even more apparent.Despite the nice enough visuals, I won't watch part two.

title: Good that he did not do the Star Wars episode :)
text: This is ridiculous. So odd dialogues, so bad writing, so many Star Wars element ( but so badly made), and sooooo boring. Everything is predictable, and it is like from other movies ( dirty dozen- when they gathering the solders, end even the wwII type nazi costumes)... only positive part is the fighting scenes with reasonably good choreography.I don't wait for the part 2 at all, although I am a big sf fan watching every sf movies coming to the theaters or streaming.Something seriously went wrong with this movie: it is lacking soul, it is like an empty rag doll without the stuffing, trying to walk but all the time loosing the balance...

title: Disappointed
text: I was eagerly anticipating the opportunity to watch Rebel Moon Part One: A Child Of Fire, directed by Zack Snyder. Given Snyder's track record with films like the 300 series, Man of Steel, and the director's cut versions of Batman vs Superman: Dawn of Justice and Justice League, I was intrigued by his take on the classic franchise of Star Wars, hoping for a dark and visually stunning experience.However, my excitement turned into disappointment as the movie failed to deliver on multiple fronts. The weak narrative made it difficult to connect emotionally with any of the characters, as the pacing was too fast, turning the plot into a series of disjointed scenes. The film seemed to lack substance, featuring a group of characters with forgettable names banding together for reasons that didn't warrant attention.Rebel Moon felt like a continuous stream of aliens, generic sci-fi elements, and action sequences that induced headaches. The slow-motion technique, which is a trademark of Snyder's style, was overused to the point of diminishing the impact of every action scene. While some may praise the cinematography with its visually appealing shots, the motion blur during action sequences left much to be desired.Despite the anticipation of a Star Wars rival, Rebel Moon fell short, featuring few moments with aliens that were not visually impressive. The potential salvation of an extended cut was mentioned, but the idea seemed more like a cash-grab opportunity than a meaningful enhancement to the narrative. Given that Rebel Moon was released on an OTT platform, there was no need to wait for an extended cut; releasing the complete version from the start could have potentially improved the overall coherence of the storyline.

title: A dull remake of Seven Samauri
text: Unlike Rogue One, the script did not have the originality to find a sensible alternative plot.The Japanese original had a bunch of bandits as foes - plausible. Rogue One had sections of a well-organised Resistance. This has a scattering of unlikely individuals, who for some reason get involved in an entirely local matter.I also found a lot of it silly - ploughing using a horse-like animal, in a society with advances spacecraft.And there was a grimy look to a lot of it. Only by making the villains irrationally bad could one feel for the heroic characters, and they were not that heroic.It was not a waste of time. And I fancy I can guess what part two will be about. But I'd not expect it to have much impact.

title: Rebel moon - Fantastic Epic Sci-Fi
text:
What's with all the negative reviews???I'm tired of all the whinging, complaining, sad individuals who have nothing better to do than bang on about how unoriginal, how boring, how bad the acting or the dialogue was, how long, how short, how they didn't like the ending, or the beginning, or whatever .. blah, blah, blah....
This current generation of online complainers more than likely spent most of their time on their phones typing up their complaints instead of actually watching the film, and obviously have the attention span of a fish.IF they HAD actually watched this first part of this proposed trilogy, they would have enjoyed a fantastic start to an epic space adventure.The overall 'feel' of the movie was overwhelming - gorgeous cinematography, fantastic characters and creatures, gigantic space battleships and brilliant GGI.Sure, the dialogue was definitely not Shakespeare, but it was as good as any other movie in this genre. The acting itself was more than adequate and as for the plotline, although simplistic, it held together quite nicely without falling into plotholes or sillyness.Reviewers, get over yourselves, stop being so nit-pickey!And why complain about Sofia Boutella being able to fight off the bad guys in the movie just because she's female - her character is a super trained warrior and she can totally kick ass!Guys... get over it!In fact, the whole cast was very good. No complaints. Quite honestly, it was a treat to watch and left me wanting more... now!I love sci fi movies and this is one of the good ones. If you liked Star Wars you will like this.Sure there are similarities to Star Wars and a few other films (Seven Samurai for instance).But, name one movie that doesn't borrow from or pay homage to other movies?I mean, really - who cares!And if you do - WHY?Why, when the result is this good.No complaints either with Zack Snyders direction - it was spot on.Oh, and the ending was perfect, setting us up for part two.Stop looking for the bad - pay attention and see the good.You will be rewarded.

title: Rebel Moon - It Could Have Been So Much More
text: First of all, there were some flashes of wonderful in "Rebel Moon". The set designs were superior. The plot line was certainly laid out for us ... easy to follow and very easy to root for the good guys and for the bad guys to be vanquished. The movie certainly had its share of good actors who knew how to carry the load. Those are the positives. The negatives were overpowering. The film lacked subtlety, nuance and was heavy-handed to the nth degree. I felt as if I was watching a B-Movie from 1965. Or maybe it was more akin to a sub-standard video game from 2000 that was geared toward adolescent boys. There was over use of slo-mo and overemphasis upon machismo without character development. Sometimes it seemed as if I was watching a bad Western. The musical score was the absolute worst. There was no score when needed and then it overshot its intended effect by utilizing short bursts of soaring vocals and kettle drums which (I assume) was supposed to transport us in a similar manner as we were by the score in "Gladiator". The next thing I knew, I was watching Ninjas fighting sexualized, anthropomorphic spider-monsters using demonic light sabers. What-the-actual-heck was that ? ! ? ! There is no director's cut that can save this mess. I wanted to like this film. I REALLY wanted to like it. Calling it a hot mess is being kind.

title: One of the movies ever made...
text: This is a disaster from start to the very end.I truly feel sorry for people who had hope that this is going to be good. For me personally? I see "Zack Snyder Movie", I already know this is going to be train wreck... and this one is in slow motion.Because somewhere half of the movie is a slow motion, in the places where there shouldn't be any slow motion.Acting, Direction, CGI, Dialogues, Story, Universe - Everything is terrible.Characters act like total morons, going out in the open and yelling that they are searching for rebles - despite few seconds before that saying they shouldn't talk too loud cause they can get noticed...Crew members, just join our 2 protagonists because they join. We know nothing about anyone.To be fair, we get to know one line of history from their past when there is big exposition dump by the main baddie in the last 10 minutes of the movie.CGI is horrid, it's so blurry and cheap, some shots look like they were pulled straight from 90s video game cutscenes.Dialogues in this movie are written probably by AI, because normal people don't talk like this.And every time characters talk with each other in the movie they have to speak SLOWLY and take huge pauses between sentences, because ZACK SNYDER thinks the viewers are (REDACTED).I had to watch this atrocity with breaks. Because I couldn't sit through it. Glad it wasn't a theater movie because I'd probably leave.

title: Why are these films being made!!
text: What an incoherent mess... the entire story is just nonsense. The motivations of the characters is just ridiculous. The acting is pathetic. The agents are worse. What is going on how did this get above a 1 star there is nothing redeeming at all. They have pushed yet another female character beating up blokes twice the size of them. It's eye rolling.The usual slow motion that was great for the likes of 300, over used for very boring fight scenes... I mean the scene with the spider and the badly copied light sabers was just laughable along with the usual end speeches after a kill or a task complete again just why.I had to turn it off at the colseum part I just though what a waste of everyone's time.

title: Absolutely awful
text: This is yet another in a long line of new movies puked-out by Hollywood for mass consumption that is artistically devoid and entirely soulless. To describe it as long and boring is an understatement. It's like reading every word of a 2000-page novel about something very dull, and which is written in a foreign language one doesn't speak.The director is perhaps the most overhyped director in the history of directing. This movie is just amateurish. I found myself fast-forwarding through the long boring bits before realising that the entire thing is just one long boring bit. Hollywood has been taken over by people that don't know how to make movies worth watching. They only get away with it because the NPC audiences are sufficiently large. Those of us with more than one brain cell to rub together might as well just forget about the concept of the photoplay. There's just nothing worth watching anymore, especially if this soporific bilge is anything to go by. It's depressingly bad. Compare this garbage to the Star Trek movies, or Star Wars. Just behold the difference in the writing, directing, and editing quality. This is a joke in comparison. It's nothing but empty acting, empty script, and empty story. What the hell has happened to Hollywood?

title: A visual feast.
text: Kind of like blade runner, Star Wars, and especially "battle beyond the stars" , which if you remember resembles this movie very closely about a weak populace fighting an overwhelming planet conquering force. This is a fine fun sci fi adventure of a similar story featuring a rag tag farmer warrior assembling a most unusual army to fight an over bearing evil empire taking everything in its path. This movie stands on its own and need not be compared to anything else, with exception to battle beyond the stars. It's quite fun and lots of action and visuals that are quite stunning. I'm always amazed that so many bad reviews are people who expect the first Star Wars or something they've already seen. This is just a different story of a different kind, enjoy it for what it is. Loved the main character in her movie "the mummy" and she's very good here as well. No questionable content, nudity or foul language, some blood and gore and some violent fight scenes, cgi is excellent and beautiful. So are all the cool various species of aliens. I'm sure you'll enjoy this movie as much as I did. I will see it again a few more times. Can't wait for the next parts. Enjoy!

title: Zack Snyder at his worst
text: Imagine a basic, well written epic space tale. And then imagine Zack slicing out any and every of the parts adding dept and flavour to the story. This is what the first volume of Rebel Moon is: a childlike tale, in which the introduction of a new character is stripped of each and all flavour and depth.I can't recall regretting a producer and director butchering a decent story base just as much as I regret this horrible piece of cinema.(And the most awful part is that persons who didn't mind Valerian, will love this piece of excrement.)But helas, you might even like this thing and they might even make part 2, because you and I just weren't hard enough and didn't turn of the stream after the first ten minutes like we should have done.

title: Didn't worth the hype...
text: The movie "the seven samurai" has duration 90 minutes more than this one and for a reason... to proper introduce/present the characters, build relations, etc, so this movie feels too rushed because there was wasn't enough time to do that. Maybe in an extended cut this will be fixed but for now it's not good at all.The writing of this movie is also bad, there is no chemistry between the characters, they created a robot with psychological issues and the bad guys are just bad without a purpose... The directing of the movie is ok but the classic Snyder's slow motion scenes are boring.I like Butella but her acting wasn't persuasive and I don't think that she is a good fit for the role of the main protagonist.I know that's a TV movie but the CGI is average at best and many times looked like it was from an early 00's video game.To sum up, even though the director was inspired by the movie "the seven samurai" and he wanted to make "star wars" type movie, the result was similar to the "battle beyond the stars" (1980) ...

title: Another Snyder film trying to do too much
text: Snyder makes great visual films, but this is just another film where he is trying to fit too much in and doesn't give the right things enough attention. It has so much potential I hope the sequels are better. We are introduced to multiple characters and given the bare minimum backstory to them, yet we are meant to feel emotionally attached to their journey? One character in particular who is recruited.. we never see him in any action? All visual and lacking substance, such a shame. The pacing of this movie is off, I think it needed more quality storytelling over the quantity of heroes it was trying to introduce.

title: Who greenlit this dumpster fire?
text: I spent the first 10 minutes of this movie hoping that this was intentionally camp. But no, this was a very self serious movie. It was shortly after when I decided everyone involved with conceptualizing and producing this movie should never be allowed to make another movie.And who in god's green earth invested the money to make this? This is just a complete mess. The dialogue sounds like a 15 year old boy wrote it. The plot makes no sense and is a rip off of many other concepts.Save yourself the pain and avoid watching this unless you enjoy watching train wrecks.Sophia Boutella is a cool actor but, wow, she should have skipped this one.

title: Don't listen to the hate
text: I'd just like to start by saying i read an article online before this even came out that the first 20 something reviews on rotten tomato gave it a 9%. Ridiculous, clearly they were being paid by disney to give such poor reviews because at this point they don't like spending the amount of money this took to make which is the only reason I assume they passed on it. It's a great movie. Going by what the reviews had said i thought it would be a star wars clone but it was different enough in my opinion and had more action then the last few SW installments combined. Give it a chance I hope you like it.

title: Basically a bugs life in space
text: Cliche storyline, ridiculously overpowered good guys and unbelievable (not in a good way) action scenes. Yawn. I think it's trying to be a mix between a marvel movie and Star wars. Feels like the creators are trying to get a piece of the pie when the ship has already sailed. Basically uses the bugs life storyline. Don't bother watching it if you're bored of this genre its not going to change your mind. A lot of good actors are in it though... Which is surprising. I hope this doesn't get any sequels it's not worth it. I have to fill this revie with forty six more characters so I'm just going to keep typing.

title: Predictable and boring. Script terrible.
text: Schematic, predictable, boring, shallow. The characters say lines that seem to have been written by a computer program. There is no tension, no drama, no stakes in this film. We know what's about to happen. The characters are devoid of personality and bland. During the screening, we don't care about their fate at all, maybe because there are too many of them, or maybe it's because of the absurd and bland script, or maybe both. This film is another example of American cinema slowly dying. Maybe that's a good thing, fortunately, there are other interesting and truly absorbing productions outside of America.

title: An Action movie with no skill...
text: Like so many others, this really did look like it was going to be a special edition in the world of Action movies, such great talent hired, a huge budget and the director who has pedigree...what went wrong?I honestly believe out of everything it was the fight scenes, why can no one fight well? No one can shoot well? Even the most skilled took multiple hits & the only one that landed an impressive shot was the robot.When you put this next to the script? It can be wrapped up in minutes as it's a generic premise that's been done hundreds of times.The effects were the best thing about the movie, clearly see where most of the money got spent but effects don't save a poor movie.

title: What happened to Jack Snyder?
text: The movie is undeniably terrible. Terrible plot and no character development. Every decision and every dialog in the movie seems so random and detached. You just cannot connect to the movie. Heroes are weak and their assembling story is even weaker. The villain side is also a complete mess.A couple of years ago, Jack Snyder's name had a weight in the industry. I do not think I will ever watch another Jack Snyder movie again. This was the final blow.Do not watch it unless you are searching for how lots of money, a stacked cast, and poor action cannot save a movie. Netflix, please spend the money on a charity instead of making a sequel to this.Seriously Jack, stop with this slow-mo already..

title: Great! and here's why...
text: It is obviously a Star Wars reconstruction. In today's world of countless "remakes" and "live adaptations" I would much rather see someone try to recreate a great movie/series with some new ideas than simply recreate what already exists with better technology. Leave the greats alone and continue creating something new, albeit similar.If you want to be taken on an epic sci-fi adventure, this is the best we've had in quite a while. The story is actually too condensed for my liking, have quick through away lines in place of what could be a 5-10 minute scene or flashback to explain something rather than plugging a hole. All in all, I really enjoyed it for being something new-ish.

title: I want my 2h back...
text: I get that Snyder likes slow motion scenes, but why so many? The movie would be like half an hour short easily without those pointless slow motion scenes (the cape scene LOL).What to say about the acting? What was that? Several soulless characters trying to hard to express... Human emotions and concise dialogues.The movie had Now I understand why this was never approved as a Star Wars spin-off. This is just bad. I'm mad about this movie trying to be so grandiose... With a mediocre plot twist.Now we have to wait and see if the next one will be as bad... Or worse. I cannot believe that I got so excited to watch this...

title: Unoriginal, rushed and boring
text: Zach Snyder, the epitome of style over substance. His DC films are dull and miserable affairs with the occasional cool spectacle. With Rebel Moon: Part 1 the not complete edition, he hopes to deliver his version of Star Wars. And he did just that, without anything that made Star Wars good.All the characters are forgettable, none of them are memorable. The villains are comically evil and lack any of the charisma or intimidation required from good villains. Any new character is introduced and then shoved aside. No one gets any form of development or character arc and are all derivative of better characters. The acting is not much better, everyone appears bored. It's a shame because the likes of Charlie Hunnam and Ed Skrein can deliver fun performances, but Zach Snyder doesn't allow fun.The plot is just cliche after cliche, all of it derivative of better movies. This entire film is poorly paced with what feels like so little happening in 2 hours and yet at the same time it feels rushed. I'm sure the Snyder Cut will rectify these issues but it's just stupid that Zach can't deliver the movie he promised in the first time. What makes it worse is Snyder's massive over-indulgence in slow motion. Dear god, every scene has it and it's so pointless. It makes the movie drag and any potentially interesting action sequence is ruined by it. This film lacks any moment of halfway decent spectacle and the CGI ranges from good to laughable. The only positive I can mention is the soundtrack has its moments.Overall, just watch Star Wars. I doubt part 2 will change my opinion of Rebel Moon and I know well enough that Snyder's director's cut will not improve this film massively. A film so bad that it's not even memorable. A bad film can be fun, but this is far worse.

title: This goes well with an engineering documentary failed megaprojects
text: I had just got done with a documentary series on failed billion-dollar megaprojects like buildings and bridges that investors had poured billions into when I decided to rent. Rebel Moon.The only difference between, say, an abandoned skyscraper in the desert and Rebel Moon is you'll remember the abandoned building and compared to the acting the buildings are less wooden.In both the abandoned skyscraper and Rebel Moon, investors are out a lot of money, you've seen most of it all before, there'll only be a small handful of people vehemently defending the project, and most people will wonder why anyone in their right mind made it in the first place.To be fair to abandoned skyscrapers though, they hold up better than Rebel Moon's plot and are far most interesting.

title: Don't overthink it!
text: Having read the comments here, my partner and I still decided to give this movie a chance, and we haven't regretted it. I didn't have extremely high expectations, unlike when we saw Avatar 2. I just wanted to have a good time, and what a great 2 hours of my life it's been. I'm a huge fantasy fan, and this is what you get. Pure escapist bliss, where you can just sit back, and enjoy a good movie. Definitely recommended, but don't expect it to be anything ground-breaking. I don't think that every movie has to be extremely meaningful, and come up with entirely original stuff. There's nothing new under the sun, and I think people need to let go of this idea that they'll get a "Lord of the Rings"-level fantasy film 2-3 times a year. So overall, manage your expectations and just enjoy the ride, that's my tip for you. It's pointless to keep looking for thibgs that could be better, you're just ruining the experience.

title: When looks are everething!
text: Ten minutes from the end as I write this. I might finish, but who knows....The positive: It is gorgeous to look at, truly a marvel of cgi-sunsets and semi-believable worlds. The amount of weird planets with breatheable atmosphere is amazing. High five to the writer here.And what a story, a classic done so many times before, just not.... with these actors, and with this much CGI.And the unbeliavable acting from these profiled actors, made easy by a really progressive script, using most if not all motivational memes from the last 20 years as dialog. A masterstroke of genius.Cons: Nothing much.

title: Why does this keep happening?
text: We as a society keep letting this incompetent moron make films, and he keeps punishing us. He took some of the best hero characters in history and gave us the absolute garbage that he turned the DCU into. He ruined the entire history of Greece with basically an 8 year olds wet dream of what it meant to be brave, and we let him. He ruined zombie movies and you morons still gave him money. Now he is running both Star Wars and Kurosawa through the wood chipper, and people are still watching it.You all know he is going to ruin Norse mythology and King Arthur next?Just stop letting this hack make films. Just. Stop. They suck. They all suck. He is like if the least talented parts of of all the worst directors and writers in history all had a baby, and it then got brain damage.Just stop watching his trash.Apparently we are not smart enough to stop him.

title: It's a good movie
text: Honestly I don't understand what people wanted or expected from this. This movie/franchise is not a rip off like people seem to be assuming/saying. Yes, takes a bunch of ideas from sci-fi and fantasy movies, but it is still original. That's like saying when artist sample beats their song(s) cannot be an original. Totally ridiculous notion I'm seeing. The first 30 minutes of the movie I found myself in aw because of the special effects and emotions it (the characters) would bring out of me. I think people are being very unfair to criticize this movie to the level it seems to be getting criticized. I hope everyone will give the entire movie at least one good watch without prejudging. It has the tones to become a great franchise and I personally cannot wait to see what Zach and the whole cast/crew have in store for part 2 and future projects. Please give this movie a shot! I want more!

title: Idk how I feel about this
text: This movie felt overwhelming. No blood. Nazis in space. Really? The villain is a joke. He really tried to make a Star Wars movie of his own. But he shows that he can't. This is pathetic. I'm not even interested in watching Part 2 XD. I expected this movie to be good because I watched the trailer from it and thought that it's going to be good. I was wrong and this whole movie was so bad. I don't like it. All I know that this movie was better than Wonder Woman 1984. If you want to watch this, watch it. I only liked that one woman with that cool swords making it look like lightsabers and that's all.

title: Z-List Warhammer 40K ripoff
text: Rebel Moon desperately tries to be Warhammer 40K's Imperium but without any depth, meaning, or care applied. It's void, soulless, and crass, and it's embarrassing that Netflix and Zack Snyder felt they could waste people's time like this. They steal everything from WH40K and then manage to degrade it beyond belief. From the main character just being a wanna-be Guardsman from Warhammer's Imperium of Man with her clothes, attitude and standard barer. Plus, Titus is the name of the Space Marine from WH40K Space Marine Video Game. And their "Fallen King" is just WH's Emperor. An absolute shambles.

title: What a waste of time. Predictable, badly written and WAY too much slow-mo
text: We could only get to 1:08 and had to stop. The worst thing we've seen in a while. Predictable and terrible writing. The ridiculous over use of slow-mo. And I love how a farmer (Luke?), a badass woman (Leia?) & a crazy guy with a spaceship (Han Solo?) walk into a bar full of crazy aliens and get into another slow-mo fight. Then a random hot guy with amazing abs rides a Harry Potter griffon.Why treat your audiences as such idiots? Make it interesting and challenge us to think and be curious about where the story is going.Stupidest and most boring steaming pile of poop ever. Don't waste your time with this one!!

title: Have you no shame?
text: Zack Snyder's films are gems, from a photographic point of view. So is this one. Some spectacular cinematography, there you have the one point.The story is incoherent and totally uncompelling. The main hero collecting her 'magnificent seven' to fight an evil empire, through seven non connected stories. All the while the other heroes stand by and watch with deep meaningful looks in their eyes.... it is so bad it made me laugh.I truly like Sofia Boutella, her mere presence is compelling, usually. Not in this one. Her dialogues were way below average, and her character one dimensional. Her talent wasted on this ridiculously bad film.As others have already noted: it is up to the rim filled with plagiarism. Have you no shame?

title: Fabulous
text: I have no understanding of why people seem to harshly critique almost anything that is new ( despite being based on a similar story ). The effects are great and different , the aliens are darker and more menacing than the child friendly Star Wars ' the story is compelling and I see a lot more acting ability than the genetic rubbish Disney has brought out in the name of Star Wars / sci fi etcYes there are similarities of course a cruel dictator ship and ruthless soldiers and poor farmers lol but that has been used many times...but this was done well. Love itAre we watching the same thing ?? Well done and can't wait for part 2 !

title: Painful
text: C'mon Zack... this could have been so much better. What an insult to Sofia, the other actors, as well as your viewers. Cliches galore, terrible dialogue, the bad guy look like (you guessed it) a nazi. The story is basically star wars. I can only ask one thing... why? Maybe you could just be a 2nd unit fight scene Director, because really that seems to be all you bring to the table in your past few attempts. I wish I could write a better review. The only reason I watched it through was to show the Actors the respect of watching their work. As you can see from the reviews... people want something that at least feels a tiny bit real.

title: Copy by idiots that didn't understand the originals
text: Copies the plot of Seven Samurai, the Magnificent Seven and the Three Amigos, but in a Star Wars universe. It completely misses all the points though. No character, absolutely nobody acts like a human being or with an independent will of their own. There is no thinking no planning. All actions are instead determined by the need to hit TV tropes but without understanding the background or use of said TV tropes. Things just happens because they are meant to happen not because they make sense.It is an amazingly stupid movie. It could perhaps have been a great comedy if it didn't take itself so serious. Get really drunk and make a drinking game out of it if you want to get enjoyment out of this movie.

title: Such little depth....no heart.
text: There is very little to like but there where some positives. Solid world building, beautiful visuals among them. Although way too much slo mo. The Empire & it's hierarchy was very interesting but we didn't see much of it which was a shame. Instead we got the main character going around catching characters like pokemon. Each character gets a short showy little intro when they are introduced & that's about it. We don't hear much from any of those characters again except action scenes with them. Very little else in terms of story depth. It's all shiny surface level stuff. Hard to get invested in the story or care for the characters with such a shallow weak story.

title: Pay no attention to bitter critics
text: This movie is visually amazing, the sound is outstanding (must watch it in surround), in a good Zach Snyder fashion all the character development doesn't happen right away, be patient it is not the 90s anymore. There are some predictive scenes just like any other movie of course, however it is NOT bad to the point of trashing the whole saga. Critics are used to get freebies and cash from the studio to write stellar reviews and when they don't get anything they trash the studio completely. Watch it! It's worth your time and appreciation. It fun and entertaining good enough for a Netflix movie. You'll be glad that Disney/Starwars did not get their hands on it, they would have ruined it beyond belief.

title: It's like when you see a Xbox/PS game on the outside the pic looks like it's gonna be an epic adventure turns out the game is trash!!
text: This movie is sooooo boring I started watching it and I kept thinking to myself get interesting fast, cus I kept pulling out my phone the movie was becoming background noise, needless to say I got through maybe 30 or 45 minutes and I clocked out, at certain point I just looked at the reviews and saw I wasn't the only one who thought this movie was tasteless. The movie looked cheap for some reason and the story telling from what I saw was disjointed and predictable, some of the acting was stale and "very try hard", I didn't care for none of the characters, and the cgi was subpar, Zach Snyder is a good director, but storytelling isn't his forte.

title: Feels incomplete
text: The entire movie felt like hopscotch, like I was jumping around plot points. Not only did a lot of things seem to have little relation to each other, but there were also things that were forgotten about completely.There also was not nearly enough build on the characters, so there were several instances where actions the characters made, made little to no sense. Some characters I think they forgot were in the movie.Not to mention the action. For starters every few minutes there was a slow-mo. A few would of been fine but they were everywhere.
