In addition, the way the characters talked, I expected an epic battle, I was incredibly disappointed when I was given an incredible short and mediocre fight.I understand that this movie is supposed to be a "part 1" to the story, but I can't see the second movie doing much to improve the first.

title: Bad story and mediocre acting
text: There's not much story. Nothing makes sense. The leading actress is quite bad. I figure they spent all the money on the pointless cgi. No budget for better actors and actresses. No budget, nor standard, for screen writer and story. People come from nowhere and with zero context. Violence start for no reason and end with no consequence. This is the worst Movie I've seen in 2023. Again....this kora character was unbearable to watch. The movie can finish in 20 mins but it drags on pointlessly for two hours. CGI movie needs to come with a decent story. It's disappointing how bad movies have gotten nowadays.

title: Enjoyed to the end!
text: I went into this movie without any preconceived notion or read any reviews or anyone's opinion. As a result I enjoyed it tremendously. I thought the special effects and the casting in the writing was very well done.Did it have a touch of Star Wars feeling to it? Sure, but it was well done and I enjoyed it.The only thing missing was a big bucket of popcorn and more people to watch it with.But on a 65"big screen with surround sound, I thought it wouldn't have been done any better and I can't wait for the part two.All the other haters are sad, sad people who has lost the joy of giving the movie a chance.

title: Soulless CGI drivel, rehashed from.... every other SCI-Fi franchise
text: I started watching this film really wanting to give it a chance, despite the tendancy for Netflix to miss more than it hits with new movie releases.Boy, was I wrong. I'm ashamed at myself but only got about 45 minutes in. Actually, I'm not ashamed at myself, I lasted longer than the film deserves. Right from the beginning, the film is INSTANTLY forgettable. It's a bland, well-trodden but beautiful mess of a film from what I've watched, but I just couldn't suspend my disbelief. The tortured protagonist is about as well hidden as a fat pig behind a toothpick. You already know how her arc is going to go in the first 5 minutes. Her first fight scene was entirely predictable and completely ridiculous. Femanists, lets see you defend a 50kg woman beating a group of battle-hardened soldiers.The villains are based on Nazis - which of course, every major sci-fi franchise in history has had some iteration of.Netflix, do better. It's lazy, generic, safe and above all boring AF. 2/10 for the visuals, 0/10 for the rest.

title: Shallow and 1 dimensional
text: Characters have no depth; no background or incentive. There is no reason for any of the characters to be involved in the storyline which makes the whole structure unbelievable and disengaging . Storyline is shallow, linear and ultimately a predictable tale of revenge and good against evil (yawn) as of life is that simple and 1 dimensional. Special effects are great in some areas but then a bit budget in others. Costume and environmental design is also confused. Why would space fairing settled systems be wearing old World War 2 materials and outfits. Ultimately this is a classic American movie directed by someone that loves special effects but isn't very good at story writing or character development. Very disappointing.

title: A Snyder story - Lots of show. Very little to tell.
text: This is meant to be a story that Disney rejected. A Star Wars story that had to be rejigged to become something "R" rated.I know why Disney rejected the idea.Zac Snyder is hanging on to the coat tails of 300 and to a lesser extent The Watchmen. Both based on comic book stories written by people who understand story.Snyder's skillset is trying to polish a core idea with OTT visuals.The problem is that recently he's been polishing turd.Justice League (the Snyder cut) was better than the original but that's like saying 15 day old milk smells better than 60 day old milk.To Rebel Moon then. All the hallmarks of bad story telling (of a bad story) wrapped up in unnecessary amount of wrapping paper. You open the present only to find that's there's a lot of wrapping paper but very little else.It is just Justice League really. Every character is "bigged up" by someone telling you. Take General Titus. He's a genius. He's a genius because someone refers to him as the "genius" General Titus. And.....do we see any of that genius on show?.....nope. Nothing. That's it. Pointlessly chewing up the scenery. We know he's a genius because someone tells us he's a genius.You have a character whose whole purspose is to have no shirt on. By God he has a magnificent body. And I'm a heterosexual man! But every scene he's in, I'm thinking...sorry did you say something. Every chuffing scene. No shirt. Why? Eye candy for some of the viewers but absolutely nothing for the story.And this visual splatter gun smorgasboard goes throughout the film. The overall world building is lacking. Even if you had questions, by the end, frankly, you're not bothered if they are answered.You simply don't care.And Snyder does the most Snyder thing. You think the film has ended. Long drawn out zoom out shot of our heroes standing there looking victorious.....cut....to our heroes on horseback....talking about how all is good in the universe (with that fella with no shirt still topless) then zoom out shot of them riding into the sunset. Tadaaaah. The End..... nope there is another scene.And to add insult to frankly a mess of a story....it says END PART ONE. Because the word OF is like so last decade.It's a waste of time that you would really only watch if you wanted to waste some time.It isn't good. No. Not good at all.4 out 10.Sorry.4 out OF 10.END PART ONE.

title: Favorite Snyder Movie
text: I don't typically like most of Snyder's other movies. Really like this one. Solid sci-fi movie. The visuals in this movie look great. It has a good story, is easy to follow, but not overly simple. You understand the motivations of the characters, and it starts to fill out some of their backstories. The action scenes are great and feel exciting. The acting was good, and I really liked the characters, even has great villians. It felt like a big screen epic, and not like a straight to video movie. Does draw from other sci-fi but also feels like it has its own identity. I don't understand the hatred or dislike this one's getting. I'm really looking forward to the second part.

title: Why this???
text: Watched the Movie tonight.And I was all the time wondering why and how that could happen. It's like a B-Movie with a gigantic budget.So what happened to get this mess out to the audience??? I love Snyder's Justice League Cut. But this movie is the worst movie I watched in the last two years.Normally you get to see a mediocre movie on Netflix with top Stars. But this movie is so bad. That the mediocre Netflix movie seems to be a 9 out of 10.So i am now still left behind with question marks how that could made it to release. Did the test audience fall asleep in the first 20 minutes of the movie and everyone then said the movie was great?Don't waste your time like I did and spare you this experience.

title: Generic Sci Fi/Samurai film
text: We've seen all this before. This is literally the plot of every samurai movie without Tom Cruise ever made. Snyder generically plucks from other genres and directors to patch together a very generic script. So it's pretty typical Snyder but it lacks the gorgeous and innovative cinematography that makes people think Zack has more talent than he does. So removing Snyder's eye for lush scenery and sexy action, you're left with a cookie cutter sci fi film that you could see on YouTube.The casting is really rough. Not only are the actors poorly chosen, but on this planet everyonr looks human but no two characters that aren't related look remotely similar. I get you are looking for diversity but they checked literally every box once.Back to the script, one mind boggling thing is why someone would fight a superior opponent for a couple minutes only to pull out a weapon that kills them immediately.Snyder needs real writers and a real editor. He loves his own stuff so much that he takes the final product for granted. Bottom line, Snyder loves the smell of his own farts and he Dutch ovens the audience with this one.

title: Space Frankenstein...in Space!
text: This is the best way to describe a movie which is one part - Seven Samurai/Magnificent Seven (the heroes and plot), one part Star Wars (villains in essence), one part Warhammer 40k (villains in style), one part Dungeons and Dragons (quest to gather heroes and the Dryder lady), one part every girlboss hero ever written (protagonist) and last but not least one part every Snyder movie ever made condensed into one (slo-mo, camera work, dark and gritty setting).Of course when you put so many parts in your creation, it is easy to forget a few - for example character development, good dialogue or an original plot.Eclecticism is a thing but if you are not careful you just get a mess like this.Another thing that bothered me is that the protagonist's backstory is relayed through a few rather long flashbacks, which might seem like showing not telling, HOWEVER the character herself is narrating them/telling them to another person and they are written in such an unnatural, impersonal way that makes them sound like she's reading from a wiki page. Might not be as jarring as that Dune scene with the tablet, but it sure comes close.It's such a shame because this movie could have been so much more...

title: B movie with high budget
text: After watching this movie, I understand now the writers strike and them being against the AI writing.Writers these days, are a waste of money. This movie script seems to be written by children. Any AI if they had access to scripts for movie from 20 years ago would of written something a lot better.The acting and directing are average at best, the dialogues are stupid and meaningless. I really felt bad for wasting 2 hours of my life after watching this.You basically have female Michael Jackson, living not in a steam punk setting like Star Wars but more like a medieval punk world and for a really really idiotic reasons, she starts to gather the diversity squad: the Indian prince, the back general, the Asian assassin and of course the sneaky white merchant. And it goes as you expect, a crapfest. I couldn't close the TV fast enough. Movies as an art form no longer exist in Netflix. Just watch something else, you will thank me.

title: Don't get all the poor reviews!
text: As someone who does not know anything about Rebel Moon, I really enjoyed this introduction. Great cast, characters and story. Really looking forward to part 2 in April 2024.When I first heard Charlie Hunnam doing a Northern Irish accent, I was like oh no, this is gonna be bad but he really done well, I think.Loved seeing the actress from The Mummy, knew I would see her again, amazing presence and love her character in this.Great to see some Game of thrones characters too.Normally not too keen on Sci fi bit game me some star wars vibes. The only Sci fi I really enjoyed.I would say, ignore the reviews and watch it with no expectations. Just enjoy it for what it is....... Really good!

title: What?
text: Apperantly we live in a time where 90 million buys you this?!First of all... in a film about aliens and different world I like to see the different surroundings of said world. For some reason Snyder chose to only focus on 1/6 of the screen, mostly character faces, at a time. I don't know why, but my best guess is that this is the only way the viewers will actually pay attention to this train wreck's story....The whole story leaves you questioning why you started the film in the first place. Very little to no explaination is giving to explain what is going on. It tries to conceil the very very bad plot with unnecessary slow motion "action" shots that hold no merit.The introduction is rushed and tries to make you feel something, but the only emotion you will feel is boredom and confusion.Stop now and look for a different film.

title: Big disappointing
text:
I can't believe how bad this movie is. I watched it because it was choreographed by Zack Snyder. A movie with a good cast but from beginning to end there is no connection at all. The content in the film is too fragmentary, making it difficult for viewers to understand.The villain is terrible, the hero is no better. The action scenes are too gentle, creating a feeling of awkwardness
And many slow motion scenes make viewers uncomfortable, feeling like they are insulting to the viewer's eyes
70% of the movie is a complete waste of time and unnecessary.If they still intend to make a sequel, they should do better in content and action otherwise, they are delusional.

title: Couldn't stay awake
text: I watched this on a streaming platform after work. It sounded great. An adult aimed star wars / Ridick clone. But it's like they added a check box list of all the scenes in Star wars films then used CGI to make up for the casts lack of acting ability. It's a shame because it could have been good.I kept falling asleep in the endless fight scenes and predictable plot twists that only seemed to surprise the wooden main character and no one in the audience.You can watch the first 10 minutes and the last 10 minutes and save a couple of hours or watch the Ridick films which aren't perfect but a thousand times better than this. I can't even remember the names of any of the characters.What I did enjoy was the prop weapon design. They did actually look good. Sadly this is meant to be a film, not a cosplay event.

title: Snyder is pushing the sci-fi genre forward
text:
8.3/10 stars
Snyder really seemed to push the genre forward with this movie, it felt fresh and not just some copy pasted marvel movie that's been beaten to death at this point.Honestly I was shocked to see how reviews were so overwhelmingly negative with this movie, I went in because it looked cool and interesting and I was not disappointed! The movie tells you from the beginning that it is part one of two, this tells me that part one will be the setup, so naturally it will be slower paced which is fine with me, it's like reading the first half of a good novel. The setting the characters and the narrative are all beautifully set up in a way that had me wanting to know more, the movie doesn't give away too much too quickly so it kept me interested the whole time.My only criticism is that some of the scenes were a bit cheesy, some character tropes were a little cliche, and the slow motion scenes were a bit much. But overall didn't ruin my enjoyment of the movie.

title: Entertaining but extremely mediocre
text: Whole movie tries too hard to be cool and fails constantly.One example is the main character. They made it a good looking badass woman because it looks cool. But then failed spectacularly at writing her as an actual main character. *Embarrassing*Let's not even talk about the token asian, the native-like and the black characters...They should have stuck to doing what they know to do. It would look less of an incoherent mess. I know it would have looked more like any other movie... But certainly it would have been better than this failed attempt at being cool?Action scenes entertaining but you know how they will go in advance. The only one you won't guess is the one they pulled a deus ex machina to save the day. So yes... You couldn't guess it... Because it was nonsense.Slow motion... So you can better see how utterly unremarkable is most of what they are slowing down.Leave your brain sleeping and watch for fun. Don't think to deeply about it. The more you think about it the more you notice how utterly bad it is.

title: What happens with the story !
text: Started ok but then I forgot I was watching Rebel Moon and thought I was watching a copy of Star Wars the magnificent seven and Battle beyond the stars. Just a total mash up of stories. There seems to be no investment in the characters with lots of plot holes.You could see that they tried to make a 1hour 40 minute film into the 2 hour 14 minutes bore fest with all the padding. This added nothing to the overall film or narrative. The time would have been better spent on the characters maybe we would then have had some connection on what happens to them.Overall the Special effects are good but sole less. I hope the second part can redeem itself.

title: Is this a parody of Star Wars rip-offs?
text: Rebel Moon was DESPERATELY trying to be a Star Wars movie right from frame one and the whole 'substitute world building' is woefully shallow and it's trying to build a universe when this story COULD have worked in the actual Star Wars Universe.This movie has the hardened badass girl archetype, the shunned but street-smart scoundrel, the strong-willed slave, the humanised robot, the *cough* Empire *cough*, and these cliches have been done to death in better movies that makes Rebel Moon sadly derivative when this film could have easily been a more inspired thing had it not become an awkward exposition-fest interlaced with Zack Snyder iconography that's on the brink of being a satire of the man's style and filmmaking techniques.Supposedly the 'Director's Cut' is gonna be a better movie (or more of the same) but I'm not too sure if extra stuff would fix the movie right here. Maybe with more breathing room Rebel Moon could easily have had a valid reason for existing besides being a space opera to fill in the Star Wars and Star Trek cinematic voids (currently).Simply put, Netflix wanted to make this as a 'rival Star Wars' franchise, but the problem is that these universes NEED depth right off the bat. And this one is waiting for either a directors cut or a clearer vision with less cliches to pick out of the proverbial raffle hat.Rebel Moon is a multimillion dollar copy-and-paste job that seems like a passion project which became a feature length missed-opportunity-and-a-half for 2023 and Zack Snyder. Maybe Part Two will be an improvement? Who can tell with these things?2/5 stars. For all it tries with its impressive visuals, the film seems like it's trying to be certain with its world building while being completely uncertain on whether to make this new world actually feel real to the viewers.

title: Decent sci-fi flick
text: People need to relax.... Just try to watch a movie and enjoy it. Cool action sequences, good effects, good sound, it's a 'good' sci-fi movie. I'd say it could have used a little better writing but it's not horrible. Some of the characters are classic throwbacks to different genres, reminding me of He-Man and Gladiator, and a little Valarian.... I wish there were more movies like this, or at least I wish there were more big budget movies that weren't prequels or sequals. New characters on new worlds in a new universe is a welcome change.Watch it with an open mind, ignore the negative reviews and judge for yourself.

title: Rebel Meh...Wasted potential.
text: I went into this movie with an open mind and optimistic for a new story of sci-fi and adventure, but I was left disappointed.Point 1. There is little to no character development for any of them during the whole movie, we don't learn their backgrounds, their morals, their personalities. It is fast paced game of Pokémon, got to catch them all but without any substance, story or character arch. It is rushed and you don't care for them.Point 2. Bad story telling and pacing. Everything is choppy and fast paced that you don't get to be immersed into the lore and galaxy. It's like they jumped from one green screen to another.Point 3. Too many similarities to Star Wars that made the story predictable and unoriginal. I wanted this movie to give us a better or different story completely. It failed to do so, it became boring and lame.Point 4. Too many slow mo's that leaves you bored and frustrated. Many unnecessary scenes with slow mo. It would have been better to have faster paced scenes but the director went crazy with the slow mo.In all, I am very disappointed as this could have been very good if the movie had better writers, script, editing and pacing. The opportunity to make a darker Sci-Fi with an epic story and lore has been sorely wasted by Zack.If there is going to be a Rebel Moon 2, there needs to be a lot of work to correct all the mistakes the first one movie made.

title: Could have been so much better
text: I was looking forward to this and hadn't read any of the reviews before watching.When I realised it was part 1 and the trailer for part 2 is already out I thought it was going to be really good.How wrong was I, the storyline sounds good and the effects and fighting scenes are really good but the rest of it is just so boring so much so that after about 90 mins and still nothing really entertaining had happened I had to stop watching and not waste anymore of my time.I don't know if the story will conclude after part 2 but I don't see it carrying on any further than that unless it gets a lot better.

title: Synder is a One Hit Wonder
text: Don't let this guy ruin the career of great actresses. We all know that Cavill, Gadot an Afflweck blow in front of the screen. Totally missing the point of other characters. BUT DON'T LET THIS RUIN THE CAREER OF Sofia Boutella. Please!!! This is a diamond in the rough trying to shine among the chaos of..everything. Just look at Atomic Bonde. Script writing is important!!!!!!!!! Please Stop the Michael Bay Trash. #forgetMB. Action is way less important amount quantity. Slow down. Enjoy the journey. No one needs action please support, better directors and script writers. We don't need CGI. We need better movies. Please look at Oppenheimer and appreciate the simplicity of Christopher Nolan.

title: A Unique Masterpiece Dedicated to the Fans
text: A movie with a few despicable characters.The implication and the characters involved when you sit and think, they are utterly disgusting in certain scenes.That's how Snyder works.He's a counterculture specialist.His values are on every frame.This is a movie with three audiences.First and foremost?The fans.This one is for us. This one is for us! The characters on screen? They are us.Second audience? General. This has broad appeal. It talks about themes of abandonment, of found family, of wonder and technology, of sadness and death, of bounty and harvest.The third?Only the Fans and Snyder's family and friends know who the third audience is.It's on every frame of this movie.It's built into the architecture.Every shot, every action scene, every beat, every word.There is one person for whom this movie was made for. And in honour of.And we as Snyder fans know exceedingly well who it is.Just thinking about it makes me cry.For Autumn. Zack Snyder's daughter who sadly took her own life. Before his Snyder Cut came out. It forced him to abandon Justice League.The words "For Autumn" I can tell you now are nowhere on the film. Because it's a Netflix production for worldwide distribution.But they don't need to be there.Because any fan will be able to tell. Whether they end up loving the film or seeing pacing issues or really desiring the Fantastical R-rated cut.Something no one can ever deny, no critic no fan no general audience member, is that this is a movie dedicated to that person. The one person who can never, unfortunately, watch this film.Or any of his future films.But we as fans have always banded together to support Zack. To tell him "we are here and you do whatever movie you want. We are here."And the thousands of dollars raised for AFSP is already our legacy. I donated a small amount myself. Cementing my place. But we can do more.I got no doubt in my mind this movie will be the hit of Netflix Christmas/ Festive Season.

title: Great visual but can't get past the cultural appropriation
text: It started out slow, but then it became somewhat interesting, especially the bar scene. It was reminiscent of Star Wars cantina scene. Yet when they get to the next planet, already the tiresome cliche and lack of creativity began to surface.Why must space aliens who can tame wildlife look and sound exactly like a native American? And then the next scene, why must the Asian alien wear a Korean traditional hat and use katanas? I mean, do these people have any original creativity or they just copy what they see in the world and stereotype?And as the setting is cliche, so is the plot. Nothing was surprising, everything was predictable. And when everything is predictable, then nothing is entertaining.Excellent visuals, I especially like the slow down effects, a bit of Matrix going on. However, just can't get past the cringe worthy stereotypes and lack of creativity.3/10.

title: So boring, so recycled.
text: I don't know why the sci-fi genre is so obsessed with retelling the Seven Samurai story but please, stop. We are all tired of it especially when it's done with enough slow motion to extend the film by 20 minutes.I found none of these characters interesting, their motivations were not convincing. None of them seemed remotely interesting story wise or visually. Why is the one guy constantly shirtless? Space is cold, you're gonna catch a cold going on your space adventures without a coat on dude. Each character is a very pale "homage" to previous sci fi characters or star based archetypes. Just this time there's far more eyeshadow and baby oil.The designs were boring, when they weren't distracting from being lifted from somewhere else that is. We all get it Zach, you like black, and dark grey and charcoal. Find a new palette, it's visually boring. For the dark thing to work it has to play off light.

title: Doesn't grab you or take you on an adventure
text: My apologies to the makers and creators of this movie: I know you put a lot of hours and dedication to the production of this movie. I am sorry to say that it the movie did not grab hold of me or took me on a wild ride of an adventure. The connection with the leading hero doesn't ad up. And why should you show evil only as a killer of innocent and de defensless people? I have no fear for this evil, only resentment. I missed the fear of an Voldemort or Darth Vader. You know they are bad to the bone by their posture and speech. This evil is just a bully. The off world locations where sci fied by adding star Trek liking swoosh doors to it.All in all I wasn't caught by the challenge stated. It is not cult either.If you can choose between this movie and any other, choose the other.

title: Don't pay attention to negativity
text: Pay no attention to the negative reviews, form your own opinion. This is a good movie and a solid watch. The writing is good, the story is good, the action is very very good, and the acting is good. I will say that some CGI could be better, it doesn't take away from the overall enjoyment of the film. While this film embraces its Star Wars roots, my only qualm lies in the inclusion of characters resembling Star Wars creatures and people. It slightly detracts from the otherwise original story, removing them is a small tweak that could elevate the overall experience. Again... Be you're own critic.

title: It's already been said
text: Had high hopes for an evening's entertainment. But NO! First thing I noticed was the across the board bad acting. Ed Skrein was over the top, but that actually fit in. Everyone else was just bad. The plot?? Taken from a half dozen other movies and patched together - poorly. This was like a scrapbook of other film plots, badly written, badly directed, badly edited and badly acted. Run away! Nothing made sense. There's just so many ways I can write BAD to fill up the required word count. Ok, the most embarrassing acting was our protagonist heroine. There was a bit of sweaty six pack fluff, serving only that purpose, and one cool griffon creature. Someone at Netflix needs to be moved to a basement room with his stapler.

title: Great entertaining and action packed
text: It's not a film that'll chase Oscar's but it's still a great Sci fi story. Could have had a little more backstory but the action and characters are fun too watch. It's not thought provoking but it doesn't try to be. I enjoyed it and many sci fi fans will love it.It sets up the 2nd part extremely well, the main antagonist is good and the villain is easy to hate which is exactly what you want . The set pieces are stunning and the FX satisfies. Yes, it is mostly what has happened in other films but there is a limited amount of detail that you could throw in to a space opera. Sit back, admire the action and don't listen to the neigh sayers that want a more complex story.

title: This starts off looking like a science fiction masterpiece and concludes as a science fiction dud
text: My wife and I watched Rebel Moon (2023) last night on Netflix. The storyline unfolds on a planet filled with farmers who are confronted by a military unit that kills their leader and demands their entire upcoming harvest. An orphan among the farmers understands the ruthless nature of these soldiers and the lengths they'll go to collect on their demands. She decides to enlist the help of other soldiers on the planet to form a rebellion against the oppressors.Directed by Zack Snyder (300), the film features Sofia Boutella (Hotel Artemis), Djimon Hounsou (Blood Diamond), Charles Hunnam (Sons of Anarchy), Doona Bae (Cloud Atlas), Ray Fisher (Justice League), and Ed Skrein (Deadpool).This movie had everything it needed to be great: a compelling set-up, well-developed characters, a mysterious universe, and elite special effects. The science fiction elements are gorgeous, and you genuinely care about the main character, who is easy to root for. The action scenes are top-notch with great violence and shootouts. The premise is well-established, and there are some good subplots too. Unfortunately, with about an hour to go, the film takes a completely new direction with over-the-top action scenes, shootouts, and circumstances that feel ridiculous - one after another. Even the dialogue and storyline fall apart at the end, to the extent that they should abandon the idea of a sequel.In conclusion, this starts off looking like a science fiction masterpiece and concludes as a science fiction dud. I would score this a 5/10 and recommend skipping it.

title: Give my time back - 3 stars would be more than generous
text: Rebel Moon, what a hot mess! I can't even with the dialogues - they're like they were written by a robot on sleep mode. And don't even get me started on the actors; they're as boring as watching paint dry on a wall.The plot? Well, it's like someone tossed a bunch of sci-fi clichés into a blender and hit 'frappe.' It's a total letdown, and I expected so much more from a director of your caliber.Zack Snyder, does he have some secret tape of executives' embarrassing moments or something? Because they just keep giving him opportunities to make more flops??? Holy mother of flares and slowmo this guy still hasn't learn to make a good movie !!!Honestly, Rebel Moon is a painful that nothing can beat star wars.

title: Embodies all of the typical Zack Snyder tropes one would expect for better and for worse
text: "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is a science fiction action film co-written and directed by Zack Snyder ("Dawn of the Dead", "300", "Watchmen"). Starring Sofia Boutella and Ed Skrein, it embodies all of the typical Zack Snyder tropes one would expect for better and for worse.In a faraway galaxy, the militaristic empire known as the "Motherworld" has ruled over the galaxy's systems for centuries. The Motherworld send their military leader Admiral Atticus Noble (Ed Skrein) to the farming colony on Veldt in an effort to strike a deal with the inhabitants of a small village to sell some of their grain. After the village elder (Corey Stoll) declines the offer, a farmer named Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) disagrees with his decision, which prompts Noble to beat the elder to death and instead demand all of the village's grain before he returns. A lone villager named Kora (Sofia Boutella) reveals to the others that she is a former high-ranking member of the Motherworld's soldiers and teams up with Gunnar to assemble a group of warriors from other worlds to defend Veldt from Noble and his troops.If there were ever a more sharply divisive director to have worked in the past twenty years, it would be Zack Snyder, whose very name conjures up mixed opinions among audiences and critics alike. Throughout his career, Snyder's style of filmmaking has won him many fans while also earning him his fair share of detractors in the process. Whether you love him or hate him, there's no arguing that Snyder has definitely made a name for himself in the cinematic world. With Snyder's latest film "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire", the controversial filmmaker attempts to tell his own version of "Star Wars", but instead it feels more like his take on "Jupiter Ascending".A common criticism among most of Zack Snyder's films is their weak character development, and this one is no exception. When we are first introduced to our protagonist, Kora, we see that she acts distant from the other villagers regarding her origins and won't go into detail about why she is staying there in the first place. Later when something bad happens in front of her, Kora demonstrates her physical strength on those causing trouble and is then hailed as a hero by the village. Normally, this type of characterisation works in a film's favour, but I found Kora hard to connect with due to how derivative she is of other protagonists in similar films of this genre. Kora seems like a slap-dash amalgamation of so many other heroes in extraordinary situations that I already knew how events were going to play out for her in the end, and that's exactly what happens.Similarly, when we watch the ironically named villain Atticus Noble demonstrate his cruel streak, he comes across as cartoonishly simplistic in his motivations. This may have been done to make him seem like a personification of evil rather than a potentially redeemable tragic villain, but aside from that there's nothing about Noble that makes him all that interesting as a character. There are other supporting characters littered throughout the story as well that either have little significance to the plot or are just there to peddle exposition to the audience in the most flat way possible. Practically everyone feels like a stock character, only there to fulfil the purpose of a particular scene and nothing more. Aside from Kora and Noble, I struggled to remember the names of any other character in the film that I even slightly cared about.Additionally, there are also major problems with the structuring of the plot. There's never enough time given to any world-building elements before the film cuts away to a completely unrelated scene afterwards. For instance, in one part we see Noble and his soldiers invading another system demanding to know where they are hiding any rebels. What follows is him briefly interacting with the system's leader with the latter begging not to have his people slain, a request that quickly falls on deaf ears. I would have liked to have known the significance of why Noble had chosen this specific planet during his search but before we properly learn who these people are, he's already given the order to wipe all of them out. Most of the film functions this way, with only glimpses of the different species of the galaxy's inhabitants that are reduced to being little more than cannon fodder for the villains.On a more positive side, the film does have some nice visual effects to go along with its otherwise flawed presentation. As brief as they were, I did appreciate seeing the way that the varying types of worlds looked throughout the story, as they had areas that seem to hint at what they were like before the Motherworld took over. There was this city that actually resembles a once bustling civilisation that has now been reduced to a ghetto-like slum and another desert-like planet that looks as though it has been left abandoned for some time. Had the film focused more on combining these great visuals with proper world building, then it could have been a more appealing story.Also, some of the action scenes were quite exciting at times, mainly during the third act. If there's one great thing that Zack Snyder movies usually contain, it's a thrilling climax and this film certainly has just that. Without giving away spoilers, I enjoyed the showdown near the end, as it was among the few parts of the story that actually had me invested the whole time. The cinematography was on point and the character motivations made sense within the context of what was happening. Even Snyder's signature slow motion is used quite effectively here too. It's just a huge shame this is the only instance where I truly cared about what was happening in the story, as virtually nothing else in the film elicited this type of reaction from me.As mentioned earlier, the characters are all rather uninteresting and poorly developed. I didn't really care much for Sofia Boutella as Kora, as she lacks the charisma for a leading role like this. Although she's more than capable of handling the action sequences, when it comes to the dialogue she falls flat. Boutella's accent hinders her delivery of certain lines to the point where it doesn't sound natural. It also doesn't help that her character has only one major role in the story; to recruit other people who would be potentially better at leading this film than her, like Djimon Hounsou, Charlie Hunnam, and even Anthony Hopkins as the voice of a robot.If I had to pick just one character that left the most impression on me, it would be the villain Atticus Noble. Though his character lacked important development, I guess it was just Ed Skrein's performance that made him more appealing to watch over everyone else. Skrein, whom most people know as Ajax from "Deadpool", definitely has the screen presence for this type of villain, which is part of the reason why I was curious to see what he'd do next. Though this may also be to do with the fact that he's literally dressed as a Nazi SS officer (minus the Swastikas) for the majority of the film that makes it seem like he really means business.For the beginning of a new franchise, "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" leaves a poor first impression on viewers that allows little excitement for what else is to come. So far, none of the characters have any true staying power and the universe it exists within is exceedingly dull. However, there is the possibility that all of these issues could be amended in the following sequels, so perhaps I shouldn't speak so soon. Until then, all I can say is approach this film like you would any other Zack Snyder movie; as either mindless entertainment or just plain mindless.I rate it 5/10.

title: Amazing and fresh. Snyder is top of the top!
text: Watched Rebel Moon and it was amazing. I saw the movie and everything I read in reviews of critics its a lie. About movie, its a very good story with interesting universum. Pictures are so beautifull, all of the suns, planets, creatures, so amazing. VFX, dynamics, action is on the top level. It got potential to be a huge frenchise. Maybe to much of slow motions but I think Snyder do it because its like his signature move. Actors are good, Sofia is stunning. For me its a mix of Star Wars (but for adult), 300 and The Vikings, its a 10/10. I will watch it again and wait for directors cut. Thank You Zack.

title: A Chore to Sit Through
text: This movie is just bizarre. It has all of the traditional Zach Snyder-isms, and while his films are slow-moving and sometimes tedious, this one is fast-moving and somehow frequently tedious. If I'm understanding this right, we have a farm girl recruiting heroes in a quest to fight space nazis threatening her village? And when I say 'space Nazis' I mean that quite literally. This movie has the stupidity of writing that is typically reserved for something targeted to children, yet the themes are very adult-oriented; so like a lot of "current day" entertainment, it begs the question, "Who is this made for?" I have to conclude Snyder stans who can ignore the confusing writing and be pleased by all the Snyder-isms, and adults with the discernment of children. It's probably okay to throw on in the background if you're doing chores, but it's nothing worth paying attention to.

title: Really Snyder... really??
text: Pros: Visual effects and backdrop.Cons: EVERYTHING ELSE!!Always been a fan of Snyder but this movie is just simply bad. It had the potential to be something great but it failed miserably mainly in writing and direction.Predictable plot with every action/sci-fi cliche you could think of. Characters with absolutely no depth or development. Wooden acting/direction despite some of the acting talents. Irritating overuse of slow motion (even for Snyder) which further spoils the already mediocre action scenes.Yes it draws many parallels with Star Wars but so does a lot of sci-fi movies. They still could've made into something worth watching but unfortunately, Snyder just didn't make the cut.

title: Far too cheesy for my liking
text: I have to admit, I don't mind cheesy movies. I quite like them, but not on this level. I really wanted to like Rebel Moon; it should be right up my street. However, the way it's been made, the dialogue, the characters and plot are so contrived, I couldn't bring myself to give it more than 4 stars.It's a shame: Charlie Hunnam's not in it enough, the dialogue is too much tell and not enough show, and altogether this is one terrible movie, although I did sit through the whole thing, so it's not one star worthy. The villains looking like nazis, complete with caps and overcoats, was a stretch too far for me. This should be Sci fi. Surely the filmmakers have an imagination and don't need to resort to mimicking history?If you're expecting an amazing Sci fi / fantasy extravaganza, look elsewhere. This isn't it.

title: Worst movie I've seen in ages
text: Quite possibly the worst movie I've ever seen. It's not original at all, it's directly a one for one ripoff of Battle Beyond the Stars for the first half.Nothing in this movie is actually original. It's as if the writer took his favorite clips of movies he's watched and fed them into an AI script generator and filmed what came out the other side. Seriously you can make a game out of it with your friends, and pause repeatedly to see which movie each segment was stolen from.75% of the film is purposely blurry apparently for artistic reasons, but only served to annoy me. There is a small circle in the middle of the screen that is in focus, everything other than that small circle is blurry. If this was the only thing wrong with the film it would be enough, but the dialogue, the story, the absurd premise, and the EXCESSIVE overuse of slow-mo just removes any suspension of disbelief.Oh and the casting is horrible. If you want to show me some scrawny 98 pound girl beating the crap out of eleven 200+ pound men at once, at least cast an actress that has muscle tone, or give her super powers, or at least revel she has cyborg parts or something.Seriously it's awful, it's not even so bad it's funny, it's just eye roll inducing.

title: Not amazing but very good and well worth a watch
text: Enjoyable movie, it's taken a lot of influences from, seven samurai, Star Wars, dune, GoT and a few more, (it's even got the cantina scene close to the start). Im ok with that, most good shows take influence from previous good shows.I feel this could have been a 10 episode series rather than 2 movies. What it suffers from is we dont see enough of the main characters backgrounds and I found myself not caring too much about any of them apart from the main girl.Still a thoroughly enjoyable watch though.What this did confirm for me is how good the original Star Wars movies are nearly 50 years after they were made.

title: Please make it stop
text: Zack Snyder, can't say I'm surprised. Visually this looks great, as always with his movies. Too bad, movies also need a story and decent dialogue.Why do we need the main character to tell us her whole life's story every 5 minutes, when the whole world around her is just cartoonishly one dimensional? It just does not connect on any level.Why on earth would you allow Charlie Hunnam that godawful, butchered mockery of an Irish accent? Why? You clearly see how much he needs to focus, and how little brain capacity is left to actually do... you know...the acting.On the brght side: the dead sheep they glued to Djimon Hounsou's face got a good laugh out of me. That "beard" looks absolutely ridiculous, particularly the fluffy upper lip section. Poor guy.I could go on, but would rather just sum it up. If you need to put your brain on autopilot for a while, sure you can watch this. But the cringe is strong with this one, so don't expect much.And just because I think this should be said as often as possible: Justice League's Snyder Cut sucked so hard. It was just as bad as the original version and added an hour of braincell suicide. Thanks for nothing.

title: Boring
text: Well, I made it 27 minutes into this movie and realized it was yet another clunker by Netflix. Something in this movie just seemed off. The one action scene was predictable and disappointing. The writing was elementary. I'm 56. I remember when dialogue in a movie would grasp our attention instead of the middle school level dialogue which happens now. Critics say that the internet has conditioned us to need action and scenery to keep our attention in movies. Well, when the writing is this bad, as in 95% of anything released now, then yeah, we need much more than just dialogue. And the extra parts need to be good. Sadly, the first 27 minutes of this didn't provide them.

title: A nice looking scrapbook
text: I've seen my share of Zack Snyder films and this carries a lot of the same elements as earlier movies with grandiose cinematography and trademark slow-mo shots. Nevertheless, it feels like the director has mixed and matched parts from other movies rather than coming up with something new. Hence the plot feels really weak although the production is quite nice. There is a plethora of places and characters that maybe would feel relevant if there was a story that carried forward. Also the actions of the characters are sparsely explained or motivated. Cgi is unimpressive. The lead is not a good enough actor to carry the role. Charlie Hunnams accent is totally unconvincing as well as his acting. Ed Skreins character has a fetish for finishing people off with a walking stick for some reason. The rest of the cast is mediocre at best. Overall a nice package but too messy and incoherent content to warrant a second part. I suspect I will give it a chance, but I'm almost certain to be disappointed.

title: Sofia Boutella wins again!
text: I don't think I've watched a film where I've not enjoyed the character Sofia plays, she is a fantastic actress and very diverse in her roles!This was a brilliantly gripping movie right from the start, very action packed throughout, I loved the different characters and worlds we got to see and how each character has such an incredible background! The creatures we see along the way are fascinating and the interactions between them and the characters was very good. (My favourite had to our introduction to Nemesis)If you're a lover of fantasy and action then this film is the right one for you!This movie has definitely laid the foundation for more and I am very much looking forward to part two!

title: Acting is seriously poor
text:
The visuals were what kept me watching , the story had some potential but was very rushed if the "heroes
" were given a bit more context to their story it would've made much more sense , the acting in general was average but the main actress did a seriously poor job , I don't normally pay that much attention to bad acting so when i say it was bad then it was really bad that even I noticed it , every line was worse than the one before in the end i was laughing at how bad her acting was ..
The villains are the most interesting thing in the storyline , going to watch the next part hopefully it's better.

title: We were on the verge of greatness.
text: The setting is cool. It's a bit gritty, dark, sci-fi. Has aliens not only as masked humans, but aliens with tentacles, horns and such. Great creative design. CGI and images were done well.The music is meh... It felt okay, it paired great to the scenes but didn't add anything plus.The story idea is a bit mainstream but then, every story was already told a 100 times. Didn't have any surprising twists. I could have foretold every major plot point, as well as many minor ones.Of course the bad guys look like space nazis, their army consists of bandits with no discipline whatsoever, to really antagonize the watchers and make us hate them.There are many real unsound decisions on part of many characters. And then there are characters that are totally left out. Maybe they come back in the sequel, but they felt like such major plot hooks and then... nothing. Not even a mention of them. Completely left out of the story.

title: I've seen a lot of sci-fi movies. I'm 80. I LOVED THIS MOVIE!!!
text: WHAT do you people want?? There were scenes and concepts in here, that I had never seen before! I saw fantastic effects, GREAT directing and acting, and PLOT, and EVERYTHING!I gave it a nine, because of two things: The background planet is WAY too close, because the two would be tearing each other apart, ala "When Worlds Collide". Also, when Ray Fisher's "Bloodaxe" character is trying to get his troops to come with him, he should've been MUCH louder. How could they hear him? But those are ALL TWO of my problems with this movie.And all of you who didn't like this one, I'm sure YOUR movie would've been so much better. HA!Jerry Ryberg, Galesburg, IL.

title: An entertainment black hole
text: "Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire" is a cinematic black hole where even gravity couldn't salvage its lack of substance or plot.Despite boasting good cinematography and meticulously crafted worlds and sets, it ultimately fell victim to its unoriginality, feeling like a thinly veiled homage to space operas like Star Wars.While the quality actors did their best, their performances felt wooden, failing to breathe life into the uninspired script. What's most surprising is the low quality of this Netflix production, given the track record of both the streaming giant and director Zack Snyder, who seemed to have fallen asleep at the wheel, allowing derivative storytelling to eclipse any potential for innovation or excitement.

title: Great filming.. But bad story.
text: Star Wars mixed with Dune. It has the Dune history and family fighting concepts and an empire to be overthrown. Put into space and with simple characters like star wars and then mixing in random bits and pieces from bother genres to make something new.I can't tell if it's the actors not able to have chemistry or the plot being so dull with the writing that it makes the film seem so baseless and pointless. But the whole feel of the movie concept is way off.THE ONLY REASON why I gave it 5 stars, is because of the filming and CGI was good. The scenes, theme, and compositing was pretty well done.But the writing, plot, acting/characters are so out of sync it makes it feel like a low budget mess.

title: Cheesy Predictable Movie
text: Zack Snyder stuns with another cliché action movie: boring!I can say that this movie was visually stunning, but everything else fell flat. Although it was bad, it was bad/good, you know, not bad/bad because it had its moments, sorta kinda... Bad.good movie that became comedic at times, which made me enjoy it a little lol.I wish this movie was more than what it seemed, as everything is so predictable and literally feels like every sci fi/ action movies put into one! My boyfriend and I were guessing what would happen and lines, and it would happen or be exact because everything was so obvious!!!The story would make some sense and then no sense at all as well. Overall, this movie was somewhat entertaining, and I'd be willing to watch the next movie to see where it goes...AND WHY WAS PRINCE TARAK SHIRTLESS THE WHOLE TIME LOL?!

title: I wanted to like it
text: I am such a huge fan of Charlie Hunnam but sorry to say that even with his skills, his character was predictable. The plot was predictable and as some other person said the reason they all join together is flimsy and not a lot of convincing involved. It was too fast. The whole movie was predictable, actually.And don't get me started on the slow motion action scenes. TOO MANY SLOW MOTION SCENES. I know it's Snyder's signature move but enough already.It's not bad for a movie but it's not something I would watch again. It was just okay, it's not a very memorable movie, which is sad because a lot of work went into it.

title: I find the whole grousing inappropriate
text: ... if you compare this film with the total crap, which is offered far too often today and obviously willingly consumed by sufficient masses."All just boring repetition" - that's what I thought about the last trilogy of Star Wars (Abrams & Johnson)! They were so outrageous and simply brazenly copied themselves (i.e. The older SW films)? Just because of the crowd of haters, there is one star as an extra bonus for this refreshingly new project from me.The film must be rated in the category from which it originates. You shouldn't expect Shakespeare with a bag of popcorn in your hand. All the "self-made film experts" nowadays are too happy to evaluate according to their own taste - negative as well as positive.Yes, I also thought: Star Wars meets sandal movie and western - but ... so what?! Are we suddenly demanding? Yes, there are a few lengths and the dialogues are not dripping of deep thoughts - but this is not the "Club of dead sci-fi authors"!I felt well entertained, the look and the effects are right, the design is good, there are some well-done figures - so let's see how it will develop. As a series, however, I would actually like more depth and denser narrative, as in some episodes / films of Star Trek TNG or Altered Carbon, Black Mirror, Love Death & Robots, or other slightly more demanding Sci Fi - so that you really like and stay interested in it.Maybe the eternal grumblers should watch the very old Enterprise episodes from the 60s again? Silly today - but my mom and I loved it back then !! 😉🤗 The idea of "Rebel Moon" can also become something good!

title: Chronicles of riddick rip-off. Every clique in the book!
text: Ai definitely wrote this. It's just how Ai would collect all the things it thinks should be in there and how everything should look. Massive chronicles of riddick rip-off!Terrible clique crap, bad directing of the actors who have been great in everything else yet look terrible is this. The bad guys are dresses as sci-fi nazis as usual. The fighting scenes were so bad. They were so slow that every 2 seconds they had to go into slow motion to try and make it look good.Every character was so obvious with a clique obvious back story. This film rips off so many films it's nuts. I can't believe a person wrote and directed this. I feel like this is an initial test to see if people like films written by Ai and see if people can notice the difference.

title: Good background noise
text: I knew what I was getting into here. Zac Synder is someone who I consider to be a pretty good director but a terrible writer, and this movie pretty much puts on full display his style when he has full creative control, which is: visuals first, story last. And visually, there are a lot of nice scenes and action (although Snyder reallllly needs to lay off the slow mo, he overuses it wayy too much).The story is so simplistic that it feels like a video game from 20 years ago, so if you are a non-native English speaker and need an easy movie to practice, here you go. There was one laugh-out-loud scene for me I must admit (unintentionally so) regarding how a ship is taken down, but otherwise it's all pretty much generic sci-fi fantasy. If you took Firefly and Star Wars and put them in a blender, then dumbed down the story so that a 5 year old could understand it, you'd get this movie. If you've gotta do laundry or cleaning around the house then sure, put it on in the background. But if you are looking for a well-made sci-fi movie to actually get invested in, look elsewhere.

title: Stunningly Terrible
text: If you're looking for a decent, big budget sci-fi... This isn't it. Just watch The Creator instead.The acting in this film was ok. Especially with the material they were given. The story is awful. Like just bad. You don't care about any of the characters or understand their motivations. They rushed through and just didn't include, what felt like important moments to tie an audience to a film and the characters. Also, what is with all the slow-mo action scenes? It was distracting, not visually appealing and pulled you out of the moment. I literally laughed out loud at some moments that were definitely supposed to be suspenseful/serious.

title: Rebel Moon Honest Review
text: Rebel Moon.Zach Snyder again. This time he brings us part One of his epic space saga. After two minutes of the movie I was blown away by the directors vision. This movie is absolutely stunning. Every single scene is breathtaking. As a Massive fan of his work I want to say that there isn't many directors out there that could make this type of film. My thoughts always turn to the amazing 300 as the starting point for this style of storytelling. The Star Wars comparison will always be there for any sci-fi movie these days. It's very hard to judge a movie on a single part of a two part saga. Zach builds a rich and colourful universe and introduces us to Kora ( Sophia Boutella ) Kora has a secret past life and has settled on a farming planet. As things always do it's not long before the bad guys commanded by ( Ed Skrein ) Admiral Atticus arrives on the planet demanding resources. Given the choice to serve or face the consequences Kora has a big choice to make. Along the way we meet a former military robot voiced by ( Anthony Hopkins ) and Irish Rogue Kai ( Charlie Hunnam ) his Irish accent is pretty terrible but a decent character all the same. The opening hour or so was mainly an introduction to the main cast of characters. Darrian Bloodaxe ( Ray Fisher ) Nemesis ( Bae Doona ) General Titus ( Djimon Hounsou ) Tarak ( Staz Nar ) and Gunnar ( Michiel Huisman ) before we embark on several fantastic looking adventures. I definitely enjoyed this. With the promise of a R rated Directors Cut in 2024 it has the potential to get even better. If you are looking for epic sci-fi fun this holiday give this a spin. With low scores on the corrupt Rotten Tomatoes 🍅 ill give you my verdict below.My Rating 🌚🌚🌚🌚This could be the start of something brilliant. I'm a bit gutted that the directors cut wasn't released the same day giving the viewer the choice. The Snyder Cuts just seem to improve the movies in a big way. The superior cut of Batman vs Superman and Zach Snyders Justice League proving the point.

title: Underwhelming at best.
text: Overuse of slo mo mid action was jarring.Pacing all over the place with no real character development or logical motivations.Average CGI and special effects.Wasted characters, especially one quite early on.Too much telling of the story vs showing the story.Poor clone of many Star Wars elements.White males are either weak or villainous, with a big diversity quota push.Really odd mishmash of storytelling, like someone tried to create wow scenes and threw them together to show how badass each of the main characters are but no real timing.This is clearly a rejected Star Wars story that had to be revised to avoid copyright challenges.The best part was Ed Skrein.

title: Meh....seen it all before
text: I went into this movie with high hopes, the trailers looked amazing and Zac Snyder has a solid reputation. I really enjoyed Army of the dead and Army of thieves.Unfortunately this was a complete turkey. The plot felt like the magnificent seven in space but set in a quasi Viking setting at the start...with barely a glimpse of the other locations as Kora flys around recruiting a forgettable crew. I'm also curious why the blood axe soldiers look like a androgynous emo band?The acting wasn't bad but it was wooden and all the rousing speeches just felt flat, the characters lacked depth (my three favourite characters were the robot, the Griphion and the Spider woman all of whom were in the movie less than five minutes each).The cinematography was beautiful to look at but the over use of slow motion coupled with bland action scenes killed a lot of the visual impact.I'm trying to keep an open mind for the second movie but it's 50/50 if I'll waste two hours watching it.

title: Tries too hard to be Star Wars
text: It didn't surprise me to hear he pitched this as a Star Wars movie...it just tries WAY too hard to be SW. If it weren't for Sofia, it wouldn't be worth watching. Really, just embarrassing for how much it fan girled other space movies.I'll be interested to see how many people watch part II next April after watching the initial part now? I will watch it if I'm bored, but certainly won't be "looking forward" to it. Sofia deserves a leading role after her performance in the Mummy, but this movie falls flat. Oh, it also has an Indiana Jones bend to it with the "German" looking bad guys. Rambling to meet the min. Characters for a review now.

title: Finally something good on Netflix
text: Amazing movie!amazing cast!amazing picture! The action scenes were so good!can't wait for part 2!!!people being saying it's not good or boring I don't know what they were watching if you going in this wanting Star Wars type of film it's not I personally dislike Star Wars this is far better the acting the story was great!!I've been waiting for something different and we finally got it. You have to be open minded to this film every piece of the film was great!!!truly a masterpiece the director two thumbs up!!!!let's go I'm ready for number 2!!! I will most definitely watch it again this is a must see film.

title: Utterly boring,
text: No idea what the writers where upto, so much taken from other Movies... Star Wars, Lord Of The Rings, Avengers.The characters where just so unbelievable and it was obvious that the actors where not invested in the storyline.Everything about this movie was predictable and BORING, even the special effects where cheap and nasty, the creation of the 'other' worlds was just 'really' is this the best they could do in this day and age.Sadly, I really cannot think of any, nay one redeeming thing about this movie.I expected more from Snyder, considering the reputation he has in Hollywood, but this one.. Zack you missed by a mile.Save your monies and your time and give it a huge MISS!

title: Wasted potential
text: Wasted potential. Zack Snyder puts to much everything on screen, average viewer can't focus on action or characters presented in movie. From my point of view photography was the worst part of the film, everything seems so blury and blend with background. Another problem is no connections between events and characters presented on screen, story is just poorly written. Despite everything bad I must admit there is some good written characters like Kora or Admiral Noble, also there is high potential in political background presented in this world. I hope extended edition or even next movie will improve defects from Rebel Moon - Part One.

title: The preview is a better movie
text: I don't usually write reviews but I needed to say something about this as they wasted my anticipation time. It was not good! If you're watching a movie and you can see its a set and see that it's fake, then it is a terrible movie! It was like they were walking around photos, there was no reality to it, the actors were terrible, you can literally see the acting, it was super unrealistic! I wanted to watch the movie so bad, I was excited about it but it was torture, I couldn't finish watching it I couldn't continue to waste my time. The stuff characters, the slow motions, the supposed animals that look like horses.....Omg!! And the movie had actors that have done good in other movies, I don't know how this is such a miss!!

title: Snyder Sci-fi Eye Candy
text: If you like Zack Snyder's aesthetics and his taste for drawing on mythology and Joseph Campbell, this is the film for you. My only mild complaint would be how quickly the movie had to move through some parts due to the abbreviated runtime, but this should be fixed by the release of the directors cut. As a huge Star Wars fan, this feels like the mature grown up version of Star Wars I've been waiting for, with a fresh dip into unfamiliar terrain. Deep, stunning to look at, and just the tip of the iceberg! Excited for the future of the franchise! Snyder is truly a filmmaking visionary for our generation.

title: Magnificent what?
text: Considering the storyline is a lift from 7 Samurai/Magnificent 7, you borrowed your universe from Firefly and Warhammer and you clearly had shed loads of budget - how do you make something this clunky?Somebody tell the director his imposter syndrome might be real.Not the worst thing I've ever seen, it's pretty enough in a 'where have I seen that before?' way. I can only imagine they thought they could paper over a weak story and a script chatGPT would laugh at, in post production with a thick layer of cgi - so didn't put the work and necessary critique in at the start.Writer AND Director? I think I see the problem.I vote they ask Jim Henson to do part 2. It would work with Muppets. No, really, certainly couldn't be worse.Anthony Hopkins as the hippy robot (I am so pleased Isaac from The Orville found a new role) was outstanding. He got an appearance fee without his actual face being associated with it.Let this be a lesson to Directors everywhere who forget that if the story is bonkers and the script/acting weak, no amount of special effects lipstick can hide the pig.I am so sorry I was rude about Aquaman. If only I'd seen this first.

title: Can Netflix repay me the cost of electricity I wasted to watch this movie?
text: It is (still) 2023 and now it is hard to come up with new ideas- new story, new effects or new universum. I get it. But this story is just a mix of Star Wars, Harry Potter, Guardians of the Galaxy, Matrix and more. What annoys me the most is the fact that people who created this story do not respect the audience and took all the obvious scenes or motives from epic stories and put in this movie. Even costumes! Bad guys looks like Mr Snyder found costumes from some movie with Nazis in the background and just changed the logo. I should not be surprised because it is another failed Netflix movie but still it is a waste of space.

title: Sadly not Mr. Snyder's best work
text: Sadly disappointing. I usually enjoy Zak Snyder's movies, but this one is very weak. The plot, a mixture of Star Wars - Star Trek - Blade Runner - Dune - Gladiator - Harry Potter - Seven Samurai - with elements of GoT, is very messy. The acting is reasonable though not helped by the poor script that seems, at times, to have been written by a GCSE student. The locations for shooting are beautiful at times and the actions scenes would be great if they were put into slow-mo every-single-time! Overly complex characterisation, weak plot, shocking script and poor cinematography equals a sadly poor film. I won't be rushing to see part 2.

title: So so so disappointed ..what happened
text:
May be I missed the whole thing but it just dragged on I can't believe it ..did no one tell Synder he needed to
Change the movie based on the dailies..movies I had to force myself to watch the movie I just don't get it ..is there a synder cut which actually contains all the awesome bits of the movie ...it was really painful to watch ..the cgi in certain areas really need to be improved ... the whole thing with Jimmi what was the point may they will address is in the second movie .. fight scenes were great but the cliche slow downs just got a little boring .. I found myself even in the action sequences thinking how long will they take to finish ...so disappointed.

title: Great movie
text: I would have to say it is one of the best movies i have seen in 2023. Rebel moon is star wars meets braveheart and gladiator. There were some parts that could have been better and others where it was near perfect. I think the special effects and acting were on point and this should go down as a classic syfi movie. If i could say anything i would have liked to see this as an MA15 movie not M rating. So it could have been a little more violent. But overall i think this movie is one of the best zack Snyder has done. Considering it was meant to be a star wars movie originally, i thimk it is so much better than any of them .

title: If Slow-motion Could Kill
text: The plot is the Equate brand of sci-fi and it shows but what truly killed this movie for me was the cinematography. I could almost tolerate the generic, sci-fi storyline that we have seen countless times before were it not for the constant pointless slow-motion shots that add absolutely nothing but seconds to the runtime. Half of these slow-mo shots are of nothing: the lead landing in slow-mo, the lead drawing their gun in slow-mo, someone turning around in slow-mo, it goes on and on. The lack of a better score and the repeated blunders of the cinematography left me frustrated at the budget they must have wasted all on something that was probably doomed to be underwhelming.The only reason to watch this is to have it playing in the background while you scroll on your phone or read. I have a feeling you will find your attention focused somewhere other than the TV screen halfway through this anyways.

title: All the pretty faces and still a flop
text: I am very confused by this movie. And also why did this get a sequel is beyond me. The line up with all the pretty faces and sadly in my eyes it's still a flop. Main character actress is really just skin and bone in this movie, it's just bothered me so much, back of my mind said, eat please, every time, hard to imagine what makes these producers think, it's believable. All for females roles, but not in this case. Missing some meat on her, honestly and with some of the massive guns, just plain comic, instead.I hope it's not just me, but please if you already have to continue this trend of female badass characters, they need to look the part too. At some point I gave up and left the movie running in the background and not paying any attention and listening to the noise. The storyline was hard to follow in my opinion even the graphics and pretty faces didn't keep me motivated enough to sit through the whole movie. Again, why did this deserve a sequel, I really don't understand.

title: Seven samurai in space with magic, but told badly
text: Generally, it's seven samurai in space with magic, but told badly.A lot of stolen ideas, "plot twists" that you can see from a mile away, storytelling of an eight year old with ADHD.If you have ever seen a movie, you can predict what will happen next. Pretty much, every character is a stereotype.Fights are choreographed awfully and are cutted into oblivion. It's just painful to watch, especially because it looks like a kid playing with action figures, but replayed by actors.A lot of scenes just doesn't make any sense. Things happen because the plot needs to be pushed forward, but it's just stupid.Total waste of time :(

title: A master piece of visual power.
text: Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire" ignites the screen with a visual extravaganza, showcasing Zack Snyder's cinematic prowess. The film's strengths lie in its stunning visuals, epic world-building, and a blend of action and emotion. Snyder's unique directorial style is on full display, creating a captivating sci-fi epic.Visually, the film is a masterpiece. Snyder's knack for crafting breathtaking scenes and using visuals to tell a story is evident throughout. The grandeur of the sci-fi world, coupled with meticulously designed set pieces, immerses the audience in a universe rich with detail. Cinematography and special effects work hand-in-hand to deliver a spectacle that's both visually impressive and narratively engaging.The cast delivers commendable performances, with characters that are both relatable and compelling. The emotional core of the story is well-supported by the actors, particularly the protagonist who evolves into a symbol of resilience. The film successfully balances character-driven moments with adrenaline-pumping action sequences.Action aficionados will find much to appreciate in the film's intense and well-choreographed fight scenes. Snyder's signature slow-motion style adds a distinct flair, enhancing the impact of key moments. The accompanying soundtrack, a Snyder trademark, complements the action, creating a visceral experience that resonates with viewers.However, "Rebel Moon: Part One" is not without its challenges. The ambitious world-building, while visually stunning, may overwhelm some audiences, potentially diluting the impact of the central narrative. The film's runtime is substantial, and at times, the pacing may feel uneven, impacting the overall flow of the story.Additionally, Snyder's penchant for visual spectacle might overshadow character development for some viewers. Certain plot elements, while intriguing, may lack the depth needed to fully resonate. Striking a balance between the grandiosity of the world and the intimate journeys of the characters proves to be a delicate task.Overall: In conclusion, "Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire" stands as a testament to Zack Snyder's cinematic vision. The film offers a feast for the eyes, blending stunning visuals with intense action and emotional depth. While it grapples with the challenges of ambitious world-building and pacing, the overall experience is a thrilling ride that will leave audiences eagerly anticipating the next instalment in this promising sci-fi saga.

title: What did I just watch :/
text: I want to start by saying I love sci-fi and fantasy movie. Love them!But I've been left a little confused by this movie. So much so that I don't even know where to start with this.Firstly, there's no reason for the movie to be this long. It would have been over a lot quicker if it wasn't for all the unnecessary "slow motion" moments. They add nothing to the movie other than to highlight the poor CGI.The story telling was poor. The characters who want to form a team are happy to just watch the others get laid into and... stand around and just watch? It's bizarre.Snyder has his way of working and maybe there's a reason he's not making blockbusters anymore because this just ain't it.

title: Rebel Moon is tasteless but at least redeemable
text: I watched it with low expectations, I think that worked in its favor, although it's still unsatisfactory.It's a stumbling movie that doesn't quite know how to structure the story it wants to tell, and it simply manages by jumping from one place to another through ellipses, where all the interactions between characters are lost, and in the end, you discover that you don't know them. They don't stand out, you don't care about them, they're just participants in the action and nothing more.The structure is clumsy, with flashbacks inserted inorganically and forced, only to try to drive the entire story behind it a little, which doesn't really contribute much to this movie, maybe to the second part, but that remains to be seen.In the end, the best thing that can be said about this movie is that it doesn't make you feel like you've wasted your time, and it doesn't evoke any emotion, you feel nothing once it's over, it just ends.But it announces a second part, which hopefully won't be so disappointing.

title: Budget Warhammer 40k, without any plot.
text: The only thing this movie has going for it is the visuals, though, in some scenes, even that fails. A lot of the scenes seem to 'clean' and 'sterile', making it obvious that this is a movie set with a lot of green screen work.The plot is basically non-existent and amounts to a fetch-quest of "jump from one place to another and pick up random baddasses who will not do a single thing outside of their opening recruitment scene".The plot really feels like it's a script badly written by AI, not actual human beings. If any human with a brain had reviewed the script, and given any amount of care to it, this COULD have been decent. Instead, well, I mean, it's a Netflix film. Were you expecting it to be good?

title: The Revolution? I'm in !
text: Finally a new I. P. where we as fans can get immersed in . The universe that Zack has created in Rebel Moon is truly amazing. I've never been to major on Star Wars or even Dune for that matter, but Rebel Moon just works. This is Zack's love letter to his legacy I feel. Many will call it a copy or watered down version of other popular science fiction movies, but its simply Zack Snyder's own work inspired by those films of the past . And I'm so happy for both him and his wife Deborah Snyder . Beyond ready for the director's cut and I've bought the official novelization companion to explore more into the mythology of Rebel Moon . The cast is stellar and I absolutely adore Sofia . Don't sleep on this film . Honestly I really enjoyed it and can't wait for what's coming next! 10/10!

title: Tired Sci-fi
text: To start, the show is not bad, nor is it good. It is stale. Sci-fi is stuck in a rut. I'm afraid that Star Wars is playing a large part with the issue. It was so innovative and original that other attempts pale in comparison. Even the newer Franchise releases have suffered under the hands of Disney.The original Star Wars developed characters before jumping head on into the saga. We cared and understood the characters. They were also limited to a number that allowed their development. Do we really understand or care about the Rebel Moon participants? Not in my book. We have retread characters that don't measure up to Luke, Lea, ObiWan, Han, and of course Vader.The writing is stale. We need new blood in the Writers Guild. Be innovative and not copy previous themes. I'm afraid Sci-fi may follow a path that Westerns did from the 50s, too many similar themes that caused a hiatus of releases. Perhaps a pause till new material is warranted.

title: Really wanted to love this...
text: I like most of Snyder's stuff and was really excited to hear about this universe he wanted to build when I first heard about it but unfortunately, for me it was a tough watch. It was, just okay.. I really, really wanted to love Rebel Moon.. Kudos to those who enjoyed it though.I'm interested to watch the next two instalments but less excited after watching Part 1. I'm trying to reserve judgement for Pt2 & 3.My take:

title: The waves of fast track shiny junk is just relentless and its exhausting!
