text: The waves of fast track shiny junk is just relentless and its exhausting!I am an avid fan of sci fi, a genre that feels starved of good shows so I'm always hopeful when something new pops up.Now this being a Netflix show I didn't have a lot of expectation but boy was I not prepared for this level of low effort ... everything.Firstly, this feels like a ripoff or melting pot maybe to be more fair, of several well established franchises. It feels like a Warhammer meets Star Wars and others.The graphics/atmosphere is good. The actors do what they can with the moronic pace, characters and plot they were given.That being said, I can find NOTHING else redeeming for this ...thing.The story is fast tracked to the point it feels like snapshots barely hanging on to context and to their previous narrative. The plot is weak. The characters are cringey and unbelievable.As story unfolds and advances, characters and actions are increasingly cringe to the point of ridiculous.The entire world concept is in a perpetual conflict with itself, where technology is both advanced as well as antiquated at the same time.For example you have this all conquering empire that can travel the vast reaches of the galaxy, relentlessly enslaving, yet they can do soil analysis, they can't recognize outlaws, they have unruly robots, moronic and ill prepared 'soldiers'. The regents, while clearly presented as cold blooded genocidal maniacs are somehow also good...The wars presented are intensely fought by infantry despite technology. I mean even Star Wars and Warhammer (where they seem to have borrowed a lot of the looks, motifs, etc.), do a lot better to feel more... advanced...Too bad frankly... Wasted potential & budget :(.

title: A bugs life but in space (and not as good)
text: Drawn out set up, excess exposition, and too much Zack Snyder slo-mo action scenes which also slows the movie down. The further along into the film, the more patience is lost with character introductions, which is a shame because some of the characters you empathize with have to make room. Feels more like a netflix series crammed into a movie. Once the story seems to be picking up, they throw in one of the issues mentioned above to the point where you tune out. I understand this is a part one, and it really feels like it with the amount of set up they're trying to accomplish but at that point this is just the bread getting stale while you wait for your entree.

title: Loved every minute of it!!!
text: I don't get what people are complaining about. It's a fantasy... why are people moaning!! This movie was brilliant. It kept me entertained from the very first minute... You get people who loved Oppenheimer which I thought was absolute garbage, and wanted to fall asleep. When I watch a movie, I just wanna zone out and this movie definitely zoned me out that's for sure. The actions and the soundtrack was on point. I wish I could see this movie in IMAX. It annoys me when I see people give boring movies like Joker rave reviews but this gets slated. This kept me entertained!!!! Loved it!!!! If you love action and special effects then this is for you.

title: Limited plot, lack of cohesive narrative, but enough slow-mo for 3 movies
text: You could make an interesting picture book by matching interesting stills with a decent narrative.Slow-mo. Generally not a fan, but if used 1-2 times in a movie to accent something particular, I can appreciate it. Here each move in each action sequence gets slow-mo treatment that further removes you from any investment in the (already ludicrous) action sequences.I'm struggling to get past the first 1-1.5 hrs, only hanging on based on other review indicating there is something reasonable at the end... but gathering melee weapon street fighters to combat an empire star destroyer?? At least the rebels in Star Wars had X-wing fighters.

title: only efforts at CGI, no money left for the rest?
text: I went into the movie without expectation, hadnt seen a trailer and hadnt read anything about it. I just wanted to see it because it was a scifi movie i didnt knew about.It was very disappointing.A poorly looped story - taken from too many top movies. Weakly cobbled-up characters, with distinctive sayings that should look cool, but sound so trite instead. Whose acting performance is so wrong and unbelievable that one wonders who the director is. And the fight scenes - a minute's silence for the fight scenes. It happens all the time in bad flicks that screenwriters have no idea about physics and, for example, let experienced soldiers look for protection behind wooden tables against plasma guns (like here to). But as soon a slender character parried twice as heavy opponents with wooden movements and can assert themself against several such opponents, then wishful thinking is involved (twice happend). Just like the ridiculous slow motion.All of this together has nipped the movie experience in the bud.Give one star for the cgi, and another one for the nearly empty cinema, so noone disturbed with laughs.

title: Where does this disdain for Zack Snyder come from??
text: Does he re-use themes, stylistic sets and cinematography from his previous films? What director doesn't? Whereas Chris Nolan will get lauded for the look and feel of his films (regardless of diminishing quality) Zack seems to get torn apart for anything that might even resemble 300 or BvS.. and for those that harshly criticize the dialogue or characters and go on to cite the "amazing" dialogue, character development, and acting in any of George Lucas's Star Wars (sarcasm).... well, unfortunately I'm not 7 anymore and I've actually grown up and can recognize poor writing now. Before the uproar from the SW fanboy legion goes off, go back and watch Eps 1-6 and tell me how brilliant Hayden Christianson, jar jar, Luke and Leias romance, and watto. Poor Natalie couldn't even make those lines tolerable. Rebel Moon is a solid sci-fi entry. Watch, enjoy, and accept it for what it is and if you insist on comparing it to other films of the genre, give credit where it is due. Zack created beautiful sets, interesting characters, and told an entertaining story in a galaxy far, far away..

title: How could it go wrong??
text:
First of all. Great CGI, big actors and nice universe. BUTI wouldn't recommend it to anyone, only if they felt bored anyway.Because:
1. It felt rushed, cuz I didn't feel the connection to the characters only the farmer. Gunnar.2. I didn't like that there was so many slow motion scenes.3. I think it was a waste of the actors potential. I can not believe how such a great director managed to make such a bad movie.4. The fight scenes were pretty dull. It felt like the actors weren't tought how to fight properly.I really wish it wasn't so bad, and as I said earlier, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I will watch part 2, and maybe its better or even worse. Who knows?

title: Zack Snyder's next sci-fi saga is a mess but a mesmerizing one.
text: Sprawling space opera that wants to be the next Star Wars so bad that it just rips off Star Wars. With elements taken from The Magnificent Seven, Gladiator, Braveheart, Warhammer, and Jupiter Ascending.Zack Snyder still has an eye for unique visuals and incredible imagery. The various worlds and cultures we encounter are compelling from a design standpoint. The CGI is pretty good for the most part. I saw complaints about the visual effects not looking polished. There may be some wide shots that look suspect. But overall, it doesn't look *that* bad. There is a robot character that is a very good looking effect.But the story feels very incomplete and most of the characters introduced, and there's a lot of them, do not leave an impression. It doesn't help that the movie is very po-faced and serious but not in the ultra gritty way that Snyder can do it like in '300' or 'Man of Steel' that is so over-the-top it becomes fun. Also for an R rated story, it really is not that much more violent than an ultra-light episode of 'GAME OF THRONES'. Oh that's another thing the movie rips off for the political intrigue. It doesn't help there are some GoT alumni in the cast.There are a couple exceptions. Anthony Hopkins voices a robot that is actually an interesting character, but he's in the movie for like five minutes. Charlie Hunnam shows up as someone who looks like he's going to be the Han Solo of the story (there is a part two coming soon). He's alright. But then all of a sudden, he's not the Han Solo of the story. Ed Skrein plays the villain of the movie that is essentially every Imperial officer ever from the Star Wars franchise, plus a little bit of Hans Landa from 'INGLORIOUS BASTERDS' too. He is a cartoonishly evil character but at least he shows something of a personality. Everyone else is not bad per se, but they're very bland.Sofia Boutella handles herself well in the action scenes. But she is saddled with horrendous dialogue and overwrought exposition. In fact, a lot of the script's problems is directly a result of Zack Snyder ignoring a vital rule in storytelling which is "show not tell".I really dug the world that Zack Snyder has created for the plot but I wish that he just gave the audience just five minutes to sink in and settle into this world. Or just to halt the exposition dump for a while.

title: So bad I had to finally create IMDB account
text: Please - give yourself the gift of two hours of life, on me. This show is embarrassingly bad for such a well-known Director. You never knew which theme he was trying to channel. Was it lord of the rings, Star Wars,harry potter, or matrix - it was this weird combination, Almost the entire storyline was one person going to try to build a team to fight the bad guys. I will not waste my time watching the sequel. The directors ability to use light scenery, etc. Is amazing however, applied in this movie was a complete disaster. If Disney was really offered to make this a Star Wars movie, they were smart to say no.

title: This movie is the best to hit Netflix in years
text: The story line, the introduction to the characters will all surely play major roles in the second part, the fighting and action scenes, the things you didn't expect.....all leaves you anxious for what happens next. Fantastic Movie and this current rating of 5.9 is complete and utter nonsense.Not sure how much more you can say without giving anything away but do yourself the favor and watch this movie as soon as possible.If you notice the largest percentage of voters selected 10 out of 10 for this one.Each actor/actress played the hell out of their respective roles and the visuals were astounding.

title: Cheap boring version of The Witcher
text: Too bad for the spent money, this can't even be called "movie", it's cheap, boring, lame, etc. Haven't checked the credits because in got too bored but it really really sounds like The Witcher, has the same slow motion scenes, sounds effects, colors. The horses were so funny because the focus is never put on the nose. The beginning was interesting, went to a total but different direction afterwards and ended with a copy from a different other movie. I don't understand why the lack of ideas, there was so much available time to make a good movie. Also saw the trailer for second part... i'm so excited to see what other movies and soundtracks they copied.

title: B MOVIE
text:
I don't even where to start with this movie. Netflix invested in advertising quite a bit and it seemed like the sci-fi that we've been missing. It's definitely a breath of fresh air to get an exclusive after so long but boy oh boy...
Why is Snyder put on such a pedestal? He has a few good movies but did he really do such a great job with the DCEU?Anyway.. back to rebel moon, visuals are not impressive. Storyline is nothing original. Although they have a few ok actors, it just didn't translate/ deliver. There's a certain Lack of chemistry with the movie, hard to explain but those who have seen it know what I mean. First 20mns were promising but went to crap afterwards, this is a B movie at best.In my opinion, it would have been better as a series.Very mediocre, uninteresting, not captivating, nothing innovative!!!

title: Disney turned it down for a reason
text: Rebel Moon is a boring movie with bad acting, special effects and a terrible script. It reminds me of Jupiter Ascending, which was also an expensive piece of burning garbage.Zach Znyder has been overrated since Watchmen, but this is his worst film yet, by a good margin.The backdrops look really fake, and the 3D effects are a mixed bag. Some look pretty good while others look like a video game from 2006. The only really good things about this movie is the sound-design, which I actually think is rather impressive. The worst part is the script though: They say all the quiet parts out loud and there are 0 surprises in the plot. Sharknado has a better story than this. 1/10, hope they cancel part 2.

title: Snyder's Seven Samurai (or less)
text: I'm not a Zack Snyder fan. I've only seen two films from him and I hold them in high regards. Rebel Moon essentially follows a ex-soldier who goes on a journey to recruit a band of outlaws to aid her in a quest to bring down her former empire after they plan to ransack her village of their needs. Basically Seven Samurai or A Bug's Life if you will.The story is big, very big. We go through multiple planets to recruit these outlaws and each planet is very distinct from one another. The problem is, with a story this big you naturally have some parts underdeveloped and oh boy, do some characters get massively sidelined here. Our main characters that we're supposed to root for, don't have distinct personalities to begin with, in fact, almost all of them have no personalities at all! I get the sense that maybe Snyder wants to expand upon them in the next installment but this is not conventional storytelling. You have to get us familiarized with these characters in order for us to get invested in them, especially when the movie is trying to have some emotional moments with them. Another point I want to mention here is the acting, there are some really talented actors here, but they all feel very wooden here as if they're just phoning it in for the paycheck.The VFX are acceptable, I appreciated some of the practical effects here but from an ~83M+ budget (Both films share a 166M+ budget), I've seen better from the likes of "The Creator", which had the same amount of budget as this had. There are some decently handled action scenes and a lot of that trademark Zack Snyder slo-mo that he just can't make a single film without (Except maybe Dawn of the Dead) but not a lot inventive ones. There is a clear visual style with each planet they travel to; There's an industrial planet along the likes of "Blade Runner 2049"; a desert-like landscape that recalls the video-game "Monster Hunter" and the villain here is very nasty, helped by reliable Ed Skrein in the role whose attire recalls a certain group of Germans from the 1940s.Overall, a wannabe-epic that squanders over the weight of its own story. It fails to distinguish itself by simply not having enough of anything. It's very self-indulgent by Snyder and I do think he's getting a load of himself here but I enjoyed most of it. I am somewhat interested in the extended cut Snyder is planning to release some time in the future that will hopefully fix some of my problems that I had with this version. I'd say check this one out as a no-brainer, it's not peak Sci-fi but hey, its something.

title: Rips off everything...
text: Clichéd. Actually managed to feel like a much inferior Battle Beyond the Stars. It was trying hard not to be Star Wars, by not showing deserts, or lots of space scenes, but instead forests and lots of rain soaked places.I found myself expecting the "twists" as there was nothing new, and the attempts at accents were a joke, Charlie Hunnam's "Irish" and of course the bad guys on the planet, having an Afrikaans accept. Guess these are the new stereotype bad guys!Can't really say I cared about anyone, so I didn't care who lived or who died.To my mind ripped of the look of everything from Star Trek TNG to Fantasy movies. But then this is the man who gave us Sucker Punch!Took me a few goes to sit through it, as it just wasn't gripping. A lot of wasted talent, who didn't do much.

title: Stay away from this rubbish
text: So much filth and so much violence makes you wonder what happened to the children who like this kind of films, what kind of mental problems they have and whether they are dangerous to others and to themselves. I'm sorry, but this is a show for violent psychopaths only. Script repeated a thousand times, characters without personality, senseless violence only as a spectacle for sick minds. The references to The Seven Samurai, which you'll read in a review, is a real insult to Akira Kurosawa. To Star Wars? That's a joke.Seriously, don't waste your time and keep your brain away from this rubbish.

title: Great visual experience, nice graphics, a story to continue.
text: A story to go, graphics are very nice, I like the slow motion effects, characters are very alien, I really like how the story is told. Zack is well known for his graphics on the movies, shots, the CGI accuracy, from 300 Spartans to Justice League his cut. He always pick actors that match the characters, he has a good eye for it, a good match. I'm curious about the cut of this movie, some more action in more detailed run. I don't see any association with other movies. It's unique in many aspects. The future image far from where we are now. I'm curious how far will it go, both in story and Galaxy. Enjoy the movie, I consider is worth of a view.

title: Movie lacks depth and Story is Rushed
text:
Just been watching this highly anticipated Rebel Moon and right from the beginning something was off. It reminds me of Star Wars episode 4 "A New Hope" but there is no character development what so ever nor any of the EPICNESS of George Lucas' "Star Wars"
The bad guys are like obvious Nazis that can't seem to shoot straight and the heroine is unhittable for some reason. Moreover you have no idea if this is a Sci-Fi Space Opera or something like Avatar because of the constant switching back and forth of movie genres.The story seems VERY Rushed and there is no obvious build up to scenes, there is not provided understanding of the type of Universe this is and who the enemy that this Homeworld is fighting.It reminds me also of Dune but there is no presentation of what these Religous looking people in the masks are about, why they are traveling with the Dreadnought or how do they fit into the whole context of the story.Very disjointed and disappointing film from Zack Snyder and his writing team that I expect better from.

title: Bad movie: A rare case of honest bad reviews by critics.
text: It has been a while since I have reviewed a title, this one because I am a fan of Zack Snyder - I had to. I think in the end there will be a debate about director's cut and stuff, but this one is not only about how this movie was chopped at the editing room - but nothing also really works, action scenes are blend, really weak, the story is non-existent, the world building is interesting but never quiet convinces, the secondary characters have no role... I was really excited about this one, but I am starting to think Mr. Snyder needs to find his spark back.Simply put it as it stands - a bad movie!

title: Nothing good with this movie
text: A movie where everything has gone wrong.First the story. It had (and I think still has) great background. But the overall story of this first movie makes no sense. I mean why on earth a single village would even think of resisting an empire that is in power for 1000 kings (so at least 10000 years). It just makes no sense.Then come to the acting. Man they had almost no emotion. Sofia Boutella, come on! At least try to connect to the scenes you are acting. Others actors also didn't do that good, however, many of them didn't get enough screen time.The action scenes are also totally unrealistic. I think even Tamil (an Indian movie industry known for unrealistic action sequences) movies are more realistic than this.While Zac Snyder has some good movies, I think he messes things up a lot when it comes to pure sci-fi. He messed up the Justice League, now this one.

title: It's got a great premise but needs work.
text:
I was excited for Rebel Moon, and I gave it a full focused watch because with Zack Snyder films you need to pay attention. Let's start with the good: The casting is well done - Sofia Boutella is the perfect Kora, her emotions and skilled fight scenes represent the character so well. And it's great to see Ray Fischer in a new role and he looked so cool. Also, the overall story/premise is very interesting as well and has potential to be an epic series. But that's about it on the positives.Now the negative: The writing just feels very amateur. There's a lot of deep moments and dialogue throughout the movie that's very moving and touching, but the way it's written is a bit cringey. I said the casting was amazing, but that's tainted a bit with the dialogue they've been given. I hope for Part 2 they really focus on the writing to improve it significantly. I'm not sure if it's because Netflix got involved, which does happen unfortunately like with WB did with his previous work. The cinematography while great most of the time, feels a bit odd at times with this blurry effect when something is out of focus, I'm not sure if that's intentional, but I don't really see it adding anything to the story or mood. The fight scenes could have been much better. Only Kora's fight scenes were epic and well done. Everyone else's felt a bit too step by step and not action-packed enough for such an epic battle.As a big fan of Zack Synder's work, I was expecting more. However, there's definitely potential here as I said above for it to be an awesome sci-fi series. There's still lots of story to tell, and lots of
interesting characters they can deep dive into. But I really hope with Part 2 they really fix the writing and camera effects.

title: All Glimmer, No Glory: Rebel Moon Falls Short of Sci-Fi Majesty
text: Snyder's "Rebel Moon" blasts off with stunning visuals, but crash-lands on predictable plotlines and hollow characters. Kora's rebellion feels like a greatest hits of sci-fi, lacking the spark of originality. Every twist is telegraphed, leaving the audience adrift in a sea of déjà vu. While the action sequences are undeniably epic, they're smothered in CG, sacrificing grit for spectacle. Dialogue clunks with exposition, spoon-feeding the story instead of letting it unfold. Underdeveloped characters, mere archetypes in costumes, fail to ignite emotional investment. "Rebel Moon" might ignite a flicker of potential, but Part One is a forgettable journey through a familiar galaxy. Skip it unless you crave Snyder's signature visuals or a sci-fi nostalgia trip.

title: Rip off of Bugs life
text: Rebel moon is a bad put together version of the Disney classic bugs life. Instead of it being ants and grasshoppers it's Farmers and space people😂 Grow the crops, give us the crops, the hero of the colony goes and finds "warriors" to fight the the space people...Hello?? This is just a worse version of Bugs life and I can't believe no one has noticed it.Everything about this movie is poor and boring. Seriously no effort was put into this movie. The cast is the only good thing about the movie but even that doesn't hide the fact this film is so boring😂 Every single scene in this movie feels like it's been shorten there's no excitement at all. Just another failed sci-fi film that can't live up to the classics.

title: Very simple review
text: Magnificent Seven meets Clash of the Titans with a late 80s/early 90s Enya-esque sound track. "Meets" is an understatement. Truly, it's as if somebody asked ChatGPT to script and design a SciFi movie, and the prompt said "redo Magnificent Seven in the style of Clash if the Titans". And recycle some used Star Wars set leftovers. Nothing much else to see here, so move along. Impossible to sit through the whole thing without hurting your jaw during the yawns. I can't believe somebody thought this would fly. I'm sure the under 12 crowd love it, actually no, that is unfair. A lot of kids have good taste and have seen a lot of movies. Also a lot of borrowed costume and make-up design. Some good character actors in this one. Not sure how they got pulled in. This is the worst movie I have seen i years.

title: 8 Stars
text: The movie was Fantastic, with immaculate visuals, and flawless acting. The action scenes are like the combination of Batman V Superman: Dawn of Justice and Zack Snyder's Justice League, The story is not original but the transitions of every scene are very pure, This movie is much better than Rogue One and other Star Wars movies that came after, Zack delivers again, and never disappoints. ONLY SNYDER HATERS and MARVEL FANS are saying that this movie was bad, Me and my colleagues love the movie, the funny thing is we're not even die-hard Snyder fans. I'm gonna watch it again later... can't wait for the uncut version though.

title: Out and out rip off of 7 Samurai, and the Magnificent 7
text:
This has a good cast, but it is not so loosely based on the Seven Samurai (1954), the first truly great western.Poor farmers (although in this flick they all look pretty buff, rich, good looking thin, not poor, hard scrabble skinny.) bullied by space bandits etc, etc...."We'll be back in 12 weeks for your harvest, ... or else"....
Sooo, the farmers send our heroine and one of their own on a mission to recruit 7 samurai to, well, .... just look up a synopsis of 7 Samurai (or The Magnificent 7) and you'll have this space version sorted. Space version, indeed...we've seen all the green screen cgi action/stunts before. Kind of a pity though, the performances are good, the cast is good, but the writing is not. Intended for the young kids....to bring along a new generation....and they are welcome to it.All is not lost though, this is Inspiration to watch Seven Samurai again.

title: Totally garbage
text:
Very bad characters development
This movie is fully disappointed in its PG 13
I saw this because of R Rated action
Only villain role was better and his scene's of killing were also PG 13. Only sword fight and slow motion is good nothing more.Please join my team what the hell
Even action is also poor
I really waited for very long time but this movie disappointed me.Zack Snyder make best
I didn't enjoy the movie
Very sad because I am Zack's fan but I will also watch part 2 no matter how they will make
We will happy to see army of the dead sequel instead of rebel moon.I hope it won't disappoint in part 2.

title: This movie is just bad
text: What is happening with movies, there have been so many flops by big name directors, and Rebel Moon is no exception. The only character I connected with was the robot that didn't even have any parts minus his 5 minutes of introduction.Gosh this movie was just so bad, please watch it for yourself, but one person said it was like they had scripts from several sci fi movies and they Frankenstein'd them together. That was a very accurate description of how disjointed this movie was.I am always skeptical of reviews, because they are so subjective, in my opinion, if you liked Rogue One, Dune(remake), or Edge of Tomorrow this movie will leave you disappointed. I loved Army of the Dead, I know Synder has it in him, not sure what happened here.

title: Seven Samurai: overcooked yet still undone
text:
OK let me be the first to draw the parallels between this flick and Akira Kurosawa's 'Seven Samurai'. A village needs protection, a farmer and a warrior assembling a ragtag band to defend the villagers...
The dialogues are unconvincing, the characters are shallow, the plot - is flat and basic. Everyone seems eager and happy to join this apparently suicidal mission without much convincing or thinking. "Hey, let's fight an evil empire! Oh yeah! Count me in!" This is very disappointing, considering the amount of visual effects. I guess if you are a teenager - you might enjoy this feeble drivel, but it is not for hardcore sci-fi fans. The makeup was also not up to the task. This move will go on the same shelf as Jupiter Ascending I am sure.

title: Had High Hopes
text: I'm an avid sci-fi / fantasy reader and fan. I hate to say it but this was awful. The actors did the best they could but that script and the world building wasn't there. It was a total rip off of Star Wars meets Foundation with a Thanos & Gamora relationship at the root driving the protagonist. I didn't care about any of the characters. Great sci-fi and or fantasy all have one thing in common and that's the world being meticulously designed in a creative and interesting way. There was nothing about this world that was original or memorable. The world just didn't feel lived in by anyone. This lacked passion, creativity, and imagination. I was really excited about this film and it was a total disappointment.

title: Freakin' beautiful
text: I'm not sure what bottled lightening others expect, but I think this is one of the best sci-fi epics (part 1!!!) that will grow into a cult following once people see past the bs and just appreciate the movie for what it is.The slow motion, lens flare aside (genuinely not as excessive as many seem to exaggerate) the planets, the ideas, the robots, the brain bug, the other robots, the battles, hell even the bad guys are just plain cool.Don't believe the negative press, this is a space opera in the.making. My only suggestion is maybe wait for part 2 and binge it - if you're like me you'll not want to wait another 4 months.Is there going to be a part 3, part 4, part 5??? Dear god, let this be so...Meanwhile, to the people who were amazed by stars wars as a kid you need to realise part of the magic was BECAUSE you were a kid. Find your inner kid again and stop over analysing sci-fi, it's supposed to be entertaining, not perfection. This ticks every box apart from having Carrie Fisher and Harrison Ford who (let's be honest) carried a slightly hammy Star Wars to greatness. Greatness is in Rebel Moon, and I sincerely hope we see it grow into something as ground-breaking as Empire and Jedi.

title: Reddit has better fan fiction that this...
text: This project was pitched to Lucasfilm by Zack Snyder.... and Kathleen Kennedy finally got something right.This movie is a mess... It is plagiarism more than fan fiction honestly... Wild that they would plagiarize some of the best movies and character made and end up with something I would only re-wacth as part of a drinking game...What s odd is that i feel like this couldve "kinda" work as a TV show... I mean 2 3hish movies couldve been made to a 13 episodes show... Given that half of part one is fetch/recruitment it would have allowed to focus on each character with more dedicated time spent on each of them.Instead we get this.... A movie that rips from amazing films but somehow end up looking a like a it was put together by 6 dudes on reddit fan fiction section who were ended $150M.

title: Mish mash of Sci fi movies... Keep expectations low.
text: Rebel moon is a mish mash of movies and personally I found it left me with similar feelings over this production.You take a dollop of Star Wars, Seven Samuarai, Lord of the Rings, Potter, John Carter of Mars and Avatar, then just mix them altogether to get this film. So clearly for the maturer viewers of this film, we've seen it all before. To summarise the story it surrounds a young lady out to gather a group of Rebels together to take on a mighty but unconvincing invading empire. So you've heard it all before.Thel most impressive part of the film is clearly the special effects, which unsurprisingly are very good albeit some ropey moments too, but in this age that's not enough.The problem for me is two key aspects. The acting & dialogue is woeful, and really the producers could have taken just a bit of time to improve this and we'd have had a decent film.Quite frankly I just mentally switched off throughout much of it. I was mostly unimpressed but it's still watchable.With so little out at present and this being on Netflix, I guess it won't cost to watch it. Just go in with low expectations.

title: Trys too hard
text: If a movie could try too hard to be an epic, this would be the perfect example. So much story packed into weak writting, it stank of desperation to create a new saga worthy of the budget. Sadly, it failed. The acting wasn't horrible, but the casting wasn't great. The story was rather cliche, and in all honesty lacked any reason to invest in a second or third follow up. No real plot twist that you could not see coming from a mile away. On the brightside, the cinematography was decent, save far too many slow motion scenes. The world creation was ok, but nothing even close to original. Star wars, firefly, Battlestar galactic, star trek, the matrix and even Harry Potter all made appearances. Over all, not even worth a watch.

title: Where is Tom Cruise?
text: In this "Cocktail" Tom Cruise would be missing to try to save something.A meaningless mishmash of "The Seven Samurai" and "Star Wars" as the main ingredients and numerous films of the worst anime as companions to season a meaningless cocktail.Even as an acolyte of Snyder's visual imagery, you cannot justify wasting more than two hours of your life in this story that would perhaps be visible as an animated series in thirty-minute chapters, but even seeing it as a pilot episode does not have enough interest to watch the second part; which (unfortunately) given my masochistic side of finishing what I started I will end up doing, at least to find out the story of the horned android.

title: PURE Awesomeness
text: Well, no spoilers, or just a bit, don't you worry, the movie is short, felt like it needed a cool 3 or 4 hours to really enjoy it. Worry not, Snyder's cut is coming, and we all know it won't dissapoint.As for Part 1: Just forget or don't read what critiques write about the movie. They wouldn't know a good movie right in front of them. They have poor taste cause why post negative reviews yet this is an awesome movie, full of great action packed scenes, the first one comes 30 minutes into the movie, so patience is required, but after, it's intense, as we see the slow build up of the main characters roles.Definitely worth your time.

title: Disappontingly boring
text: This movie is filled with good cgi, decent characters and great actors. Unfortunately the story is sub par, and the movie's pace is all over the place. Everyone other scene is on another planet, so the result is that it both rushes and drags at the same time. Overuse of slow motion as seen in Justice League, it feels like it has been added to extend the lenght of the movie.Charlie Hunnam is good in this, but there is No explanation to why everyone is joining the quest, they are so easily swayed it is kinda wierd. I cant remember a single name of a single character, and disappontingly, the movie is just plain boring.

title: WAY Worse Than I Thought It Would Be
text: I've not heard too many good things about this movie but I had to watch for myself and come up with my own opinion.The people are NOT wrong. It's terrible. Like REALLY, terribly, horribly, dull and BAD.If the 2nd part is as bad as this one that's gonna be a rough watch. So Far I don't know why on earth this needed to be broken into two parts? It was so incredibly dull and dragging that before it was even half over my mind was on a hundred other things, this just didn't hold my interest at all and I LOVE sci-fi movies. I couldn't wait for it to be over.Every actor/character in this movie is not only forgettable, they're not even likable. They were so unappealing. It seemed like even they didn't want to be there.The acting was terrible, especially from the main character, Kora. Every lame, eye rolling, cliche pose and stupid saying you can think of in movies, she did them all. Terribly. I don't mean to completely crack on her though, I don't know her or her other work. Perhaps her horrible character was at the direction of Zack Snyder? Maybe he thinks that's great acting? Wouldn't surprise me given his other movies...And the HORRIBLE CGI / special effects... Is EVERYTHING filmed in front of a green screen nowadays? Newsflash, it doesn't look good! This was particularly bad.Filmmakers of the 70's and 80's did WAY better work with so much less.The best part of the movie is when it went off and there were almost 12 minutes of credits. That's 12 minutes I got to fast forward through and not watch.There's something about Netflix movies... Very rarely does Netflix kick out a movie where I think "Man, that was a great movie, I need to tell everyone how good it was." This was no different.So awful. I can't believe this is what passes as good filmmaking in the 2020's. C'mon, man.Just my silly opinioin.

title: What a shame
text: I was really looking forward to this film. I ignored my fears that releasing straight to Netflix meant it would be bad and held out hope. If this was a low budget sci fi or a tongue in cheek space opera it might be forgiven but sadly this was a serious attempt to make a major sci epic. For a director like Snyder to release a film so badly produced and directed is inexcusable. It lacks soul, finesse or story line. The acting is sub par, the action is clunky, the fight scenes are poorly choreographed and telegraphed and the special effects aren't good enough to make up for Many scenes seem to be lifted directly from other films and the whole film is riddled with cliches and over used tropes.This was originally conceived as a 2 part Star Wars film and I'm so so glad it was turned down.

title: Zack Snyder, the director of Man of Steel, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, and Zack Snyder's Justice League, has created his own sci-fi universe at Netflix with the two-pa
text: Zack Snyder, the director of Man of Steel, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, and Zack Snyder's Justice League, has created his own sci-fi universe at Netflix with the two-part series Rebel Moon. The series follows Kora, a conquered people fighting for their freedom on another planet. Snyder's interest in spiritual, erotic, and kinetic pop mythology serves revenge as a vision. Rebel Moon resembles numerous familiar sci-fi adventure tales but has a unique energy and imagination. As Kora gathers forces, her allies, including bounty-hunter Kai, disgraced General Titus, maternal warrior Nemesis, cagey pacifist Gunnar, revolutionary Darrian Bloodaxe, and enslaved royal Tarak, are introduced in stirring episodes. These sequences, along with Kora's flashbacks, evoke a compendium of movie and biblical myths, setting the background for a familiar legacy of conquest and liberty. Snyder, as his own cinematographer, creates a lusty narrative that resembles Frank Frazetta's fantasy art. His sensual daring, including white clouds and planets, creates kineticism and wonder that resembles The Thief of Bagdad. The film features Tarak tames an enormous gryphon, achieving 3D closeness without 3D. Snyder's signature motif of particles floating in prelude to violence adds to the thrill. Snyder, a renowned filmmaker, has a unique ability to create visually striking films that captivate audiences. His imagery blends elements from A Hidden Life and Geronimo: An American Legend, combining lyrical, hostile, and historical elements. His visual-kinetic excitement surpasses the works of George Lucas, Peter Jackson, and the Wachowskis. Rebel Moon, a film that stands out for its movement and spectacle, is particularly striking. The expressiveness of Kora's flashbacks, conveying her emotional need and mystery, surpasses the juvenile tomboy gestures of Daisy Ridley's Rey in the Star Wars saga. Rebel Moon by Zack Snyder addresses the issue of Hollywood's obsession with action-movie distractions, a trend that began with George Lucas's Star Wars franchise. Despite its popularity, the franchise's artistic potential was squandered when Lucas sold the franchise to Disney, leading to mass-reproduction and diminishing artistic results. Snyder's approach to action and sensual mythology in Rebel Moon, combined with his visual poetry, makes it a triumph over the Marvel, Harry Potter, and Lord of the Rings movies, which have also achieved box office success but with diminishing artistic results. "Rebel Moon-Part One: Child of Fire," the first half of Zack Snyder's planned Star Wars sequel, is praised for its action-figure-deep heroes. After 133 minutes, the film features Akira Kurosawa in space, but with storyboard perfection and a focus on visual scale, despite a lack of eye-catching details. The film is a satisfying addition to the Star Wars franchise. "Rebel Moon" by Snyder and co-writers Shay Hatten and Kurt Johnstad is a formulaic film that often looks more like an animated pitch for a movie than an actual movie. The film follows the space farmers who fail to resist a visiting party of space fascists, representing the Motherworld's formerly great colonial power. The space farmers are led by Corey Stoll, a brawny character, and Admiral Atticus Noble, a pale goose-stepper with a short temper and an army at his back. The film's big, corny, and ungainly plot makes it difficult to enjoy and enjoy. "Rebel Moon" is a visually appealing film that excels when it revolves around objects crashing into or flying above each other. However, the transition from storyboard to screen has not preserved the fun and affection that likely went into the creation. The characters' perverse humor and sincerity are difficult to empathize with. Heroes like Kora are used to justify the prefab epic-ness, but they do not make the film move faster towards its cliffhanger ending. Snyder's film focuses on style-guide features like cleavage, haircuts, and accents, rather than the characters. Some actors like Hunnam and Stoll contribute, but dialogue is constantly expository, threatening plot. Kora is the main character, but other characters establish interest in post-Star Wars themes of resistance, hope, and compassion through bumpersticker dialogue and G. I. Joe poses. The movie's plot is primarily driven by Kora, with other characters contributing to the film's overall appeal.

title: The low rating of this movie is quite unfair, it deserves at least a bit more
text: I consider this a 6.5, even a 7, at least because of the great visuals. Not only that, it does also have a certain decency in its script and lines, where many other better-rated movies fail. All of you who have voted this 2,3, or 4...you must be so smart, wow! ...to consider this movie such an insult to your great intelligence.Honestly, it is not fair at all for this movie to have this low rating, a lot of work was invested in it. It's such a shame it has become a trend to be mean with reviews...you must feel so important your voice was heard. I hope with my rating I am able to increase a bit the general score - I am happy I watched it. I almost didn't because of the unfair rating.

title: Did Netflix budget it?
text: Take Battle Beyond the Stars (1980) and mix with Star War episodes 3 and 4, put some strange film characters from Dune(2021 and previous releases) in the crew of Imperium commander Atticus Noble, the soldiers and the ones with covered head with exotic helmets seems to be rented from Dune. Kai the mercenary pilot is clearly Han Solo bad copy, Tawau-class freighter a new version of star ship Millennium Falcon (Chewbacca was left behind but hope to see his bad clone in part 2), Atticus Noble is a bad copy of our sweet Darth Vader and Regent Balisarius is mix of Palpatine and Leto Atreides from Dune, I can list more bad copies but so far this the scared I can describe. To make things worst, Jimmy(JC-1435) a cherfull droid in the begining of this funny production was ordered to wash his face (a machine need to wash his face?) in a streamlet and meeting with Sam a farm girl who afferd him a wreath of flowers, was it very cute and human??? And in the end the droid show up with deer horns rented directly from Netflix Sweet Tooth series. The writers Zack Snyder, Kurt Johnstad and Shay Hatten really did a hard work in mix diffent succesfull movies in a terrifing bad production, did Netflix budget it?

title: 10 out of 10 Masterpiece!
text:
Amazing story and visuals held togueter with great actors and performances.Most of the negative reviews are just soy boys with t levels so low they can't fadom a movie being enjoyable and have amazing visuals without tipping their fedora and add a label of "style over substance" and call it a day by sleeping on a room filled with their flatulences so confident on their intellectual superiority
Yeah is the 7 samurais in star wars!Yeah some things about the plot don't make sence
But the style and passion is in every frame
You can tell this a passion project that everything is made according to an original vision.I really enjoyed it!

title: Just plain bad.
text: Plot line is well,The Magnificent Seven in space. Exact same storyline just done very poorly.Acting is mediocre at best. Charlie Hunnan can't decide what accent he wants to use. Switches from Irish to just a garbled mess. In the village all the men are scared cowards and the only one willing to fight is a woman. Yea, realistic as all get out. The movie seems to be a cross of Star wars, Dune and B- movies. Cantina scene and cloud city are obvious rip offs of the Star wars franchise. The speeders crossing the plains same sound effects and visual imagery. Bounty hunters? Can we say Mandalorian?Main problem here is that there is absolutely nothing new. Everything has been stolen from other classic films.

title: Why the hate ?
text: Very entertaining and enjoyable movie. I'm not understanding the negative comments by some saying basically they can't follow along with the movie. Fortunately for me I had no problem following the story line because I'm not 3 years old. Watch the movie decide for yourself don't read the negative comments judge for yourself. I'm looking forward to part 2 in April and also the director cuts of both films. I am a Snyder fan though so maybe my views are a little biased. Either way the movie is not hard to follow it is a good story I would recommend to any fans of sci fi that this is a movie you would enjoy.

title: Perfect example of what cinema has become
text: I went to the +8 reviews section out of curiosity, just to see if some people could possibly find something positive in this. Had a blast ! That is scary and reflects a major part of the audience that we have to deal with because this kind of movie overflows more and more on streaming platforms.After half an hour long, I knew this was a bad movie suffering from the disease that is consuming cinema these days. Tons of money wasted to provide mediocre entertainment to people willing to swallow it without looking further than what they're watching.I mean everyone that has some culture in movies and some good references can tell, after few minutes in, that this is going to be a disaster :And the list could go on...

title: Television Backwash?
text: I'm sure most fans of TV/Film has tuned into a TV show and been pleasantly surprised to discover one or more AAA actors involved in the project. Equally pleasant is a high quality film maker directing the majority of a TV project, like the criminally underrated Devs (2020). Same can be said of any number of filmmakers transitioning elegantly to the smaller screen.But what about the other way? Has anyone ever said, "Wow, that movie reminded me of a TV show! And it was so good!" No! No one ever said that!And that is what we have here. We essentially two or three episodes of a TV show crammed together to try and make the first installment of a movie franchise. Zack Snyder really should of known better, especially with a writing credit. While it's not a complete disgrace? It is all around bad, and I'd argue the biggest problem is the approach. That, by the way, is a failure of production and a failure of leadership.Rebel Moon gets off to an astonishingly boring first 15 minutes... that sets the pace for the entire experience. People standing on green screens talking. This is not a story that needed Any science fiction in the first place. It's a story that has been told better many times in period pieces like Braveheart. Chronicles of Riddick is also a comparison, but Riddick has the protagonist already in place, played by a Super popular actor at that time. It also dove into the science fiction right from the start, not... farming! Rebel Moon... is so... average... I'm actually irritated - don't do the genre like that!I think the make up/costuming is good - but it's hard to recognized any merit among the abundance of mediocrity.Acting is wooden. Characters are two dimensional. Scenes are bland. The content can be cherry picked to make a decent trailer, but thats about it.

title: Found Lacking
text: It had the potential to be great with fairly good CGI and some what ok background but it lacked everything else. The story was so slow, predictable and dull that i checked three times for when the movie will end during viewing. The story was rushed without giving proper charecter development and background explanation and yet the movie went at a snails pace. From begining till end the movie ate up time with bunch of visuals without context. The action genre always has things in common but this movie cherry picked all the negative aspects of the genre. Action and violance without premise without perpous just to show some fighting scene and they weren't even epic. The movie was so one sided logically that people just might want the good guys to die quicker so the movie might end a bit earlier.Summery: Could have been great but every thing is messed up in the most boring way possible.

title: I won't say "don't waste your time", but... I believe I just did.
text: It's been a very long while since I haven't watched a movie till the end.It lacks originality, the characters are random the timings and everything happens without a reason yet everything starts matching perfectly.As I left at the middle, sounded as a bad RPG adventure where you're gathering the party, but everything surrounded by lame excuses, bad motto, tacky profiles, pseudo-phylosophical conversations, and all overused archetypes and references for every fantasy/sci-fi movie released in the last 20 years.The budget is good enough for you to feel sorry for the feable results right from the scratch.I won't say "don't waste your time"

title: Netflix is wasting our investment
text:
Dear Netflix,I trust this review finds you well.Rebel Moon as you know has been panned for its highly derivative plot lines and bad scripting. As i am sure you knew well in advance of fully committing to this production.Some have been gracious to say the design and special effects are good. I would not say this - again lacking originality and depth. Reminiscent of the awful art design created by Zack during his DC stomp.Ordinally i do not rate nor review - for as mum used to say "if you haven't got something nice to say do not say anything at all". However given my continuing downward impression of Netflix, i thought i might dangle my toe in the waters of Grumpy Internet Person.To my point: Dear Netflix would you please stop wasting our investment in you. I struggle to justfy the subscription fees as there is nothing worth watching on your service anymore.With kind regards
Adrian.

title: A real disapointment
text: Please, please let someone who isn't paid on production review movie ideas before they get made? This is star wars minus the character engagement, or well developed characters, or even chemistry between characters.I understand that its part of a series and that all will be explained in subsequent chapters, but it doesn't hang together.The action scenes are very expensive, but without character engagement they don't mean much. There is no chemistry between the two "leads." The emotional connection to the crew is missing as well.I feel like I need to say something nice, the costumes were well done, the titles were legible and.

title: Wonderful new world Snyder created
text: There was plenty of introduction to the characters, without it being boring, and I did not long for them to get on with it like some movies. It was a great understandable story, not confusing. There were not too many characters and stories. I found it a great, relatable world and very relatable characters. I care what happened to them, There were great fight scenes, lots of action, as expected. Also as expected there was a few slow motion moments, not too many. There were great visual effects, as expected from Snyder. There were just enough little wonderful moments, to make you care about the characters and the story. Satisfactory ending, not some horrible cliff hanger.

title: WHAT AN EPIC WASTE
text: The film's failure is rooted in a glaring oversight by executives who greenlit a weak script. It presents a muddled narrative, devoid of clear direction and substance, diverging from the fundamentals of engaging storytelling. Characters, introduced haphazardly, lack depth, meandering through a plot that feels aimless and uninspired. This leads to forced, unconvincing dramatic scenes. A clichéd, predictable conclusion only underscores the script's inability to captivate or innovate. It's a clear misallocation of resources, a stark reminder of the importance of a solid script in filmmaking, and a missed opportunity to create something truly memorable.

title: Leave your high hopes at the door
text: I had waited for this with anticipation, but I should have known better from a Zack Snyder / Netflix product.The first hour is very, very boring and the cinematography appalling - Zack don't try this yourself again please.The CGI comes from some kind of kids movie with the worldscape really cheap, cardboard and unconvincingThe take on an Amish / Scandi village , somewhere between Witness and Vikings was puerile - as was the introduction of Afrikaners as the baddies, whih kind of telegraphs there demiseThe only saving grave was Sofia Boutella and the classy under used Anthony Hopkins bot.From there the plot and the acting from the other "stars" got progressively worse, especially the Newcastle born Charlie Humdrum whose attempt at an Ulster accent as well as his cardboard acting only deserves contempt.This film also reminds me why we don't we see much of Ed Skrien ( replace with Harry Lloyd please as baddies should be a parody or evil , pick one) and the person who replaced him in Game of Thrones Michiel Huisman, is terribley miscast, unless I am missing something, other wise it's just a badly written waste of his talent.Even the ever reiable. Djimon Gaston Hounsou phoned in his part.Snyders attempt to replicate the original. John Sturges take on The Seven Samurai was appalling, with his episodic back stories being plain boring, daft and just providing a disjointed narrative, if there is one.Sturges managed to make a film of several almost stand alone stories helped by his stellar cast, but Snyder is no Sturges.Lets hope that part two is better as I can't imagine it being much worse.

title: Derivative and Underwhelming
text: If there is one thing to thank the Heavens for, it's that Zack Snyder didnt get the chance to completely ruin the Star Wars franchise the way be ruined Batman with Ben Affleck in the helm.This movie show zero creativity. It's basically an amalgam of other, better and more successful movies.You will recognize rip offs of not just Star Wars, but Dune, Masque of the Red Death, Avatar, you name it.And if you can sit through the endless horrible slow motion action scenes, you are a better person than I.None of the creatures or characters are original. Every scene is taken from somewhere else in cinematic history.Snyder just isn't a good writer/director. Plain and simple. And wasn't this first supposed to be a motion picture an then a mini TV series but it was so mediocre it wound up on Netflix?Glad I don't have to invest in Part Two. Can't wait for the Dune 2.

title: Godawful mess
text: I honestly don't know how this got made. As many have noted the story, the dialog, the pacing, the acting, the blatant rip-offs from superior films- it's just a godawful mess.I made it a little more than halfway through and found I was looking at Instagram more and more more since the film couldn't keep my attention. The plot was silly and Swiss cheesed with holes. So many enormous gaps in logic or actions by the characters. I found myself caring less and less as the minutes crawled by like the umpteen pointless slo-mo shots. JJ Abrams has his lens flares, Snyder has his slo-mos. Ridiculously over used here.Even the visuals were horrible. Why is everything blurred? Edges of buildings, rooms, objects - all blurry. Shallow depth of field makes everything look flat. Very 90's CGI vibe to the whole thing. Meh.Won't bother with part 2.

title: Brilliant! I can't wait for part 2!
text: As much as it's like star wars it also does enough to be it's own unique thing! I can't wait to see how the story continues with part 2. This movie does feel incomplete but that's because it is just the first part. Hopefully part 2 adds more lore and world building to this blossoming universe! I think the characters are great and have good backstories. The imperial faction are evil enough for you to despise them. I'm going to write my own story based in this universe. I hope you liked my review and enjoyed the movie like I did as I. Everything about it is good and Zack is good at making movies.

title: WOW!!!!
text: $166m investment for this. WOW again.What would I at a minimum want for my money from (no judgement) a Star Wars style movie?A few decent action scenes...... not a single one. A few slo-mo single person action pose. Perhaps a decent screen saver but nothing more.A few relatable characters - NOPE.A few inspiring characters - NOPE.A relationship to invest in - NOPE.A scoundrel to amuse - NOPE.A villain to scare, intimidate or even have an ounce of interest in - NOPE.Surely visuals to bathe in - NOPE.Not once did I have any emotional response to any single thing in this movie other than my thought of "$166m for this! WOW".This film maker should not be given a budget.Finishing note. There are many of the poor big budget action films by Netflix that I have enjoyed but this is NOT one of them.

title: Some Visuals and Mid Characters
text: Rebel Moon can be visually great and sometimes I don't like what I see. The visuals showing a new planet and some of the CGI can look pretty good. And sometimes it doesn't with the slow mo action and the lights in a lot of scenes are glaring on the scene. It can be very distracting during a scene like as if someone had a flashlight shining in my face.Then there are the characters if I can call them that. The MC does get a lot of characterization from watching flashbacks but nothing too noteworthy. The villain seems pretty evil, but that's about it. He's not a very relatable villain with those ideals that you can kind of agree with. He's just evil and not like in a fun way like Palpatine is in Return of the Jedi.There's the rest of the cast but they're pretty forgettable. You don't get to really learn too much about them and their lines are forgettable. Just overall nobody really doing a noteworthy performance that makes me want to remember the characters.The visuals are there now and then, but the story and characters don't bring much substance which makes me not care much about the CGI if the plot behind it is very bland.

title: Magnificent 7 in Space with Lens Flares and Slo-Mo
text: The visuals are passable for a TV movie. Everything, and I mean everything, is in a gold hue.The film is predictable. Nothing surprises. I know that is duplicitous but I have to write a certain number of words for this to be viable.It's a series of set pieces that make no sense. "I want this warrior to prove themselves." "Oh, they do. In a very pointless way. Like, let's bring out the laser swords in the last quarter of the fight."And that's not need the most annoying point. Everything, in this gold-hued universe has inexplicable lens flares with annoying blurs along the top and bottom of the screen.It could have been half an hour shorter without the slo-mo.In short ... laboured, pointless, don't care.

title: Ummmm,,, What! We waited for this...? This?
text: This movie was high on my anticipated movies list. The Star Wars tie in made it even sweeter. And then I watched it. I should've known. The dialogue is so clunky it's hard to take anything seriously. It felt like everyone was in a high school play trying too hard. There were some visuals that were pretty cool until whatever moxie the movie had gained was destroyed by constant threat of rampant misuse of slo-mo and terrible editing.Jimmy felt wasted. Major actor voicing and poof, gone.It feels like a rejected Star Wars fan fic script that got made anyways and no story editor touched it. If they need help for the next on I know a few high school kids qualified to edit the script for movies like this.

title: Hesitated... until... I just LOVED IT!
text: At first I was hesitant, but NOT too hesitant. So I had decided to check this movie and see it for myself (unlike some people who are too far in negativity and listen to just critics all the time these days). Movies don't have to be perfect, oscar worthy, or anything close, but this one was really good to see. I'm not sure what these 1 star low rating people were expecting at all. You expect almost too much and then you'll never like it. Probably not going to enjoy anything that's a simple movie. I went into it with lower expectations, and it paid off. Can't wait for part 2. Haters gona hate! But not me or many others around! YEAH! 👍

title: Zack Snyder should stick to directing
text: This movie is a mess and not a good one, the writing is plain, is bad and is plain bad.There is nothing here to like save the directing that, while it doesn't feel new since 300, is decent.Writing scenarios is a real job, let the professional do it Zack and stick at beain behinf the camera, it will make for way better movies because this one suck.Remember when people complained about The Creator being generic? Wai until you see Rebel Moon. And now they try to hype the "uncensored" version? Who would want to see an even longer version of this seriously? It is already a drag as is and I was unable to watch it in one go.You can totally skip this and missing nothing, waste of your time really.

title: Emperor Snyder has no clothes
text: When will the faithful realise that Snyder is not the saviour of cinema? His DCEU films were poor (yes, even his version Justice League) and this is a threadbare quilt of other people's stories that he has tried to fold into a single story. The results are visually engaging (if repetitive) but the narrative is thin and the script crumbles under the weight of the exposition. Honestly, the script is horrible and unintentionally hilarious on more than one occasion The die-hard Syner-philes will no doubt herald this as a masterpiece... but it isn't and someone really needs to tell them that the Emperor has no clothes.

title: Dragged down by compensating for its lack of ideas
text: I love sci-fi and I'm always eager for a good female action lead. We get so few of them. But I truly did not enjoy watching Rebel Moon.This was inspired by Seven Samurai. So was Adam Sandler's Ridiculous 6. Yet for all its flaws, that movie had better ideas and more fun than Rebel Moon can muster. Even the forgettable Magnificent Seven remake was better.This movie starts with a lengthy narrative intro, then dumps us on a medieval moon, only to take a astoundingly predictable forty minutes of shallow character archetypes doing and saying EXACTLY what you'd expect.There are no original ideas here, which the movie masks by being unnecessarily serious. That just leads it to drag out moments and constantly show its hand (and doubles down with so much exposition, narration, and flashbacks).Technically, Rebel Moon is very impressive. But as a story, it's enormously derivative which it tries to cover by being overly self-important.

title: A great start
text: Now. On first viewing I was up and down about the movie. It was beautifully shot, especially on Veldt. I felt like the pace was too quick and I wanted more of the characters and the world. I am one that loves to spend time with the land and the essence of the worlds.My biggest gripe (just to get it off my chest) was the pacing. The character meetings were too quick. I would easily love to have had a trilogy. Taking the time on Veldt. Learning more about the farmland and the world before venturing out to the other planets.I loved the characters and only wanted more from them. I wanted the hits to be shown. I loved the tension and the world building. I really want to see more of Jimmy. 100% he has my attention. I also want to see the character Aris build a relationship with Sam.I can't wait to see the directors cut and part 2. The world is beautiful and may not be for everyone. But it is such an amazing joy to watch the start of a new universe begin and then grow into something.

title: Sci-Fi Shillelagh
text: Zack Snyder knows how to make a very sleek, atmospheric looking movie. Unfortunately this is, on the surface, a polish turned. I don't know, is he aware of what he made?The movie is a reworking of the Seven Samurai story, village is being starved by bad guys who steal their crops and hire protectors, which isn't in itself a bad thing; Many movies have done that. It does however fail to make me care about any of the hired guns that she picks up along the way. They're given very quick and silly introductions, complete with plenty of Zack Snyder slo-mo poses, and suddenly join the team without a whole lot of motivation. The bad guys are cartoonishly evil and dress like nazis (of course), the good guys are cartoonishly righteous. Oh yea, and the main antagonist has a shillelagh. It's not even like a laser shillelagh or anything. I'm not entirely sure what part two will be, since this one seemed to wrap itself up.He wrote this movie for the Star Wars franchise and Disney turned it down, so he thinly disguised the various trademarked elements and made the movie anyway. Now, was he doing this as a tribute to the B-Movies of the late 70's and early 80's? Because this feels like one of those Starcrash, Battle Beyond the Stars schlock fests made to capitalize on the popularity of Star Wars.Also the opening shot made me laugh out loud. Come on now.

title: What a pity.
text: This could have been good but oh dear, what a missed opportunity. Pretty much everything that was going to happen was telegraphed ages before it happened. Seeming interesting characters appeared, started to build a role in the story then vanished without a trace. Action scenes were more hilarious than tense and the editing to try to make them look impressive did the opposite, a weird mix of normal, slow and fast speed and of course the baddies for the most part were rotten shots. The acting was rather odd as well, lots of very flat characters and many of the actors seemingly not that interested in the story they were trying to tell.

title: Zack lost his touch
text: Typically I love Zack Snyder movies and they are usually very well done. Rebel Moon is anything but good though. I was very excited about the arrival of this movie seeing as not too many good sci-fi movies get made. Sadly this feels like more of a B movie that a cable channel would produce than a big budget film.The CGI is both bad and good. Although it seems to get worse as the movie trudges along. It's almost as if they started running out of money so they had to take shortcuts.I've seen a lot of hate spewed towards the script and dialogue, it's warranted. At times it seems that a 14 year old wrote it due to the incredibly bland conversations of it all.As for the story it starts out with a decent amount of character and story building only to pivot to a rushed "get it all in" feel. It's hard to not see all of the Star Wars rip offs in the movie and not acknowledge them. Some of the characters, including our main baddie and our story's heroine are good in my opinion. Unfortunately other characters get very little polishing so they seem to matter little.You may have a different opinion when watching it so give it a go. I wouldn't set my expectations too high. There's a part 2 slated for the spring that maybe Snyder can do better with, or it'll be a huge flop for Netflix.

title: Slow as always
text: I didn't realize this was Zack sunders until I kept pausing this movie to do something else. His passion and love to slow everything down is ridiculous. All his movies can be cut short by 30% and this would have been a decent movie. Besides all the b-rated actors it didn't sell the movie. If it were unknown actors it might have made this more real. Visual appealing? On some occasions, the tiresome slow plot? It's a good movie to fall asleep with. I can't fall in love with the story since there's so many like Dune and other types that doesn't really give me a reason or tell the difference. It's just another costume design.

title: Zack Snyder doing Goat things 🔥
text: Rebel Moon feels fresh and carefully created cinema, the music, cinematography, emotions, actions & the character work is top notch which is going to keep you coming back to it, Zack Snyder and crew have struck Gold.Sofia Boutella character is Kora, the woman who's gonna lead the charge, she is doing some of her best work here.Charlie Hunnam is just amazing with his switch and he has given his best performance ever.Djimon Hounsou is really solid, a very strong presence, totally ripped and ready to fight.Michiel Huisman is really fresh and plays a complicated character, who is possibly the love interest for our lead.Ed Skerin is just superb, exactly what a villain should be, you can just hate Admiral Noble the moment he comes on.Ray Fisher won my heart here, Zack let him cook & he absolutely nailed it.The scenes are perfect, space is amazing and CGI is totally on point, even the side characters are doing amazing here, the story is intriguing and engaging, I would absolutely love to see this universe build and story to go on.Can't wait for part 2 🔥

title: 1999s Wing Commander meets 300
text: Take the poor designed sci-fi of 1999s wing Commander, add the greased up half naked torsos of 300, sprinkle in some poor CGI bluescreens, then sew together with the stop-start choppy storytelling of an over budget Activision game.I love scifi, all sorts of sci-fi, and I can usually gloss over hammy films, but Rebel Moon is the first time I've been genuinely upset as to how disappointed i found Rebel Moon.Straight to landfill, home video. I would have been happier watching Downton Abbey reruns than wasting 2 hours on this.66 episodes of The Expanse cost not much more than 4 hours of this waste of internet bandwidth. Another wasted Netflix opportunity and why the company's days are numbered if they keep churning out gash such as this.

title: Confused mishmash of drivel
text:
It's astounding that someone put up the money to make such an appalling and unoriginal film.Let's list out all the films this tries to be, and unashamedly copies.Nazis from Indiana Jones
Anithero oddball group of friends - guardians of the galaxy
Light sabers, creatures, storm troopers and 100 other things from Star Wars
Dragons and oddly blacked up and ripped "eye candy" (Drogo) from GOT
AI robots with a concious from Terminator
Fight scenes and gladiators from Gladiator
The list goes on and on as does the film, but goes nowhere. Some good effects, but if you have enough money that's not hard to pull off - but they can't hide how terrible this movie is.

title: Who thought this movie was finished?
text: This is so bad, I don't even know where to start.The acting is not good. Sofia Butella, Staz Nair and Sky Yang (even though his role was small) were especially bad. Sofia Butella plays the character with the most potential, Kora, but it just goes nowhere and her line deliveries are incredibly wooden.Speaking of characters. There are so many that get no development, and I think the only chatachter with a story arch is Kora. Unfortunately, her arch is mostly finished in the first few minutes, and then it's as static as everybody else's. Most other characters get a short introduction (told, not shown, more on that later) and then just hang around. Most of them don't really do anything. Was there not a single person during the process who thought the characters should be more than props?The merry band of overpowered outcasts collected by Kora and Gunnar seem to be picked up by chance and for no particular reason. Each one no more than a checkmark in the direcors notebook. Most of them also seem to have essentially no interactions with other characters beyond their introduction.There is so muched packed in to this movie, I don't think it would have been possible to do it well, but there is still so much room for improvement. Everything is too on the nose, and I don't think there is a single new idea in the entire movie. The old "show, don't tell" rule is thrown out. Instead, we are constantly being told what happens, what is going to happen, what happened and why things are happening. I just wish someone told me why this movie happened.Before this movie, I had no strong feeling on Zack Snyder. He had some hits (I think Army of theives is fantasic and a really fun movie) and some meh movies. However, I think this movie should end his career when it comes to big budget movies. It's just that bad.Jenna Malone and Anthony Hopkins were good, and their characters were the most interesting to me. Too bad neither of them had big parts.

title: Made for modern action movie fans!
text: If you are into Zack Snyder movies you will love this one too. If you like movies where the villains are vicious and the actors playing them are fantastic you will love this movie. This had the potential to be the greatest Star Wars movie of the modern era. Fortunately it ended up being its own thing and it rocks in my home theater. If you liked Netflix's Lost In Space you will love this movie! If you like great action sequences, if you like Predator and Aliens II you will love this movie. I've seen negative reviews, but I don't think those are from people looking at the film from the perspective of streaming and gaming entertainment enthusiasts. If you liked Justice League, Andor or. Rogue One you will love this movie!

title: A failed attempt at making Star Wars
text:
First of all, I can say that I understand his inspiration and everything that came with it.It's a cool concept (that's obviously been been done before with greater success) but nevertheless, it's an interesting idea for a movie if done well.This however, is anything other than done well.I'll start with the pros because it will be short;The world is at least somewhat interesting.The CGI is at times very solid.That's about it for the positives.Then here the cons come;
The casting(!) is one of the worst parts of this movie. When you have a high budget netflix film, which is being split into several parts, you can't get better actors than this? Seriously?The main cast is boring, the "mini" villain is Ed Skrein (who is dressed up like a 2000s emo band member most of the movie) and the big bad villain is...... I don't even know because I don't recognise him from anywhere.The acting is also horrendous, from basically everyone in the main cast to even random extras. Literally noone gives a good or even believable performance.Most characters feel so out of place and the actors who portray them feel equally out of place in this movie.I don't even know where to begin with the story, so I'm not even gonna try.There's so many loose ends that (hopefully?) gets tied up in a satisfying way in part 2, but I really doubt it based on what a shitshow this movie was.The visuals are mostly solid but at some points it really feels very green-screeny, and distracts some from the action.Speaking of action, the fight choreography is horrible. It feels slow, and lethargic, people swinging and missing on purpose shown front and center on screen.Actors missing timings everywhere and what not.But the worst thing personally, is the god damn slow motion.Yes Zack, I know you like slow motion, and there definitely is a place for it. Once or twice in the movie to really sell a scene.But when you use slow motion 2-3 times PER FIGHT SCENE, it really becomes annoying after the second time you see it.I could go on and on about the shortcoming of this movie, but I really don't have the energy to write anymore.It's a badly made, horribly acted mess that should've been alot better had it been handled properly.

title: Great Sci-fi idea, very poor execution...
text: This is just a bunch of great ideas from other great films put together but the script is a cliche and too on-the-nose for me to give it any grace. The first red flag was when I saw a robot get thrown into horse poop because bad guys hate nice things. Had a very promising intro, well 20 minutes at least, but then BOOM a cliche bomb hits you in the face afterwards. I couldn't continue watching after an hour and 20 minutes of this film because I got tired of confusing exposition getting thrown in my face and getting introduced with empty characters with little dialogue. Felt like Snyder didn't want other eyeballs to go through the script before filming. But the visuals and some fight scenes, and I mean some, have made this film somewhat doable to try and finishing watching. But it wasn't enough. I do hope the second film is good enough for me to go back and finish watching it.

title: Not as bad as I'd been led to believe.
text: This has had some scathing reviews, so I sat down with a "can it be that bad?" frame of mind and was pleasantly surprised. I mean it's no masterpiece, it's full of stereotypes and one note characters, and the lead is kind of dull (kind of by design,) but is full of fun supporting characters. The plot is a bare bones Battle Beyond the Stars ripoff, which itself was a ripoff of both Seven Samurai and Star Wars, but it hits all the beats right. The visuals are good, the technology on display is neat, and it's got a lot of action throughout. It ends fast, and without resolution, but that's okay Part One is in the title, the space fantasy world it sets up is interesting enough to get me excited for part Two.

title: Awesome space western!
text: I can't for the life of me understand all of the hatred toward this movie. It has a touch of everything and it's never boring. Great ensemble cast with nobody go against type that it takes you out of the picture, sensible sets and situations, but just enough sci-fi fantasy to sell it as what it is - a space western.I thought it was an absolute blast. This feels like the first time I watched Clash of the Titans as a kid. And Star Wars. And Kung Fu. It pushes all of my nerd buttons and I love it.Space westerns are supposed to be silly and fun and cliche. That's what makes them fun. They're supposed to be popcorn movies, and Rebel Moon delivered on that. Settle in with a tub of buttered and enjoy!

title: Would have been better as a TV series
