text: Underdeveloped, lazy writing. So many troupes we've seen before, not a lot going on, but visually interesting. I was just overall bored. Which is not what you want in a fantastical sci-fi full of action that comes in two parts. I don't know what they could possibly do to make up for this in the second part.Of course we have seen this narrative a million times, but I do think that the world and mythology being built had some interesting ideas. I think a TV series, or better yet a mini series, would have given the room to fully flesh things out. There was a bit too much exposition for my liking, and some weird moments of characters doing things for no reason. Why are we trusting this dashing rogue? Just not a lot of motivation for choices made at some points.

title: Decent sci-fi retelling of 7 Samurai
text: I saw the bad reviews but decided to try and give this one a chance. I'm glad I did. It definitely has its flaws, but nothing as bad as what people say. It's a theatrical space opera built from the premise of 7 Samurai. The writers admittedly took inspiration from Akira Kurosawa. The world they built is nothing short of fantastic and immersive. I wish the character development was given more emphasis but with what they did, the plot at least did not suffer.The cherry on top of this cake is the lead actress, Sofia Boutella. She did an excellent job at portraying her role as the Darth Vader-gone-good protagonist. She even reminds me of Nara from Chorus (video game). All in all a worth-it experience for fans of Star Wars, and Kurosawa alike.

title: Basic in every way but visuals.
text: Rebel Moon seems to work off the premise that all we want to see is something pretty. Literally an hour and a half of this could be put into a short montage, but it drug out to be most of the movie.Casting did an amazing job, but the pay off is equivalent to hiring Lewis Hamilton to drive your go cart. All of these actors weren't allowed the room to do anything to earn their paychecks. There is zero depth. It's a massively simplistic story that in no way motivates me to watch the next installment. Unfortunately, it's another example of Netflix not being too particular about what it throws onto it's streaming service.I've never been a huge Snyder fan, and Rebel Moon does absolutely nothing to move that needle. I wouldn't even recommend this movie to people who are curious because of all the hype.

title: Predictable. Nothing new
text: Bits of many old themes with nothing new to say. Counted at least five other movies and shows this is derived from, but there are more. Might be remembered as the one with the Irish accents? A lot more could have been done with this: a third protagonist, like in the Halo game, for example. An existential threat to more than a small farming village. The enemy are cruel and brutal. Obviously. They have to be taken down. Obviously. Maybe the enemy could have been slowly overwhelming bureaucrats? Defeated by the weapons of mass paperwork? The heroes angered by yet another form to fill in? Even the trailer for part 2 is uninviting.

title: Star Wars plus the Seven Samusri
text: I would have loved it more if it wasn't so directly derivative of two other movies plus several others. A lso the dialogue and acting is bad. Lots of fighting between the Nazis and the good seven others. I mean the kings men although he is dead but they keep on fighting. There may be a magical princess somwhere ala The witcher. A main character who may not be human but who cares. In fact that is the main fault you just don't care. All the good guys seem to die. There is a bar i think it isn't called the Mose Eisley but it might as well be called that. The language is way too modern. Rewatch Star Wars One.

title: Rebel Moon: Snyder's Cosmic Fumble - A Galaxy of Shallow Backstories and Lost Potential
text: Rebel Moon on Netflix shoots for the stars but crash-lands in a galaxy of unfulfilled potential. Mixing Star Wars with Dune, it delivers a weak punch with underdeveloped characters, a muddled plot, and a desperate reliance on flashy CGI and eye candy.The film's fatal flaw? Shallow characters. Rebel Moon introduces a slew of forgettable figures with little depth or backstory. Viewers are left wanting more, as the cast feels like mere placeholders rather than fully-realized individuals.The storytelling is equally lackluster. Attempting a complex narrative of rebellion and intergalactic conflict, Rebel Moon stumbles with rushed pacing and missed emotional beats. Critical moments lack the impact they desperately need, leaving the audience struggling to care about the lackluster unfolding events.Sure, the CGI is top-notch, and the cast is easy on the eyes, but style can only take you so far. Rebel Moon prioritizes visuals over substance, borrowing heavily from more successful franchises. The result? A half-baked attempt at replicating the magic of Star Wars and the complexity of Dune.In the end, Rebel Moon is a sci-fi misfire that fails to carve out its own space in the genre. Despite the dazzling visuals and attractive cast, the film crumbles under the weight of poor storytelling and forgettable characters, leaving audiences longing for a more fulfilling journey into the cosmos.

title: I am sad that a piece of art with good potential turns out to be a dud & haphazard.
text: Story 1/10, - Script 2/10, - Pacing 2/10, - Characters 0/10, - Cinematography 6/10, - World building 5/10, - Visuals 6/10, - Sound design 7/10.As an admirer of Zack Snyder over the years it is sad to see such a failing in story, script, and wrong casting types.The world building is fine, we know that he has that potential.Unfortunately, it appears that rather than letting the characters and their story build the world and then it is informing back on its characters, it is that the world building was done with lack of attention. As well filmmakers have forced all the story and its beings into this shell.Seen through the portfolio of Snyder, I imagine it is the story writer and focusing on what is it that he is exploring, would give him freedom to play around with his artistic colours and camera movement.

title: Zack Snyder puts the slow motion into watching a car wreck
text: If you loved the 3 hour long, 80% slow motion Justice League, you'll also love this film. For everyone else - we're out here wondering how so much money and such capable performers are being wasted on the slowest mo-est most boring action sci-fi that could be imagined or conceived.This is a director that took an awful comic book movie and said "The problem is - there's not enough CGI and slow motion, plus we can make it all black and white to cut costs!" with this one it's more like: "We wrote 5 minutes of screen time, so everyone has to move slowly or we slow-mo post production. Gotta also make it extra long because all the good movies are."Anyways. I'll give you a car wreck of a production for many less millions of dollars than it takes to hear Zack Snyder shout "slow motion!" so hire me instead.Edit: Snyder's justice league is actually 4 hours long with no reimbursement; slow motion or otherwise.

title: Nope Special Effects & VFX Cant Save It
text: This is a prime example of an over hyped movie that failed to meet expectations.I must acknowledge that the graphics and visual effects (VFX) were top-notch, and that is the only positive aspect I can highlight about this film.However, there was a lack of character development, and the connections between the characters were absent. Consequently, it's challenging to comprehend why each character behaves the way they do. There is a noticeable disconnection in both the story and the characters.Simultaneously, the story outline appears somewhat cliched, and the acting did not live up to expectations.It's regrettable that the movie did not live up to the pre-release hype.

title: Barely Watchable Wannabee Space Opera Fails on All Levels
text: Zack Snyder has directed some good movies (Sucker Punch, Justice League) and some rubbish (300) over his career. The fact disney rejected this as not being good enough for their SW franchise should tell you where this sits.It's got no heart or soul at all. About 20% of the movie is Original and Interesting, the rest is predictable, forgettable and been there, done that I didn't care about any of the characters or the story. The constant Slo-Mo action scenes are unbearable. When slo-mo is used it's usually to mask bad fight choreography or to show something new (like The Matrix), in this case it was just because the director has a love for it (like he did in 300). The movie would've gone for 30 minutes less if they had normal action scenes so I guess that's one way to stretch a movie out.This is a big budget version of one of those rip-off movies that come out around the same time as a blockbuster. Even with the big budget some things look cheap, like they made a paper mache mask and put it on a horse and called it an alien creature.Normally reliable actors, like Djimon Hounsou, look totally clueless. Not because of their ability to act but because of the situations and dialogue they are given.

title: Rebel Moon is masterfully directed
text: I went into this film without viewing any previews and without any background information of the film so I had no expectations of the film. Within the first 5 minutes I was drawn in - the very first scene captured my undivided attention.Rebel Moon is masterfully directed with beautiful cinematography, a great storyline and an amazing cast. Keeps the audience engaged throughout the entirety of the film. Intense action scenes that keeps you on the edge of your seat, coupled with scenes and moments that leave you invested in the characters and their journey.This Sci-Fi thriller has all of the elements of a great film and deserves a spot among the best. I'm looking forward to part 2.

title: Another from Hollywood's most average director.
text: Another true to form Snyder film. How does he keep getting work? I think perhaps it is because many of us original DC fans have gone to DC films purely for nostalgia reasons, and it's assumed we thought they were good.The only times his fims waiver to the good side of average is when they are saved by stellar cast, cutting & composers.This film is just a mashup of the sci-fi greats, stolen and put together with the recklessness of a toddler, with lazy costumes either from past films wardrobe cupboards or someone's wardrobe with dirt added.It's so bad I went and did laundry, and I'm the sci-fi geek in the house.Nope, don't bother.

title: Seven Samurai in space
text: Yet another remake of Kurosawa's wonderful film, Seven Samurai. Lacks the pathos and humour of the original film.Strongest character in the film is the artificial human voiced by Anthony Hopkins. Hopefully he gets more of an outing in part 2 as for me, he was the only character with a reasonable backstory that has more to give in the second film. The others were one dimensional cutouts lifted from various pages to meet the required numbers for the final act.Plenty of other 'influences' throughout if your bubble is popped and you need something to keep you going until the end.The crew that cut the trailer did a great job as I was expecting another film entirely!

title: bad in every form
text: What a waste, no story, poor acting, mediocre action, ayyo with all that hype hype hype.... then a fart... its like a 10 year old wrote this fairy tale. A mash up of other movie parts.... felt ashamed to watch this! Sad to see such a cast playing along to the most simple heartless script, among some of the worst movies this year Rebel Moon takes the cake, I find it amusing that, who really advice these producers to go ahead with these projects, my biggest disappointment is that so much potential and they came up with this, you have movies like Dune and knock offs like this, weakest writing Ive seen in a long time, unpractical loop holes so big that you can shove the empire state building down it, and I still doubt that want be enough!

title: There's no character building so you don't care what happens.
text:
The Pros:
The Cons
The bones of a great epic are here but they just aren't fleshed out. The film would have been better served spending less time on world building and more time investing in character development. The Star Wars similarities would have been less obvious then.Maybe Part 2 will solve these problems.

title: Simply amazing work
text: This visually stunning sci-fi epic is amazing! Better than most of what Hollywoods 200 mil + movies had offered us lately. It's so impressive how wrong the critics were. A movie for you and your girl/partner will enjoy on a Friday night with food! It automatically hooks you in to the story the bad guys were great antagonist! The main character Kora was bad ass in such a believable way no Mary sue who isn't afraid of being sexy and powerful. But this movie will leave you wanting MORE! Your gonna want more character backgrounds, more worlds to visit, more aliens to see, more fights and when the 3hr DIRECTORS CUT comes out we will have more! I cannot withhold my anticipation for part 2 in April. A great watch!

title: Rebel Moon - The disappointment
text: RM isn't the worst movie ever, but it isn't good. You don't connect nor feel anything for the characters and the whole movie is spent gathering soldiers that nobody cares about. The action is raw but the slow-mo handcuffs the fighting scenes from being great. A satisfying yet weird ending that I'm 50/50 on. I appreciate the backstory of how Snyder has been carrying around this story for a long time and to finally see it come to fruition. Unfortunately, his story wasn't well thought out for a commercial movie. Overall, I didn't like it but it had enough to where I can give it another chance with the sequel. A lot has to change though.

title: I'm not mad Zack, just disappointed.
text: When you watch a movie you go in hoping to feel something, some emotion. Maybe even take away a life lesson from it. This film felt empty. I felt no connection to any of the characters who didn't show any real development. The best character was a robot with 1 minute of screen time. Given Zack's previous films I was hoping for some awesome fight sequences and visuals however, I was underwhelmed. The fights appeared slow and unrealistic. The settings were weather man quality green screens. It's hard to get into a movie when you're distracted by the clearly CGI set. Not sure what happened with this film. Zack's better than this film.

title: Whiners?
text: Sad to see so many rating this movie so low do to a "100 pound girl" beating up the bigger guys and all.In real life yeah, I would agree.But some ppl just don't grasp the term sci-fi...emphasis on the "fi" (fiction)...They accept watching starships, aliens and what not...,but accepting that a woman, in a fantasy world, can beat bigger guys is just too much for their fragile ego to comprehend?If this character was male, would they rate this movie higher, due to the realism of the other parts of the movie?The movie is perhaps a good 8, but I gave it 10 to try in a small way to counteract some of the hater reviews.So sad to see that some ppl cannot enjoy fictional storytelling.

title: Rebel Moon isn't very good!
text: I was generally optimistic about this movie. The whole premise and pitch had me really hoping it would be good, and even after the fact I see potential of what it could have been but that slowly goes out of the window. I just think it was all executed poorly, like there's so much to take from this movie and tear apart.There was like nothing 'good' about this movie. Maybe others found something to like about this movie but man I really slogged through this movieAs I said there was at the start some potential. For instance the idea of a farming community on a moon, I absolutly loved that. But once the cartoonish villains showed up and our heroes went elsewhere it was all paint by numbers by that point.Its needlessly aggressive, comically so. The villains are so cartoonish its almost funny if the movie wasnt taking itself so serious in doing so. Trying to be an adult Star Wars is fine but the way Snyder went about it was just so weak, like everyone is miserable, everything is dark and gritty, oh and there is a uncomfortable scene of a woman and a bunch of men that just felt uncomfortable, (the word I cannot use cos I think it will get the review declined).... like really?The characters, are forgettable, and just boring, the cinematography is this wishy washy brown that every 'dark' adult, gritty movie has got to have now, it lacks identity. It feels very dated in some aspects and while it seems to pay homage to alot of 80's sci-fi it does little to be original by its own merits. It doesn't help when the writing just tends to flip flop all over the place with no direction, which is ironic since the writing and direction are the same person.Oh and the slow-mo, good god the slow-mo too, way too much slow mo (Yea I know, a Snyder movie with slow-mo, shock and awe )The story was just a collect 'em all movie. Go here, get this, go here, collect that, go here, collect this. Like nothing had a chance to breathe, a planet got destroyed and I am like 'meh' am I supposed to care? Our heroes didn't even care, they didn't even know I don't think? This movie is so bad it is literally leaving my subconscious right now I am struggling to remember parts.This movie wanted to be something I have craved for a long time, 'original sci-fi fantasy'. It delivers the sci-fi fantasy but very little on the originality. And that's sad. I really hope a movie like this doesn't deter movie makers from creating original pieces of fantasy franchises. Because in an era where everything is remakes and reimagining's and extended universes I want something like Rebel Moon, just Rebel Moon wasnt it.It was not very comfortable viewing overall. And it was good this was on Netflix I had time to groan loudly in pain as this movie dragged for 2 hours that I would never get back, and stretch my legs and take a 5 minute break half way. I will be honest if this was on the cinema I probably would have never went to see it at all. I saw it only because I was curious, and also hopeful because I wanted this to be good.I will assume this show is going to have a audience and it will be one of those growing audiences over time maybe, but this wasnt what I hoped for and thats just sad.

title: Hands down original otherworldly &sci-fi Organic!!
text: To sum up many words concerning the combination of scientific genius & modernity is above all expectations below is my unbiased observation & opinion of the scientific methodology & dramatic genius of this particular film.The Darkness of the personalities that leaves you wondering & craving more of their backstory, genuine flaws in design that's too complex for a modern critic to comprehend.Also amazingly compelling to its competitive appeal that the Star Wars franchise should learn a thing a two especially from Zack Snyder. Honestly I'm expecting this to become a slow & steady state of accomplishment of future franchise. Extremely compelling is the one word I would have to use to describe this film.

title: Truly terrible
text: Ok so we don't need another sci fi so soon after all those Star Wars films but if a film is good it'll always be given space.This on the other hand is a mishmash of lord of the rings, the aforementioned Star Wars, and game of thrones but is filmed like a terrible advert for some cheap men's aftershave. The script writers have read a little bit of folklore and came up with a total catastrophe.Speaking of the script: it is terrible, the acting totally wooden, and the casting is laughable. The main woman in it should be pouting on a billboard not pretending to be some sort of warrior. It tried so hard to be something but just ends up as...nothing. Blah.

title: Just ridiculously bad
text: It's as if someone took the concept of Firefly and imprinted the Magnificent Seven/Seven Samurai over it and had set and costumes designed by someone who only plays Warhammer. The movie is a jumbled mess. Characters are uninteresting. River Tam was a better badazz than this main character. You know the direction this movie is going within the first minute and a half. In fact, the amount of stealing the creators did just shows how bereft of talent they are. Feel like a taste of Avatar or Clash of the Titans? There's a taste but it doesn't improve the flavor of this gruel. Save yourself the 2 hours of your life you'll never get back. Don't watch this. You will only be disappointed.

title: Another total piece of garbage
text: Once again I found myself turning off a movie halfway through because it was so horrible. I find it amazing that a director can convince legitimate actors to star in movies like this. A movie this bad should have Dwayne Johnson, Steven Segal and Tara Reid. The story was hard to follow since it made very little sense. I stopped watching after the seemingly endless Avatar ripoff scene with a dude trying to ride a gigantic bird. Hopefully the second half is better but I'll never know because there is no way I'll ever watch the rest. After watching Midway it seemed like Ed Skrein was on track for a solid career. Not so sure now.

title: A Collection Of Everything That Is Wrong With Modern Film Production
text: A boring, lukewarm PG - 13 movie, which apart from being poorly written, also gives us a hilarious main character.We have a super elite soldier who beats up people twice her size, farmers who work the land "with their hands", and a super advanced civilization that can travel infinite distances but doesn't know how to grow food. Hilarious.We're supposed to believe that the main character can beat trained assassins twice her size. Such things have become boring and tiresome, and all together produce the exact opposite effect of what the writers would like.The characters are boring and even irritating, and this all looks like a remake of Seven Samurai, only the action takes place in space. Well, Seven Samurai is a masterpiece, and this is a Netflix movie, and that's all you need to know. I don't mind that this movie borrows from other movies, a lot of movies are like that and that doesn't make them bad, some actually turned out great, but this feels like a bad parody.I didn't watch the movie until the end, because I couldn't bear to watch another piece of garbage, goodbye Netflix, there's really no point in having a subscription.Even the villains are hilarious, all together this would be a good parody. Lately we have a lot of movies that show all men as incompetent morons, and this movie is like that too. There is no point in spending time and money on something that is an obvious waste of time.We're supposed to believe that the main character is some kind of elite soldier, absolutely hilarious.The fight scenes look like a parody, I can't believe so much money was spent on this. Zack Snyder has made some fun movies, but this is a disaster. I give it the lowest rating, because I didn't even manage to watch it to the end.I spent an hour on this before giving up, an hour I will never get back. Total waste of time.

title: Amazing new sci-fi series
text: This movie would probably be an 8 or 9 for me but with the amount of reviews rating it lower than it deserves it's now an easy 10.The people that have been reviewing this less than 7 pleases check yourselves and your privileged, this movie isn't for you it's for sci-fi and fantasy fans who are fans series like Star Wars and Dune.It's not a perfect film but it's only great fault is how it is rushed in creating this world that is already moving when we join it.The acting is amazing and for once I don't think there is a single person I would change, Ed Skrein is particularly amazing in his role as the villain.The special effects are top teir which should be expected for the budget but with other films lately on Netflix wasting this it's still good to see.

title: No plot
text: This looks great, a lot of money has been spent making this. There's next to no plot, no depth, nothing really. The makers of this have forgotten the key ingredient, a great story. Without it, there's nothing to connect with. The characters seem like stereotypes without any purposes. I think you are meant to connect because it's the good guys and bad guys story. If so, you'd be far better off watching an episode of The Roadrunner.Clearly, somebody spent a lot of cash making this but they seem to have forgotten the point, to tell a story. Without that, you have nothing. I can't fault the FX people, costume designers and so on, they have done a great job. It's just a shame their is nothing to bind it together. Very disappointed.

title: Is this some kind of sick joke?
text: Without exaggeration, this is probably the worst movie I've ever seen. The writing is atrocious, the plot makes absolutely zero sense, and it doesn't contain a single original idea. I would be surprised if it was written by an actual person, because it's so bad it really seems AI-generated. It's a nonsensical mish-mash of star-wars-esque fantasy/sci-fi tropes filled in with generic terms like "the Motherland," as if even thinking of a name for a futuristic society was beyond the writer's creative capacity. To add insult to injury, most of the acting is terrible too. Completely embarrassing for everyone involved.

title: Blurry mess
text: Zack Snyder has peaked after his masterpiece justice league Snyder cut, the city of the dead movie was extremely boring and had his new style blurry backgrounds, in rebel moon I thought zack might have a come back moment, while the story line is ok and interesting enough, the performance is lacking and worse is that he took the "blurry visuals" that he came up with in city of the dead to the next level. Literally every scene is entirely blurred other than the character that is speaking and certain objects, everything from people in the background, foliage, nature, trees, sky is blurred in a "fish bowl" style lens which makes it extremely unwatchable and beyond ridiculous. What is zack snyder thinking here??? Every scene is ruined by this blur which takes away from great details in the scene and is painful to the eyes. This is why I only give it two stars, big fail from zack.

title: Luckily this was a pas for Star Wars
text: Zac's ego is enormous.He should have taken the rejection as a reflection of the quality of the script, instead of trying to prove something to Disney, & blow his own trumpetBasically it's a stale storyline, a weak script, poorly built sets and CGI, boring cinematic effects (like the slow-mo battle sequences), not great acting and even worse directing, lots of shots out of focus, even more edge of frame distortions - even on actor faces, which is a sin when framing the shots - and flimsy just irritating characters.I got just over half way through watching before I stopped it and looked for something else instead.

title: Confusion in interesting imagery
text: I was not expecting much and I got it. This is so many stories in one that has no harmony in its entirety.There is potential, however I can't see it happening.I know why this was put on Netflix and not in a theatre release.The cast is amazing the 'action' is okay but the plot and story line needs more.Can we not have the slow motion action scenes ? This movie makes me miss the Roger Corman flix that would be on late at night.I miss Good Sci-fi. I miss plausible storylines.I want to fire whomever decided that this was a good haircut for Ed.I don't know if I will watch the next chapter or not.I would rather read this in a book series.

title: Has its moments, but not many of them
text: Pretty much from the start it becomes apparent that this thing is blatantly plagiarising other films fairly liberally, both visually and in terms of the tale, so it doesn't take long to start playing 'influence bingo' with it to help pass the time as you watch. And if you do play that, rest assured there are a lot of films you can tick off, sometimes even entire scenes are identical to other movies.You've got a all the Riddick series in there, several Star Wars movies, Seven Samurai (or The Magnificent Seven if you prefer to choose the remake), Serenity, Chappie, Gladiator, Blade Runner, several Spaghetti westerns, they're all in there and manymore besides. I could go on, I'm sure you could too if you watch it and play along.For example, fairly early on there is a 'let's go to this Cantina' scene which is about as close to the classic scene in Star Wars as you could get without it being identical. I was literally expecting the Star Wars Cantina music to stat playing. It's therefore not a surprise to find that a handsome roguish smuggler whom they meet there (and yes he shoots a bad guy and indeed fires first) has a ship which can fly them off the planet to continue their quest.That said, visually it looks pretty okay with some competent CGI and derivative yet competent costume work, but even so there's far too much 'drop to slo-mo for the fight' going on, so much so that it actually impacts on the action itself in a pretty negative way. The audio mixing is, as is sadly all too common these days with movies, terrible; bombastic 120 decibel music one second then quiet dialogue another, which has you adjusting the volume on your TV up and down like you're playing a trombone in order to not be deafened but still hear what the characters are frequently telling, rather than showing you, not that it matters much if you don't hear the odd line, you could probably spontaneously invent a better and more original one yourself and pretend that's what the character said and you'd still be bang on the money as far as where the plot was heading.All of that could have been forgiven if it actually had a decent plot or even actually had a sub plot at all, but unfortunately, it's so basic that you'd have to be in a coma to not be able to predict it, and what plot there is has some logic holes in it which are big enough to fly a spaceship through, which doesn't help.There is the odd bit of decent dialogue here and there, but for the most part the cast are pretty much phoning it in because they have so little to work with. You get the impression that they are only sticking with it in the hopes that it make make it to a few sequels and provide a few more paychecks for them.I'm not saying it's absolutely not worth watching, it'll pass an hour and a half if you are bored and enjoy spotting infuences, but any and all of the films it borrows from are much better than this and if any of the plot surprises you, and that even includes the fina scene before the titles roll, then I would be very surprised indeed.

title: Great visuals, poor world building
text: As is always the case with Zack Snyder the visuals of this film are fantastic. The fight scenes are well choreographed, the actors are doing a great job with the script they have to work with. The only issue I have is I don't really feel any emotional attachment to these characters. The attempt to build a universe was unsuccessful and there's really no real reason for the audience to feel any emotional attachment to these characters. I don't really care who lives or dies because everyone just seems like an expendable character. In Star Wars the audience very quickly established an emotional attachment to Luke, Leia, Han, Chewbacca, and of course R2-D2 and C-3PO and were invested in whether or not they survived. In Dune, the exposition setting up the universe is so well executed that you understand who the main players are and why things are happening the way they are. To be fair I have read the first Dune novel which these two movies are based off of but I feel like anyone who watches the first film understands who the Atreides and Harkonnen houses are and what is at stake. So overall could have been better, I'll watch part 2 but I doubt this franchise gains much traction.

title: Great visuals, art movie!
text: "Rebel Moon epitomizes the classic Snyder touch-melding profound artistry with action-packed sci-fi allure. While it might challenge the masses with its depth, for movie aficionados, it's a cinematic gem disguised as a thrilling action sci-fi. Zack Snyder's masterful storytelling transforms what seems like a standard genre film into a visually striking and intellectually engaging experience. Every frame is a work of art, rewarding those who delve deeper into its intricate layers of narrative and meaning. A must-watch for those who appreciate thought-provoking cinema wrapped in a spectacular sci-fi package."

title: How did this get made?
text: It is astonishing that Zach Snyder and several renowned cast members would have partaken in this film. It just does not work at any level. The casting is all wrong and no one has a good fit for their acting style and pedigree. Sofia Boutella was not the correct choice for the main role, it just does not work.The plot is not captivating and seems very boring. I could not find a care to give for the story line. It just does not make sense. Too little backstory of the main characters, and leaps of logic to develop strong bonds in forming a team.The writing and dialog is simplistic, and lacks an epic story or fantasy journey one would expect from a Star Wars saga.Not worth the effort to watch as you already go into it knowing you are watching only part of the series.

title: Well, it has Sofia Boutella
text: I saw the trailers for this. But I like Sofia Boutella. After some self-debate, I did start to watch it, and it does have lots of Sofia Boutella in it.After a while, it dawned on me that I should think of it as a live-action cartoon, and from then I could enjoy watching Sofia Boutella more. Also entertaining, was thinking about all the other movies it reminded me of, since there sure are a lot of them. I'm also pretty sure I saw landscapes from World of Warcraft.It has a plot, but it's one of those plots where they could have just told you what it is in a couple sentences and you'd be like "oh yeah, that one, I know that one, that's a good plot. Oh, no, no, you don't have to fill in the names and whatall - I got it." This film would be way better with no exposition at all, no voiceover, no flashbacks. When you're doing something this familiar, and fully conscious of its familiarity, it just does not help anything when you sit us down and explain it all. I get "space Nazi" - this is like the 20th film I've seen with these exact same space Nazis; it's just wasting our time to keep going on about how these guys are space Nazis. When exposition is expounded with something like this, it really has to be a tale of extraordinary interest to be worth slowing it all down to fill in the backstory. Do you really think you cleared that bar? Honestly?The CG artists sure worked hard on it, lots of cool art.Surprisingly the fight sequences don't work that well. Are those supposed to be like squirt guns? They squirt stuff. Really, it's like they squirt yellow goo that splatters around and glows and only kills people when it's convenient for the scene. It always seems weird to me when movies have sci fi space guns that are less effective than actual guns. Like, did they forget how to make bullets in the future? Maybe it's in the past, which could be why their agricultural technology is somewhere around early Bronze Age level.Yup, live action cartoon with Sofia Boutella.

title: Sugarfree
text: Imagine buying a cake, that looks and smells pretty, but the bakery forgot to add sugar.Thats how this felt.All its beauty can not make up for such a boring and predictable story, with unlikable and shallow characters.I havent been a big Snyder fan for years, but i still hope that one day he will open the box and grab the tools that gave us Watchmen.Even if hollywood cant write any more good stories and plots, atleast give us some characters we can relate to and fall in love with.And please stop riding giant birds and battle humanoid spiders just to show off your characters. Had nothing to do with the plot. Dumbest thing I have ever seen.

title: Who Greenlit This?
text: Watching a Snyder film is like talking to a really beautiful, young woman who can only say "whatever", "like" or "buy me a present" and cannot find Canada on a map. It looks like a good idea initially but it is really not.Snyder is a brilliant cinematographer but he's writing is on the level of Jar Jar Abrams, destroyer of franchises. This is a master class in how NOT to start an IP on the level of that moving city rubbish Peter Jackson put out a while back - I do not even remember the name. I cannot believe that someone read this script and went "awesome". FFS man, slow motion is NOT an alternative to character development.And oh, Shichinin no Samurai (1954) has been done to *death* and typically better. Go watch Battle Beyond the Stars (1980) instead.Now I have to rinse my eyes and sinuses with Vodka.

title: did not keep me on my chair watching
text: First i am going to say is the image looks great, production design and camera movement are all good. And that is all.The world this movie established is just so not working. No logic, not rational, dose not hold up for any further understanding.It is just like star wars. You build a world with phenomenal technology and light speed spacecraft, but you fight with sword and spears. And i have to mention, the big spaceship is powered like 1900, men shovel coal fuel.In this movie, when laser guns go with west style horse farming and myth animals, you know it is just another hollywood hollow CGI big MTV style commercial product.Hollywood now a days is just so felt behind. You stay in your comfort zone for too long. The audience has grown up, and world has grown up. And american producers are still live in their dreams with pride. The director is so well known for play cameras and lenses. In his interviews he always talks alot of how special his camera and lens are built. But cinema is about story telling, human emotions, life experience. He should be a cameraman and let someone else be the director.

title: Omg no!
text: I really wonder how they could get this financed. I doubt this even looked good on paper, still it was made. I did not even finish this cause it was embarrassing to look at, filled with "cool" characters and predictable storyline, I have seen character in cut lines in games with better acting than this. Don't waste your time on watching this, there is so much else out there that is worth your time. Not that I had any hopes when I saw the cast or the trailer but sometimes you get surprised and you find something new and good. This was not the case this time. If anyone finds this enjoyable I will be surprised.

title: Didn't feel authentic...
text: I cannot understand why the dialogs were written in such a simple form. There was no flow to it. It felt like borrowed material, copy and paste in the wrong places. Which makes it a little uncomfortable to enjoy. More time should have been invested in a good storyline, because that is what makes Sci Fi film great. Content! Also the writing/story did not match up to the music and costumes. That is why it didn't feel authentic to me, which is a pity. Excuse me?🤔 There is a part two? Why? I hope the makers has listen to the Sci Fi fans and fix it. It gets a 4 for trying, the costumes and music.,,

title: Evil Lloyd Christmas
text: There's possibly an okay movie somewhere in this heap, but as is it's kinda bad. From the bad guy looking like Lloyd from Dumb and Dumber to terrible CG in a lot of places this movie is a mess. It also just shoves everything in your face with no time to breath. It just feels like someone took a rejected Star Wars script and just kept adding troupes into it to add to the run time.The only thing I'm actually curious about in Part 2 is the robot who got all of 2 minutes screen time in this one.If you already have a Netflix subscription and have some time to waste it's not the worst movie ever so maybe give it a watch if you're into sci-fi, but you won't be messing anything if you don't.

title: The plague of plagiarism
text:
This is truly amazingly bad.I rate it 2 stars. One star for visuals and one for audio. Both are good to a certain point.Where should I start with what's the bad? (There aren't any more good)Oh, that could be a long list.The plot, the acting, the screenplay is terrible
And who the hell decided it was a good idea to use Anthony Hopkins voice for a robot??? I love Anthony Hopkins, and his voice, but it's as far from an artificial voice as it gets.Further more is the extremely exaggerated use of slow motion. Ohhh myyyy g......... 💤
Seems like they watched the movie "300" and decided; "Hey! Slo-mo is cool! Let's use it to extend the movie length".And the film feels slow motion from start til end.The characters are boring, and it seems to me that the actors share this opinion. I can't find anything that resembles of great acting here. Sorry to say.This is in fact some of the worst I've seen in quite a while.Anything else is known from other movies. And they haven't even tried to hide the plagiarism.One could start with Star Wars, Lord Of The Rings, 300, and several great movies, cooked up in a soup of anorectic nonsenseThe story is a mess yet predictable and boring.I think I'll just stop my review here.WOW!!! This is a bad movie.

title: what movie was that
text: As my partner and I watched this we couldn't help but comment to each other "Star Wars" "Star Trek" and numerous other titles of the last 40 years. It was like watching a rehash of scenes from old original movies re-shot with new characters all strung together. Very little original concept. Very lazy writing and directing. I'd quite expected more than this from Zac. Lets just hope No2 finds its own story. We'll just have to wait and see I guess thought it won't be with baited breath in anticipation of something to blow our minds. And now Ive run out of things to say but the system demands 600 words.

title: Walmart Brand Star Wars
text: After being dumped by Warner Bros and turned down by Disney to direct a Star Wars film, Zack Snyder went to the next best option, Netflix. Rebel Moon: Part One- A Child of Fire takes Snyder's Star Wars plans and turns them into one of the most lifeless and generic space adventures ever made. Giving us a kick-ass cast, the dialogue and lack of development make every moment difficult to get through. The entirety of the runtime is spent setting up the next film and by the time it is over, it feels as though there were 30 minutes of ideas, stretched into this nearly two and a half hour film. Some of the action scenes are fun to watch as the choreography is nicely done, but nowhere near Snyder's best work. Though the cinematography is gorgeous, that seems to be where the efforts stopped. Everything about this film, down to the character names, feels like it was written by a 13 year old boy, after being asked to make the most 'badass and extreme' film that his high school mind could imagine. Rebel Moon: Part One- A Child of Fire is Walmart brand Star Wars, trying to be the real thing, while being a hollow shell instead.

title: Again, I have to disagree with everyone
text: Just like the case with "Godzilla: Minus One" but in reverse, in which I kind of not actually like the movie that everyone loves, this time I like the movie that everyone seem to see as a mess or a dumpster fire (a dumpster of fire lol). The inspiration from "Seven Samurai" is pretty clear, CGI is nice, story or plot-wise it's clearly not as captivating, heavy, or complex like "Dune", but at least it lies somewhere around the level of the original Star Wars, if only it got more fleshed out (maybe that's everyone's problem with this movie?). Still like it tho, thank God I have learned (still learning actually) to not have reviews or ratings from both the general audiences and critics from obstructing me to watch or enjoy a movie that I hype about and really want to watch. Feel free to bully me or calling me names for this, I don't care, I just love having an independent thought, free from the fear of everyone's judgement and view.8/10.

title: "This could easily be any of you lying here in the gutter of some forgotten world in the name of revenge."
text:
FILM: 4.0
So, I've been a Zack Snyder fan, appreciating most of his work, but Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire is, to put it bluntly, a disaster.Originally conceived as a Star Wars project, it still feels like Star Wars, just without any of the iconic elements. Sofia Boutella's character seems lifted from Rogue One, resembling Jyn Erso, and the parallels with various Star Wars properties are hard to miss.Typically, Snyder's films are visually captivating, but here, it's surprisingly generic. The attempt at a vintage vibe with custom lenses falls flat, resulting in a blurry and overly bokeh-ridden mess outside the direct centre of the frame.While the costuming appears elaborate, there are moments like Ed Skrein interrogating someone in a white business shirt and black tie, looking misplaced and like he stepped off the set of Transporter Refueled. It's just one of a number of confounding creative choices in the film.The CGI is well-executed, albeit occasionally at odds with the unique live-action camera work. However, what truly stands out for me is an unexpected element in a Snyder film: boredom. Rebel Moon delivers boring characters, bland action, an uninspired story, and janky visuals, making it feel longer than Snyder's four hour Justice League cut.If that weren't enough, the film is only halfway through, with Part 2 expected in April. It faces a significant challenge in salvaging this lacklustre project.FORMAT: StreamingVIDEO: 9.0

title: To much of everything and then even more
text: I had big expectations of this movie and it started put quite good. But then it flipped totally. The story is so shallow, when it has potential to be more. Painting up the characters in action scenes and continuing pushing forward with stupid, in the sense of believable, action scenes. Incredible bombastic but completely out of scope in the part of the story where the first film ends. No sense of touch, no depth, no feelings that I could adhere. If you like a movie with "bring it all on, do not think" this is it. I'm so sorry to se yet another American movie that will be forgotten in 5 seconds after it has ended. Compared to a great movie like Dune this is as bad as it can get.

title: How to ruin the start of a new franchise...
text:
I'm so glad this was not made in the Star Wars universe. Possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen. No spoilers, but my reasons to never see this nonsense movie:
This feels like a student movie, and a bad one at that, and holds no original and creative ideas whatsoever. I was so looking forward to seeing it, but never have I ever been so disappointed. Seriously, don't bother!

title: Adequate
text: This series is derivative of other sci-fi and fantasy media. It's beautiful to look at and has some interesting world building that's cobbled together from previous films. The story line is predictable. The characters are lazy. Because we've seen them before Snyder thinks we'll just get who they are. They're straight outa Star Wars, LOTR and Vikings. And what's WITH the Vikings in space thing anyway. Was it easier to buy beard beads and puffy shirts on ETSY than come with new costume designs? I also object to the uraki that are just horses with weird masks on their heads that make what seem to be growly noises. Too much pew pew gun stuff for me. Compare this to the Mandalorian series. Rebel Moon is the lesser.I'm watching this for the visuals. This is the age of great fantasy and genre fiction. MK Jemisen is a favorite of mine. Film makers can be very conservative in developing stories. Maybe they need to read more. Or maybe they need to watch some of the good anime films that are on Netflix. Studio Ghibli should be an inspiration. Not the overdone Star Wars world.

title: Fun romp for holiday season 2023
text: This is an old school buddy film of a rag tag group of people on the periphery of a changing world. Sofia is a great lead and is so authentic in her role, which goes the same for the rest of the cast. Yes, it is formulaic, but don't overthink it, enjoy the ride.I love sci-fi, this feels like Star Wars, Serenity, Star Trek. The casting is bang on, with just perfect mood setting with the actors and really settling into their roles. Then there is the surprise role of a robot, it is so tender and human, just not expected.I will definitely watch this again during the holidays again, just escape and appreciate the whole package for what it is. I am definitely looking forward to the next release.

title: Too much for one movie
text: Well as their propaganda, I thought it would be a starwars killer but ot was NOT at all. I mean there's a lot here for one movie and the Story didn't caught me in. I mean I like the vibes of tech + old world but I think that they got too much on their plate and didn't make the best of it. The CGI is okay, but sometimes feels like a PC game and not a movie. The characters seems to be so shallow that you berly know them. All my friends were like talking about this movie and I did had some kind of hype and was like this cant be bad I mean, DUNE was amazing and so but this wow... I could not make it to the end the story was so boring. I'm not sure if there are books for the series but I might try them as they probabaly will get me a better expirence than this movie. I have nothing, again absolutely nothing agains Zack but man, that movie is a hard one to watch again. Maybe they should have split this into more parts with a deeper story for each character, with the world surronding them. Anyway, this is my opinion and for my taste 2/10 is the best that I can give at the moment for this movie.

title: Lots of good films, combined into one - FAIL!
text: So, The Magnificent Seven meets Star Wars with a splash of Gladiator chucked in - would seem the recipe for a great movie, I mean, surely anything with great ingrediants must be good, NO??? Well, NO NO NO!!!The movie bounces along in a very predictable way, with special effects on a kin with something made 20 years ago, and on the cheap too, which is why I am so suprised that this was very expensive.To make matters worse, the director, Zack Snyder, who is usually great, insists on using his Xmas present at EVERY opportunity - the 'SLOW MOTION' shoot.. literally within 5 mins, it will occur at least once... very distracting and annoying.Lots have people have viewed this on Netflix, so that might look good, but don't be fooled, its a poor farce!

title: Hipster viking space opera
text: This...is not a good movie,lets get that out of the way straight out of the gate.come the end you care little for the faith of any of the characters,this is mainly down to them all having zero arc or backstory. The plot suffers from constantly pinching bits & pieces from numerous other major flicks creating some kind of frankinstein sci fi show that has no redeeming qualities of its own.Another bone of contention is the strange choice of accents for some characters,in particular Charlie Hunnam.whoever decided that this space pirate should have a Belfast accent needs firing,he steals every scene he is in,and not in a good way.By the time the sequel rolls around in April i doubt there will be many who are invested enough to give it a whirl.

title: Pretty much sucked as a Netflix alternative to Star wars.
text: My god the search for allies was so simplistic one had to be medicated to enjoy it.Nothing stood out explosions and slow mo combat scenes.Yawn.And this was based on the Seven Samurai? The Toshiro Mifune character was a joke. At least in the original and in the Magnificent Seven, original not modern rip off, he had a voice. The representation of poor people.I actually dread the fact there will be at least two more of these to dull an already insipid audience to their early demise.Please some one sue streaming services for life time lost in the hopes dull, tedious, and ultimately useless entertainment will pay viewers not on drugs for the hours of life lost waiting for anything significant to happen.Netflix if you wanted to do something original use the works of Neal Asher and create your own universe that is more interesting. Much like Amazon did half assed with the Expanse.

title: Expectations....
text: Watch this for what it is - fantasy. Take a mixture of your best sci-fi films and video games over the last 20 years, add a dash of westerns and samurai genre and you get the basics of this movie. (Even a bit of Harry Potter).One cool thing is add the ZS cinematography and it just makes it better.This sounds crazy but I think ZS plays WoW, I saw some world instances that were pretty much exact areas in that game (BRF and Blades Mountains). I thought that was pretty cool too.Basically the movie is fun, amazing looking, and something new to watch over Christmas after eating all the food. If you fall asleep just start where you left off.

title: I saw 1 hour, was enough
text: After watching the first hour of the movie, I realized I hadn't read any reviews beforehand, and considering Zack Snyder was the director, I thought that would be sufficient. However, it proved to be quite the opposite. The initial hour failed to captivate me, and I've decided not to finish it because it doesn't seem worth the time investment. Zack Snyder's directorial style may resonate with some, but based on my experience with this particular film, it didn't manage to engage me or live up to my expectations. Perhaps it gets better later on, but my initial impression has led me to the decision to move on to something else that aligns more with my preferences and cinematic taste.

title: Really quite bad & Such a waste of time
text: This film promised high & delivered low in my opinion.The premise of the film makes this another remake of Kurosawa's "Seven Samurai" but really quite poor in the retelling. Remember when the Original 'Dune' film tried to compress 4 books into 90 minutes? This film takes a similar approach but even at over 2hours there a so much assumed backstory that you're lost halfway through.Once you get past the unoriginal plot - you're onto the script , casting and acting. All of which are stilted and horrible. Clunky dialogue that feels like each scene is rushed to get to the next scene without any improvement to plot. The accents are all over the place and even the SFX feels like it was cut in from a 20 years old sci-fi movie. And finally once you get past all of that.... There's the very heavy handed use of slow motion in the fight scenes. It's all so over the top and bad that this film will no doubt be an odds on winner for the Golden Raspberry Award. 3 out 10. Utterly disappointing. Really quite badly made.

title: You've seen it, but in regular speed and with more appealing characters
text: The poster for this movie says it all- Lead character is a "strong female lead" with the biggest head, and then a whole bunch of other characters you couldn't care less about. And on top of that, the poster is from a template used by 103 other movies in the last 3 years. This movie has it all: Nazis (in space though), a girl who kicks butt against men who could actually break her like a twig, a double cross by a white male 'protagonist', and the most runtime-slow-motion-padding you've ever seen in a movie. You know those scenes in movies where they get the gang together and it's done in a montage fashion over several minutes? Well, in this movie it takes 90 minutes. In fact, the title should be: Rebel Moons- How many moons 'til we get through this?But seriously, like Indiana Jones, they put space Nazis in it. Like Harry Potter there is a literal Hippogriff. There are light sabers like Star Wars (along with bad guys who might shoot worse than storm troopers). And as mentioned, more slow-mo than Monday Night Football. This movie isn't worth the time it takes to sit through it. It's dumpster fire fodder. Skip it if you can.!!

title: Solid Sci-Fi: ignore the bad reviews
text: Netflix doesn't always have the best sci-fi movies, but this one was great. The title seems to imply that there will be another part, and I am looking forward to it. It's an action sci-fi, very reminiscent of a Star Wars type tale. It's full of fun special effects, androids, epic fight scenes, and cool looking aliens. Not sure what all the people who are hating on this film were looking for, but it's a solid watch that I think most people will enjoy, definitely not worthy of just one or two stars like some of the other users have rated it. Do yourself a favor and give it a chance, I don't think you will regret it.

title: A Misadventure in Cinematic Excess
text: In Zack Snyder's 'Rebel Moon,' the spectacle eclipses the soul. This leap into a 'Star Wars'-like universe lands in a charmless sandbox, with Snyder's overindulgence in slow-motion for even the simplest actions serving more as a narrative hindrance than an enhancement. The characters, as deep as action figures, meander through a plot stitched together from clichés of B-movie westerns and Kurosawa's classics, yet devoid of their essence.This space opera, embedded with 'Star Wars' DNA, fails to evoke the sense of awe and wonder it ambitiously aims for. Visually striking it may be, yet it's a landscape emotionally barren. Unlike 'Dunyayi Kurtaran Adam,' the Turkish cult classic that playfully dabbled with 'Star Wars' themes with a tongue-in-cheek approach, 'Rebel Moon' takes itself too seriously, morphing into an expensive parody, a shadow of the cinematic titans it attempts to replicate.In conclusion, 'Rebel Moon' is a visual feast starved of substance, proving that sometimes, less is indeed more in storytelling. Snyder's fondness for slow motion only adds to the film's overbearing atmosphere, making it a cumbersome watch.

title: Everything wrong with Space Opera
text: Snyder's Rebel Moon has become the newest addition to my list of the stupidest sci fi movies of all time, finding itself right in between Prometheus and Jupiter Ascending. It is 100% style and 0% substance. Every ounce of production was spent on trying to make a thing that looks "cool" and not one modicum of effort was spent on characters, narrative, cohesion, world-building, etc. There are so many problems with this movie and I'm annoyed that I haven't seen any reviews giving this the brutal scalding that it deserves.First of all, there is not one single thing in this movie that is unique. I saw a review describe this as a kid dumping out their toybox filled with bootleg action figures and bashing them together, and that's EXACTLY what it feels like. Take the worst, most generic tropes from every Space Opera (Star Wars, Dune, Warhammer, Riddick, Guardians of the Galaxy, etc), combine them and you get Rebel Moon. Every single character, scene, location, encounter, line of dialogue, etc is at best extremely uninspired and predictable, or is a nearly direct copy of something from another movie. For example there is a cantina scene here that is pretty much beat-for-beat the Mos Eisley scene. The motherworld or whatever is just House Harkonen/Imperium of Man/Necromongers, the Gyphon scene is straight out of Harry Potter/Avatar....you get the idea.The story is painfully stupid and suffers from the same inherent flaw as Justice League. This is another "I'm forming a team" movie where we're thrown into a universe that we know nothing about, and are rushed around to meet the characters who will form the squad at a breakneck pace without ever understanding why or what's going on. We're quickly introduced to each character on some random nondescript world, shown what is supposed to a poignant scene with them (which has no impact whatsoever because we know literally nothing about them) and then quickly move on and the character never speaks more than 2 lines for the rest of the film. It's impossible to care about anything because nothing is explained or connected in any meaningful way. To make it worse, the scenes are often incredibly silly and contrived, take the spider one for example -- the asian lady with swords (sorry, we're told nothing at all about this character so that's literally all I can say to describe her) kills the spider because it has been stealing children. However they say its been stealing children for a while yet only RIGHT NOW in front of our heroes the lady decides to kill her. There are no repercussions whatsoever for killing the spider, so why didn't she (or someone else) do it sooner? Every one of these scenes is exactly like this - completely lacking in logic.The narrative provides only the absolute bare minimum required to move the characters to the next place so they can find the next guy and we learn nothing of substance in any of these encounters.The other major problem with this film is that I never got the sense that the writers put any thought into the universe, not do they understand anything about how science, technology, or space work. Similar to the stupidity of Prometheus: no one ever wears space suits or a helmet for some reason, because I guess everyone can breathe everywhere in the universe and every planet is exactly the same as Earth in every way; when people do actually wear "armor" it's the most bizarre, half assed stuff that wouldn't protect you from anything (one in particular is like a half-finished roman cosplay outfit. Yeah very functional for futuristic combat I'm sure!). The level of technology is extremely inconsistent to a level of absurdity so great I'm not going to bother getting into it. There are a lot of throwaway lines that indicate how little thought was put into this universe. At one point the main girl mentions fighting for the empire when she was age 18 and that she "fought on countless worlds". Really, how did you have time to fight on COUNTLESS worlds being that young? Things in space are very, very, very far apart, how did you travel to countless worlds in the span of a few years? Are we really saying this universe even contains COUNTLESS (millions, billions?) of fully populated, habitable worlds in it? How would that even work? How does the empire keep control over millions of worlds, how do people travel and communicate over those distances? Anyway, my point is that there are tons of lines and scenarios in this movie that make it obvious that the only thing that mattered was making things and scenes that "look cool", and nobody cared that nothing makes a single shred of sense if you think about it for more than a second.Unfortunately, they barely even succeeded at the looking cool thing. A few things do look nice - a few of the Star Wars-derivative locations are nice to look at and a few costumes are ok as well. There is a robot that looks cool and seems important, but then after 2 minutes of screen time is never shown or mentioned again. That said, there is also a lot of horrendous CGI (the background on the moon is laughably atrocious), and a whole lot of scenes randomly going out of focus which feels painfully amateur.The fights are generally clunky, illogical, filled with "extremely accommodating stunt men" and the comically liberal use of slow motion.There's more I could say but I'm tired of expending mental resources thinking about this film. To sum it up: Rebel Moon is the worst aspects of Zack Snyder filmmaking, the worst aspects of Zack Snyder writing, and the worst aspects of the Space Opera genre. Watch at your own risk. 1 star for a few of the creature designs and 1 star because my cat seemed to be really into it and only ran away once.

title: Why all the hate?
text: As a person who has seen all Star Wars movies and does not get the hype about them, I thought I'd give this space film a watch.And I have to say, I think it's better than Star Wars with a good story. I'm actually looking forward to part 2. I've never looked forward to a Star Wars release because it's all the same over and over again.The problem I find is that too many Star Wars fans keep comparing sci-fi movies to Star Wars. Look at this film as a totally separate experience and just enjoy it.If you like Zack Snyder films, then you will not be disappointed with part one of this new world. 9/10.

title: In the words of the immortal Frank Cross ...
text: Wow, did that suck.Constant slow motion. Constant melodrama. Zack Snyder found every way possible to make a potential interesting story as boring as possible.Ed Skrien, who I like, somehow ends up in an IRS white shirt and pencil thin tie in an intergalactic thriller?What?Snyder attempted to steal and then deform every potential good idea to make it completely devoid of any entertainment.A Borg-like spider? Sure, why not.A blonde haired blued princess who is the "savior of kindness and empathy"? Sure, why not.Sofia Boutella, Dijmon Hounsou, Charlie Hunnam and Skrien are all wasted on an awful script and worse dialogue.I'm sure I will watch Part 2 because I'm a fan of the actors but Snyder hasn't done anything really good since Sucker Punch.

title: No story what so ever..
text: The story doesn't make sense. Bad dialog, bad acting, bad flow. Just a waste of time and money... it feels like AI wrote it. The Star Wars from the 80s was much better than this junk. When I tried to explain the story to my friend, I was actually speechless... The whole story could be summarized in 2-3 sentences. What a shame. This movie proves that even if you get millions of dollars, you still can easily make something as bad as this.I feel very very very disappointed after watching this movie, and I need some quality sci-fi to emotionally recover from this.My advice to you who didn't watch it yet... DON'T.

title: A congested story that is better suited for a series
text: The scale of any sci-fi project is innately grand and ambitious; and even though this universe and its characters are products of Zach Snyder's originality, they lack the grounded charm and relatability of the Star Wars universe that clearly serves as a source of inspiration. Confining this type of story to two films may prove to be a congested decision. Instead of proper development, as seen in Dune (Part One) or Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope, Rebel Moon rushes through its fundamental pieces to jumpstart an adventurous journey that would be more rewarding if the foundation had been set. The score by Tom Holkenborg is excellent and there are glimpses of triumphant moments, but Snyder quickly returns to his own stylistic choices that have proven to be unsuccessful in previous films. Staged sets with distinctive backdrops create an enclosed world to tell an expansive story which ultimately confines the unearthly element that makes this story unique. There's enough context to leave viewers wondering what will happen in Part 2, however I'm not sure many will be marking their calendars in April to find out.

title: Throw a pot of paint at the wall and watch it dry for 2 hours, it'll be more entertaining than this film
text: Oh, dear! Just like the cast probably did, I went in to this film with such high hopes. I presumed this film would be a great watch, a career defining moment for all those involved, a Zack Snyder film to be in ore of, alas it is anything but.To be honest I wished I'd cashed out of this film after just five minutes, and by the looks of the acting chops of the cast...they actually did that themselves. From the opening shot the film had lost me, I was expecting a visual spectacular, only to be met with obvious set extensions and poor acting. With the emotional empathy of a charging rhino the cast ground the scatter gun nonsensical plot into the interstellar earth and they didnt give a monkeys by all accounts.Bad cut after bad cut of ropey CGI, obvious set extensions and ScFi with zero heart or intent of the likes not seen for a decade and more grinds out before your eyes in a soul crushing realisation that the film just continues to slowly burn out after peeking with the opening credits, I was stunned...this is a Zack Synder film isn't it or was it Sack Zynder? And all that's not helped by a plot which is thinner than a bald man's hairline, it really is poor.To cap it off it's part 1, oh god prey tell there's not going to be more made, not like this...please no!I'll save you the trouble of wasting 2 hours of your time. Thrown a pot of paint at the wall, pull up a chair, sit back and watch it dry forv2 hours, I'll tell you for nothing, it'll be far more interesting than watching this film.

title: A visual delight but little else.
text: I was really hesitant to watch this film due to all the bad reviews but it looked so interesting and I love sci-fi so I thought why not, surely it's not as bad as the reviews make it seem, well unfortunately I was wrong, it's without question very bad.Really the only thing the movie has going for it is the CGI and cinematography, it truly is a visual delight for the eyes and for that alone I gave it 4 stars, everything else however is just plain terrible, the acting is wooden, the characters are uninteresting and poorly developed, the story is rushed and the writing laughable, it literally has nothing else going for it and being a visual treat doesn't make a movie good.So to summarize, it looks good and little else, if you want anything more than incredible CGI prepare to be disappointed.

title: Awesome if you like slow motion action and are drunk
text: There is no way I can honestly recommend this movie, it was that bad.The acting was absolutely horrible. I didn't care for any of the characters and even before the end I want to turn it of and watch Mandolorian again instead. The MC was supposed to be some kind of awesome warrior but instead could not hit the side of a barn with her gun at 5 feet. The dialog was garbage. The action was just a person dancing around with weapons in slow motion while the enemy stood still looking confused. The gun fights were all about spray and pray. Much of the cgi was poor especially at the beginning of the film.This movie is more reminiscent of Chronicles of Riddick meets John Carter with a smattering of other almost straight up copied characters from other movies. I was half expecting a bunch of apes to come out running into the action armed with crossbows and a wizard or two to run out waving a wand and chanting spells maybe flying on a broom.Personally I think I'm done with Snyder's films.

title: Worst Brown Movie EVER
text: This movie is just so bad, disappointing and generic, I don't even have words or nerves and patience to describe it! Plot summary: Rebel irish farmers and space minorities fighting against space nazis! I hate the brown color now thanks to this movie, the color DP has maybe daltonism of some sort or something, he needs to be fired! The story is waste of time. Blinding amount of lens flares, bloom effects and action scenes with constant slow- mo! Not to mention that this is not sci-fi, its FANTASY and just like Star Wars sucks monkey buts! Don't watch this, better off just go watch the two seasons of Isaac Asimov's Foundation. They are gold compared to this crap!

title: Not the worst
text:
I really enjoyed this...after reading the early reviews,wasn't expecting much..it ticked all the boxes for me..it made me escape from the life I think a lot of us are going through..you have to know what to expect from a zach snyder film...it's not saving private ryan..but visually its spectacular...thought Charlie's northern Irish accent was just a touch better than his cockney accent in green st..Corey stoll is solid as always...got a feeling Anthony hopkins has a big part to play in episode 2.thought the young girl giving out water (when you watch you will know)
Is going places.a decent movie.

title: What I just saw
text: This is a bad movie no matter whose fan you are. The only reason I gave it a 4 is because the visuals are not that bad (but we expected that) but I can't say the same thing about action scenes which are boring and bad executed.The story makes no sense. I can't even give you spoilers because nothing happens in this movie. Many, many so called main characters are introduced here in the most pathetic way, that at the end of the movie you won't remember who is who. The dialogue is the most cringe I have ever watched, can't stand it. Poor actors are not to blame here because they did what they could.It's a waste of time!

title: Derivative and not in a good way
text: This movie lurches from one scene to the next with bad dialogue, stock characters with infantile predictabilityIt "borrows" from other films and genres so much so it was probably pitched as; The Seven Samurai meets Riddick meets Harry Potter meets Gladiator and throw in some bad guys we have left over from Raiders of the Lost Ark with some questionable "tentacle" cameos...and kid you got yourself a film!No Zack, what you have here is a mess.What you have created should be something that should end your career. Sadly though, there will be an equally painful part 2 to this miscarriage.Skip this one and the next one.

title: Wanted so hard to like this.
text: For something that was originally intended as a Star Wars movie, that franchise appears to have far less influence here than so many other movies, shows, books & games.Warhammer 40K, Lynch's Dune, Chappie, John Carter, Anime, even Lord Of The Rings, and in one scene it was Harry Potter meets Avatar.But the thing is, this isn't reverent homage, or skilfully adapted influence, it's out & out cherry-picked plagiarism, and really badly, obviously done.The whole film is one "wouldn't it be cool if . . . " moment after another, the action scenes are over-choreographed & reliant on excessively used slo-motion to cover up their shortcomings, and the character development is practically non-existent, except for the main protagonist, who gets extended flashback scenes to give her her 'Gamora' backstory. As a result there is no empathising with any of the cardboard cutout cliches this movie is populated with.The plot is one that's been used over & over & over again. Seven Samurai, Magnificent Seven, Battle Beyond The Stars, and each one of those did it better.I'm not a Snyder hater, but he's always been better at adapting existing stories (300, Watchmen) than producing original work.Frankly, the prospect of a part two, and an extended cut is underwhelming & leaves me with no enthusiasm at all. I honestly couldn't care less.

title: I honestly can't fathom the low ratings
text: I don't know what people are rating this so low for. It is quality sci-fi, which, is so rare. Complaining about characters not being fleshed out enough!? What do want, a novel, on every major character!!? Use you imagination a bit. It has solid story, sure it's been told before, but in a fantastic new world and setting. The characters it presents leave rrom both for imagination, which is fantastic in my opinion and also to be fleshed out with more back story in part 2. I also found them quite engaging and it's not too hard to imagine their back stories. Sure it's not going to set the world alight as a progessive awe-inspiring piece of cinema, but, it's a damn good film. I give this 8/10 but actually rating it 10/10 to spite the haters.

title: A Poster Child for Style over Substance
text: Rebel Moon is a movie that deals in compelling concepts and worldbuilding and boasts amazing visuals, but it sadly fails to deliver on more basic storytelling fundamentals. It's easy to see the parallels Snyder was trying to draw between his film and Seven Samurai/Magnificent Seven, but these only serve to cripple the story in the character department. Kora is given a somewhat decent backstory, but virtually every other side character is given only one introductory action scene before they are shelved to make way for the next. This results in a collection of exciting but shallow set pieces that fail to function as the director intended simply because he has not given the audience nearly enough material to sympathize with most of the characters. It would've done the movie a lot of good to cut an action scene (or three) in order to show the cast interact with each other and bounce off of each other's vastly different backgrounds and experiences. Instead, the audience is given only the bare minimum in terms of character description before the plot moves along to the next scene. It makes it very difficult to feel the emotional impact of a character's sacrifice when the audience knows basically nothing about their motivations.In summary, Rebel Moon has some gorgeous cinematography and impressive (albeit very Snyder-ized slo-mo) action scenes, but lacks basic writing techniques needed for good characters. Good for one watch, but the script needs some serious re-drafting.

title: Some good scenes but...
text: Like any quest, it has the hero's journey to fight for a noble cause. But it was let down by its unimaginative writing. All I could see here was a recycled script that had been synonym-washed by ChatGPT.I wanted to like this movie, it has all the elements of a classic space western but I couldn't immerse myself in the story and the fight scenes were diminished by the incessant slo-mo.Other reviewers have mentioned its rejection by Disney as Star Wars story, King Levitica certainly looks like he's from that universe and the bar scene was so awkwardly cribbed I automatically started humming the Cantina Band song. The less said about the shamelessly Potteresque griffin encounter the better.Despite my criticisms I'll most likely watch part 2 of this Seven Samurai wannabe, I just hope it's more like the Magnificent 7 than the Three Amigos.

title: Fun fact
text: If you burn a Million dollars a minute for the whole duration of this movie you'll still 25 million short to reach its budget, but you'll be more entertained.Overall it's not even a movie it's just a long clip, quite beautiful in some parts, but everything else is bad. It's like a child used chatgpt to write a star wars spin-off.Dialogues, plot, characters, exposition, everything is pure disaster.Every character words causes extreme cringe or is just relaying exposition to one another: -"Hey most dangerous woman in the universe, can we win this?" -"Sure most defiant and experienced general in the Galaxy veteran of whogivesanf".

title: Awful story line
text: The whole story line feels totally rushed and fake. There's no connection to the characters, there motivations and so many plot holes that leave you wondering how did this script ever get funded and how did they get those actors to commit to it.It's quite possibly the worst movie I've ever seen and the only reason I finished it was because I was on a plane and had already downloaded it. It was so bad though I took 3 attempts to finish it.The bad guys are comically bad too and it so are the heros. It's like it's taken pieces from different films and chucked it all into one film but with no context or back story. Just super lazy.

title: I'm digging it.
text: I read so many bad reviews for this movie that I think people just like to hate on Zack Snyder's movies. So many said it was a "Star Wars rip off" when the only thing that resembles Star Wars is that it has intergalactic elements . I couldn't stop thinking about how that's such a very small minded opinion that barely scrapes the surface of what this movie (and Star Wars for that matter) is.
