It definitely is it's own movie with it's own universe and story, and if you're not trying to nitpick everything that's "wrong" with the movie then you might have a good time watching it like I did. There isn't one problem with the acting, dialogue, scenery, special effects, or anything that I see most complaining about. I saw one review that said they could barely make it the first 10 minutes. Like... really? What movie are all these haters watching because I don't get it at all. This is only part one and I'm definitely on board to see where the next parts take us. Anyway, if you're interested in the movie at all or just happen to come upon it and think it might be worth a watch, don't listen to the hate, have an open mind and just watch the damn movie.

title: Who in the world keeps allowing this man to make movies?
text: How can I describe this film? Imagine you asked chatgpt to write star wars but to remove all the magic, all the flair, everything interesting and charming, make it look, sound, and read like it was done by a rejected film student turned YouTube creator with 156 followers (and counting guys so keep smashing that like button!) named Kyle who loves Axe body spray and monster energy and was given the budget of the first avengers movie oh yeah and add in Kratos, a samurai, vikings that turn into cowboys, and make it horny and full of fire. If you can imagine that film and how bad it is, then you've found yourself with a film that was about ten times more watchable than this swill.

title: Eating too much Lucky Charms
text: Hunnam's fake Irish accent.. hahahahahahahahaha ... did he just watch Lucky Charms commercials to try and mimic them? It's laughable!!! The Irish don't have the same tonal inflection to every sentence they speak - start low, end high. It's almost like he thinks he's singing.Anyway... for a film.. meh.. s'okay.Basically it's a rework of The Magnificent Seven meets Star Wars. That the crux of the story.Star Wars for the bad guys... Magnificent Seven for the good guys.... Perhaps Snyder is relying on viewers not making the connections, but it seems so glaringly obvious to me.I watched the entire thing... so there's that... and I'll catch the next part, so there's that as well. But I won't be sitting through this again anytime soon. Once was enough as I imagine it would be for most viewers.There's no repeat viewing aspect to it. Nothing, other than the Gryphon, is terribly unique or interesting. And I have no clue what riding a gryphon has to do with someone being a good soldier or taking down an Imperial Planetary army (quite a nonsensical leap there). Just another case of Snyder throwing in some interesting visuals that mean NOTHING to the actual storyline. He could have used the money spent on a CGI gryphon FAR more effectively.

title: Another great Snyder remake
text: Having read some of the reviews on there, I nearly didn't watch it. That would have been a big mistake. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and as always, Snyder never fails to entertain. Some of the comments on here are just laughable, particularly those that state the similarities between this and some other films. Particularly Star Wars. It's Sci-Fi, it's in space, it has a baddie, oh yeah must be Star Wars. No. If anything this movie can be compared to something like "Battle Beyond the Stars", classic 80s style SciFi that I watched as a kid. Is it one of Snyder's best, no, is it great fun to watch, yes. Can't wait for the sequel.

title: Huge budget, no substance
text: It's hard to review this movie without comparing it to all the other forms of media it is so similar to.It's a bit like watching a mishmash of all the popular science fiction media of the last 30 years or so. One would assume this yield a fun and entertaining result, but not so. Rebel Moon left me wondering why should I care about these characters, there is next to no character development, a handful of characters are thrust upon your lap and you're suddenly expected to feel invested in their story. It really, feels shallow and under developed.The only positive about the movie, is the visuals, that's about it.I would recommend watching the other similar material it clearly drew inspiration from instead.

title: Not sure what exactly I'm looking
text: Not sure what exactly I'm looking for. Trying to watch this for the Christmas holidays but have a hard time. Just another bad sci-fi movie. Bad dialogues, mellow stories, and action scenes are filled with outdated slow-mo.Characters are not persuasive and I can't figure them out as much as I want to. The military guy is probably copied from Inglorious Bastards as a character.Not sure why Charlie Hunman is playing in these movies. I have a feeling his roles are the same character. Wish this would be an exception but it's a rule that is hard to make good sci-fi.Not sure that after this I'm gonna watch part 2.

title: Very disappointing.
text: I will start by saying that I am not an avid Star Wars fan, if I were it's quite possible I would've felt personally insulted by this film. It's really very poor. The characters are all awful, the story is awful, the acting if bad, the SFX are incredibly sub-standard given it is almost 2024, and the action scenes aren't really that at all because they are all in super slow-mo.Zack Sneyder is capable of much better than this. It is understandable why it was rejected by the Star Wars franchise as there is nothing here that they haven't already done bigger and better and 45 years before this turd.

title: Nothing original about thus
text: Star Wars, Avitar, Pirates of the Caribbean, Game of Thrones, Lord of the Rings, Inglorious B*******, you will see all these and more in this huge lump of 2nd rate cheese. There was always going to be a time where we humans ran out of fresh ideas. I guess we have arrived there. I feel rather insulted that they thought we wouldn't notice. Why Charlie Hunnam had a Northan Irish accent is unfathomable, but one things for sure using his own accent would have been easier for him and easier for us as well. In the days of advanced cgi I guess churning out weak stories masked by fancy computer work is the order of the day. Sad really.

title: This was awesome
text:
This movie was really good! It had a cool story, great visuals, interesting characters and fun planets. I can really see the Star Wars influence on this one, and how it could've played out if Snyder didn't have to abandon the franchise.It wasn't a perfect movie, the first half was cool and more character focused, but it was a bit slower. It spent its time introducing you to cool characters, who after their moment to shine in their intro, they don't do a whole lot. I wish I could've seen more of them, but I think we'll see them shine in the next one.Once the movie made it to its second half it went by really fast, and I was surprised when it ended "so quickly"
It had the standard Snyder slow motion, which was cool, but several times felt overplayed and unnecessary.It's still a fun movie and I recommend to any science fiction fan out there.

title: Script and plot by ChatGPT?
text: I honestly googled if the script was AI generated and it seems I wasn't the only one who wondered. It felt like scene after scene was cut right out of a bunch of other films, stitched together to form a halfway coherent plot, and changed just enough to pass a plagiarism test. It was really just a mashup of tropes from popular films with zero character development. I sat through it only because I like some of the actors and was hoping the plot would actually come together and stsrt making sense at some point. It took me three sittings just to get through it. I'm generally love sci-fi and fantasy and am not super picky in those genres, but I could not help but audibly groan and roll my eyes throughout this movie. I reactivated my imdb account just to write a review because I don't think I've ever seen a worse movie.

title: The most generic movie, with good visual
text: This movie pissed me off as it lured you in with good cinematography and the promise of "a new Star Wars", or at least you get the feeling it aims to be "a new Star Wars"Yet it fails to deilver on anything but good effects and visuals in general,the plotnline is very predictable, the dialogue between characters feel unnatural and incredibly boring, the fight choreographyy is a lot of dramatic music with excessive use of slow mow, and the characters themselves are more shallow than a puddleI had to skip a few scenes because they were too dranw out, or melodramaticSafe to say i dont reccomend, neither this one, nor the second part (witch is even worse)

title: Frustratingly terrible
text: Plot made little sense, and the character development was ambitious and failed. That is a directorial decision that should have been reviewed before someone gave Snyder another budget.Why, exactly, assemble this ragtag group of rebels only to not put them to use? How is it that they their existence and loyalties are known, yet scattered throughout the universe?How is it that the main protagonist presents as a young female, yet has enough Mary Sue energy to single handedly defeat a battle group of hardened military opponents?I kept thinking that this was Seven Samurai meets Firefly, and yet both of those thematic predecessors did their job with more thoughtful consistency to both character and plot.This appears to yet again be another exercise of Snyder getting a big budget for some laser flashes and ultra violence, but maybe somebody will eventually require that he employs a writer too.Ps. Why is everything on Netflix so mediocre? Could they plz start valuing quality over quantity? Even if they are trying to speak to multiple demographic cross sections, I'd prefer 3 good movies in any one category than 15 very mediocre ones. I legit can't remember the last time I recommended an original Netflix series to anyone I know.

title: Zack Snyders space opera epic opens a new franchise with this film feeling little short
text: 4 out of 5 stars.Rebel Moon: Part 1 A Child of Fire is a good epic space opera film which Zack Snyder tries build a worldbuilding franchise. A start of one with this film. Several characters being introduced. The plot setting up for bigger events to come. Several worlds and set pieces.The plot is about a tyrant invading a peaceful farming world which Kora (Sofia Boutella) a hidden rebel soldier. Decides to recruit other warriors to help fight back against this tyrant.The film sets up with Kora recruiting several others by visiting there worlds. Convincing them to join her. Which is what majority of the film covers.There is a few action sequences. Great fight sequences with Sofia Boutella. The visual effects are good and set pieces are good. The cast ensemble is also good as well.The film does leave you feeling a little short. Especially the climax which the films action sequence felt like it was trimmed down. While Kora was doing most of the fighting. The team she built up felt underutilized during the climax which the film spent most of the run time building up the team and even on an epic scale. When it came to the climax it missed out on the epic and wow factor when it came to Kora fighting with the bad guys army. Hopefully, Zack Snyders directors cut version fixes all that. Cause the film did feel like they trimmed it down.Overall, it was a good film and i enjoyed it. Which I cant wait to see more films made and see what Zack Snyder does next.

title: What a disappointment...
text: I wanted it to be good, but alas what they gave me was characters I couldn't care about, banal dialogue, impossible-to-follow battle scenes, and noise. Lots and lots of noise.I saw all of part one, and although I gritted my teeth and tried to enjoy part two, I just couldn't make it through more than the first few minutes of that segment. I have been more engaged by some of the amateur productions I've seen on YouTube's Dust. Probably the best thing about all of this is that there pretty definitely will never be a part three.Finally, on a more positive note, I found the design of the ships and the way they would hover over the landscape to be very nicely done.

title: Watchable!
text: Bad:Its well over 30. The hell, even 40+.And that folks demand way better acting in a first place (tbh, not that everyone sucks).Another thing - cheap ass SLOW MOTION effects in EVERY fighting scene? Was that done in a Cap Cut app? Cheese, childish, amateurish.In a first fighting scene, I expected a clean cut of an arm and pretty much gore and blood, yet immediately realised its kind of censored, but don't understand why? You have A LOT of violence here anyway, like smashing heads with a stick/pole, and you do fighting without blood? Adding gore in a visual way would ramped this movie up really good. Actually, in the last scene, there is a tiny bit of it..Some emotional scenes are like... commercials. Have a real TV commercial vibe. Or some 2000. Music video, idk. Its not good, however.It looks like no one who worked on this film had a freedom and everything is heavily limited because of this and that, idk. Seems that most of the actors decided to do this half ass.Movie made for everyone, yet no one will really like it.Good:+ But anyway.. somehow its a highly watchable movie. Not completely trash as it seems. It still IS kind of "netflix generic crap", but it has something, to hold attention, and even enjoying a bit.Photography is great, guns and shootings are well designed, space ships and frigates are solid, sound is great. Fighting is good (even with annoying slow motion and lack of blood and gore).Sceneries are great. Haircuts are original and perfect.Using of smoke effects is well done..Will watch part two, even if it is on the same level.

title: No
text:
Another film that makes no sense banal and obvious seems written with cahtgpt
The direction of this film and much more lacking and non-existent slowmotion than the preferred mannerism of snyder and unbearable slow down the rhythm of the film then the final twist and the most predictable and the worst ever seen in a movie. The visual effects are done quite well but employed badly in the scenes the sepia filter dulling everything and the dark photo does not help because from a dull and sad tone to all movie. What a Star wars,, mixed with dunes that is full of flaws and no obvious merits another movie failure for Netflix.

title: Stylish space opera is OK but lacks new ideas
text: Part 1 is obviously set-up; we meet the "Seven Samurai" characters and get some world-building. The characters are rather simple; the good guys have honor; no one else does. There's a giant spider woman and nasty mercenary creatures that look like orcs -- feels a bit like Tolkien's LOTR in Space (although there's no MacGuffin {One Ring} so far) with Warhammer-style ships and weapons. And we have an over-the-top stereotypical Nazi villain. The word derivative comes to mind.The casting seems generally fine, but the choice of Sofia Boutella (Hotel Artemis) for a super-warrior is a bit of a stretch. She's athletic but a bit unconvincing; I like her but I think she would have been better cast as a secondary warrior or perhaps a thief; she seems a bit small to go up against some of the hulking adversaries (but granted, her character's combat skills are impressively well-rounded).This Netflix movie begins and ends on an agricultural planet (The Shire?) populated by pseudo-Viking peasants. There's a town with a space-port full of dubious characters (think Star Wars "bar" scene).Conceptually, this is only a three (3) star film. But it gets a 1-star bonus for the impressive visuals, and another for the Zack Snyder touch. That's five (5) stars total.BTW, my favorite character is the thoughtful, melancholy robot -- the only story element that lingers, sadly.EDIT: Part 2 is now out. I'm in the minority that liked it better (gave it a 6); there is more character development. So if you're on the fence, endure Part 1 for the set-up, and Part 2 for some pay-off. Just my two cents.

title: If you enjoy Sci fi
text: It's great.Yes there are alot of scenes lifted from other films but it's done very well. Anthony Hopkins as the voice of the robot is so lovely, more please.If you like Zak Snyders style, you know what you are in for, beautifully shot and a bit of slo mo.Watchmen is one of my favourite films, I have watched it many times, this not quite up there yet but looking forward to part 2 in April. This would have been fantastic on the cinema screen but glad it is on Netflix.Ed Skrein is great, I love good bad man.It whips along, as anything over 2 hours is a bit long for me but this doesn't drag at all. Sit back and enjoy.

title: Boring despite all the skills available in the cast
text: Good actors but they hardly got any depth in their screen personas, nor anything to say so you never get to know them. You do not get any feelings for them as they are flat as cardboard cutouts. Nice settings, pompous music, a lot of slow motion that is kind of cool but gets old fast. Cool dark atmosphere but a lot of space travel where people are added to the team easy and without any real discussion, they just come along with a stranger with a suicide mission without any sense of camaraderie. The bad guys are super bad, almost comically drawn as the worst and then times 10. Not likely the staff of the universes most disciplined army where mistakes lead to crucifixion.The movie could have been really good and I usually are rather open minded when it comes to sci-fi, overlooking sound in space, gravity on spaceships and fast travel between planets that seem so go effort and cost free.A missed chance in my mind. I will look at part two of course hoping that it will redeem itself.

title: Beautiful and Empty
text: "Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire" is a cinematic endeavor that shines in its imaginative world-building but unfortunately falls short in delivering a coherent plot. Director Zach Snyder, known for his visually arresting style, crafts a universe rich in detail and aesthetic splendor. The film is a feast for the eyes, with beautiful cinematography and cutting-edge animation that promises an epic sci-fi adventure.However, beneath this visual spectacle lies the film's Achilles' heel: a lack of substantive storytelling. The narrative feels secondary to the array of slow-motion action sequences, which, while impressively choreographed, do little to advance a compelling story. The film frequently indulges in these stylistic flourishes, often at the expense of developing a believable and engaging plot.The world of "Rebel Moon" is undeniably creative, a testament to Snyder's vision and the film's talented art team. Yet, this creativity doesn't extend to the script. The characters wander through stunning landscapes and elaborate set pieces, but their journey needs more depth and emotional resonance. It's a classic case of style over substance, where the narrative's potential is overshadowed by its visual execution."Rebel Moon" is a frustrating experience. It had the potential to be a groundbreaking piece of science fiction cinema, given its breathtaking visuals and innovative world. However, Snyder's focus on aesthetics and neglect of a solid storyline ultimately undermine the film's impact. It's a stark reminder that no amount of visual stimulus can compensate for the foundational need for robust and compelling storytelling in film.

title: Star Wars meets Riddick in a really bad way
text: The most expensive movie in 2023. This is how it was being advertised on NetFlix.So naturally I am compelled to watch, and I did.Basically, it was sheer torture to have to witness a really bad storyline done with awful acting and top to bottom Star Wars clichés. Some parts of the story was reminiscent of Riddick and there were also other rip-off themes not worthy to mention. The whole thing is one big bag of clichés which of course is a recipe for utter boredom.I am truly appalled for Zach Snyder to come up with this pos. Is there really a lack of good, inventive, creative, dare-to-challenge-the-norms kinda new stories that even after 46 years they are still spending millions on Star Wars clones?

title: How many rip offs are in this waste of money flick?
text: According to the IMDb page an estimated $90,000,000 was wasted on this movie. Surely someone with far more patience and viewing breadth than moi has already complied a complete list of all the films and series dumped into this terrible excuse for a script. From Star Wars to Vikings to The Matrix and lots of others it's all blatantly coped and pasted together to create a meaningless mess. Impossible to care for any of the characters. The plot is a complete cliche of cliches. Guess the upside is that it provided employment for the cast and production crew? Am racing straight back to my to watch list of South Korean films and dramas produced with pride in the finished product. Check out the Blue Dragon Awards 2023 for far better film entertainment. Don't waste you time on this moon manure.

title: A brilliant movie I thoroughly enjoyed
text: I don't understand why there's so much dislike for this movie amongst many reviewers. I knew absolutely nothing about this movie when it appeared on Netflix, and so I watched it on Christmas day with no expectations what so ever. I am a great lover of science fiction and fantasy and it turned out I was in for a highly entertaining treat. I definitely sensed the Star Wars influence, and appreciated the great performance from an intriguing set of actors. The entire movie is grandiose eye candy, with some very interesting slow motion sequences. Absolutely loved it and can't wait for part 2 to be released next year.

title: Nothing New
text: The simple people rise against the empire!The simple farmers are so simple, their simpliness so simply simple that we cannot help but root for them.Oh, wait. I can. This concept is so over done is boring. Just another technology advanced civilization with advanced space travel with farmers harvesting by hand. It's such banal nonsense that we as the viewer are expected to just accept. The writer and director must see us as simpletons; giving us these shallow simple people as what we are able to relate toI would rather see the story of the lineage of the royalty and their magic than this trite garbage.

title: Bad Star Wars with SA references
text: Poor storyline. Consistent need to reference sexual assault to grab the viewers attention. Terrible dialogue. Looked like a PlayStation game. So long and boring but none of the characters were somewhat likable. Wants to be Dune meets Star Wars but just feels like the Harry Potter PlayStation game with a lame story where they just consistently bring up sexual assault.Don't waste your time watching it. I had to finish it cos my fiancé wanted to. Honestly had to turn it off 3x times as we kept falling asleep. Don't start it. The people who made this movie should've put their money towards feeding world hunger.

title: Star Wars meets Gothic
text: Yes again... female super strong lead (weighs probably 50kg) eliminate ten soldiers which had the similar training to her. Nothing I can identify with and this is just forced diversity. I could accept if this would be a robot or at least enhanced female like Alita Battle Angel.To much slow motion but this is Zach Snyder. Also a lot of shots are forced blurred. The landscape views are wonderful and some ideas great.But this first movie was just OK. Far away from the hype it got in the past. But close to the level I expected from another female fight character movie we got from Hollywood again.

title: $160 Million Storyboard
text: Zach Snyder has essentially spent $160 million to create a storyboard of a movie idea. He shows us 3-D images of characters, aliens, spaceships, and planets, but all without any true depth. If only Snyder had hired some actual story writers to add some meaning to his Sci-Fi idea, we could have ended up with a good movie. Snyder is good at imagining and directing action but safe to say at this point he is not a good writer. Hopefully Netflix has learned this lesson, unfortunately the hard way. This disaster reminds me of Rings of Power, and another cautionary tale of how desperately need good writing to make a good movie. So say we all?

title: Epic Movie!!!
text: Absolutely the best movie out there. Great writing, characters and directing. The acting is phenomenal. The twists and turns are perfectly proportionate and doesn't overwhelm. Truly an original masterpiece!! Zack Snyder outdid himself again. The writing brings out the characters and story in a way I haven't seen in years. The entire movie keeps your full attention. The story is gripping, edge of your seat action and the fighting scenes are creative and epic! It's the greatest movie my family and I have seen in so long and will be rewatching again over and over! Must see movie!!! If you like sci-fi and action then this movie is for you!!

title: Plagiarism and ridiculously bad
text:
I rarely write reviews, but this was just straight out bad.I didn't read a single review on this movie, just went in with a open mind and boy my mind was blown in thousands pieces of how bad this movie was written and executed.The plot and acting is just embarrassing bad. Seriously, almost every aspect of this movie smells of plagiarism, no originality in any sense. To summarise:Imagine a teenager that has taken every sci-fi movie he'd ever watched, and tried to cook that together in a movie. Some were:Pirates of the Caribbean
Anime
Star wars
Matrix
and many more moviesJust no! Please don't support this crap and more importantly don't waste your precious time.

title: Excellent
text: I don't know what people want from a film anymore. But for me, this was excellent. Very entertaining. I liked all the characters. The film looked beautiful. May be a little too much lens flare but that's Zach Snyder. It comes with the territory. I definitely want to see more of this universe. I can't wait to see the next installment. He seems to take notes from all these incredible intellectual properties of before. The Matrix, Star Wars, 300. Superman man of steel and many more. It looks like everything he's learned along the way. It's taken to create this New World. I'm into it I want more. I would say it's better than any of the modern Star Wars, including the George Lucas ones.Except for rogue one. That one's a gem and a proper film not just an action sci-fi movie which I believe this is.

title: High hopes...but
text: I had high hopes for the movie, but unfortunately, it fell short on many fronts. Visually, it was chaotic, lacking coherence in its direction. The storyline was thin, failing to engage viewers, and the battle scenes, while attempting to be awe-inspiring, felt forced and unconvincing.Moreover, the plot felt disjointed and rushed, leaving little room for character development or emotional investment. Despite its two-hour runtime, it seemed as though important plot points were glossed over, leaving audiences disconnected from the narrative and its characters.However, amidst its shortcomings, there are glimpses of potential within the film's world-building. The universe presented holds promise for captivating tales and epic conflicts, yet these elements were not fully realized in this installment. One can only hope that future sequels will rectify these issues and deliver a more compelling cinematic experience.

title: Cheezy rip off blend of Star Wars and Seven Samurai
text: I won't say that this show is unwatchable because it does have its moments, but given the budget and the multitude of upper level actors it is just a really disappointing knockoff that tries to combine the elements of Star Wars with the plot line of Seven Samurai. The contradiction between future technology and hand to hand fight scenes is comical and constantly breaks the suspension of disbelief.The actors mostly deliver their lines woodenly as if they can tell the plot line is farcical. Just about every scene comes across as if the actors were simply reading off a prompter in the background. I just finished watching Part One and I honestly don't know whether I will bother watching Part Two when it comes out in April. That should tell you something.Anyone checking the ratings for this movie should probably knock of 1 or 2 points for the shills that have written multiple extravagantly favorable reviews. It's pretty easy to spot them, and several use exactly the same phrasing.

title: Excellent movie!
text: Dissapointed to see such a lower score for a wonderfully produced and acted movie. Zack Snyder has done it again!! I hope this newer generation can get on board and show more appreciation for such works of art. This movie captivates from beginning to end. Unique story and very creative charters and scenes. I love the space and earth combination. It has a viking feel to it along with string values amd family connection. A plot of betrayal and hurt but new found acceptance and a need to fight what is good. I am excited to see the next chapter. I hope is the movie progresses that the score will improve. Unfair to see such a low score for something so will done.

title: Empire meets Motherland
text: "Rebel Moon Part 1" takes audiences on a journey to a galaxy far, far away, but unfortunately, it falls short of delivering the awe-inspiring experience we've come to expect from space epics. The film, directed by Zack Snyder, feels like a budget-friendly rendition of the iconic Star Wars universe, with a plot that echoes the timeless classic "Seven Samurai."Visually, "Rebel Moon Part 1" struggles to escape the shadows of its more established counterparts. The set designs, special effects, and overall production quality give off a distinct impression of a Netflix production values and attempt at capturing the grandeur of space opera. The spacecraft and alien landscapes lack the meticulous attention to detail that has become a hallmark of the genre, leaving viewers yearning for the immersive environments that have defined other sci-fi epics.The plot, while intriguing in its own right, cannot shake the feeling of déjà vu. "Rebel Moon" borrows heavily from the Seven Samurai trope, where a group of warriors is recruited to defend a vulnerable settlement against an impending threat. While this narrative formula has proven successful in the past, the film fails to inject sufficient originality or depth into its characters and storyline, making it feel more like a recycled concept than a fresh take on the genre.The characters, unfortunately, suffer from a lack of development, leaving audiences with thinly sketched archetypes that fail to evoke the emotional investment needed for a space epic. The dialogue feels stilted at times, and the performances, though earnest, struggle to elevate the material beyond its derivative nature.Despite these shortcomings, "Rebel Moon Part 1" does manage to offer some entertaining moments. Action sequences are passable, and the film occasionally hits the mark with its attempts at humor. However, these fleeting highs are not enough to redeem a movie that ultimately feels like a missed opportunity to breathe new life into the space opera genre.In conclusion, "Rebel Moon Part 1" falls into the trap of emulating the giants that came before it, particularly Star Wars, without successfully carving out its own identity. While the homage to Seven Samurai adds a layer of familiarity, it also reinforces the feeling that we've seen this story unfold in more captivating ways. As the first installment in a planned series, one can only hope that subsequent chapters will find a way to break free from the shadows and forge a unique path among the stars.

title: A marvelous feeling after watching it
text: It really surprises me that many people here criticize the film without understanding how Snyder creates the content of the picture. People get bogged down digging into completely irrelevant details that don't fit their personal taste... missing the important point. This movie wasn't meant to fit any sort of template from the beginning. The movie stands on its own, such as it is, and gives me a great feeling of wanting to watch it over and over again. In recent times, only "The Mandalorian" has given me that feeling..... Many critics over the years of watching dozens of fantasy pictures mixed with attempts to blend and integrate actors into super-realistic, computer-generated works like "Avatar", etc., lose their sense of reality, of what they really like, and can no longer see other pictures as examples of independent art... It's like comparing comic books and movies based on them. Great movie, great art, real Snyder.

title: Worst movie I've seen in a long time
text: I've created an imdb account just to warn people, it's that bad. This movie and Dune have the same budget of 160 million dollars, Dune is a masterpiece and this is trash. I gave it a shot because of the cast (Anthony Hopkins, Charlie Hunnam, some of the Game of Thrones cast etc.) and I can't blame the actors to be honest, the script and directing were both horrible.The whole movie is just Zack Snyder poorly stealing iconic scenes from famous movies like Harry Potter, Star Wars, Dune, Guardians of the Galaxy, The Avengers, The Matrix and he didn't even try to hide it. Scenes that are in over-used slow motion were terrible and cringe. If I had given 160 million dollars to my 5 year old brother, he could've done a better job.I'm officially.done with Snyder movies, stop giving this man money please, he is just wasting it like I wasted 2 hours of my life watching this movie.

title: Put all your favorite sci-Fi films together and then just smash them to bits with a massive fat hammer and then smash them again
text: Just because you like lots of Sci-Fi films Zack doesn't mean you can just smash them all together and serve them in a golden CGI pot. That's not how you make a good film or dish. A bit of a story, a few decent characters and some dialogue would go a long way. Frankly it's just lazy. Was it the actors strike or the writers strike or the fact that you just have to churn out something for the moola? I feel like a 10 year old has got all his action figures out and has made up this film on his bedroom floor...I half expected a t-Rex to come out with a Lego character on its back and hot wheels cars for shoes. Brrrm brrrm.

title: Something Coming Out of a Space Vagina
text: Very early in the film, there's a scene in which a huge vagina shape appears in space, and a space cruiser travels through it. I don't even have a dirty mind, that's just how it looked like. Later in the film, there are scenes which are supposed to be somewhat comical, but this was the one time I laughed while watching.I tried to watch this, thinking maybe it's a cult film, so bad that it's good, but halfway through I realized this is following the idea from Akira Kurosawa's Seven Samurai, one of my top ten films and felt like it's impossible to continue. Kurosawa's film is a great classic, perfect as a movie, while this one is just terrible.Action is bad, it goes slo-mo in unusual places, I guess it's Zack Snyder's attempt to distinguish from other directors. I'm getting tired to see tiny women throwing big guys around, it's just such an off putting theme these days. And that's the least sucky thing in this movie.The dialogue is so wooden you could build a summer cottage using the script. Sofie Boutella, a charismatic actor who I liked a lot in SAS Rogue Heroes, tries her best but it doesn't help.Only thing I liked in this film was that in some places sets reminded of colorful and moody old westerns with painted backgrounds. This minor detail won't save the film.

title: Don't listen to the haters, this is next gen of Amazing!
text: Don't listen to the haters this movie is amazing. There is Action in a way where everything comes out like it was never better. If you don't believe me give it a watch. Just because other people don't like it doesn't mean you won't. There is some parts where it can be a bit boring but that is just explaining the movie. The CGI is next level with amazing graphics. I am definitely staying tuned for the next movie this was a banger for sure.If you don't like boring story telling then this movie might not be for you. If you like action this movie is for you. All i'm saying is that you need to watch this movie it was Amazing10/10.

title: Wow, talk about plagiarism
text: As I watched this movie, I kept saying to myself, I've seen this before. As the movie progressed, I kept saying that more and more. Then it hit me. It's sort of a remake of the 1977 Star Wars move - A New Hope. There are some other movie similarities in there as well, but that is the one that stood out to me the most. Remember the bar scene? Yep, it's in there. The ending, yep it's there. It's a real shame that the writers just ripped off other movies. There is plenty of acting talent in there, but that couldn't save it from a bad script, bad directing, sluggish story, etc., etc. This is just part one so I hope the other parts are better. Perhaps a younger audience will enjoy it.

title: "REBEL MOON: PART ONE- A CHILD OF FIRE" REVIEW
text:
Directed and co-written by Zack Snyder. A Runtime of two hours and thirteen minutes. Streaming on Netflix with a PG-13 rating.Set in a futuristic setting. "Kora" played by Sofia Boutella lives on a small distant moon where the only thing taking place on this planet is farming. "Gunnar" played by Michiel Huisman takes the lead on organizing and selling their crops.There is a huge war going on. Well not so much now. They're tyrants and people fighting against them. But this small community of farmers stays out of it and just worries about the farming.Well, they did until commander "Atticus Noble" played by Ed Skrein came to their planet looking for a rebel who's been a thorn in this regime's side. As well as get his troops fed for the foreseeable future.But things didn't go well. After causing chaos and giving this community a deadline of an unrealistic quota of crops to fill. While also leaving boots on the ground(soldiers) to help oversee things while he's gone. This will cause "Kora" true identity to come out. Let's just say she's no farmer but an elite warrior with a back story.Some might say she was brave for sticking up for these people after the boots on the ground were causing nothing but mayhem. But now she has to deal with the repercussions of it. This causes her to leave the planet with "Gunnar" in hopes of finding warriors to help defend this planet against "Atticus Noble".You watch as she searches and collects a handful of talented people. Like "Titus" played by Djimon Hounsou, "Nemesis" played by Bae Doona, "Bloodaxe" played by Ray Fisher, "Tarak" played by Staz Nair, and "Kai" played by Charlie Hunnam.Even with the most skilled fighters will this be enough to help stop what's perceived to be an unstoppable force? Find out in the first part of this two-part film."Rebel Moon: Part One- A Child of Fire" had too much going on. Netflix gave Zack Snyder the keys to the house. Giving him all the actors he could ask for and a massive budget. Letting him create the framework of his version of "Star Wars". There are even lightsabers in this film. At least his version of them.This was a huge mistake. I think this should have been a series. It was way too much going on and if you started thinking about it, it didn't make much sense. Zack was obsessed with slow motion. There was a lot of Tom's foolery going on in between scenes. The action is what made it tolerable. But then that got redundant with slow motion after slow motion. Like, switch it up a little.It felt like A combination of a bunch of different films. "Avatar", "Star Wars", "How to Train Your Dragon", "Dune", "Fifth Element", "Matrix", and the "Pitch Black" franchise to name a few. The audio was a mess as well. High and low throughout the film.For a new franchise that you knew had multiple films coming, this felt rushed. I didn't get that. They have plans if this is successful to build a whole universe. Not many people get that type of power.Zack Snyder is already talking about a Snyder cut. Every time the film isn't good he always says if the film I wanted to put out came out it would be completely different. I understood the issue with Warner Bros. His Snyder cut of "Justice League" was better. But I don't want to hear that with this film. I don't. Put out the best cut from the jump.I'm not looking forward to the next film. Such a lot of promise but they dropped the ball with this. The action scenes were dope and Ed Skrein plays the villain so well. His jawline just screams butthead. A collection of talented actors with a script that felt rushed. This is not to bash Zack. I love most of his films. I'm just disappointed because he was talking a big game while filming. Mentioning how Netflix is letting him be great. I expected him to knock it out of the park. Instead, he barely made it to first base. I give this a strong two mor fire 🔥🔥.#CosmoandtheMovieWithin
#CosmoMovieBlog
#CosmoLanier
#RebelMoonPartOneAChildOfFire.

title: No more letting Snyder write.
text: Visuals are good as all Snyder films go, the story is poor the writing is poor as all Snyder films go. I found myself wildly bored in a sci fi action film which never happens. Snyder should stick with visuals and let others write the story. The characters are bland and have almost no development. The story is a reused story line and done in a less interesting way. I'd advise everyone to save their selves the two hours of a waste of time and to watch almost anything else. I enjoyed one scene in the entire film l and the scene was less than five mins long. The action is boring and the ending is a waste of time.

title: Fun movie
text: I can not understand why people don't like this movie. Such a great movie. Probably would have done very well in the he theater also. I would have to say a lot of people sure are becoming snobby about what movies are coming out now. This movie has a 1977 star wars type vibe to it. Lots of great sci-fi and a ton of action. Takes a little bit of the movie to really get going, but once it does it seems to pull you in more and more. Im very glad that they are planning on making these into a trilogy. You definitely have a fan and I plan on making sure all my movie theater friends know about this movie and any future ones.

title: Like a puddle, utterly flat with no Depth
text: I wanted to like this film; I've loved some of the directors other films but certainly not this one; it was about as memorable as lift music. A films plot doesn't have to be original to be good, a certain level of cliche and tropes can make an excellent film if well implemented or with a decent twist applied; this was none of those things. The Magnificent Seven in space minus all the charm; good dialogue, good set pieces and drama. Everything about the film seemed horribly mechanical and flat; Plot flat and obvious; dialogue wooden and with no real emotional effect; characterisation almost non existent, action, overblown slow mo fest with bad guys rooted to the spot whilst the 'hero' spins around a lot firing a pistol like a gangsta rapper. Frankly it looked like the sort of thing a film club could come up with. Bad guys straight out of a violent panto. Some of the visuals where quite good but for a lot of film you cant get it out of your head that you're really watching 6 actors on an empty sound stage with everything CGI'd in afterwards and various horrible colour filters applied. In space everything is grey or brown bar the sky apparently. And after all of that we only get half the 'story'. I assume the 2nd half will be an orgy of slow mo battles but will anyone care. A final thought is the 1980 release "Battle Beyond the Stars" does the same MS in space trip and despite cheesiness and low special effects actual has more charm and heart than this effort; Characters actually have character and the whole story is done in one sitting.

title: Waste of time
text: This movie is a disaster. Bad acting, bad storytelling, bad plot! Effects are cool but thanks to the plot they are just become cheesy! Zack Snyder have lost his flare. Maybe the story could have some potential but the acting is SO BAD and the way they tell the story is so bad! There's so many logical plot holes that you can't do nothing less than feel really really bad.i think me dropping down my pants and doing some "rebel mooning" would give the world more comfort and joy than what this movie ever could do. With the exception mine would not take as long!Shame on you for making this movie!!!!

title: Rip off
text: Chreap Star Wars rip off. It is just a little bit altered with "How to train your dragon", but some scenes are ninety percent the same as in Star Wars. Just change of characters and gender. If it wasn't for Snyder I would never watch it. Worst Sci-fi movie for the year by far. I didn't expect for the script to be so familiar... They even have an equivalent for C3P0... Ridiculous!!! I rarely post reviews, but in this case I am sure that the movie is overrated. At least they could think of a different name for the largest ship rather than "Dreadnought". Don't bother watching it. You've seen it 20 and almost 50 years ago.

title: Awesome science fiction movie!
text: Me and my wife enjoyed this movie immensely. It is packed with great visuals, cool characters, lots of action, and it really surprised us. Visually it looked awesome, the characters, the landscapes, the space stuff, the ships, the aliens..I recommend anyone to watch this, and enjoy this for what it is: a cool, original, science fiction movie!Keep in mind this in only part one, and i am looking forward the the second part. And i hope some more of the background of each character gets revealed.FYI: Don't you mind all the crying trolls here giving this a shamefully low score. They are not science fiction fans, and take any chance to troll anything they don't like. It has nothing to with star wars; by their logic any science fiction movie is a rip off from Star Wars. (Star Wars, while awesome, is/was largely inspired/ripped off by The Hidden Fortress - Akira Kurosawa, and Dune - Frank Herbert)

title: Nope. Nope, nope, nope.
text: I guess this would be cool if you've never seen Star Wars, Dune, Gladiator, played any video game from the 2000s, or basically had zero knowledge of any sci-fi from any medium. And you're a moron. Then maybe this would be cool. Why do they let him keep making movies? He's had 3 bangers and the rest have been mid to bad. The action is boring, the plot is nonsense, and they shoe horn crap into a scene so they can have a slow mo fight. Acting mediocre, characters all over the place, incredibly predictable. Should have been a series and then you could have fleshed it out some and made it salvageable. Watch it if you're bored. That's it.

title: built a franchise instead of a story?
text: The movies of today seem to be aiming directly at the franchise i.e. Lots of things but the movie itself and that is visible. The director did few good movies I think. 300 and watchmen were excellent. Man of steel was ok so he can do it. All the others are just unwatchable and this film unfortunately belongs to the unwatchable category. Not sure why really - the idea was good I think even if sold so many times already. You could make it at least a half a decent movie out of this instead it is just boring. I really tried but as with the justice league I did not last over 30minutes.Maybe indeed too much attention paid to franchise instead of to the story? Mandatory these days super female did not disturb as much as the boredom. Maybe it got better after 30minutes but this I will probably never know. What a waste of time.

title: Wow. This was bad.
text: Trailer looked good. Movie is basically the trailer with more words between the action. Not any words that make sentences or anything, just words.This is probably one of the worst scripts I've seen. There is nothong connecting anything to anything. Words are thrown around without any meaning. There's no real story. They seem to sometimes try to tell a story but it's like noone could agree on what that story should be.The depth of the characters are like "Ugh, help me - Agh, ok I help". Why do anyone help? Noone knows.There is a lot of slowmo fighting, slowmo turning around, slowmo adding another character. There is gun fights, cool glares, hand to hand fighting.But there's nothing giving any reason to it. It's just there.It's like a 5 yo wrote the script. No wait. Ten 5 year Olds wrote it and they never could cooperate. It's the worst I've seen for ages.Second movie in my life I gave up on before it was finished.It made a good trailer. The movie is just ruining a good trailer.

title: A Great start to a new universe!
text: This movie was fun. Great intro flick to an expansive universe. Can't wait to see more. Was it perfect, no, but what movie is. Don't understand all the negativity Snyder gets. I've always enjoyed his movies for what they were - great escape from reality! He's fantastic at making great worlds. I can see why Disney rejected the idea and I'm glad they did! Disney would've forced all types of corny dialog and junk all throughout this movie which clearly it didn't need. Much like his DCEU Snyderverse was geared towards adults, so is this the same with a Star Wars universe! Director's cut is going to be epic and part 2 will be legendary!

title: Neo Feminist Sci-fi Fantasy
text: This a a neo feminist Sci-fi fantasy and as such will only attract a certain audience. However it has been marketed to the masses and the subsequent poor reviews have flopped in. Because it won't appeal to the masses, male or female.I have given it a 3 star rating due to it being an awkward tumbling mess of a film.It's incoherent and hard to follow. And because there isn't anything in this film for me to latch on to, due to the afore mentioned target audience, it's a hard film to connect with.Because these films aren't subjected to cinema releases they continue to slip by.N. B. Why do English actors continue to mimic Irish (and Scottish for that matter) accents?They always end up doing a generic hit and miss imitation that travels all around the county and dips back into England.

title: No original ideas
text: No original ideas in this. Everything was just a rip off of something else. Very weak dialogue. Zack Snyder is very good at visual but is not good at screen writing. If you think about the projects he directed that were good they were projects where here didn't have to come up with the story from scratch.Rebel moon being his passion project just showcased his weakness towards storytelling. He is a visual director. Nothing deeper sadly. The movie was didn't give enough time to any character for me to feel any connection to them. Nothing felt compelling. The action wasn't anything special which was the real let down. I didn't expect an amazing story but I did expect great action and I felt robbed of that.

title: Avery bad clone of...
text:
Magnificent 7, Star Wars, Matrix and Teletubbies. What were they thinking? Is no one in Hollywood
reading these childish scripts anymore? Those useless slow motion shots made film longer than it should be. Every TikTok and YouTuber have better cinematography than the crew who was responsible for this movie.I mean Special Effects from the 70s, enemy's in old Nazi uniforms???? I really wanted to like this movie but after watching it for an hour I had to turn it off.I'm glad that Disney hasn't used the script for an Star Wars movie because compared to this the Ryan Johnson has Oscar potential. Sequel? Directors cut? PLEASE NO!

title: Worst movie I've ever seen.
text: I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone. There is nothing original or interesting about it. The pacing was really weird the characters were incredibly awkward, like no chemistry at all which made it really hard for me to care one bit about them. The "main cast" as in the five characters that were supposed to form some league (???) had close to no interaction between each other and some had almost no screen time more than a brief introduction. And speaking of their introduction, they were really awkward and I was honestly confused at times why they even spent time on it but then at the end I realised it was because they wouldn't have any screen time at all without it. Also this is the first time I've ever felt the need to actually write a review, so take this as a warning and don't waste your time watching.P.s The end battle was incredibly unsatisfying and boring.

title: Great start
text: I see the foundation for a good bunch of sequels, and I hope they come. The atmosphere was just right, the acting well done, and the premise set for a good future. Certainly "Star Warsy," with the rebels and the "evil empire" scenario, but there is nothing wrong with that in my opinion. Lot's of fun to be had.So, I really hope they continue. Don't leave us hanging on this one.Just good stuff. We need some quality space-faring, kind of dark, drama and action. We will see where it goes from here.Bring us more! Don't let this one die on the vine!I look forward to the next installment. I just wish it wasn't so far out in the future!

title: George Peppard, we hardly knew ye.
text: I look at Zack Snyder's Rebel Moon and see a gussied up remake of Battle Bayond the Stars. There is even the same ship as the old movie in the preview video at about 1:55. Bad guys threaten peaceful farming world, plucky hero has to voyage space to find some down on their luck mercenaries to save the day. Replace Richard Thomas with a Battle Angel Alita wanna be (more plagiarism) to be gender smart and you have yourself a holiday blockbuster. Hollywood once again proclaiming how bankrupt it has been for the past fifty years. I can only wonder who keeps reinforcing the myth that Mr. Snyder has ever had an original idea in his life.

title: A Bugs Life did it better
text: Only got about 15 minutes into the movie when I realized it seemed oddly familiar. Although I can't say whether or not they copied it completely because I never made it past the 30 minute mark.Apparently the review needs to be six hundred characters long in order to post and my contribution only put me at one hundred and ninety-three, so I'm adding some extra words to hit that six hundred character mark. I'm still not quite there, but honestly there's nothing else I have to say about this movie. Those thirty minutes left absolutely no impression on me. Don't watch it. It will work as a sedative if you need help falling asleep... Ah, there we are.

title: CGI budget only .
text: Right from the opening monologue, everything is familiar . Star wars , Star Trek , Firefly , Avita : Battle Angel etc etc . Does Mr Snyder have an originality at all ? He borrowed from everyother well know projects and sagas that are a thousand percent better than this . Most things in this movie are telegraphed to the point where you can guess the next few scenes with the sound off. The Plot is watered down to the point of drowning in ocean of derivative lines . As for the direction , George Lucas could have done better . I believe they spent most of the money on the CGI which is at best , ok in some parts and in others no better than a 14 year old version of Halo . Can't get my 2 hours back . Skip it .

title: Great movie!
text: Loved this movie, was entertained right away. I nearly got put off my some bad reviews.. but I'm glad I decided to ignore the critic reviews on another site.Loved the characters, the effects and the storyline was exciting and doesn't get too boring like a lot of other new sci fi movies/series.I don't normally take the time to give a review, but I feel people have really gone harsh on a good film. So i had to back this film up! The amount of new films out there, which aren't 10% this good is crazy. I'm a huge lover of old films, especially sci fi.I can't wait for part two, I shall be keeping an eye out for it!

title: Mishmash without a point
text: This movie looks like a college student project where they tried to incorporate every iconic scene from famous sci-fi movies. There is a classic rip-off of the Star Wars bar scene, there are references to Dune, there are references to Matrix martial arts fights, there are Harry Potter-worthy creatures, but no character development or interesting story line. I gave this movie four stars out of a sense of generosity or pity. I wonder why Anthony Hopkins participated in this farce as the voice of another Star Wars rip-off android or robot. I don't plan to watch the next installment expected to drop in April.

title: Bad Star Wars Copy
text: I don't know where to start. It's really just simply put a bad movie.Dialogues are flat, story makes 0 sense, fighting scenes are with an overuse on slow-mos. Scenes in the bar, the robot, the spaceship or the girl with the 2 swords (which are awfully alike to a light saber) are just flat out bad copy from Star Wars. That was then combined with some Nazi Style soldiers.I like the actors, but they didn't do themselves a favor playing in this movie. The animations , especially the backgrounds we're not well done either.I really wanted to see this movie, but we actually ended the film after the first half.

title: 7 samurai
text: Is it me or is this just a space opera remake of the seven samurai, the magnificent seven, if you prefer. Ultimately it's seven 'outlaws' against the evil empire or whatever. The idea sounds great. The seven samurai is a classic after all.That said, the movie, or more specifically, part one, doesn't really grab anything. They made everyone too generic. Killed off the actors or characters that had real potential to save the ones with known names. There are many ways this could have been done better, not use Zack Snyder, possibly may have been one option. His movies are stilted and lifeless. This is a mediocre movie at best. Not nearly worth the hype.

title: Rebel Moon focuses on world building and big epic spectacles instead of good storytelling, a good sci-fi film - My Ultimate Review
text: Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire is finally here, the first part of the Rebel Moon duology and universe Zack Snyder has created. I have been looking forward to this film for quite some time, I'll be going through more of my thoughts in different paragraphs down below. This is very much Zack Snyder's film as Netflix gave him complete freedom, with him directing it along with co-writing the screenplay with Kurt Johnstad and Shay Hatten, also producing it and serving as the film's cinematographer. But it's not "the" film I hoped for as I thought it would have been R-Rated from the beginning, this PG-13 cut is visually striking but lacking in certain ways when you clearly see its supposed to be R-Rated, but then again this makes that more people get the opportunity to watch the film which is always good. The inspiration is clearly from Akira Kurosawa's film, Seven Samurai, with a sci-fi touch. Zack Snyder first conceived the idea from a Star Wars pitch before becoming its own thing, Star Wars was heavily influenced and inspired by Kurosawa and Dave Filoni made an episode dedicated to Seven Samurai in The Clone Wars show.The film is set in a fictional galaxy ruled by the Motherworld, whose military, the Imperium, threatens a farming colony on the moon Veldt. Kora, a former Imperium soldier, ventures on a quest to recruit warriors from across the galaxy to make a stand against the Imperium before they return to Veldt.Starting off with a voice over by Anthony Hopkins (who does the voice for Jimmy) it was the right choice as it gave us a feeling of this new world Snyder had created. Other than Hopkins in a small role, its ensemble cast features Sofia Boutella, Djimon Hounsou, Ed Skrein, Michiel Huisman, Doona Bae, Ray Fisher, Charlie Hunnam and Staz Nair. Sofia Boutella holds her own in the ensemble, yet occasionally falling in the shadows of her more well known actorsAbout the writing, I had hopes that the villains and antagonists would be three dimensional but nope they were one or two dimensional. There's a sequence at 30 minutes into the film where Kora saves a woman from being raped and abused by a couple of soldiers, the writing was not very good except for showing Kora's character development and for bringing an action sequence, but the thing is the choreography wasn't even that good and it focused mainly on coolness. The flashback action scenes told by Kora were good. The next big sequence has Kora and Gunnar visit a town called "Providence" which made the planet "Veldt" much more interesting, seeing the different kinds of aliens which co-inhabit the planet and world. Here's also the first great action sequence, which introduces Charlie Hunnam's character. I've read critics criticizing the storytelling and character development, I agree with them. Zack Snyder needs praise for the world building, that aspect of the storytelling is fantastic, but the smaller stuff like character introductions and overall writing wasn't very good. It comes off that Zack Snyder focuses more on spectacle than a well written story, like in the scene we get introduced to Tarak, I found him cliched and simply boring and after a scene of dialogue we get this spectacle with Snyder doing what he's best, creating a painting like frame. I know Zack Snyder can do better than this, given more time writing a better script would have improved the film heavily. The character development isn't quite there, I'll give that a pass though because of how this is 1/2 of a film, why it's called Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire. The characterization though, that's something I can criticize, it's not very good and although I like the casting and actors playing them, the characters doesn't have a lot of depth making most of them two-dimensional. The final big set piece, the climax, it was actually one of the high points of the film. One certain twist and a brilliant action sequence, the film's best. For a story that started interesting but quickly lost its way, the ending was actually quite great.My honest opinion, I think it's great that Zack Snyder gets the chance to be his own cinematographer, but same with Army of the Dead, Rebel Moon suffers from an issue with motion blur and things looking unfocused. Stylistic? Perhaps. But why blur out things when you can use that to establish the world, and when it's blurry inside interiors where lots of characters are, it just becomes that it bothers me. Yet, the film looks utterly fantastic and the visuals are spectacular, with some great camera angles. Snyder has never made a bad looking film, his stylistic choices are great. The costume department, art direction and production design, are all terrific. Making it even more visually striking. The musical score by Tom Holkenborg was fantastic, giving each scene that extra depth. I think Zack Snyder's direction was actually quite great, both in his visual storytelling and his direction to the actors. The visual effects were top notch, making Marvel and DC nowadays feel like a B movie.If you dislike Zack Snyder's other movies, then Rebel Moon isn't a film for you. It has quite a slow pacing with lots of dialogue, all to build up a universe and second film, characters like Titus played by Djimon Hounsou will have a much larger role in the upcoming film. Inspired heavily on Seven Samurai as I've written before, yet far from meeting the same expectations. You see, Seven Samurai is three hours and takes the first two hours if not more to set up its characters, their characterizations and making them all three-dimensional. Meanwhile, Rebel Moon focuses more on world building and big epic spectacles, instead of giving that time and attention for its characters. I think the film would have been better if world and universe building was an after thought, as there would probably have been more focus on the screenplay. For what it's worth, I liked the film despite its many flaws. From whom do I recommend Rebel Moon to? To fans of the sci-fi genre but also for fans of Zack Snyder.

title: Critics should chill
text: I'm going to say here what I said on other platforms too, the bare bones of a good series is here, lighten up and see what can happen next.I hear the director's cut will have more info and a lot more things have been shot, so that should be fun, there are plenty cool things in this universe with some not so, but thats ok, this shouldn't have been a perfect movie like the critics want it to be.I sometimes don't understand why does Zack Snyder have to be the only one to stand up to the insane critics demands while many other sci-fi and comic book directors get a free pass by giving basic movies.

title: Cringeworthy
text: Hard to find anything positive to say about this. The plot is weak, the characters implausible (even considering it's sci-fi fantasy), the acting wooden, the sets and costumes amateur. Some impressive action graphics but that's not enough to carry the movie. The story seems very tired and predictable, borrowing extensively from other movies. With the available budget, director and cast, surely something more original than this could have been made. To cap it all, Part I fizzles out with Part II on the way .......shudder..... The cast contains some considerable talent, and that feels wasted. For the avoidance of doubt, I didn't enjoy it.

title: What a mess
text: If this is supposed to be a new Star Wars like epic. It fails on so many levels. The fight sequences are too long and the dialogue mostly dreary. Where's the lighter moments that you need. Drop the flashback sequences and keep people in the present,Sadly this film suffers from the same symptoms as many modern sci-fi films, lots of CGI and poor plot. I was an hour and half in and still didn't know what the good guys were actually looking for. It was also too obvious who the girl was because of the flashbacks. Leave us some intrigue to work out slowly. I doubt I will bother with any next part.

title: Another Zach Snyder debacle
text: Rebel Moon, unfortunately, falls short of expectations. The plot lacks depth, struggling to engage audiences with a clichéd narrative. Character development feels rushed, leaving actors with little to work with. The CGI, touted as a highlight, often appears unnatural, detracting from the overall viewing experience. The pacing is uneven, making the film feel disjointed. While there are glimpses of potential in the concept, execution ultimately falters, resulting in a forgettable sci-fi disappointment. Zach Snyder really should not be allowed to make movies. Not sure why he's allowed to waste so much of everyone's time.

title: A Frustrating Cringe-Fest
text: I'm not a pro, but this was disappointing. And maybe I was expecting too much from Snyder. I'm a tad naive when it comes to stuff like this. I just figured that with a grand total budget of $166 Million for both movies that the writing would be better. The costume & props design were uninspired. Everything was original and just not...good. The design of the worlds and ships etc looked like a cheap movie on the Sci-fi Network circa 2009I was expecting a fun ride, but was left wishing I had my time returned to me. Snyder is this generations Michael Bay. All boom and no substance. But hey, a paycheck is a paycheck.

title: What it for Sofia Boutella going absolute ham
text: Solid plot, beautiful scenes, nice colouring, Snyder action scenes of course. All in all a good solid movie.Maybe not the most original. The universe feels like Star Wars, but it's intriguing, it's interesting. There are some strong archetypes and characters in there.It felt much like someone did a DnD adventure in the Star Wars universe, pieced together a group of different classes and went on their own Star Wars adventure with their own characters and villains.I was glued to the action from start to finish. Honestly, watching Sofia Boutella go absolute ham on some baddies in the beginning, is worth it all! That was a god damn awesome fight and I could rewatch it again just for that short scene.

title: this is really bad!
text: I am amazed how such a poor script could be made with such a high budget. There is no justice! It feels like an AI wrote the script, the actors are really bad because there are no situations, no characters arcs. I literally could not believe what I am witnessing here, if I were Zack Snyder I would be really embarrassed. I just simply do not understand how this could be made? Why would actors agree to do this? Is it literally only about the money? I mean, this film should be thought in film schools - how not to make films, it lists all the basic mistakes how to ruin a film. I am honestly out of words here, this is so bad that there is nothing to talk about.....

title: what happened?
text: From the start with a Dune style intro that drifts off into something someone cant be bothered to finish into a polished sci fi world that makes little sense, things don't add up, there's something wrong, missing, disconnect little cute houses in a dustbowl poverty style with a funny horse and designer dungarees.. someone certainly spent money on thee sets but you kinda need a competent story? I was lost, frustrated and confused by this tall tale that is no tale. Comedy bad guys? Passion free writing with a probable drug psychosis thinking that this is the best thing ever written in the whole of history, whoever signed this expensive mess off needs a firing squad.

title: Great Sci Fi from the great Zack Snyder.
text: Zack Snyder did it again in this beautiful and wonderful adventure of justice, revenge and finding one's self in the mist of conquest. This movie is a great introduction to this world, where there is an evil Empire conquering and enslaving planets. The characters are great, Sophia's character is strong but no over bearing and the villain is great. The other characters are good but like this movie is the first part, they are not fully explored but well established in their motives, I hope in the next chapter we get to explore more of them. Zack Snyder, like always, is awesome in his visual and the world he is building is great. Can't wait for part 2 and see this world get the recognition it's deserving.

title: A labotomy of a movie
text: If I had ever watched a movie worse than this, it was the second Aquaman, but not by much. How these people can justify spending all that money and all that time creating such useless drivel, it amazes me. There was not one redeeming character, plot point, or entertainment value throughout the film. Perhaps, someday, a contemporary filmmaker will be able to amalgamate a story in this genre that will perhaps stimulate the viewer to have some kind of interest in its characters, however, this doesn't. Somehow, this seem to include all of the worst of special effects without any redeeming value I would rather watch stalactites form, then see any further iterations of this movie.

title: That's no moon, it's a collection of cliches!
text: Some good visuals. That's as good as it gets, as far as I'm concerned. But even at that, a lot of the slower scenes were unfocussed at the peripherals, where you'd want to look at the background a little. Don't even get me started on the slo-mo parts. I honestly did try to like it, but it didn't take long for the inconsistancies to pile up. The baddies descend on a poor village when there's a city nearby. The village has electronic doors on their wooden huts, animals for ploughing, they all dress like 16th century peasants. Star Trek on a budget, anyone? Plot? I'm sure by now you know which movies have been plundered to make part one. They even borrowed something from Beetlejuice (made me want to watch that again, to be fair!). But by far, the worst thing, about this movie? The. Absolute. Worst. Thing? Charlie. Hunnan's. ACCENT! (Avoid if you're from Northern Ireland, this accent may be offensive). If you have a penchant for cliche-ridden films, you're in luck! Tried to take it down to 3 stars, but can't, hmmph!

title: Bang movie
text:
Don't believe to Snyder haters
Don't believe to Snyder haters criticThis movie is classic epic space drama movie.I don't know why Snyder get so much hate
His vision is extraordinary.Rebel Moon is a stunning sci-fi epic that delivers on almost every level!Zack Snyder has crafted a visually spectacular and emotionally engaging story that takes us to a galaxy far, far away, but also feels very relevant and relatable.The film is clearly a homage to Star Wars, but also a fresh and original vision that expands the genre and creates a new mythology.The film is a thrilling adventure that keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish!The action scenes are breathtaking and inventive, with a mix of practical and digital effects that create a realistic and immersive experience.The film also has a lot of humour and heart, with witty dialogue and touching moments that make you care about the characters and their journey.The film also explores themes such as freedom, identity, loyalty, and sacrifice, and challenges the audience to think about their own role in the world!It's more than just another sci-fi film; it's a bold new chapter in the genre!.... Loved it 💕

title: Starwars From wish
text: Rebels vs Motherland(empire), even has glowing swords, sound familar? The only upside to the sequel coming out is that charlie hunnams "kai" is dead and you dont have to hear him butcher another accent, if you thought jax tellers accent was terrible, "kai" is northern irish/hindu/russian from what i heard. Film was over two hours long but felt rushed and way to long at the same time. Had potential especially it being a zack snyder project but it just feel like he just lent his name to it and was to busy with upcoming DC revamp to actually put anything if himself into this. Most noticeable to me was the distinct lack of blood considering the first fight scene involves people being stabbed slashed shot through the head, theres no blood at all. Luckily i already pay for netflix for other content cuz this isnt worth paying for.

title: Nothing to write home planet about
text: The other reviewers have already said what needs to be said about this film. I'd just like to add that my 5 rating is for 5 cliches per hour. Was it inspired by Seven Samurai? Star Wars? Lynch's Dune? AppleTVs Foundation? All of them and many others, although inspired may not be the correct word. More like some brazen shoplifting.Has lots of action, but it's slow. It's also joyless. Humorless. Perhaps others will find it better than I, but I don't think I could watch it again. Will Part II be any better? It would almost have to be.I will give Snyder credit for a good-looking film, and the monster bird that has to be "broken" isn't bad, but slapping some prosthetics on the heads of horses is just plain lazy.

title: Oh, Yeah, it mostly sucks All right
text: This film has the same substance as any B-movie flick you've ever seen. This film is so average it's difficult to write a review about it. The film is so dull and generic it makes you wonder how it even managed to get this far into production. Generic isn't necessarily bad, but a stroke of creativity doesn't hurt right?There's no amount of originality to the script. Keep in mind, originality in art translates to execution. Of course, this is nothing new under the sun-but execution is what makes or breaks anything in life. In this case, Rebel Moon is a movie that a 12-year-old would come up with. Scratch that, that's an insult to 12 years olds everywhere. Rebel Moon is a movie a lazy person would come up with to pass the time.The pedestrian storytelling and script are severely lacking. The worldbuilding is uncreative--it's like no effort went into to anything here. The characters are largely forgettable--I cannot recall anyone's name lol. We never get to know any of the characters beside the farmer dude and the MFC. Everyone else *shrug* no clue. Why did they even exist in the movie in the first place?I can say the only thing the movie had going for it are the SFX, but that's not really saying much in the long run. That's the equivalent of saying you like the font a book was written in and the little illustrations throughout, but the story itself was kinda whatever.In the end, it's good entertainment if you want to watch something that you could laugh and talk through because you aren't missing out on anything noteworthy in regards to plot.

title: The Wish version of Dune
text: It was just ok. A 5 star rating seems accurate. Both husband and I were on our phones at multiple points throughout. There's a couple exciting scenes and some of it looks pretty cool. But it's not engaging, it's not thought provoking, it's predictable. Idk if it's Snyder or Netflix, but it clearly is trying to be like Dune.Not a unique plot at all. Very predictable. I wasn't even that impressed with the graphics. For a Netflix/Snyder film, I was expecting better but it did not meet my expectations (in terms of plot or graphics).Didn't pass the Bechdal test either but again it's Snyder so not surprised.AND there's a weird distortion at most points in the whole movie. The entire edge of the screen as well as background and often foreground have this weird distortion, that almost looks like a TikTok filter. It messed with our eyes and we had to adjust for a bit.Not the worst movie, but if there was a better option, I would pick that. Just doesn't seem like many good movies out these days.

title: Phenomenal Netflix Film!!
text: I'm shocked by how phenomenal this one was!Not once did I expect much, but I can see why I never trust any critics or what their kiss-wissy hater bandwagon types wanna say about movies when they only speak to feel more disgusted about everything.I mean, really? It doesn't sound like they've seen this at all. Instead they don't want anything to do with something cooler to see, or impactfing, or dark, or slo-mo alike, or even inspiring.Honestly, you haters have a problem with this movie having slow motion, but you never had a problem with slow motion in The Matrix films, did you?Either way, this one was phenomenal.

title: Ripoff of every SciFi ever made
text: This movie is an incredible rip off of every major sci-fi (and even fantasy) movie you have enjoyed from the late 70's to now. There's zero original storyline aside from how Zach Snyder just mishmashed a bunch of well liked objects, sets, and scenes from other people's work into his own amalgamation of whatever this movie is. At some point, after the first excruciating hour (which seems like at least three hours) you're going to realize that the horrendously shallow plot of this movie is revealed by intermittent flashback slow motion scenes that all seem to have very loose and near meaninglessness connections. I feel bad for the Actors and crew that worked on this thing; do yourself a favor and watch anything else or just nothing at all instead of this.

title: A mish mash of a film...
text: This could have been so much better... Clunky script, wooden acting and no real character or world development. A collection of set pieces muddled together with pantomime Villians.
