As for the special effects.. the lacked an edge in terms of depth and clarity.I can see the premise for the movie borrows from others where are so many parallels in relation to the storyline...Star Wara, Battle Beyond the Stars (awful but fun to watch), The 7 Samurai, The Magnificent 7...I'm hoping that part two offers more but I am not expecting much more ...The promos in the run up to it being released offered so much but in the end delivered a wack film. Think I need to rewatch Dune... now that's quality sci fi film making.

title: It's literally Battle Beyond The Stars
text: Battle Beyond the Stars with added brutality and more slow motion. It feels artificial and isn't fun. Looks good. But hollow. I wanted to like it so much. He needs to find outside writers. He's at his best then als 300. There is elements of many different films and ideas which is fine, but they don't all jail for me into some thing that has the spark of fun adventure. Some of the villains are quite good, and having fun, but some of the main characters are a little flat and underdeveloped to really make you get behind them, and want to be invested in the story and the action. I hope this is part of a Renaissance of space, opera, and science-fiction movies that have original ideas.

title: We've seen all this before....
text: ...and it was done better.Rebel Moon is a mess. It's shamelessly derivative and full of cartoon characters that just don't work.It is a blatant takeoff of Star Wars mixed in with the Seven Samurai having poor, innocent farmers being threatened with death if they don't hand over all their grain to the evil empire which turns up unannounced in the sky above their idyllic village. Why a galaxy-spanning empire that has the technology to build sentient robots and starships the size of aircraft carriers needs grain is not explained. The two dimentional villain is a Darth Vader ripoff without the cool cape and helmet who is run by an emperor who is even more evil. It even turns out he's a cybernetically enhanced Darth Vader ripoff. This guy just delights in violence and cruelty for its own sake and as a result the character is simply vapid as are his comic-book lines and facial expressions. The real Darth Vader was a far, far better villain who had depth and Ian McDiarmid's Emperor Palpatine was a stellar performance rendering Rebel Moon's attempts at these types mere cardboard cutouts by comparison.The hero is just as vapid. The often-seen-in-action-films-these-days sylph-like girl out for revenge who can break bones and the laws of motion physics with equal ease is simply boring and unbelievable.The scenes and locations are blatant Star Wars ripoffs too. The trek across a barren planet to a thug-infested spaceport where there is a fight in a seedy bar full of strange looking aliens. The joining forces of the hero with a mercenary so the hero can hitch a lift on his starship. The villain's mortal injury and cybernetic resurrection at the end...I could go on and I'm surprised Lucasfilm/Disney haven't sued for copyright infringement and plagiarism.To reiterate: we've seen all this before and it was done better.

title: Not THAT bad
text: True, the writing is a bit clunky here and there, but whatever... it's a Netflix movie. It's not terrible. It's watchable. People's expectations and standards are so high. Not everything is, or can be, the best thing ever.People are complaining about the acting. The acting is fine. Lord knows we've seen much worse. One thing I found weird was Charlie Hunnam's accent. Actually, in sci-fi movies set in a different galaxy it's always strange when accents are Earth regional, but we just have to get past that, since the actors are from Earth. 😁. I guess I'm used to either Brit or American accents in Space because I found his Irish accent a bit distracting. And, Irish? He isn't even Irish, so this was an odd decision. Someone said there was no motivation for anyone who joined the rebel crew. Actually I found their individual motivations to be pretty clear.Overall, I enjoyed it. I liked the world building and the esthetic of the different locations. Mainly, I'm just happy to have some sci-fi that isn't set in a dystopian future. I'm so tired of that. For the past few years the majority of sci-fi seems to be a mix of dystopia and zombies with a few super heroes and monsters thrown in. For me, this is a welcome change. I'll definitely watch part 2.

title: 2 Hours + 13 Minutes of strung together Sci-fi clichés
text: There was a lot of potential here. As other have noted, it's visually well done but the material is meh and unoriginal. Every element is recognizable from another well known movie, tv show, or book.Also: someone should really explain to Zack Snyder that slow motion is meant to be used for dramatic effect, not for the beginning of every single motion of every single character in every single action scene. The constant use of slo-mo into normal speed for each action movement oooooover and oooooover and ooooover again makes this almost unwatchable. It probably extends the movie 15 minutes.The acting isn't terrible but the actors are not served with a smart script or smart editing. I went in with an open mind and can usually find something to appreciate to some degree in most sci fi. Passable for a watch through but not a rewatch and I won't be waiting on the edge of my seat waiting for part 2.

title: You know you're in for a rough ride when the movie starts off with 2 minutes of exposition in a David Attenborough impression.
text: Honestly, one of the worst films I've sat through in recent memory, If I hadn't been watching it with family, I'd have turned it off after 20 minutes. After the really bad opening exposition, we're greeted with some really good imagery that is ruined by the horrible creature design of just a Clydesdale horse with a piece of driftwood stuck to its head. But wait, it gets worse once the humans start acting.No amount of Lens flare can hide the poor writing and bad acting of this movie, though Mr Snyder sure does try. It's almost like someone is making fun of him. The mishmash of cool imagery and stupid imagery just left me feeling confused; why are some shots really great, and others really bad and confusing? Why are some aliens cool, but some are just a horse with driftwood on its head?!The writing is bad, the pacing is off, and the characters are so flat they disappear when turned sideways. Not even so-bad-it's-good, just plain bad.

title: Extension of Star Wars
text: I think that this movie had lots of interesting characters that could have easily been in a Star Wars episode or movie. Not sure how defined the plot was if there truly was a plot but I personallyoved the special effects and Cinematography.Basically a film about a peaceful society trying to fight back against a tyrannical force.If you enjoy star wars movie the you may just like this 2023 film. Quite of few differant hairstyles and makeup arrangements but believable. Not sure why this movie would be for mature audiences only. Maybe too much violence for critics taste but I found the film lacked any big fighting scenes.

title: Eye candy and nothing else
text: The majority of reviewers nailed it.Eye candy and a good concept but dialogue and action are completely boring.Zack Synder should be ashamed of himself for promoting this as the next coming of Star Wars. He had all the elements to make this into a new era of sci-fi with movies , spin offs and toys games etc. But instead he released a hack of a movie with poor dialogue choices , stuff acting and awful pacing that let the audience see zero development of the runtime.I liked Man of Steel and Batman v Superman somewhat and of course 300. But this movie is a complete mess and Netflix got hosed on this deal.

title: Disappointing
text: I really was hoping for another great sci fi action movie like dune or Star Wars but to be honest it was pretty messy from characters to the story. Was definitely no where near as great as those other blockbusters what was even more disappointing was that Zack Snyder could create something like this I do like him and most of his movies he has some incredible talent but this this was like they tried to mix all sci fi avtion movies and mix em together and really didn't put much effort into this film the acting is okay the main problem is but I found I didnt suck me in and I ended up skipping some parts of the movie and the ending just realy just really just sucked to be honest not sure if this helpedjust trying to explain without spoiling but just honestly just watch it.

title: Stupid fun
text: It may stupid at times, but it is fun. It's really just the story of how the gang got together, so hopefully the story will be better in the next part. But the characters are cool, the action is fun, the setting has a certain intriguing quality. It's a bit less like star wars than I expected,, that is good because I don't like a knock off. I gave it an 8 (which may be a bit too generous) to offset all the over the top negativity from the critics. The movie has a certain cool factor and I believe it will appeal too many people and be a success. I will certainly be waiting for the next part in April.

title: A mix of good movies gone bad
text: A mix of Star Wars, Avatar, Star Trek, Avengers and Matrix all mixed into one movie. It's not very original and not anywhere near as good as the movies mentioned. Below average sci- fi movie. Many of the scenes are copy cats of other movies, from Anikan Skywalker changing into Darth Vader to taming and riding the giant birds from Avatar, we've seen it all before. The ending was predictable and of course open to part two which will undoubtedly be more scene stealing from other movies. It wasn't terrible but it was watchable to the extent of figuring out what movie they used for an inspiration for the next scene.

title: Action above plot
text: This movie furthers the take that Zach Snyder hit a home run with 300 but had yet to deliver a movie since then that actually has a good story line. The first 20 minutes of this was good, engaging and with character development. Once past the original intro the rest of the movie was action for action sake with the viewer having no real interest if our heroes live or die.Zach Snyder took a lot bad press for the DC universe movies including Man of Steel and Justice League, with many viewers blaming DC as the reason for such a poor false start within that franchise. After seeing this I am left pointing at Snyder as a major portion of those movies bad performance.The action scenes in this movie are decent, but who cares if the movie is un-engaging.

title: The cast is pretty, every thing else is bad.
text: I came into this with high hopes but this has failed on every level. The dialog sucks. The plot is thin, but thinks it's deep. The acting is like drinking the water in the sink after washing dishes. Soapy and disgusting. The cast are pretty. Like if you have a speaking role you have probably worked as a model at some point. The action is ridiculous and not in a good way.You can tell they really wanted to do a star wars movie. There are droids, an empire, a dead Emperor, light sabers, and lots of uses of Star Wars sound effects. There is even something like the world's between.I will say this... I do like the effect they used for the blasters. When they hit metal it melts the metal and the slag splashes off.

title: Rebel Moon is Star Wars for grown adults. Excellent film.
text: I'm a movie buff and typically quite critical of movies. I also use IMDb as a resource to protect my eyes and ears from a bad film or tv experience. I recently watched Aquaman 2 and felt it was my duty to let others know not to waster their precious time on that piece of trash. So when I got home from Aquaman and explored the reviews for Rebel Moon, I avoided it, thinking it was going to be another huge letdown.I was pleasantly surprised by this film. Zach Snyder is a hit or miss director but when he hits, his movies are amazing. This was an exceptional film with great graphics, great acting, and a lot of nuggets dropped to get you to buy in to the ongoing saga. Sure it is a little plastic in terms of character depth. It started as a film so it doesn't have the richness of a film built on an epic novel. But it hit all my joy points and I was even left thinking about it after it was over. This was a very good movie. Far better than any of the Star Wars films except maybe the original 3.Rebel Moon is Star Wars for grown adults. Ignore the reviews. Go see it. Enjoy it.

title: LOL
text: This movie was so bad (at almost everything) that I had to rate and review and see others reviews before I've finished it.At first, you don't realize it's bad while you're shown scenes of a farm and you wonder where it's all going then suddenly, while watching the movie unfold that there have already been too many slow motion shots and you're not even that deep into the movie yet.The acting isn't *all* bad, but a lot of it is laughable, and there are characters that simply aren't explained or make any sense -- such as these two skull masked sort of "priests" that follow the main antagonist around, you just have no idea what they're even there for other than to be some ominous aesthetic.The guy from Sons of Anarchy is in it and he is using the worst Irish accent , that makes it hard to really take him serious, despite having a serious roll.To describe this movie in a word: Corny.

title: A lot unused potential
text: The movie is just a disappointment. The storyline is flat and obviously, there is actually not much character development and personally I miss enough depth of backgroundstories and motivation of most characters. Which is quite sad cause a lot of sets are promising. The diversity of planets and populations are quite interesting. But there is no moment to dive in because the movie feels rushed through. I didn't liked the CGI. It didn't felt contemporary so that at no point I had a feeling to really dive in and let myself go with all of it.... and the slow motion scenes are just to much. The fight scenes seem pretty predictable and sometimes I felt it was missing a certain flow (waiting for the next move or enemy to attack, something happened so they start shooting without any aiming and such things)It has a lot of potential but it needs to slow down has to give every single character time to unfold to make it plausible that this character needs to be in the team. It needs to connect more with the diversity of its surroundings and needs to find it's own way to develop an universe worth to be told.

title: A Watchable Adventure
text: When it comes to Zack Snyder's films, you can't say he doesn't go for it visually. Even on a lower budget, his goal is always to make his films feel grand. I have enjoyed a lot of his films, so I will always give his efforts a chance, even if they don't look good throughout promotion. Well, his latest release, Rebel Moon - Part 1: A Child of Fire is now streaming on Netflix and I must say, even though I didn't hate it, it's one of his weakest films for sure. A lot of people are tearing this film apart and while I agree with a lot of the criticisms I'm hearing, I did find some good in it. I won't be recommending this one, but I will say that I liked it just enough to watch the sequel coming in a few months, so there's that.Much like many Sci-Fi stories, Rebel Moon - Part 1: A Child of Fire is simply about a hero who needs to form a team to take down a looming threat. With that said, when you start incorporating robots, cantinas, laser swords, space travel, and a massive villain showdown, eyebrows will be raised. Personally, this is a film that knows it's borrowing from all the classics and it runs with it, so I just chose to forgive it and try to experience it for what it is. Sofia Boutella as Kora is honestly pretty wooden in her performance, which is a shame because I have loved her in the past and this entire film is on her shoulders. Many of the side characters were far more interesting to me. I'm going to move on from the characters though, because that's probably the worst part of the film (nobody gets any real development) and I don't want to rant about just that. I also know that a version of this film is coming that's an hour longer, so I'll be even more frustrated if they're fleshed out more later on.I also think this film suffers from having a smaller budget from Netflix. It film tries to look huge, but the CGI doesn't quite match up in my opinion. The slow motion didn't hurt the film for me like others are saying and I thought the action was fun. The exciting aspects of this film are really why I give it a pass. The screenplay however needed some work. The dialogue is very simplistic and over-explanatory all at the same time. It felt like the characters were reading a description from a novel, rather than dialogue for a feature film. It wasn't bad writing in general, it just didn't feel like a script, which to me might be worse.Rebel Moon - Part 1: A Child of Fire is not a good film by any means, but I'd be lying if I said I hated watching it. It was the perfect film to relax in the afternoon and watch. That's probably not the intended idea behind this film and it does have a lot of wasted potential, but I still mildly enjoyed it. Again, this one isn't getting a recommendation from me, but I do believe it's better than the terrible reviews out there. It's now streaming on Netflix and if you had any interest already, you may still enjoy it.

title: This movie doesn't know what it wants to be...
text: I keep reading about parallels with Star Wars. Sorry, but I'm just not seeing it. What I saw was Firefly/Serenity meets Dune meets Chronicles of Riddick. Maybe some Warhammer 40k sprinkled in there for no apparent reason. There was no character development, so there's no opportunity to become invested in them so I couldn't care less about what happened to them.Considering Zach Snyder's involvement, I went in with high hopes, which were sent crashing.I'm not going to say it's unwatchable. The fight scenes and visuals were okay, maybe too many slow motion action scenes. Just know going in that you're not seeing anything new.Now if Zach had made a Warhammer 40k movie, I think he'd have something there.

title: Good for a Warhammer clone.
text: I think this movie will only be appreciated by those who are fans of Warhammer 40k. It's clear that was what they were shooting for with their own spin on it. I enjoyed it thoroughly with that in mind despite pacing being a bit off in the middle. Overall exciting and enjoyable to watch and not a star wars ripoff like some people seem to think it is. I enjoy many of the actors they got and the not so subtle 40k inspirations. What this movie does lack is going full on with the 40k inspiration. Could have been more high Gothic in design, could have had mentions of the warp and daemons. Could have used extreme prejudice against all alien lifeforms. But it did capture the imperiums need of subjugating planets and stripping them of their resources by any means necessary. Keep in mind this movie could also just be inspired by Dune as well given 40k and Dunes connection to one another.

title: Such a waste of time and money
text:
"Zack Snyder first conceived this as a Star Wars movie, and pitched it to Lucasfilm shortly after it was bought by Disney in 2012, but it never got off the ground."Really? What a surprise! I wonder why? Well, I think I know :No acting, no real dialogues, ridiculous slow motion scenes, bad matte painting, no suspension of disbelief at all....
Nothing is okay in this movie. It's so bad, it's shameful Netflix offered it like a great sci-fi movie.It' so pathetic it could have been funny if it wasn't so pretentious.The worst issue is : there is a second part.Don't waste your precious time watching that.

title: More machine now than man; twisted and evil
text: We probably all remember when Zach Snyder was exciting and new. 300 and Watchmen were unique films with an aesthetic we rarely had seen, and he threaded the needle well between action and fantasy. Then he made at least 5 terrible movies that only his cultists appreciated. Now, I think it's completely appropriate to say that he has nothing left in the tank and is either here for the check or has gone drunk from the adoration of his narrowing fan base.There are no interesting or believeable characters in Rebel Moon. There are no clever twists, honest dialogue or original stories. Between the completely superfluous Jena Malone spider-mom character and the guy who's allergic to shirts recreating Harry Potter's hippogryff scene shot-for-shot, this movie exceeds any reasonable person's allowance for suspension of disbelief 30 minutes in and never earns it back. And Zach, action scenes don't become art by just slowing them down. This really is just a boring, tired, uninspired, hacky attempt at science fiction.

title: My first review ever because this was so bad!!!
text: Writing my first ever review and I search on imdb a lot..... sooooo disappointed!! Felt compelled to do a quick review. Its the combination of slightly dodgy sex related themes and conversations (no nudity but frequent unnecessary innuendo makes it feel a bit dirty minded). So the opposite of an amazing classic like star wars. Thank goodness this movie kept away from that legend! Unreal overuse of slo-mo (my teen kids were laughing at this a lot!) and worst accents in a movie ever! (I am from NI so so unnecessary also made us laugh), and worst haircut on a bad guy ever! Plus dialogue is rubbish. They had a cool robot voiced by Anthony Hopkins at the start then got rid of him for the whole movie. Just utter pants! 2 hours of your life you will never get back!!

title: Reviews were spot on.....
text: It's like AI made a movie. The characters are one dimensional and there's an over reliance on narration to explain the story and spell out the precise emotional reaction it is trying to elicit. The lack of any subtext or nuance is pervasive and honestly begs the question as to whether or not it was completely written by AI. That said, it's not an entirely unpleasant movie to watch. Lots of eye candy, beautifully shot and well executed. Is it enough to make me care about any of the characters? Meh......the worlds they've created seem cool and I want to know more about their universe, but I just don't care about any of the people.

title: "Rebel Moon: A Galactic Odyssey Unfolds in its Own Orbit - Embrace the Unexpected!"
text: "Rebel Moon presents a captivating viewing experience with its unique narrative, urging audiences to appreciate it independently rather than drawing parallels with classics or Star Wars. The film establishes a strong foundation, generating excitement for the unfolding storyline, despite the initial perception of a hurried plot. Embracing the movie with an open mind, devoid of preconceived expectations, enhances the enjoyment of this cinematic journey. The anticipation for future developments in this intriguing universe adds an extra layer of excitement, making Rebel Moon a film that stands out on its own and leaves viewers eagerly awaiting what comes next in its promising narrative."

title: Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child of Fire
text: In a small farming village on a planet far far away very nasty Admiral Noble (Ed Skrein) arrives on behalf of the totalitarian authority the Motherworld, looking for grain and information leading to the capture of rebels. A leading light in this rebellion, Kora (Sophie Boutella) is hidden there and wipes out a small group of Nobles' men. She then hurriedly leaves the planet with rather cowardly and smitten farmer Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) in tow to recruit a range of colourful fighting characters to take on Noble and the Motherworld.Whilst this is nowhere near as bad as some critics are making out, there is still a good deal wrong with it. The 'characters' such as they are, are completely flat and dull as ditchwater and are recruited by Boutella to the cause one by one in a long series of set pieces of varying quality a la Magnificent Seven, Snyder's Justice League etc. The story is just so derivative of better works, most obviously Star Wars it defies belief including a C3PO robot character played by a miscast Anthony Hopkins who when he speaks sounds like he's delivering a Shakespeare monologue from the London stage. Finally, like other Snyder films it has far too much exposition and far too much anti climactic epilogue.On the plus side Boutella is convincing in the lead, Skrein is great fun as the villain whose moral compass and he parted centuries ago and some of the set pieces are impressively staged. It is not enough though, there is clearly a desire here to create another franchise which will sit nicely with Snyder's many loyal fans which I'm sure it will. (They will no doubt write to Snyder asking if Mark Hamill could join the rebellion) I will pick up with part 2, but I think that will be enough for me. Not awful, watchable, but unnecessary.

title: Could have been a wonderful movie...
text: ...but instead, the script fell of the creative shelf and straight into the quick money-making hamper.The beginning is good (why I gave it a 4 star). It was strong and beautiful. When Jimmy (Anthony Hopkins) comes in, there's a strong feeling of something cooking and an involvement is created.And then comes the first fighting scene where everything, and I mean EVERYTHING breaks into 1000 pieces of irregular, random pieces from every corner of the universe.The choreography is just sad. Watching a lot of Korean movies, I'm used to well executed fights and action. In comparison, this was such an extremely disappointing experience that I had to look again who produced and directed it.Cliché after cliché and stereotype after stereotype, the director fails completely to engaging me in the story. Loss didn't touched me. Death didn't move me. Environments didn't convinced me. And so on...Such a shame.

title: pretty good, high budget scifi
text: I dont quite understand the hate for this show, yes its a bit random and a bit fast paced, but the overall story is fine and the special effects are great. People are saying the story is bad, well what about 'the 100' and 'hunters' with al pacino, those shows are incredibly bad, and make little sense to someone with common sense, but they both get a 7/10 but this gets a 5.7.Anyway i'm looking forward to the second installment, it reminded me of firefly and lex, but not as dark. Maybe theres a conspiracy online to hate this show, It feels like it's getting review bombed for some reason, I am looking forward to the R rated version.

title: Wow,this was awful.
text: Rebel Moon, despite its potential, stumbles dramatically with a scene where a mountain inexplicably showers a colossal waterfall over an ostensibly arid farm. This absurd visual not only defies basic laws of nature but also undermines the film's credibility. The director's attempt to blend awe-inspiring visuals with a coherent storyline falls short, as the sheer lack of logical coherence in this particular scene disrupts the audience's ability to suspend disbelief. Flashy imagery can only compensate so much for a narrative that sacrifices realism for spectacle. The film's failure to maintain internal consistency leaves audiences perplexed, questioning the very fabric of the story. In a cinematic landscape where immersion is key, Rebel Moon misses the mark, overshadowed by scenes that prioritize visual extravagance over a sensible storyline. Despite commendable efforts in other aspects, this particular flaw significantly hampers the overall viewing experience, turning a potentially captivating film into a disappointing venture for those seeking a narrative grounded in BASIC logic and coherence.

title: Slow, boring, unbelievable
text: What do you get when producing a movie in slow motion half the time? That's right, a very slow movie. I was hoping for a Guy Ritchie in space, with a few touches of Kill Bill. And the atmosphere of Dune. It's all of that kind of, but failed. It's not witty, exciting or epic. It's incredibly slow, with long dragging scenes and awful dialogue. Most of what is happening or said is unbelievable. Why the whole village suddenly there, as if it's one person? Because it's convenient. Why are their beds separated by see-through curtains? Most of this movie doesn't make sense and it takes a great deal of perseverance to get to the better part of it. No they should remake this movie and do it better, using actual writing that is proven to be good.

title: Rushed Plot. No development
text: So.. I thought it resembled Star Wars and went into info about this movie.Sure enough, Riddy wanted this to be a Star Wars sequel or concept plot.Instead it became a movie. Movie that feels very rushed.Each characters have very brief introduction. Cliche characters who emerge as great heroes. We've all seen this before, surely.Empire, worlds, stories.. each lacks in their own way. As a viewer, I was confused to what each heroes did before being involved into the plot.World is unsure. Just... random aliens and human here and there. So brief in fact, that you forget you already hopped from a planet to a planet.Too rushed. That's all I can say. Slower development could've really made this movie great.

title: Dissapointed
text: I believed that Zack Snyder, who gave us the Justice League, could create something very special. There are signs of his greatness in this movie, but the story, screenplay, and dialogue are disappointing. We got the same sci-fi movie with more color and slow motion.Left wanting more in the end. If this is a world he is building, then we've got one more to add to the list of all stories told over and over again and nothing learned from the failure.But there are good things about it, like he always does: the cinematography, background score, and sets are amazing. The world beyond our reality is something we can only dream of.

title: This movie is a Sci-Fi fan's Easter Egg hunt
text: I feel like this is an homage to Sci Fi... the story itself is basic and lacks any surprise. There is little to no twists or gasp moments to draw you in. The main character is dragged into the position of playing hero, and finds other ragtag fighters to help her fight the big bad. But I will say for the true Sci Fi fan, this is Easter egg galore... from Avengers to Matrix to Star Wars to Star Trek to Mad Max to Beetlejuice to Harry Potter... the scenes play out like a recap of Sci Fi over the last decade. My husband and I basically made a game of guessing which movie would be tapped into next.

title: Bugs life with aliens.
text:
It's entertaining but don't expect much more than that. We had fun naming which show each part was taken from: Bugs life, Star Wars, game of thrones etc.But it's still entertaining enough.The fight scenes are good. The effects are good.The acting is even pretty good. I think our main issue was it was too much like every other show I mentioned.I agree with some other reviews saying there are too many characters and not enough development for them. Maybe the second installment will remedy that.The accents kind of threw me off but I dont know how made up aliens should talk so...
I wouldn't say you SHOULD watch it but if you're bored it's not too bad.

title: A Visual Extravaganza with Room for Improvement
text: A visually striking cinematic experience, stands as a solid watchable movie that captivates its audience with a focus on stunning visuals. In the realm of contemporary cinema, diversity in genres is imperative for a well-rounded cinematic landscape. While some may argue for the significance of movies like "Creator," which delve into serious undertones and intellectual exploration, fun films like "Rebel Moon" hold their own importance offering audiences distinct experiences. What makes "Rebel Moon" particularly noteworthy is its ability to deliver an even larger visual ambition within a similar budget range, with a staggering $166 million allocated for the production of two parts.I would have loved to see "Rebel Moon" in cinemas with 3D. Especially since some of my favorite 3D visuals are of Zack.I had several goosebump moments, accompanied by solid visuals that elicit a resounding "hell yeah." These goosebump-inducing moments contribute to the film's ability to resonate emotionally with the audience, creating a memorable viewing experience. The visual prowess of the movie is undoubtedly one of its strongest attributes, providing a feast for the eyes that complements the narrative.However, the film does not come without its criticisms. Achieving the right balance between providing necessary information and maintaining a dynamic storyline is a delicate task, and "Rebel Moon" might lean slightly towards the side of excessive exposition.Another point of contention lies in the characterization of certain roles. While Sir Anthony Hopkins delivers a standout performance, other characters such as Djimon Hounsou's Titus and Michael Huisman's Gunnar may come across as a bit on the nose. Finding the right balance in character development is crucial, and the film could benefit from a more nuanced approach to these roles to avoid veering into stereotypical or predictable territory.Despite these minor critiques, the ensemble cast, as a whole, fulfills their roles admirably. Each actor contributes to the narrative, ensuring that the movie maintains its momentum and keeps the audience engaged. The overall execution of the characters is mostly perfect, demonstrating the proficiency of the cast in bringing the story to life.

title: Rebel moon part 1
text: So me, and the wife just sat through this... movie? What is the plot? I feel like some of the main heros were killed in the first battle. After giving up, what felt like, hours of my life. I still don't understand what rolls any of these people play. There is no excitement, no point. I know some of these actors can act. I have seen them do it. I know the directors can make a decent film. I feel that this was just a poor attempt to try to make a few dollars. So sad they spent so much money to do it, and it was a flop. I will not be watching the second one. Because the first one sucked so bad. How did you guys even come up with the money for the second part?

title: Mash up of sci-fi tropes
text: Star Wars meets The Magnificent Seven meets Dune meets ... well you get the idea. From the opening credits I spent most of this movie wondering which remake I was watching. And there are any number of films to choose from in this mash-up. Thats not to say it's a bad movie. A credible cast and budget deliver credible if not gripping performances and not quite enough to have me on the edge of my seat, especially when there are too many tropes you can see coming from a mile away. And this is 'Part 1' so perhaps it's a slow burner with more to come. It's ok to fill a few hours in between Christmas and New Year but lacks anything to make it stand out from the crowd.

title: It squeaks out a pass despite being trite
text: I don't know about all the drama surrounding the production of this, but this was about as good as the last couple Star Wars movies. It's trite and predictable and poorly acted, but I actually thought this version of space fascists vs space Vikings was fine, for what it was. But I also have a soft spot for the subgenre of women who hurt men who hurt women and I really like the impetus of this whole conflict being around the supplying of food to one faction.There's a good movie hiding in here. The budget was obviously huge because the fights are fun and more interesting than Star Wars. The entire aesthetic makes little cohesive sense, neither does the various accents people have. Like, how does one father have an accent but the daughter does not? The world bible for this thing must be wild to see.I think I liked this more than the last two Star Wars though. It's all just lasers and reasons to show lasers and glowing swords and things, and that's fine, for me, when I'm in a particular mood.

title: unimaginative, cheap and generic, but watchable
text: Well the review is in the title, but since i have to write something here, let's go a little deeper. This is just the start of another franchise of weird superhero like movies with a overly accentuated characters. We have warriors princesses, warrior princes, warrior commanders, and the list goes on. The movie started nice, but then just devolved. Would have liked it if it just built on that first 10 minutes; instead it went all out into kitchen sink writing.CGI is bad. Very cheap and you can spot all the cheese. Oh well.The universe is basically nazis in space, which has been done a few times before. Find something less cliched .. i mean its imaginary scifi, like be creative!Acting is eh. As a superhero like movie there is no real acting. Just some amazing fighting abilities and stupid situations to showcase them. And of course every cast member has their own thing. But they all have the ability to never be shot as they run around with shorts to close the gap against 40 machine guns firing at you.. anyway, more cheese than a cheese factory.5/10 because it was not horrible. Watch and forget.

title: A Promising Start with Room for Improvement
text: Rebel Moon Part 1: A Child of Fire is an action-packed sci-fi film that brings a thrilling and visually stunning experience to the screen. While it showcases impressive action sequences, a captivating screenplay, and commendable performances, it falls short in certain areas, hindering its potential greatness.The film boasts a series of truly badass slow-mo action sequences that are sure to left with just one word, wow. The film also delivers thrilling moments that showcase the film's high production values and meticulous attention to detail.The screenplay of Rebel Moon Part 1 is another strong aspect, offering an intriguing storyline that sets the stage for an epic space opera. The narrative explores themes of rebellion, sacrifice, and the fight for freedom, creating a sense of urgency and emotional resonance. However, the film suffers from a slightly underdeveloped first act which could have benefited from more refined pacing and exposition.While the direction of Rebel Moon Part 1 is generally solid, there is room for improvement. The film sets up a vast and immersive world, but at times, the direction lacks the grandeur and polish necessary to fully bring it to life. Also, there is no emphasis given to character development. With a more visionary approach, the film could have achieved a greater sense of scale and spectacle, elevating the overall experience.Another weak aspect of the film lies in the love story between Kora and Gunnar. Although the potential for a compelling romance is present, the development of their relationship feels rushed and underdeveloped. More attention could have been given to their connection, allowing audiences to invest emotionally in their journey.The editing of Rebel Moon Part 1 is a mixed bag. While certain scenes are expertly crafted and contribute to the film's narrative flow, there are instances where the editing feels uneven. Some scenes appear unnecessary or could have been tightened, occasionally disrupting the film's overall pacing and rhythm.The performances in Rebel Moon Part 1 are undeniably commendable, although Ed Skrein's performance as Admiral Atticus Noble stands out amongst the crowdIn conclusion, Rebel Moon Part 1: A Child of Fire presents an enjoyable cinematic experience with its badass action sequences, strong screenplay, and commendable performances. However, the film falls short in certain areas, particularly in carving out the love story and maintaining consistent editing. With improved direction and a more refined first act, the film had the potential to reach greater heights.Despite these shortcomings, Rebel Moon Part 1 sets the stage for a more action-packed part 2 that leaves me eagerly anticipating what comes next.8/10.

title: This could have been SO GOOD!
text: Love it when women in a movie can be tough WHILE staying feminine. Many have done this over the years, Wonder Woman, the original Galadriel (sp) from the LoTR Trilogy, but when women become so tough that they lose our natural depth and humanity, then why not just watch another dull, boring male action movie with bad writing? What's the point? If the whole point of this movie is to make women look masculine and men look feminine, then this movie should be rated a TEN, but that's about all it was good at... and it's sad because it had SO MUCH PROMISE. The lead actress had no depth by the middle of the movie. She had one expression, one delivery (just like the lead in the LOTR Trilogy, when women forget about being tough, and just mimic men, it comes across as very one dimensional). Women can be tough without acting like a man.I feel bad for the men in this film. They were all dependent on her for safety. They were useless followers. I am ready for a male lead in a fantasy movie more than ever now.

title: First 2 minutes are exactly how the whole movie is.
text: Yes, this first scene of a girl plowing field with an absolutely stunning view at the back is perfect representation of the whole movie.It's cliche.It has beautiful cinematography.It's predictable and straightforward.And 15 minutes in you know how it will end. With, maybe, one not completely obvious plot twist, which is still very predictable (in a way of "either this will happen or this is just overwhelming boring plot").Overall it would be a generic Netflix kinda movie. Nothing but a time killer, but... it ain't awful. And honestly with new approach StarWars is getting, I would say this has much more potential.

title: Crude unsophisticated drivel
text: I don't know why Snyder gets to make films. This is Terrible. Crudely written, wooden dialogue, and terrible cliche storyline. Unnecessary set pieces that are meant to establish character but they are so badly done that there is no emotion there. The extended versions for parts one and two must be excruciating to watch. Justice league was also terrible, irrespective of the version as is this. Don't waste your time. It's a crude rip off of Star Wars and Dune crudely mashed together with zero insight or originality. Predictable and tedious. I can see why Disney rejected this as a Star Wars movie, it should never have been made.

title: Sci-Fi from Zack
text: Awesome first 25 minutes, then a bit rushed.All in all: good acting, amazing atmosphere, stunning visuals and great action scenes. However, the R-Rating got in the way of better action sequences. Hope for more in the extended cut, when it comes to story telling and charachter building in the second part of the movie as well as more sophisticated action scenes.I like that the animated worlds are playing a big part, but is almost always used to alter and support the story line. We've seen a lot of movies in recent years where the animations are supposed to cover up for everything else that is lacking (like a proper story/acting performances)I look forward to part 1 extended, part 2 and part 2 extended over the next few months!

title: A colossal waste of time
text: Rebel Moon lures you in and then it just devolves into a Star Wars wanna be mess. I began losing hope when the skinny little heroine, armed with a farming tool, took on six jacked marines all armed with rifles - it's so tiresome. My interest continued to fade as our hero's rebel crew hopped around the galaxy gathering a motley crew of characters typical of the genre. The character development was lacking and rushed. I can't remember their names because they were all so blah. The plot was something a 5th grader could've contrived: awesome fighter chick because girl power...poor helpless farmers that need saving...bad space nazis...light sabers...random scenes featuring a unique alien creature...a traitor...and a climax that's just mind-numbingly stupid. The only redeeming quality of this flick was some of the visuals and the imaginative worlds. Give it a pass. People need to stop creating a market for this nonsense.

title: Hurtful
text:
The criticism I have read here is more than valid. Mediocre acting, bad script , overly stereotypical characters without any nuance, weirdly paced, many " borrowed" ideas from other popular franchises and the Snyder -typical slow motion sequences to the maximum which take more away from the overall quality of the movie than they add. Fight sequences don't manage to pop due to weird editing choices and mostly poor choreography design.Snyder has left me very often with a feeling of " this could have been better" and that was my dominant feeling at the end of this movie too. Money or time restrictions were clearly not issues for what he had to make foul compromises... So what is the problem...again...
It utterly unnerving.

title: Wow it's bad...
text: I couldn't stop watching this shipwreck in hope of it becoming better.The storyline is unoriginal, entire scenes felt ripped off from several movies. Script filled with cliche's.The acting was too dramatic and felt very amateur (not in a good way). The fighting scenes were covered with special effects and a dramatic score - but were very unprofessional and many of the actors seemed poorly trained for fighting scenes (especially the main villain).The movie felt like it was trying to overcompensate for a poor script with a lot of everything. Almost as if they'd given AI to write a script and it just put together the best scenes of other movies and put them all together.Now for the story itself, it had 1 decent plot twist in which the heroes were in danger for a few minutes, ruined by a "saving scene" which i still don't understand.Sorry but the bad reviews were true this time (and I'm usually very easygoing with movies, enjoying even the mediocre ones).

title: Painful low budget crap with bad acting
text: It was so painful to watch. I am a sci-fi fan so naturally I was excited, especially seeing director behind the move, but... very disappointed. Worse than mediocre acting by some of the main characters. Backdrop image painfully bad. 5-year old would be able to do it better nowadays. Full of clichés. Nazi uniform for baddies... come on! Monologues - made me want to cringe. One of the reasons Netflix is going to lose the streaming battle - bad, cheap content.Anyway, save your time - stare at the wall, it will be more fun and your brain will thank you.And unsubscribe from Netflix. It's not worth it.

title: Amazing, the story should continue
text: The story, cast, and sequence were impressive. It is the start of a good space saga. A strong woman character is introduced, with a team that is assembled during the movie. The final battle was in an unexpected place; however, it was a good little twist, with a surprise. The back story is also given in narration and flashbacks. However not much about the villain was given. Some characters got more screen time such as the robot and the water girl but their story and need in the film was not shown. The scenes after the last battle were too long. They should have been added as mid-credit. Hopefully, the second part will come soon.

title: Movie without an idea
text: The good: production of the movie is of high quality.The cast is quite good, with the exception of gunnar and the lead actress, which were average, but not too bad.The bad: the script seems like written by AI: there are some rather goo, yet copied ideas from the other movies, but there is nothing connecting them.The ugly: the tempo and lavk of ideas make this movie seem like a frankenstein glued up from 6 microstories that neither connect to each other well, nor watches well. This is a perfect example, how adding a bit more effort to writing could have made this movie at least an A lister, but due to the rush (or AI) it ould not likely outgrow imdb score 5.

title: Disappointing
text: If someone told you they were remaking Battle Beyond the Stars without the campy fun, but with lots of dark grittiness, you'd probably think that didn't sound great. Well, Rebel Moon is here to prove you'd have thought right.I really wanted to like it and I don't think my standards are especially high, but there's just not much I could get into. The most interesting character is basically an extra and the rest feel very one-dimensional. The plot is basically a series of vignettes to introduce our band of tropes and not much more.To be fair, it is only part one of a two-part movie, so maybe it comes together in part two and part one is just an introduction, but I doubt it and I think I'll pass.

title: Unrefined film lost between Nazi - and Norse - exploitation, Star Wars ripoff
text: Much of the way through, I felt that this epic -- epically stiff -- production must have suffered from being over budget and forced to be tightly restrained, so much that the final work didn't quite get the attention it needed. Whether that's true or not, it felt like it. The film felt it was not thoroughly developed, not rewritten enough to reach clarity, not expertly directed and edited. It did not achieve the kind of action or narrative pace, nor character growth, to keep a clever viewer engaged. It was not refined, no more than something for an audience to stare at 'xplosions 'n' pew-pews, a film one might let distract them while in a waiting room. This was rarely a popcorn-chomping film full of "wow."I'm not resentful, but I wanted to like this story; I wanted to love this film. I was intrigued by the backstory -- it is rooted in a rejected Star Wars story pitch by Snyder -- and interested to see how Snyder and team might build a Star Wars-esque space opera that didn't feel like a ripoff -- or awkward in other ways. It felt like a ripoff. Plus, there are some obvious cultural and accent similarities that I liked at first, but was annoyed by, in total.There is a space-Norse villager feel, which might have been OK on its own, but then space Nazis (Motherworld enforcers) showed up to be cold and cruel. Then, Charlie Hunnam's character had an... Irish accent, umm, sorta. Why? (Why not just go with his native Aussie accent?! Just a thought.)Rebel Moon Pt. 1 is filled with some intended intense characters, some intended bold action sequences, and has a basic story that must have been great in a pitch session. But, with whatever struggles were encountered in creating this Netflix film, it did not make for a finished product that offered a refined, watchable tale.It was not as horrible as, say, "The Spirit" (a painfully stiff 2008 Frank Miller fantasy flick), but it is not even on par with, for example, "Solo: A Star Wars Story" (a decent, not great, 2018 Han Solo origin film), in its cohesion and entertainment value.What makes it worth it? The actors and the characters, while not fully developed in this struggling narrative. As the lead baddie, Ed Skrein does evil well. I am a sucker for star Sofia Boutella (Algerian actor, you might know her from a "Star Trek" reboot film or "The Mummy" with Tom Cruise, among other films) is about as intense a female actress as is out there. Other actors show up and their skills are apparent, but get hammered by the stumbling last half of the film. Boutella and the other actors can't save this story, but she and some others make it watchable. Just not watchable enough.So, is the Zack Snyder director's cut of this coming? Hopefully, they'll put more effort into it.

title: Entertainment
text: I watch movies to escape reality. I don't care about the "extra" stuff people rate movies. You can watch the trailer and see what kind of movie it is so why be surprised and bash it like it was up supposed to be the #1 movie at some fancy film festival my goodness. Also these people who give reviews here, 99% of the movies they rave about are some of the most boring movies I've attempted to watch, the ones they hate I seem to enjoy. Imagine that. All I say is to go into the movie knowing what you are expecting. Did you watch "Harold & Kumar" and say " Horrible movie that plot was so unbelievable"? Like really?

title: No soul
text: This was having a good vibe at the start, as it got a little slow, but there was a story. Once it got deeper into the movie, some actors seem to be unable to play, some scenes had no link between them, just some separate scenes that where added to make a movie. The characteres have no connection, no chemistry, just a bunch of actors playing in a studio, being payed some money at the end of the day and that would be it. Some actors are really bad, no surprises there whatsoever. This is just another failure of Netflix that is trying to impose some things, but never gets to where it should be. Dissapointing. Again.

title: Yet another remake of a classic
text: The Seven Samurai arise again in a galaxy far far away. I find it hard to understand why film makers try to remake a classic movie. They just can't compete in any way with Kurasawa's magnificent Samurai movie.Yes it's in colour and magnificent 4k but eye candy just doesn't cut it.Rather than a bunch of bandits our heroes now face a gigantic fascist dictatorship with so many men and so much firepower you would need a massive force to stand up to them let alone beat them. But then you've got to somehow beat an old black and white movie in Japanese with no special effects made by one of the greatest directors the world has ever seen.The vast amount of money needed to make such an epic with spectacular effects unfortunately doesn't compare to the wonderful photography, great acting and magnificent battle scenes of the original.Maybe 5/10 is generous. I will watch the second part and maybe readjust my rating.

title: Great movie great casting it has a soul
text: Look the reason why movies don't get renewed is because everybody just trashed them man that movie is so good I watched it all and it made me exactly how I was supposed to feel anxious excited for the part two like it or not one of the best movies this year to be honest. Kosh get out yourself before you read reviews let's push this movie to keep on getting movies from Zenaida one of the greatest produces to be honest. I don't see any problem with this monkey look I'm excited for the part two. Considering nowadays we don't even get good movies this is one of the good movies that has been made since the endgame don't get me wrong there are so many good movies but this just did it for me this year.

title: Terrible
text: It's like Zack Snyder watched Battlefield Earth, and said hey I can make a sci-fi epic worse than that. If you grew up watching the kind of movies that eventually got turned into MST3K episodes, you might be able to finish it. Honestly if the Walking Dead had continued at it's same steady decline in quality this is like what season 38 would be. It is that bad.Those people who give it positive reviews are the people who dug their heels in arguing that Zack Snyder is a director who knows what he's doing. And after all those years they can't admit that they were wrong.There is going to be a director's cut that fills in the major holes in the plot and story, but the damage is done. Watching it with vital information cut out of it for no reason, make it a confusing, jumbled mess of 1/2 ideas with poor execution. Not many will go back and watch what might be a comprehensible film when the longer cut is inevitably released.

title: Visually appealing but empty everywhere else
text: A mish mash of some of the best and some of the worst elements of Kurosawa, Dune, Star Wars, and more. You've seen it all before. It's obvious the great cost that was put into the visual affects and world building...but never quite enough to make the characters compelling or the story believable. Zack Snyder thinks he can build mediocre media without even the foundation the Star Wars and Marvel series'...but well that's his modus operandi isn't it? Like those franchises, the viewer feels as if they are supposed to already know so many things...but in this film...this is it. There's nothing else to know and nothing propping it up.Don't even start with Charlie Hunnam's atrocious Northern Irish accent.

title: Good ideas, but poorly executed
text: The film is surprisingly good until the first 40-50 minutes. After that, it becomes a complete mess.Too many characters, too many plots and too little time to present them correctly. There was an entire universe, so many planets, mythology and history. You simply can't present all of this adequately in 2 hours. It was all very rushed.Kora, Gunnar, Kai, Tarak, Nemesis, Titus, Admiral Noble, the Bloodaxe brothers, the droid... So many characters that you *should* care about, but you don't. I felt unable to empathize with any of them. I didn't even feel sad about a character's death, because... it doesn't make any difference. It's just a random character.I am very disappointed. I really expected more. Maybe Rebel Moon could have worked better if it had been a series, rather than a film. Either way, I believe Part 2 will be better, as it won't be an origin story, like Part 1 was.

title: More than what i expected
text: I was unaware this movie existed till I randomly stumbled into it on Netflix so I came into this with no expectations. Visually this movie did an amazing job. All the landscapes and scenes look nice and crisp. It was a very enjoyable immersive sensation.In terms of storytelling, I like that the main character has a strong background with a moral dilemma and is not heroin who came to power just because of random events that made her better. She struggled and did things like every other person could have.The only negative I can really say about this movie is that I believe the story was very rushed. I believe this might have been decided to explain as much as possible as fast as possible to make the audience understand the situation. I am not aware if this is based on other source material or if this is an original story, but I believe this is the reason they made the first chapter so packed. I am actually interested in where this story goes. This movie did a good job of triggering my imagination and making me want more.But I do believe this series can become more successful, but they are going to have to slow it down a little and do more character development. By the end, besides the main character, I knew very little about the other characters, just a few comments that left me with more questions than answers. I believe there's a lot of potential here if they take the time to develop all the characters and lore. I don't understand all the super-low reviews.

title: Who? Where? What?
text: I didn't see even the trailer for this one, just a random movie watching afternoon's choice, but please give me back about that 1,5 hours of my life which amount of the movie was just cringe, boring and uninteresting.Seriously, how could someone build a movie by not giving any attention to the characters that appear in the story? For real, I don't remember most of the names after I watched the movie.We know only hints about the main guys (the admiral takes like 2 minutes talking about them), why or how they become who they are is also mostly unanswered. No interesting addition whatsoever by the brief scenes when they are assembling the team.The visuals were somewhat OK, but the too many slow motion mid-fight scenes were terrible at times. And why do I have the feeling that some elements are taken from Star Wars?Almost no screen time for about the most (or the only) interesting character, the robot which was voiced by Sir Anthony Hopkins. What a shame.I don't think the second part will save this title...this is the uninteresting version of a galaxy far, far away with a hint of Harry Potter with the crow-headed griffin. Don't sit down watching this if you have any hopes about originality or a nicely built up movie and character development.I give a 4, because the visuals and the music was ok, but a zero for story and the characters. Seriously I think Snyder is well overrated. I'm not on the hype train which are full of loves for 300 or Justice League, though I seriously wanted the latter to be as great as the Avengers, but it wasn't. This one? Not recommended.

title: Unbearable
text: With one cliché after another this movie is a very poor copy of Star Wars and The Magnificent Seven. The amount of bad acting, naive storyline and really poor effects fits this film in the lowest of production categories that there are. The bad guys are of course dressed as Nazis and the good guys are so naive that it is admirable that they are not all wasted in the first part,but will make it to the second. Unless, you are looking for some laughs about how bad the movie production is these days I would certainly advise not to watch this film. I doubt that I will watch the second part, because the ending is quite painful.

title: It's good looking
text:
It's got lens flares and beautiful scenery galore.Sadly that's about the extent of my good things list for this movie.It's a bit over 2hrs of random scenes of dialogue with lots and lots of characters who for the most we know nothing at all about interspersed with slowmo flipping and lens flare actionIt's mostly fun if you have other things to do while you watch.I'm assured that theirs another film hopefully with some follow thru on these characters. I'm also told that there's a Snyder cut that apparently is actually good and isn't randomly thrown together like this mess isWhy if they already were doing a directors Snyder cut wouldn't they just release that? Why have a terrible boring cut?Save yourself 2hrs and just watch the complete Snyder cuts once they're out. It's possible that cut is
just another hour of slow motion montages but maybe he made it a watchable movie.

title: Everybody's a critic
text: Action, sci-fi, some moving moments, good villain, a story that has a hero with a legitimate reason to fight.If you like any or all of those attributes in your movie, then you won't be disappointed. I guess Snyder should be flattered with all the hate, it shows people are watching it.I remember when the 1989 Batman came out, it had a lot of criticism. Read siskel and eiberts review. Point is popular opinion is at times not an accurate measure for grading a movie.As far as copying or inspiration? Most sources borrow there inspiration from something. Case in point John Carter of mars novel is heavily borrowed from, and Time Machine by HG Wells. They are heavily borrowed from since their creation.Bottom line, adventure movies set in space are a cash cow, and I'm here for it.

title: Not sorry I watched it
text: Is it a story that has been told before? Yes. Were parts exceedingly slow? Yes. I was able to fast forward without losing the storyline as the storyline is pretty predictable? It's a movie about people fighting for their freedom.Yes. I agree with most that have said there was little to no character development. There is little that really bonds our hero's together, other than hey I am building this team.In part two, I hope that slow-mo is not used for the action sequences as much as this one.Visually the movie is pretty as was the epic music for the scoring. Acting is well done as I enjoy the work of most of the actors. I found it slightly hilarious that both characters that played Daario in GOT were in this movie. I am guessing from hints of this movie what part two is going to reveal. I will watch part two because I want to know if I am correct or not.

title: The most overhyped director of all times proudly presents...
text: When I saw the eye-catching trailers of Rebel Moon, I was expecting an epic adventure film like Star Wars, Lord of the Rings or Dune, but unfortunately, the result was very disappointing for me. Rebel Moon is a complete disaster in almost every aspect and color grading might be the only redeeming feature of this film. That's why I have no doubt now that Zack Snyder is a terrible director and does not deserve his fame. I wonder how he manages to get involved in big budget productions (maybe he knows someone very important) but this man should never be assigned any work other than mediocre music videos with thousands of unnecessary slow motions.

title: Mr Synder should be embarrassed to have let this out
text: The movie started ok but lots of the characters have no rationals for what they do and the story jumps without explanation from one topic to the next. Why they go to certain places is based on one random characters 'need' to go there but then seems to have no reason to have gone there apart from to allow other character to pick up another character where they risk everything for some stranger for no reason. All I kept saying from that point on was 'what?'.Totally wasted opportunity and not what I expected from Mr Snyder. Very disappointed.m with this. If you want to waste a couple of hours but not be worried about good writing o script then go for it. If you want something that has solid story and character development then avoid like the plague.

title: Inspired but has own identity
text: Rebel Moon has got to be one of the best looking films of the year. The vfx and alien worlds all look spectacular. The lore beneath the surface is itching to come out and explode into all of our faces. There is so much there that it leaves me wanting more. The characters are pretty cool, and the action is of course top notch. I do have issues with the fast pacing and hopefully the directors cut helps with that. And I know we'll know more about the characters later, but still wanted to know more of their back stories in the first part. There is inspiration from a lot of other works (not just Star Wars), but has its own identity and feel. I think this might be one of my favorite films of the year even with its flaws. It was there to mostly set up the universe and the characters. I am excited for more from this universe because by the end I just needed more of it in general. Part 2, the extended cuts, and the comic can't come soon enough!

title: Ugh
text: What a cliché. A CGI mess of a creation with nothing original that hadn't been stolen from other projects. Dialog so contrived you can predict each character's next line in advance. Even the better of an otherwise second rate cast (Anthony Hopkins amongst them) is forced to vomit crappy dialog, and poorly so.10 minutes in, the remaining time left of the story is easy to see coming. It almost feels like a setup for a future video game. The attempt for the scenes to appear "timeless" has viewers needing to reconcile the confusing mashup of 1800's England with some proposed distant future. I hate to be this visceral, but I had high hopes for this.

title: It's simple...this was made by kids for kids using AI
text: Before you get too disappointed, it's the only explanation. This was written by kids, probably using chapGPT, for an audience of kids, and, as mentioned in other reviews, it has a heavy dose of blatant homage to a hodgepodge of multiple sci fi and fantasy predecessors with little in the way of unique or original ideas. It would be one thing if it was advertised as a knockoff or even a spoof (e.g. Spaceballs), but it appears Snyder and the 5th graders didn't tell anyone at Netflix that's what they were up to. If you watch it, the best way to make it through is to try to count all the movies that are referenced in it. Otherwise, you might not make it to the end. To get you started, the obvious ones are Star Wars and...wait for it...Gladiator. All over the map...you know, just like AI would do.

title: "The Dawn of something better"
text:
A new attempt at a Space Opera by revered creator, zack snyder.It tries to tell a story of insurgents uniting to spark a rebellion against a giant Empire.. but this isn't a story! And more of a summary or the boring vignette of one, completely devoid of build-up and payoff. With time-wasting scenes, predictable outcomes seen from miles away, terrible pacing, and formulaic execution in every event. The problem is that it feels SO small, when it wants to be too big. A perfect example of everything wrong with recent cinematic attempts at trying to make something big without a soul.Content-wise there Farmer Land, Japanese Land, Cowboy Land, Coliseum World.. there's not an ounce of creativity to be seen. Either in narrative, alien lifeforms, culture, technology or developments. And the epic-sounding background music has the opposite intended effect! Makes it all seem childish, with generic science fiction out of a Kellogg's box and a stink of unfulfilled grandeur, like a hero's anthem played on kazoo. Then the Battle choreographies are dull and poorly made. I've seen enough to know the overuse of slow motion ruins everything, and the poor direction and camerawork puts the actors and stunt workers to shame. Not to say anyone is charming or endearing. Everyone seems like charisma-vacuums, and the dialogue is almost inconsequential. Oh, and Sofia Boutella should not be screaming her lines.. makes her look like a novice.I didn't particularly enjoy the recent Dune.. but by God does it do things better! There are characters, stakes and tension..
This, on the other hand, is one of the worst pieces of big-budgeted content I've seen in a while! Sad to say this feels like a giant waste of time and money.

title: Watch it - it is being review bombed it's good...
text: This is an excellent new sci- fi franchise and the beginning of something I think will be very popular. It has some great characters and a good plot. I think for some reason it has been review bombed it's easily as good as the original Star Wars and loads better than all the more recent Star Wars movies because it actually has a plot. I also really enjoyed it because there is clearly huge scope for progression of the characters over the course of the two movies and what will hopefully be many more after that.If you need the shot to change every 2 seconds because you have zero attention span then this is not for you but if like a movie which actually has a plot, great characters and imaginative special effects I recommend you watch it!

title: Zack Snyder can do better
text:
And did. After Army of the Dead and The (probably finished) Justice League, I hoped for a similar epic story. But this felt very rushed. Characters who were interesting and fighting scenes which could have been very memorable, were just not worked through.The cast was very well chosen, even though I missed a bit more alien life. We are introduced into a universe full of it, but all alien characters only played minor unimportant roles.The most interesting character for me was Jimmy the AI robot. But even he had just a little part.This seems like another Justice League situation. Rushed.But this time there is no good reason, but rather the industry simply being what it is. I am sure if it had been up to Snyder, the movie would have taken a few months more to come out, but it would have been the epic Space Opera his fans were hoping for. This movie though is just a lot of wasted potential.Sad
I am waiting for the Snyder Cut with hope.

title: So formula
text: Impressive graphics and a great looking SciFi film but a truely second rate plot. I would not have been surprised to find this had been written in a creative writing class for 15 year olds who have a thing for SciFi.Thinly veiled elements from the Seven Samurai, the wild west, Star Wars (everywhere), the collecting together of the magnificent 7, a baddy you can recognise fron a dozen films and an Emperor straight fron, you guessed it, Star Wars. It doesn't help that they tell you straight up there is no end to this film by naming it part one with part two not out for several months. I won't be waiting with baited breath no matter how good the effects are.

title: A Derivative and Uninspired Seven Samurai
text: I went in with low expectations for this movie, and I was still disappointed.Rebel moon is a retelling of the original Seven samurai, but is probably the weakest iteration I have ever seen.The movie has Snyder's signature clunky dialogue which feels unnatural in some scenes.The characters felt underutilized and underdeveloped almost as if they cut some of their scenes.The actions scenes we do get are not exciting at all, the combination of unnecessary slow motion, stylistic fighting and unpolished special effects makes the scenes lose any weight or intensity.The scenes also felt like they have been directly lifted from other popular movies and the characters felt like they were recruited from them as well.To add to this is probably the least intimidating background villain who's only there for a few scenes.Overall the lack of character development, weak story and originality makes this something I would avoid watching. This also makes me want to skip the sequel if the quality is gonna be the same.

title: Haters gonna hate
text: I enjoyed the movie. All the tropes are classic hence brief hero introduction is sufficient. I see also no reason for hating other peoples motivation to join the team since they're enslaved/drunk/lost absolutely everything and would die for any chance of redemption. Actors are good and most of the character development for secondary characters I expect to happen in a second part of the movie. This one was focused on Gunner which is logical. Costumes excellently matched characters and visuals are stunning.I am also extremely happy to see a new high budget sci-fi movie being released instead of making 10th sequel/prequel of established franchise.

title: Lacking identity.
text: I was simply disappointed. For a film with plenty of potential to build a new franchise, a new journey, it just seemed to borrow from to many other story lines, like a rehash of stories told one hundred times before. Charlie Hunnams awful attempt at a northern Irish accent was completely unnecessary and added nothing to his character. So many other characters were lacking in any kind of individuality. Like they were just there to fill a gap in the story. Ultimately it felt like a movie lost in its own self importance and hype that just left me feeling underwhelmed and disappointed. Not Zach Snyders finest moment.by any stretch of the imagination.

title: Rebel Moon -- A star wars story
text: As everybody knows, this was a movie that Snyder want to make as part of Star Wars. Although that didn't happen, Star Wars is written allover this movie, they just changed the bad guys name and ambience.Some cool visuals, some nice battles, some slow-motion and that's it. No originality whatsoever, a story that we have seen before, the sequence of forming some kind of misfits that we have seen before , the evil empire that we have seen before and generally I get why this was rejected from the star wars universe in the first place.I forgot to mention that it is also boring -- therefore if you are looking for a nice sci-fi film, please look elsewhere.

title: Disappointed, but not surprised
text: So I've watched Rebel Moon,as I figure I can't talk about it without watching it and I'm not a fan of Snyder's work. Went in open minded though.Looks great, lovely cinematography and FX. However the story is a poor and lazy rehash of Seven Samurai/Magnificent 7, and The Mandalorian did that better, in one of its poorer episodes & in 45 minutes!The Star Wars influences are so blatant they can't even be called Easter Eggs, but there's none of the connection with the characters here that you get from that franchise. Characters are 2 dimensional, and their motives, not so much transparent, but written in sharpie on their foreheads!While the FX & costume/production design is good, what was going on with The Big Bad's beard at the end! Looked the worst stick on beard!Disappointed, but not surprised.The #StarWars influences are so blatant they can't even be called Easter Eggs, but there's none of the connection with the characters here that you get from that franchise.While the FX & costume/production design is good, what was going on with The Big Bad's beard at the end!

title: Zack has done it once again!
text: The movie opens wonderfully with great visuals all throughout, I found myself impressed on multiple occasions with the visual aspect of this film! To me the story flows amicably getting to where we know the story will go. Zack is a master of action and the use of slow motion always adds more depth to the scenes. There were times I found myself angry, sad, and excited as the story will pull you in many different directions. Ray Fisher shined and really showed his ability to bring emotion to the screen. The movie feels as big as I hoped it would, Zack did a great job of making you feel immersed in the universe. I'm really looking forward to the R-rated director's cut. And I'm excited for Part 2!

title: Boring. Next.
text: I'll start with this: after you watch the teasers for this movie, lower your expectations. And then lower them some more.I had high hopes for this movie given Zack Snyder's track record with action and superhero films but this one is out of his grasp. Just like the Star Wars franchise falls from grace, so does this strange ensemble of scenes that were slapped together to make this a so-called movie. At first glance, the casting is appealing but I'm not sure this movie did anyone any favors (aside from pushing them to get ripped so they at least look good on screen). The story and movie itself lacked depth and was overall just weak. It's almost like they sat in a room and said "so we've done 50 shades of Star Wars, Divergent, Game of Thrones, The Avengers, but what if we try to combine themes from each series and then pepper in some Fifth Element vibes?!" Also, the fight sequences were terrible. Don't get me wrong, I know it's all fiction, but the reaction time during fight scenes was so unbelievable and the major fight scenes were all borrowed from other movies.I'm sure there is certain pressure to bring "the next best thing" to our screens when it comes to sci-fi/fantasy film and space opera but this ain't it. And it certainly doesn't make me eager to watch part 2. Zack Snyder needs to take a seat, sit back, and chill on this one.Conclusion: go watch Dune. It has substance and depth, superior casting, better acting, and fantastic cinematography.

title: Largely predictable
text: It was a decent movie but predictable. This isn't a Star Wars knock off anymore than the current below average Star Wars content is a knockoff of history and the stories that came before itCredit that this story line is at least its own story, not a piggy back off anything else. Original characters and story line. The character backstory and development was nice to have for once and the directly did a docent job weaving their stories together for the overall story but without giving you every detail of each character, just enough to allow the viewer to understand each's interest being part of the story.The biggest ding is the female lead. Not because a woman is the lead but rather how unbelievable this character is. Hollywood is really doubling down is trying to make everyone believe that an average height women who is 100lbs soaking wet with clothes on can physically dominate and beat down every man twice her size with minimal effort despite the man's training, superior strength and size.But the director couldn't stop there in the name of DEI. You have to have a sob story from every ethnic group character required to qualify this as a "diverse" movie to make this "good guy" team of misfits unstoppable.
