This powerfully diverse group of misfits uniting through struggles to be like a sci-fi Avenger team to challenge the all powerful, and purely white skinned, elite "evil" autocratic government aimed at stripping all worlds of freedom and resources. The usual annoying and incompetent drone of activists to parallel modern society who just repeat brainless electric without thought.If the female lead was believable in her prowess this movie would be easier to stomach, even with the usual droll social activism forced into the movie. This story concept has potential to be so much more than this movie gave us.

title: What were they thinking?
text: The look and feel of the movie is a bit of a star wars knock-off. It also reminded me of seven samurai. A few knights that wanted to defend a village.Contrary to that last movie the plot twists don't make sens at all. Every character in the movie, except maybe for the main villain (who was also a stereotype, but less non-sensical and with some unexpected twists), is completely flat and uninteresting. They read their script lines, but I don't understand why, nor do I care. They also seem to have deep revelations or feel deep emotions for no particular reason. I find it hard to comment on the acting, because the background story and lines of each character were both so cliche and non-senscial, that I didn't feel any empathy for any of therm.Another problem is that the plot feels like a train. No matter how a scenes is played out, they continue to the next piece of story, without any logic. A great army and a large ship is suddenly defeated by 20 people. Nobody blinks an eye when those 20 people are going to defend a small village from a war-ship the size of a large city.On a positive note: I found some of the visuals were quite good. I just wonder why nobody created a consistent script before they starting filiming.

title: 8 times better than Guardians of Galaxy
text: Don't believe the negative reviews !!! I said that, because for almost all the movies I read the reviews before, but this is not the case.The trailer leaves space for another other scenes so if you really are a fan of sci-fi movies, take a bucket of popcorn and prepare to be surpised.The special effects are of high quality, the action is well dosed and the story is not bad at all.Indeed, it borrows some scenes that can also be found in Star Wars, but this is definitely not a movie in which you will fall asleep or get bored.And the second part is not far at all! As I said: 8 times better than Guardians.

title: I tried - but cannot finish this
text: My expectation is a little above average when I see Zack Snyder directing this one. I just want a good- or maybe an acceptable scifi where the story is built upon some original ideas about a world that differs from ours. And I tried so badly to finish this, but I cant. Every scenes, dialogues, acting, facial expression, all the stories - is just fake and forceful. I dont mind the borrowed details in space ships, Buckbeak, worlds, conflicts, rebel etc., but it is important to create a convincing story. A small village in a small planet, how can they convince others to join them? Why should they care? What is the idea to defend with all lives?

title: Such a disappointment
text: Rebel Moon. Jyn Erso...er, I mean Kora (not the Avatar) brings together a band of fighters to start a rebellion (even though there is already a larger, better equipped, and better organized rebellion already started) against the evil Mother World with, I dunno, a series of high Charisma rolls. That's the only way to explain how she is able to convince all these people to come fight for her adopted farming village. It's Star Wars (of course, this was meant to be Zack Snyder's Star Wars entry) meets Seven Samurai.The good: Sofia Boutella (Kora) has decent screen presence. The smoky stand-ins for lightsabers are pretty cool. Charlie Hunnam is engaging as smugger/thief/whatever he's supposed to be Kai. Ed Skrien's Admiral Atticus Noble is effective as a much more brutal and competent version of General Hux.The bad: Kinda everything else. The effects are Star Wars on a Serenity budget but it's too bad they didn't have a Joss Whedon-caliber writer. Most of the characters get only the most basic introductions. Kora's imploring speeches to convince them are short and unconvincing. Everything feels rushed and half-done. And oh my god So. Much. Slow. Motion. I almost gave up during the first fight scene.I really really wanted to like this movie. I really really didn't.

title: Waste of such potential
text: This movie clearly had access to ample funds, evident from the numerous stunning locations and impressive visual effects (although the use of slow-motion appears somewhat outdated). It introduces potentially interesting characters, races, and planets, offering viewers a glimpse of its visual brilliance.However, the movie falls short in terms of storytelling. The characters come across as overly simplistic, primitive, and unengaging. The dialogue lacks depth and sophistication, often feeling overly straightforward. Also, we have seen this plot many, many, many other times. Why on earth would you do this basic plot again in a completely new universe?It is also feels like there were not enough time to show characters or develop them somehow. Mostly you get half minute preview and that's it, no backstory or any depth and they already in the team.I would eagerly anticipate a second installment with a fresh narrative team, as the current movie struggles to engage the audience beyond its captivating visuals. It falls short in delivering a compelling story.The whole premise of this movie is ambitious and certainly have potential, but it is not delivered well.

title: Patience & Depth
text: Anytime you're going to start a new universe & characters, it should take time & it should be thorough. This was expected on my part, when I heard that they are making a Part 2 right behind it. Honestly, I liked it for the depth it had in building up the characters.The general public, however, doesn't have the patience for movies w/ depth any longer it would seem. These are the same people that have Google & Amazon at their finger tips to give that immediate shot of dopamine that they need so quickly.Personally, I really liked the movie. Was it the greatest movie ever made? No, it wasn't. But that because it's leading to something larger.Synder wasn't going to make the same mistake that the production company/DC comics forced him to make in the DC universe. They forced him to fast track into Justice League. He wanted a 2nd Man of Steel, a stand-alone Aquaman, a stand-alone Batman... all before the Justice League came out. DC had other plans because they were so desperate to keep up with Marvel & they rushed it, it was slammed together too quickly & it failed. Somehow, that was Synders fault.I believe he is trying to do the opposite with Rebel Moon. Depth in characters, build-up, universe building, & it was a good production. I just hope I'm proven right in Part 2 because I do like the idea of the universe he's trying to build.Lastly, I think it might have made a GREAT 10 episode miniseries, instead of 2 movies... But I haven't seen Part 2 yet. So, I'll wait to judge.

title: Boring space opera trying to be epic
text: Zack Snyder has managed to surprise us with great cinematographic pieces such as 300, Watchmen and Justice League, but he's far from being an infallible filmmaker, as he has also known pronounced setbacks, which unfortunately he himself seems to omit and forget, believing himself to be a director of a category that is not. Part one of Rebel Moon is presented as an epic piece of science fiction, worthy of a giant awards shelf, but it isn't. It has almost absurd flaws for a million-dollar production and under the names it supports.Starting from the script, there are too many narratives to present characters, situations and events. The most basic and easiest way to tell a story. A shameless shortcut by Snyder and his team of writers. There are conveniences and inconsistencies. And let's address the elephant in the room. There are many similarities with Star Wars. Understanding the story behind the scenes, these similarities could have been reduced, but it was decided to make a cheap copy of the Lucas film intergalactic saga.In terms of editing and photography, there is an excess of slow motion. It's understood that it's part of Snyder's rubric, but it's really an excess of this resource. The lighting is irritating. They shine spotlights in your face all the time. They saturate you with frames full of light sources, some even meaningless.Moving on to the performances... poor, flat, soulless, lacking enthusiasm. None of the actors convince in their roles. I even think that putting Anthony Hopkins' voice behind an android was a mistake, since it's very far from being something that fits together.Now, not everything is terrible. The film is not a disaster as critics want to make it out to be, despite what you have read so far in this review. The action is entertaining, the battles are captivating, the production design is a good element, the visual effects are not like those of Marvel, although they are not like those of The Creator or Dune.I hope that Snyder knows how to fix his shortcomings for the second part to be released this coming year in 2024.PS: We need more blood!!!

title: Really must try harder
text: This movie though visually stunning is just directionless and weak. The plot line shamelessly and blatantly steals elements from a host of much better and more coherent movies.Zack Snyder should stick to flipping burgers instead of churning out this unimaginative garbage. Even the sound effects used are formulaic and derivative.I feel I haven't done the film justice by generously giving it 4 out of 10, it deserved less.The acting isn't too bad (except for Charlie Hunnam's shocking Irish accent) but I felt in some cases the actors were dissociated from the story they were trying to convey.

title: Such a disappointment from Zack Snyder
text: You can't have 300 with a sci-fi twist sorry. It's better to keep doing what you are good at. And thats my message to Zack Snyder.The movie wasn't up to expectations and am tired of seeing women heroes recently because by logic and its against human nature.Been waiting for this movie for so long but at the end it ended up with wasting my time, I believe in zack Snyder talent, he just have to do what he have been doing and whats he's good at (zombie movies, super hero movies, war movies). There were good scenes with Zack Snyder touch in the movie but the movie in general was not up to expectations thats all.

title: Don't waste your time
text: Do not waste your time, this is the worst movie of 2024. The only good thing about this movie is that the Dutch actors character is making money of both sides of the war.Luckily this movie is made now, because in a couple years time this could be a massive plagiarism claim. Nothing in the movie is original, it is like they asked AI to write a movie based on all existing sci-fi movies. Only the AI is programmed by a first year student with a hangover, so all the storylines are messed up. More then 2 hours full of nothings, not even a logical goal of any kind.The visual effects are good, but I hope the artists are payed beforehand because royalties will not cut it by this movie.

title: The charm of sci fi movies circa 2000
text: Sure, it's not a masterpiece, nor something that i will remember in 10 years.Sure, i could write a lengthy review about everything wrong with this movie.But i like this movie a lot all the same.It has the charm, the vibe, the smell, of the cheesy action sci fi movies of the early 2000s. It reminds me of the 2000 Pitch black and other subsequent Riddick movies, of Princess of Mars and subsequent John Carter movies. From the scenario to the way its filmed via the way its acted via the sound, this movie is an addition to an old school sci fi fantasy sub genre that certainly won't please most, but will still please many fans of sci fi.It reminds me of dusty 80's sci fi fantasy books you dig out at the back of a barely surviving bookshop, it has a style that nobody uses nowadays, it's nothing you haven't already seen before, but it's still an entertaining read.It transported me to another world and it made me smile.Just because it's not among the "best" doesn't mean it's not enjoyable all the same.

title: What a crappy movie
text: I once thought that Zack Snyder was a interesting director. He made really good movies like 300 and Watchmen. But now he has descended to the Uwe Boll level, and even Uwe Boll knows how to put more story and originality in his movies. The fact that this was once a pitch for a Star Wars movie made me curious. The management at Disney was very wise not to give this guy any money, Netflix was less sensible. What a lame movie, without any original idea. Seven Samurai is reduced to an incredible simple story without any tension, the warriors never really hesitate to join the team. Al little chat, a stupid ride on a imitation buckbeat and they join. Normally fine actors are not challenged at any time and act completely without inspiration. The CGI is incredibly ugly and nowhere the movie gets exciting. An idiotically weak and never impressive or scary enemy. This is really sad and should not be compared with masterpieces as Star Wars, Seven Samurai and Dune. If you want to compare it, compare it with Jupiter Ascending and Battlefield Earth, also utter crap. I really don't get how people can like this. This is more content then a real movie. What a money waste.

title: Cringle cliché with single-dimensional characters
text: Cringle cliché with single-dimensional characters. I know what there is no original art any more - everyone is inspired by other previous works but this movie is a bit like: take a bit of Star Wars, Random Western, Seven Samurai, Space Nazis and sprinkle some 2023 on it (for the added cringe) and then dumb it down with 50 IQ points. It is also very long, doesn't worth your time. It's a shame, because we really need some epic Sci-Fi universe where we can have multiple movies with an epic storyline and good characters. The CGI quality varies, sometimes it's epic and sometimes it looks like an MS-DOS computer game from 1995.

title: Rebel Moon: A Cosmic Letdown
text: "Rebel Moon" shoots for the stars with flashy visuals, but the story gets lost in space. Zack Snyder's cool effects and hero scenes can't save it from a slow, crowded plot.The story drags, and there are too many characters with no time to get to know them. The movie rushes through world-building, making it hard to care about what's happening. Even with great visuals, the pacing is off, leaving you disconnected.Acting feels fake, artificial, with overacted poses and gestures that don't help.There's also the usual Hollywood agenda message there, from beginning to the end. I won't get into details about this, probably there are already videos on this subject.The ending is a miss. You won't care about what the characters did achieve or didn't, if they are betrayed, who lives or dies in the process. "Rebel Moon" aims high but falls short of being the epic space adventure it wants to be.

title: Very enjoyable... but not without flaws
text: Rebel Moon: ACOF, In my opinion was well worth watching. Snyder does a very good job of building a beautiful and believable worlds for Rebel Moon's set pieces despite perhaps a lower CGI and on location shooting.The movie also seems very well cast, major kudos to Sofia Boutella for presenting a very likable and intriguing hero. The rest of the cast are very good and believable in their respective roles with an additional standout performance by Ed Skrein as the main villan of the movie.Unlike a few other movies I have seen that seem to go on forever with needless filler, I would say that Rebel moon would have benefited from a longer run time. I am looking forward to the next installment. This is quality scifi.

title: Disappointed at infinitum
text: I wanted to like it. But it was so boring, uninteresting, cliché, lazy script, a festival of VFX and out of place slow mo. An amalgamation of stories and characters, mythology that don't stick together at all.All characters are plain and you don't care at all about them. The fact that the best part of the movie is the robot that is only 5 minutes in screen says a lot.I can't believe I am saying this but it is worse than SW 9 the Return of Palpatine. And that's a very low bar.Definitely this is a movie that looks like it was written by a 12 years old stealing ideas from several sci fi and fantasy he saw.So disappointed in Snyder.

title: Unbiased and honest opinion
text: First of all i want to say love sci fi movies , truly madly deeply . They allow the viewer to escape even for a brief moment from the daily routine . To dream of magical worlds in space where anything you could think of could happen . So my question is what happend ? The people around Zack who saw the movie , advised or helped didn't say anything ? I would have loved to be an advisor on this movie or the last person to see the movie before being released . I would have given an honest opinion !!!I went into this movie without reading reviews or spoilers.There is no cohesion in the plot , the characters are like loose treads on a sweater and the have some really great actors .But you can't even try to connect to them or the story , it's all flat ! My guess is and i don't mean any disrespect to anyone involved , the problem is the script . There is no feeling in it , no humanity , no soul , nothing .I felt more from The Creator , shed a few tears , i felt something and it's not about the robots or A. I. but feels like more thought was put in it and its not the best movie i've seen , far from it . I would give that a 5/10.I also feels rushed , the development of the characters could have been so much better , sometimes less is more but not here !To make a small suggestion look at Dune (2021) , forget about the plot of both movies for a second and look at the development . I could say more , but whats the point ?!!Feels like were just filing a quota of plot points .I'm not gonna watch part 2 if its the same clipboard check-in.I don't leave reviews this is my first , it had so much potential but was lost in translation . Feels bad !

title: When you buy Star Wars on Wish
text:
A truly awful film. So disappointing considering the director.Acting, storyline was grim at best.The trailer looked like a lavish sci fi epic but apart from the special effects it delivered nothing more than a budget b movie...
There are a number of scenes in which the acting was so bad it even felt like the actors were having an out of body experience... Choosing to have multiple accents Irish English etc was weird at best I know the Irish diaspora had a far reach but was unaware it stretched to a Galaxy far far away.The worst thing is there's a second part... Do yourself a favour and avoid.

title: Not really worth your time
text: I found this so absolutely unimaginative and the acting for the most part was terrible.Some nice looking people in it, but nothing to waste your time on.I tried to finish it about 3 times and gave up because it was stupid to a fault.Quite disappointing overall. I really have not much else to say about it.I was bored with the plot. Charlie's acting was surprisingly awful.If you are into sci-fi then you may or may not like this. It isn't good by any standards, but that is just my opinion and it is long as well.Too much time spent on trying to get through this hoping it would be better. Time I can't get back.

title: Great fun!
text: A fun story, with brilliant visuals. Like most sci-fi it has lots of recognizable influences, many are obvious, and clearly is 'seven samurai in space'. That said, if you want a bit of fun, don't take it too seriously and just enjoy sitting back and watching a film where clearly lots of passion has been put in then look no further.Only a few small things I didn't like, a few scenes longer than they needed to be, and one terrible accent but so be it.I was nearly put off watching it form seeing many terrible reviews and I honestly think some people have just missed the point of entertainment. I'm far from a Snyder fan but I can't wait to see the next one and hope he does more.

title: How does this director still get funding
text: A script that perhaps more than any other, confirms AI are deep seated in the writing process, desperately unoriginal and dripping with cliches.Have an honest look back at his CV and one thing becomes vividly apparent, Epic Film wannabeism that has not nor likely ever will quite make it.And this even after riding the wave of SuperHero populism these past decade and a half, that thankfully appears to be finally waning.Rebel Moon Part I appears to be attempting to blend the western with the space hopper tale, and while careful character development is to be applauded with any project managing not to do so for so long really takes non-talent.

title: Watch it for the SFX not the story...
text: Two words: A Re-tread.Been there, done that.If 300, Matrix, Ridrick, Star Wars and Dune (both 1984 and 2021) had some progeny, this would be it.I was looking forward to another Space Opera that was not Star Trek or Star Wars.The movie had potential, but fell flatter than Coyote being hit by an anvil.It had no originality. The same old tropes (mystery backstories, evil empire vs agrarian societies, dude with plugs, strange aliens, etc) with very stiff acting and a threadbare story. Only the SFX were the redeeming value.Wonder if Part Ii is any better?Based on the trailer, I sincerely doubt it.The question I had, why tje heck was this released in the fall? Makes a much better summer blockbuster.

title: Man, people are miserable
text: I don't understand the hate this movie is getting. Feels like a lot of these people had already decided they would hate it before watching it. Others can't comprehend that movie concepts CAN be done again and it isn't a mortal sin.Rebel moon is an exciting new universe with some fun characters and worlds (and some aweosme weapons!!) I loved some of the "nods" to Star Wars, especially the cantina like bar with the crazy different creatures.People, lighten up a bit. Enjoy the show. Maybe don't focus on comparing it to other things and just watch it for what it is.I thoroughly enjoyed it and am looking forward to part 2!

title: Truly terrible. Make it stop.
text: I usually don't write reviews for movies I don't like. But on the off-chance that this saves someone else from spending two hours on nonsense, here goes...The movie: essentially whatever footage was left over from making the trailer.The story: a vaguely plot-shaped device on which to hang visual effects and cool makeup/costumesThe plot: 70% nonsense, 15% good ideas borrowed from elsewhere (Harry Potter, the Matrix, Foundation series among others.) Yes, I'm aware that only adds up to 85% and therein lies my point.The dialogue: feels like it was written by ChatGPT, then put into Google translate, translated into another language (pick any), then translated back to English - one imagines to make it sound more interesting/complicated/epic.The effects, costumes & general aesthetic: absolutely killer, like actually insane. From an aesthetic perspective, it's exquisite. Hence, 2 stars (you can't score less than one, the second is for the aesthetic.)My advice: put it on mute, turn off the closed captions and let it be a beautiful background noise while you invest two hours in something else more worthwhile, like Tetris, trying to teach your dog another language, alphabetizing your socks or vacuuming your Roomba.

title: Who is the rebel moon. Gotta find the rebel moon.
text: I went in with zero expectations. I'd read reviews both positive and negative and decided to go in with low to no expectations, similarly to how I approached valerian and the city with tons of planets or whatever.It's mid. Like an ice cold cheap beer at a party you don't want to be at.Good stuff: loads of cool looking stuff like alien designs and some of the action is cool. The attempt at world building is there, the potential for lore is great.Guns are cool.Weird stuff: there's no blood or gore? Feels like it's really missing that. Especially with any hand to hand stuff?Ol Zack attack with his slow mo. So. Much. Slow mo. Fun drinking game I suppose.I seen an interview with Charlie hunam where he says he wanted to do an accent, so he chose to do this. He decided to do it. He certainly attempts something. He's definitely met someone who briefly lived in Ireland once.Everyone with the exception of 2 characters hair is dumb.Bad stuff: the script is not great.No character interacts outside of their introduction scene it's bizarre. Where a movie like expendables does so much in the plane on the way to the mission bonding it becomes tedious, rebel moon does the reverse. All of these characters are strangers to each other from what we see.I've already seen calls to "release the snyder cut" I'd be more forgiving of this if it was the first time. But ALL of Zack attacks movies go this way. Even the beloved Watchmen has a million different cuts. I get there is studio interference and stuff has to be cut out to get run time down and hundreds of other reasons why a film is edited the way it is. THAT BEING SAID this was supposed to be his free reign. Free of constraints, his movie his way.This is the Snyder cut.It didn't go to cinema it went to streaming. The Irishman was a million years long and netflix was fine with that? So not sure what the holy directors cut has to offer and yes I watched the directors cut of BVS and justice league both are still a mess.I'll watch another one for sure, am strapped in and want to see where it goes. It's nice to see a new property that's not connected to the Disney collection.Despite what others may have said it's not unwatchable just turn your brain off, accept the flaws and look at the pretty slow mo and the not lightsaber lightsaber.

title: Seems bad, low budget, seen a thousand times
text: I watched it because it was advertised as a new Star Wars and stopped watching after 30 minutes because it was just bad.It started like a low budget pilot for a series or video game, some vague narrative and we watch the life of a small community somewhere on a planet. Then the nazis come (seriously, a nazi outfit in a sci-fi movie? Ed Skrein again in a sadistic character, haven't we seen that a thousand times?) and ask for harvest they can't produce. Free violence that doesn't help the story. Top of that a robot design directly copied from the anime Jujutsu Kaisen (because we wouldn't notice?).I just couldn't watch it anymore, so many clichés, no storytelling abilities whatsoever. Maybe teenagers should go back to books, if they're interested in SF. Better way of spending time...

title: Are you all insane? So bad.
text: Which dreamy hunk to pick? We have mastered interstellar travel but we need bushels, gonna beat your simple chief no one going to even bat an eye. This is written by someone who has mental health issues. I stopped watching it because I was scared of how stupid it was going to get. Why does a review need to contain 600 hundred characters? So real people don't waste their time. How to explain how the film industry pumps out garbage. Snyder has talent but I'm sure he was hamstrung by corporate executives and bottom dollar. But he also seems like a director who has little human contact at all. Every thing seems very fake.

title: Someone should stop Zack Snyder for continuing delivering this crap.
text: The whole movie is just senseless. It feels self righteous and trying to mix a full of good ideas from other good cinematographic universes and films. A movie is not just some interesting characters and cool effects. There could be something worth to dig underneath, but I'll take a guess and the writer and producer is the problem. The plot is ridiculous, there is nothing believable in how the story grows, the motivation of the characters and it ends up just being a collection of ideas trying to make it look like there is something worth the time if the viewer. Zack Znyder does it again and delivers just a rip off.

title: A Turd in Slow Motion
text: Rebel Moon is a tedious slog devoid of any original ideas. That Disney rejected this as a potential Star Wars trilogy shines through as little to no effort has been made to make Rebel Moon feel like it wasn't intended to be part of the Star Wars universe. Furthermore, the plot is pretty much a direct copy of Seven Samurai with elements from the likes of Dune thrown in for good measure.I could forgive this if the film was actually good fun but it isn't. This is just a slow, bloated mess with a terrible script and non-existent character development. The cast do their best to try make their characters seem interesting but they are given so little to work with that it is impossible to elevate them to levels that you would have any interest in what happens to them. Snyder has already leapt to the defence of the film saying that his director cuts are always better but maybe he should take a step back and wonder why directors such as Nolan and Villeneuve can tell far more complex stories in a two and a half hour run time whilst Snyder needs four hours just to tell a slightly above basic story. It's time he realised his talent lies in making basic action films. There's nothing wrong with that.Moments of Snyder's eye for visual flare and exciting action sequences to sneak through but these are lost in what has now become his signature overuse of slow mo. Even the best action sequences will soon have you rolling your eyes as another needless slo-mo shot takes over. And Snyder hasn't just limited slo-mo to the action sequences. Oh no, we're even treated to characters turning their head in slow motion. I'm sure he thinks it looks dramatic. It doesn't.Thanks to the existence of the cinematic travesties that are Sucker Punch and Batman V Superman, Rebel Moon just about manages not to be Snyder's worst film but it isn't far off and should only be watched as an example of how not to make a movie. It really is a turd in slow motion.

title: Zack Snyder's new space opera with a too lukewarm start
text: Rebel Moon is Zack Snyder's new work that tries to offer a space opera story in the style of Star Wars and Dune. You can notice a certain resemblance to Star Wars because it was originally planned as an installment of the franchise created by George Lucas, but aimed at a more mature audience. Snyder chose to try to create his own story in hopes of starting a new franchise. The film has that visual style that Snyder always uses and an air of an epic story taken from Greek myths. It has good sequences, good special effects and a great soundtrack by Junkie XL. The weak point that this film has is the script due to its questionable writing.The film is only the first part of this story that is currently divided into 2 parts, but Snyder hopes that this will be the beginning of a new franchise with a universe that can be expanded through different means. This being the case, this movie would be only episode 1, but it starts this story in a way that is too slow and unexciting. It has a good story, but the way it is introduced doesn't generate much attraction or excitement. It presents the characters directly, without fully knowing them or knowing what their motivations are, except for a few winks. That makes it difficult to connect with the characters. Kora is the only one who can be known a little in depth because of how they show her past. It is clear that there are more things that needed to be explored or explained that Snyder perhaps decided to reserve for later or were left in the original cut of the film, since the released version is a PG-13 rated cut.Apart from using Star Wars as inspiration, Snyder also decided to base himself on some works by Akira Kurosawa and the one that can be most noticeable in the plot is The Seven Samurai. It is curious that Snyder's narrative level has dropped, because his previous films, from 300 and Watchmen to the extended version of Justice League, had better narrative development. It seems like that started to decline since Army Of The Dead. After having been in charge of the DC Comics universe, Snyder now wants to create his own franchise and hopes to get it with this new proposal.Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child Of Fire has something interesting to tell, but it's too lukewarm a start to this new intergalactic adventure. My final rating for this movie is an 8/10.

title: Cliche versus Trope.
text: I hope not to repeat what other reviews have already touched on. Zack Snyder can, and does, make entertaining films, or at least, if the film is too kong and doesn't hold a cohesive story of interest, he gives us entertaining moments, and even things to think upon in character dialogue. Here, it is stated that Snyder borrows a lot from other sources, including other films, but his imagery of the Imperium strong-arming the farmers, and the outfits of the officers, is very reminiscent of Nazi Germany. The world-building is indepth and the execution goes back-and-forth between dramatic intensity to drawn out dialogue. Is it western, space opera, sci-fi, fantasy, etc? No matter, it can work. Where it fails for me, is that all the bad guys, the most vile, the abusive and rapey, are all white men, even a pig-faced perv at a bar. A galaxy far away is so different than Earth that the human tendency to conquer and garner power, assault inferiors, is subject to a demographic. In addition, a woman trained under the Imperium, is able to destroy a whole Imperium military unit of men, though her backstory is that she has no special powers or abilities different from them. This is a common Hollywood trope, for decades, amplified with Disney and Marvel and so forth, to present women as powerhouses, creating a standard of elitism that neither man nor woman can keep up with. This also hurts the main character's personality: she is bitter to be around, depressing, monotone, and a harbinger of justice and revenge that that doesn't age well even after a few hours.

title: Such a disappointment.
text:
Does Zac thinks we are just stupid?Quick review:
Started out interesting. Became unbelievable. My suspension of disbelief shattered with the same boring plot.....
1) Leader of small village disagrees with over whelming (as in battle ship vs canoe) force. Like anyone ever really does that?2) 2 of a platoon of solders are psyco and threaten their own men. Thusly a world conquering army has no effective chain of command. Uh huh
3) Basically the bad plot of every 'c' or 'd' movie you've ever heard of.I quit at that point since it became unbelievable. My point? Absolutely no one team that acts that way survives let alone become world conquering.

title: Felt like it was unfinished
text: It was decent to start with & had a bunch of good points throughout it. But really felt like an unfinished movie that had a lot left out because of its inclusive rating.Part way through it started to feel like it was pushed towards young teens who need fast pacing and lots going on, even if the story is left unfinished / characters aren't fleshed out.Not often do I get to a point in a movie where I just don't really care about what's happening anymore.Visuals & sound were very good though (watching with Atmos & Projector).Checked again before reviewing today & found there is going to be a full cut of the movie as well. (director / snyder cut) that is higher rated. Hopefully it has the same quality improvements overall like Justice League did (but not the annoying 4:3 aspect ratio). As that was a massive improvement on the theater release (which was as bad as this movie).

title: Difficult to find something good in this one
text: Movie is terrible. CGI is a disaster. Looks almost a theatre background. Terrible actors. Poor script. Nothing new. It is difficult to believe a director of this level made such a movie school level. As I said Difficult to find something good in this one. The main character is totally contradictory with her background. Too many clichés sentences. In general the movie is boring. I dotn know if I will see the second one. Netflix got a very bad deal for this one. Trying to think in a single thing a could say I liked but there is none. I will say it enter in my 20 worse movie list for sure. . . . .

title: Zack Snyder in Space
text: Listen, I'm a huge fan of Zack Snyder and his visual storytelling abilities. With that being said, let let me lay this out for you, as unbiased as I can.If you like Snyder's stuff, you're going to like Rebel Moon. The Slow-Mo is about as prevalent as it's ever been in a Snyder flick, there's interesting world design, in the sense that it leaves you wanting to know more about each of the world's the rebels visit, they're all very unique.The fight scenes are visually interesting and you don't have to worry about the shaky jump cuts that plague a lot of action films. The movie itself visually stunning throughout(outside of the CGI in one scene, you'll know the one). The movie looks its best in the first act, Veldt is beautiful and the overall aesthetic of the film might be my favorite of any Snyder movie to date.The cast is great, although the majority of the team doesn't have enough to do (more on that later). Boutella, Hunnam, and Fisher carry the day.If you don't like Snyder, there's not enough here to change your mind, largely for the reasons you'd think.It's definitely a part 1 film that doubles as an "assemble the team" film. So don't expect Casablanca in terms of story. Lots of exposition, but again, it's all interesting.Act 2 is definitely rushed, sacrificing getting to know the characters in favor of moving the story along. I imagine this is where the director's cut will come in and fix some of these issues, along with the pacing.All in all, I saw enough that it left me wanting more, which is the most important thing a part 1 movie can do.

title: Perhaps the most derivative thing I've ever watched.
text: The story, the characters, the individual scenes and even the shots within the scene have all been lifted from somewhere else. Does the writer and director think that no one has ever watch Star Wars E,4?!?!That said, its watchable and there are some good moments and scenes but the plot holes are Star Destroyer sized. I mostly sat there identifying where scenes and shots were lifted from other movies.Production values are terrific and there is an abundance of eye candy of all sorts. It all gets a bit jerky and comes off the rails when you recognize the director is copying from How to Train Your Dragon, mixed with a bit of Game of Thrones.The super human female combatant trope is getting a bit old and Snyder goes for more than one here. Sadly the introduction of the Nemesis character feels awkward and pointless and to put. Hounsou's character in a gladatorial setting for his introduction was a bit too on the nose.But hey, if you like Joseph Campbell's Hero's Journey story line, mixed in with The Seven Samurai, a Star Wars origin story and comic book like violence, then sure, go for it. Just remember to turn your brain off as soon as you get past the opening credits.

title: Better than Star Wars
text: Let's be honest the original Star Wars three were the only good ones.Snyder has created a fantastic futuristic world that is a breath of fresh air to be invited into.I love this story and the effects look beautiful.For a budget of 150 million or so This was done exceptionally well.I am a fan of Sci Fi and we have not had such a compelling story in years. I think people just dislike it unfortunately because Snyders name is attached. Never understood the hate on Snyder he is a brilliant story teller and a fantastic director. I loved the movies he was involved in the DC universe. Watch it and just enjoy it. It's worth it.

title: All in one action packed everything at once that looks like Disney, written for Netflix. Easy to watch, easier to forget
text: George Lucas was inspired by his love for old Western and Samurai films and created a fantasy sci fi world that became a timeless galaxy far away called Star Wars. Despite the use of popular cinema tropes, it worked with subtle reinvention of classic genres made into something new with original storytelling and good writing.Zack Snyder is guilty of trying to copy that formula almost as if its part of Star Wars, yet lacking the writing. Making it too boring to surprise, yet safely entertaining enough to watch till the end credits. Willing to please anyone that settles for general relatable content in a movie with a Sci Fi undertone that looks cool as a trailer and would be a modern Snyder directed weekend movie blockbuster for any age to enjoy without feeling offended. Or at least pretend you enjoyed it if you were forced into watching it like me.It is ambitious in a smothering way at times, borrowing from everything one can possibly put into one movie that feels like it came from another movie like a random lapse of cinema Deja Vu. A character from every mainstream time period genre Snyder possibly could put in the future, he made sure they all exist there shamelessly. Mixing and mashing them all together like some diverse space multi cultural Justice League where each unique individual has a heroic origin story, prequel and possible sequel that already feels exhausting to even imagine trying to be that person that actually cares to Google it.It might sound great if it actually made sense to expand a complex universe, but it ends up looking like a typical Mormon farming community being oppressed by WWII Nazi lookalikes, add a robot and some spaceships and give them funny accents and we are in the future telling a tale as old as time. Wow! But wait, its about to get weird with so much more stereotypes to entertain us with...Imagine watching western influenced cowboys and Indians that meets Chinese Dynasty era with Roman Empire Gladiators meets Scandinavian Vikings along with fascist supremacy villains with a dash of Marvel's Wakanda warriors with PG approved GOT violence with a Chronicles of Riddick landscape along with The Matrix steam punk technology mixed with a little Pocahontas in a futuristic Dune mystic fantasy world with slow motion action packed Star Wars signature alien creature world like qualities. Renowned cinematography that typically expands Snyder's 300 classic, but now it's in space on steroids where every character is a possible lead. We just simply don't care to know yet. At least it's what anyone can expect. Super attractive cast that looks amazing when they move so fast in action scenes filmed in slow motion to see how fast they move, but in slow motion...What is it about exactly? Space oppression with a hint of resistance to fight for a better future and justice for all. An old generic heroic tale of bravery just like Star Wars but different types of good guys and bad guys. Totally different its almost original if you take the Zack Snyder fandom very seriously. No desire for average folk wanting to know more at any point unless it becomes a multi billion dollar franchise to exploit and stretch out Marvel style.As fans would fairly demand in a world with so many choices of stories that would never end until its rebooted and retold for the next generation with a modern spin and advanced CGI that makes it never ending yet you can't wait for more sequels, spin offs and prequels with shocking cliffhangers revealing more cliffhangers.Rebel Moon is a possible franchise option in an ocean of competitors identical to using the exact same magic formula and character arcs from every franchise that ever made a profit. Honestly it's a tough competition for any Network to invest in, especially Netflix well known for quantity over quality. Otherwise it's canceled until something better replaced it.Also, It's quite exhausting to watch if you expect something original. Especially if you try to find deeper meanings and focus like there would be a twist any moment that would surprise you and make you jump out of your seat and yell "Aha, a plot I well thought predicted yet I've been fooled by the ultimate twist of great storytelling!?!" None of that, sadly. Very predictable.It comes across as multiple ideas for a movie that evolved more as a Snyder directorial concept pitch to Netflix than an actual well written story to be adapted into film. A great idea that looks visually stunning and promising with a well known directorial name behind it, yet begging the viewer not to want more than to capture it at face value. Be happy with anything that anyone might find remotely relatable in a movie at any given time as you watch it. Then it's for you! As long as it makes studio a target with a healthy viewership algorithm for a wide audience with long term seasonal return viewer ratings, then I guess it achieved its ultimate goal.Mediocre and watchable. Relatable yet equally forgettable to think it would need a sequel to make it any longer and more boring... One Rebel Moon is enough to get a basic "meh" experience... Everything explained very thoroughly and it feels like the only debate would be if you actually care to find political metaphors into why the farmers be farming, and why the oppressors be demanding a harvest. Total mind blowing opportunity right there... We are all Rebel Moons! A self revelation of our own quest for justice? Meh, not really...Unless you are a obsessive Snyder superfan that has dark thoughts after reading this negative outlook on what is clearly a masterpiece to you. Then I would say just kidding silly. Best movie ever. Nothing like it, please dont hurt me with your super human powers.

title: Slow motion galore
text: Nothing to watch on Netflix and it's been so long that I've been paying a subscription without watching anything, so I give this one a try and convince myself that I have to finish it no matter if it's good or bad.This is a typical Snyder film, dark and soulless. Who cares about storytelling right? As long as he can insert as many fancy scenes and slow motion as he can, and for this one, oh boy there are too many that it feels too cringy every time it appears. I must admit some of them are cool, but if they appear every few minutes it gets annoying.This reminds me of the Rings of Power TV series, seems like both are made just to show off some cool scenes.

title: Pretty empty
text: Great visuals, good cast, a lot of potential... however the delivered result was way of the mark.The story is weak, regurgitated from a thousand other sci-fi films, and thrown together with no cohesion whatsoever.I waited, keenly, for a hook to bring me in, the point where the story clicked and and really kicked on...it never happened, unfortunately.The potential is definitely there, with a strong cast and excellent visuals to boot. Mr Snyder just seems to have forgotten the glue to stick it all together.Maybe the second installment will miraculously tie everything together and show my review to be a premature slight on a cult classic...spoiler, it doesn't!

title: Snyder should be ashamed of himself.
text: Rebel Moon production meeting...'Let's steal from Star Wars, Riddick, Dune, Matrix and Harry Potter and make a film!''Hey, Jack, great idea! Here's a truck load of money. Go and do that. Who needs original ideas, anyway? Not us, that's for damned sure!''Thanks guys. I've fooled a couple of good actors to appear...that Anthony Hopkins guy, but he's not so daft, he'll only do a voice, that dude who was ace in Sons of Anarchy and that guy who was Crowe's sidekick in Gladiator. There's a bunch of other folk, but nobody will know who they are. But hey. I'm Jack Snyder, everything I touch turns to gold. Doesn't it?... Doesn't it?'Errr, well, Jack....'

title: If Zack just wouldn't rely on so many time-worn tropes...
text: "Rebel Moon" is a hodgepodge of extremely time-worn tropes, with little originality. It is predominantly a swipe of "Seven Samurai", by way of "A Bug's Life". The Pixar film I just mentioned felt like a winking homage, "Rebel Moon" feels a lot more like a copy, a cheap way to introduce Snyder's roster of protagonists. Some could claim other films, like "Guardians of the Galaxy" used a similar mechanic, but this film feels a lot more blatant with the swipe. Even the original "Star Wars" owes it's origins to Kurosawa's "The Hidden Fortress", but this just feels heavy-handed. With more movies coming, I can only imagine what movies will be scotch-taped in as the plot.Snyder comes up with some very impressive visuals, but he needs to learn that's not enough. He needs some original writers with original ideas. He needs to stop writing movies, and stick to directing.With "Rebel Moon", you will see Snyder use that slo-mo-time effect during fights way too often. That Matrix-era mechanic is getting old. I do want to point out that I have enjoyed some of Mr. Snyder's films- I'm not a "hater". I'm just tired of the same-old same-old.I also think better wardrobe would have helped this film- it doesn't seem "another planet" enough when the clothing styles are way too close to standard Earth clothes. There are any number of ways to make a wardrobe feel "different"- none were used here. For pete's sake, Ed Skrein's "Little Hitler" has on an Earth shirt and tie! All of the Enemy forces look way too much like Nazis. Star Wars did a better job of making "Nazi-ish" uniforms 40+ years ago. I did really like the Anthony Hopkins robot.I really wanted to like this, and I do a little- I always like seeing Djimon Honsou and Sofia Boutella in movies, but at the very least it needed better costume design, and another pass at the script. The storytelling is sloppy, and derivative. It's rumored that this was Snyder's pitch for a Star Wars film, if so I can see why they passed. This movie is an ok time-waster, but not a destination watch.Zack, I'm still rooting for you, but talk to some better writers at least.

title: Boredom beyond the stars.
text: 'Rebel Moon - Part One: A Child Of Fire (2023)' is just... nothing. This mishmash of much better movies doesn't have an original bone in its body, presenting its well-worn plot in the most plodding way possible and somehow flattening all of its theoretically colourful elements into a single greyscale blob. There's no character to any of it, least of all the actual characters. At times, it's hard to keep track of what's happening and why, as the piece just throws trope after trope at you while hoping its plentiful peppering of sci-fi jargon will cover the stench of familiarity that clings to each and every one of them. Everything vaguely makes sense but most of it just happens in a very transactional, A-to-B kind of way that prevents the overarching plot from feeling cohesive in the slightest. There's no reason to care about anything that happens. Furthermore, the film is straight-up boring even at its most eventful. It's the sort of thing that slips from your mind as soon as it's over; you'll be very thankful of the recap that opens its sequel even if you're watching the two back to back. Zack Snyder is so used to the studio butchering his intended vision that he's decided to do it himself, even after being afforded all the creative freedom he could wish for. It's baffling. I can't imagine anyone clambering for a longer version of this, even if it does fix the blatant butchering of some of the movie's clearly shot-for-R fight scenes. Bleh. I don't know what else to say.

title: Eye candy without any substance
text: Zack. Why did this obvious well meaning series fall so flat? Let me say. The cinema photography is good!! The costumes, the well thought out scenes and sequence was timed with one wanting more. However, well good intentions cannot bring a film to a status of excellence which could elevate to even a cult level for fans to gush over for years!! And that's why it didn't work. Film making needs to go deep into character substance and a storyline that brings the main character to a heroine with the emotional backing for the fans to delve into whether it's in space or on even on a regular timeliness. Looking good, without depth of the belief of this series storyline. Certainly there are good points, but sigh let one holding a empty popcorn bag with great marketing. And marketing syfy movies into a two partier without a stream of believable story. Everyone in Hollywood go back to studying storyline.

title: This film is exactly what you think it's going to be.
text: If you've come to this film to watch a high energy sci-fi action movie that is made up of all the usual elements that make this genre entertaining then you've come to the right place.Yes, it is highly influenced by Star Wars and you can even trace what parts of Star Wars Zack Snyder was thinking of when creating this but it takes nothing away from the enjoyability of this.It's a Netflix movie so some of the set pieces are very CGI and not in the way a theatrical release would be, and the dialogue could use a bit of editing however this is a throwaway movie that is enjoyable to the end.Looking forward to what Part Two has to offer.

title: Mediocre and just watchable
text: I thought I was watching a remake of Battle Beyond The Stars with added bits of almost every other decent sci-fi movie. It's not good, it's not even bad, it's just pfffft. Like someone else said, I wanted it to be good but it's not quite there and i just didn't care about any of characters .Poor character development of the main players who just seem to be thrown together quickly, even the main character doesn't get much development.Ed Skrien oozes menace, charm and a severe amount of distrust in what should be a wonderful cast.Heres hoping chapter two actually builds up the characters and does something worthwhile with them than just another by the numbers sci-fi yarn.

title: Excellent gold all round - deserves much better score than it currently has!
text: I'm confused by the current 'average' score this has received on IMDB. The film is well made, good script, great acting and the cinematography is excelllent - it's the epic it set out to be! And it's what you would expect from Snyder. You can see why it was something written along the Star Wars 'theme' and it's a shame it was never taken up by them, but it has been brilliantly adapted into its own story, and taken forward to produce something worthy of being its own franchise. Even friends/family who don't usually watch sci-fi have enjoyed this and they watched it knowing nothing beforehand. So ignore the critics and the sub par reviews, sit back and enjoy the ride!

title: Unbelievable bad clichee
text:
This Rebel Moon movie was a real dissapointment, a lot of clichees of which we are so tired to see, like:
The producers and the director are responsible for this huge failure to produce something original and breathtaking.So many missed oportunities in scenes to show old things in a new sci-fi artistic ways, I can't believe how unprofessional were their advisers too.It looks like a cheap rushed up movie project.The movie had few interesting creatures and scenes but not enough to save it from the disaster ( especially when the movie strength doesn't lie with its storyline either).I propose the whole lot of producers, directors, writers,
and advisers of Rebel Moon to take a crash course in movie creation and production by liaising with real SCI FI movie giants teams like those of James Cameron, Ridley Scott and so on, they have a lot to learn.

title: Didn't finish it, regret not turning it off sooner
text: This movie comes across as if someone somehow reanimated Cecile B. DeMille but didn't restore the latter's brain and heart rate, only getting back a shadow of the man. Now place said director in today's competitive movie industry where most variations on the Hero's Journey have been made, and imagine as if all of the reel burned down in a storage room fire and the company had to deliver by splicing together aborted reels from Star Wars, Lord of the Rings and what have you lying around collecting dust behind locked doors in Hollywood. Like someone else here said, this watches like a parody on an attempt at a homage to a... 80's bad fantasy film. Except that there's no way an 80's bad fantasy film could have been that bad. Even the bad ones I occasionally dig up to watch end up being _almost_ worth the 1-2 hours spent watching one.With this movie -- not so much. "Almost didn't watch it" would be an understatement, as in fact I turned it off somewhere near the end, cursing under my breathe I let Netflix lure me into giving it a chance. What a waste of acting talent. Yes, I believe no small part of the cast can actually act, but with the 2-dimensional depth-less characters they're given to play, they can't do much as demented re-animated DeMille behind the camera, in Snyder's incarnation, seems to bend the project to their bottom-line. The result is like watching a child's show, except there's no humour and it is far more boring to an adult than most of the children's shows I've looked at.Frankly, I don't know what else to add. The plot is waferthin, and has been rehashed a gazillion of times since invention of movie camera. There's so much tropes badly woven in the movie I am not sure what it wants to be. Even the title is absurd -- I don't know which moon they're referring to.I can't escape think of Star Wars here, what with Rebels etc. I wonder if Disney will want to try send their legal department after the people who so blatantly "almost" copied Star Wars here?Regards, a fan of good science fiction. Have I set my sights too high? No, I don't think so, there are many good stories to be told well, I am sure of it. This falls so far off the mark, the stone might as well been thrown _backwards_. Snyder should be allowed to retain directing duty, but his writing seems like scribblings of a pre-school kid asked to write a novel.

title: The STARS WARS we needed!
text:
I feel so sorry for the people that like this genre but didnt like the film cause this is a clear example of a fiction and space movie.My only complain is the age ratio (not a drop of blood and i really want to see that damn blood!)
Sorry for haters, zack did it well and to be honest i didnt wait to enjoy this movie as a i did.Also to say that it seems shorter that it seems. Sometimes it feels so fast moreover when they are trying to explain some important moves on the plot. You can follow it but its like.. give me a breath.The female and main character: AWESOME."There is no strong female representation on hollywood movies" ...thanks Zack for shutting them up.

title: Who gave money to shot this?
text: I really wonder. How did he get money to shot this bad mix of several decent movies?Action scenes are a disaster, badly scripted, badly executed. Bad guys just wait in line to get their share of ass kicking. When action suck even more, they just put some slow motion sequence to cover it.CGI is also bad. So bad that is even worse than in low budget SciFi soap operas on Netflix.There are some decent guys in this movie, like General Zorg from the latest Superman, Ajax from Deadpool and bird-horse from Harry Potter. I feel sorry for them. They got some money, but they lost their dignity.So, I lost more than two hours of my life so you don't have to.

title: Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, but not in the case of Rebel Moon
text: I wanted to like this movie, I really did. The hype leading up to it had me going. But what I ended up watching was just bad, really boring, and derivative of other, better franchises in the worst ways it could. Bad writing, lame dialogue, weak story that just borrows everything from other movies and shows, cheesy space-nazi bad guys, mediocre CGI with overuse of color filters and blurry camera effects to try and disguise the mediocre CGI, and boring action sequences that seem to be more slo mo than regular speed. Really so much slo mo in this movie it started to get predictable and irritating maybe halfway through it. The slo mo in the action sequences actually made the main character seem less bad ass despite obviously being used to try and achieve the opposite effect. Also, the main character felt like a bunch of tropes on legs.This movie was so bad I would rather watch Battlefield Earth.

title: Derivative Drivel
text: I so wanted this to be good, it isn't, prepare to be disappointed.The production quality is superb, dreadfully let down by a poor storyline, poor dialogue and wooden acting. The story is so derivative, you will find yourself counting off other film storylines you have seen before as they are crammed in to a Rebel Moon.The tech, the people, society and back story are all so unbelievable - no credibility whatsoever- even for a science fiction film. Star Wars this is not.What is going on with Charlie Hunnam's accent?, pikey in space - woeful.There are glimpses of what a great Warhammer 40,000 movie/series could be like - Amazon please learn from this dreadful mess of a film.

title: Fascinatingly bad... 💩
text: Zack Snyder is a horrible story teller. Every single time one of his movies is watchable, it is because it's taken from a graphic novel or a comic book, which dozens of images serve as storyboard.In Rebel Moon, it's the usual: huge financial means to find an orgy of visual richness, so as to hide the simplistic "storyline" and the lack of directional talent.None of the characters are worth mentioning; even worst, Snyder tries to portray personalities and emotions with the subtlety of a 3 year old. He paints with his feet on a canvas either too large or too small for its intended purpose.Do not waste your time, I did it for you.

title: Finally Sci-Fi we can love
text: This was such a great movie.As a Sci-Fi fan who of course loves Star Wars and Star Trek and all movies like that I was thrilled when I first heard of rebel moon.This might finally be a new Epos that is created. I like other movies that Zack Snyder has made so this might deliver. And deliver it did.This wasn't one of those fast sci-fi without a story. This pure joy of build up and execution. They really picked the right actors and writers and the best CGI team.Lately big blockbusters have been released with poor cgi. But this was top notch. And sound. That's just something that can take a movie up one level that nothing else can affect. Sound was really good.All in all this is definitely a movie to watch. And I can't wait for the next part to be released. I really hope this builds to a big sci-fi epos with many movies. I can easily continue watch anything in this universe.As always just like with sound of freedom there is a lobby against movies ok Netflix. And those who love Gunn will do their best to try to destroy these ratings. I really loved this movie. If you watch it based on my review and dislike it. Send me a dm on twitter matsisthename or a follow if you like it.

title: Actress who played Kora is one of the worst actresses I have ever seen!
text: First: The actress who played Kora is extremely un-talented, how she got the job puzzles me. She had no talent whatsoever! Her acting really annoyed me, it was painful to watch. And all that fighting like she was Supergirl was ridiculous, they couldn't hit her with at least one bullet! There could be 10,000 soldiers with guns and they still wouldn't be able to hit her.Second: "Some" of the male actors were okay but the story writing ruined their characters, it looked like it was their first time acting. The character "Tarak" was really intriguing. I will not be watching part 2, as I find it pointless.This is also my first time writing a review, the story and the actress who player Kora were so terrible it made me write a review for the first time, it says a lot!

title: Is this Warhammer 2K?
text: I was very excited to see a new sci-fi world build with funding to back it. Unfortunately, they spent the budget entirely on visuals (which were beautifully done). This film had the potential to be great but missed the mark by a wide margin when it came to character development, world building, and captivating story telling.The characters were paradigms of a party you might find in a Final Fantasy game, not a bad thing if done correctly. Each of them received a formulaic Ocean's Eleven inspired introduction to showcase their origin story and combat skillsets. Unfortunately I couldn't remember any of their names or cultivate any attachment because they rapid-fire sped through what seemed like a dozen of these. In fact by the time the audience is introduced to all these awe inspiring characters, they manage to spare a few minutes for a final battle.I do wish they spent more than 20 minutes setting the stage for this 'epic', it's as if there was a missing 90 minutes of film that would have tied it together better. Maybe, but maybe not. It is very clear that this film drew HEAVY influence from Warhammer 40k, Star Wars, Warhammer 40000, Dune, WH40K, and a dash of Harry Potter. I get being influenced but...come on now.I sincerely hope they turn this trilogy around (if it survives). The visuals are top notch, it would be cool to see that matched.

title: Loved the movie
text: I don't really care if it's similar to start wars not everything that has space and rebels is starwars. It's a good movie with really good soundtrack and great visuals and actors. I can't wait for the second one.Zack Snyder did it again with the effects and the slow motion which i really like. Some people are saying the action is boring but I didn't even feel the 2hours passing while watching the movie.The story is nice, it's like an adventure going to find the team that will fight and help you get your village back. I like each character and their story.Hope the second one will be as nice as this one.

title: Lord of the rings - Star wars mashup
text: What a waste of time, watching this. The entire color palette is shades of brown. And some black for good measure. It's basically Lord of the Rings, a full bucket of StarWars elements splashed on top, a pinch of Chronicles of Riddick aesthetics and an alien idea from Independence day. Labeling this film as Sci-Fi is only for the 90-95 seconds of generic spaceship screentime and a few "aliens" found in other franchises and genres tweaked a (very little) bit, only to avoid copyright issues. Nothing new, nothing interesting, unlikable heroes, unbearable pace, a story without much interest. The Asylum-level production. And the marketing dept. Have the nerve to say "it's the new StarWars" & "world building", and on top of that they're preparing for a sequel? Where's that Picard facepalm pic?

title: I enjoyed it!
text: I thought it was very entertaining and was exactly what I was expecting from a big movie and director. The famous cast does a great job of bringing the story to life. The cast really is a mix of well known actors with some future stars. The fight scenes are well done and Kora is someone you want to root for. I don't get the bad reviews. I think people just love to complain publicly and can't sit back and just enjoy being entertained. I will probably watch part 1 again soon to see what I missed the first go around. Can't wait for part 2 and see more of the story and maybe find out more about princess issa and Kora.

title: Couldn't shake off the feeling of being 'generic'
text: Sofia Boutella did good, the action scenes were enjoyable, and the dedication to world-building was evident and deserves recognition. Nevertheless, the screenplay and the underlying narrative of Part One of Rebel Moon failed to meet my expectations.This can be attributed to two main factors.Firstly, the lack of character development makes it challenging to form a connection with the characters or their cause. Secondly, the storytelling itself lacks excitement, which is surprising considering the extensive effort put into constructing various realms and cultures.Overall, it felt like a subpar amalgamation of numerous sci-fi and ComicBook movies I have watched before. There was a distinct lack of originality, and to top it all off, the film failed to evoke any emotional response. Except for a handful of sequences, the majority of it was unremarkable.On a side note, it's clear now that Mr. Snyder has a penchant for slow-motion sequences. Perhaps Zack 'the slo-mo' Snyder would be a fitting moniker moving forward.

title: If Star Wars and Sucker Punch had a baby, it would be Rebel Moon.
text: Pretty much exactly what you would expect if the writer/director of Sucker Punch made a Star Wars style film. Much like how I felt about Sucker Punch, I wish it had gone either more thought provoking or leaned all the way into (space) fantasy and the middle road feels less fulfilling.Not bad but also not that memorable. It would have benefited from some more world building.It does contain scenes of sexual assault, so be warned if you want to avoid that.The acting is acceptable across the board. The special effects are nothing revolutionary but are professionally done. The writing isn't terrible but could have been better and as I said before I wish it had a bit more world building.

title: Ignore the ratings and the critics
text: I don't know why all that hate for a great movie. I don't know if that hate is toward ZS personally or professionally. But I know that this movie is WORTH seeing and I can't wait for part two and if there is part three as well. This movie for me is a combination of The Magnificent Seven + Star Wars + Dune. The story, the soundtrack and the casting are all great. The visuals and seeing new worlds were amazing. So I am asking whoever will read my review is to ignore the critics, ratings and watch the movie then decide for themselves. I know it's a repeated story taking back what's your and fight for your freedom but I really loved that movie. Charlie Hunnam was big surprise for me in that role and loved the fact Sir Anthony Hopkins himself was narrating and lending his voice.

title: Slow-Mo 7 Samurai in Space
text: The concept of 7 Samurai is timeless: a group of strangers gathering together to protect a small village. It is simple, yet effective. Nevertheless, Snyder managed to turn it into a slop-fest of slow motion shots and edge-lord scenes that ultimately amount to nothing other than some. 13 year olds Star Wars fan fiction.It is quite sad because I was looking forward to this movie and have enjoyed many Snyder films, but this is the most and maybe worst "Snyder being Snyder" I've seen. It is like someone did a parody of Star Wars and a parody of 7 Samurai and a parody of Snyder at the same time...

title: Seven Samurai Not Done Well
text: With obvious heavy borrowing from movies such as The Seven Samurai and The Magnificent Seven, this movie adds nothing new to make it compelling and does a poor job of bringing this genre to a space epic. The plot, with unbelievable fight sequences and military tactical disaster, has story holes you could fly a Star cruiser through. Although this type of movie rarely gets critical acclaim, in this case the mediocre reviews are well warranted. I wouldn't even call this film particularly fun. Although visually appealing, that does not make up for the lack of a compelling plot. I would not waste four hours on this.

title: Intriguing story but bad execution
text: Maybe that I keep comparing it to Star Wars mythology, anything else just pale in comparison.The premise isnt all that bad. It's just that everything just happens to work out for the protagonist. Every move is very predictable.I don't like the portrayal of the enemy as if they were space nazis, maybe that's how it's intended; it's just too cliche.Best to describe this movie as a mixture of star wars and guardians of the galaxies. And I am being nice.The whole story is a bit unconvincing. I wouldn't spend money to see it at the cinema, nor would I do the same for part 2, and omg there will probably be a part 3.Enjoy it on netflix, so you can pause it and pick it up in a few days on your next days off.

title: Forget what all the other reviews say, go watch it asap, it's just fun as hell.
text: An epic spectacle of a space opera ensemble with no shortage of breathtaking, picture-perfect scenes and memorable philosophies, but without the dragging politics and lore introductions. Perfect balance of world-building, drama, and well-choreographed action.Admiral Atticus Noble and his whacking bone-stick is just too entertaining to watch. His presence throughout the movie is unmatched. I simply can't get enough of him. He is without a doubt, already one of my favorite villains of all time.Kora is the hardest of all time. Girl power done effortlessly without any radical feminism uncomfortably forced onto you. Just badass people being badass.Super easy to watch and enjoy. The movie score is immensely captivating and inspiring. I can't imagine how fun it is to have a marathon with Part II, I'm all here for it. I want more of it and I want it now.

title: I stopped watching
text: It's a hodgepodge of ideas just thrown in there. A lot of those ideas were pretty neat if they were given any kind of pacing. There was so many ideas that the movie just kind of hummed along without really spending any time with any of it. Which kind of sucks because I feel like the only time Zack Snyder makes a good movie is when he's following a graphic novel frame for frame. Which makes sense why those graphic novel movies are the only ones with solid world building and character development.The space farmer/viking aspect of the move: cool idea. The space reich: a little tired, but maybe something there. It's just...man, they tried to recreate one of the most iconic scenes from Inglorious Basterds...but in space at a different pace. It was cringe. What makes inglorious basterds great is the pacing and the dialogue. You watch Tarantino's characters build anticipation with nothing more than dialogue over like 15 minutes. In this film...you have similar wardrobe and set design...but ugh, it is just bad. Don't get me wrong, some of the best work is inspired by others work...but not when you're just copying wardrobe, setting, and 'general vibe'. We want to watch Tarantinos dialogue because it's sets up dire consequences; there's a lot at stake. And he followed through with devastating results. Almost like in Heat (1995), they do a lot of talking, but the payoff is some of the best action sequences of all time.But back to this movie: there's nothing worth listening to because there's nothing at stake. There is nothing that makes me care about any of these random characters or what they had to say, so anything that happened to them became trivial. Any work they put in is towards a goal that I'm pretty disconnected from.Some of the visuals looked pretty cool though. Even though the visual sequences were a little misplaced. Like the dropping of the seeds when the ship arrived. It just seemed like a forced visual to try and heighten importance.Overall would have been cool to see better character/world building at a pace that lets it breathe. It also helps if you make your protagonist likable. Not just hot and stoic. You could even make your antagonist likable. Not a great movie, but cool to have on in the background.

title: Perfect Hair and Clichés
text: This could have been a good movie, but unfortunately it failed to be more than a collection of clichés and copies of beloved scenes of successful movies. It feels like a poor homage to Star Wars, Matrix, 300, Dune, Harry Potter and Lord of the Rings without introducing something new and unique.This doesn't mean that it had to be a bad movie, but the writing is just too bad. Some scenes feel overly lengthy without any contribution to the main plot, while others are rushed and don't give credit to the talented cast. All the right ingredients are there but are poorly mixed.It is similar with the CGI. It is A grade in some scenes and then it looks like an ambitious fan project in the others.The acting is decent given the poor script. I liked especially Ed Skrein as the main villain. Djimon Hounsou and Bae Doona are great as always. Special credit goes to the character of the android Jimmy which is dubbed by Anthony Hopkins. Probably the best of the entire movie. Not much is revealed and still Jimmy seems to have depth which the others lack so much. I am looking forward to more of him in part two. I hope his story will not end up in a cliché as well.The point that bothers me the most and I think makes the movie less believable is the fact that everyone is too good looking. Seriously, stop that. Please hire normal people. It just doesn't help if everyone looks like right out of the gym, oiled up with a fresh hair cut. It might work in stylized movie like 300, but not here. It feels fake. And that's probably a good description of the movie. Fake.

title: Scifi Seven-ish Samuria-ish... -ish
text: A weak scifi adaption of the Seven Samurai (1954), minus the interesting and more memorable parts. Sigh... I miss the days when men were men and women were women. Movies and TV shows where everyone is essentially the same have no soul. Likely minus 2-3 stars for that boring maneuver. Sure, La Femme Nikita (1990) was fun when it came out. Maybe Atomic Blonde (2017) gets a pass as well (assuming I'm remembering the right film and not confusing it with a similar one -- they all begin to blur together after a point). So, yeah, maybe one tough-girl flick every 25 years is my saturation point for this sub-genre... or maybe consider the laws of physics for minute when choreographing a fight like those films do (then watch more Aikira Kurosawa, Bruce Lee, and Steve McQueen to see what else you did wrong).

title: Amazing ! No reason to hate this MASTERPIECE. 10/10
text: In a cinematic landscape often saturated with formulaic narratives, the recently experienced sci-fi masterpiece emerges as a beacon of innovation and storytelling prowess. The film unfolds as a mesmerizing interstellar odyssey, seamlessly blending cutting-edge visuals, stellar performances, and a thought-provoking storyline.At the heart of this cinematic journey is a narrative that transcends the conventions of traditional sci-fi. The film navigates through the cosmos, exploring profound themes of existentialism, human connection, and the mysteries of the universe. The screenplay is a tapestry of intricately woven ideas, providing both intellectual stimulation and emotional resonance. As the plot unfolds, the audience is taken on a journey that transcends the confines of space and time, inviting contemplation on the very essence of our existence.The strength lies not only in its narrative depth but also in the compelling performances of its cast. Each actor breathes life into their character, infusing the film with authenticity and emotional weight. The chemistry among the cast is palpable, contributing to the film's overall impact. Whether it's the protagonist grappling with the cosmic unknown or the supporting characters navigating the complexities of human relationships, every performance adds layers to the cinematic tapestry.Visually, the film is a triumph of modern filmmaking. The special effects are nothing short of groundbreaking, creating awe-inspiring vistas of distant galaxies, futuristic technology, and mind-bending phenomena.
