The attention to detail in every frame is commendable, immersing the audience in a visually stunning and meticulously crafted world. The seamless integration of practical effects and state-of-the-art CGI contributes to the film's immersive quality, making it a visual feast for sci-fi enthusiasts.The director's visionary approach is evident throughout the film, as they skillfully balance the grandiosity of cosmic exploration with intimate human moments. The pacing is masterful, allowing the audience to absorb the magnitude of the universe while also delving into the intricacies of the characters' personal journeys. The director's ability to navigate the complexities of both the macrocosm and the microcosm is a testament to their storytelling prowess.A notable aspect of the cinematic experience is its evocative soundtrack, which serves as the emotional heartbeat of the film. The music, composed with precision and artistry, enhances the narrative's emotional beats, creating an immersive auditory experience. From moments of intense suspense to poignant reflections on the human condition, the soundtrack complements the visual spectacle, elevating the overall impact of the film.In conclusion, the recently experienced cinematic journey stands as a triumph in the sci-fi genre. It transcends the ordinary, offering a narrative that is intellectually stimulating, emotionally resonant, and visually spectacular. The synergy of exceptional performances, visionary direction, and groundbreaking special effects creates an unforgettable cinematic experience. The recently experienced film is not merely a film; it's a cosmic journey that leaves an indelible mark on the viewer's psyche. For those seeking a thought-provoking exploration of the cosmos coupled with breathtaking visuals, the recently experienced cinematic journey is a must-watch-a testament to the limitless possibilities of storytelling in the vast expanse of science fiction.

title: A bad mix of D&D and Star Wars
text: The plot seems like it has been written by a 13 year old boy who just discovered fantasy RPGs and Star Wars. It's an incredible mixture of all the possible stereotypes of these subgenres. The characters, the costumes, the setting, the weapons... Even the names are so obvious. The indigenous looking handsome guy? Tarak. The nazi/ancient roman-looking villains? Titus, Belisarius and so on... And the Asian ninja-like woman? Nemesis, of course. Seriously, who writes this stuff? Want to talk about the recycled costumes? "Ok guys, we've got this double buckled belt from a previous steampunk movie, these clothes from a western movie, some rags and random cloaks from a Star Wars fan made movie".Oh come on. Who even out money for this?

title: Like a beautiful film set
text: This movie a beautiful film set. Looks nice but not much behind it and supported by thin pieces of wood. Generally all of the reviews here so far are right. This is a great movie for a bad hangover where you don't have to think, you can doze off, wake up hit a bit and not miss a beat. The only thing that really drove me nuts was Charlie Hunnam. It's very possible I'm too sensitive to these things but his awful accent absolutely ruined every scene he spoke in. Not only is there no need to have a Northern Irish accent for the character, he does a really really bad job. Everything he said sounds the same because he is focused on the accent and not giving his dialogue life. I actually muted him when I could and just read subtitles instead. Watch is you are feeling brain dead and want to see some very nice VFX, otherwise skip it.

title: The worst thing to pass before my eyes in years... and not only in TV or film
text: A lot of people are citing influences like The Seven Samurai and the Star War franchise as main inspirations for this unfortunate dreck, and this may be true, but I see other influences, more obvious than the above such as Road Runner & Wile E Coyote or Tom & Jerry throughout the many fight/dance sequences haphazardly strewn about like so many broken teeth.Like them the characters (and I'm being very generous calling them characters) could beat the pulp out of each other resulting in bits intermittently flying off them yet when the dust settles there's not a scratch on them, not a dent in the fender, not even the slightest sign of exertion or fatigue throughout any of the exchanges. It was just like a cast of emotionless marionettes being pranced through various landscapes where, and this is where it diverges from the source material of Wile E Coyote or Tom & Jerry, none of them actually learn anything throughout their escapades, they are just as vacuous at the end of the tale as they were at the beginning.The actors, like many of the reviewers searching vainly for something to say about the greatness of Zack Snyder, had absolutely nothing to work with although they tried valiantly to justify their time and money. In the end the viewer is left as crestfallen and utterly bereft of hope as the expressions all the actors exhibited at the end, even though the characters they played supposedly won the day and sent the bad guys packing. I seen it, I just didn't feel it.So to wrap up, some questions about the crazy universe in which I was briefly dipped...1. What kind of wonder crop were they growing that apparently takes nine weeks to mature, one moment scattering seeds by hand, the next heaving a scythe about with harvest approaching?2. What was so great about the murdered king, sounds like he was as bad if not worse than the folks who killed him and deserved no pity nor honour?3. Just how many teeth does Atticus really have? He clearly loses at least seven permanent ones in the final fight scene and yet regains them all when his comrades plugs him into a recharge socket? Are they like the Mr. Conehead's teeth comprised of multiple layers, or like a shark, constantly replenishing themselves?

title: brexit
text: Holy cow -i think casting theresa may and lord bucket-head could have produced a better product. I make this reference because the only thought that came to mind after i granted the first twenty minutes of part one some latitude was 'this is going to be a s**t-show...'you can find that 'lord bucket-head' clip online, i'm sure.It is definitely more entertaining -unless 'blender train wreck sci-fi' is the preferred genre.I just can't believe it's as popular as netflix claims it to be -I almost stopped at the very beginning with the narrated bit of back story in the opening; I had to double check that i wasn't rewatching hitchhiker's guide...netflix should have included 'rebel moon' in their 'black mirror' series as produced by 'streamberry' and ended with a montage of all the disappointed faces of the people who took the time to watch.

title: Rousing. If you need originality, see The Creator
text: Nowhere near as original as The Creator, this is the most rousing sci-fi popcorn movie since Alita Battle Angel or the last Star Wars movie (and at a fraction of the cost).I do see the negative pro and user reviews. What I believe they miss is to work with a "four quadrant" audience, blockbuster movies need to stay close to familiar archetypes and archetypal themes. The quality has to mostly come from committed and dedicated execution, in front of and behind the camera. Nothing cheap here at all. Rebel Moon has mountains of commitment and dedication so it works to engage audiences.If you need more originality, go see The Creator.

title: You've seen it all before
text: Not sure what Snyder is celebrating, the fact that because people who have already paid for Netflix watch this because it's the Christmas holiday and the hype and also to see if it's as bad as people say doesn't make it "the number one movie". And yes, it is as bad as people say.It rips off everything from Midsummer (Scandi sex cults) to Avatar, Harry Potter, Dune, Blade Runner, The Chronicles of Riddick, Warhammer 40K, Battlefield Earth, and obviously Star Wars which it desperately wants to be but fails at, mainly because IT'S NOT FUN! It's incomprehensible, the plot so thin it's barely water, and the characters utterly forgettable.If there's a longer cut coming, what's the point of this? Would anyone want to sit through MORE of this just to ascertain that yes, it's still bad.People will keep watching this and it will look like a smash but if it had been a cinema release it would have been a historical flop.

title: Amazing space opera
text: Loved the artistic cinematography. Slow motion and sound quality of the effects, especially with the weapons created a fearsome sense of lethality. Characters were entertaining. Can't wait for part 2. Some shots of the landscape while world building was beautiful. The movie left me wanting to see more of the lore and backstories of the main characters. The common thread of honor and bravery among the protagonists were balanced out well by the intimidating and brutal villain. It was great to see a darker, grittier take on the space opera that star wars is unwilling to delve into. Epic movie and I am looking forward to watching the directors cut.

title: Not Zack Snyder's best work.
text: I am a fan of Zack Snyder's work. 'Man of Steel' and '300' are some of my favorite films ever. That's why I was so utterly shocked and disappointed when I saw this film. Rebel Moon to me is basically a ripoff adaptation of 'Star Wars'. Think about it, a young farm girl must rebel against the evil tyrant forces that rule the galaxy after threatening to destroy the place she calls home. She then scrapes the galaxy for people who too were chased by this force, ultimately creating a rebellion. And to top it off, fricking plasma swords, or for how most are accustomed to, "Lightsabers".The cast itself isn't bad at all. Some terrific actors star in this film. Djimon Hounsou (Titus), Charlie Hunnam (Kai) and Anthony Hopkins (Jimmy) are amongst them. Unfortunately for me, the main protagonist, 'Kora' played by Sofia Boutella, fell short for me and didn't resonate with me at all. A shallow performance in my opinion.The plot is just filled with cliches and doesn't seem to give us anything new or original. No character builds a connection with the audience because no real effort is put to make us care about what's going on, at least that's how I've felt. Plus everything seemed to be predictable.Visually too, I was not expecting much as this was a Netflix production. And unlike most of their series which look fantastic, their films aren't usually impressive to look at. This film was no different.Did not enjoy this view. I was baffled by the dialogue and performances that carried throughout the film. The ending is left with a cliffhanger "setting up" the sequel and runs for a little over two hours.

title: Nothing new, but not terrible or good really
text: This isn't the worst movie ever, but its not really that good either. It's main problem is poor writing and calling them cardboard characters is actually a compliment to how shallow they really are.Just in the first few minutes you get Warhammer 40K, Starwars and space Nazis. The main bad guy is a comically mustache twirling space nazi who is evil just for kicks. Who has completely incompetent soldiers who are comically evil just because. He asks them to set up a camp and they just decide to start raping random people instead of you know setting up camp. Plot needs to have bit more than that.There are some very cool scenes, but there are also plenty of scenes that leave you scratching your head. Like it sounded cooler in the director's head, but looked awful on film.The good guys pose a lot and look mean, or constipated, not sure which. Luckily all the bad guys just freeze up with them instead of just shooting them. And no that wasn't one of the way to many slomo sequences.Had to watch this in about 4 sittings because my 'well that is dumb' meter filled up too many times.Did I hate it? Not really. Did I enjoy it? Not really. Get a decent writer and editors and this might have been good b grade sci-fi. As is they made knock of light sabers not look cool and really didn't have much of a story despite ripping the plot from at least 7 other shows. Including straight out of Harry Potter. Kind of like in Army of the Dead where he had a shot for shot ripoff of Aliens.

title: Invasion of the stupid clone reviews
text: Silly humans this movie Rocks and we've only scene the first part and the cut one at that .Anyone who thinks this isn't good movie is either a clone mimicking the idiot so called critics or has extremely bad taste u probably like the Percy Jackson movies lol .No but seriously I had a fun time watching this movie and it actually didn't disappoint me like everything else lately. Dune wasn't that great the first one is all building no fun .This movie was fun unlike the Ring of Power which first season was all building also .Critics seem to like this building bs .Kinda like morons in the 80s liking Bon Jovi music .

title: Bugs Life but female
text: Pixar ought to sue because this is a cheap knockoff of Bugs Life, minus the circus bugs. Bugs Life is more entertaining and its bad guy was cooler. Hopper had a better storyline. But this movie does include Sir Anthony Hopkins' voice as the wise, old, robot. And nobody can be upset about Charlie Hunnum in anything. It's not that spectacular shooting with the slo-mo fight scenes. The story is predictable. Not that great scenery and the scientific world is not that challenging to the many stories that have been played over and over again. Simple farmers are in need of a tough as nails fighter to defend their group or town. Seven Samurai, Clint Eastwood and yes, Bugs Life have all been done.

title: Rebel Scum
text: I personally think it is not that bad but it is that bad, the same formula but different but still the same. Right after watching all the spectacles (that yet fails to awe), I immediately thought of the original Star Wars trilogy that were made back in the 70s, compared it and still A New Hope did better even with outdated technology. Great casts but lacks of character. The Snyder shot does appear but still nothing new to that. Thank God that this movie was pitched and never made as a Star Wars movie. Too many unnecessary conversations, slow paced with predictable plot, the action sequence feels like 300 ripoff. Truthfully I know Zack tried to did his best in this movie and being original as Zack does Zack, but look at Nolan; he did what he did best but with a twist and fresh and experimental and new. It hurts me as a fan, and disappointed much as I have high expectations that Rebel Moon could be better than Star Wars but unfortunately no.

title: I gave it a chance
text: Its awful they build up this entire premise of some vast empire that had its king slain about 40 times cool we get it however its so massive that they have to STEAL WHEAT from neutral planets. I'm sorry what?How is your empire even alive if you cannot supply your people nay your flipping military rations? They claim because the supply depot is gone but you dont have any type of rations on board your ship or even a supply ship to help?Modern day military has supply trucks that take part in convoys just for that exact reason if not anything else they may run short of.I couldn't care less about any of the characters everyone in it is some edgelord or cliche driven theme thats been done time and time againThis motherworld place should be in full on revolt if they can't feed their own not just this small 20 man group of rebels.

title: I really can understand the bad critics
text: The latest cinematic gem I had the pleasure of watching is an impressive blend of fantasy and realism, a spectacle for space movie enthusiasts. The special effects are simply astounding, standing out for their quality and ability to transport the viewer into a completely new and astonishing universe.What really sets this movie apart are its original characters. Each one brings a freshness and depth that has been missing in recent productions. There's a palpable sense of authenticity and grittiness in their portrayal, reminiscent of the iconic movie "300", and sharply contrasting with the more sugared and less impactful version of recent Star Wars films.The story itself is intriguing and beautifully narrated. It introduces us to a fascinating world that leaves the viewer longing for more, eager to explore every corner of this newly discovered universe. The plot hooks you from the start and maintains a pace that skillfully balances action and character development.It's surprising to find negative reviews of this work, as personally, I think the movie marks a before and after in the space sci-fi genre. It had been a long time since I saw a movie of this type that captivated me so much, both for its visual quality and its solid storyline.In conclusion, this movie is an absolute recommendation for those looking for a cinematic experience that combines top-notch special effects with a deep and immersive narrative. Without a doubt, it's a film that not only entertains but also invites reflection and wonder.-

title: LAST STAR FIGHTER
text: People keep comparing this to Starwars, but the story is more in keeping with the Last Star Fighter.The opening scene actually feels like trying to recreate Inglorious Bastards in space with a tense exchange between the bad guy and a farmer.Visually it's fine, no different from current Sci-Fi movies and TV. The problem seem some of the acting and script are a bit hokey.I do think its interesting people complaining about a slight female being the badass protagonist...these people have obviously never watched Aliens or Dawn of the Dead.In a nutshell it passable watching, nothing ground breaking nor Zack Snyder's best work.

title: Roger Corman's 1980 Battle Beyond the Stars was a better adaptation of '7 samurai' than this...
text: I love Zach Snyder's spirit and attitude, and his work on the living dead series and Army of the Dead. Man of Steel was his magnum Opus, although Slither still is my personal favorite. But this... this reads as 'Well if Disney won't let me make a Star Wars Seven Samurai movie, I'll just do my own thing!' and then he breaks out the crayons and cries himself into a storyboard for a movie, supposedly a dream of his from the late 90's to make, which doesn't reflect the perspective time is supposed to grant. I had such high hopes for this movie. I am a rather big Akira Kurasawa fan, and I love Seven Samurai and Yojimbo, as well as all the various movies and series spawned from those two movies. This was just painful to watch for me. You feel the star wars vibe in all the blaster fire moments, and yet there is an over-arching 'dune' feeling to a greater huge power at work, which is not at all what seven samurai was about. There wasn't a nation, or huge organization targeting the village in seven samurai, or in magnificent seven, or the planet Akier in Battle Beyond the Stars, but a group of insurgents, bandits... one might even call them rebels without a cause. That is why the title of this is so very off putting... Zach Snyder is making his own Star Wars parody of Rebels vs the 'Evil Empire', just for the sake of doing it. It is not at all in theme with the original premise of Seven Samurai. I wanted so much more out of this, and Zach did not deliver. I think the current IMDB score of 5.6 at the time of my writing this is very, 'VERY' generous.

title: Strange but okay
text: Rebel Moon Part 1 is a gorgeously shot film, with visuals that are truly stunning. It's raunchy, weird, and a little bit freaky, which might appeal to some but will definitely won't be for everyone. The story is average and doesn't particularly stand out, and the characters feel underused and underdeveloped. Some scenes feel too short while others are to long. The slow motion Zack Snyder is known for is used but not effectively. Despite this, it's not a bad film by any means, but it might be a disappointment to some viewers who were expecting more. Overall, it's a film that's worth watching but don't go in expecting a masterpiece.

title: A good start for a new epic adventure
text: The movie is a great start for a new universe. The characters, the score, the visuals, everyone who worked on this one seems to care a lot, so the movie has this family made soul. Great experience. Its a part one movie, and for sure, its is not a complete history, bit that is not a problem, will make you looking foward for more. Darrian Bloodaxe is a big surprise, the presence of the actor Ray Fisher is outstanding, although the small mount of sreen time. The fight scenes are great, and the best of the best is the Jimmy robot. Dont know how they did a machine seems so emotional and charismatic.

title: Waste of time
text: This movie was undeniably dreadful, to the point where I had to go through the hassle of retrieving my IMDB password just to express my disappointment. Its glaring shortcomings are evident in its lack of a coherent storyline, character development, and any semblance of depth. Scenes seem haphazardly strung together, bearing no connection to one another, resulting in a jumbled mess of disjointed visuals. Frankly, it was an utter squandering of time. One can't help but wonder why such a substantial budget was allocated to produce something so abysmal. The fact that I went through so much to write this review shows commitment to save your time. You are welcome!

title: Beautiful world building
text: For what is was it was really good. You can see where the context of scenes are left out because it is the PG-13 version. Extremely anticipating R-rated 3 hour movie! I can tell already from this viewing it's going to be INSANE! I got what i needed out of it, but didn't get what i wanted.. Admiral Noble is BRUTAL and Kai was fantastic! Those two were my favs! Kora and Jimmy where solid.. I really wanted more from Nemesis but i should get that from R-rated version. ALL & ALL solid movie don't believe these haters. Family had a really fun time watching.Definitely doesn't deserve the low rating.

title: Trigger Warning for Hateful Imagery
text: Movie experience completely stained by use of swastika like face tattoo for Atticus, wouldn't have watched if I knew. Whilst I appreciate that the face tattoo is not a swastika 1 to 1, it does resemble it. I found this tattoo to be triggering and will steer clear from this movie from now on and any follow up movies in the future. Please think twice before watching this movie especially if you do not wish to be subjected to subliminal visual cues.Any symbols historically associated with hate groups or that depict people as less than human should be at least be disclaimed on this marvellous tool that is the Internet.

title: A lot to say
text: I'll start off with the good:Boutella is an excellent fit for the strong and broody (but not annoyingly broody) hero. Someone complained about the 90 lb waif look and I'm so confused by that because she's lean but visibly very strong. A very convincing bad ass.The visuals are incredible.On to everything else:This is the most painfully sucked up I've seen this many men in a long time... at least for the sake of these actors kidneys can we cut out the need for hyper chiseled characters?! It's such a ridiculously unsustainable look. Skrein and Nair are clearly committed, both had me VERY concerned for their health😖Why did Hunnam need to do an Irish accent? In space?! And why was it so bad?! I can't stress this enough (and it goes for all sci-fi movies) they're in freaking space, I know we're prolific but FFS. Having him do an almost insulting Irish accent was highlighted by Fee's real Irish accent 🤦totally ridiculous and unnecessary.Huisman is an excellent actor, but his performance here was like he was reacting to blank screens... scenes of horror barely illicited a response from him but I'm not explicitly blaming him, this might be a director thing.Lots of other really great actors, wish I could have seen more of their character development but that would have made it feel like suicide squad, it was already pretty forced.Snyder has a habit of rushing through story to focus on visuals and it all just feels underexplored, slap-dashy (like Justice League).This sci-fi story is really captivating but characters were dumped on us then snatched away or just not explored enough.Exposition is dropped way too often but how else can they tell an untold story when there's no book to fill in the blanks? This movie feels like it should have been a book, maybe even a series but a movie (even 2) feels like it's been robbed.Cinema Sins is probably going to rip this movie apart, for sure🤷Side note: Can we get more of Ray Fisher saying stuff? Like in movies, commercials, whatever because that voice! He said the word, "revolution" and I died😅

title: The emperors new clothes.
text: So once again Zack Snyder has a huge budget and a big cast and once again serves up a film that is just plain boring. How and why studios keep backing him is a mystery to me.One of the problems of the movie is the plot. It is just boring and unoriginal. And it's not just the main storyline which makes little sense, the villains are comedic and not interesting, a mix of Nazis, star wars villains and just like stormtroopers seem incapable of hitting any of our heroes.The assembly of heroes which is the main point of this part 1 is what the movie is about, is also rushed and the motivation of the people to join is straight-up nonexistent in most of the cases and is simply skipped entirely. Think a poor imitation of Magnificent Seven/Seven samurai and you kinda get the idea.As for the villain who comes to find mysterious troubling rebels, apparently every single person knows who are the rebels and how to find them and shares that information to the first stranger they meet. It's not like they are even hiding.Next, combat and action scenes. Blasters that penetrate people in armor through, but can't penetrate a thin piece of wood. Remember when in the new Star Wars trilogy a red guard could strike Ray but was just making dumb random moves to simulate action? Well, it's absolutely the same here. Maximum drama, lots of slow motion, frequent switch of the scenes every few seconds and very little sense.The acting is ok, but it's difficult to judge the actors due to the poor script tells. Kora is just a poor character who feels out of place and a character who I just didn't feel any connection to.It's not all bad. The visuals are good but like most Snyder films I felt it was a 2 hours and 15 mins long that could quite easily have been done in 30 to 40 mins.I'd say it's the most disappointing Snyder's movie so far and that's saying something given Sucker Punch, Batman v Superman etc.

title: Do Not Listen to the reviews ! Watch it!
text: Do not listen to the reviews. We are huge movie buffs in this house. We give every movie a chance. I am glad we didn't listen to the reviews. This movie is not just about the action sequences. Zack catered to everyone. Obviously it's a part one so it does a lot of world building. You end up wanting more of the world. I need to know more and want to know more about the characters. Great action and cinematography. In the sea of trash movies on netflix this is a pretty good movie. This movie is definitely worthy of a sequel. The zack haters are out to trash him for his slow motion but he does a great job at making you feel like you are there. Just give it a chance. If you can watch half the stuff on netflix you wont be disappointed if you give this a watch.

title: Sci-fi used to be limited by technology; now it's limited by writers
text: Trying to mash up old stereotypes of Vikings, Romans, Samurai and whatnot, then throwing in some space Nazis probably sounded fancy on paper and might even work in an open-world game but was doomed to fail in a film. Obviously some writers still tried and probably died (at least inside) in the process, so the rest was seemingly left to be written by a school kid or two. The only twists can be seen from a mile away.I felt like half of this film was character introductions, and they even did it twice for most of them. Admittedly I lost interest in the characters somewhere along the way, so they probably had to. If they're trying to sell action figures, this might be a sensible approach, but at the same time there's a lot of violence and stuff like implications of interspecies sex, so am I supposed to buy that tentacle thing for my kid or what? I'm confused.Certain visuals are nice, but that's about it. I thought slow-mo combat scenes died somewhere in the 90s, as nowadays there are more sophisticated ways of emphasizing action, but perhaps Snyder didn't get the memo.

title: Pc game cut scene Magnificent 7 in space
text: Wow this is bad. Just play a couple Starfield missions instead. Visually it is computer rendered. Storyline is ridiculous and makes no sense. Characters are one dimension cut outs randomly speaking in Irish and other accents for some reason as the movie plods from boss fight to boss fight bit who cares. They plough fields with horses bit have automated doors. Robots cjange sides when given flowers. Dialogue is cliched to ridiculous levels but even the CGI is unconvincing and does nothing to redeem. Think Assasins Creed/Starfield slow motion cut scenes and you are there. Blows my mind that money was spent on this.

title: Wanted to be an epic
text: They relied on too many effects and a weak story. Obviously that was the kiss of death. How could it ever succeed? They didn't bother to develop any depth but went in for a breadth of a dizzying number of characters that somehow managed to end in an unplanned climax. A completely unconvincing movie that had a feel of an epic but ended up trying to ram some slow motion effects down our sympathetic minds. But we're not that gullible are we now? Most of the movie's three hours were spent in slo-mo. Not the brightest move there. Unnecessary and disconnected scenes that betray a director and editor who didn't talk to each other. Just signs of a non existent team effort behind the scenes and Zack too impressed by his fancy lenses that he'd got specially crafted for this movie. If he'd only seen deeper into his Japanese inspirations then he'd realise that lenses are the weakest link in a film at the end. But this has become an American Hollywood cinema obsession where technology replaces any talent. Next time Zack.

title: 12 with a Schizophrenic ChatGPT Writes Script
text: Netflix is struggling. You'd think that fact would compel the company to double down on quality writing and production. Instead they tarnish the reputation of several stellar actors by dropping them into a blue screen set and asking them to recite a script written by a 12 year old using ChatGPT. I really feel sorry for the actors. Visually the entire thing is a mess as well. There are jarring lens aberrations all over the place, post processing that blurs elements even when they should be in focus, boring sepia everywhere. This needs to be a career ender for the writers and director involved. An hour into this mess and I had absolutely no idea what was going on. It's schizophrenic mutterings turned into film. Skip Rebel Moon.

title: Visual spectacle. Ignore the sour critics
text: Okay - I've bought into the Rebel Moon franchise and ready for part 2 and any spin offs it has to offer.As a massive Star Wars fan, I can see the inspiration, but this is not it and differs enough.The cinematography is second to none, from the simple scenes to the grandiose ones, each one is so beautifully shot and artistic.The story may have some familiar tropes, but each good vs evil, rebellion vs empire and this movie does solidly enough to stand it's own.Sofia Boutella has marked herself as an excellent and believable protagonist. I saw one comment about how a skinny girl can't beat up men - nonsense. Those comments probably come from fat armed men who don't work out like she does - she clearly got good muscle definition and you don't need to be big armed to have speed, technique and urrrm, shoot a gun?As I've been hyped for a Star Wars inspired movie, I saw the critics reviews - do not listen to what those miserable people have to say. I expect they need happy fun movies because their lives lack it. I enjoy a more serious gritty movie as much as I enjoy a humorous happy go lucky adventure.My only criticism, and by no means a deal breaker, was 2 things.1. Slow motion action used a tad too much. Don't get me wrong, I can't argue too much with it, as you see such beauty with slow motion you wouldn't see in real time. But some of the action may have been appreciated how quickly the protagonist dispatches of her enemies to show her form.2. Pacing. I believe there is rumour of an extended version - and I think this will do the movie great justice. Because this movie is quite ambitious in what it tries to lay down, and because of all the characters it introduces, it is not enough time to flesh out who these characters are.In summary, a fantastic spectacle which leaves you ready and wanting for part 2.

title: Zach??
text: This isn't his work, is it? He was doing far better when shooting on film and had a DP. This is ego out of control or maybe he's just lazy now. The red camera has ruined a lot of movies and this is partially at play here I think. I was actually into it until the 120lb girl started beating up soldiers. I hate that every other action film has to do this now. Are the writers or directors into some kind of kink thing here? What's with all the little girl beating up men in films!? WE ARE TIRED OF IT. Hey Zach, team up with Larry again and get away from Netflix please. JL and Man of Steel and Watchmen... that's you man.

title: Loved it until...
text: Charlie Hunnam... and his ludicrous Belfast accent, just why?? Couldn't they afford Jamie Dornan?! This film clearly borrows a lot of, ehh, inspiration from other well known scifi movies, Star Wars being the most obvious. This didn't bother me as much as the woeful acting from CH.. other cast members were strong, he is definitely the weakest link and would have been so much better without him. Overall don't take this film too seriously, it's entertaining if you don't overthink it and something to pass the time when there's nothing better to watch! Not the worst, but by no means the best. Maybe part 2 will improve.

title: Well I thought it was good
text: Look, there's a lot to set up. Back story and the introduction of characters... and a whole history to touch on. For those saying it's boring, perhaps you need a movie with more action and less story. Personally, I hate movies like that. Action packed with little to no story.This had a lot to get through so I get why it might seem a little slow in ways. I actually found it interesting and wanted to know more. There's a lot going on and I worried that being a movie, it would rush a lot of it, but I found it was well balanced with both action and story. The graphics were good and over all I found it entertaining.

title: Perfect
text: Maybe the closest thing to a "Perfect" movie I have ever seen. Those who rate it low are too busy comparing it to other films (one saga in particular) to appreciate this masterpiece as it's own work of art. If this movie had come out at a different time, or that other series did not exist, it would be the biggest movie in history bar none!From writing to cinematography to FX this movie leaves nothing to be desired.The story is rich, yes it has similarities to other stories before it, but what movie doesn't? Zack manages to build a storyline for a ragtag team without wasting precious run time but while still giving the audience enough to understand each character's unique motivations.The cinematography is the amazing enthralling beauty that Zack Snyder has become known for, and is made even greater by the absolutely stunning VFX work.I almost always leave a movie with some 2-3 points that I wish they had done better, and I'm very critical of everything (much to the annoyance of those accompanying me) but this...this was one I walked away from with full satisfaction and anticipation of the next part.I eagerly await part 2.

title: Rebel of a Review
text: After reading other reviews about bad acting, bad dialog, etc,. I'm glad I watched it first so I wasn't confused thinking I was watching the wrong movie.Two hours of entertainment. Period. The CGI was very good. I was expecting much lower quality and was pleasantly surprised.It did seem to get a bit lost on the quest to "get warriors" as they were only getting one at a time, then when they did find the rebels, the total was at best a dozen fighter craft and nothing big enough to take on the Gaze.Overall, I enjoyed the time spent, and that's the whole purpose of watching movies. Looking forward to the expanded release and part two.

title: Don't quit on it yet
text: I don't understand why the such harsh reviews, whilst there are explosions after explosions and a fairly poor plot i think this movie has real potential and it would be sad if Netflix drop it. I agree it is a mix of star wars, avatar and gladiator but whats wrong with that they are all block busting movies. I think it would be better off a tv series or an longer build up to a string of movies like star wars giving it a stronger foundation as it does seem a bit rushed, just too much has happened in the two hours. Either way I personally loved it and cant wait for part two, and hopefully a 3,4 and 5.

title: If you like fun, watch it
text: Any user reviewer saying this movie is bad is trying to mimic the no-fun hypocritical movie critics. Is it cheesy at times? Without a doubt. Does it keep you on the edge of your seat though? AbsolutelyMy favorite thing to do is to look at all of the 1/10 reviewers' past reviews. If they like bland indie movies and hate unanimously loved/good movies, then I will give their negatively ranked movie a go. This was one of those movies, and the formula worked.The acting is solid and the vision is new. Game of Thrones fans will get a kick out of Dario Naharas vs Dario Naharas with a sprinkle of a Dothraki soldier.Critics also hate the amount of slow motion used, but if slow motion is used in some indie anime movie they call that acceptable.It's by no means a top 10 movie of 2023 but the review bombs by all of these losers are people that hate good ole fashioned fun. It is ambitious and tries to combine Star Wars with 300, Vikings and the magnificent 7, and somewhere in between you appreciate the movie unless you go into it wanting to hate it like most critics do.If you like fun, watch rebel moon.

title: A really interesting Sci Fi flick with cool characters and amazing visuals, why all the hate?
text: So the movie isn't perfect but you people giving this a 1 or a 4, seriously? The visuals are absolutely stunning, the characters and creatures are sometimes jaw droppingly cool and unique! So it isn't the perfect movie and could have had some more background character development, it was still a stunning visual treat for your eyes and a good Sci Fi movie in its own right.I watched the whole movie and wasn't bored for a second. Makes me think these comments are fake or put here for alterior motives. You guys don't know what a truly horrible movie is that's for sure but just definitely not this!If you love science fiction movies you should definitely check this one out! I haven't seen anything like this for quite some time and perfectly quenched my thirst for Sci Fi!

title: Rey Skywalker who?
text: Ignore the haters bashing this movie because they think it's fashionable to dislike Zack Snyder or his loyal following this Movie and franchise is a must watch!I'll kick things off with the Director, this is pure Zack Snyder, the angles, the color grading, the impeccable visuals and of course the slow-mo, brilliant!The cast, Sofia Boutella as Kora is the kick ass strong female lead that Rey only wishes she could be! The fight sequences are incredible and her acting is precise for the character!This is a Part one and should be viewed through that lense, it is setting up for a massive world, characters and Lore all while providing the necessities of a good movie to indulge in; enjoy it as I did!

title: Really enjoyed Rebal Moom part one!
text: I really think there must be a Directors cut that is much longer. You have an awesome Director and awesome cast. Enjoyed it from beginning to end. Not sure why it got such low reviews.I really dislike movies that are part one and then a whole another part two. Unless they come out at the same time, it seems like there was a lot more to the story that did not get told, some more backstory on each character would have been nice. I think that is the biggest problem with the low scores and also because it's "part one" of there's not a true ending to the story.There was a great plot twist that I did not see coming and I will watch it again when part two comes out. I really hope they make it Directors cut that is longer with more backstory.

title: Not one of Snyder's best movies, but I had a really fun time
text: I heard and read negative reviews for this movie so I was a bit trepidacious when I turned this movie to stream on Netflix. So I tried my best to lower my expectations before watching this movie. I was surprised at how much I liked this movie. They basically took the storyline of "Seven Samurai" and the hero gathering like "Mass Effect 2" to really try and flesh out the characters that are being recruited. I thought some of the standout heroes were Kora, Nemesis, Jimmy, and Tarak who had a bit more complicated characteristics, but they didn't develop Aris, Bloodaxe, and Titus enough - although Bloodaxe does have an amazing standout action scene towards the end of the movie. I also thought it was pretty cool of Snyder to bring Michiel Huisman/ Ed Skrein (the infamous recasting of Daario Naharis from "Game of Thrones") being in the same movies as opponents. Skrein definitely tries his best to bring out his inner Col. Hans Lands from "Inglorious Bast*****," and although he is no Christoph Waltz he does a good enough job to make him a hateful villain. Also, I like how the movie throws you a curveball and it seems like the movie will end with a fight like it's Seven Samurai, but the ending in this movie gives this movie its own uniqueness and even some shock factor. I liked this movie so much I am watching it again this morning!

title: This movie is fantastic and definitely a must-watch!
text: The movie was the best I've seen in a long time!It's like a blend of Star Wars: Rogue One and Game of Thrones, but better.The story is fantastic within an incredible universe. The fight scenes are remarkable. Both the main hero and the villains are portrayed amazingly. The visuals are of the highest quality.The only downside I could mention is that almost all the villains are portrayed as white, while the heroes are from diverse backgrounds-literally one representing each minority. It might be due to Netflix's agenda, which seems a bit forced.It's absurd that "critics", who praised movie like Barbie and serie like LOTR as good, rated this movie poorly. It's a complete joke and doesn't accurately represent its quality.I'm eagerly anticipating more movies like this in the future. This is the best sci-fi movie I've seen yet, and it's just a teaser for what's to come.

title: Magnificent 7 In Space!
text: I enjoyed it, I enjoyed Mag 7 old and new also tho, I watched this on a theater screen in VR and it was an action packed sci-fi that I haven't already seen two dozen times, it had everything you would want in a space sci-fi movie but yes it was a bit generic and the casting wasn't spot on, the slow motion action scenes were a bit much, there were times where I was thinking if I see one more slowmo scene I'm gonna scream but I stuck with it and it's a good start to a decent sci-fi series and we don't have nearly enough of those coming out, so I'm just glad we got this, big budget, big names albeit some I didn't agree with but some of them were spot on and kicked major ***, you know who I speak of if you watched and enjoyed it, here's hoping the second one gets more people on board with it and chills out on the slowmo scenes, for the love of baby J please use normal speed unless it actually is an epic scene and there is no way we would catch everything that is happening. The end.

title: Good future flim
text: The movie is so awesome. Some peoples not understand and rechargeable in mindset. This movie is very excited and two much hard work to the team crews. Very good movie must watchable movie to all people. Instead of establishing and repeating the same flavor, we are presented with a sci-fi-tasting menu of increasing complexity. The first film acted as a setup for what's to come, with Kora gathering a variety of intergalactic warriors to help defend the moon of Veldt. Its follow-up promises a larger focus on action, something that might help make the second movie more exciting than the first. However, while Rebel Moon - Part One's ending sets up a memorable battle, the lack of story and character development in the film may cause Part Two to be less emotionally resonant than it could be. However, it's still possible the movie's director's cuts will end up getting more positive reviews, since they'll be more complete films aligned with Snyder's vision. However, Rebel Moon's reliance on sci-fi tropes seen time and time again appears to be a fundamental issue with the movie as a whole. This means it will still feel generic even if its story and characters become more well-developed. It remains to be seen just how different the R-rated versions of the movies will be, and if they can bolster critical reception.

title: It's great and something different
text: Lots of terrible review but actually watching it I thought it was fantastic. It's needing to introduce a new complete universe and some people thing the development was rushed. I thought it had a good balance between action and background. People would complain if he spent the movie just on development and didn't let it stand on its own.It would need to be over three hours long to get the development and action in so I thought Zac synder actually such a good balance.I feel like I was left 'up to speed' with the universe background as well as enjoying a good movieI'm sure people who actually like sci fi and open to new takes will enjoy this movie. I certainly did.

title: Rebel Moon Part One Review by Cole Kennedy
text: Rebel Moon Part One distinguishes itself as a noteworthy cinematic endeavor by masterfully amalgamating elements of thrill and amusement. The film's measured pacing in its opening sequences serves as a deliberate narrative choice, gradually laying the groundwork for the unfolding drama. However, the narrative dynamics undergo a significant transformation with the introduction of compelling and nuanced antagonists, injecting a palpable energy that propels the storyline forward.In juxtaposition to the widely criticized trajectory of Disney's Star Wars, Rebel Moon emerges as a refreshing departure, rectifying perceived deficiencies and providing a cinematic experience more aligned with audience expectations. The film effectively sidesteps the pitfalls of its cinematic predecessor, crafting a narrative that resonates with authenticity and resonant storytelling.While some discerning viewers might identify moments of contrivance in the choreography of fight sequences, wherein each character's strengths are seemingly spotlighted, these instances, upon closer examination, contribute to the film's overall strategic narrative. Rather than mere gratuitous displays, these moments serve as deliberate choices by the director, enhancing the depth of character exploration and ultimately enriching the viewer's connection with the protagonists. Overall, I give the movie 8.5 stars out of 10.

title: Great sci-fi, ignore the Zac Snyder hate campaign
text: Blown away visually, well done sci-fi that gives homage to the sci-fi of old , great cast.There's always haters of new sci-fi but this is truly a masterpiece and people who have left low scores will live to regret.A future sci-fi classicReady for part twoZac Snyder a true geniusJust remember some people slated the Godfather .This film would be awesome at the cinema , my advice would be watch on the biggest tv you have or buy a new one not something you can watch on a tablet or phone.Ignore or negatively about accents and slow motion that spoil the film , most films today have people for all walks of life and they have accents and fight scenes are better in slow motion.Also ignore the magnificence seven reference , no similarities what so ever.

title: Another Amazing Zack Snyder Epic
text: I loved everything about this movie, the story, the action, the actors were perfectly chosen and Zack Snyder ALWAYS delivers. I always scratch my head when I see negative reviews like this from people. I understand Zack's style or even SciFi in general might not appeal to you...why watch it then? You always know what you're going to get with Zack Snyder and if it is any your cup of tea, then pass on it. It cracks me up when I see people bagging on a gem like this...I mean what exactly does it take to entertain you? This type of movie couldn't have been done 15-20 years ago. With CGI advancing the way it has I want to see more moody, epic action like this.

title: Anything with synder! 10/10
text: When synder drops a banger of a sci-fi its definitely worth a worth, firstly starts of slowly but action starts then slows down but I guess you remember there's two parts so first is setting the story.Writing is great I gotta admit, NOONE CAN WRITE AND DIRECT women lead better than ZACK, if you watched sucker punch and wonder women the Amazons in ZS JL compared to other female directors with female lead they just have no clue.Charlie hunman just felt like he did not want to in the movie at all but I guess once you read the script and realise you are another just expendable character only have a few scenes I guess just show up for a pay check then why not..Part 2 will definitely have more to offer I reckon! Overall this movie will age well give it some time just all of zacks movies.

title: Mind blowing!
text: Great movie. Loved the cinematic scenes. CGI was awesome apart from some scene where it felt it could be better. The character building of main character girl Kora is amazing. Loved it. But other characters where short on their build up. About the team they all teamed up so quickly, i thought it would take a bit more convincing to recruit them. And their aims are so bad .they are top notch fighters arnt they. Overall, these are just some things which i dont say are bad but could have been better to have. Loved this movie, hyped to the build up. This universe is going to be epic. Highly Recommended!

title: Too much hate and probably wrong expectations...
text: We have had a lot movies that flopped just because people had the wrong expectation, like expecting it to be a serious movie with smart plot when it was designed to be for kids... a faced a friend that was giving a lot of hate to a Disney movie... Told him you forget it's a Disney movie designed to sell toys... then he admitted that his hate was unwarranted... It's like watching IP man and expecting it to be about networking...So I just think this is just another case of that...A movie designed to be simple show for the entire family for your brain to unwind was watched withe the expectation to be another serious adaptation of Dune, only for adults...

title: Doesn't break the mold but is absolutely entertaining
text: The low reviews all seem to point to lack of imagination on the story, but I've seen numerous higher acclaimed sci fi thrillers be higher acclaimed, and less entertaining or well executed.The characters fit the narrative well, the world building is on par with many well loved sci fi epics, and the action sequences, while spaced out possibly too few throughout the movie, are extremely well put together and orchestrated to a T.I'm a very big fan of origin stories when it comes to franchises and stories, and this one does well to articulate why characters such as Kora and Gunnar act and grow in the movie the way that they do.Snyder and the production/writing/directing team don't break any new ground or change the mold on movies of this genre, and they shouldn't have to for it to be good. The fact is that is well choreographed, well acted, well executed, and edited with popcorn blockbuster flair. It's not the best sci-fi epic of all time, but it's certainly worth multiple watches and I think it warrants further diving into the universe that it's created.

title: Completely enjoyed
text: Can't really comment on Snyderverse; CGI, other comments.What I watched was a thoroughly enjoyable sci-fi tribute to "Seven Samurai" and " Magnificent Seven". The story arc and characters began to roll out nicely; with every reason to believe they will further flesh out in Part 2.Having said that it was a nicely complete story in and of itself. Characters you embraced as ones you cared about...or ones you despised; a Star Wars quality robot and a great fantastic flying creature that both bring engaging emotions, a similar emotional connection to the resistance backstory through individual histories of horror; very nicely composed and timed music to heighten each scene. I thought the story flowed well; rose to an excellent ending, and lent itself to a great part one ending... promising more in part 2.Have I seen something like this before?? Sure, but come on... writers and directors have thrived revisiting David and Goliath; revenge and self sacrifice, wonderful support characters as far back as stories have been written.I think Snyder has come up with a wonderful retelling, with a very good characters and an equally good cast, excellent production, costume design, music scoring and editing.Top notch entertainment!

title: Zack Snyder never disappoints
text: Visually pleasing, and epic story telling as well as beautiful fighting scenes.Front the characters background, introduction and tiny development we can only stay immersed in their journey to fight against their oppressors. There are still a lot of questions unanswered but i cannot wait for part 2, which in my opinion is extremely promising.Zack Snyder never disappoints when it comes to movie directing and realizations. He always transports us to other dimensions and worlds. I would recommend everybody to watch it and not pay too much attention to the critics reviews, because they barely reflect the potential and Beaty of this movie.

title: Pretty decent Star Wars could have been
text:
Firstly, DO NOT LISTEN TO ALL THE NEGATIVITY, for some reason we are going through an age where massive negativity gets views, reads, clicks and then actually takes down a film or series before it has begun
So, this film, I watched with my wife who is a bit super heroed out like most of us but I explained that Zak Snyder had written a trilogy as a Star Wars story then adapted it to his own stand alone universe story, nothing wrong with avoiding the Disney effect I think. That said, he wouldn't have the same budget or resources and this is what some negative reviews unfairly pick up on.The story is somewhat predictable in areas from a possible Star Wars story but it is very enjoyable, a decent intro into their backgrounds and enough information given about the story ark.But, I wanted to know more about the over thrown royal family, and, who may become a character, the kings daughter if she survived.Yes, not the most refined that it could have been when you compare to the justice league but decent enough to want more, understanding enough to know there has to be a beginning
So less hate, enjoy it as a film, a piece of art and expressions of a story
Enjoy.

title: Zack Snyder take a bow
text: Where to start, for me this was one of the films I have been looking forward to this year and I was not disappointed. The way he has started to create this universe is breathtaking. The story unfolds at a great pace and the fact its done in two parts means it does not have to rush. We all know this is what he wanted to bring to the Star Wars universe but its so much more then that, I found myself bing realy pulled in to the story and some of the action scenes as brillianty done. For me Zack Snyder is one of the best at telling these kind of storys. The cast was a great mix and everyone of them brings something to the story you dont feel like they are just there to make up the numbers. For me this film is a solid 10/10 and I can not wait for Part 2 and hopfuly more after that.

title: Great potential to set up a new universe
text:
The character development, plot, squences, action scenes, twists, acting and screenplay are all great. If we pause a second and think objectively, this first movie started something with a huge potential to set up a new universe like star wars or something different.Actor and actress were perfect fit for the roles ans expecting a lot more from these characters in the next upcoming movies.I was worried with initial reviews and actually rarely write a review but it seemed like an "organized campaign" against this movie or against Zack. The movie is great. It is not complete since it is the stepping stone and intro to Zack's vision.I bet second one will go deeper in characters with great action to set up a 3rd deeper movie.It is Zack's style and storytelling to do in stages. And this may be different to many audiences' expectationGreat movie
10/10
It has one of best potentials to go any direction with endless possibilities.

title: Ignore Most of These Reviews
text: I don't know why this film is receiving so many negative scores. I think there's a group who just review bomb any Zach Snyder movie.Is it the greatest sci-fi movie ever made? No.Is it a good movie with a large budget, good cast and solid effects? Yes.I watched this movie with my 12 year old son on Boxing day after deciding to ignore the reviews and watch it anyway, and I'm glad I did. I enjoyed it, he enjoyed it, and I'll watch the 2nd one when it comes out in the next few months as well.The movie has a solid cast and the scenery is well done. The only legitimate complaints any one could have is that the film doesn't go into full detail on the main characters past, but this is obviously because it's to be expanded upon in the later additions to the series.The other complaint anyone might have is the slow-mo fight scenes are, well, pretty much every fight scene, but this is Zach Snyder's style and you either enjoy it or you don't, but it doesn't take away from the overall movie.In short, the movie is very enjoyable, and the lore it hints at or delves into is very interesting, and I think the reviews are being unfairly critical of what is a decent part one of a series.

title: I'm starting to think a lot people are not able to follow a complex movie anymore.
text: This was a stunning movie.The acting from faces we know and faces we don't were all equally well done.Given that yes, they packed a lot of story and characters into it, it was still easy to follow each of them, and the plot. I can see how some people might have lost what was happening if they stopped paying attention for a bit. It is a movie to watch for the first time, with no distractions, especially if you're going to do a review on it.But it never slowed or got boring, something was always moving forward.The special effects were seamless and the world itself was beautiful. And the imagery... I must have commented out loud about it no less than 5xs.It was refreshing to see something come out of Hollywood that wasn't the same old characters or a remake or sequel. And yet it had a familiarity from some of it's inspiration sources that was comforting.My only critique was too much slow motion. But that seems like hardly a mention at this point.I look forward to Part 2.

title: A Stunning Good Vs Evil Movie
text: I just finished watching Rebel Moon. I give it a 9.1/10. My first impression was the visuals were stunning. It's compared to Star Wars but I think it holds its own. It looks better than Star Wars. The fight scenes looks incredibly natural. Kora made me believe what she was fighting for. Sofia Boutella's acting was quite good. I think she has the potential for more. I read some reviews about a bad or unsatisfying cliffhanger ending. I don't know what these people are talking about. It feels like a standalone movie. I feel satisfied but I also like the Part 2 trailer made me want to see the second movie. I'm just glad I don't have to wait one year for it. Also, the twist was unexpected. The heroes had back stories that could be explored further in the future. I'm really happy Netflix chose to bump up the premiere. Just watch it. You won't be disappointed.

title: Looking forward for Part 2
text: It's a film with a very interesting concept, although not new. The idea of an empire and a rebellion has been visited before. However, it is understood that it is a story based on this idea. The performances are very good with a few exceptions. The action scenes do not disappoint and go hand in hand with what Zack Snyder has accustomed us to. At times the CGI is a bit bad, however, these little things are not so obvious. An Honorable Mention to Ed Skrein's performance, which is entertaining and magnificent throughout the film. Its a great movie to watch with friends and Family but not for Kids.

title: I don't understand the hate for this
text: Admittedly it wasn't perfect and there is room for improvement but I really did enjoy this.It isn't easy find good sci-fi films so I was surprised at how well put together this is. I didn't even know about the hate towards Zack Snyder so I didn't start watching this expecting it go be like some of his previous film that some other reviewers thought were bad.There is plenty of action with a definate likeness to Star Wars and with a good storyline to it too.The plot of rebels coming together to save a planet is a familiar plot but there was enough added into the plot so it wasn't a remake of Star Wars or Magnificent Seven.

title: The reviews are right. But I still liked it.
text: I myself struggled to watch it until the end. I actually watched in three separate 45 minute sessions. I'd like to judge it as a comic book inspired movie, with lots of intentionally ridiculously EXAGERATED characters, scenes and characters a la Robert Rodriguez' Sin City.Yes, it's a Star Wars wannabe movie, yes the acting is bad, yes the writing is most of the times bad. But I like the premise of the story and if you shut down your analytical brain for a bit and try to immerse yourself in the universe Snyder built you might end of liking it. This movie has a tremendous amount of potential, and I'm looking forward to episode 2 and hope it'll be continued after that as well. I'm giving it an 8 to bump the score up a bit and counter the 2 or 3 reviews.

title: This film should have gone to theaters.
text: This film has a good script, well rounded characters and plenty of good and evil "people". The backstory is explained as the film progresses but there is much more to the main character than meets the eye. The special effects are top notch quality and quite creative. The film has a lot of relatable characters, but double crosses and traitors around. There is a cyborg with a heart as it seems and I would bet he features more heavily in part two. Pay attention for the spider battle, it is quite good! I know this is not getting the greatest reviews but it is the best sci Fi film I have seen in ages! I love the genre and if you give this film a chance you will like it.

title: Great enjoyable start
text: Very watchable and entertaining.I think this has been unfairly review bombed by star wars and Zack Snyder trolls.Ignore that this was once might have been an idea for the star wars franchise. Ignore if you have opinions on Zack Snyder.Just press play and enjoy the movie without bias.Even ignore that this is a part one of two - this part is very watchable on its own - and of to a great start building - if not characters - then team and skillset for part two.The story itself is very tight and easy to understand - and pleasently without tons of lore and backstory.So - if you are not an elitist, but just want to be entertained - without the could've, should've and would've.Sit back - press play - and be enjoy.

title: Amazing
text: I don't fully know what makes a movie truly great but rebel moon definitely exceeded my expectations. I was worried with it being a Netflix film but after watching it, I can't wait for the second one. If you're a person that doesn't enjoy slow paced movies, this one may not be for you. Although, the actions scene, the plot, the cinematic shots, and so much more will make up for the slower pace. One of the most interesting parts was the slow motion scenes and how clear everything was, it felt like I was there. The music choices are perfect and I've never heard the style before. One thing that could've been done better would be the way people die because almost every time, whatever they were killed by will not leave a mark on the. Like a gun annd an mnife shoule leave obvious cuts annd whatever else, but the fist to fist combat was perfect. Overall, a solid 9/10.

title: It's not Star Wars but it's better than Justice league
text: Its a movie that has a beginning a middle and an end that keeps you off your phone for 2 hours and lets you drift of your reality! Don't expect life changing performances but it has some good casting if you ask me! And remember it's only part 1! It's a new franchise and we all know how hard that is for fans to show actual Interest but it tries to have a deeper story to talk to yours emotions and reach a certain level of understanding to why everything but it has some loopholes there (perhaps the backstories should have been a little or a lot more)! To conclude say what you want but I really want to see the second chapter!

title: What movie did everyone else watch?
text: I thought this was a pretty entertaining movie. I read bad acting? It had an insane cast that did a solid job. Yes it has a Star Wars feel so maybe that makes ppl mad. I thought it was fun and entertaining. Beasts and creatures are cool and look good. Visuals are great. I can't wait for part 2 to see where the story goes. I'm literally blown away to see under a 6 on this movie. A mid 7 at the absolute lowest. How often do we get a sci fi movie that's well made with an allstar cast with what looks to be a solid budget. Especially for a movie that came out of nowhere (for me) I was very impressed and entertained! Deserves a lot better then a 5. That's all I have to say.

title: Positive Vibes on Rebel Moon
text: I loved it. Had low expectations. Loved the characters and the scenes. Many whiney types seem to pick apart everything. It WORKS. Just enjoy it. Highly recommended.This movie gets one thing right- a strong villian character who you can really relish giving some justice to. Ed Skrein is wonderful as the imperial villian who is almost likable in his joyous evil! This is a space OPERA and "big" charactere are a must. His evil stick is a fierce and personal weapon.Sophia Boutella as Kora is my favorite character, the hero, and central to the plot. A former Imperial who was taken as a child and trained in combat. She is beautiful and has a noble dignity. She knows the peaceful farming community she inhabits will not survive it's encounter w the Empire. So she hastily heads off to find alliesA great aspect of Rebel Moon is the different worlds and characterd Kora finds. Every ally she finds I loved! Great characters all. Even the tricky rogue.So, to summarize-see this film. Don't nitpick every detail. Remember, it's a space fantasy. In terms of freshness and good acting it's at least in the ballpark of the first Star Wars. Although, it's a bit more intense and combat driven. This is part one. I look forward to part two, in April 2024.

title: Captivating
text: Immersive and thrilling, Rebel Moon offers an experience that seamlessly blends futuristic visuals with heart-pounding action sequences. The narrative is simple yet captivating, transporting the audience to new and fascinating worlds. The choreographed action scenes are visually spectacular and serve to drive the plot, keeping the audience on the edge of their seats. From start to finish, the pacing is expertly handled, ensuring an exciting and thoroughly enjoyable journey. Furthermore, the film's sound design and musical score enhanced the overall experience. It's a must-watch for fans of the genre.

title: Splendid
text:
Very good! Story growns on you. Actors are good dressed. Its a came of trying who's the best, power and ball's. Must wait for the New serie in april 2024. Hoop it will go up with the story that make it happen. Planes are fighting and go to ware. Gangs are made. Fight and fly. Who is the boss and who is the chicken 🐔. There is a love thing between
some of theme. They must be in peace. April 2024 is the answer and we wait till it is april. Michael Huisman is a very good actor and looking nice. We are proud of him in the Netherlands. Other actors are looking also good. Cast is very well done. Wait and see!

title: Entertaining
text: I read and watch for two reasons, to learn or to be entertained. I enjoyed this and was entertained, regardless of what the "critics" say....those who can, do, those who can't are critics.I can see a great new franchise coming from this, and I for one welcome that. I can see table top role playing games, books, comics, spinoff, a plethora of fun coming from this. I'm looking forward to the directors cut, and a third installment. This is the type of show I look forward to, and we need more like it. I hope the money people listen to the fans, who want this and not the "critics" who don't have a clue....

title: Hard not to compare to star wars
text: First off this was an outstanding movie with all the above. With out giving any spoilers. The Art, graphics, cinematography so on, spectacular to say the least.I love the main charter is female and beautiful and kick butt one on top of that. It is a great plot and stories with the costumes and each charter was done real well.I don't compare movies to other where they all have there own story to tell. I must say this one is not a star wars type. I think if this movie was out before star wars. This movie would have been top pick and better ratings then I see in here. I do like the story lines in this as well. Cant wait to see the 2nd one! Keep it up. And it is not like a cowboy type movie at all.

title: Cowboy wild west space opera meets seventh samurai
text: I was pleasantly surprised by this movie. It was visually engaging, beautiful actors, and balanced perfectly well between a bigger than life space opera action movie but with a slight cheeky nod to all the other galactic space movies and even some references to the seventh samurai in gathering a group of gunho bunch of heroes. Stylistic it was well edited and payed good attention to detail and comedic effects. Actors sounded mostly european, as I figured that was probably the intention to do so, to give the movie a bit of a film noir cyberpunk styl of vibe, like they did in the movie 5th element or Valerian. All in all it was a pleasant watch and I am eager to watch the second installment of this, well done!

title: Fun romp!
text: This movie is a fun romp across the galaxy! Don't let the haters sway you. Watch it and decide for yourself. 1. The visuals are stunning. Although, at times, a bit cartoonish (I.e. How is that massive waterfall coming from the top of that tiny peak?). 2. The acting is strong-not Oscar-worthy, but they sucked me into the story. 3. The story is basic, but fun. It's oddly similar to Battle Beyond the Stars, with a budget and a top director. 4. The action scenes are AMAZING. 5. EVERYONE kicks ass-men, women, aliens, animals, spider people, etc.I definitely recommend that folks give this a chance. I generally get bored during movies but this one held my attention and now I eagerly await the sequel!

title: Beautiful movie
text:
Strong visual effects and lots of new and interesting characters. Yes there parts that are very predictable and there is not alot of depth but good entertainment and and good fun. I love the weapons and mixture of old and new actors
.. we have been introduced to some awesome new actors and a freash new world that looks very familiar but also something different to what we are used to . It is a very gritty and rough a nice break for the comady bases action movie trying to make you laugh all the time at the expense of of the story that marvel and star war have become recently. Watch and enjoy a good movie.

title: Top quality sci-fi entertainment
text: Rebel Moon is an epic retelling of movie classics Seven Samurai and The Magnificent Seven. This is high class entertainment with movie quality special effects and seat of your pants action. I really enjoyed it having watched both parts at once, and I sincerely don't understand the low ratings some people are giving.If I saw this in the movie theaters I would be very happy with the quality and entertainment. Zack Snyder has delivered an admittedly far fetched but highly entertaining good versus evil story that certainly fulfilled all my expectations and more, considering this was made for Netflix. It deserves to be shown on the big screen.

title: Fills the vacuum Disney left in the star wars (heros journey) big budget film
text: So I sincerely believe that seeing this we know who should have directed the last Jedi. Hands down. And now we are seeing a bunch of paid Disney trolls invading the review board because they know they turned that billion dollar franchise to mush and a new series is stepping in.The film was exciting. Kind of A TON OF WORLD BUILDING smashed into two hours. So many questions to be answered! The robot?? Is he really that actor I can't remember the name of? It was fun and I can't wait to see more it's like gritty star wars with all those fantastic elements of a heros journey and that those samurai movies nailed down. And with more time (it's Zack Snyder) like more feature films oh yeah baby this is gonna entertain!

title: 9/10 really folks (please review your own opinion) There's a war here which we were supposed to see in part 2.
text:
So we have our Rebel moon part 1: A child of fire in Netflix apparently this is the PG 13 cut of the film( expecting to have the directors cut of the rebel Moon part 1 so not making it too long as I need to see more of this rebel moon universe) .I will just say the pacing is very very good,the characters are well played,the dialogues are solid and Amazing directing cinematography. What about vfx and visuals? Is top notch, this is what you expect from Zack snyder The visionary director so for me this is a solid 8.5 no more
or no less manifesting the director which will have more detailed info about the world he built. Go to your Netflix and stream the hell out of it.and review your own opinion
#RebelMoon .8.5/10 (that directors cut is needed )

title: It's great fun, isn't that enough...?
text: So the keyboard warriors have spoken. Again, Zack Snyder's work is found wanting by the great unwashed. Seriously, you can't just enjoy Rebel Moon for what it is because you're too busy complaining about what it isn't? I'll tell you what it isn't, shall I? It isn't dull. It isn't afraid to take a few chances. It isn't afraid to wear its heart on its sleeve. Shall I tell you what it is? It's more fun that the last three or four Star Wars movies....Is it perfect in every possible way? Absolutely not. Is it thoroughly enjoyable in a Flash Gordon, Saturday morning pictures kinda way? Absolutely it is. It has the spirit and sense of joy that Lucas, Kennedy et al lost somewhere around....oh Jesus, I dunno. Return Of The Jedi? It isn't helpful or fair to make too many Star Wars comparisons but it also isn't easy to avoid doing it. Suffice it to say that I'd plump for this over anything Lucasfilm has churned out in a long, long while.See it yourself and make up your own mind. Like a grown up.

title: Visual cosmic delight!
text: Visual cosmic delight! Stylish, impressive, pathetic! The quintessence of the most recognizable space opera techniques in one bottle + Zack Snyder's incomparable style! After oversaturation and fatigue from the dead-end movie comics of Marvel and DC, this film is just it! Definitely better than Episodes 7, 8 and 9 from the Star Wars Universe. From the first frames, it becomes clear that the script was originally intended for the Star Wars Universe and could be on par with Rogue One and Andor. It's difficult to say whether it's unfortunate or fortunate, but modified and placed in his own Universe, he is beautiful and charismatic.

title: "A Bold, Cinematic Odyssey - 'Rebel Moon' Triumphs with Originality and Emotional Depth"
text: "Rebel Moon" is a spectacular space epic that not only pays homage to the classics but also carves out its own distinct place in the sci-fi genre. Director Zack Snyder, known for his visionary storytelling, delivers a masterful blend of action, emotion, and rich world-building in this ambitious tale.The film's narrative heart lies in the journey of Kora, portrayed with depth and resilience by Sofia Boutella. Her character's arc, rooted in a rebellion against the oppressive Motherworld, resonates with themes of freedom and identity. The casting of Charlie Hunnam as Kai, the mercurial pilot, adds layers of intrigue and complexity to the story.Snyder's skill in visual storytelling is evident in every frame. The universe of "Rebel Moon" is meticulously crafted, with attention to detail that immerses the viewer in its unique world. The battle scenes are choreographed with Snyder's signature flair, making them both visually stunning and emotionally engaging.The decision to split the film into two parts allows for a deeper exploration of the characters and the universe they inhabit. This choice pays off, providing a richer narrative and more profound emotional connections. The twist ending leaves viewers eagerly anticipating the next installment, testament to the film's captivating storytelling.While "Rebel Moon" nods to its inspirations like "Star Wars" and "Seven Samurai," it stands firmly on its own merits. It's a refreshing addition to the sci-fi genre, offering a story that's both familiar and entirely new. Snyder's ambition and creativity shine through, making "Rebel Moon" a must-watch for fans of epic science fiction and compelling storytelling.In conclusion, "Rebel Moon" is a triumph of imagination and a testament to the power of original storytelling in cinema. Its emotional core, combined with stunning visuals and dynamic action, makes it an unforgettable experience and a stellar addition to Zack Snyder's filmography.

title: Good start for a new movie series
text: A movie that is better than most things that have been released in a long while. Netflix seem to have done a good job with this movie, with good actors, effects, scenes and story.The movie is part of what looks to be a very well produces movie series. While there is more to be wanting for, the first movie is a good start of an rich scifi world.Good and beautiful worlds and battle scenes.
