Looking forward to the next part.I think most of the people here making bad reviews will never be happy for anything. Many crybabies criticism here. That will critic absolutely everything. I mean go a write for all the countless scifi movies or movies in general that have been bad.

title: Amazing! 10 out of 10
text: I'm not the biggest Zach Snyder fan. I loved man of steel and that was it. But I was really looking forward to seeing this. And I have to say it didn't disappoint. I was completely invested from the start, a brilliant cast, amazing story, the slow motion scenes were a little annoying at times but that's it. If you read this review I hope you decide to give the film a go. Some people just like to complain and moan about anything, if you don't like something don't watch it. Don't moan and complain because you have nothing else to do. Should Zach Snyder see this. Thank you for this incredible story and film. I genuinely cannot wait for part two! And I really really hope this gets a blu ray release because it 100% deserves one. A 1000 times better than anything we have had from Disney Star Wars. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

title: Masterpiece
text: Beautiful cinematography, special effects, story, characters, universe, environments, just an epic movie, Masterpiece. It leaves you wanting more of this epic journey, Zack's imagination is on another level same as his masterful work on the lens, photography etc, after seeing this movie a can't help my self to ask how is it possible that the supposed (professional critics) are giving this beautiful work those poor reviews obviously motivated by only Hate for this man without sense, it is more than clear that in this days (critics) has lost all credibility, just watch the movies, be your own critic and judge for yourself.

title: Looks Great
text: I'm watching it for the second time now. It makes more sense. Zack is a genius storyteller. Everything about this film looks great. The colors are magnificent. It looks very realistic. The only thing I would add to it is more soundtrack music during the fighting. Zack was great with the casting. The villain was someone you really wanna hate. There was something for everybody here. There was plenty of diversity. It was an ensemble hero cast. I love how it's the number one film on Netflix in 61 nations with a big time Hollywood actor/actress leading. It really relied on the story to carry the movie.

title: Great Potential
text:
Overall I enjoyed the movie a lot. I've no idea where all
the hate is coming from, is it Star Wars fans hating anything that's similar to it? Is it because of Synder? Oh well, the movie is great fun, I hope it becomes a nice franchise and I'm looking forward to the next one, hopefully there is one.Kora's (main character) acting skills might be a bit dodgy at times but it's not too bad.I've read some reviews complaining about the plot, well if it annoys you then I don't know what groundbreaking plot you were expecting. It's a nice sci-fi adventure action movie and it's not going to make you think too deeply, and there's nothing wrong with that.Just sit back and enjoy a nice adventure.

title: Excellent Film
text: I cannot say enough good things about this movie. Kora was amazing. She is a natural hero and fighting to get back all of her humanity back. The romance was not forced. It's subtle and has the potential to blossom. I want to know more about Prince Tarak. I wonder what happened to Aris. They should have spinoff series exploring all the other characters. I'm gonna watch it again tomorrow. I wanna see the Director's Cut and Scargiver Part 2 really bad. Glad I don't have to wait long. I had to see this movie before Aquaman. Definitely, Rebel Moon is better than Aquaman The Lost Kingdom. I like both but Rebel Moon stands out.

title: The better Star Wars
text: This film is truly remarkable, with its captivating and intense storyline. Its darker and more violent themes make it a departure from the traditional Disney style, which is not surprising that they declined it. However, it is a truly worthy candidate for inclusion in the Star Wars franchise, as it possesses all the elements that would have made it a perfect fit. While the story may not delve as deeply as some might hope, I found tremendous enjoyment in it. Despite its minor shortcomings in terms of depth, the overall experience was incredibly fulfilling and captivating. Indeed, "a true Zack Snyder masterpiece" perfectly captures the essence of this film.

title: Brilliant
text: I dont often write reviews but sci fi is my favourite and all these people giving bad reviews is mental, i have only watched 45 minutes into the 1st eposide and i love it, it is everything i would expect from a sci fi movie, i do not know what all these Expert reviewers expect from a sci fi movie, its not Star Wars or Riddick but it is really good sci fi, it does have a Star Wars feeling with similar spacecraft and warp speeds so just enjoy without moaning.All the characters are brilliant the droids are the same as Star Wars it does have Star Wars written all over it bit its not so just enjoy.

title: Intensely Vibrant
text: I love this movie. Kora and the rest of the characters are chosen very well. The whole cast looks great. Kora is hot. Tarak is smoking hot. Those abs are to die for. Aris is very handsome. The movie was very stylish and intensely vibrant. The slo-mo action scenes just adds to the intensity. I bet the Director's Cut is more intense. Usually, when a movie makes pay attention, it's very good. This movie makes my blood pressure rise. The twist in the end was surprising. It's too bad they lost a team member or maybe two team members. Not sure yet. The trailer seems to bring one back to life. I can't wait for Part 2. :-)

title: Great movie. Great cinema.
text: A simple story, marvelously delivered. Meanwhile Star Wars is naive space fantasy, Rebel Moon is adult space adventure.Visually perfect in any aspect, specially considering the budget of $80M (less the half of any Marvel movie that looks mediocre), great performances, amazing sound and music, all aspects of what makes a great movie great. This is really CINEMA.The only thing I didn't like is the choice made by Netflix releasing first a PG13 with one hour less version of the movie. I think that hurt the movie and some people that could liked it, didn't. I'm sure that when (if) people what the original Snyder Cut of the movie, they will like it more. In sure I will!

title: Awesome Movie After so much Time I watch to like this type of movie
text: I really enjoyed this movie because I didn't go into it with any expectations or previews. I just went in open minded and ended up liking all the characters and the story. Yeah the setting and the themes are reminiscent of Star-Wars, but Zack executed it in a new way.I really hope that Netflix gets the outcome that they expect out of this so they can make more than just two parts. title: Love it!
text: Completely different from the original series, which pleasantly impressed me, I really wanted to see something more. Captivating, the action keeps you in suspense. It is very well acted, the actors did not disappoint me. It is typical Star Wars, the action taking place in one of many other and different worlds in that distant universe. So, the combination of Steampunk fashion and culture and advanced technology used in interstellar flight is really successful, not all worlds have to be the same. I like Steam Punk culture and so from my point of view, this combination is and was a successful one. I look forward to the sequel. Enjoy!

title: What?? So shocked to see such a low score - Ridiculous!
text: I consider myself a sci-fi fan - all the way from Star Trek to the Star Wars movies. Totally love shows like Edge of Tomorrow, Fifth Element, Contact, The Matrix, etc. This was quite good - great effects, well developed characters, not totally predictable plot line. I'd totally watch it again. Several star actors in the cast made it even better. Every sci-fi has some common elements and though some reviewers counted that as a defect, I don't feel that's true at all. One of the elements that draws in the viewer is the backstory of the main character Kora, who is an amazing combination of farmer rebel, and female warrior. Her choreography in many scenes is spectacular and shows her skills in dance acquired from 20 plus years of high level training.

title: A Truly Enthralling Experience
text: Ever since I heard of Rebel Moon, I was impatiently waiting for its release. I knew I will not be disappointed, because of Snyder's name.There's so much more to movie making than meets the eye. It takes a lot more than just high-budget visual effects to create a masterpiece. The acting, script, plot, direction, cinematography, all work in cohesion. But the most important thing is the art of blending all these elements together in such a way that the viewer gets absolutely immersed in the experience - enjoying every minute of it. I believe very few movie makers have mastered this art - and Zack Snyder is undoubtedly one of them.Kora (Sofia Boutella), a former warrior, wary of violence, had decided to call it quits and live a peaceful life in a small village on a moon of a distant planet. But then, something happens, and she is compelled to fight again - you know - 'don't mess with me - you don't know who I am' kind of thing. We have seen these characters before, but we never get tired of seeing them again - provided all the essential elements of movie making are handled properly, which, in this movie, have been combined exceptionally well - leaving no dull moments at all.I really feel Rebel Moon should have been released in theaters, before becoming available for streaming on Netflix. The reason is that movies like Rebel Moon have lots of cinematic elements - which means that they can be best enjoyed on a big screen with an immersive sound system. Most people watch Netflix on their home TVs, tablets and even smartphones which essentially strips away those theatrical components that make the movie a truly unforgettable visual experience. I am seeing several negative comments and reviews and I feel this might be the main reason.As a Netflix subscriber, I'm so delighted that the streaming service is coming up with such cinematic marvels which are a treat to watch on your home cinema. Can't wait for part 2 in April 2024.

title: Great fun
text: "Rebel Moon" is an exhilarating cinematic experience that takes us the audience on a journey to a distant world filled with action, intrigue, and stunning visuals (The fight scenes with sword and gun are 10/10). Zack Snyder once again proves his mastery in crafting epic stories with this space-faring adventure. The world-building is nothing short of spectacular, it felt familiar and yet still surprising with touches of Star Wars, The 300 and Man of Steel and I was here for every bit of it. This movie is an action/sci-fi lovers dream. Honestly I loved it and my only real critique would be that it should have been a series so that the characters could have had a bit more back story. The acting is fantastic and it's visually striking.I can't wait for part 2.

title: INCREDIBLE
text: I'm leaving this review after watching it for the second time. First time viewing of the movie I felt there were too much left out substance wise , and I felt the pacing could have been better. After my second watch I have a whole new feeling towards it. The movie is absolutely incredible , the atmosphere is just top notch. Everything about the cinematography, sound design, aesthetic, emotional story is simply CAPTIVATING. For this to be a first introduction into a brand new IP we should be all excited for this. I know I am , I cannot WAIT for part 2 ! Bring it on ASAP!P. S. Zack Snyder ftw! 🙌

title: ignore the haters
text: I am very surprised to see bad reviews on this one. People complaining that the director didn't do enough research or that the movie is for kids. Really, people? Go ahead and see for yourselves.Maybe if you are not truly a Science Fiction fan you will not like it. But keep in mind if you enjoyed Star Wars, go ahead and see this one. I enjoyed every minute and I'm waiting for the part two.Like another reviewer said, "the rating is objective" correction man: rating is always subjective. It's your view and your taste. This doesn't necessarily implies that is good. Common, read a bit, think a bit. Peace.

title: Is it trendy to criticize Snyder?
text: Honestly, it's not bad like some reviews say, watch it without negativity... I'm looking forward to part 2.I see a lot of bad reviews, I page Netflix just to watch it, it seems a little slow because they must explain many things since it is practically a new universe and maybe it has too much SlowMotion... but I still loved it... I'm looking forward to the second part.I see a lot of bad reviews, I page Netflix just to watch it, it seems a little slow because they must explain many things since it is practically a new universe and maybe it has too much SlowMotion... but I still loved it... I'm looking forward to the second part.

title: IGNORE THE BAD REVIEWS!!! GREAT SCI-FI ACTION MOVIE!!!
text: I just had watched the new Dune movie last week, and was blown away by it! Saw this movie Rebel Moon was #1 on Netflix and so I wanted to give it a try. I LOVED IT, and cannot wait for Part II! Storyline and plot is incredibly simple, which always makes for the best epic movies. Characters were deep and intriguing. Action sequences were unbelievable and entertaining. Special effects and CGI was off the charts, same as Dune. It is SOOOOO NICE to have AWESOME top tier movie franchises like these two, Dune and Rebel Moon, offering an alternative to the lame and boring Star Wars franchise, which only eve offers us more of the EXACT SAME THING, wrapped up in different packaging... Let me guess, the next Star Wars trilogy is gonna have the 3rd Death Star, and then the 4th Death Star, and then the 5th Death Star??? LoLoLoL. You have NEVER seen anything like Rebel Moon! Dune was amazing as well. I literally cannot wait for the second version of both these movies. I am SHOCKED that Rebel Moon didn't make it into the theaters!?!?!?! It was just as good, if not better than Dune was! I like them both better than any of the Star Wars movies.

title: Very, very fun
text: It's a fun movie. It's fun to look at. It's intense. It's very enjoyable. I liked all of it. I'm excited that there could be more.When I go to watch a movie. I want to have fun. This accomplished that beyond my initial expectations. I'm not typically a fan of Zack Snyder's work, but this was really great.It's a better Star Wars than any Star Wars I've seen lately. It's not a story that is going to blow your mind. It's an action movie in space. Why can't be enough?It's a spectacle, and an impressive one. The cinematography is engaging.What else can I say besides I had a blast watching it the whole time?

title: don't believe the negative propaganda
text: Zack Snyder has done it once again only this time not with an established property and beloved characters but has managed to create a universe of his own.The fact that Disney passed on this story line as part of the star wars universe is a testament to how out of touch they are with the fans. It wouldn't surprise me if the house of mouse hasn't propagated all the negative response to this film in an attempt to cover up such a monumental blunder. Had they seen it through you would no doubt be reading nothing but positive reviews about how this is the star wars film the fans have been waiting for since the empire strikes back. The only disappointing part of the film is that it had to end but luckily there's a second part on its way. I'm excited for the future of this new franchise and hope to see much more of it in the future beyond rebel moon part 2.

title: i watched the full runtime
text: That is pretty rare, usually i watch a 2 hour movie in 1 hour or less because i keep skipping the boring parts.Not to imply that this is just action from start to finish, but rather that it built a good amount of tension that kept me watching.The story is nothing particularly new, just another hero origin story. Its part one, so you are getting some background story and character introductions, as well as some worldbuilding.Sofia boutella is amazing as always and the other characters are also well cast and played, nothing to complain here.I very much enjoy this new dark scifi world that seems like a mix of starwars and warhammer, but is not burdened by the horrible old scifi design where everything looks like a kids-toy.I dont think its a perfect movie, there where little things here and there, but all in all its a recommendation from me and ill be back for part 2 for sure.

title: Fantastic, Great Plot, Writing and Music
text: I watch this Part 1. Weekly by Zack Snyder's brilliant Plot, writing Cinematography!People are entitled to their opinions or paid to be negative. I'm not paid by anyone just a common man who loves a good flick👍 Rebel Moon is up there as one of my Favorites and looking forward to Part 2. Needed to be sooner people forget on dates released later. The Plot and Action with a Story line that Hero's you engaged at all times. Love the Action scenes and MusicGreat acting and actors and the Negative will pass in tome and be one of the Best Films made .The ms in actress is the best like her previous movie her fighting is real.

title: Wonderfull movie
text: This is not a real review, it should be understood more as a collection of impressions on the film.In my opinion, a very beautiful and valid science fiction film which, with a very classic formula, manages to entertain the viewer very well throughout its duration. The science fiction universe created is also very good and holds up very well. So I consider this film quite underrated only because it is not supported by a great science fiction franchise like Star Wars and therefore mistreated by everyone, yes it is true there are many similarities between this universe and that of Lucas but because that imagery has now monopolized science fiction and it is difficult to create something completely new.

title: A Long time ago in a Mythology, far- far-away
text:
This is not a Starwars movie, if anything it's more closely aligned with
WarCraft, Skyrim, LOTR,and others, except there's no dark lord as yet revealed as its mythology is more contextual with Japanese cultural film history, e.g. Kurosama's seven samurai original classic.Which didn't inspire SWars, instead the Magnificent Seven western as I recall.I expected it to be dark with Snyder's flair for the gritty,cruel and unusual
Great cinematic scenes in space and land with unusual aliens without the plasticky face masks A la Lucas...and a lot more critters in this movie with asian lore influences...Wasn't disappointed, hope there's going to be a longer cut, or more content and depth in future parts to be developed, a saga in the making.The usual suspects.. great character actors are present, gleaned
from other movies that did well, and as they are introduced, you then know what to expect.Later on midway what grated a bit was Ed Skrien, the main villain in a London style 80's shirt collar and tie, have a word with the wardrobe dept, and keep it sci-fi,
don't think there's any east end tailors in another galaxy,
looked unfortunately like a pox doctor's clerk.May wanna cut that scene Mr Snyder...But so far so good .

title: Dont read American reviews!
text: Americans do not like anything anymore, its a good movie, not the best. Its not star wars it doesnt try to be so do not compare it to it. Its a good start for a new universe. The first Movie is story building some things go a little fast other things could have used more story, Maybe this will come in the next movies. Some fight scènes could have been better. American reviews are bad they dont like anything anymore. Somehow they have strange expectations and when those are not met the movie is trash. So look for yourself and make your own opinion. Its a good movie and has the chance to become better.

title: This was awesome!
text: From the first moment the movie, started, it became obvious that this was a Snyder movie and I'd love it. The building of the atmosphere, introducing the world and its people, giving us time to love and care for them.And then, action. It came so naturally and was built up so fantastically that it was as if I demanded it and they obliged. It was served on a golden platter, even the most brutal parts delivered elegantly.There were some weird moments, but they all made perfect sense in the end. I usually catch those parts in movies but this time I couldn't and I loved it.In the end, this is a solid action heroes movie with a satisfying story and a promise of a beautiful franchise.I can't wait for April 2024 for part 2.

title: Not bad as other reviews claim
text: This movie is good. Even better then good, because it has great visuals and action sequences. So, I do not understand why we have so meny bad reviews. Ok, it is not perfect, far from it, but it is only part one. It has some Ster Wars elements, yes...but that is not a problem. Problem is that it has a old story (it is 7 samurai, maginificent 7, Battle beyond athe Stars remeke more then Star wars). It easy can be a Star Wars movie, but for adults, it is to violent...and it is not. So, movie is worth of waching, solid fun (after all it is only sf action flick, has no pretend to be artistic masterpiece), so relax and wach it. 2 plus hours of fun for me. Exact grade will be 7.5/10, but I give it an 8 because of other bad reviwes.

title: Overachieving my expectations
text: "Moon Rebel" brilliantly captures the spirit reminiscent of a Star Wars film, while distinctly carving out its own identity. The special effects and cinematography are strikingly well-crafted, reflecting a remarkable degree of professionalism and skill. Yet, the film's narrative sometimes meanders, lacking clear direction; a more focused and tighter editing approach could enhance the storytelling. Notwithstanding these narrative shortcomings, the movie excels in its action sequences. The fight scenes are exceptionally choreographed and executed, offering a blend of excitement and engagement that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. These elements collectively contribute to a cinematic experience that, while imperfect, is visually stunning and action-packed.

title: A world building epic - ignore the haters
text: No spoilers here. Visually amazing, but it also builds a big universe that hints at plenty of backstory that could build into a franchise. Yes it's a mash of Star Wars and plenty of other franchises but I'm here for a new sci-fi IP and it has the potential to be great! Watch it and enjoy it for what it is. Bring on the rated R 3hr versions of both Part 1 and Part 2! Ignore the haters and watch it for yourselves. If it's not for you then it's not for you, but I don't many will regret ignoring the haters and giving it a go. Part 1 builds everything up while Part 2 looks to be *alls to the wall and I can't wait to get more backstory and see where this goes!

title: Stunning visuals, homage to the films it references. Don't believe the bad reviews
text: We get a brand new IP (how often does that happen in 2023?) with fully fleshed out world-building, stunning visuals, great actions, and memorable characters, and people are giving this a 4? Come on.It's true - Rebel Moon clearly pulls strong influence from Magnificent Seven/Seven Samurai. Who cares? It's clearly self-aware in that regard, while still introducing some story twists and political backdrop of its own.The world is something of a space-western/samurai movie, but interestingly pulls some cultural and architectural references from Nordic fare as well (long houses, village elders with braided beards drinking ale, etc.). The action is cool and character driven, ranging from people meant to be reminiscent of cowboys and native Americans to those more of the mythical samurai persuasion.The cinematography and lighting are appealing and intentionally stylized, the character design is interesting, and while the writing isn't Aaron Sorkin, it leans into its fantasy sci-fi world without being campy. A few scenes suffer from looking a little green-screened, but that's quickly forgiven as you're too busy looking at the interesting gritty costumes or wondering what fun new creature will show up next. Plus the action direction keeps things kinetic, physical, and story-driven as opposed to just a bunch of shots of people pointing guns at each other.Some say "the plot doesn't go anywhere". I disagree, but even at that, it doesn't hide that it's a "part one". This film is about introducing you to its interesting universe while giving each of the characters in the ensemble their "moment" to set up what comes next. Relax and enjoy that about it.Don't believe the bad reviews. Rebel Moon is a well crafted adventure set in an interesting world with stunning visuals. It's a new IP that knows its roots and sets up what comes next. Have fun with it.

title: Great movie recommend watching it without prejudice, gave it 9.
text: It's embarrassing to read so many negative comments on the movie which I believe they are biased by comparing it with other sequels of the same nature. We have to give the actresses, producers and director a lot of credit to make such a great movie in all aspects. Please fellows be more realistic and objective rather than subjective in evaluating movies with big productions and amazing post productions. I have rated this movie with a 9 as being more than fair and I'm looking forward for part two which I hope will be on Netflix and in theaters the soonest possible which I'm sure the director and producers will overcome any snags that would have occurred.

title: Straight fire 🔥!!
text: It's pure unadulterated fun. Like a mix of 300. Game of thrones and the Matrix all in one but in space. No convoluted confusing storyline just straight to the point. Recruit the rebels to make a stand against the corruption and chaos of a massive dictatorship. It's Snyder movie so its a must re-watch to catch all the good stuff you missed the time. I'm on my 3rd watch right now and I'm still catching stuff i missed the the first two times. Can't wait for the next installment to dive into the past of some of the other rebels on this team. Their definitely an interesting cast of characters im ready for more of.

title: Ignorance is bliss I guess?
text: Never reviewed a movie. So, there's that. Saw a commercial and took a look. Saw bad reviews when it was starting and usually I'd listen and turn it off. Seems I don't watch enough movies to have such a critical eye as others. I don't tend to look at movies "relative" to something else. It's like wine. I either like it or not. Idk about all the technicalities. I don't get StarW comparisons and wasn't looking for it either. Not overexposed to "slow mo" so found it quite cool. Bottom line. I couldn't stop watching. Loved it! I'm simple. The whole time I'm thinking wtf is wrong with people? Weird.

title: Very intensive first hour
text: I really loved the first hour. The evil is very intense and brilliant played. Last time I was so catched by a film was Batman vs. Superman. I don't see any parallels to Star Wars (Who is Luke, Lea and Han and where is Darth Vadar?). A thousend year kingdom is not the 20 year empire of Palpatine. Netherless after that hours the film is the SiFi version of the 7 Samurai, which is not bad but a little bit implausible. You can't feel the motivation of the fighters to follow Kora. On the other hand is the action and the fights on high level and for a Netflix production great. A very enjoyable film and I am exciting for the second part.

title: Rebel Moon Part 1 > The Batman
text: Both are blatant rip offs of older more successful films. The only difference is this was always supposed to be Zack Snyders Seven Samurais Star Wars, this was always the plan. People going into it expecting something else and then getting upset about it make no sense. Whereas, The Batman should've been something new and fresh, yet we got the most simple and safest take on the character, didn't take a single risk, and literally just ripped off some other movies and used the name batman, but everyone loved and praised that. I really don't understand this unnatural amount of hate for Snyder and his movies. At least Snyder adds his own style to the films he makes, which is more than can be said about other directors that get praised for copying other movies. Lets not forget that Rebel Moon is a netflix release, with a more definitive directors cut still to be released, and people are acting like this is the finalized version. Did people not learn from BvS and Justice League? Or are people just looking to hate for the fun of it? Because i can say for sure that i don't go out of my way to watch movies made by directors that i don't like the style of, and don't understand why anyone would, unless its just to hate.

title: Wow
text: Just wow , I'm absolutely flabbergasted and frustrated , at the herd following some primitive critics and afraid to have a modicum of independent thinking and taste !!! Giving this film 10 , just to compensate for all the inadequate ratings , given to it by plebs ) My real rating would be a very strong 7... It is a very well made film , with a storyline , which can be compared with Dune and Star Wars . Strangely enough , I like it more than Dune and definitely more than forever overrated Star wars drivel . Acting is fine , signature directing from Mr. Snyder , pleasant mutation of 7 samurais with Dune ! Brilliant !!! Highly recommended for those , who still have some brain cells left , to not necessarily agree with majority )

title: Great sci-fy, nothing to do with SW... :)
text: First of all, this movie has nothing to do with Star Wars. I think its a good movie within its genre, i like how it was mixed with a few fantasy elements. The first movie introduces the heroes and the conflict. As an improvent feedback: the main femail character could be stronger both physically and acting wise. Other then that strong casting. Picture work is also amazing, usual Snyder style. The touch of unexpected turns and the hippie robot was very nice, i appriciated. Cant wait the second movie in april, i nope we will learn mire about the backstory as well. The movie trys to introduce us a huge universenand a lot of details were missing still, but i guess we are used to universe building via serieses which can not be compared to an all night movie.

title: Superb movie
text: Well done Netflix, this is the quality of movies you should be churning out but a little disappointed that it wasn't the Directors cut which would have been a bigger win for you and your audience.Very good story, great acting, superb visuals and amazing fight scenes, truly a classic in the making. Looking forward to the second installment.This easily challenges Star wars franchise and is on par and definitely fresher with endless possibilities if Netflix carries on investing in the franchise.Critics that rated low clearly have no understanding of what the audience wants and enjoy, these critics are negative people with no appreciation of a quality movie.

title: Oh man, if Sci-fi is what you like...
text: This is a Sci-fi fun fest. Right off the bat you start to care about these people. Their homes, their lives, their passions. Their families and their world. Then all that you care about, is in danger, and it's real, ugly, mean, mess up your whole world kind of danger. Let the battle begin!Fascinating worlds, strange beings, amazing graphics and big, wild battles in the stars. These warriors are also wild and each "big" in their own way. Kora is one of the biggest and baddest! A fierce fighter and leader, of a band of the wildest, butt kicking bad asses ever assembled!What's not to like? The ride is fantastic, fierce, big, imaginative and beautiful.I want to go again!!

title: Not every movie is The Shawshank Redemption.
text: The title says it all. Rebel Moon: A Child of Fire is an awesome sci fi movie with great action and great slow motion scenes. I recently watched both films and i thought they were cool. It definitely doesn't compare to something like Star Wars or Dune, but it is a great film. I don't understand all the hate. This film isn't supposed to "change the film industry" like people think every movie should. At the least this movie should have a 7.0 or maybe 6.7, but 5.6? Really? At this point people are just hating on Zack Synder which makes zero sense. If you love movies like 300, Watchman, or the 4 hour cut of the Justice League, you will enjoy this film.In conclusion, don't expect every film to be The Dark Knight or The Godfather because there not gonna be that level. Just have fun with movies. If the movie is good or bad it still won't change the way your life is.

title: A mix between Star Wars and Chronicles of Riddick
text: I really don't see why there are so many bad reviews for this movie. Were they watching what I watched? This movie was entertaining and had some twists that I didn't see coming. I was engrossed to the k look last minute and loved the cast they put together for this.The acting was great, the special effects were great and we already knew from the title that it's part 1. I found it refreshing to have some different characters rather than the same old Star Wars and Super hero movies.The best way ti describe it would be Star Wars meets Chronicles of Riddick. I can't wait to see the next instalment of this series.

title: Enjoyable space opera, even if derivative
text: I'm a bit surprised by the viciousness of many of the films critics. Even though I agree with many of the criticisms.... It's derivative, the initial aggression against the first village required much more cost and effort than would be retuned in resources, it steals heavily from Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, the Seven Samurai and all of its remakes... BUT it looks good. This more closely resembles pulp inspired space opera than most recent sci-fi movies. The action set pieces are well choreographed and the colour palette is attractive and resembles high end graphic novels. There are MANY good films that are derivatives or remakes. Yes, there are some lazy narrative choices but all in all I really enjoyed this and while I respect others may disagree with me, I think many of the critics who have cranked up the bile and the negative superlatives are just examples of the polarisation of discourse where some people think they have to mark to extremes to make a point.

title: Great movie
text: Seriously I don't understand all the bad reviews, this movie is great! People need to understand this movie wasn't put in the theaters for a reason, it's a Netflix movie. And for a Netflix movie that was never in the theatre it's a 10/10, it was exciting fun and new! Me and my wife love watching movies and have seen almost every movie out there, so when this came out we didn't have any expectations and it was great! Right after watching it we were immediately looking forward to the second part. Ngl it feels like people are giving this movie bad reviews for other reasons like not liking the director or something weird... like they're on some hidden agenda. People are comparing it to Star Wars but tbh it's just a more realistic version avengers end game. But even then it's its own movie.

title: Worth watching...
text: If you look beyond this being the apparent love child of 'Lord of the Rings' and 'Star Wars' (with some elements of Harry Potter - "Buckbeak, is that you?"), this is actually a well-written and very well cast sci-fi epic.The obvious features of a quest and gathering of comrades to fight in the necessary rebellion; twists and turns with some well choreographed fights. Fast paced with great effects.I shall look forward to next one. Plenty of scope for the development of the plot into sequels with opportunity for further excitement (waffling a bit now to fill the characters so I can post this!)...

title: Nice intro
text: The trailer was quite exciting but when I saw the low rating on IMDb I started to hesitate whether it was worth watching. Although there are quite some cliches going on, I believe it doesn't deserve the current low rating of 5.2 / 10.Admittedly, not too much happened in this movie, but I still gave it a 7.5, which rounds up to 8 due to the benefit of the doubt the following parts will live up to all the seeds that have been planted. This first part touches a lot of lore but doesn't go into much detail, so I hope this will be addressed in following parts. I look at this first part more like an introduction to the characters and the story. Thus far, I wouldn't call it original, but it does succeed in bringing entertainment.Some turns of events are quite unrealistic, if you can't stand that, better not watch ;) overall, i can recommend though.

title: Solid entertainment! And visually beautiful
text: I don't get the negative reviews on this movie. This was a good movie, entertaining, and great visuals. Some of the characters' development was slightly rushed, and yes the dialogue could be better. But overall it was an enjoyable movie (of which there are few these days).I had seen the IMDb score before watching and I keep expecting it to turn bad, but it didn't. I was surprised by how engaged I was as the story unfolded. Again, it is a visual treat, in classic Zack Snyder style (perhaps slightly brighter). Good fighting scenes and interesting characters that I hope to learn more about.I've missed this genre, and already look forward to part two.

title: One time watchable, The making is some what good
text: The movie has good VFX and making but the story is old. It doesn't potrait any adventure or beauty of that outer moon also planets. It just made simply. The characters also doesn't show experience to travel to another planet. They simply go there. The story is struggle for freedom because the powered man tortures for food. This is actually like THE BUGS LIFE movie. The climax twist is very very old as you can feel it. The villain must be killed over but he was gain given life by advanced technology that was not clearly explained. The movie is in the manner that it was made like a sequel look. The perfect starting point is not shown about the space adventure.

title: It is clearly a Snyder film. Not your average Star Wars
text: First of all, people complaining the movie looks a lot like Star Wars should remember Rebel Moon was originally a Star Wars script that Disney rejected (and quite probably turned into what is now Rogue One).Zack Snyder's visuals are always on point, tremendously gorgeous, giving us the feeling of being immersed in a live-action graphic novel. This, accompanied by an epic OST.What to expect from the film? Well, if you are expecting your typical Star Wars or your average action film, you will be disappointed. What you must expect is a Zack Snyder film. Period. Boring? Not for me. Was Dune boring? Some say yes, some say no. But the film became a classic of Sci-Fi. Is Sandman boring? People enjoyed it despite the lack of action, so it all depends.I watched Rebel Moon twice, the first time I really liked it (especially the second half of it), and the second time I loved it.The characters are great, especially the main protagonists and the antagonist. Some, like Nemesis or the robot, look epic but lack a proper development. However, as this is only part 1, their presence builds hype for part 2.I get that Snyder films are not for everybody, but I think this is one of his best, and one of the best contents on Netflix right now.

The whole concept is astonishing. It reminds me a lot of dune. I really liked the different species. The only thing i think it lacks is the main characters. They really didn't grab my attention that much, it was just ok. There was a character with black horns who looked amazing but to only give her a 10 second part seems crazy to me. It's def. Worth the time to watch. I may even watch again. I hope the next saga is a little bit soul grabbing. The positives I like are obviously the storyline, the worlds and the off world species. The negative was the main group did not bring out any emotions out of me it was just bla. Rooting for the next one.

title: A CALL TO COURAGE
text: I love when a filmmakers wears their influences proud on their shoulder and makes something so grand and just powerful.What makes this film standout is its testament to not being subtle in the best way imaginable. Atrocities committed by fascists propagated by capitalism is not subtle at all. It's right in our faces, we see now those fighting back, Rebels who have a call to courage and are not afraid to die for their land. Something so beautiful that evil can't stand and must monopolise for their own gain. "Vote Blue" isn't a solution but a disguise of evil to commit their atrocities. We need for films like this to tell the world how it really is.Zack Snyder uses the optics of the brand new RED V-RAPTOR to take us into a heavy metal world, with VFX inspired choices akin to the likes of George Lucas with the prequels. Sublime photography I can't wait to capture all my favourite shots into a hard drive.Rebel Moon isn't afraid to go slow-mo and uses it even more to make nerds who hate it cry and moan online. Every time it kicked in it sort of made me the viewer feel like a benevolent force observing closely at these courageous actions.

title: Best
text: How ever i never wonder that coming to be so obvious 🤣 of short term effects 😕 that film had on audience and the Audio condition is best 😄 cinematic video 📸 appeal was charishing and blowing the scenes of the movie 🍿 I loved watching that real animation 😀 actually I watched that move several times. This review was never intended to be prepared for the previous week and prescription of pressure presented to the masses in such naive occasions of Christmas however the same colour will unavail the cause of the movie to see it again in agony of agoraphobia of the situation with the weather forecast for the reindeer of village hall.

title: Ignore the hate, Dune meets Never ending story
text: I don't understand the hate. I feel like people just want Hollywood crap blockbusters. This movie is great and I can't wait for part 2. It visually amazing with great storyline. I think this is the best snyder made so far, you get to fly away in an amazing story. It has the feeling of Dune with never ending story. It's like reeding a book and the journey is amazing, I love the feeling I get from this movie, it's like the old movies that had a dream feeling where you get sucked in to another universe. Great characters and full of interesting creatures, trust me give this a fair chance. But away your phone and you might enjoy this.

title: Great movie! Rebel, rebel!
text: The storytelling is amazing and I like how it mixes fiction along with fantasy, The battle scenes were also well done and had me hanging on the edge of seat. The were beautifully shot and the movie had some great casting. The characters in the movie were awesome and loved the backstory of badass Kora, Nemesis, Kai and Titus especially loved Jimmy and Gunnar. The visuals were stunning. The movie was a thrill ride. The movie left us on a a perfect cliffhanger and I definitely look forward to Part 2 of Rebel Moon. So many negative reviews. I'm glad I ignored the reviews and watched the movie anyway.

title: Absolutely spectacular!!
text: I don't know why this does not have a much higher rating. The characters are well written and the story has real pathos. The acting in this is top notch. The special effects and battle scenes are amazing and so real. You can't help but be swept up in the raw emotion and plight of the villagers.This first part sets the scene for an epic story and I am hoping we do get some back story on most of the characters. This movie will move you and you won't be able to stop from cheering for our heroine.The robot (Jimmy ) is well nicely woven into the story and has a major role to play I am sure of it.Loved it and can't wait for more.

title: Not Quite Up There with John Carter, Mandalorian, and Dune
text: So, Rebel Moon started off pretty good, giving me vibes of John Carter, The Mandalorian, and Dune. The visuals were cool, lots of eye-catching colors that reminded me of other space adventures I love.But, here's the thing. Even though the story had potential, some dialogues and small scenes kinda messed it up. And honestly, some of the characters, like the farmer guy, just didn't pack a punch. It's a bit of a letdown when a movie that could've been great falls short, especially when you're measuring it against the big names in the genre.Still, I'm hoping for better things in the second part. Maybe they'll iron out the kinks and give us a more solid story. Fingers crossed!

title: So far so good, entertaining
text: Another movie about galaxy! Away from star war,guardian of galaxy and etc, this galaxy movie are very entertain when watching it. I dont know the plot or something, i watching the storyline flow in smoothly. The graphics so nice, at least i didn't notice any bad on it, the planets scene design all different from other, netflix need to invest more so that the planet scene can be much more enhanced and more view. Main cast playing the role well, much focus on Kora, hopefully part two will bring up more view and scene on other casting. Exciting waiting for part two, please proceed it. When you lack of movie to view, you won't regret to watch this.

title: Seven Samurai
text: Seven mercenary samurai on a Dune are Universal Soldiers preparing for the War of the Stars against the Resident Evils that are Nazi zombies. They run like Blades Runners, they are like Michel Strogoff, the Robot cops from Death on their heels to finally face it: it's the Clash of the Titans, the Wild Wild West. Because in the end, all of this, in the imagination from Homer to Zack Snyder, is just one for all and all for one, a beautiful place to die."I Know a thing or two about the guilt of carrying on when those you've sworn to fight with are gone. Honor them with everything you can from now. Carry them."

title: I'd rate it a 8, gave it a 10 to boost from the abysmal 5 it currently has
text: Seven Samurai in space. If you like Seven Samurai, Magnificent Seven, etc, you're more likely to like this. Me personally? I loved the Samurai Seven anime, nostalgia is strong. Strong enough for me to go "hell yeah" for anything similar. Funny, huh? But to the review: I enjoyed it. My mom enjoyed it. We like sci-fi. People are so burnt out and cynical that they only see negatives. It's a shame. I feel this movie would have benefited from a longer runtime, more specifically a tv show or or video game or anime (lol). Alas, Netflix is known for destroying good things, specifically tv shows. It was either come out as a movie, or the story would never be finished, canceled after the first season. Unfortunate, but true. As is? Like I said. We enjoyed it.

title: A breath of fresh air in modern Sci-Fi films nowadays!
text: Another great work for Zack Snyder himself. Fans of sci-fi has the tendency of comparing this movie to lifelong Sci-Fi movies like Star Trek and Star Wars but the movie did a tremendous job of separating itself from these 2 movies. Even though some of the viewers noticed a share of colour palette with Dune.The first part of the movie focuses more on the background story for Kora and I hope we could see more of the background stories for the rest of the rebel squads in the directors cut or in part II. Slow-mo scenes are well delivered to emphasized the impact of the scene. The only downside of the movie is the lens blur for some of the scenes hampering the CGI.

title: Rebel Moon
text: The idea of a peaceful settlement being threatened by a tyrannical ruling force is a classic conflict that can create tension and suspense in a movie. The addition of a mysterious stranger who becomes their best hope for survival adds an element of mystery and potential for character development.However, without more information about the execution of the film, such as the director, cast, or specific plot details, it's difficult to provide a thorough review. It will ultimately depend on how well the story is told, the performances of the actors, and the overall production value.Rebel Moon tends to remind me of Star Wars and Mad Max.

title: Once again another film that triggers the fragile culture war peeps.
text: While this film is being trashed by 'certain' people, it has to be noted that while not perfect, it is actually a well made and admirable attempt to create a new sci-fi franchise that is enjoyable entertainment.The effects are fantastic, the direction and production are superb, the actors all provide decent performances (on the whole) and it's well executed and presented. The script/pace is not perfect (at least to begin with). And yes, some of the characters are 'over the top' and archetypal - but isn't that what stories about heroes and action are meant to be?Just because it reminds somebody of something that may have come before, does not mean it loses any merit. And that's because when you look at storytelling, performance or art, everything can be broken down as being a copy of a copy of a copy if you are inclined to take a negative view. The question should be - is it well done and entertaining? And the answer is YES!If you are unfortunate enough to be handicapped by your own prefrontal cortex and implicit bias, then you are probably the type of person who says 'I want high budget, lot's of action sci-fi franchises'. But when they are presented with one that also has POC, LGBT or strong female characters, they will whine 'bUt NoT lIkE tHaT'.8/10. But I'm giving it 10/10 just to balance out the low scores of the intellectually handicapped that are more than likely to be Russian bots - or at least misinformed and inspired by them to have the foolhardy 'courage' of showing us who you really are.Watch out guys, your intolerance and prejudice is showing <3 :-)

title: Amazing and Mind Blowing
text: This movie was truly amazing! Not sure why the hate or dislike for this movie by many. From the moment I saw the trailer, the first thing I said "this looks like a Star Wars based movie", and sure enough, I find out that Zack Snyder did write this movie originally as a Star Wars Story, however it was not used, so then he took it back and re-created his own thing. Well what you get is this great feel like your watching a sort of distance story to Star Wars similar universe, and it hits it out of the park! Since Disney took over the Star Wars franchise, they started great with Rogue One & Force Awakens, however after that in my opinion this movie Rebel Moon is better then all the other actual Star Wars based movies and TV shows that have been released. That being said, don't think this is just some knock off to trying to be Star Wars, it is very different and original story, the similarities fall more in visuals like creatures, many alien races, androids or some terms used, many paying homage to the classic, however maintaining it's own path. Can't wait for Part 2 to be released in April 2024.

title: Slick Stylish and Fun !
text: Rebel Moon is an exceptional space opera film that takes viewers on a thrilling journey through a fictional galaxy. Directed by Zack Snyder, the film showcases his signature style and delivers an epic cinematic experience .The ensemble cast, including Sofia Boutella, Charlie Hunnam, Michiel Huisman, Djimon Hounsou, and Doona Bae.Set in a galaxy ruled by the Motherworld, the plot follows Kora, a former Imperium soldier, as she embarks on a quest to gather warriors from across the galaxy to stand against the oppressive Imperium and protect the farming colony on the moon Veldt. This quest leads to thrilling action sequences and intense emotional moments that keep viewers on the edge of their seats.Visually, Rebel Moon is stunning. Not unlike Snyder's other films his visual flair is a complement to the set design creating a slick and stylistic look.The film's screenplay, co-written by Kurt Johnstad and Shay Hatten, is well-crafted and keeps the pacing tight. The dialogue is sharp and impactful, adding depth to the characters and driving the story forward. The combination of a compelling script and Snyder's direction is both stunning visually and narratively engaging.Rebel Moon is a must-watch for fans of space opera and action-packed adventures. It delivers on all fronts, with a talented cast, a gripping story, and breathtaking visuals. Zack Snyder's directorial prowess shines through, making Rebel Moon a standout film in the genre.

title: A Top notch, hardcore space opera
text:
Truthfully, honestly, I don't care what the idiotic negative reviews say. Half of the people today have no taste in movies at all.Rebel moon part 1 is one of the most epic & greatest sci-fi movies I've ever seen so far!Zack Snyder made a great, original twist of the whole thing! Its a careful mix of seven samurai/magnificent seven meets star wars: a new hope with a touch of hidden fortress.The fx: beautiful
cinematography: operatic
directing: top notch
Acting: Oscar worthy
Set design: as if they were actually on other planets!👍I truly recommend this to one who's interested!Rebel moon part 1 wonderfully stands out from the crowd & is one of the kind, outside of the box feature film! I can't wait to see part 2 coming up in April soon.I give the movie 9/10.

title: Snyder at his best
text: I won't say this is the next Star Wars or this is movie of the year. But it is my favorite movie from Snyder since Watchmen and I am excited to see part 2! I hope we get more after that. He is at least creating a new property. He is at least doing something original for his own work and even if it is a low budget Star Wars with more grit, I think that is its strength. Who wouldn't want this! And I know his name brings weight. I think if anyone else had directed it would be praised. Instead its being torn apart online and I don't get it. He brought us a badass sci fi movie for christmas and I am appreciative! I hope he sticks with space sci fi. It is suits him.

title: Finally a New Sci-Fi story that's more than enjoyable to watch! Amazing job by Synder!
text:
I had to give it 10 stars to outweigh all the haters and negative comments about this movie. This movie is 100% enjoyable and when you compare to all the other garbage sci-fi plot lines this one stands out.I personally think Zack Snyder knocked this way out the ball park for creating something fresh and completely new.Now could they have made the script better and added context in scenes? Yes.Should it have been less predictable? Yes
Should they have build the characters stories more? YesI do agree it did feel rushed and not as much effort in the script than it should have. So is this a perfect movie absolutely not. But this is as close as you can get to something besides star wars. Synder is trying to start something that can be big. I just hope he continues to add more depth context and develop characters more so us as the audience can connect more.7.5/10 for me. The movie Dune doesn't come close to this, I was so bored in Dune but this had my attention all the way through. It has its downfalls but like I said compare this to so many other movies of 2023 and this stands out like a diamond in the rough!Watch it with an open mind and decide for yourself. Def. DO NOT compare this at all to Star wars bc it's not and obviously nothing can touch star wars.

title: Thank you Zack Snyder
text: After the disappointment of so many promising films eg Dune, all of the last three Star Wars movies, finally a film that entertains without trying. The backstory is told succinctly and with clarity. The characters are engaging. No Deadpool-like anti heroes. No tiresome endless Star Wars nonsense. Excellent battle scenes. Great actors and acting. The negative reviews for this movie are inexplicable. What the hell do you want from a movie that this doesn't give?? Seriously some people shouldn't be allowed to share their thoughts on social media and tarnish such a great movie. I can't wait for the next episode!!

title: One of Two
text: I really enjoyed this film! But then again it was exactly what I expected it to be, the first part of a two part story. I believe it had previously been partially developed as a TV series so I was expecting something along the lines of the Dune & Children Of Dune miniseries produced by the Sci-Fi Channel 20 odd years ago. However the production quality of Rebel Moon is just a step or two down from a Marvel feature so way higher than any TV film! I would keep in mind that this is a Netflix production. Over the last few years I have sat through many films produced by one of the streaming services. Some are better than others and as I pay the equivalent of about two beers a month for the privilege I can't really complain! One option could be to wait until the second part is released and watch them back to back.

title: One of the best for a long time
text: Haven't seen such a good storyline and deep plot for a long time. I am totally waiting for the second episode. I really hope to see battle at the farmland and all that graphical eyecandy. Don't get it how this masterpiece gets so many negative reciews. Yes there are thing that are borrowed from other movies but come on, everything is already done in this world we live in and there's no way that someone can bring anything new to the screens. Rebel Moon stands on it's own for me and is a breath of fresh air for now. Thankfully we get to see new episode soon enough. Just give this movie a try and keep yourself open minded. It's worth to watch.

title: Visually stunning
text: As a movie fan with over 50 years of watching experience, I do not expect groundbreaking, unique content, it's virtually impossible not to take from the greats, whether it's art, music or movies, paying homage isn't copying its respectful.I get the love and get for Zack Snyder, but all directors have their styles and I love that part of movie making, no one is my favourite director but they all have my respect for sticking to their methods.It's a slick sci fi movie, beautiful cinematography, fantastic costume design, fantastic actors and acting.I hope that there Will be an r rated version with more gore and also can't wait for the part 2.

title: Original, yet familiar. Why the hate?
text: An original universe, written with similar story elements that harken to other movies. Movies, I might add, that are classics in sci-fi and other genres. So why are folks raging against it?Is it the Snyder slow-motion? What did you expect? It will be there, it will be gorgeously shot, and it typically emphasizes a critical moment in either character development or action sequence. You know its coming, so if thats not your cup of tea, move along to the next regurgitated IP that Disney attempts to feed you.Is it perfect, heck no. I'd take a three hour version that lengthens the character intros/development in a way that doesn't make it feel so rushed. Some character motives could also be further explored, given time for more dialogue.But to establish an entire universe, set the table for storytelling, and move it along to a clear, concise conflict- is way beyond much of the sci-fi drivel we've had to consume in recent years. Oh, and its entertaining. Very entertaining. PBring on part two.

title: Complex Simplicity at its best
text: Dumb fun with a fair sprinkle of artistic sophistication. Promises to expand to an exquisite universe of unapologetic 80's and 90's style Sci-Fi Fantasy cheese-fest. But fine cheese, from like a fancy country, like France or Spain. Each actor plays their character with passion and honesty. The visuals are just breath taking. The CGI is top choice. The action sequences are mind blowing. I was honestly never bored watching it. Not my favorite Snyder film but still, bravo. Sofia Boutella as Kora gives me vibes of Sarah Connor and Trinity. The whole cast delivers. The soundtrack is gorgeous. I would've loved this to be a Star Wars movie. I think it would've given the franchise a fresh breath of air. I give it a B. But Snyder movies get better with each viewing so, we'll see.

title: I think It's Just Me
text: You know, I'm a fan of many movies and many directors, but most of all I'm a fan of good stories and good characters. This has both. Sure, there are some issues with battle scene slow motion (which personally I think can detract from the chaos and intensity of battle) but it's a minor niggle if the story works. It's also refreshing to have a story not beset by a big studio "message" or pandering to be relevant in today's society and just being a story. It's a traditional story about empire stomping on those that it claims to protect, the things that real world rebellions have been caused by, but it's an enjoyable ride along with a band of characters and protagonists that left me wanting to see a) the next chapter and b), the extended r-rated version.

title: A Balanced Take on Zack Snyder's 'Rebel Moon'
text: Zack Snyder's "Rebel Moon" has drawn comparisons to "Star Wars", but these similarities are largely because both Snyder and George Lucas were inspired by similar sources. Snyder's concept for "Rebel Moon" originally pitched to Lucasfilm, shares DNA with "Star Wars" due to both creators being inspired by Joseph Campbell's works and Akira Kurosawa's "Seven Samurai". Despite these influences, "Rebel Moon" maintains its distinct identity, akin to how "Star Wars" evolved into an original property despite its influences from Westerns and pulp sci-fi.As an admirer of the cinematic arts, rather than a staunch fan of either Snyder or Star Wars, I appreciate "Rebel Moon" for its visual splendor. Snyder's unique style, with its muted tones punctuated by bursts of color, provides a visually arresting experience. This film, despite its narrative challenges, distinguishes itself through its cinematic beauty, showcasing Snyder's ability to craft visually stunning scenes.Additionally, there's a palpable anticipation for the Director's Cut of "Rebel Moon." Given Snyder's reputation for delivering extended versions that often reshape the narrative and deepen the cinematic experience, there's a keen interest to see how his unfiltered vision might enhance the film's story and overall impact.

title: Ignore stupid NWO trolls of Disney. The movie was just fine. Enjoy it.
text: Every single year that passes, Cinematography faces a larger kind of crisis, not because of its own identity, but because of...the audience.From the moment you have to deal with a generation which is NWO 'sensitive lillies', fragile to specific vocabulary (George Orwell celebrates at this point) and of course when a movie like REBEL MOON is a dark space opera, then your expectations have - unfortunately - to be low. The low grades here were given by viewers who "loved" the new, abhorrent Disney's STAR WARS Trilogy.The same herd of viewers try - unsuccessfully - to shape a new generation of brainless movie fans who consider REBEL MOON..."soulless" or "weak". It wouldn't be a surprise if the same viewers will put REBEL MOON in the same category with JUPITER ASCENDING (another - without logical reason - underrated movie, unless you wanna fly in pink clouds and you are afraid of anything dark).As the title says, ignore all these stupid NWO trolls of Disney (just because Snyder figured out that he couldn't fit in the vomiting and toxic environment of the specific multinational). The movie was fun, with a great FX level, concrete scenario, quick and in the end you will find that it had lots of elements of DUNE + FIREFLY + LORD OF THE RINGS + FOUNDATION + HALO + 40K WARHAMMER.If you a true (dark) space opera fan, you will appreciate that project.If you are a NWO fruit/"princess", you will continue admiring pointless with no I. Q. characters like Rey Skywalker.Merry Xmas and Wishes for more Brains in 2024...

title: Solid Beginning, Rough Around The Edges
text: I've not always been the biggest Zack Snyder fan but I have to take my hat off to him here for thus universe. I can echo what many have said here about the need for some writing refinement, mostly with dialogue which is far to exposition at at times. Te characters are interesting though, they just need to be as well scripted as they are conceptualised. The plot is solid reflecting the resistance of space nazis and the world is gorgeous. The biggest problem is Snyder invited comparison with Star Wars which was brave. It has the potential but only time will tell. I'm excited for the next one and there is good setup for a saga.When you write a movie intending it to be part of a series based on an original concept then you naturally will make the mistakes of cramming too much and too little into each film. This movie managed to do both and oddly that actually worked.If you go into this with an open mind and ignore all the Star Wars comparison then there is a lot for SciFi fans to enjoy and it will keep you thinking.

title: Very entertaining
text: Rebel Moon is a very good sci-fi movie. It establishes our new universe and gathers our party of adventurers for the next movie. There is story and backstory here. Lots of crazy new creatures and cultures. This is what I want from my sci-fi movie. Rebel Moon is way better and more interesting than recent Star Wars and Marvels. Sure it is a little cheesy in places and has hints of StarWars,BuckRogers,Marvel,LOTR in various scenes. I'm not quite sure why people are hating on this. There is some really great CGI cuts of more than just endless battles scenes. This could be the start of a really good series of films.

title: Entertaining and Visually Striking Sci-Fi Action from Zack Snyder
text: The visual effects were superb throughout with compelling characters and outstanding performances, especially Cara. The plot and setting reminds you of several universes but it never detracted from the viewing experience. I thought one scene at the Trading City bar was reminiscent of the Star Wars Cantina but that was the only blatant borrowing I saw. Obviously it is about a group of Rebels that rebel against an Empire, so you can see some of the parallels to Star Wars. I also felt it had some homage to Dune and Chronicles of Riddick. The movie plays quickly at 2:15 I never felt it dragged and let me just say there is a twist near the end that surprised me and something unexpected. I understand this is a multi-part series so hopefully it will develop a following. If you love Sci-fi, give it a chance and enjoy it for what it is and don't try to overanalyze it.

title: Absolutely loved it
text: It was an awesome movie, loved the storyline, fantastic characters, fantastic acting, brilliant visuals, huge world with endless avenues to expand a new universe. Would love to see a huge battlescene in Koras part.So many have givens bad reviews, don't listen to them, it's awesome entertainment. Im a huge star wars fan, and I say anything that's similar is welcome in my mind, Star wars has sadly been worn out, disney last trilogy was so bad, their series alittle better. It's time for a change, loved the movie, was only bored with the big bird scene.Love Zacks work, thank you so much for this.

title: Rebel Moon: Part One - A Child of Fire!
text: This movie is a mix of sci-fi & fantasy, with stunning visual landscapes & individual characters that each have their own motivations & abilities that, when joined together by a common mission & put to the test, rally to save their beloved moon home in a harmonious farming community.They will need others to help them reach their goal so an epic adventure awaits as others are found & added to their rebel force as they work together to bring peace back to their home & oust a Motherworld's militaristic Infantry that comes to their moon Veldt to buy grain to replenish their food stocks as they hunt the galaxy for a band of rebels. There are many twists & turns in this 1st of two movies that keep one at the edge of their seat! It's a fun, exciting watch! Worth a look if you get the chance!

title: Sure it's not super unique, but I liked it... 7.5 stars
text: Maybe you guys watched it on a tiny screen. I watched it on a 120 inch screen, with 5.1 speakers, hehehe. I liked it! Sure it borrowed a lot of concepts from other movies mainly Seven Samurai / 47 Ronin. I even thought the robot would have its own arc similar to I,Robot / Chappie. Plot isn't unique at all. Might have borrowed the Borg queen, Braveheart warpaint, Gladiator, and an Urukai. It even has a little bit of Greek mythology influence. It tries to mix all these elements into one movie, but I thought it worked, because it entertained. A plot problem would be that ship - who lets a gunner also pilot a ship that size? Looking forward to the Director's Cut.

title: Quality of sci-fi
text: Anyway, according to the reviews...positive - negative.Let's be honest, great directors have spoiled us.I am a generation of 1965 and when I remember the first sci-fi films with content and good effects, I was convinced that it couldn't get any better. They surprised both positively and negatively, but with increasingly better effects as well as good content. Of course, quantity does not mean good quality.That is why, of course, there are also many failed films for which I do not know who paid for the film... or did they even read the script??Ok, I agree, maybe the first part is really a bit stretched and there is a little Darth Vader association in it...at least at the end.However, the story is set seriously enough to unfold into an interesting sequel. Of course, all of us who are fans of good action and stories know that hunting, revenge, etc. Follow. However, it is difficult to satisfy all tastes.My opinion is that as far as Sci-Fi goes, I found the film watchable. We'll see what the sequels will be like.

title: VISUAL SPECTICLE THAT WON'T WIN ANYTHING FOR ACTING
text: If you liked the original 300 and you liked sucker punch - you will like this. A truely beautiful Snyder film. Acting is a bit meh and the film rushes through charater development - assuming the following parts will slow down a bit. But well worth a watch - just don't expect any Oscar winning performances.Additional note - those saying this is a Star Wars ripoff movie are completely wrong - this could not be further away from Star Wars. Magnificent Seven in space would be a better conparison.Anyway. Enjoy it for what it is and don't cry because you expected someyhing different. Sometimes all we need is bealutiful CGI.

title: Better modern Star Wars
text: This movie got so much unnecessary hate I can't even comprehend it. I've received what I expected - a very Star Wars-like clichy story. It won't take long for anyone to see the clear inspiration, especially if Rebel Moon was originally a project pitched for Lucasfilm. Watching this open-minded will do you good.I liked the movie thanks to it's good visuals ( both special effects and cinematography were on point), real Star Wars pacing (it fits, what can I say), original characters which we all have yet to get to know. So far they've been just introduced, because that was the task of this movie - to introduce a new world to the audience. In my opinion it did a great job of setting a base to build upon.It's definitely a decent entry for a new franchise that's why I'm giving it 8/10 even though it's more like a 7 or 7,5 maximum. You can call my score an incentive. It's just an important introduction, very much needed, for next parts.Waiting for the sequel.

title: Soon to be a classic!
text: This movie is great, epic, emotional, deep, great visuals and score!The story and the world building is one that from the start with that Anthony Hopkins opening dialogue grabs your attention and interest, and then for the rest of the movie takes you on a journey through different worlds with each an unique and fresh feel, as well as introducing us to characters that each with their backstories and charisma instantly makes you like them and want to see more of them.Zack Snyder did a great job again, another soon to be classic.Go give it a watch, don't let haters review bombing it spoil your desire to see it.Go, you'll have a blast!

title: Near sighted reviews
text: I thought that this was a pretty good film with a highly mix of recognisable parts of sci-fi and fantasy film methodology.Those who criticise it for being slow or underwhelming are missing the point that this is only part on and therefore a scene setter of hopefully more to come!The foundation of the story narrative in the first part of a series is often science as the worst but patience is required. The 300 desk slo mo is done in the right places, the characters are established, the longevity of the story is also established. If this wasn't Netflix i don't think it would have such negative reviews and it's the first of its kind for this particular story, if this was Star Wars people would give it more of a chance.Stick with it!

title: Good popcorn movie
text: One-third George Luca, one-third Akira Kurosawa, and one hundred percent Zack Snyder. Good cast, decent script, stellar CGI. Fun to watch, even though I can see a gigantic plot twist (to be revealed in Part Two) coming a mile away. Sophia Boutella is intense and memorable as Kora, a refugee with a past, who becomes the defender of the farming village she now calls home. Her background in dance serves her well in the combat choreography. Ed Skrein plays evil characters so well, and he's in his element as the face of the evil empire. The look and feel of the oppressors is similar to the aesthetic of Warhammer 40K. Quite happy with this movie, can't wait to see Scargiver in April.

title: Don't listen to the negative reviews
text: As a lifelong fan of Science Fiction, especially complicated interstellar travel and progressive technologies this was wonderful film series. The acting was really well done, good plot and pacing, visually appealing, amazing soundtrack, well written, good casting all leaving me wanting more (April 2024). I have no idea what those who wrote about this negatively saw? Have they seen the crap put up by Disney over the last 5-8 years? It is laughable to knock this series down. Serious Science Fiction fans must watch it themselves and decide as I did that this is a rare gem on Netflix worthy of your time.If you have read negative reviews on IMDB then take a look for yourself. This is one hell of a good science fiction movie series. If you are tired of Star Wars or even if you like it this will give you that "more" you have been seeking. A diverse group of protagonists, a hateful group of antagonists and one hell of a good ride within their universe. Enjoy and post a 8+ review like I did to counter those evil trolls who seek to remove a really great contribution.

title: One of the Better Star Wars Movies
text: Zack Snyder has clearly taken it into his own hands and made his own Star Wars movie. If you can figure that out early you'll enjoy it. Even the title Rebel Moon sounds like a Star Wars sequel. Great job on what is probably the most expensive Star Wars fan fiction ever made.Light sabers, empire, rebels, a Mos Eisley-esque bar and bar brawl, a Star Destroyer called a Dreadnought, laser guns, an emperor ("king"). No Jedis, but the characters form a group of people with extraordinary skills who basically fill that gap.Snyder is obviously frustrated with the Star Wars franchise and this movie should be viewed as a response to the Disneyfication of Star Wars. I just wish they would have let him do this on the record, but that's sort of the point I guess.

title: So much fun! Why all the hate for Snyder?
text: Zack Snyder offers up a stunning space opera with Rebel Moon, a first-part saga that wears many influences joyously on its sleeve while still managing to find its own place among the stars of this genre that we don't see enough of these days (Star Wars doesn't count by reason of over-saturation alone). On a small moon at the edge of the universe a clan of quiet, industrious agriculturists work hard for a simple, bountiful life until a monolithic spacecraft penetrates through through their atmosphere, bringing violence and war with it. It represents a ruthlessly dogmatic regime with eyes on conquering everything in the known cosmos and only a mysterious stranger (Sofia Boutella) living amongst them provides any hope against the eventual onslaught. This first film is a raucous recruitment montage as she leads a ragtag band of outliers across many solar systems to find others that may help their cause. Snyder builds his world with music (phenomenally emotional score by Tom Holkenborg), motion, colour and stirring passages of monologue rather than sit-down exposition. Anthony Hopkins' robot narrator provides the obligatory Galadriel opening spiel and then it's off to the races and even if everything doesn't quite make sense plot-wise, the film moving in fits and starts of slow and sped up pacing, Snyder paints with such vivid, broad strokes one can't help but be moved by the spectacle onscreen, a feast for eyes, ears and soul alike. Boutella has already proven what a strong presence she is in the action/fantasy realm and holds her own as a lead terrifically here, supported by Djimon Hounsou, reliably villainous Ed Skrein, Michiel Huisman, Charlie Hunnam, Cleopatra Coleman, Cary Elwes and a standout Jena Malone. The isn't without some issues; it races along with such childlike lack of expository inhibitions that we aren't introduced to all of the characters languidly enough to care about them as a unit, and the story can feel a bit scattered amongst the stars in terms of coherency. But observe the style, movement (yes, there's lots of slow motion, deal with it), music and sheer atmospheric scope of this story, it's truly something breathtaking and a world to get lost in from moment to moment. That's what Snyder and excels at so much is the *moment*, the sheer cinematic bliss of one framed scenario and all the spatial dynamics requisite to capture an audience. In this moment I'm grateful for his vision, and excited for the second part of this story. Any film that references Harry Potter, Avatar, Inglorious Basterds and Chronicles Of Riddick in the same runtime while still managing to retain a soul of originality is doing something right.

title: Better then the reviews
text: For some reason, I think the movie is much better then the reviews. The reviews have been over critical. But Diffently a copy of star wars...but a good movie ever the same. But it might be best if movies weren't made with the plan to make more. The worry is they won't make the others.... Like they did with "Beautiful creatures". But never the less a movie worth watching if you like action pack Science fiction. Hopefully they will make the other movies with the same characters.The bigger question is why a reviews needs to contain 600 charecters? Maybe forcing a little to much detail in someone's opinion.

title: An interesting visual start
